पर वो यह्वं पुरूणां विशां देवयतीनाम|	with words sent forth in holy hymns agni we supplicate the lord.
अग्निं सूक्तेभिर्वचोभिरीमहे यं सीमिदन्य ईळते|	of many families who duly serve the gods yea him whom others also praise.
जनासो अग्निं दधिरे सहोव्र्धं हविष्मन्तो विधेम ते|	men have won agni him who makes their strength abound we with oblations worship thee.
स तवं नो अद्य सुमना इहाविता भवा वाजेषु सन्त्य|	our graciousminded helper in our deeds of might be thou o excellent this day.
पर तवा दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम|	thee for our messenger we choose thee the omniscient for our priest.
महस्ते सतो वि चरन्त्यर्चयो दिवि सप्र्शन्ति भानवः|	the flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around thy splendour reaches to the sky.
देवासस्त्वा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा सं दूतं परत्नमिन्धते|	the gods enkindle thee their ancient messengervaruṇa mitra aryaman.
विश्वं सो अग्ने जयति तवया धनं यस्ते ददाश मर्त्यः|	that mortal man o agni gains through thee all wealth who hath poured offerings unto thee.
मन्द्रो होता गर्हपतिरग्ने दूतो विशामसि|	thou agni art a cheering priest lord of the house mens messenger.
तवे विश्वा संगतानि वरता धरुवा यानि देवा अक्र्ण्वत|	all constant high decrees established by the gods gathered together meet in thee.
तवे इदग्ने सुभगे यविष्ठ्य विश्वमा हूयते हविः|	in thee the auspicious one o agni youthfullest each sacred gift is offered up.
सत्वं नो अद्य सुमना उतापरं यक्षि देवान सुवीर्या|	this day and after gracious worship thou our gods that we may have heroic sons.
तं घेमित्था नमस्विन उप सवराजमासते|	to him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout.
होत्राभिरग्निं मनुषः समिन्धते तितिर्वांसो अति सरिधः|	men kindle agni with their sacrificial gifts victorious oer the enemies.
घनन्तो वर्त्रमतरन रोदसी अप उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे|	vṛtra they smote and slew and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode.
भुवत कण्वे वर्षा दयुम्न्याहुतः करन्ददश्वो गविष्टिषु|	the glorious bull invoked hath stood at kaṇvas side loud neighed the steed in frays for kine.
सं सीदस्व महानसि शोचस्व देववीतमः|	seat thee for thou art mighty shine best entertainer of the gods.
वि धूममग्ने अरुषं मियेध्य सर्ज परशस्त दर्शतम|	worthy of sacred food praised agni loose the smoke ruddy and beautiful to see.
यं तवा देवासो मनवे दधुरिह यजिष्ठं हव्यवाहन|	bearer of offerings whom best sacrificing priest the gods for manus sake ordained.
यं कण्वो मेध्यातिथिर्धनस्प्र्तं यं वर्षा यमुपस्तुतः|	whom kaṇva whom medhyātithi made the source of wealth and vṛṣan and upastuta.
यमग्निं मेध्यातिथिः कण्व ईध रतादधि|	him agni whom medhyātithi whom kaṇva kindled for his rite.
तस्य परेषो दीदियुस्तमिमा रचस्तमग्निं वर्धयामसि|	him these our songs of praise him agni we extol his powers shine out preeminent.
रायस पूर्धि सवधावोअस्ति हि तेअग्ने देवेष्वाप्यम|	make our wealth perfect thou o agni lord divine for thou hast kinship with the gods.
तवंवाजस्य शरुत्यस्य राजसि स नो मर्ळ महानसि|	thou rulest as a king oer widelyfamous strength be good to us for thou art great.
ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु ण ऊतये तिष्ठा देवो न सविता|	stand up erect to lend us aid stand up like savitar the god.
ऊर्ध्वोवाजस्य सनिता यदञ्जिभिर्वाघद्भिर्विह्वयामहे|	erect as strengthbestower we call aloud with unguents and with priests on thee.
ऊर्ध्वो नः पाह्यंहसो नि केतुना विश्वं समत्रिणं दह|	erect preserve us from sore trouble with thy flame burn thou each ravening demon dead.
कर्धी न ऊर्ध्वाञ्चरथाय जीवसे विदा देवेषु नो दुवः|	raise thou us up that we may walk and live so thou shalt find our worship mid the gods.
पाहि नो अग्ने रक्षसः पाहि धूर्तेरराव्णः|	preserve us agni from the fiend preserve us from malicious wrong.
पाहि रीषत उत वा जिघांसतो बर्हद्भानो यविष्ठ्य|	save us from him who fain would injure us or slay most youthful thou with lofty light.
घनेव विष्वग वि जह्यराव्णस्तपुर्जम्भ यो अस्मध्रुक|	smite down as with a club thou who hast fire for teeth smite thou the wicked right and left.
यो मर्त्यः शिशीते अत्यक्तुभिर्मा नः स रिपुरीशत|	let not the man who plots against us in the night nor any foe prevail oer us.
अग्निर्वव्ने सुवीर्यमग्निः कण्वाय सौभगम|	agni hath given heroic might to kaṇva and felicity.
अग्निः परावन मित्रोत मेध्यातिथिमग्निः साता उपस्तुतम|	agni hath helped our friends hath helped medhyātithi hath helped upastuta to win.
अग्निना तुर्वशं यदुं परावत उग्रादेवं हवामहे|	we call on ugradeva yadu turvaśa by means of agni from afar.
अग्निर्नयन नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं तुर्वीतिं दस्यवे सहः|	agni bring navavāstva and bṛhadratha turvīti to subdue the foe.
नि तवामग्ने मनुर्दधे जयोतिर्जनाय शश्वते|	manu hath stablished thee a light agni for all the race of men.
दीदेथ कण्व रतजात उक्षितो यं नमस्यन्ति कर्ष्टयः|	sprung from the law oilfed for kaṇva hast thou blazed thou whom the people reverence.
तवेषासो अग्नेरमवन्तो अर्चयो भीमासो न परतीतये|	the flames of agni full of splendour and of might are fearful not to be approached.
रक्षस्विनः सदमिद यातुमावतो विश्वं समत्रिणं दह|	consume for ever all demons and sorcerers consume thou each devouring fiend.
इन्द्रमिद गाथिनो बर्हदिन्द्रमर्केभिरर्किणः|	indra the singers with high praise indra reciters with their lauds.
इन्द्रं वाणीरनूषत|	indra the choirs have glorified.
इन्द्र इद धर्योः सचा सम्मिश्ल आ वचोयुजा|	indra hath ever close to him his two bay steeds and wordyoked car.
इन्द्रो वज्रीहिरण्ययः|	indra the golden thunderarmed.
इन्द्रो दीर्घाय चक्षस आ सूर्यं रोहयद दिवि|	indra hath raised the sun on high in heaven that he may see afar.
वि गोभिरद्रिमैरयत|	he burst the mountain for the kine.
इन्द्र वाजेषु नोअव सहस्रप्रधनेषु च|	help us o indra in the frays yea frays where thousand spoils are gained.
उग्र उग्राभिरूतिभिः|	with awful aids o awful one.
इन्द्रं वयं महाधन इन्द्रमर्भे हवामहे|	in mighty battle we invoke indra indra in lesser fight.
युजं वर्त्रेषु वज्रिणम|	the friend who bends his bolt at fiends.
स नो वर्षन्नमुं चरुं सत्रादावन्नपा वर्धि|	unclose our manly hero thou for ever bounteous yonder cloud.
अस्मभ्यमप्रतिष्कुतः|	for us thou irresistible.
तुञ्जेतुञ्जे य उत्तरे सतोमा इन्द्रस्य वज्रिणः|	still higher at each strain of mine thunderarmed indras praises rise.
न विन्धेस्य सुष्टुतिम|	i find no laud worthy of him.
वर्षा यूथेव वंसगः कर्ष्टीरियर्त्योजसा|	even as the bull drives on the herds he drives the people with his might.
ईशानो अप्रतिष्कुतः|	the ruler irresistible.
य एकश्चर्षणीनां वसूनामिरज्यति|	indra who rules with single sway men riches and the fivefold race.
इन्द्रः पञ्च कसितीनाम|	of those who dwell upon the earth.
इन्द्रं वो विश्वतस परि हवामहे जनेभ्यः|	for your sake from each side we call indra away from other men.
अस्माकमस्तु केवलः|	ours and none others may he be.
अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवं रत्वीजम|	i laud agni the chosen priest god minister of sacrifice.
होतारं रत्नधातमम|	the hotar lavishest of wealth.
अग्निः पूर्वेभिर्र्षिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत|	worthy is agni to be praised by living as by ancient seers.
स देवानेह वक्षति|	he shall bring hitherward the gods.
अग्निना रयिमश्नवत पोषमेव दिवेदिवे|	through agni man obtaineth wealth yea plenty waxing day by day.
यशसं वीरवत्तमम|	most rich in heroes glorious.
अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वतः परिभूरसि|	agni the perfect sacrifice which thou encompassest about.
स इद्देवेषु गछति|	verily goeth to the gods.
अग्निर्होता कविक्रतुः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः|	may agni sapientminded priest truthful most gloriously great.
देवो देवेभिरा गमत|	the god come hither with the gods.
यदङग दाशुषे तवमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि|	whatever blessing agni thou wilt grant unto thy worshipper.
तवेत तत सत्यमङगिरः|	that aṅgiras is indeed thy truth.
उप तवाग्ने दिवेदिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम|	to thee dispeller of the night o agni day by day with prayer.
नमो भरन्त एमसि|	bringing thee reverence we come.
राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपां रतस्य दीदिविम|	ruler of sacrifices guard of law eternal radiant one.
वर्धमानंस्वे दमे|	increasing in thine own abode.
स नः पितेव सूनवेअग्ने सूपायनो भव|	be to us easy of approach even as a father to his son.
सचस्वा नः सवस्तये|	agni be with us for our weal.
गायत साम नभन्यं यथा वेरर्चाम तद वाव्र्धानं सवर्वत|	the praisesong let him sing forth bursting birdlike sing we that hymn which like heavens light expandeth.
गावो धेनवो बर्हिष्यदब्धा आ यत सद्मानं दिव्यं विवासान|	that the milkgiving cows may unimpeded call to the sacred grass the gods assembly.
अर्चद वर्षा वर्षभिः सवेदुहव्यैर्म्र्गो नाश्नो अति यज्जुगुर्यात|	let the bull sing with bulls whose toil is worship with a loud roar like some wild beast that hungers.
पर मन्दयुर्मनां गूर्त होता भरते मर्यो मिथुना यजत्रः|	praised god the glad priest brings his hearts devotion the holy youth presents twofold oblation.
नक्षद धोता परि सद्म मिता यन भरद गर्भमा शरदः पर्थिव्याः|	may the priest come circling the measured stations and with him bring the earths autumnal fruitage.
करन्ददश्वो नयमानो रुवद गौरन्तर्दूतो न रोदसी चरद वाक|	let the horse neigh led near let the steer bellow let the voice go between both worlds as herald.
ता कर्माषतरास्मै पर चयौत्नानि देवयन्तो भरन्ते|	to him we offer welcomest oblations the pious bring their strengthinspiring praises.
जुजोषदिन्द्रो दस्मवर्चा नासत्येव सुग्म्यो रथेष्ठाः|	may indra wondrous in his might accept them carborne and swift to move like the nāsatyas.
तमु षटुहीन्द्रं यो ह सत्वा यः शूरो मघवा यो रथेष्ठाः|	praise thou that indra who is truly mighty the carborne warrior maghavan the hero.
परतीचश्चिद योधीयान वर्षण्वान ववव्रुषश्चित तमसो विहन्ता|	stronger in war than those who fight against him borne by strong steeds who kills enclosing darkness.
पर यदित्था महिना नर्भ्यो अस्त्यरं रोदसी कक्ष्ये नास्मै|	him who surpasses heroes in his greatness the earth and heavens suffice not for his girdles.
सं विव्य इन्द्रो वर्जनं न भूमा भर्ति सवधावानोपशमिव दयाम|	indra endues the earth to be his garment and godlike wears the heaven as twere a frontlet.
समत्सु तवा शूर सतामुराणं परपथिन्तमं परितंसयध्यै|	thee hero guardian of the brave in battles who roamest in the vanto draw thee hither.
सजोषस इन्द्रं मदे कषोणीः सूरिं चिद ये अनुमदन्ति वाजैः|	indra the hosts agree beside the soma and joy for his great actions in the chieftain.
एवा हि ते शं सवना समुद्र आपो यत त आसु मदन्ति देवीः|	libations in the sea to thee are pleasant when thy divine floods come to cheer these people.
विश्वा ते अनु जोष्या भूद गौः सूरींश्चिद यदि धिषा वेषि जनान|	to thee the cow is sum of all things grateful when with the wish thou seekest men and princes.
असाम यथा सुषखाय एन सवभिष्टयो नरां न शंसैः|	so may we in this one be well befriended well aided as it were through praise of chieftains.
असद यथा न इन्द्रो वन्दनेष्ठास्तुरो न कर्म नयमान उक्था|	that indra still may linger at our worship as one led swift to work to hear our praises.
विष्पर्धसो नरां न शंसैरस्माकासदिन्द्रो वज्रहस्तः|	like men in rivalry extolling princes our friend be indra wielder of the thunder.
मित्रायुवो न पूर्पतिं सुशिष्टौ मध्यायुव उप शिक्षन्ति यज्ञैः|	like true friends of some citys lord within them held in good rule with sacrifice they help him.
यज्ञो हि षमेन्द्रं कश्चिद रन्धञ जुहुराणश्चिन मनसापरियन|	for every sacrifice makes indra stronger yea when he goes around angry in spirit.
तीर्थे नाछा तात्र्षाणमोको दीर्घो न सिध्रमा कर्णोत्यध्वा|	as pleasure at the ford invites the thirsty as the long way brings him who gains his object.
मो षू ण इन्द्रात्र पर्त्सु देवैरस्ति हि षमा ते शुष्मिन्नवयाः|	let us not here contend with gods o indra for here o mighty one is thine own portion.
महश्चिद यस्य मीळ्हुषो यव्या हविष्मतो मरुतोवन्दते गीः|	the great whose friends the bounteous maruts honour as with a stream his song who pours oblations.
एष सतोम इन्द्र तुभ्यमस्मे एतेन गातुं हरिवो विदो नः|	addressed to thee is this our praise o indra lord of bay steeds find us hereby advancement.
आ नो वव्र्त्याः सुविताय देव विद्यामेषं व ज|	so mayst thou lead us on o god to comfort may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
सोमानं सवरणं कर्णुहि बरह्मणस पते|	o brĀhmaṆaspati make him who presses soma glorious.
कक्षीवन्तं याुशिजः|	even kakṣīvān auśija.
यो रेवान यो अमीवहा वसुवित पुष्टिवर्धनः|	the rich the healer of disease who giveth wealth increaseth store.
स नः सिषक्तु यस्तुरः|	the promptmay he be with us still.
मा नः शंसो अररुषो धूर्तिः परणं मर्त्यस्य|	let not the foemans curse let not a mortals onslaught fall on us.
रक्षा णो बरह्मणस पते|	preserve us brahmaṇaspati.
स घा वीरो न रिष्यति यमिन्द्रो बरह्मणस पतिः|	neer is the mortal hero harmed whom indra brahmaṇaspati.
सोमो हिनोति मर्त्यम|	and soma graciously inspire.
तवं तं बरह्मणस पते सोम इन्द्रश्च मर्त्यम|	do thou o brahmaṇaspati and indra soma dakṣiṇā.
दक्षिणा पात्वंहसः|	preserve that mortal from distress.
सदसस पतिमद्भुतं परियमिन्द्रस्य काम्यम|	to the assemblys wondrous lord to indras lovely friend who gives.
सनिं मेधामयासिषम|	wisdom have i drawn near in prayer.
यस्माद रते न सिध्यति यज्ञो विपश्चितश्चन|	he without whom no sacrifice een of the wise man prospers he.
स धीनां योगमिन्वति|	stirs up the series of thoughts.
आद रध्नोति हविष्क्र्तिं पराञ्चं कर्णोत्यध्वरम|	he makes the oblation prosper he promotes the course of sacrifice.
होत्रा देवेषु गछति|	our voice of praise goes to the gods.
नराशंसं सुध्र्ष्टममपश्यं सप्रथस्तमम|	i have seen narāśaṁsa him most resolute most widely famed.
दिवो नसद्ममखसम|	as twere the household priest of heaven.
कदु परेष्टाविषां रयीणामध्वर्यन्ता यदुन्निनीथोपाम|	what dearest pair is this in strength and riches that ye as priests are bring from the waters.
अयं वां यज्ञो अक्र्त परशस्तिं वसुधिती अवितारा जनानाम|	this sacrifice is your glorification ye who protect mankind and give them treasures.
आ वामश्वासः शुचयः पयस्पा वातरंहसो दिव्यासो अत्याः|	may your pure steeds raindrinkers bring you hither swift as the tempest your celestial coursers.
मनोजुवो वर्षणो वीतप्र्ष्ठा एह सवराजो अश्विनावहन्तु|	rapid as thought with fair backs full of vigour resplendent in their native light o aśvins.
आ वां रथोअवनिर्न परवत्वान सर्प्रवन्धुरः सुविताय गम्याः|	your car is like a torrent rushing downward may it come nigh broadseated for our welfare.
वर्ष्ण सथातारा मनसो जवीयानहम्पूर्वो यजतोधिष्ण्या यः|	car holy strong that ever would be foremost thoughtswift which ye for whom we long have mounted.
इहेह जाता समवावशीतामरेपसा तन्वा नामभिः सवैः|	here sprung to life they both have sung together with bodies free from stain with signs that mark them.
जिष्णुर्वामन्यः सुमखस्य सूरिर्दिवो अन्यः सुभगः पुत्र ऊहे|	one of you prince of sacrifice the victor the other counts as heavens auspicious offspring.
पर वां निचेरुः ककुहो वशाननु पिशङगरूपः सदनानि गम्याः|	may your carseat downgliding goldencoloured according to your wish approach our dwellings.
हरी अन्यस्य पीपयन्त वाजैर्मथ्रा रजांस्यश्विना वि घोषैः|	men shall feed full the bay steeds of the other and aśvins they with roars shall stir the regions.
पर वां शरद्वान वर्षभो न निष्षाट पूर्वीरिषश्चरति मध्व इष्णन|	forth comes your strong bull like a cloud of autumn sending abundant food of liquid sweetness.
एवैरन्यस्य पीपयन्त वाजैर्वेषन्तीरूर्ध्वा नद्यो न आगुः|	let them feed with the others ways and vigour the upper streams have come and do us service.
असर्जि वां सथविरा वेधसा गीर्बाळ्हे अश्विना तरेधा कषरन्ती|	your constant song hath been sent forth disposers that flows threefold in mighty strength o aśvins.
उपस्तुताववतं नाधमानं यामन्नयामञ्छ्र्णुतं हवं मे|	thus lauded give the suppliant protection moving or resting hear mine invocation.
उत सया वां रुशतो वप्ससो गीस्त्रिबर्हिषि सदसि पिन्वतेनॄन|	this song of bright contents for you is swelling in the mens hall where threefold grass is ready.
वर्षा वां मेघो वर्षणा पीपाय गोर्न सेके मनुषोदशस्यन|	your strong raincloud ye mighty ones hath swollen honouring men as twere with milks outpouring.
युवां पूषेवाश्विना पुरन्धिरग्निमुषां न जरते हविष्मान|	the prudent worshipper like pūṣan aśvins praises you as he praises dawn and agni.
हुवे यद वां वरिवस्या गर्णानो वि|	when singing with devotion he invokes you may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
स परत्नथा सहसा जायमानः सद्यः काव्यानि बळ अधत्त विश्वा|	he in the ancient way by strength engendered lo straight hath taken to himself all wisdom.
अपश्च मित्रं धिषणा च साधन देवा अग्निन्धारयन दरविणोदाम|	the waters and the bowl have made him friendly the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
स पूर्वया निविदा कव्यतायोरिमाः परजा अजनयन मनूनाम|	at Āyus ancient call he by his wisdom gave all this progeny of men their being.
विवस्वता चक्षसा दयामपश्च देवा अ ध द|	and by refulgent light heaven and the waters the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
तमीळत परथमं यज्ञसाधं विश आरीराहुतं रञ्जसानम|	praise him ye Āryan folk as chief performer of sacrifice adored and ever toiling.
ऊर्जः पुत्रं भरतं सर्प्रदानुं देवा|	welltended son of strength the constant giver the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
स मातरिश्वा पुरुवारपुष्टिर्विदद गातुं तनयाय सवर्वित|	that mātariśvan rich in wealth and treasure lightwinner finds a pathway for his offspring.
विशां गोपा जनिता रोदस्योर्देवा|	guard of our folk father of earth and heaven the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
नक्तोषासा वर्णमामेम्याने धापयेते शिशुमेकं समीची|	night and dawn changing each the others colour meeting together suckle one same infant.
दयावाक्षामा रुक्मो अन्तर्वि भाति देवा|	golden between the heaven and earth he shineth the gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां यज्ञस्य केतुर्मन्मसाधनो वेः|	root of wealth gatheringplace of treasures banner of sacrifice who grants the suppliants wishes.
अम्र्तत्वं रक्षमाणास एनं देवा|	preserving him as their own life immortal the gods possessed the wealthbestowing agni.
नू च पुरा च सदनं रयीणां जातस्य च जायमानस्य च कषाम|	now and of old the home of wealth the mansion of what is born and what was born aforetime.
सतश्च गोपां भवतश्च भूरेर्देवा|	guard of what is and what will be hereafterthe gods possessed the wealth bestowing agni.
दरविणोदा दरविणसस्तुरस्य दरविणोदाः सनरस्य पर यंसत|	may the wealthgiver grant us conquering riches may the wealthgiver grant us wealth with heroes.
दरविणोदा वीरवतीमिषं नो दरविणोदा रसते दीर्घमायुः|	may the wealthgiver grant us food with offspring and length of days may the wealthgiver send us.
एवा नो अग्ने समिधा वर्धानो रेवत पावक शरवसे वि भाहि|	fed with our fuel purifying agni so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.
तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्ताम अदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थ्विवी उतो दयौः|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
किमु शरेष्ठः किं यविष्ठो न आजगन किमीयते दूत्यं कद यदूचिम|	why hath the best why hath the youngest come to us upon what embassy comes he what have we said.
न निन्दिम चमसं यो महाकुलोअग्ने भरातर्द्रुण इद भूतिमूदिम|	we have not blamed the chalice of illustrious birth we brother agni praised the goodness of the wood.
एकं चमसं चतुरः कर्णोतन तद वो देवा अब्रुवन तद व आगमम|	the chalice that is single make ye into four thus have the gods commanded therefore am i come.
सौधन्वना यद्येवा करिष्यथ साकं देवैर्यज्ञियासो भविष्यथ|	if o sudhanvans children ye will do this thing ye shall participate in sacrifice with gods.
अग्निं दूतं परति यदब्रवीतनाश्वः कर्त्वो रथ उतेह कर्त्वः|	what to the envoy agni in reply ye spake a courser must be made a chariot fashioned here.
धेनुः कर्त्वा युवशा कर्त्वा दवा तानि भरातरनु वः कर्त्व्येमसि|	a cow must be created and the twain made young when we have done these things brother we turn to you.
चक्र्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छत कवेदभूद यः सय दूतो न आजगन|	when thus o Ṛbhus ye had done ye questioned thus whither went he who came to us a messenger.
यदावाख्यच्चमसाञ्चतुरः कर्तानादित तवष्टा गनास्वन्तर्न्यानजे|	then tvaṣṭar when he viewed the four wrought chalices concealed himself among the consorts of the gods.
हनामैनानिति तवष्टा यदब्रवीच्चमसं ये देवपानमनिन्दिषुः|	as tvaṣṭar thus had spoken let us slay these men who have reviled the chalice drinkingcup of gods.
अन्या नामानि कर्ण्वते सुते सचानन्यैरेनान्कन्या नामभि सपरत|	they gave themselves new names when soma juice was shed and under these new names the maiden welcomed them.
इन्द्रो हरी युयुजे अश्विना रथं बर्हस्पतिर्विश्वरूपामुपाजत|	indra hath yoked his bays the aśvins car is horsed bṛhaspati hath brought the cow of every hue.
रभुर्विभ्वा वाजो देवानगछत सवपसो यज्ञियम्भागमैतन|	ye went as Ṛbhus vibhvan vāja to the gods and skilled in war obtained your share in sacrifice.
निश्चर्मणो गामरिणीत धीतिभिर्या जरन्ता युवशा ताक्र्णोतन|	ye by your wisdom brought a cow from out a hide unto that ancient pair ye gave again their youth.
सौधन्वना अश्वादश्वमतक्षत युक्त्वा रथमुप देवानयातन|	out of a horse sudhanvans sons ye formed a horse a chariot ye equipped and went unto the gods.
इदमुदकं पिबतेत्यब्रवीतनेदं वा घा पिबता मुञ्जनेजनम|	drink ye this water were the words ye spake to them or drink ye this the rinsing of the muñjagrass.
सौधन्वना यदि तन नेव हर्यथ तर्तीये घ सवने मादयाध्वै|	if ye approve not even this sudhanvans sons then at the third libation gladden ye yourselves.
आपो भूयिष्ठा इत्येको अब्रवीदग्निर्भूयिष्ठ इत्यन्यो अब्रवीत|	most excellent are waters thus said one of you most excellent is agni thus another said.
वधर्यन्तीं बहुभ्यः परैको अब्रवीद रता वदन्तश्चमसानपिंशत|	another praised to many a one the lightning cloud then did ye shape the cups speaking the words of truth.
शरोणामेक उदकं गामवजति मांसमेकः पिंशति सूनयाभ्र्तम|	one downward to the water drives the crippled cow another trims the flesh brought on the carvingboard.
आ निम्रुचः शक्र्देको अपभरत किं सवित पुत्रेभ्यः पितरा उपावतुः|	one carries off the refuse at the set of sun how did the parents aid their children in their task.
उद्वत्स्वस्मा अक्र्णोतन तर्णं निवत्स्वपः सवपस्यय नरः|	on the high places ye have made the grass for man and water in the valleys by your skill o men.
अगोह्यस्य यदसस्तना गर्हे तदद्येदं रभवो नानु गछथ|	Ṛbhus ye iterate not today that act of yours your sleeping in the house of him whom naught can hide.
सम्मील्य यद भुवना पर्यसर्पत कव सवित तात्या पितर वासतुः|	as compassing them round ye glided through the worlds where had the venerable parents their abode.
अशपत यः करस्नं व अददे यः पराब्रवीत परोतस्म अब्रवीतन|	ye laid a curse on him who raised his arm at you to him who spake aloud to you ye spake again.
सुषुप्वांस रभवस्तदप्र्छतागोह्य क इदं नो अबूबुधत|	when ye had slept your fill ye Ṛbhus thus ye asked o thou whom naught may hide who now hath wakened us.
शवानं बस्तो बोधयितारमब्रवीत सम्वत्सर इदमद्या वयख्यत|	the goat declared the hound to be your wakener that day in a full year ye first unclosed our eyes.
दिवा यन्ति मरुतो भूम्याग्निरयं वातो अन्तरिक्षेण यति|	the maruts move in heaven on earth this agni through the midfirmament the wind approaches.
अद्भिर्यति वरुणः समुद्रैर्युष्मानिछन्तः शवसो नपातः|	varuṇa comes in the seas gathered waters o sons of strength desirous of your presence.
चन्द्रमा अप्स्वन्तरा सुपर्णो धावते दिवि|	within the waters runs the moon he with the beauteous wings in heaven.
न वो हिरण्यनेमयः पदं विन्दन्ति विद्युतो वित्तं मे अस्य रोदसी|	ye lightnings with your golden wheels men find not your abidingplace mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अर्थमिद वा उ अर्थिन आ जाया युवते पतिम|	surely men crave and gain their wish close to her husband clings the wife.
तुञ्जाते वर्ष्ण्यं पयः परिदाय रसं दुहे वित्तम|	and in embraces intertwined both give and take the bliss of love mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
मो षु देव अदः सवरव पादि दिवस परि|	o never may that light ye gods fall from its station in the sky.
मा सोम्यस्य शम्भुवः शूने भूम कदा चन वित्तम|	neer fail us one like soma sweet the spring of our felicity mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
यज्ञं पर्छाम्यवमं स तद दूतो वि वोचति|	i ask the last of sacrifice as envoy he shall tell it forth.
कव रतं पूर्व्यं गतं कस्तद बिभर्ति नूतनो वि|	where is the ancient law divine who is its new diffuser now mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अमी ये देवा सथन तरिष्वा रोचने दिवः|	ye gods who yonder have your home in the three lucid realms of heaven.
कद व रतं कदन्र्तं कव परत्ना व आहुतिर्वि|	what count ye truth and what untruth where is mine ancient call on you mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
कद व रतस्य धर्णसि कद वरुणस्य चक्षणम|	what is your firm support of law what varuṇas observant eye.
कदर्यम्णो महस पथाति करामेम दूढ्यो वि|	how may we pass the wicked on the path of mighty aryaman mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अहम सो अस्मि यः पुरा सुते वदामि कानि चित|	i am the man who sang of old full many a laud when soma flowed.
तं मा वयन्त्याध्यो वर्को न तर्ष्णजं मर्गं वि|	yet torturing cares consume me as the wolf assails the thirsty deer mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः|	like rival wives on every side enclosing ribs oppress me sore.
मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो वि|	o Śatakratu biting cares devour me singer of thy praise as rats devour the weavers threads mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अमी ये सप्त रश्मयस्तत्रा मे नाभिरातता|	where those seven rays are shining thence my home and family extend.
तरितस्तद वेदाप्त्यः स जामित्वाय रेभति वि|	this tṛta Āptya knoweth well and speaketh out for brotherhood mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अमी ये पञ्चोक्षणो मध्ये तस्थुर्महो दिवः|	may those five bulls which stand on high full in the midst of mighty heaven.
देवत्रा नु परवाच्यं सध्रीचीना नि वाव्र्तुर्वि|	having together swiftly borne my praises to the gods return mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
सुपर्णा एत आसते मध्य आरोधने दिवः|	high in the mid ascent of heaven those birds of beauteous pinion sit.
ते सेधन्ति पथो वर्कं तरन्तं यह्वतीरपो वि|	back from his path they drive the wolf as he would cross the restless floods mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
नव्यं तदुक्थ्यं हितं देवासः सुप्रवाचनम|	firm is this newwrought hymn of praise and meet to be told forth o gods.
रतमर्षन्ति सिन्धवः सत्यं तातान सूर्यो वि|	the flowing of the floods is law truth is the suns extended light mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अग्ने तव तयदुक्थ्यं देवेष्वस्त्याप्यम|	worthy of laud o agni is that kinship which thou hast with gods.
स नः सत्तो मनुष्वदा देवान यक्षि विदुष्टरो वि|	here seat thee like a man most wise bring thou the gods for sacrifice mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
सत्तो होता मनुष्वदा देवानछा विदुष्टरः|	here seated manlike as a priest shall wisest agni to the gods.
अग्निर्हव्या सुषूदति देवो देवेषु मेधिरो वि|	speed onward our oblations god among the gods intelligent mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
बरह्मा कर्णोति वरुणो गातुविदं तमीमहे|	varuṇa makes the holy prayer to him who finds the path we pray.
वयूर्णोति हर्दा मतिं नव्यो जायतां रतं वि|	he in the heart reveals his thought let sacred worship rise anew mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
असौ यः पन्था आदित्यो दिवि परवाच्यं कर्तः|	that pathway of the sun in heaven made to be highly glorified.
न स देवा अतिक्रमे तं मर्तासो न पश्यथ वि|	is not to be transgressed o gods o mortals ye behold it not mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
तरितः कूपेअवहितो देवान हवत ऊतये|	tṛta when buried in the well calls on the gods to succour him.
तच्छुश्राव बर्हस्पतिः कर्ण्वन्नंहूरणादुरु वि|	that call of his bṛhaspati heard and released him from distress mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
अरुणो मा सक्र्द वर्कः पथा यन्तं ददर्श हि|	a ruddy wolf beheld me once as i was faring on my path.
उज्जिहीते निचाय्या तष्टेव पर्ष्ट्यामयी वि|	he like a carpenter whose back is aching crouched and slunk away mark this my woe ye earth and heaven.
एनाङगूषेण वयमिन्द्रवन्तोअभि षयाम वर्जने सर्ववीराः|	through this our song may we allied with indra with all our heroes conquer in the battle.
तन नो|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
पर ये शुम्भन्ते जनयो न सप्तयो यामन रुद्रस्य सूनवःसुदंससः|	they who are glancing forth like women on their way doers of mighty deeds swift racers rudras sons.
रोदसी हि मरुतश्चक्रिरे वर्धे मदन्ति वीरा विदथेषु घर्ष्वयः|	the maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow in sacrifices they delight the strong and wild.
त उक्षितासो महिमानमाशत दिवि रुद्रासो अधि चक्रिरे सदः|	grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained the rudras have established their abode in heaven.
अर्चन्तो अर्कं जनयन्त इन्द्रियमधि शरियो दधिरे पर्श्निमातरः|	singing their song of praise and generating might they have put glory on the sons whom pṛśni bare.
गोमातरो यच्छुभयन्ते अञ्जिभिस्तनूषु शुभ्रा दधिरे विरुक्मतः|	when children of the cow they shine in bright attire and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments.
बाधन्ते विश्वमभिमातिनमप वर्त्मान्येषामनु रीयते घर्तम|	they drive away each adversary from their path and following their traces fatness floweth down.
वि ये भराजन्ते सुमखास रष्टिभिः परच्यावयन्तो अच्युताचिदोजसा|	when mighty warriors ye who glitter with your spears oerthrowing with your strength een what is neer oerthrown.
मनोजुवो यन मरुतो रथेष्वा वर्षव्रातासः पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वम|	when o ye maruts ye the host that send the rain had harnessed to your cars the thoughtfleet spotted deer.
पर यद रथेषु पर्षतीरयुग्ध्वं वाजे अद्रिं मरुतो रंहयन्तः|	when ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer urging the thunderbolt o maruts to the fray.
उतारुषस्य वि षयन्ति धाराश्चर्मेवोदभिर्व्युन्दन्ति भूम|	forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud and moisten like a skin the earth with waterfloods.
आ वो वहन्तु सप्तयो रघुष्यदो रघुपत्वानः पर जिगात बाहुभिः|	let your swiftgliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions come ye forward with your arms.
सीदता बर्हिरुरु वः सदस कर्तं मादयध्वं मरुतो मध्वो अन्धसः|	sit on the grass a wide seat hath been made for you delight yourselves o maruts in the pleasant food.
तेअवर्धन्त सवतवसो महित्वना नाकं तस्थुरुरु चक्रिरे सदः|	strong in their native strength to greatness have they grown stepped to the firmament and made their dwelling wide.
विष्णुर्यद धावद वर्षणं मदच्युतं वयो न सीदन्नधि बर्हिषि परिये|	when viṣṇu saved the soma bringing wild delight the maruts sate like birds on their dear holy grass.
शूरा इवेद युयुधयो न जग्मयः शरवस्यवो न पर्तनासु येतिरे|	in sooth like heroes fain for fight they rush about like combatants fameseeking have they striven in war.
भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना मरुद्भ्यो राजान इव तवेषसन्द्र्शो नरः|	before the maruts every creature is afraid the men are like to kings terrible to behold.
तवष्टा यद वज्रं सुक्र्तं हिरण्ययं सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिं सवपा अवर्तयत|	when tvaṣṭar deft of hand had turned the thunderbolt golden with thousand edges fashioned more skilfully.
धत्त इन्द्रो नर्यपांसि कर्तवेअहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जदर्णवम|	indra received it to perform heroic deeds vṛtra he slew and forced the flood of water forth.
ऊर्ध्वं नुनुद्रेअवतं त ओजसा दद्र्हाणं चिद बिभिदुर्विपर्वतम|	they with their vigorous strength pushed the well up on high and clove the cloud in twain though it was passing strong.
धमन्तो वाणं मरुतः सुदानवो मदे सोमस्य रण्यानि चक्रिरे|	the maruts bounteous givers sending forth their voice in the wild joy of soma wrought their glorious deeds.
जिह्मं नुनुद्रेअवतं तया दिशासिञ्चन्नुत्सं गोतमाय तर्ष्णजे|	they drave the cloud transverse directed hitherward and poured the fountain forth for thirsting gotama.
आ गछन्तीमवसा चित्रभानवः कामं विप्रस्यतर्पयन्त धामभिः|	shining with varied light they come to him with help they with their might fulfilled the longing of the sage.
या वः शर्म शशमानाय सन्ति तरिधातूनि दाशुषे यछताधि|	the shelters which ye have for him who lauds you bestow them threefold on the man who offers.
अस्मभ्यं तानि मरुतो वि यन्त रयिं नो धत्त वर्षणः सुवीरम|	extend the same boons unto us ye maruts give us o heroes wealth with noble offspring.
मध्वः सोमस्याश्विना मदाय परत्नो होता विवासते वाम|	aŚvins your ancient priest invites you hither to gladden you with draughts of meath of soma.
बर्हिष्मती रातिर्विश्रिता गीरिषा यातं नासत्योप वाजैः|	our gift is on the grass our song apportioned with food and strength come hither o nāsatyas.
यो वामश्विना मनसो जवीयान रथः सवश्वो विश आजिगाति|	that car of yours swifter than thought o aśvins which drawn by brave steeds cometh to the people.
येन गछथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तेन नरा वर्तिरस्मभ्यं यातम|	whereon ye seek the dwelling of the piouscome ye thereon to our abode o heroes.
रषिं नरावंहसः पाञ्चजन्यं रबीसादत्रिं मुञ्चथो गणेन|	ye freed sage atri whom the five tribes honoured from the strait pit ye heroes with his people.
मिनन्ता दस्योरशिवस्य माया अनुपूर्वं वर्षणा चोदयन्ता|	baffling the guiles of the malignant dasyu repelling them ye mighty in succession.
अश्वं न गूळ्हमश्विना दुरेवैर्र्षिं नरा वर्षणा रेभमप्सु|	rebha the sage ye mighty heroes aśvins whom like a horse vile men had sunk in water.
सं तं रिणीथो विप्रुतं दंसोभिर्न वां जूर्यन्ति पूर्व्या कर्तानि|	him wounded with your wondrous power ye rescued your exploits of old time endure for ever.
सुषुप्वांसं न निर्र्तेरुपस्थे सूर्यं न दस्रा तमसि कषियन्तम|	ye brought forth vandana ye wonderworkers for triumph like fair gold that hath been buried.
शुभे रुक्मं न दर्शतं निखातमुदूपथुरश्विना वन्दनाय|	like one who slumbered in destructions bosom or like the sun when dwelling in the darkness.
तद वां नरा शंस्यं पज्रियेण कक्षीवता नासत्या परिज्मन|	kakṣīvān pajras son must laud that exploit of yours nāsatyas heroes ye who wander.
शफादश्वस्य वाजिनो जनाय शतं कुम्भानसिञ्चतं मधूनाम|	when from the hoof of your strong horse ye showered a hundred jars of honey for the people.
युवं नरा सतुवते कर्ष्णियाय विष्णाप्वं ददथुर्विश्वकाय|	to kṛṣṇas son to viśvaka who praised you o heroes ye restored his son viṣṇāpū.
घोषायै चित पित्र्षदे दुरोने पतिं जूर्यन्त्या अश्विनावदत्तम|	to ghoṣā living in her fathers dwelling stricken in years ye gave a husband aśvins.
युवं शयावाय रुशतीमदत्तं महः कषोणस्याश्विना कण्वाय|	ruṣatī of the mighty people aśvins ye gave to Śyāva of the line of kaṇva.
परवाच्यं तद वर्षणा कर्तं वां यन नार्षदायश्रवो अध्यधत्तम|	this deed of yours ye strong ones should be published that ye gave glory to the son of nṛṣad.
पुरू वर्पांस्यश्विना दधाना नि पेदव ऊहथुराशुमश्वम|	o aśvins wearing many forms at pleasure on pedu ye bestowed a fleetfoot courser.
सहस्रसां वाजिनमप्रतीतमहिहनं शरवस्यं तरुत्रम|	strong winner of a thousand spoils resistless the serpent slayer glorious triumphant.
एतानि वां शरवस्या सुदानू बरह्माङगूषं सदनं रोदस्योः|	these glorious things are yours ye bounteous givers prayer praise in both worlds are your habitation.
यद वां पज्रासो अश्विना हवन्ते यातमिषा च विदुषे च वाजम|	o aśvins when the sons of pajra call you send strength with nourishment to him who knoweth.
सूनोर्मानेनाश्विना गर्णाना वाजं विप्राय भुरणा रदन्ता|	hymned with the reverence of a son o aśvins ye swift ones giving booty to the singer.
अगस्त्ये बरह्मणा वाव्र्धाना सं विश्पलां नासत्यारिणीतम|	glorified by agastya with devotion established viśpalā again nāsatyas.
कुह यान्ता सुष्टुतिं काव्यस्य दिवो नपाता वर्षणा शयुत्रा|	ye sons of heaven ye mighty whither went ye sought ye for his fair praise the home of kāvya.
हिरण्यस्येव कलशं निखातमुदूपथुर्दशमे अश्विनाहन|	when like a pitcher full of gold o aśvins on the tenth day ye lifted up the buried.
युवं चयवानमश्विना जरन्तं पुनर्युवानं चक्रथुः शचीभिः|	ye with the aid of your great powers o aśvins restored to youth the ancient man cyavāna.
युवो रथं दुहिता सूर्यस्य सह शरिया नासत्याव्र्णीत|	the daughter of the sun with all her glory o ye nāsatyas chose your car to bear her.
युवं तुग्राय पूर्व्येभिरेवैः पुनर्मन्यावभवतं युवाना|	ye everyouthful ones again remembered tugra according to your ancient manner.
युवं भुज्युमर्णसो निः समुद्राद विभिरूहथुर्र्ज्रेभिरश्वैः|	with horses brown of hue that flew with swift wings ye brought back bhujyu from the sea of billows.
अजोहवीदश्विना तौग्र्यो वां परोळ्हः समुद्रमव्यथिर्जगन्वान|	the son of tugra had invoked you aśvins borne on he went uninjured through the ocean.
निष टमूहथुः सुयुजा रथेन मनोजवसा वर्षणास्वस्ति|	ye with your chariot swift as thought wellharnessed carried him off o mighty ones to safety.
अजोहवीदश्विना वर्तिका वामास्नो यत सीममुञ्चतं वर्कस्य|	the quail had invocated you o aśvins when from the wolfs devouring jaws ye freed her.
वि जयुषा ययथुः सान्वद्रेर्जातं विष्वाचो अहतं विषेण|	with conquering car ye cleft the mountains ridges the offspring of viśvāc ye killed with poison.
शतं मेषान वर्क्ये मामहानं तमः परणीतमशिवेन पित्रा|	he whom for furnishing a hundred wethers to the shewolf his wicked father blinded.
आक्षी रज्राश्वे अश्विनावधत्तं जयोतिरन्धाय चक्रथुर्विचक्षे|	to him Ṛjrāśva gave ye eyes o aśvins light to the blind ye sent for perfect vision.
शुनमन्धाय भरमह्वयत सा वर्कीरश्विना वर्षणा नरेति|	to bring the blind man joy thus cried the shewolf o aśvins o ye mighty ones o heroes.
जारः कनीन इव चक्षदान रज्राश्वः शतमेकंच मेषान|	for me Ṛjrāśva like a youthful lover hath cut piecemeal one and a hundred wethers.
मही वामूतिरश्विना मयोभूरुत सरामं धिष्ण्या संरिणीथः|	great and wealgiving is your aid o aśvins ye objects of all thought made whole the cripple.
अथा युवामिदह्वयत पुरन्धिरागछतं सीं वर्षणाववोभिः|	purandhi also for this cause invoked you and ye o mighty came to her with succours.
अधेनुं दस्रा सतर्यं विषक्टामपिन्वतं शयवे अश्विनागाम|	ye wonderworkers filled with milk for Śayu the milkless cow emaciated barren.
युवं शचीभिर्विमदाय जायां नयूहथुः पुरुमित्रस्य योषाम|	and by your powers the child of purumitra ye brought to vimada to be his consort.
यवं वर्केणाश्विना वपन्तेषं दुहन्ता मनुषाय दस्रा|	ploughing and sowing barley o ye aśvins milking out food for men ye wonderworkers.
अभि दस्युं बकुरेणा धमन्तोरु जयोतिश्चक्रथुरार्याय|	blasting away the dasyu with your trumpet ye gave farspreading light unto the Ārya.
आथर्वणायाश्विना दधीचेअश्व्यं शिरः परत्यैरयतम|	ye brought the horses head aśvins and gave it unto dadhyac the offspring of atharvan.
स वां मधु पर वोचद रतायन तवाष्ट्रं यद दस्रावपिकक्ष्यं वाम|	true he revealed to you o wonderworkers sweet soma tvaṣṭars secret as your girdle.
सदा कवी सुमतिमा चके वां विश्वा धियो अश्विना परावतं मे|	o sages evermore i crave your favour be gracious unto all my prayers o aśvins.
अस्मे रयिं नासत्या बर्हन्तमपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं रराथाम|	grant me nāsatyas riches in abundance wealth famous and accompanied with children.
हिरण्यहस्तमश्विना रराणा पुत्रं नरा वध्रिमत्या अदत्तम|	with liberal bounty to the weaklings consorts ye heroes gave a son hiraṇyahasta.
तरिधा ह शयावमश्विना विकस्तमुज्जीवस ऐरयतंसुदानू|	and Śyāva cut into three several pieces ye brought to life again o bounteous aśvins.
एतानि वामश्विना वीर्याणि पर पूर्व्याण्यायवोअवोचन|	these your heroic exploits o ye aśvins done in the days of old have men related.
बरह्मक्र्ण्वन्तो वर्षणा युवभ्यां सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम|	may we addressing prayer to you ye mighty speak with brave sons about us to the synod.
तरिश चिन नो अद्या भवतं नवेदसा विभुर वां याम उत रातिर अश्विना|	ye who observe this day be with us even thrice farstretching is you bounty aśvins and your course.
युवोर हि यन्त्रं हिम्येव वाससो ऽभयायंसेन्या भवतम मनीषिभिः|	to you as to a cloak in winter we cleave close you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise.
तरयः पवयो मधुवाहने रथे सोमस्य वेनाम अनु विश्व इद विदुः|	three are the fellies in your honeybearing car that travels after somas loved one as all know.
तरय सकम्भास सकभितास आरभे तरिर नक्तं याथस तरिर व अश्विना दिवा|	three are the pillars set upon it for support thrice journey ye by night o aśvins thrice by day.
समाने अहन तरिर अवद्यगोहना तरिर अद्य यज्ञम मधुना मिमिक्षतम|	thrice in the selfsame day ye gods who banish want sprinkle ye thrice today our sacrifice with meath.
तरिर वाजवतीर इषो अश्विना युवं दोषा अस्मभ्यम उषसश च पिन्वतम|	and thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength at evening o ye aśvins and at break of day.
तरिर वर्तिर यातं तरिर अनुव्रते जने तरिः सुप्राव्येत्रेधेव शिक्षतम|	thrice come ye to our home thrice to the righteous folk thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help.
तरिर नान्द्यं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिः पर्क्षो अस्मे अक्षरेव पिन्वतम|	thrice o ye aśvins bring us what shall make us glad thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail.
तरिर नो रयिं वहतम अश्विना युवं तरिर देवताता तरिर उतावतं धियः|	thrice o ye aśvins bring to us abundant wealth thrice in the gods assembly thrice assist our thoughts.
तरिः सौभगत्वं तरिर उत शरवांसि नस तरिष्ठं वां सूरे दुहिता रुहद रथम|	thrice grant ye us prosperity thrice grant us fame for the suns daughter hath mounted your threewheeled car.
तरिर नो अश्विना दिव्यानि भेषजा तरिः पार्थिवानि तरिर उ दत्तम अद्भ्यः|	thrice aśvins grant to us the heavenly medicines thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold.
ओमानं शंयोर ममकाय सूनवे तरिधातु शर्म वहतं शुभस पती|	favour and health and strength bestow upon my son triple protection lords of splendour grant to him.
तरिर नो अश्विना यजता दिवेदिवे परि तरिधातु पर्थिवीम अशायतम|	thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us thrice o ye aśvins ye travel around the earth.
तिस्रो नासत्या रथ्या परावत आत्मेव वातः सवसराणि गछतम|	carborne from far away o ye nāsatyas come like vital air to bodies come ye to the three.
तरिर अश्विना सिन्धुभिः सप्तमात्र्भिस तरय आहावास तरेधा हविष कर्तम|	thrice o ye aśvins with the seven mother streams three are the jars the triple offering is prepared.
तिस्रः पर्थिवीर उपरि परवा दिवो नाकं रक्षेथे दयुभिर अक्तुभिर हितम|	three are the worlds and moving on above the sky ye guard the firmset vault of heaven through days and nights.
कव तरी चक्रा तरिव्र्तो रथस्य कव तरयो वन्धुरो ये सनीळाः|	where are the three wheels of your triple chariot where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened.
कदा योगो वाजिनो रासभस्य येन यज्ञं नासत्योपयाथः|	when will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it to bring you to our sacrifice nāsatyas.
आ नासत्या गछतं हूयते हविर मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिः|	nāsatyas come the sacred gift is offered up drink the sweet juice with lips that know the sweetness well.
युवोर हि पूर्वं सवितोषसो रथम रताय चित्रं घर्तवन्तम इष्यति|	savitar sends before the dawn of day your car fraught with oil variouscoloured to our sacrifice.
आ नासत्या तरिभिर एकादशैर इह देवेभिर यातम मधुपेयम अश्विना|	come o nāsatyas with the thriceeleven gods come o ye aśvins to the drinking of the meath.
परायुस तारिष्टं नी रपांसि मर्क्षतं सेधतं दवेषो भवतं सचाभुवा|	make long our days of life and wipe out all our sins ward off our enemies be with us evermore.
आ नो अश्विना तरिव्र्ता रथेनार्वाञ्चं रयिं वहतं सुवीरम|	borne in your triple car o aśvins bring us present prosperity with noble offspring.
शर्ण्वन्ता वाम अवसे जोहवीमि वर्धे च नो भवतं वाजसातौ|	i cry to you who hear me for protection be ye our helpers where men win the booty.
उषो भद्रेभिरा गहि दिवश्चिद रोचनादधि|	een from above the skys bright realm come uṣas by auspicious ways.
वहन्त्वरुणप्सव उप तवा सोमिनो गर्हम|	let red steeds bear thee to the house of him who pours the soma juice.
सुपेशसं सुखं रथं यमध्यस्था उषस्त्वम|	the chariot which thou mountest fair of shape o uṣas light to move.
तेना सुश्रवसं जनं परावाद्य दुहितर्दिवः|	therewith o daughter of the sky aid men of noble fame today.
वयश्चित ते पतत्रिणो दविपच्चतुष्पदर्जुनि|	bright uṣas when thy times return all quadrupeds and bipeds stir.
उषः परारन्न्र्तून्रनु दिवो अन्तेभ्यस परि|	and round about flock winged birds from all the boundaries of heaven.
वयुछन्ती हि रश्मिभिर्विश्वमाभासि रोचनम|	thou dawning with thy beams of light illumest all the radiant realm.
तां तवामुषर्वसूयवो गीर्भिः कण्वा अहूषत|	thee as thou art the kaṇvas fain for wealth have called with sacred songs.
इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमूतये मारुतं शर्धो अदितिंहवामहे|	call we for aid on indra mitra varuṇa and agni and the marut host and aditi.
रथं न दुर्गाद वसवः सुदानवो विश्वस्मान नोंहसो निष पिपर्तन|	even as a chariot from a difficult ravine bountiful vasus rescue us from all distress.
त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये भूत देवा वर्त्रतूर्येषु शम्भुवः|	come ye Ādityas for our full prosperity in conquests of the foe ye gods bring joy to us.
रथं|	even as a chariot from a difficult ravine bountiful vasus rescue us from all distress.
अवन्तु नः पितरः सुप्रवाचना उत देवी देवपुत्रे रताव्र्धा|	may the most glorious fathers aid us and the two goddesses mothers of the gods who strengthen law.
रथं|	even as a chariot from a difficult ravine bountiful vasus rescue us from all distress.
नराशंसं वाजिनं वाजयन्निह कषयद्वीरं पूषणं सुम्नैरीमहे|	to mighty narāśaṁsa strengthening his might to pūṣan ruler over men we pray with hymns.
रथं|	even as a chariot from a difficult ravine bountiful vasus rescue us from all distress.
बर्हस्पते सदमिन नः सुगं कर्धि शं योर्यत ते मनुर्हितं तदीमहे|	bṛhaspati make us evermore an easy path we crave what boon thou hast for men in rest and stir.
रथं|	like as a chariot from a difficult ravine bountiful vasus rescue us from all distress.
इन्द्रं कुत्सो वर्त्रहणं शचीपतिं काटे निबाळ्ह रषिरह्वदूतये|	sunk in the pit the Ṛṣi kutsa called to aid indra the vṛtraslayer lord of power and might.
रथं|	even as a chariot from a difficult ravine bountiful vasus rescue us from all distress.
देवैर्नो देव्यदितिर्नि पातु देवस्त्राता तरायतामप्रयुछन|	may aditi the goddess guard us with the gods may the protecting god keep us with ceaseless care.
तन नो|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
कया शुभा सवयसः सनीळाः समान्या मरुतः सं मिमिक्षुः|	with what bright beauty are the maruts jointly invested peers in age who dwell together.
कया मती कुत एतास एतेअर्चन्ति शुष्मं वर्षणो वसूया|	from what place have they come with what intention sing they their strength through love of wealth these heroes.
कस्य बरह्माणि जुजुषुर्युवानः को अध्वरे मरुत आ ववर्त|	whose prayers have they the youthful ones accepted who to his sacrifice hath turned the maruts.
शयेनानिव धरजतो अन्तरिक्षे केन महा मनसा रीरमाम|	we will delay them on their journey sweepingwith what high spiritthrough the air like eagles.
कुतस्त्वमिन्द्र माहिनः सन्नेको यासि सत्पते किं त इत्था|	whence comest thou alone thou who art mighty indra lord of the brave what is thy purpose.
सं पर्छसे समराणः शुभानैर्वोचेस्तन नो हरिवो यत्ते अस्मे|	thou greetest us when meeting us the bright ones lord of bay steeds say what thou hast against us.
बरह्माणि मे मतयः शं सुतासः शुष्म इयर्ति परभ्र्तो मे अद्रिः|	mine are devotions hymns sweet are libations strength stirs and hurled forth is my bolt of thunder.
आ शासते परति हर्यन्त्युक्थेमा हरी वहतस्ता नो अछ|	they call for me their lauds are longing for me these my bay steeds bear me to these oblations.
अतो वयमन्तमेभिर्युजानाः सवक्षत्रेभिस्तन्वः शुम्भमानाः|	therefore together with our strong companions having adorned our bodies now we harness.
महोभिरेतानुप युज्महे नविन्द्र सवधामनु हि नो बभूथ|	our spotted deer with might for thou o indra hast learnt and understood our godlike nature.
कव सया वो मरुतः सवधासीद यन मामेकं समधत्ताहिहत्ये|	where was that nature then of yours o maruts that ye charged me alone to slay the dragon.
अहं हयूग्रस्तविषस्तुविष्मान विश्वस्य शत्रोरनमं वधस्नैः|	for i in truth am fierce and strong and mighty i bent away from every foemans weapons.
भूरि चकर्थ युज्येभिरस्मे समानेभिर्व्र्षभ पौंस्येभिः|	yea much hast thou achieved with us for comrades with manly valour like thine own thou hero.
भूरीणि हि कर्णवामा शविष्ठेन्द्र करत्वा मरुतो यद्वशाम|	much may we too achieve o mightiest indra with our great power we maruts when we will it.
वधीं वर्त्रं मरुत इन्द्रियेण सवेन भामेन तविषो बभूवान|	vṛtra i slew by mine own strength o maruts having waxed mighty in mine indignation.
अहमेता मनवे विश्वश्चन्द्राः सुगा अपश्चकर वज्रबाहुः|	i with the thunder in my hand created for man these lucid softly flowing waters.
अनुत्तमा ते मघवन नकिर्नु न तवावानस्ति देवता विदानः|	nothing o maghavan stands firm before thee among the gods not one is found thine equal.
न जायमानो नशते न जातो यानि करिष्या कर्णुहिप्रव्र्द्ध|	none born or springing into life comes nigh thee do what thou hast to do exceeding mighty.
एकस्य चिन मे विभ्वस्त्वोजो या नु दध्र्ष्वान कर्णवै मनीषा|	mine only be transcendent power whatever i daring in my spirit may accomplish.
अहं हयूग्रो मरुतो विदानो यानि चयवमिन्द्र इदीश एषाम|	for i am known as terrible o maruts i indra am the lord of what i ruined.
अमन्दन मा मरुत सतोमो अत्र यन मे नरः शरुत्यं बरह्म चक्र|	now o ye maruts hath your praise rejoiced me the glorious hymn which ye have made me heroes.
इन्द्राय वर्ष्णे सुमखाय मह्यं सख्ये सखायस्तन्वेतनूभिः|	for me for indra champion strong in battle for me yourselves as lovers for a lover.
एवेदेते परति मा रोचमाना अनेद्यः शरव एषो दधानाः|	here truly they send forth their sheen to meet me wearing their blameless glory and their vigour.
संचक्ष्या मरुतश्चन्द्रवर्णा अछान्त मे छदयाथा चनूनम|	when i have seen you maruts in gay splendour ye have delighted me so now delight me.
को नवत्र मरुतो मामहे वः पर यातन सखीन्रछा सखायः|	who here hath magnified you o ye maruts speed forward o ye lovers to your lovers.
मन्मानि चित्रा अपिवातयन्त एषां भूत नवेदा म रतानाम|	ye radiant ones assisting their devotions of these my holy rites he ye regardful.
आ यद दुवस्याद दुवसे न कारुरस्माञ्चक्रे मान्यस्य मेधा|	to this hath mānyas wisdom brought us so as to aid as aids the poet him who worships.
ओ षु वर्त्त मरुतो विप्रमछेमा बरह्माणि जरिता वोर्चत|	bring hither quick on to the sage ye maruts these prayers for you the singer hath recited.
एष व सतोमो मरुत इयं गीर्मान्दार्यस्य मान्यस्य करोः|	may this your praise may this your song o maruts sung by the poet mānas son māndārya.
एषा यासीष्ट तन्वे वयां विद्यामेषं वर्जनं जीरदानुम|	bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
इन्द्राय हि दयौरसुरो अनम्नतेन्द्राय मही पर्थिवी वरीमभिर्द्युम्नसाता वरीमभिः|	to indra dyaus the asura hath bowed him down to indra mighty earth with wideextending tracts to win the light with widespread tracts.
इन्द्रं विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दधिरे पुरः|	all gods of one accord have set indra in front preeminent.
इन्द्राय विश्वा सवनानि मानुषा रातानि सन्तु मानुषा|	for indra all libations must be set apart all mans libations set apart.
विश्वेषु हि तवा सवनेषु तुञ्जते समानमेकं वर्षमण्यवः पर्थक सवः सनिष्यवः पर्थक|	in all libations men with hero spirit urge the universal one each seeking several light each fain to win the light apart.
तं तवा नावं न पर्षणिं शूषस्य धुरि धीमहि|	thee furthering like a ship will we set to the chariotpole of strength.
इन्द्रं न यज्ञैश्चितयन्त आयव सतोमेभिरिन्द्रमायवः|	as men who win with sacrifices indras thought men who win indra with their lauds.
वि तवा ततस्रे मिथुना अवस्यवो वरजस्य साता गव्यस्य निःस्र्जः सक्षन्त इन्द्र निःस्र्जः|	couples desirous of thine aid are storming thee pouring their presents forth to win a stall of kine pouring gifts indra seeking thee.
यद गव्यन्ता दवा जना सवर्यन्ता समूहसि|	when two men seeking spoil or heaven thou bringest face to face in war.
आविष करिक्रद वर्षणं सचाभुवं वज्रमिन्द्र सचाभुवम|	thou showest indra then the bolt thy constant friend the bull that ever waits on thee.
विदुष टे अस्य वीर्यस्य पूरवः पुरो यदिन्द्र शारदीरवातिरः सासहानो अवातिरः|	this thine heroic power men of old time have known wherewith thou breakest down indra autumnal forts breakest them down with conquering might.
शासस्तमिन्द्र मर्त्यमयज्युं शवसस पते|	thou hast chastised o indra lord of strength the man who worships not.
महीममुष्णाः पर्थिवीमिमा अपो मन्दसान इमा अपः|	and made thine own this great earth and these waterfloods with joyous heart these waterfloods.
आदित ते अस्य वीर्यस्य चर्किरन मदेषु वर्षन्नुशिजो यदाविथ सखीयतो यदाविथ|	and they have bruited far this heromight when thou o strong one in thy joy helpest thy suppliants who sought to win thee for their friend.
चकर्थ कारमेभ्यः पर्तनासु परवन्तव|	their battlecry thou madest sound victorious in the shocks of war.
ते अन्यामअन्यां नद्यं सनिष्णत शरवस्यन्तः सनिष्णत|	one stream after another have they gained from thee eager for glory have they gained.
उतो नो अस्या उषसो जुषेत हयर्कस्य बोधि हविषो हवीमभिः सवर्षाता हवीमभिः|	also this morn may he be well inclined to us mark at our call our offerings and our song of praise our call that we may win the light.
यदिन्द्र हन्तवे मर्धो वर्षा वज्रिञ्चिकेतसि|	as thou o indra thunderarmed wilt as the strong one slay the foe.
आ मे अस्य वेधसो नवीयसो मन्म शरुधि नवीयसः|	listen thou to the prayer of me a later sage hear thou a later sages prayer.
तवं तमिन्द्र वाव्र्धानो अस्मयुरमित्रयन्तं तुविजात मर्त्यं वज्रेण शूर मर्त्यम|	o indra waxen strong and wellinclined to us thou very mighty slay the man that is our foe slay the man hero with thy bolt.
जहि यो नो अघायति शर्णुष्व सुश्रवस्तमः|	slay thou the man who injures us hear thou as readiest to hear.
रिष्टं न यामन्नप भूतु दुर्मतिर्विश्वाप भूतु दुर्मतिः|	far be malignity like mischief on the march afar be all malignity.
पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी रताव्र्धा मही सतुषे विदथेषु परचेतसा|	i praise with sacrifices mighty heaven and earth at festivals the wise the strengtheners of law.
देवेभिर्ये देवपुत्रे सुदंससेत्था धिया वार्याणि परभूषतः|	who having gods for progeny conjoined with gods through wonderworking wisdom bring forth choicest boons.
उत मन्ये पितुरद्रुहो मनो मातुर्महि सवतवस्तद धवीमभिः|	with invocations on the gracious fathers mind and on the mothers great inherent power i muse.
सुरेतसा पितरा भूम चक्रतुरुरु परजाया अम्र्तंवरीमभिः|	prolific parents they have made the world of life and for their brood all round wide immortality.
ते सूनवः सवपसः सुदंससो मही जज्ञुर्मातरा पूर्वचित्तये|	these sons of yours well skilled in work of wondrous power brought forth to life the two great mothers first of all.
सथातुश्च सत्यं जगतश्च धर्मणि पुत्रस्य पाथः पदमद्वयाविनः|	to keep the truth of all that stands and all that moves ye guard the station of your son who knows no guile.
ते मायिनो ममिरे सुप्रचेतसो जामी सयोनी मिथुना समोकसा|	they with surpassing skill most wise have measured out the twins united in their birth and in their home.
नव्यंनव्यं तन्तुमा तन्वते दिवि समुद्रे अन्तः कवयः सुदीतयः|	they the refulgent sages weave within the sky yea in the depths of sea a web for ever new.
तद राधो अद्य सवितुर्वरेण्यं वयं देवस्य परसवे मनामहे|	this is today the goodliest gift of savitar this thought we have when now the god is furthering us.
अस्मभ्यं दयावाप्र्थिवी सुचेतुना रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं शतग्विनम|	on us with lovingkindness heaven and earth bestow riches and various wealth and treasure hundredfold.
अस्तु शरौषट पुरो अग्नीं धिया दध आ नु तच छर्धो दिव्यं वर्णीमह इन्द्रवायू वर्णीमहे|	heard be our prayer in thought i honour agni first now straightway we elect this heavenly company indra and vāyu we elect.
यद ध कराणा विवस्वति नाभा संदायि नव्यसी|	for when our latest thought is raised and on vivasvān centred well.
अध पर सू न उप यन्तु धीतयो देवां अछा न धीतयः|	then may our holy songs go forward on their way our songs as twere unto the gods.
यद ध तयन मित्रावरुणाव रताद अध्य आददाथे अन्र्तं सवेन मन्युना दक्षस्य सवेन मन्युना|	as there ye mitra varuṇa above the true have taken to yourselves the untrue with your mind with wisdoms mental energy.
युवोर इत्थाधि सद्मस्व अपश्याम हिरण्ययम|	so in the seats wherein ye dwell have we beheld the golden one.
धीभिश चन मनसा सवेभिर अक्षभिः सोमस्य सवेभिर अक्षभिः|	not with our thoughts or spirit but with these our eyes yea with the eyes that soma gives.
युवां सतोमेभिर देवयन्तो अश्विनाश्रावयन्त इव शलोकम आयवो युवां हव्याभ्य आयवः|	aśvins the pious call you with their hymns of praise sounding their loud song forth to you these living men to their oblations living men.
युवोर विश्वा अधि शरियः पर्क्षश च विश्ववेदसा|	all glories and all nourishment lords of all wealth depend on you.
परुषायन्ते वाम पवयो हिरण्यये रथे दस्रा हिरण्यये|	the fellies of your golden chariot scatter drops mighty ones of your golden car.
अचेति दस्रा वय  नाकम रण्वथो युञ्जते वां रथयुजो दिविष्टिष्व अध्वस्मानो दिविष्टिषु|	well is it known o mighty ones ye open heaven for you the chariotsteeds are yoked for morning rites unswerving steeds for morning rites.
अधि वां सथाम वन्धुरे रथे दस्रा हिरण्यये|	we set you on the chariotseat ye mighty on the golden car.
पथेव यन्ताव अनुशासता रजो ऽञजसा शासता रजः|	ye seek midair as by a path that leads aright as by a path that leads direct.
शचीभिर नः शचीवसू दिवा नक्तं दशस्यतम|	o rich in strength through your great power vouchsafe us blessings day and night.
मा वां रातिर उप दसत कदा चनास्मद रातिः कदा चन|	the offerings which we bring to you shall never fail gifts brought by us shall never fail.
वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षपाणास इन्दव इमे सुता अद्रिषुतास उद्भिदस तुभ्यं सुतास उद्भिदः|	these somadrops strong indra drink for heroes poured pressed out by pressingstones are welling forth for thee for thee the drops are welling forth.
ते तवा मन्दन्तु दावने महे चित्राय राधसे|	they shall make glad thy heart to give to give wealth great and wonderful.
गीर्भिर गिर्वाह सतवमान आ गहि सुम्र्ळीको न आ गहि|	thou who acceptest praise come glorified by hymns come thou to us benevolent.
ओ षू णो अग्ने शर्णुहि तवम ईळितो देवेभ्यो बरवसि यज्ञियेभ्यो राजभ्यो यज्ञियेभ्यः|	quickly o agni hear us magnified by us thou shalt speck for us to the gods adorable yea to the kings adorable.
यद ध तयाम अङगिरोभ्यो धेनुं देवा अदत्तन|	when o ye deities ye gave that milchcow to the aṅgirases.
वि तां दुह्रे अर्यमा कर्तरी सचां एष तां वेद मे सचा|	they milked her aryaman joined with them did the work he knoweth her as well as i.
मो षु वो अस्मद अभि तानि पौंस्या सना भूवन दयुम्नानि मोत जारिषुर अस्मत पुरोत जारिषुः|	neer may these manly deeds of yours for us grow old never may your bright glories fall into decay never before our time decay.
यद वश चित्रं युगेयुगे नव्यं घोषाद अमर्त्यम|	what deed of yours new every age wondrous surpassing man rings forth.
अस्मासु तन मरुतो यच च दुष्टरं दिध्र्ता यच च दुष्टरम|	whatever maruts may be difficult to gain grant us whateer is hard to gain.
दध्यङ ह मे जनुषम पूर्वो अङगिराः परियमेधः कण्वो अत्रिर मनुर विदुस ते मे पूर्वे मनुर विदुः|	dadhyac of old aṅgiras priyamedha these and kaṇva atri manu knew my birth yea those of ancient days and manu knew.
तेषां देवेष्व आयतिर अस्माकं तेषु नाभयः|	their long line stretcheth to the gods our birthconnexions are with them.
तेषाम पदेन मह्य आ नमे गिरेन्द्राग्नी आ नमे गिरा|	to these for their high station i bow down with song to indra agni bow with song.
होता यक्षद वनिनो वन्त वार्यम बर्हस्पतिर यजति वेन उक्षभिः पुरुवारेभिर उक्षभिः|	let the invoker bless let offerers bring choice gifts bṛhaspati the friend doth sacrifice with steers steers that have many an excellence.
जग्र्भ्मा दूरादिशं शलोकम अद्रेर अध तमना|	now with our ears we catch the sound of the pressstone that rings afar.
अधारयद अररिन्दानि सुक्रतुः पुरू सद्मानि सुक्रतुः|	the very strong hath gained the waters by himself the strong gained many a restingplace.
ये देवासो दिव्य एकादश सथ पर्थिव्याम अध्य एकादश सथ|	o ye eleven gods whose home is heaven o ye eleven who make earth your dwelling.
अप्सुक्षितो महिनैकादश सथ ते देवासो यज्ञम इमं जुषध्वम|	ye who with might eleven live in waters accept this sacrifice o gods with pleasure.
अश्वावति परथमो गोषु गछति सुप्रावीरिन्द्र मर्त्यस्तवोतिभिः|	indra the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine.
तमित पर्णक्षि वसुना भवीयसा सिन्धुमापो यथाभितो विचेतसः|	with amplest wealth thou fillest him as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill sindhu full.
आपो न देवीरुप यन्ति होत्रियमवः पश्यन्ति विततं यथा रजः|	the heavenly waters come not nigh the priestly bowl they but look down and see how far midair is spread.
पराचैर्देवासः पर णयन्ति देवयुं बरह्मप्रियं जोषयन्ते वरा इव|	the deities conduct the pious man to them like suitors they delight in him who loveth prayer.
अधि दवयोरदधा उक्थ्यं वचो यतस्रुचा मिथुना या सपर्यतः|	praiseworthy blessing hast thou laid upon the pair who with uplifted ladle serve thee man and wife.
असंयत्तो वरते ते कषेति पुष्यति भद्रा शक्तिर्यजमानाय सुन्वते|	unchecked he dwells and prospers in thy law thy power brings blessing to the sacrificer pouring gifts.
आदङगिराः परथमं दधिरे वय इद्धाग्नयः शम्या येसुक्र्त्यया|	first the aṅgirases won themselves vital power whose fires were kindled through good deeds and sacrifice.
सर्वं पणेः समविन्दन्त भोजनमश्वावन्तं गोमन्तमा पशुं नरः|	the men together found the paṇis hoarded wealth the cattle and the wealth in horses and in kine.
यज्ञैरथर्वा परथमः पथस्तते ततः सूर्यो वरतपावेन आजनि|	atharvan first by sacrifices laid the paths then guardian of the law sprang up the loving sun.
आ गा आजदुशना काव्यः सचा यमस्य जातमम्र्तं यजामहे|	uśanā kāvya straightway hither drove the kine let us with offerings honour yamas deathless birth.
बर्हिर्वा यत सवपत्याय वर्ज्यतेअर्को वा शलोकमाघोषतेदिवि|	when sacred grass is trimmed to aid the auspicious work or the hymn makes its voice of praise sound to the sky.
गरावा यत्र वदति कारुरुक्थ्यस्तस्येदिन्द्रो अभिपित्वेषु रण्यति|	where the stone rings as twere a singer skilled in laudindra in truth delights when these come near to him.
अभि तयं मेषं पुरुहूतं रग्मियमिन्द्रं गीर्भिर्मदता वस्वो अर्णवम|	make glad with songs that ram whom many men invoke worthy of songs of praise indra the sea of wealth.
यस्य दयावो न विचरन्ति मानुषा भुजे मंहिष्ठमभि विप्रमर्चत|	whose gracious deeds for men spread like the heavens abroad sing praise to him the sage most liberal for our good.
अभीमवन्वन सवभिष्टिमूतयोअन्तरिक्षप्रां तविषीभिराव्र्तम|	as aids the skilful Ṛbhus yearned to indra strong to save who fills midair encompassed round with might.
इन्द्रं दक्षास रभवो मदच्युतं शतक्रतुं जवनी सून्र्तारुहत|	rushing in rapture and oer Śatakratu came the gladdening shout that urged him on to victory.
तवं गोत्रमङगिरोभ्योअव्र्णोरपोतात्रये शतदुरेषु गातुवित|	thou hast disclosed the kines stall for the aṅgirases and made a way for atri by a hundred doors.
ससेन चिद विमदायावहो वस्वाजावद्रिं वावसानस्यनर्तयन|	on vimada thou hast bestowed both food and wealth making thy bolt dance in the sacrificers fight.
तवमपामपिधानाव्र्णोर अपाधारयः पर्वते दानुमद वसु|	thou hast unclosed the prisons of the waters thou hast in the mountain seized the treasure rich in gifts.
वर्त्रं यदिन्द्र शवसावधीरहिमादित सूर्यं दिव्यारोहयो दर्शे|	when thou hadst slain with might the dragon vṛtra thou indra didst raise the sun in heaven for all to see.
तवं मायाभिरप मायिनोअधमः सवधाभिर्ये अधि शुप्तावजुह्वत|	with wondrous might thou blewest enchanter fiends away with powers celestial those who called on thee in jest.
तवं पिप्रोर्न्र्मणः परारुजः पुरः पर रजिश्वानं दस्युहत्येष्वाविथ|	thou herohearted hast broken down piprus forts and helped Ṛjiśvan when the dasyus were struck dead.
तवं कुत्सं शुष्णहत्येष्वाविथारन्धयोअतिथिग्वाय शम्बरम|	thou savedst kutsa when Śuṣṇa was smitten down to atithigva gavest Śambara for a prey.
महान्तं चिदर्बुदं नि करमीः पदा सनादेव दस्युहत्याय जज्ञिषे|	een mighty arbuda thou troddest under foot thou from of old wast born to strike the dasyus dead.
तवे विश्वा तविषी सध्र्यग घिता तव राधः सोमपीथाय हर्षते|	all power and might is closely gathered up in thee thy bounteous spirit joys in drinking soma juice.
तव वज्रश्चिकिते बाह्वोर्हितो वर्श्चा शत्रोरव विश्वानि वर्ष्ण्या|	known is the thunderbolt that lies within thine arms rend off therewith all manly prowess of our foe.
वि जानीह्यार्यान ये च दस्यवो बर्हिष्मते रन्धया शासदव्रतान|	discern thou well Āryas and dasyus punishing the lawless give them up to him whose grass is strewn.
शाकी भव यजमानस्य चोदिता विश्वेत ता ते सधमादेषु चाकन|	be thou the sacrificers strong encourager all these thy deeds are my delight at festivals.
अनुव्रताय रन्धयन्नपव्रतानाभूभिरिन्द्रः शनथयन्ननाभुवः|	indra gives up the lawless to the pious man destroying by the strong ones those who have no strength.
वर्द्धस्य चिद वर्धतो दयामिनक्षत सतवानो वम्रो वि जघान सन्दिहः|	vamra when glorified destroyed the gathered piles of the still waxing great one who would reach the heaven.
तक्षद यत त उशना सहसा सहो वि रोदसी मज्मना बाधते शवः|	the might which uśanā hath formed for thee with might rends in its greatness and with strength both worlds apart.
आ तवा वातस्य नर्मणो मनोयुज आ पूर्यमाणमवहन्नभि शरवः|	o herosouled the steeds of vāta yoked by thought have carried thee to fame while thou art filled with power.
मन्दिष्ट यदुशने काव्ये सचानिन्द्रो वङकू वङकुतराधि तिष्ठति|	when indra hath rejoiced with kāvya uśanā he mounts his steeds who swerve wider and wider yet.
उग्रो ययिं निरपः सरोतसास्र्जद वि शुष्णस्य दरंहिता ऐरयत पुरः|	the strong hath loosed his bolt with the swift rush of rain and he hath rent in pieces Śuṣṇas firmbuilt forts.
आ समा रथं वर्षपाणेषु तिष्ठसि शार्यातस्य परभ्र्तायेषु मन्दसे|	thou mountest on thy car amid strong soma draughts Śāryāta brought thee those in which thou hast delight.
इन्द्र यथा सुतसोमेषु चाकनोअनर्वाणंश्लोकमा रोहसे दिवि|	indra when thou art pleased with men whose soma flows thou risest to unchallenged glory in the sky.
अददा अर्भां महते वचस्यवे कक्षीवते वर्चयामिन्द्र सुन्वते|	to old kakṣīvān somapresser skilled in song o indra thou didst give the youthful vṛcayā.
मेनाभवो वर्षणश्वस्य सुक्रतो विश्वेत ता ते सवनेषु परवाच्या|	thou very wise wast menā vrsanśvas child those deeds of thine must all be told at soma feasts.
इन्द्रो अश्रायि सुध्यो निरेके पज्रेषु सतोमो दुर्यो न यूपः|	the good mans refuge in his need is indra firm as a doorpost praised among the pajras.
अश्वयुर्गव्यू रथयुर्वसूयुरिन्द्र इद रायः कषयति परयन्ता|	indra alone is lord of wealth the giver lover of riches chariots kine and horses.
इदं नमो वर्षभाय सवराजे सत्यशुष्माय तवसेअवाचि|	to him the mighty one the selfresplendent verily strong and great this praise is uttered.
अस्मिन्निन्द्र वर्जने सर्ववीराः समत सूरिभिस्तव शर्मन सयाम|	may we and all the heroes with the princes be in this fray o indra in thy keeping.
सहस्रं त इन्द्रोतयो नः सहस्रमिषो हरिवो गूर्ततमाः|	a thousand are thy helps for us o indra a thousand lord of bays thy choice refreshments.
सहस्रं रायो मादयध्यै सहस्रिण उप नो यन्तु वाजाः|	wealth of a thousand sorts hast thou to cheer us may precious goods come nigh to us in thousands.
आ नोअवोभिर्मरुतो यान्त्वछा जयेष्ठेभिर्वा बर्हद्दिवैःसुमायाः|	may the most sapient maruts with protection with best boons brought from lofty heaven approach us.
अध यदेषां नियुतः परमाः समुद्रस्य चिद्धनयन्त पारे|	now when their team of the most noble horses speeds even on the seas extremest limit.
मिम्यक्ष येषु सुधिता घर्ताची हिरण्यनिर्णिगुपरा न रष्टिः|	close to them clings one moving in seclusion like a mans wife like a spear carried rearward.
गुहा चरन्ती मनुषो न योषा सभावती विदथ्येव सं वाक|	well grasped bright decked with gold there is vāk also like to a courtly eloquent dame among them.
परा शुभ्रा अयासो यव्या साधारण्येव मरुतो मिमिक्षुः|	far off the brilliant neverweary maruts cling to the young maid as a joint possession.
न रोदसी अप नुदन्त घोरा जुषन्त वर्धं सख्याय देवाः|	the fierce gods drave not rodasī before them but wished for her to grow their friend and fellow.
जोषद यदीमसुर्या सचध्यै विषितस्तुका रोदसी नर्मणाः|	when chose immortal rodasī to followshe with loose tresses and heroic spirit.
आ सूर्येव विधतो रथं गात तवेषप्रतीका नभसो नेत्या|	she climbed her servants chariot she like sūrya with cloudlike motion and refulgent aspect.
आस्थापयन्त युवतिं युवानः शुभे निमिष्लां विदथेषुपज्राम|	upon their car the young men set the maiden wedded to glory mighty in assemblies.
अर्को यद वो मरुतो हविष्मान गायद गाथं सुतसोमो दुवस्यन|	when your song maruts rose and with oblation the somapourer sang his hymn in worship.
परतं विवक्मि वक्म्यो य एषां मरुतां महिमा सत्यो अस्ति|	i will declare the greatness of these maruts their real greatness worthy to be lauded.
सचा यदीं वर्षमणा अहंयु सथिरा चिज्जनीर्वहते सुभागाः|	how with them she though firm strongminded haughty travels to women happy in their fortune.
पान्ति मित्रावरुणाववद्याच्चयत ईमर्यमो अप्रशस्तान|	mitra and varuṇa they guard from censure aryaman too discovers worthless sinners firm things are overthrown that neer were shaken he prospers maruts who gives choice oblations.
उत चयवन्ते अच्युता धरुवाणि वाव्र्ध ईं मरुतो दातिवारः|	none of us maruts near or at a distance hath ever reached the limit of your vigour.
नही नु वो मरुतो अन्त्यस्मे आरात्ताच्चिच्छवसो अन्तमापुः|	they in courageous might still waxing boldly have compassed round their foemen like an ocean.
ते धर्ष्णुना शवसा शूशुवांसोअर्णो न दवेषो धर्षता परि षठुः|	may we this day be dearest friends of indra and let us call on him in fight tomorrow.
वयमद्येन्द्रस्य परेष्ठा वयं शवो वोचेमहि समर्ये|	so were we erst new might attend us daily so be with us Ṛbhukṣan of the heroes.
वयं पुरा महि च नो अनु दयून तन न रभुक्षा नरामनु षयात|	may this your laud may this your song o maruts sung by the poet mānas son māndārya.
एष व सतोमो|	bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
सुरूपक्र्त्नुमूतये सुदुघामिव गोदुहे|	as a good cow to him who milks we call the doer of fair deeds.
जुहूमसि दयविदयवि|	to our assistance day by day.
उप नः सवना गहि सोमस्य सोमपाः पिब|	come thou to our libations drink of soma somadrinker thou.
गोदा इद रेवतोमदः|	the rich ones rapture giveth kine.
अथा ते अन्तमानां विद्याम सुमतीनाम|	so may we be acquainted with thine innermost benevolence.
मा नो अति खय आगहि|	neglect us not come hitherward.
परेहि विग्रमस्त्र्तमिन्द्रं पर्छा विपश्चितम|	go to the wise unconquered one ask thou of indra skilled in song.
यस्ते सखिभ्य आ वरम|	him who is better than thy friends.
उत बरुवन्तु नो निदो निरन्यतश्चिदारत|	whether the men who mock us say depart unto another place.
दधाना इन्द्र इद दुवः|	ye who serve indra and none else.
उत नः सुभगानरिर्वोचेयुर्दस्म कर्ष्टयः|	or whether god of wondrous deeds all our true people call us blest.
सयामेदिन्द्रस्य शर्मणि|	still may we dwell in indras care.
एमाशुमाशवे भर यज्ञश्रियं नर्मादनम|	unto the swift one bring the swift mancheering grace of sacrifice.
पतयन मन्दयत्सखम|	that to the friend gives wings and joy.
अस्य पीत्वा शतक्रतो घनो वर्त्राणामभवः|	thou Śatakratu drankest this and wast the vṛtras slayer thou.
परावो वाजेषु वाजिनम|	helpest the warrior in the fray.
तं तवा वाजेषु वाजिनं वाजयामः शतक्रतो|	we strengthen Śatakratu thee yea thee the powerful in fight.
धनानामिन्द्र सातये|	that indra we may win us wealth.
यो रायोअवनिर्महान सुपारः सुन्वतः सखा|	to him the mighty stream of wealth prompt friend of him who pours the juice.
तस्मा इन्द्राय गायत|	yea to this indra sing your song.
नि काव्या वेधसः शश्वतस कर्हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि|	though holding many gifts for men he humbleth the higher powers of each wise ordainer.
अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणां सत्रा चक्राणो अम्र्तानि विश्वा|	agni is now the treasurelord of treasures for ever granting all immortal bounties.
अस्मे वत्सं परि षन्तं न विन्दन्निछन्तो विश्वे अम्र्ता अमूराः|	the gods infallible all searching found not him the dear babe who still is round about us.
शरमयुवः पदव्यो धियन्धास्तस्थुः पदे परमेचार्वग्नेः|	worn weary following his track devoted they reached the lovely highest home of agni.
तिस्रो यदग्ने शरदस्त्वामिच्छुचिं घर्तेन शुचयः सपर्यान|	because with holy oil the pure ones agni served thee the very pure three autumn seasons.
नामानि चिद दधिरे यज्ञियान्यसूदयन्त तन्वः सुजाताः|	therefore they won them holy names for worship and nobly born they dignified their bodies.
आ रोदसी बर्हती वेविदानाः पर रुद्रिया जभ्रिरे यज्ञियासः|	making them known to spacious earth and heaven the holy ones revealed the powers of rudra.
विदन मर्तो नेमधिता चिकित्वानग्निं पदे परमे तस्थिवांसम|	the mortal band discerning in the distance found agni standing in the loftiest station.
संजानाना उप सीदन्नभिज्ञु पत्नीवन्तो नमस्यं नमस्यन|	nigh they approached oneminded with their spouses kneeling to him adorable paid worship.
रिरिक्वांसस्तन्वः कर्ण्वत सवाः सखा सख्युर्निमिषिरक्षमाणाः|	friend finding in his own friends eye protection they made their own the bodies which they chastened.
तरिः सप्त यद गुह्यानि तवे इत पदाविदन निहिता यज्ञियासः|	soon as the holy beings had discovered the thriceseven mystic things contained within thee.
तेभी रक्षन्ते अम्र्तं सजोषाः पशूञ्च सथातॄञ्चरथं च पाहि|	with these oneminded they preserve the amṛta guard thou the life of all their plants and cattle.
विद्वानग्ने वयुनानि कषितीनां वयानुषक छुरुधो जीवसेधाः|	thou agni knower of mens works hast sent us good food in constant course for our subsistence.
अन्तर्विद्वानध्वनो देवयानानतन्द्रो दूतो अभवो हविर्वाट|	thou deeply skilled in paths of gods becamest an envoy never wearied offeringbearer.
सवाध्यो दिव आ सप्त यह्वी रायो दुरो वय रतज्ञा अजानन|	knowing the law the seven strong floods from heaven full of good thought discerned the doors of riches.
विदद गव्यं सरमा दर्ळ्हमूर्वं येना नु कं मानुषीभोजते विट|	saramā found the cattles firmbuilt prison whereby the race of man is still supported.
आ ये विश्वा सवपत्यानि तस्थुः कर्ण्वानासो अम्र्तत्वाय गातुम|	they who approached all noble operations making a path that leads to life immortal.
मह्ना महद्भिः पर्थिवी वि तस्थे माता पुत्रैरदितिर्धायसे वेः|	to be the birds support the spacious mother aditi and her great sons stood in power.
अधि सरियं नि दधुश्चारुमस्मिन दिवो यदक्षी अम्र्ता अक्र्ण्वन|	when gods immortal made both eyes of heaven they gave to him the gift of beauteous glory.
अध कषरन्ति सिन्धवो न सर्ष्टाः पर नी चीरग्नेरुषीरजानन|	now they flow forth like rivers set in motion they knew the red steeds coming down o agni.
पर सु जयेष्ठं निचिराभ्यां बर्हन नमो हव्यं मतिं भरता मर्ळयद्भ्यां सवादिष्ठं मर्ळयद्भ्याम|	bring adoration ample and most excellent hymn offerings to the watchful twain the bountiful your sweetest to the bounteous ones.
ता सम्राजाघ्र्तासुती यज्ञेयज्ञ उपस्तुता|	sovrans adored with streams of oil and praised at every sacrifice.
अथैनोः कषत्रं न कुतश्चनाध्र्षे देवत्वं नू चिदाध्र्षे|	their high imperial might may nowhere be assailed neer may their godhead be assailed.
अद्रशि गातुरुरवे वरीयसी पन्था रतस्य समयंस्त रश्मिभिश्चक्षुर्भगस्य रश्मिभिः|	for the broad sun was seen a path more widely laid the path of holy law hath been maintained with rays the eye with bhagas rays of light.
दयुक्षं मित्रस्य सादनमर्यम्णो वरुणस्य च|	firmset in heaven is mitras home and aryamans and varuṇas.
अथा दधाते बर्हदुक्त्य्हं वयौपस्तुत्यं बर्हद वयः|	thence they give forth great vital strength which merits praise high power of life that men shall praise.
जयोतिष्मतीमदितिं धारयत्क्षितिं सवर्वतीमा सचेते दिवेदिवे जाग्र्वांसा दिवेदिवे|	with aditi the luminous the celestial upholder of the people come ye day by day ye who watch sleepless day by day.
जयोतिष्मत कषत्रमाशाते आदित्या दानुनस पती|	resplendent might have ye obtained Ādityas lords of liberal gifts.
मित्रस्तयोर्वरुणो यातयज्जनोअर्यमा यातयज्जनः|	movers of men mild both are mitra varuṇa mover of men is aryaman.
अयं मित्राय वरुणाय शन्तमः सोमो भूत्ववपानेष्वाभगो देवो देवेष्वाभगः|	this soma be most sweet to mitra varuṇa he in the drinkingfeasts shall have a share thereof sharing a god among the gods.
तं देवासो जुषेरत विश्वे अद्य सजोषसः|	may all the gods of one accord accept it joyfully today.
तथा राजाना करथो यदिमह रतावाना यदीमहे|	therefore do ye o kings accomplish what we ask ye righteous ones whateer we ask.
यो मित्राय वरुणायाविधज्जनोअनर्वाणं तं परि पातोंहसो दाश्वांसं मर्तमंहसः|	whoso with worship serves mitra and varuṇa him guard ye carefully uninjured from distress guard from distress the liberal man.
तमर्यमाभि रक्षत्य रजूयन्तमनु वरतम|	aryaman guards him well who acts uprightly following his law.
उक्थैर्य एनोः परिभूषति वरतं सतोमैराभूषति वरतम|	who beautifies their service with his lauds who makes it beautiful with songs of praise.
नमो दिवे बर्हते रोदसीभ्यां मित्राय वोचं वरुणाय मीळ्हुषे सुम्र्ळीकाय मीळ्हुषे|	worship will i profess to lofty dyaus to heaven and earth to mitra and to bounteous varuṇa the bounteous the compassionate.
इन्द्रमग्निमुप सतुहि दयुक्षमर्यमणं भगम|	praise indra praise thou agni praise bhaga and heavenly aryaman.
जयोग जीवन्तः परजया सचेमहि सोमस्योती सचेमहि|	long may we live and have attendant progeny have progeny with somas help.
ऊती देवानां वयमिन्द्रवन्तो मंसीमहि सवयशसो मरुद्भिः|	with the gods help with indra still beside us may we be held selfsplendid with the maruts.
अग्निर्मित्रो वरुणः शर्म यंसन तदश्याम मघवानो वयं च|	may agni mitra varuṇa give us shelter this may we gain we and our wealthy princes.
उत तिष्ठ बरह्मणस पते देवयन्तस्त्वेमहे|	o brahmaṆaspati stand up godserving men we pray to thee.
उप पर यन्तु मरुतः सुदानव इन्द्र पराशूर्भवा सचा|	may they who give good gifts the maruts come to us indra most swift be thou with them.
तवामिद धि सहसस पुत्र मर्त्य उपब्रूते धने हिते|	o son of strength each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him.
सुवीर्यं मरुत आ सवश्व्यं दधीत यो व आचके|	o maruts may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.
परैतु बरह्मणस पतिः पर देव्येतु सून्र्ता|	may brahmaṇaspati draw nigh may sūnṛtā the goddess come.
अछा वीरंनर्यं पङकतिराधसं देवा यज्ञं नयन्तु नः|	and gods bring to this rite which gives the fivefold gift the hero lover of mankind.
यो वाघते ददाति सूनरं वसु स धत्ते अक्षिति शरवः|	he who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay.
तस्मा इळां सुवीरामा यजामहे सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम|	for him we offer sacred herogiving food peerless and conquering easily.
पर नूनं बरह्मणस पतिर्मन्त्रं वदत्युक्थ्यम|	now brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise.
यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा देवा ओकांसि चक्रिरे|	wherein indra and varuṇa mitra aryaman the gods have made their dwelling place.
तमिद वोचेमा विदथेषु शम्भुवं मन्त्रं देवा अनेहसम|	may we in holy synods gods recite that hymn peerless that brings felicity.
इमां च वाचं परतिहर्यथा नरो विश्वेद वामा वो अश्नवत|	if you o heroes graciously accept this word may it obtain all bliss from you.
को देवयन्तमश्नवज्जनं को वर्क्तबर्हिषम|	who shall approach the pious who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed.
परपर दाश्वान पस्त्याभिरस्थितान्तर्वावत कषयं दधे|	the offerer with his folk advances more and more he fills his house with precious things.
उप कष्स्त्रं पर्ञ्चीत हन्ति राजभिर्भये चित सुक्षितिं दधे|	he amplifies his lordly might with kings he slays een mid alarms he dwells secure.
नास्य वर्ता न तरुता महाधने नार्भे अस्ति वज्रिणः|	in great or lesser fight none checks him none subduesthe wielder of the thunderbolt.
पर यद इत्था परावतः शोचिर न मानम अस्यथ|	when thus like flame from far away maruts ye cast your measure forth.
कस्य करत्वा मरुतः कस्य वर्पसा कं याथ कं ह धूतयः|	to whom go ye to whom o shakers of the earth moved by whose wisdom whose design.
सथिरा वः सन्त्व आयुधा पराणुदे वीळू उत परतिष्कभे|	strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes firm for resistance let them be.
युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी पनीयसी मा मर्त्यस्य मायिनः|	yea passing glorious must be your warrior might not as a guileful mortals strength.
परा ह यत सथिरं हथ नरो वर्तयथा गुरु|	when what is strong ye overthrow and whirl about each ponderous thing.
वि याथन वनिनः पर्थिव्या वय आशाः पर्वतानाम|	heroes your course is through the forest trees of earth and through the fissures of the rocks.
नहि वः शत्रुर विविदे अधि दयवि न भूम्यां रिशादसः|	consumers of your foes no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth.
युष्माकम अस्तु तविषी तना युजा रुद्रासो नू चिद आध्र्षे|	ye rudras may the strength held in this bond be yours to bid defiance even now.
पर वेपयन्ति पर्वतान वि विञ्चन्ति वनस्पतीन|	they make the mountains rock and reel they rend the forestkings apart.
परो आरत मरुतो दुर्मदा इव देवासः सर्वया विशा|	onward ye maruts drive like creatures drunk with wine ye gods with all your company.
उपो रथेषु पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम परष्टिर वहति रोहितः|	ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer a red deer as a leader draws.
आ वो यामाय पर्थिवी चिद अश्रोद अबीभयन्त मानुषाः|	even the earth herself listened as ye came near and men were sorely terrified.
आ वो मक्षू तनाय कं रुद्रा अवो वर्णीमहे|	o rudras quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours.
गन्ता नूनं नो ऽवसा यथा पुरेत्था कण्वाय बिभ्युषे|	come to us with your aid as in the days of old so now for frightened kaṇvas sake.
युष्मेषितो मरुतो मर्त्येषित आ यो नो अभ्व ईषते|	should any monstrous foe o maruts sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us.
वि तं युयोत शवसा वय ओजसा वि युष्माकाभिर ऊतिभिः|	tear ye him from us with your power and with your might and with the succours that are yours.
असामि हि परयज्यवः कण्वं दद परचेतसः|	for ye the worshipful and wise have guarded kaṇva perfectly.
असामिभिर्मरुत आ न ऊतिभिर्गन्ता वर्ष्तिं न विद्युतः|	o maruts come to us with full protecting help as lightning flashes seek the rain.
असाम्योजो बिभ्र्था सुदानवोअसामि धूतयः शवः|	whole strength have ye o bounteous ones perfect earthshakers is your might.
रषिद्विषे मरुतः परिमन्यव इषुं न सर्जत दविषम|	maruts against the poets wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart.
एता उ तया उषसः केतुमक्रत पूर्वे अर्धे रजसो भानुमञ्जते|	these dawns have raised their banner in the eastern half of the midair they spread abroad their shining light.
निष्क्र्ण्वाना आयुधानीव धर्ष्णवः परति गावोऽरुषीर्यन्ति मातरः|	like heroes who prepare their weapons for the war onward they come bright red in hue the mother cows.
उदपप्तन्नरुणा भानवो वर्था सवायुजो अरुषीर्गा अयुक्सत|	readily have the purple beams of light shot up the red cows have they harnessed easy to be yoked.
अक्रन्नुषासो वयुनानि पूर्वथा रुशन्तं भानुमरुषीरशिश्रयुः|	the dawns have brought distinct perception as before redhued they have attained their fulgent brilliancy.
