अर्चन्ति नारीरपसो न विष्टिभिः समानेन योजनेना परावतः|	they sing their song like women active in their tasks along their common path hither from far away.
इषं वहन्तीः सुक्र्ते सुदानवे विश्वेदह यजमानाय सुन्वते|	bringing refreshment to the liberal devotee yea all things to the worshipper who pours the juice.
अधि पेशांसि वपते नर्तूरिवापोर्णुते वक्ष उस्रेव बर्जहम|	she like a dancer puts her broidered garments on as a cow yields her udder so she bares her breast.
जयोतिर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय कर्ण्वती गावो न वरजं वयुषा आवर्तमः|	creating light for all the world of life the dawn hath laid the darkness open as the cows their stall.
परत्यर्ची रुशदस्या अदर्शि वि तिष्ठते बाधते कर्ष्णमभ्वम|	we have beheld the brightness of her shining it spreads and drives away the darksome monster.
सवरुं न पेशो विदथेष्वञ्जञ्चित्रं दिवो दुहिता भानुमश्रेत|	like tints that deck the post at sacrifices heavens daughter hath attained her wondrous splendour.
अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्योषा उछन्ती वयुना कर्णोति|	we have oerpast the limit of this darkness dawn breaking forth again brings clear perception.
शरिये छन्दो न समयते विभाती सुप्रतीका सौमनसायाजीगः|	she like a flatterer smiles in light for glory and fair of face hath wakened to rejoice us.
भास्वती नेत्री सून्र्तानां दिव सतवे दुहिता गोतमेभिः|	the gotamas have praised heavens radiant daughter the leader of the charm of pleasant voices.
परजावतो नर्वतो अश्वबुध्यानुषो गोग्रानुप मासि वाजान|	dawn thou conferrest on us strength with offspring and men conspicuous with kine and horses.
उषस्तमश्यां यशसं सुवीरं दासप्रवर्गं रयिमश्वबुध्यम|	o thou who shinest forth in wondrous glory urged onward by thy strength auspicious lady.
सुदंससा शरवसा या विभासि वाजप्रसूता सुभगे बर्हन्तम|	dawn may i gain that wealth renowned and ample in brave sons troops of slaves farfamed for horses.
विश्वानि देवी भुवनाभिचक्ष्या परतीची चक्षुरुर्विया वि भाति|	bending her looks on all the world the goddess shines widely spreading with her bright eye westward.
विश्वं जीवं चरसे बोधयन्ती विश्वस्य वाचमविदन मनायोः|	waking to motion every living creature she understands the voice of each adorer.
पुनःपुनर्जायमाना पुराणी समानं वर्णमभि शुम्भमाना|	ancient of days again again born newly decking her beauty with the selfsame raiment.
शवघ्नीव कर्त्नुर्विज आमिनाना मर्तस्य देवी जरयन्त्यायुः|	the goddess wastes away the life of mortals like a skilled hunter cutting birds in pieces.
वयूर्ण्वती दिवो अन्तानबोध्यप सवसारं सनुतर्युयोति|	she hath appeared discovering heavens borders to the far distance she drives off her sister.
परमिनती मनुष्या युगानि योषा जारस्य चक्षसा वि भाति|	diminishing the days of human creatures the lady shines with all her lovers splendour.
पशून न चित्रा सुभगा परथाना सिन्धुर्न कषोद उर्विया वयश्वैत|	the bright the blessed one shines forth extending her rays like kine as a flood rolls his waters.
अमिनती दैव्यानि वरतानि सूर्यस्य चेति रश्मिभिर्द्र्शाना|	never transgressing the divine commandments she is beheld visible with the sunbeams.
उषस्तच्चित्रमा भरास्मभ्यं वाजिनीवति|	o dawn enriched with ample wealth bestow on us the wondrous gift.
येन तोकंच तनयं च धामहे|	wherewith we may support children and childrens sons.
उषो अद्येह गोमत्यश्वावति विभावरि|	thou radiant mover of sweet sounds with wealth of horses and of kine.
रेवदस्मे वयुछ सून्र्तावति|	shine thou on us this day o dawn auspiciously.
युक्ष्वा हि वाजिनीवत्यश्वानद्यारुणानुषः|	o dawn enriched with holy rites yoke to thy car thy purple steeds.
अथा नोविश्वा सौभगान्या वह|	and then bring thou unto us all felicities.
अश्विना वर्तिरस्मदा गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत|	o aśvins wonderful in act do ye unanimous direct.
अर्वाग रथं समनसा नि यछतम|	your chariot to our home wealthy in kine and gold.
यावित्था शलोकमा दिवो जयोतिर्जनाय चक्रथुः|	ye who brought down the hymn from heaven a light that giveth light to man.
आ नूर्जं वहतमश्विना युवम|	do ye o aśvins bring strength hither unto us.
एह देवा मयोभुवा दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी|	hither may they who wake at dawn bring to drink soma both the gods.
उषर्बुधो वहन्तु सोमपीतये|	healthgivers wonderworkers borne on paths of gold.
कस्य नूनं कतमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम|	who now is he what god among immortals of whose auspicious name we may bethink us.
को नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च|	who shall to mighty aditi restore us that i may see my father and my mother.
अग्नेर्वयं परथमस्याम्र्तानां मनामहे चारु देवस्य नाम|	agni the god the first among the immortalsof his auspicious name let us bethink us.
स नो मह्या अदितये पुनर्दात पितरं च दर्शेयं मातरं च|	he shall to mighty aditi restore us that i may see my father and my mother.
अभि तवा देव सवितरीशानं वार्याणाम|	to thee o savitar the lord of precious things who helpest us.
सदावन भागमीमहे|	continually for our share we come.
यश्चिद धि त इत्था भगः शशमानः पुरा निदः|	wealth highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it which is laid.
अद्वेषो हस्तयोर्दधे|	free from all hatred in thy hands.
भगभक्तस्य ते वयमुदशेम तवावसा|	through thy protection may we come to even the height of affluence.
मूर्धानं राय आरभे|	which bhaga hath dealt out to us.
नहि ते कषत्रं न सहो न मन्युं वयश्चनामी पतयन्त आपुः|	neer have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit.
नेमा आपो अनिमिषं चरन्तीर्न ये वातस्य परमिनन्त्यभ्वम|	nor these the waters that flow on for ever nor hills abaters of the winds wild fury.
अबुध्ने राजा वरुणो वनस्योर्ध्वं सतूपं ददते पूतदक्षः|	varuṇa king of hallowed might sustaineth erect the trees stem in the baseless region.
नीचीना सथुरुपरि बुध्न एषामस्मे अन्तर्निहिताःकेतवः सयुः|	its rays whose root is high above stream downward deep may they sink within us and be hidden.
उरुं हि राजा वरुणश्चकार सूर्याय पन्थामन्वेतवा उ|	king varuṇa hath made a spacious pathway a pathway for the sun wherein to travel.
अपदे पादा परतिधातवेअकरुतापवक्ता हर्दयाविधश्चित|	where no way was he made him set his footstep and warned afar whateer afflicts the spirit.
शतं ते राजन भिषजः सहस्रमुर्वी गभीरा सुमतिष टे अस्तु|	a hundred balms are thine o king a thousand deep and widereaching also be thy favours.
बाधस्व दूरे निरतिं पराचैः कर्तं चिदेनः पर मुमुग्ध्यस्मत|	far from us far away drive thou destruction put from us een the sin we have committed.
अमी य रक्षा निहितास उच्चा नक्तं दद्र्श्रे कुह चिद दिवेयुः|	whither by day depart the constellations that shine at night set high in heaven above us.
अदब्धानि वरुणस्य वरतानि विचाकशच्चन्द्रमा नक्तमेति|	varuṇas holy laws remain unweakened and through the night the moon moves on in splendor.
तत तवा यामि बरह्मणा वन्दमानस्तदा शास्ते यजमानो हविर्भिः|	i ask this of thee with my prayer adoring thy worshipper craves this with his oblation.
अहेळमानो वरुणेह बोध्युरुशंस मा न आयुःप्र मोषीः|	varuṇa stay thou here and be not angry steal not our life from us o thou wideruler.
तदिन नक्तं तद दिवा मह्यमाहुस्तदयं केतो हर्द आ वि चष्टे|	nightly and daily this one thing they tell me this too the thought of mine own heart repeateth.
शुनःशेपो यमह्वद गर्भीतः सो अस्मान राजा वरुणो मुमोक्तु|	may he to whom prayed fettered Śunaḥśepa may he the sovran varuṇa release us.
शुनःशेपो हयह्वद गर्भीतस्त्रिष्वादित्यं दरुपदेषु बद्धः|	bound to three pillars captured Śunaḥśepa thus to the Āditya made his supplication.
अवैनं राजा वरुणः सस्र्ज्याद विद्वानदब्धो वि मुमोक्तु पाशान|	him may the sovran varuṇa deliver wise neer deceived loosen the bonds that bind him.
अव ते हेळो वरुण नमोभिरव यज्ञेभिरीमहे हविर्भिः|	with bending down oblations sacrifices o varuṇa we deprecate thine anger.
कषयन्नस्मभ्यमसुर परचेता राजन्नेनांसि शिश्रथः कर्तानि|	wise asura thou king of wide dominion loosen the bonds of sins by us committed.
उदुत्तमं वरुण पाशमस्मदवाधमं वि मध्यमं शरथाय|	loosen the bonds o varuṇa that hold me loosen the bonds above between and under.
अथा वयमादित्य वरते तवानागसो अदितये सयाम|	so in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to aditi o thou Āditya.
ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी विश्वशम्भुव रतावरी रजसो धारयत्कवी|	these heaven and earth bestow prosperity on all sustainers of the region holy ones and wise.
सुजन्मनी धिषणे अन्तरीयते देवो देवी धर्मणा सूर्यः शुचिः|	two bowls of noble kind between these goddesses the god the fulgent sun travels by fixed decree.
उरुव्यचसा महिनी असश्चता पिता माता च भुवनानि रक्षतः|	widelycapacious pair mighty that never fail the father and the mother keep all creatures safe.
सुध्र्ष्टमे वपुष्ये न रोदसी पिता यत सीमभि रूपैरवासयत|	the two worldhalves the spirited the beautiful because the father hath clothed them in goodly forms.
स वह्निः पुत्रः पित्रोः पवित्रवान पुनाति धीरो भुवनानि मायया|	son of these parents he the priest with power to cleanse sage sanctifies the worlds with his surpassing power.
धेनुं च पर्श्निं वर्षभं सुरेतसं विश्वाहा शुक्रं पयो अस्य दुक्षत|	thereto for his bright milk he milked through all the days the partycoloured cow and the prolific bull.
अयं देवानामपसामपस्तमो यो जजान रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा|	among the skilful gods most skilled is he who made the two worldhalves which bring prosperity to all.
वि यो ममे रजसी सुक्रतूययाजरेभि सकम्भनेभिःसमान्र्चे|	who with great wisdom measured both the regions out and stablished them with pillars that shall neer decay.
ते नो गर्णाने महिनी महि शरवः कषत्रं दयावाप्र्थिवी धासथो बर्हत|	extolled in song o heaven and earth bestow on us ye mighty pair great glory and high lordly sway.
येनाभि कर्ष्टीस्ततनाम विश्वहा पनाय्यमोजो अस्मे समिन्वतम|	whereby we may extend ourselves ever over the folk and send us strength that shall deserve the praise of men.
दवे वीरूपे चरतः सवर्थे अन्यान्या वत्समुप धापयेते|	to fair goals travel two unlike in semblance each in succession nourishes an infant.
हरिरन्यस्यां भवति सवधावाञ्छुक्रो अन्यस्यां दद्र्शे सुवर्चाः|	one bears a godlike babe of golden colour bright and fairshining is he with the other.
दशेमं तवष्टुर्जनयन्त गर्भमतन्द्रासो युवतयो विभ्र्त्रम|	tvaṣṭars ten daughters vigilant and youthful produced this infant borne to sundry quarters.
तिग्मानीकं सवयशसं जनेषु विरोचमानं परि षीं नयन्ति|	they bear around him whose long flames are pointed fulgent among mankind with native splendour.
तरीणि जाना परि भूषन्त्यस्य समुद्र एकं दिव्येकमप्सु|	three several places of his birth they honour in midair in the heaven and in the waters.
पूर्वामनु पर दिशं पार्थिवानां रतून परशासद विदधावनुष्ठु|	governing in the east of earthly regions the seasons hath he stablished in their order.
क इमं वो निण्यमा चिकेत वत्सो मातॄर्जनयत सवधाभिः|	who of you knows this secret one the infant by his own nature hath brought forth his mothers.
बह्वीनां गर्भो अपसामुपस्थान महान कविर्निश्चरति सवधावान|	the germ of many from the waters bosom he goes forth wise and great of godlike nature.
आविष्ट्यो वर्धते चारुरासु जिह्मानामूर्ध्वः सवयशा उपस्थे|	visible fair he grows in native brightness uplifted in the lap of waving waters.
उभे तवष्टुर्बिभ्यतुर्जायमानात परतीची सिंहम्प्रति जोषयेते|	when he was born both tvaṣṭars worlds were frightened they turn to him and reverence the lion.
उभे भद्रे जोषयेते न मेने गावो न वाश्रा उप तस्थुरेवैः|	the two auspicious ones like women tend him like lowing cows they seek him in their manner.
स दक्षाणां दक्षपतिर्बभूवाञ्जन्ति यं दक्षिणतो हविर्भिः|	he is the lord of might among the mighty him on the right they balm with their oblations.
उद यंयमीति सवितेव बाहू उभे सिचौ यतते भीम रञ्जन|	like savitar his arms with might he stretches awful he strives grasping the worlds two borders.
उच्छुक्रमत्कमजते सिमस्मान नवा मात्र्भ्यो वसना जहाति|	he forces out from all a brilliant vesture yea from his mothers draws he forth new raiment.
तवेषं रूपं कर्णुत उत्तरं यत सम्प्र्ञ्चानः सदने गोभिरद्भिः|	he makes him a most noble form of splendour decking him in his home with milk and waters.
कविर्बुध्नं परि मर्म्र्ज्यते धीः सा देवताता समितिर्बभूव|	the sage adorns the depths of air with wisdom this is the meeting where the gods are worshipped.
उरु ते जरयः पर्येति बुध्नं विरोचमानं महिषस्य धाम|	wide through the firmament spreads forth triumphant the farresplendent strength of thee the mighty.
विश्वेभिरग्ने सवयशोभिरिद्धोअदब्धेभिः पायुभिः पाह्यस्मान|	kindled by us do thou preserve us agni with all thy selfbright undiminished succours.
धन्वन सरोतः कर्णुते गातुमूर्मिं शुक्रैरूर्मिभिरभिनक्षति कषाम|	in dry spots he makes stream and course and torrent and inundates the earth with floods that glisten.
विश्वा सनानि जठरेषु धत्तेअन्तर्नवासु चरति परसूषु|	all ancient things within his maw he gathers and moves among the new freshsprouting grasses.
एवा नो अग्ने समिधा वर्धानो रेवत पावक शरवसे वि भाहि|	fed with our fuel purifying agni so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.
तन नो मित्रो वरुणो मामहन्ताम अदितिः सिन्धुः पर्थ्विवी उतो दयौः|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
स यो वर्षा वर्ष्ण्येभिः समोका महो दिवः पर्थिव्याश्चसम्राट|	may he who hath his home with strength the mighty the king supreme of earth and spacious heaven.
सतीनसत्वा हव्यो भरेषु मरुत्वान नो भवत्विन्द्र ऊती|	lord of true power to he invoked in battlesmay indra girt by maruts be our succour.
यस्यानाप्तः सूर्यस्येव यामो भरेभरे वर्त्रहा शुष्मो अस्ति|	whose way is unattainable like sūryas he in each fight is the strong vṛtraslayer.
वर्षन्तमः सखिभिः सवेभिरेवैर्म|	mightiest with his friends in his own courses may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
दिवो न यस्य रेतसो दुघानाः पन्थासो यन्ति शवसापरीताः|	whose paths go forth in their great might resistless forthmilking as it were heavens genial moisture.
तरद्द्वेषाः सासहिः पौंस्येभिर्म|	with manly strength triumphant foesubduermay indra girt by maruts be our succour.
सो अङगिरोभिरङगिरस्तमो भूद वर्षा वर्षभिः सखिभिः सखा सन|	among aṅgirases he was the chiefest a friend with friends mighty amid the mighty.
रग्मिभिर्र्ग्मी गातुभिर्ज्येष्ठो म|	praiser mid praisers honoured most of singers may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
स सूनुभिर्न रुद्रेभिर्र्भ्वा नर्षाह्ये सासह्वानमित्रान|	strong with the rudras as with his own children in manly battle conquering his foemen.
सनीळेभिः शरवस्यानि तूर्वन म|	with his close comrades doing deeds of glorymay indra girt by maruts be our succour.
स मन्युमीः समदनस्य कर्तास्माकेभिर्न्र्भिः सूर्यं सनत|	humbler of pride exciter of the conflict the lord of heroes god invoked of many.
अस्मिन्नहन सत्पतिः पुरुहूतो म|	may he this day gain with our men the sunlight may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
तमूतयो रणयञ्छूरसातौ तं कषेमस्य कषितयः कर्ण्वत तराम|	his help hath made him cheerer in the battle the folk have made him guardian of their comfort.
स विश्वस्य करुणस्येश एको म|	sole lord is he of every holy service may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
तमप्सन्त शवस उत्सवेषु नरो नरमवसे तं धनाय|	to him the hero on high days of prowess heroes for help and booty shall betake them.
सो अन्धे चित तमसि जयोतिर्विदन म|	he hath found light even in the blinding darkness may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
स सव्येन यमति वराधतश्चित स दक्षिणे संग्र्भीता कर्तानि|	he with his left hand checketh even the mighty and with his right hand gathereth up the booty.
स कीरिणा चित सनिता धनानि म|	even with the humble he acquireth riches may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
स गरामेभिः सनिता स रथेभिर्विदे विश्वाभिः कर्ष्टिभिर्न्वद्य|	with hosts on foot and cars he winneth treasures well is he known this day by all the people.
स पौंस्येभिरभिभूरशस्तीर्म|	with manly might he conquereth those who hate him may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
स जामिभिर्यत समजाति मीळ्हेअजामिभिर्वा पुरुहूत एवैः|	when in his ways with kinsmen or with strangers he speedeth to the fight invoked of many.
अपां तोकस्य तनयस्य जेषे म|	for gain of waters and of sons and grandsons may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
स वज्रभ्र्द दस्युहा भीम उग्रः सहस्रचेताः शतनीथर्भ्वा|	awful and fierce fiendslayer thunderwielder with boundless knowledge hymned by hundreds mighty.
चम्रीषो न शवसा पाञ्चजन्यो म|	in strength like soma guard of the five peoples may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
तस्य वज्रः करन्दति समत सवर्षा दिवो न तवेषो रवथःशिमीवान|	winning the light hitherward roars his thunder like the terrific mighty voice of heaven.
तं सचन्ते सनयस्तं धनानि म|	rich gifts and treasures evermore attend him may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
यस्याजस्रं शवसा मानमुक्थं परिभुजद रोदसी विश्वतः सीम|	whose home eternal through his strength surrounds him on every side his laud the earth and heaven.
स पारिषत करतुभिर्मन्दसानो म|	may he delighted with our service save us may indra girt by maruts be our succour.
न यस्य देवा देवता न मर्ता आपश्चन शवसो अन्तमापुः|	the limit of whose power not gods by godhead nor mortal men have reached nor yet the waters.
स पररिक्वा तवक्षसा कष्मो दिवश्च म|	both earth and heaven in vigour he surpasseth may indra girt by maruts he our succour.
रोहिच्छ्यावा सुमदंशुर्ललामीर्द्युक्षा राय रज्राश्वस्य|	the red and tawny mare blazemarked high standing celestial who to bring Ṛjrāśva riches.
वर्षण्वन्तं बिभ्रती धूर्षु रथं मन्द्रा चिकेत नाहुषीषु विक्षु|	drew at the pole the chariot yoked with stallions joyous among the hosts of men was noted.
एतत तयत त इन्द्र वर्ष्ण उक्थं वार्षागिरा अभि गर्णन्ति राधः|	the vārṣāgiras unto thee o indra the mighty one sing forth this laud to please thee.
रज्राश्वः परष्टिभिरम्बरीषः सहदेवो भयमानः सुराधाः|	Ṛjrāśva with his fellows ambarīṣa surādhas sahadeva bhayamāna.
दस्यूञ्छिम्यूंश्च पुरुहूत एवैर्हत्वा पर्थिव्यां शर्वा नि बर्हीत|	he much invoked hath slain dasyus and Śimyus after his wont and laid them low with arrows.
सनत कषेत्रं सखिभिः शवित्न्येभिः सनत्सूर्यं सनदपः सुवज्रः|	the mighty thunderer with his faircomplexioned friends won the land the sunlight and the waters.
विश्वाहेन्द्रो अधिवक्ता नो अस्त्वपरिह्व्र्ताः सनुयाम वाजम|	may indra evermore be our protector and unimperilled may we win the booty.
तन नो|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
ऐभिरग्ने दुवो गिरो विश्वेभिः सोमपीतये|	to drink the soma agni come to our service and our songs.
देवेभिर्याहि यक्षि च|	with all these gods and worship them.
आ तवा कण्वा अहूषत गर्णन्ति विप्र ते धियः|	the kaṇvas have invoked thee they o singer sing thee songs of praise.
देवेभिरग्न आ गहि|	agni come hither with the gods.
इन्द्रवायू बर्हस्पतिं मित्राग्निं पूषणं भगम|	indra vāyu bṛhaspati mitra agni pūṣan bhaga.
आदित्यान्मारुतं गणम|	Ādityas and the marut host.
पर वो भरियन्त इन्दवो मत्सरा मादयिष्णवः|	for you these juices are poured forth that gladden and exhilarate.
दरप्सा मध्वश्चमूषदः|	the meathdrops resting in the cup.
ईळते तवामवस्यवः कण्वासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः|	the sons of kaṇva fain for help adore thee having strewn the grass.
हविष्मन्तोरंक्र्तः|	with offerings and all things prepared.
घर्तप्र्ष्ठा मनोयुजो ये तवा वहन्ति वह्नयः|	let the swift steeds who carry thee thoughtyoked and dropping holy oil.
आ देवान सोमपीतये|	bring the gods to the soma draught.
तान यजत्रान रताव्र्धोअग्ने पत्नीवतस कर्धि|	adored the strengtheners of law unite them agni with their dames.
मध्वः सुजिह्व पायय|	make them drink meath o bright of tongue.
ये यजत्रा य ईड्यास्ते ते पिबन्तु जिह्वया|	let them o agni who deserve worship and praise drink with thy tongue.
मधोरग्ने वषट्क्र्ति|	the meath in solemn sacrifice.
आकीं सूर्यस्य रोचनाद विश्वान देवानुषर्बुधः|	away from the suns realm of light the wise invoking priest shall bring.
विप्रो होतेह वक्षति|	all gods awaking with the dawn.
विश्वेभिः सोम्यं मध्वग्न इन्द्रेण वायुना|	with all the gods with indra with vāyu and mitras splendours drink.
पिबा मित्रस्य धामभिः|	agni the pleasant soma juice.
तवं होता मनुर्हितोअग्ने यज्ञेषु सीदसि|	ordained by manu as our priest thou sittest agni at each rite.
सेमं नो अध्वरं यज|	hallow thou this our sacrifice.
युक्ष्वा हयरुषी रथे हरितो देव रोहितः|	harness the red mares to thy car the bays o god the flaming ones.
ताभिर्देवानिहा वह|	with those bring hitherward the gods.
नू चित सहोजा अम्र्तो नि तुन्दते होता यद दूतो अभवद विवस्वतः|	neer waxeth faint the immortal son of strength since he the herald hath become vivasvāns messenger.
वि साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभी रजो मम आ देवताताहविषा विवासति|	on paths most excellent he measured out midair he with oblation calls to service of the gods.
आ सवमद्म युवमानो अजरस्त्र्ष्वविष्यन्नतसेषु तिष्ठति|	never decaying seizing his appropriate food rapidly eagerly through the dry wood he spreads.
अत्यो न पर्ष्ठं परुषितस्य रोचते दिवो न सानु सतनयन्नचिक्रदत|	his back as he is sprinkled glistens like a horse loud hath he roared and shouted like the heights of heaven.
कराणा रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिः पुरोहितो होता निषत्तो रयिषाळमर्त्यः|	set high in place oer all that vasus rudras do immortal lord of riches seated as high priest.
रथो न विक्ष्व रञ्जसान आयुषु वयानुषग वार्या देव रण्वति|	hastening like a car to men to those who live the god without delay gives boons to be desired.
वि वातजूतो अतसेषु तिष्ठते वर्था जुहूभिः सर्ण्या तुविष्वणिः|	urged by the wind be spreads through dry wood as he lists armed with his tongues for sickles with a mighty roar.
तर्षु यदग्ने वनिनो वर्षायसे कर्ष्णं त एम रुशदूर्मे अजर|	black is thy path agni changeless with glittering waves when like a bull thou rushest eager to the trees.
तपुर्जम्भो वन आ वातचोदितो यूथे न साह्वानव वाति वंसगः|	with teeth of flame winddriven through the wood he speeds triumphant like a bull among the herd of cows.
अभिव्रजन्नक्षितं पाजसा रजः सथातुश्चरथं भयते पतत्रिणः|	with bright strength roaming to the everlasting air things fixed things moving quake before him as he flies.
दधुष टवा भर्गवो मानुषेष्वा रयिं न चारुं सुहवं जनेभ्यः|	the bhṛgus established thee among mankind for men like as a treasure beauteous easy to invoke.
होतारमग्ने अतिथिं वरेण्यं मित्रं न शेवं दिव्याय जन्मने|	thee agni as a herald and choiceworthy guest as an auspicious friend to the celestial race.
होतारं सप्त जुह्वो यजिष्ठं यं वाघतो वर्णते अध्वरेषु|	agni the seven tongues deftest sacrificer him whom the priests elect at solemn worship.
अग्निं विश्वेषामरतिं वसूनां सपर्यामि परयसा यामि रत्नम|	the herald messenger of all the vasus i serve with dainty food i ask for riches.
अछिद्रा सूनो सहसो नो अद्य सतोत्र्भ्यो मित्रमहः शर्म यछ|	grant son of strength thou rich in friends a refuge without a flaw this day to us thy praisers.
अग्ने गर्णन्तमंहस उरुष्योर्जो नपात पूर्भिरायसीभिः|	o agni son of strength with forts of iron preserve thou from distress the man who lauds thee.
भवा वरूथं गर्णते विभावो भवा मघवन मघवद्भ्यःशर्म|	be thou a refuge bright one to the singer a shelter bounteous lord to those who worship.
उरुष्याग्ने अंहसो गर्णन्तं परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात|	preserve the singer from distress o agni may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
अग्निं दूतं वर्णीमहे होतारं विश्ववेदसम|	we choose agni the messenger the herald master of all wealth.
अस्य यज्ञस्य सुक्रतुम|	well skilled in this our sacrifice.
अग्निमअग्निं हवीमभिः सदा हवन्त विश्पतिम|	with callings ever they invoke agni agni lord of the house.
हव्यवाहं पुरुप्रियम|	oblationbearer much beloved.
अग्ने देवानिहा वह जज्ञानो वर्क्तबर्हिषे|	bring the gods hither agni born for him who strews the sacred grass.
असि होता न ईड्यः|	thou art our herald meet for praise.
तानुशतो वि बोधय यदग्ने यासि दूत्यम|	wake up the willing gods since thou agni performest embassage.
देवैरा सत्सि बर्हिषि|	sit on the sacred grass with gods.
घर्ताहवन दीदिवः परति षम रिषतो दह|	o agni radiant one to whom the holy oil is poured burn up.
अग्ने तवं रक्षस्विनः|	our enemies whom fiends protect.
अग्निनाग्निः समिध्यते कविर्ग्र्हपतिर्युवा|	by agni agni is inflamed lord of the house wise young who bears.
हव्यवाड जुह्वास्यः|	the gift the ladle is his mouth.
कविमग्निमुप सतुहि सत्यधर्माणमध्वरे|	praise agni in the sacrifice the sage whose ways are ever true.
देवममीवचातनम|	the god who driveth grief away.
यस्त्वामग्ने हविष्पतिर्दूतं देव सपर्यति|	god agni be his strong defence who lord of sacrificial gifts.
तस्य सम पराविता भव|	worshippeth thee the messenger.
यो अग्निं देववीतये हविष्मानाविवासति|	whoso with sacred gift would fain call agni to the feast of gods.
तस्मै पावक मर्ळय|	o purifier favour him.
स नः पावक दीदिवोअग्ने देवानिहा वह|	such agni purifier bright bring hither to our sacrifice.
उप यज्ञं हविश्च नः|	to our oblation bring the gods.
स न सतवान आ भर गायत्रेण नवीयसा|	so lauded by our newest song of praise bring opulence to us.
रयिं वीरवतीमिषम|	and food with heroes for our sons.
अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषा विश्वाभिर्देवहूतिभिः|	o agni by effulgent flame by all invokings of the gods.
इमं सतोमं जुषस्व नः|	show pleasure in this laud of ours.
कद ध नूनं कधप्रियः पिता पुत्रं न हस्तयोः|	what now when will ye take us by both hands as a dear sire his son.
दधिध्वे वर्क्तबर्हिषः|	gods for whom sacred grass is clipped.
कव नूनं कद वो अर्थं गन्ता दिवो न पर्थिव्याः|	now whither to what goal of yours go ye in heaven and not on earth.
कव वो गावो न रण्यन्ति|	where do your cows disport themselves.
कव वः सुम्ना नव्यांसि मरुतः कव सुविता|	where are your newest favours shown where maruts your prosperity.
कव विश्वानि सौभगा|	where all your high felicities.
यद यूयम पर्श्निमातरो मर्तासः सयातन|	if o ye maruts ye the sons whom pṛśni bore were mortal and.
सतोता वो अम्र्तः सयात|	immortal he who sings your praise.
मा वो मर्गो न यवसे जरिता भूद अजोष्यः|	then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pastureland.
पथा यमस्य गाद उप|	nor should he go on yamas path.
मो षु णः परापरा निर्र्तिर दुर्हणा वधीत|	let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered strike its down.
पदीष्ट तर्ष्णया सह|	let each with drought depart from us.
सत्यं तवेषा अमवन्तो धन्वञ चिद आ रुद्रियासः|	truly they the fierce and mighty sons of rudra send their windless.
मिहं कर्ण्वन्त्य अवाताम|	rain een on the desert places.
वाश्रेव विद्युन मिमाति वत्सं न माता सिषक्ति|	like a cow the lightning lows and follows motherlike her youngling.
यद एषां वर्ष्टिर असर्जि|	when their rainflood hath been loosened.
दिवा चित तमः कर्ण्वन्ति पर्जन्येनोदवाहेन|	when they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness een in day time.
यत पर्थिवीं वयुन्दन्ति|	with the waterladen raincloud.
अध सवनान मरुतां विश्वम आ सद्म पार्थिवम|	o maruts at your voices sound this earthly habitation shakes.
अरेजन्त पर मानुषाः|	and each man reels who dwells therein.
मरुतो वीळुपाणिभिश चित्रा रोधस्वतीर अनु|	o maruts with your stronghoofed steeds unhindered in their courses haste.
यातेम अखिद्रयामभिः|	along the bright embanked streams.
सथिरा वः सन्तु नेमयो रथा अश्वास एषाम|	firm be the fellies of your wheels steady your horses and your cars.
सुसंस्क्र्ता अभीशवः|	and may your reins be fashioned well.
अछा वदा तना गिरा जरायै बरह्मणस पतिम|	invite thou hither with this song for praise agni the lord of prayer.
अग्निम मित्रं न दर्शतम|	him who is fair as mitra is.
मिमीहि शलोकम आस्यपर्जन्य इव ततनः|	form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like a rainy cloud.
गाय गायत्रम उक्थ्यम|	sing forth the measured eulogy.
वन्दस्व मारुतं गणं तवेषम पनस्युम अर्किणम|	sing glory to the marut host praiseworthy tuneful vigorous.
अस्मे वर्द्धा असन्न इह|	here let the strong ones dwell with us.
तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरा रषिर्देवो देवानामभवः शिवः सखा|	thou agni wast the earliest aṅgiras a seer thou wast a god thyself the gods auspicious friend.
तव वरते कवयो विद्मनापसोअजायन्त मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयः|	after thy holy ordinance the maruts sage active through wisdom with their glittering spears were born.
तवमग्ने परथमो अङगिरस्तमः कविर्देवानां परि भूषसिव्रतम|	o agni thou the best and earliest aṅgiras fulfillest as a sage the holy law of gods.
विभुर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय मेधिरो दविमाता शयुः कतिधा चिदायवे|	sprung from two mothers wise through all existence spread resting in many a place for sake of living man.
तवमग्ने परथमो मातरिश्वन आविर्भव सुक्रतूया विवस्वते|	to mātariśvan first thou agni wast disclosed and to vivasvān through thy noble inward power.
अरेजेतां रोदसी होत्र्वूर्येअसघ्नोर्भारमयजो महोवसो|	heaven and earth vasu shook at the choosing of the priest the burthen thou didst bear didst worship mighty gods.
तवमग्ने मनवे दयामवाशयः पुरूरवसे सुक्र्ते सुक्र्त्तरः|	agni thou madest heaven to thunder for mankind thou yet more pious for pious purūravas.
शवात्रेण यत पित्रोर्मुच्यसे पर्या तवा पूर्वमनयन्नापरं पुनः|	when thou art rapidly freed from thy parents first eastward they bear thee round and after to the west.
तवमग्ने वर्षभः पुष्टिवर्धन उद्यतस्रुचे भवसि शरवाय्यः|	thou agni art a bull who makes our store increase to be invoked by him who lifts the ladle up.
य आहुतिं परि वेदा वषट्क्र्तिमेकायुरग्रे विश आविवाससि|	well knowing the oblation with the hallowing word uniting all who live thou lightenest first our folk.
तवमग्ने वर्जिनवर्तनिं नरं सक्मन पिपर्षि विदथे विचर्षणे|	agni thou savest in the synod when pursued een him farseeing one who walks in evil ways.
यः शूरसाता परितक्म्ये धने दभ्रेभिश्चित सम्र्ताहंसि भूयसः|	thou when the heroes fight for spoil which men rush round slayest in war the many by the hands of few.
तवं तमग्ने अम्र्तत्व उत्तमे मर्तं दधासि शरवसे दिवे दिवे|	for glory agni day by day thou liftest up the mortal man to highest immortality.
यस्तात्र्षाण उभयाय जन्मने मयः कर्णोषि परया च सूरये|	even thou who yearning for both races givest them great bliss and to the prince grantest abundant food.
तवं नो अग्ने सनये धनानां यशसं कारुं कर्णुहि सतवानः|	o agni highly lauded make our singer famous that he may win us store of riches.
रध्याम कर्मापसा नवेन देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी परावतं नः|	may we improve the rite with new performance o earth and heaven with all the gods protect us.
तवं नो अग्ने पित्रोरुपस्थ आ देवो देवेष्वनवद्य जाग्र्विः|	o blameless agni lying in thy parents lap a god among the gods be watchful for our good.
तनूक्र्द बोधि परमतिश्च कारवे तवं कल्याण वसु विश्वमोपिषे|	former of bodies be the singers providence all good things hast thou sown for him auspicious one.
तवमग्ने परमतिस्त्वं पितासि नस्त्वं वयस्क्र्त तव जामयो वयम|	agni thou art our providence our father thou we are thy brethren and thou art our spring of life.
सं तवा रायः शतिनः सं सहस्रिणः सुवीरं यन्ति वरतपामदाभ्य|	in thee rich in good heroes guard of high decrees meet hundred thousand treasures o infallible.
तवामग्ने परथममायुमायवे देवा अक्र्ण्वन नहुषस्य विश्पतिम|	thee agni have the gods made the first living one for living man lord of the house of nahuṣa.
इळामक्र्ण्वन मनुषस्य शासनीं पितुर्यत पुत्रो ममकस्य जायते|	iḷā they made the teacher of the sons of men what time a son was born to the father of my race.
तवं नो अग्ने तव देव पायुभिर्मघोनो रक्ष तन्वश्च वन्द्य|	worthy to be revered o agni god preserve our wealthy patrons with thy succours and ourselves.
तराता तोकस्य तनये गवामस्यनिमेषं रक्षमाणस्तव वरते|	guard of our seed art thou aiding our cows to bear incessantly protecting in thy holy way.
तवमग्ने यज्यवे पायुरन्तरोअनिषङगाय चतुरक्ष इध्यसे|	agni thou art a guard close to the pious man kindled art thou foureyed for him who is unarmed.
यो रातहव्योअव्र्काय धायसे कीरेश्चिन मन्त्रं मनसावनोषि तम|	with fond heart thou acceptest een the poor mans prayer when he hath brought his gift to gain security.
तवमग्न उरुशंसाय वाघते सपार्हं यद रेक्णः परमं वनोषि तत|	thou agni gainest for the loudlypraising priest the highest wealth the object of a mans desire.
आध्रस्य चित परमतिरुच्यसे पिता पर पाकंशास्सि पर दिशो विदुष्टरः|	thou art called father caring even for the weak and wisest to the simple one thou teachest lore.
तवमग्ने परयतदक्षिणं नरं वर्मेव सयूतं परि पासि विश्वतः|	agni the man who giveth guerdon to the priests like wellsewn armour thou guardest on every side.
सवादुक्षद्मा यो वसतौ सयोनक्र्ज्जीवयाजं यजते सोपमा दिवः|	he who with grateful food shows kindness in his house an offerer to the living is the type of heaven.
इमामग्ने शरणिं मीम्र्षो न इममध्वानं यमगाम दूरात|	pardon we pray this sin of ours o agnithe path which we have trodden widely straying.
आपिः पिता परमतिः सोम्यानां भर्मिरस्य रषिक्र्न मर्त्यानाम|	dear friend and father caring for the pious who speedest nigh and who inspirest mortals.
मनुष्वदग्ने अङगिरस्वदङगिरो ययातिवत सदने पूर्ववच्छुचे|	as erst to manus to yayāti aṅgiras so aṅgiras pure agni come thou to our hall.
अछ याह्या वहा दैव्यं जनमा सादय बर्हिषि यक्षि च परियम|	bring hither the celestial host and seat them here upon the sacred grass and offer what they love.
एतेनाग्ने बरह्मणा वाव्र्धस्व शक्ती वा यत ते चक्र्मा विदा वा|	by this our prayer be thou o agni strengthened prayer made by us after our power and knowledge.
उत पर णेष्यभि वस्यो अस्मान सं नः सर्ज सुमत्या वाजवत्या|	lead thou us therefore to increasing riches endow us with thy strengthbestowing favour.
यज्ञो देवानां परत्येति सुम्नमादित्यासो भवता मर्ळयन्तः|	the sacrifice obtains the gods acceptance be graciously inclined to us Ādityas.
आ वोअर्वाची सुमतिर्वव्र्त्यादंहोश्चिद या वरिवोवित्तरासत|	hitherward let your favour be directed and be our best deliverer from trouble.
उप नो देवा अवसा गमन्त्वङगिरसां सामभिः सतूयमानाः|	by praisesongs of aṅgirases exalted may the gods come to us with their protection.
इन्द्र इन्द्रियैर्मरुतो मरुद्भिरादित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत|	may indra with his powers maruts with maruts aditi with Ādityas grant us shelter.
तन न इन्द्रस्तद वरुणस्तदग्निस्तदर्यमा तत सविताचनो धात|	this laud of ours may varuṇa and indra aryaman agni savitar find pleasant.
तन नो|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
एषो उषा अपूर्व्य वयुछति परिया दिवः|	now morning with her earliest light shines forth dear daughter of the sky.
सतुषे वामश्विना बर्हत|	high aśvins i extol your praise.
या दस्रा सिन्धुमातरा मनोतरा रयीणाम|	sons of the sea mighty to save discoverers of riches ye.
धिया देवा वसुविदा|	gods with deep thought who find out wealth.
वच्यन्ते वां ककुहासो जूर्णायामधि विष्टपि|	your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames.
यद वांरथो विभिष पतात|	when your car flies with winged steeds.
हविषा जारो अपां पिपर्ति पपुरिर्नरा|	he liberal lover of the flood lord of the house the vigilant.
पिता कुटस्य चर्षणिः|	chiefs with oblations feeds you full.
आदारो वां मतीनां नासत्या मतवचसा|	ye have regard unto our hymns nāsatyas thinking of our words.
पातं सोमस्य धर्ष्णुया|	drink boldly of the soma juice.
या नः पीपरदश्विना जयोतिष्मती तमस्तिरः|	vouchsafe to us o aśvin pair such strength as with attendant light.
तामस्मे रासाथामिषम|	may through the darkness carry us.
आ नो नावा मतीनां यातं पाराय गन्तवे|	come in the ship of these our hymns to bear you to the hither shore.
युञ्जाथामश्विना रथम|	o aśvins harness ye the car.
अरित्रं वां दिवस पर्थु तीर्थे सिन्धूनां रथः|	the heavens wide vessel is your own on the floods shore your chariot waits.
धिया युयुज्र इन्दवः|	drops with the hymn have been prepared.
दिवस कण्वास इन्दवो वसु सिन्धूनां पदे|	kaṇvas the drops are in the heaven the wealth is at the waters place.
सवं वव्रिं कुह धित्सथः|	where will ye manifest your form.
अभूदु भा उ अंशवे हिरण्यं परति सूर्यः|	light came to lighten up the branch the sun appeared as it were gold.
वयख्यज्जिह्वयासितः|	and with its tongue shone forth the dark.
अभूदु पारमेतवे पन्था रतय्स साधुया|	the path of sacrifice was made to travel to the farther goal.
अदर्शि वि सरुतिर्दिवः|	the road of heaven was manifest.
तततदिदश्विनोरवो जरिता परति भूषति|	the singer of their praise awaits whatever grace the aśvins give.
मदे सोमस्यपिप्रतोः|	who save when soma gladdens them.
वावसाना विवस्वति सोमस्य पीत्या गिरा|	ye dwellers with vivasvān come auspicious as to manu erst.
मनुष्वच्छम्भूा गतम|	come to the soma and our praise.
युवोरुषा अनु शरियं परिज्मनोरुपाचरत|	o circumambient aśvins dawn follows the brightness of your way.
रता वनथो अक्तुभिः|	approve with beams our solemn rites.
उभा पिबतमश्विनोभा नः शर्म यछतम|	drink ye of our libations grant protection o ye aśvins twain.
अविद्रियाभिरूतिभिः|	with aids which none may interrupt.
तवं सोम पर चिकितो मनीषा तवं रजिष्ठमनु नेषि पन्थाम|	thou soma art preeminent for wisdom along the straightest path thou art our leader.
तव परणीती पितरो न इन्दो देवेषु रत्नमभजन्त धीराः|	our wise forefathers by thy guidance indu dealt out among the gods their share of treasure.
तवं सोम करतुभिः सुभूस्त्वं दक्षैः सुदक्षो विश्ववेदाः|	thou by thine insight art most wise o soma strong by thine energies and all possessing.
तवं वर्षा वर्षत्वेभिर्महित्वा दयुम्नेभिर्द्युम्न्यभवो नर्चक्षाः|	mighty art thou by all thy powers and greatness by glories art thou glorious guide of mortals.
राज्ञो नु ते वरुणस्य वरतानि बर्हद गभीरं तव सोम धाम|	thine are king varuṇas eternal statutes lofty and deep o soma is thy glory.
शुचिष टवमसि परियो न मित्रो दक्षाय्यो अर्यमेवासिसोम|	allpure art thou like mitra the beloved adorable like aryaman o soma.
या ते धामानि दिवि या पर्थिव्यां या पर्वतेष्वोषधीष्वप्सु|	with all thy glories on the earth in heaven on mountains in the plants and in the waters.
तेभिर्नो विश्वैः सुमना अहेळन राजन सोम परतिहव्या गर्भाय|	with all of these wellpleased and not in anger accept o royal soma our oblations.
तवं सोमासि सत्पतिस्त्वं राजोत वर्त्रहा|	thou soma art the lord of heroes king yea vṛtraslayer thou.
तवं भद्रो असि करतुः|	thou art auspicious energy.
तवं च सोम नो वशो जीवातुं न मरामहे|	and soma let it be thy wish that we may live and may not die.
परियस्तोत्रो वनस्पतिः|	praiseloving lord of plants art thou.
तवं सोम महे भगं तवं यून रतायते|	to him who keeps the law both old and young thou givest happiness.
दक्षं दधासि जीवसे|	and energy that he may live.
तवं नः सोम विश्वतो रक्षा राजन्नघायतः|	guard us king soma on all sides from him who threatens us never let.
न रिष्येत्त्वावतः सखा|	the friend of one like thee be harmed.
सोम यास्ते मयोभुव ऊतयः सन्ति दाशुषे|	with those delightful aids which thou hast soma for the worshipper.
ताभिर्नोअविता भव|	even with those protect thou us.
इमं यज्ञमिदं वचो जुजुषाण उपागहि|	accepting this our sacrifice and this our praise o soma come.
सोम तवं नोव्र्धे भव|	and be thou nigh to prosper us.
सोम गीर्भिष टवा वयं वर्धयामो वचोविदः|	wellskilled in speech we magnify thee soma with our sacred songs.
सुम्र्ळीकोन आ विश|	come thou to us most gracious one.
गयस्फानो अमीवहा वसुवित पुष्टिवर्धनः|	enricher healer of disease wealthfinder prospering our store.
सुमित्रः सोमनो भव|	be soma a good friend to us.
सोम रारन्धि नो हर्दि गावो न यवसेष्वा|	soma be happy in our heart as milchkine in the grassy meads.
मर्य इव सवोक्ये|	as a young man in his own house.
यः सोम सख्ये तव रारणद देव मर्त्यः|	o soma god the mortal man who in thy friendship hath delight.
तं दक्षः सचते कविः|	him doth the mighty sage befriend.
उरुष्या णो अभिशस्तेः सोम नि पाह्यंहसः|	save us from slanderous reproach keep us o soma from distress.
सखा सुशेव एधि नः|	be unto us a gracious friend.
आ पयायस्व समेतु ते विश्वतः सोम वर्ष्ण्यम|	soma wax great from every side may vigorous powers unite in thee.
भवा वाजस्य संगथे|	be in the gatheringplace of strength.
आ पयायस्व मदिन्तम सोम विश्वेभिरंशुभिः|	wax o most gladdening soma great through all thy rays of light and be.
भवा नःसुश्रवस्तमः सखा वर्धे|	a friend of most illustrious fame to prosper us.
सं ते पयांसि समु यन्तु वाजाः सं वर्ष्ण्यान्यभिमातिषाहः|	in thee be juicy nutriments united and powers and mighty foesubduing vigour.
आप्यायमानो अम्र्ताय सोम दिवि शरवांस्युत्तमानि धिष्व|	waxing to immortality o soma win highest glories for thyself in heaven.
या ते धामानि हविषा यजन्ति ता ते विश्वा परिभूरस्तुयज्ञम|	such of thy glories as with poured oblations men honour may they all invest our worship.
गयस्फानः परतरणः सुवीरोअवीरहा पर चरा सोम दुर्यान|	wealthgiver furtherer with troops of heroes sparing the brave come soma to our houses.
सोमो धेनुं सोमो अर्वन्तमाशुं सोमो वीरं कर्मण्यं ददाति|	to him who worships soma gives the milchcow a fleet steed and a man of active knowledge.
सादन्यं विदथ्यं सभेयं पित्र्श्रवणं यो ददाशदस्मै|	skilled in home duties meet for holy synod for council meet a glory to his father.
अषाळ्हं युत्सु पर्तनासु पप्रिं सवर्षामप्सां वर्जनस्यगोपाम|	invincible in fight saver in battles guard of our camp winner of light and water.
भरेषुजां सुक्षितिं सुश्रवसं जयन्तं तवामनु मदेम सोम|	born amid hymns wellhoused exceeding famous victor in thee will we rejoice o soma.
तवमिमा ओषधीः सोम विश्वास्त्वमपो अजनयस्त्वं गाः|	these herbs these milchkine and these running waters all these o soma thou hast generated.
तवमा ततन्थोर्वन्तरिक्षं तवं जयोतिषा वि तमो ववर्थ|	the spacious firmament hast thou expanded and with the light thou hast dispelled the darkness.
देवेन नो मनसा देव सोम रायो भागं सहसावन्नभि युध्य|	do thou god soma with thy godlike spirit victorious win for us a share of riches.
मा तवा तनदीशिषे वीर्यस्योभयेभ्यः पर चिकित्सा गविष्टौ|	let none prevent thee thou art lord of valour provide for both sides in the fray for booty.
पुरु तव दाश्वान वोचेअरिरग्ने तव सविदा|	agni thy faithful servant i call upon thee with many a gift.
तोदस्येव शरण आ महस्य|	as in the keeping of the great inciting god.
वयनिनस्य धनिनः परहोषे चिदररुषः|	thou who neer movest thee to aid the indolent the godless man.
कदा चन परजिगतो अदेवयोः|	him who though wealthy never brings an offering.
स चन्द्रो विप्र मर्त्यो महो वराधन्तमो दिवि|	splendid o singer is that man mightiest of the great in heaven.
परपरेत ते अग्ने वनुषः सयाम|	agni may we be foremost we thy worshippers.
अयं वां मधुमत्तमः सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा|	aŚvins for you who strengthen law this sweetest soma hath been shed.
तमश्विना पिबतं तिरोह्न्यं धत्तं रत्नानि दाशुशे|	drink this expressed ere yesterday and give riches to him who offers it.
तरिवन्धुरेण तरिव्र्ता सुपेशसा रथेना यातमश्विना|	come o ye aśvins mounted on your triple car threeseated beautiful of form.
कण्वासो वां बरह्म कर्ण्वन्त्यध्वरे तेषां सु शर्णुतं हवम|	to you at sacrifice the kaṇvas send the prayer graciously listen to their call.
अश्विना मधुमत्तमं पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा|	o aśvins ye who strengthen law drink ye this sweetest soma juice.
अथाद्य दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे दाश्वांसमुप गछतम|	borne on your wealthfraught car come ye this day to him who offers ye of wondrous deeds.
तरिषधस्थे बर्हिषि विश्ववेदसा मध्वा यज्ञं मिमिक्षतम|	omniscient aśvins on the thriceheaped grass bedew with the sweet juice the sacrifice.
कण्वासो वां सुतसोमा अभिद्यवो युवां हवन्ते अश्विना|	the sons of kaṇva striving heavenward call on you with draughts of soma juice outpoured.
याभिः कण्वमभिष्टिभिः परावतं युवमश्विना|	o aśvins with those aids wherewith ye guarded kaṇva carefully.
ताभिः षवस्मानवतं शुभस पती पातं सोमं रताव्र्धा|	keep us o lords of splendour drink the soma juice ye strengtheners of holy law.
सुदासे दस्रा वसु बिभ्रता रथे पर्क्षो वहतमश्विना|	o mighty ones ye gave sudās abundant food brought on your treasureladen car.
रयिं समुद्रादुत वा दिवस पर्यस्मे धत्तं पुरुस्प्र्हम|	so now vouchsafe to us the wealth which many crave either from heaven or from the sea.
यन नासत्या परावति यद वा सथो अधि तुर्वशे|	nāsatyas whether ye be far away or close to turvaśa.
अतो रथेन सुव्र्ता न आ गतं साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः|	borne on your lightlyrolling chariot come to us together with the sunbeams come.
अर्वाञ्चा वां सप्तयोअध्वरश्रियो वहन्तु सवनेदुप|	so let your coursers ornaments of sacrifice bring you to our libations here.
इषं पर्ञ्चन्ता सुक्र्ते सुदानव आ बर्हिः सीदतं नरा|	bestowing food on him who acts and gives aright sit chiefs upon the sacred grass.
तेन नासत्या गतं रथेन सूर्यत्वचा|	come o nāsatyas on your car decked with a sunbright canopy.
येन शश्वदूहथुर्दाशुषे वसु मध्वः सोमस्य पीतये|	whereon ye ever bring wealth to the worshipper to drink the somas pleasant juice.
उक्थेभिरर्वागवसे पुरूवसू अर्कैश्च नि हवयामहे|	with lauds and songs of praise we call them down to us that they most rich may succour us.
शश्वत कण्वानां सदसि परिये हि कं सोमं पपथुरश्विना|	for ye have ever in the kaṇvas wellloved house o aśvins drunk the soma juice.
पर वः पान्तमन्धसो धियायते महे शूराय विष्णवे चार्चत|	to the great hero him who sets his mind thereon and viṣṇu praise aloud in song your draught of juice.
या सानुनि पर्वतानामदाभ्या महस्तस्थतुरर्वतेव साधुना|	gods neer beguiled who borne as twere by noble steed have stood upon the lofty ridges of the hills.
तवेषमित्था समरणं शिमीवतोरिन्द्राविष्णू सुतपा वामुरुष्यति|	your somadrinker keeps afar your furious rush indra and viṣṇu when ye come with all your might.
या मर्त्याय परतिधीयमानमित कर्शानोरस्तुरसनामुरुष्यथः|	that which hath been directed well at mortal man bowarmed kṛśānus arrow ye turn far aside.
ता ईं वर्धन्ति मह्यस्य पौंस्यं नि मातरा नयति रेतसे भुजे|	these offerings increase his mighty manly strength he brings both parents down to share the genial flow.
दधाति पुत्रोअवरं परं पितुर्नाम तर्तीयमधि रोचने दिवः|	he lowers though a son the fathers highest name the third is that which is high in the light of heaven.
तततदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसीनस्य तरतुरव्र्कस्य मीळ्हुषः|	we laud this manly power of him the mighty one preserver inoffensive bounteous and benign.
यः पार्थिवानि तरिभिरिद विगामभिरुरु करमिष्टोरुगायाय जीवसे|	his who strode widely pacing with three steppings forth over the realms of earth for freedom and for life.
दवे इदस्य करमणे सवर्द्र्शोअभिख्याय मर्त्यो भुरण्यति|	a mortal man when he beholds two steps of him who looks upon the light is restless with amaze.
तर्तीयमस्य नकिरा दधर्षति वयश्चन पतयन्तः पतत्रिणः|	but his third step doth no one venture to approach no nor the feathered birds of air who fly with wings.
चतुर्भिः साकं नवतिं च नामभिश्चक्रं न वर्त्तं वयतीन्रवीविपत|	he like a rounded wheel hath in swift motion set his ninety racing steeds together with the four.
बर्हच्छरीरो विमिमान रक्वभिर्युवाकुमारः परत्येत्याहवम|	developed vast in form with those who sing forth praise a youth no more a child he cometh to our call.
का राधद धोत्राश्विना वां को वां जोष उभयोः|	aŚvins what praise may win your grace who may be pleasing to you both.
कथा विधात्यप्रचेताः|	how shall the ignorant worship you.
विद्वांसाविद दुरः पर्छेदविद्वानित्थापरो अचेताः|	here let the ignorant ask the means of you who knowfor none beside you knoweth aught.
नू चिन नु मर्ते अक्रौ|	not of a spiritless mortal man.
ता विद्वांसा हवामहे वां ता नो विद्वांसा मन्म वोचेतमद्य|	such as ye are allwise we call you ye wise declare to us this day accepted prayer.
परार्चद दयमानो युवाकुः|	loving you well your servant lauds you.
वि पर्छामि पाक्या न देवान वषट्क्र्तस्याद्भुतस्य दस्रा|	simply ye mighty ones i ask the gods of that wondrous oblation hallowed by the mystic word.
पातं च सह्यसो युवं च रभ्यसो नः|	save us from what is stronger fiercer than ourselves.
पर या घोषे भर्गवाणे न शोभे यया वाचा यजति पज्रियो वाम|	forth go the hymn that shone in ghoṣā bhṛgus like the song wherewith the son of pajra worships you.
परैषयुर्न विद्वान|	like some wise minister.
शरुतं गायत्रं तकवानस्याहं चिद धि रिरेभाश्विना वाम|	hear ye the song of him who hastens speedily o aśvins i am he who sang your praise.
आक्षी शुभस पती दन|	hither ye lords of splendour hither turn your eyes.
युवं हयास्तं महो रन युवं वा यन निरततंसतम|	for ye were ever nigh to deal forth ample wealth to give the wealth that ye had gathered up.
तानो वसू सुगोपा सयातं पातं नो वर्कादघायोः|	as such ye vasus guard us well and keep us safely from the wicked wolf.
मा कस्मै धातमभ्यमित्रिणे नो माकुत्रा नो गर्हेभ्यो धेनवो गुः|	give us not up to any man who hateth us nor let our milchcows stray whose udders give us food.
सतनाभुजो अशिश्वीः|	far from our homes without their calves.
दुहीयन मित्रधितये युवाकु राये च नो मिमीतं वाजवत्यै|	may they who love you gain you for their friends prepare ye us for opulence with strengthening food.
इषे च नो मिमीतं धेनुमत्यै|	prepare us for the food that floweth from our cows.
अश्विनोरसनं रथमनश्वं वाजिनावतोः|	i have obtained the horseless car of aśvins rich in sacrifice.
तेनाहं भूरि चाकन|	and i am well content therewith.
अयं समह मा तनूह्याते जनाननु|	may it convey me evermore may the light chariot pass from men.
सोमपेयं सुखो रथः|	to men unto the soma draught.
अध सवप्नस्य निर्विदेअभुञ्जतश्च रेवतः|	it holdeth slumber in contempt and the rich who enjoyeth not.
उभा ता बस्रि नश्यतः|	both vanish quickly and are lost.
वसू रुद्रा पुरुमन्तू वर्धन्ता दशस्यतं नो वर्षणावभिष्टौ|	ye vasus twain ye rudras full of counsel grant us strong strengtheners when ye stand beside us.
दस्रा ह यद रेक्ण औचथ्यो वां पर यत सस्राथेकवाभिरूती|	what wealth aucathya craves of you great helpers when ye come forward with no niggard succour.
को वां दाशत सुमतये चिदस्यै वसू यद धेथे नमसा पदे गोः|	who may give you aught vasus for your favour for what at the cows place ye grant through worship.
जिग्र्तमस्मे रेवतीः पुरन्धीः कामप्रेणेव मनसा चरन्ता|	wake for us understanding full of riches come with a heart that will fulfil our longing.
युक्तो ह यद वां तौग्र्याय पेरुर्वि मध्ये अर्णसो धायि पज्रः|	as erst for tugras son your car seacrossing strong was equipped and set amid the waters.
उप वामवः शरणं गमेयं शूरो नाज्म पतयद्भिरेवैः|	so may i gain your shelter and protection as with winged course a hero seeks his army.
उपस्तुतिरौचथ्यमुरुष्येन मा मामिमे पतत्रिणी वि दुग्धाम|	may this my praise preserve ucathyas offspring let not these twain who fly with wings exhaust me.
मा मामेधो दशतयश्चितो धाक पर यद वां बद्धस्त्मनि खादति कषाम|	let not the wood ten times uppiled consume me when fixed for you it bites the ground it stands on.
न मा गरन नद्यो मात्र्तमा दासा यदीं सुसमुब्धमवाधुः|	the most maternal streams wherein the dāsas cast me securely bound have not devoured me.
शिरो यदस्य तरैतनो वितक्षत सवयं दास उरो अंसावपि गध|	when traitana would cleave my head asunder the dāsa wounded his own breast and shoulders.
दीर्घतमा मामतेयो जुजुर्वान दशमे युगे|	dīrghatamas the son of mamatā hath come to length of days in the tenth age of human kind.
अपामर्थं यतीनां बरह्मा भवति सारथिः|	he is the brahman of the waters as they strive to reach their end and aim their charioteer is he.
वनेम पूर्वीरर्यो मनीषा अग्निः सुशोको विश्वान्यश्याः|	may we the pious win much food by prayer may agni with fair light pervade each act.
आ दैव्यानि वरता चिकित्वाना मानुषस्य जनस्य जन्म|	he the observer of the heavenly laws of gods and of the race of mortal man.
गर्भो यो अपां गर्भो वनानां गर्भश्च सथातां गर्भश्चरथाम|	he who is germ of waters germ of woods germ of all things that move not and that move.
अद्रौ चिदस्मा अन्तर्दुरोणे विशां न विश्वो अम्र्तः सवाधीः|	to him even in the rock and in the house immortal one he cares for all mankind.
स हि कषपावानग्नी रयीणां दाशद यो अस्मा अरं सूक्तैः|	agni is lord of riches for the man who serves him readily with sacred songs.
एता चिकित्वो भूमा नि पाहि देवानां जन्म मर्तांश्च विद्वान|	protect these beings thou with careful thought knowing the races both of gods and men.
वर्धान यं पूर्वीः कषपो विरूपा सथातुश्च रथं रतप्रवीतम|	whom many dawns and nights unlike make strong whom born in law all things that move and stand.
अराधि होता सवर्निषत्तः कर्ण्वन विश्वान्यपांसि सत्या|	he hath been won herald who sits in light making effectual all our holy works.
गोषु परशस्तिं वनेषु धिषे भरन्त विश्वे बलिं सवर्णः|	thou settest value on our cows and woods all shall bring tribute to us to the light.
वि तवा नरः पुरुत्रा सपर्यन पितुर्न जिव्रेर्वि वेदोभरन्त|	men have served thee in many and sundry spots parting as twere an aged fathers wealth.
साधुर्न गर्ध्नुरस्तेव शूरो यातेव भीमस्त्वेषः समत्सु|	like a brave archer like one skilled and bold a fierce avenger so he shines in fight.
उभे पुनामि रोदसी रतेन दरुहो दहामि सं महीरनिन्द्राः|	with sacrifice i purge both earth and heaven i burn up great shefiends who serve not indra.
अभिव्लग्य यत्र हता अमित्रा वैलस्थानं परि तर्ळ्हा अशेरन|	where throttled by thy hand the foes were slaughtered and in the pit of death lay pierced and mangled.
अभिव्लग्या चिदद्रिवः शीर्षा यातुमतीनाम|	o thou who castest forth the stones crushing the sorceresses heads.
छिन्धि वटूरिणा पदा महावटूरिणा पदा|	break them with thy widespreading foot with thy widespreading mighty foot.
अवासां मघवञ जहि शर्धो यातुमतीनाम|	do thou o maghavan beat off these sorceresses daring strength.
वैलस्थानके अर्मके महावैलस्थे अर्मके|	cast them within the narrow pit within the deep and narrow pit.
यासां तिस्रः पञ्चाशतोअभिव्लङगैरपावपः|	of whom thou hast ere now destroyed thricefifty with thy fierce attacks.
तत सुते मनायति तकत सु ते मनायति|	that deed they count a glorious deed though small to thee a glorious deed.
पिशङगभ्र्ष्टिमम्भ्र्णं पिशाचिमिन्द्र सं मर्ण|	o indra crush and bray to bits the fearful fieryweaponed fiend.
सर्वंरक्षो नि बर्हय|	strike every demon to the ground.
अवर्मह इन्द्र दाद्र्हि शरुधी नः शुशोच हि दयौः कषान भीषानद्रिवो घर्णान न भीषानद्रिवः|	tear down the mighty ones o indra hear thou us for heaven hath glowed like earth in fear o thunderarmed as dreading fierce heat thunderarmed.
शुष्मिन्तमो हि शुष्मिभिर्वधैरुग्रेभिरीयसे|	most mighty mid the mighty ones thou speedest with strong bolts of death.
अपूरुषघ्नो अप्रतीत शूर सत्वभिस्त्रिसप्तैः शूर सत्वभिः|	not slaying men unconquered hero with the brave o hero with the thriceseven brave.
वनोति हि सुन्वन कषयं परीणसः सुन्वानो हि षमा यजत्यव दविषो देवानामव दविषः|	the pourer of libations gains the home of wealth pouring his gift conciliates hostilities yea the hostilities of gods.
सुन्वान इत सिषासति सहस्रा वाज्यव्र्तः|	pouring he strives unchecked and strong to win him riches thousandfold.
सुन्वानायेन्द्रो ददात्याभुवं रयिं ददात्याभुवम|	indra gives lasting wealth to him who pours forth gifts yea wealth he gives that long shall last.
उपो षु शर्णुही गिरो मघवन मातथा इव|	graciously listen to our songs maghavan be not negligent.
यदा नः सून्र्तावतः कर आदर्थयास इद योजा नविन्द्र ते हरी|	as thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
अक्षन्नमीमदन्त हयव परिया अधूषत|	well have they eaten and rejoiced the friends have risen and passed away.
अस्तोषत सवभानवो विप्रा नविष्ठया मती योजा|	the sages luminous in themselves have praised thee with their latest hymn now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं मघवन वन्दिषीमहि|	maghavan we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon.
पर नूनं पूर्णवन्धुर सतुतो याहि वशाननु योजा|	thus praised according to our wish come now with richly laden car now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
स घा तं वर्षणं रथमधि तिष्ठाति गोविदम|	he will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine.
यःपात्रं हारियोजनं पूर्णमिन्द्र चिकेतति योजा|	who thinks upon the wellfilled bowl the tawny coursers harnesser now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
युक्तस्ते अस्तु दक्षिण उत सव्यः शतक्रतो|	let lord of hundred powers thy steeds be harnessed on the right and left.
तेन जायामुप परियां मन्दानो याह्यन्धसो योजा|	therewith in rapture of the juice draw near to thy beloved spouse now indra yoke thy two bay steeds.
युनज्मि ते बरह्मणा केशिना हरी उप पर याहि दधिषे गभस्त्योः|	with holy prayer i yoke thy longmaned pair of bays come hitherward thou holdest them in both thy hands.
उत तवा सुतासो रभसा अमन्दिषुः पूषण्वान वज्रिन समु पत्न्यामदः|	the stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad thou thunderer hast rejoiced with pūṣan and thy spouse.
तवमग्ने वसून्रिह रुद्रानादित्यानुत|	worship the vasus agni here the rudras the Ādityas all.
यजा सवध्वरं जनं मनुजातं घर्तप्रुषम|	who spring from manu those who know fair rites who pour their blessings down.
शरुष्टीवानो हि दाशुषे देवा अग्ने विचेतसः|	agni the gods who understand give ear unto the worshipper.
तान रोहिदश्व गिर्वणस्त्रयस्त्रिंशतमा वह|	lord of red steeds who lovest song bring thou those threeandthirty gods.
परियमेधवदत्रिवज्जातवेदो विरूपवत|	o jātavedas great in act hearken thou to praskaṇvas call.
अङगिरस्वन महिव्रत परस्कण्वस्य शरुधी हवम|	as priyamedha erst was heard atri virūpa aṅgiras.
महिकेरव ऊतये परियमेधा अहूषत|	the sons of priyamedha skilled in lofty praise have called for help.
राजन्तमध्वराणामग्निं शुक्रेण शोचिषा|	on agni who with fulgent flame is ruler of all holy rites.
घर्ताहवन सन्त्येमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः|	hear thou invoked with holy oil bountiful giver of rewards.
याभिः कण्वस्य सूनवो हवन्तेअवसे तवा|	these eulogies whereby the sons of kaṇva call thee to their aid.
तवां चित्रश्रवस्तम हवन्ते विक्षु जन्तवः|	o agni loved by many thou of fame most wondrous in their homes.
शोचिष्केशम्पुरुप्रियाग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे|	men call on thee whose hair is flame to be the bearer of their gifts.
नि तवा होतारं रत्विजं दधिरे वसुवित्तमम|	thee agni best to find out wealth most widely famous quick to hear.
शरुत्कर्णं सप्रथस्तमं विप्रा अग्ने दिविष्टिषु|	singers have stablished in their rites herald and ministering priest.
आ तवा विप्रा अचुच्यवुः सुतसोमा अभि परयः|	singers with soma pressed have made thee agni hasten to the feast.
बर्हद भा बिभ्रतो हविरग्ने मर्ताय दाशुषे|	great light to mortal worshipper what time they bring the sacred gift.
परातर्याव्णः सहस्क्र्त सोमपेयाय सन्त्य|	good bounteous son of strength this day seat here on sacred grass the gods.
इहाद्य दैव्यंजनं बर्हिरा सादया वसो|	who come at early morn the host of heaven to drink the soma juice.
अर्वाञ्चं दैव्यं जनमग्ने यक्ष्व सहूतिभिः|	bring with joint invocations thou o agni the celestial host.
अयं सोमः सुदानवस्तं पात तिरोह्न्यम|	here stands the soma bounteous gods drink this expressed ere yesterday.
आ विद्युन्मद्भिर्मरुतः सवर्कै रथेभिर्यात रष्टिमद्भिरश्वपर्णैः|	come hither maruts on your lightning laden cars sounding with sweet songs armed with lances winged with steeds.
आ वर्षिष्ठया न इषा वयो न पप्तता सुमायाः|	fly unto us with noblest food like birds o ye of mighty power.
तेअरुणेभिर्वरमा पिशङगैः शुभे कं यान्ति रथतूर्भिरश्वैः|	with their redhued or haply tawny coursers which speed their chariots on they come for glory.
रुक्मो न चित्रः सवधितीवान पव्या रथस्य जङघनन्त भूम|	brilliant like gold is he who holds the thunder earth have they smitten with the chariots felly.
शरिये कं वो अधि तनूषु वाशीर्मेधा वना न कर्णवन्त ऊर्ध्वा|	for beauty ye have swords upon your bodies as they stir woods so may they stir our spirits.
युष्मभ्यं कं मरुतः सुजातास्तुविद्युम्नासो धनयन्ते अद्रिम|	for your sake o ye maruts very mighty and wellborn have they set the stone in motion.
अहानि गर्ध्राः पर्या व आगुरिमां धियं वार्कार्यांच देवीम|	the days went round you and came back o yearners back to this prayer and to this solemn worship.
बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो गोतमासो अर्कैरूर्ध्वं नुनुद्रौत्सधिं पिबध्यै|	the gotamas making their prayer with singing have pushed the wells lid up to drink the water.
एतत तयन न योजनमचेति सस्वर्ह यन मरुतो गोतमो वः|	no hymn way ever known like this aforetime which gotama sang forth for you o maruts.
पश्यन हिरण्यचक्रानयोदंष्ट्रान विधावतो वराहून|	what time upon your golden wheels he saw you wild boars rushing about with tusks of iron.
एषा सया वो मरुतोअनुभर्त्री परति षटोभति वाघतो न वाणी|	to you this freshening draught of soma rusheth o maruts like the voice of one who prayeth.
अस्तोभयद वर्थासामनु सवधां गभस्त्योः|	it rusheth freely from our hands as these libations wont to flow.
मा नो अस्मिन मघवन पर्त्स्वंहसि नहि ते अन्तः शवसः परीणशे|	urge us not maghavan to this distressful fight for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength.
अक्रन्दयो नद्यो रोरुवद वना कथा न कषोणीर्भियसा समारत|	thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar did not men run in crowds together in their fear.
अर्चा शक्राय शाकिने शचीवते शर्ण्वन्तमिन्द्रं महयन्नभि षटुहि|	sing hymns of praise to Śakra lord of power and might laud thou and magnify indra who heareth thee.
यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा रोदसी उभे वर्षा वर्षत्वा वर्षभो नय्र्ञ्जते|	who with his daring might a bull exceeding strong in strength maketh him master of the heaven and earth.
अर्चा दिवे बर्हते शूष्यं वचः सवक्षत्रं यस्य धर्षतो धर्षन मनः|	sing forth to lofty dyaus a strengthbestowing song the bold whose resolute mind hath independent sway.
बर्हच्छ्रवा असुरो बर्हणा कर्तः पुरो हरिभ्यां वर्षभो रथो हि षः|	high glory hath the asura compact of strength drawn on by two bay steeds a bull a car is he.
तवं दिवो बर्हतः सानु कोपयोअव तमना धर्षता शम्बरं भिनत|	the ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake thou daring of thyself smotest through Śambara.
यन मायिनो वरन्दिनो मन्दिना धर्षच्छितां गभस्तिमशनिं पर्तन्यसि|	when bold with gladdening juice thou warredst with thy bolt sharp and twoedged against the banded sorcerers.
नि यद वर्णक्षि शवसनस्य मूर्धनि शुष्णस्य चिद वरन्दिनोरोरुवद वना|	when with a roar that fills the woods thou forcest down on winds head the stores which Śuṣṇa kept confined.
पराचीनेन मनसा बर्हणावता यदद्या चित कर्णवः कस्त्वा परि|	who shall have power to stay thee firm and eagersouled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done.
तवमाविथ नर्यं तुर्वशं यदुं तवं तुर्वीतिं वय्यंशतक्रतो|	thou helpest narya turvaśa and yadu and vayyas son turvīti Śatakratu.
तवं रथमेतशं कर्त्व्ये धने तवं पुरो नवतिं दम्भयो नव|	thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nineandninety castles.
स घा राजा सत्पतिः शूशुवज्जनो रातहव्यः परति यः शासमिन्वति|	a herolord is he king of a mighty folk who offers free oblations and promotes the law.
उक्था वा यो अभिग्र्णाति राधसा दानुरस्मा उपरा पिन्वते दिवः|	who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky.
असमं कषत्रमसमा मनीषा पर सोमपा अपसा सन्तु नेमे|	his power is matchless matchless is his wisdom chief through their work be some who drink the soma.
ये त इन्द्र ददुषो वर्धयन्ति महि कषत्रं सथविरं वर्ष्ण्यं च|	those indra who increase the lordly power the firm heroic strength of thee the giver.
तुभ्येदेते बहुला अद्रिदुग्धाश्चमूषदश्चमसा इन्द्रपानाः|	therefore for thee are these abundant beakers indras drink stonepressed juices held in ladles.
वयश्नुहि तर्पया काममेषामथा मनो वसुदेयाय कर्ष्व|	quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure.
अपामतिष्ठद धरुणह्वरं तमोअन्तर्व्र्त्रस्य जठरेषुपर्वतः|	there darkness stood the vault that stayed the waters flow in vṛtras hollow side the raincloud lay concealed.
अभीमिन्द्रो नद्यो वव्रिणा हिता विश्वा अनुष्ठाः परवणेषु जिघ्नते|	but indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed flood following after flood down steep declivities.
स शेव्र्धमधि धा दयुम्नमस्मे महि कषत्रं जनाषाळिन्द्र तव्यम|	so give us indra blissincreasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people.
रक्षा च नो मघोनः पाहि सूरीन राये च नः सवपत्या इषे धाः|	preserve our wealthy patrons save our princes vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring.
पर मन्दिने पितुमदर्चता वचो यः कर्ष्णगर्भा निरहन्न्र्जिश्वना|	sing with oblation praise to him who maketh glad who with Ṛjiśvan drove the dusky brood away.
अवस्यवो वर्षणं वज्रदक्षिणं मरुत्वन्तं सख्याय हवामहे|	fain for help him the strong whose right hand wields the bolt him girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
यो वयंसं जाह्र्षाणेन मन्युना यः शम्बरं यो अहन पिप्रुमव्रतम|	indra who with triumphant wrath smote vyaṁsa down and Śambara and pipru the unrighteous one.
इन्द्रो यः शुष्णमशुषं नयाव्र्णं म|	who extirpated Śuṣṇa the insatiatehim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी पौंस्यं महद यस्य वरते वरुणो यस्य सूर्यः|	he whose great work of manly might is heaven and earth and varuṇa and sūrya keep his holy law.
यस्येन्द्रस्य सिन्धवः सश्चति वरतं म|	indra whose law the rivers follow as they flowhim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
यो अश्वानां यो गवां गोपतिर्वशी य आरितः कर्मणि कर्मणि सथिरः|	he who is lord and master of the steeds and kine honouredthe firm and sureat every holy act.
वीळोश्चिदिन्द्रो यो असुन्वतो वधो म|	stayer even of the strong who pours no offering outhim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
यो विश्वस्य जगतः पराणतस पतिर्यो बरह्मणे परथमो गा अविन्दत|	he who is lord of all the world that moves and breathes who for the brahman first before all found the cows.
इन्द्रो यो दस्यून्रधरानवातिरन म|	indra who cast the dasyus down beneath his feethim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
यः शूरेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भीरुभिर्यो धावद्भिर्हूयते यश्च जिग्युभिः|	whom cowards must invoke and valiant men of war invoked by those who conquer and by those who flee.
इन्द्रं यं विश्वा भुवनाभि सन्दधुर्म|	indra to whom all beings turn their constant thoughthim girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
रुद्राणामेति परदिशा विचक्षणो रुद्रेभिर्योषा तनुते पर्थु जरयः|	refulgent in the rudras region he proceeds and with the rudras through the wide space speeds the dame.
इन्द्रं मनीषा अभ्यर्चति शरुतं म|	the hymn of praise extols indra the farrenowned him girt by maruts we invoke to be our friend.
यद वा मरुत्वः परमे सधस्थे यद वावमे वर्जने मादयासे|	o girt by maruts whether thou delight thee in loftiest gatheringplace or lowly dwelling.
अत आ याह्यध्वरं नो अछा तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा सत्यराधः|	come thence unto our rite true boonbestower through love of thee have we prepared oblations.
तवायेन्द्र सोमं सुषुमा सुदक्ष तवाया हविश्चक्र्मा बरह्मवाहः|	we fain for thee strong indra have pressed soma and o thou sought with prayer have made oblations.
अधा नियुत्वः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्मिन यज्ञे बर्हिषिमादयस्व|	now at this sacrifice with all thy maruts on sacred grass o teamborne god rejoice thee.
मादयस्व हरिभिर्ये त इन्द्र वि षयस्व शिप्रे वि सर्जस्व धेने|	rejoice thee with thine own bay steeds o indra unclose thy jaws and let thy lips be open.
आ तवा सुशिप्र हरयो वहन्तूशन हव्यानि परति नो जुषस्व|	thou with the fair cheek let thy bay steeds bring thee gracious to us he pleased with our oblation.
मरुत्स्तोत्रस्य वर्जनस्य गोपा वयमिन्द्रेण सनुयाम वाजम|	guards of the camp whose praisers are the maruts may we through indra get ourselves the booty.
तन नो|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
अस्य वामस्य पलितस्य होतुस्तस्य भराता मध्यमो अस्त्यश्नः|	of this benignant priest with eld greycoloured the brother midmost of the three is lightning.
तर्तीयो भराता घर्तप्र्ष्ठो अस्यात्रापश्यं विश्पतिं सप्तपुत्रम|	the third is he whose back with oil is sprinkled here i behold the chief with seven male children.
सप्त युञ्जन्ति रथमेकचक्रमेको अश्वो वहति सप्तनामा|	seven to the onewheeled chariot yoke the courser bearing seven names the single courser draws it.
तरिनाभि चक्रमजरमनर्वं यत्रेमा विश्वा भुवनाधितस्थुः|	threenaved the wheel is sound and undecaying whereon are resting all these worlds of being.
इमं रथमधि ये सप्त तस्थुः सप्तचक्रं सप्त वहन्त्यश्वाः|	the seven who on the sevenwheeled car are mounted have horses seven in tale who draw them onward.
सप्त सवसारो अभि सं नवन्ते यत्र गवां निहिता सप्त नाम|	seven sisters utter songs of praise together in whom the names of the seven cows are treasured.
को ददर्श परथमं जायमानमस्थन्वन्तं यदनस्था बिभर्ति|	who hath beheld him as he sprang to being seen how the boneless one supports the bony.
भूम्या असुरस्र्गात्मा कव सवित को विद्वांसमुप गात परष्टुमेतत|	where is the blood of earth the life the spirit who may approach the man who knows to ask it.
पाकः पर्छामि मनसाविजानन देवानामेना निहिता पदानि|	unripe in mind in spirit undiscerning i ask of these the gods established places.
वत्से बष्कयेअधि सप्त तन्तून वि तत्निरे कवय ओतवाु|	for up above the yearling calf the sages to form a web their own seven threads have woven.
अचिकित्वाञ्चिकितुषश्चिदत्र कवीन पर्छामि विद्मने न विद्वान|	i ask unknowing those who know the sages as one all ignorant for sake of knowledge.
वि यस्तस्तम्भ षळ इमा रजांस्यजस्य रूपे किमपि सविदेकम|	what was that one who in the unborns image hath stablished and fixed firm these worlds six regions.
इह बरवीतु य ईमङग वेदास्य वामस्य निहितं पदं वेः|	let him who knoweth presently declare it this lovely birds securely founded station.
शीर्ष्णः कषीरं दुह्रते गावो अस्य वव्रिं वसाना उदकं पदापुः|	forth from his head the cows draw milk and wearing his vesture with their foot have drunk the water.
माता पितरं रत आ बभाज धीत्यग्रे मनसा सं हि जग्मे|	the mother gave the sire his share of order with thought at first she wedded him in spirit.
सा बीभत्सुर्गर्भरसा निविद्धा नमस्वन्त इदुपवाकमीयुः|	she the coy dame was filled with dew prolific with adoration men approached to praise her.
युक्ता मातासीद धुरि दक्षिणाया अतिष्ठद गर्भो वर्जनीष्वन्तः|	yoked was the mother to the boon cows carpole in the dank rows of cloud the infant rested.
अमीमेद वत्सो अनु गामपश्यद विश्वरूप्यं तरिषु योजनेषु|	then the calf lowed and looked upon the mother the cow who wears all shapes in three directions.
तिस्रो मातॄस्त्रीन पितॄन बिभ्रदेक ऊर्ध्वस्तस्थौ नेमव गलापयन्ति|	bearing three mothers and three fathers single he stood erect they never make him weary.
मन्त्रयन्ते दिवो अमुष्य पर्ष्ठे विश्वविदं वाचमविश्वमिन्वाम|	there on the pitch of heaven they speak together in speech allknowing but not allimpelling.
दवादशारं नहि तज्जराय वर्वर्ति चक्रं परि दयां रतस्य|	formed with twelve spokes by length of time unweakened rolls round the heaven this wheel of during order.
आ पुत्रा अग्ने मिथुनासो अत्र सप्त शतानि विंशतिश्च तस्थुः|	herein established joined in pairs together seven hundred sons and twenty stand o agni.
पञ्चपादं पितरं दवादशाक्र्तिं दिव आहुः परे अर्धे पुरीषिणम|	they call him in the farther half of heaven the sire fivefooted of twelve forms wealthy in watery store.
अथेमे अन्य उपरे विचक्षणं सप्तचक्रे षळर आहुरर्पितम|	these others say that he god with farseeing eyes is mounted on the lower sevenwheeled sixspoked car.
पञ्चारे चक्रे परिवर्तमाने तस्मिन्ना तस्थुर्भुवनानि विश्वा|	upon this fivespoked wheel revolving ever all living creatures rest and are dependent.
तस्य नाक्षस्तप्यते भूरिभारः सनादेव न शीर्यते सनाभिः|	its axle heavyladen is not heated the nave from ancient time remains unbroken.
सनेमि चक्रमजरं वि वाव्र्त उत्तानायां दश युक्ता वहन्ति|	the wheel revolves unwasting with its felly ten draw it yoked to the farstretching carpole.
सूर्यस्य चक्षू रजसैत्याव्र्तं तस्मिन्नार्पिता भुवनानि विश्वा|	the suns eye moves encompassed by the region on him dependent rest all living creatures.
साकंजानां सप्तथमहुरेकजं षळ इद यमा रषयो देवजा इति|	of the coborn they call the seventh singleborn the six twin pairs are called Ṛṣis children of gods.
तेषामिष्टानि विहितानि धामश सथात्रे रेजन्ते विक्र्तानि रूपशः|	their good gifts sought of men are ranged in order due and various in their form move for the lord who guides.
सत्रियः सतीस्तानु मे पुंस आहुः पश्यदक्षण्वान नवि चेतदन्धः|	they told me these were males though truly females he who hath eyes sees this the blind discerns not.
कविर्यः पुत्रः स ईमा चिकेत यस्ता विजानात स पितुष पितासत|	the son who is a sage hath comprehended who knows this rightly is his fathers father.
अवः परेण पर एनावरेण पदा वत्सं बिभ्रती गौरुदस्थात|	beneath the upper realm above this lower bearing her calf at foot the cow hath risen.
सा कद्रीची कं सविदर्धं परागात कव सवित सूते नहि यूथे अन्तः|	witherward to what place hath she departed where calves she not amid this herd of cattle.
अवः परेण पितरं यो अस्यानुवेद पर एनावरेण|	who that the father of this calf discerneth beneath the upper realm above the lower.
कवीयमानः क इह पर वोचद देवं मनः कुतो अधि पराजातम|	showing himself a sage may here declare it whence hath the godlike spirit had its rising.
ये अर्वाञ्चस्तानु पराच आहुर्ये पराञ्चस्तानु अर्वाच आहुः|	those that come hitherward they call departing those that depart they call directed hither.
इन्द्रश्च या चक्रथुः सोम तानि धुरा न युक्ता रजसो वहन्ति|	and what so ye have made indra and soma steeds bear as twere yoked to the regions carpole.
दवा सुपर्णा सयुजा सखाया समानं वर्क्षं परि षस्वजाते|	two birds with fair wings knit with bonds of friendship in the same sheltering tree have found a refuge.
तयोरन्यः पिप्पलं सवाद्वत्त्यनश्नन्नन्यो अभि चाकशीति|	one of the twain eats the sweet figtrees fruitage the other eating not regardeth only.
यत्रा सुपर्णा अम्र्तस्य भागमनिमेषं विदथाभिस्वरन्ति|	where those fine birds hymn ceaselessly their portion of life eternal and the sacred synods.
इनो विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपाः स मा धीरः पाकमत्रा विवेश|	there is the universes mighty keeper who wise hath entered into me the simple.
यस्मिन वर्क्षे मध्वदः सुपर्णा निविशन्ते सुवते चाधि विश्वे|	the tree whereon the fine birds eat the sweetness where they all rest and procreate their offspring.
तस्येदाहुः पिप्पलं सवाद्वग्रे तन नोन नशद यःपितरं न वेद|	upon its top they say the fig is luscious none gaineth it who knoweth not the father.
यद गायत्रे अधि गायत्रमाहितं तरैष्टुभाद वा तरैष्टुभं निरतक्षत|	how on the gāyatrī the gāyatrī was based how from the triṣṭup they fashioned the triṣṭup forth.
यद वा जगज्जगत्याहितं पदं य इत तद विदुस्ते अम्र्तत्वमानशुः|	how on the jagatī was based the jagatīthey who know this have won themselves immortal life.
गायत्रेण परति मिमीते अर्कमर्केण साम तरैष्टुभेन वाकम|	with gāyatrī he measures out the praisesong sāma with praisesong triplet with the triṣṭup.
वाकेन वाकं दविपदा चतुष्पदाक्षरेण मिमते सप्त वाणीः|	the triplet with the two or fourfoot measure and with the syllable they form seven metres.
जगता सिन्धुं दिव्यस्थभायद रथन्तरे सूर्यं पर्यपश्यत|	with jagatī the flood in heaven he stablished and saw the sun in the rathantara sāman.
गायत्रस्य समिधस्तिस्र आहुस्ततो मह्ना पर रिरिचे महित्वा|	gāyatrī hath they say three brands for kindling hence it excels in majesty and vigour.
उप हवये सुदुघां धेनुमेतां सुहस्तो गोधुगुत दोहदेनाम|	i invocate the milchcow good for milking so that the milker deft of hand may drain her.
शरेष्ठं सवं सविता साविषन नोअभीद्धो घर्मस्तदु षु पर वोचम|	may savitar give goodliest stimulation the caldron is made hot i will proclaim it.
हिङकर्ण्वती वसुपत्नी वसूनां वत्समिछन्ती मनसाभ्यागात|	she lady of all treasure is come hither yearning in spirit for her calf and lowing.
दुहामश्विभ्यां पयो अघ्न्येयं स वर्धतां महते सौभगाय|	may this cow yield her milk for both the aśvins and may she prosper to our high advantage.
गौरमीमेदनु वत्सं मिषन्तं मूर्धानं हिंं अक्र्णोन मातवा उ|	the cow hath lowed after her blinking youngling she licks his forehead as she lows to form it.
सर्क्वाणं घर्ममभि वावशाना मिमाति मायुं पयते पयोभिः|	his mouth she fondly calls to her warm udder and suckles him with milk while gently lowing.
अयं स शिङकते येन गौरभीव्र्ता मिमाति मायुं धवसनावधि शरिता|	he also snorts by whom encompassed round the cow laws as she clings unto the shedder of the rain.
सा चित्तिभिर्नि हि चकार मर्त्यं विद्युद भवन्ती परति वव्रिमौहत|	she with her shrilling cries hath humbled mortal man and turned to lightning hath stripped off her covering robe.
अनच्छये तुरगातु जीवमेजद धरुवं मध्य आ पस्त्यानाम|	that which hath breath and speed and life and motion lies firmly stablished in the midst of houses.
जीवो मर्तस्य चरति सवधाभिरमर्त्यो मर्त्येना सयोनिः|	living by offerings to the dead he moveth immortal one the brother of the mortal.
अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम|	i saw the herdsman him who never stumbles approaching by his pathways and departing.
स सध्रीचीः स विशूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्ति भुवनेष्वन्तः|	he clothed with gathered and diffusive splendour within the worlds continually travels.
य ईं चकार न सो अस्य वेद य ईं ददर्श हिरुगिन नुतस्मात|	he who hath made him cloth not comprehend him from him who saw him surely is he hidden.
स मातुर्योना परिवीतो अन्तर्बहुप्रजा निर्र्तिमा विवेश|	he yet enveloped in his mothers bosom source of much life hath sunk into destruction.
दयौर्मे पिता जनिता नाभिरत्र बन्धुर्मे माता पर्थिवीमहीयम|	dyaus is my father my begetter kinship is here this great earth is my kin and mother.
उत्तानयोश्चम्वोर्योनिरन्तरत्रा पिता दुहितुर्गर्भमाधात|	between the widespread worldhalves is the birthplace the father laid the daughters germ within it.
पर्छामि तवा परमन्तं पर्थिव्याः पर्छामि यत्र भुवनस्यनाभिः|	i ask thee of the earths extremest limit where is the centre of the world i ask thee.
पर्छामि तवा वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य रेतः पर्छामि वाचः परमं वयोम|	i ask thee of the stallions seed prolific i ask of highest heaven where speech abideth.
इयं वेदिः परो अन्तः पर्थिव्या अयं यज्ञो भुवनस्य नाभिः|	this altar is the earths extremest limit this sacrifice of ours is the worlds centre.
अयं सोमो वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य रेतो बरह्मायं वाचःपरमं वयोम|	the stallions seed prolific is the soma this brahman highest heaven where speech abideth.
सप्तार्धगर्भा भुवनस्य रेतो विष्णोस्तिष्ठन्ति परदिशाविधर्मणि|	seven germs unripened yet are heavens prolific seed their functions they maintain by viṣṇus ordinance.
ते धीतिभिर्मनसा ते विपश्चितः परिभुवः परि भवन्ति विश्वतः|	endued with wisdom through intelligence and thought they compass us about present on every side.
अन वि जानामि यदिवेदमस्मि निण्यः संनद्धो मनसा चरामि|	what thing i truly am i know not clearly mysterious fettered in my mind i wander.
यदा मागन परथमजा रतस्यादिद वचो अश्नुवे भागमस्याः|	when the firstborn of holy law approached me then of this speech i first obtain a portion.
अपां परां एति सवधया गर्भीतोअमर्त्यो मर्त्येना सयोनिः|	back forward goes he grasped by strength inherent the immortal born the brother of the mortal.
ता शश्वन्ता विषूचीना वियन्ता नयन्यं चिक्युर्न निचिक्युरन्यम|	ceaseless they move in opposite directions men mark the one and fail to mark the other.
रचो अक्षरे परमे वयोमन यस्मिन देवा अधि विश्वे निषेदुः|	upon what syllable of holy praisesong as twere their highest heaven the gods repose them.
यस्तन न वेद किं रचा करिष्यति य इत तद विदुस्त इमे समासते|	who knows not this what will he do with praisesong but they who know it well sit here assembled.
सूयवसाद भगवती हि भूया अथो वयं भगवन्तः सयाम|	fortunate mayst thou be with goodly pasture and may we also be exceeding wealthy.
अद्धि तर्णमघ्न्ये विश्वदानीं पिब शुद्धमुदकमाचरन्ती|	feed on the grass o cow at every season and coming hitherward drink limpid water.
गौरीर्मिमाय सलिलानि तक्षत्येकपदी दविपदी सा चतुष्पदी|	forming the waterfloods the buffalo hath lowed onefooted or twofooted or fourfooted she.
अष्टापदी नवपदी बभूवुषी सहस्राक्षरा परमे वयोमन|	who hath become eightfooted or hath got nine feet the thousandsyllabled in the sublimest heaven.
तस्याः समुद्रा अधि वि कषरन्ति तेन जीवन्ति परदिशश्चतस्रः|	from her descend in streams the seas of water thereby the worlds four regions have their being.
ततः कषरत्यक्षरं तद विश्वमुप जीवति|	thence flows the imperishable flood and thence the universe hath life.
शकमयं धूममारादपश्यं विषूवता पर एनावरेण|	i saw from far away the smoke of fuel with spires that rose on high oer that beneath it.
उक्षाणं पर्श्निमपचन्त वीरास्तानि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन|	the mighty men have dressed the spotted bullock these were the customs in the days aforetime.
तरयः केशिन रतुथा वि चक्षते संवत्सरे वपत एक एषाम|	three with long tresses show in ordered season one of them sheareth when the year is ended.
विश्वमेको अभि चष्टे शचीभिर्ध्राजिरेकस्य दद्र्शेन रूपम|	one with his powers the universe regardeth of one the sweep is seen but his figure.
चत्वारि वाक परिमिता पदानि तानि विदुर्ब्राह्मणा ये मनीषिणः|	speech hath been measured out in four divisions the brahmans who have understanding know them.
गुहा तरीणि निहिता नेङगयन्ति तुरीयं वाचो मनुष्या वदन्ति|	three kept in close concealment cause no motion of speech men speak only the fourth division.
इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणमग्निमाहुरथो दिव्यः स सुपर्णो गरुत्मान|	they call him indra mitra varuṇa agni and he is heavenly noblywinged garutmān.
एकं सद विप्रा बहुधा वदन्त्यग्निं यमं मातरिश्वानमाहुः|	to what is one sages give many a title they call it agni yama mātariśvan.
कर्ष्णं नियानं हरयः सुपर्णा अपो वसाना दिवमुत पतन्ति|	dark the descent the birds are goldencoloured up to the heaven they fly robed in the waters.
त आवव्र्त्रन सदनाद रतस्यादिद घर्तेन पर्थिवी वयुद्यते|	again descend they from the seat of order and all the earth is moistened with their fatness.
दवादश परधयश्चक्रमेकं तरीणि नभ्यानि क उ तच्चिकेत|	twelve are the fellies and the wheel is single three are the naves what man hath understood it.
तस्मिन साकं तरिशता न शङकवोअर्पिताः षष्टिर्न चलाचलासः|	therein are set together spokes three hundred and sixty which in nowise can be loosened.
यस्ते सतनः शशयो यो मयोभूर्येन विश्वा पुष्यसि वार्याणि|	that breast of thine exhaustless spring of pleasure wherewith thou feedest all things that are choicest.
यो रत्नधा वसुविद यः सुदत्रः सरस्वति तमिह धातवे कः|	wealthgiver treasure finder free bestowerbring that sarasvatī that we may drain it.
यज्ञेन यज्ञमयजन्त देवास्तनि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन|	by means of sacrifice the gods accomplished their sacrifice these were the earliest ordinances.
ते ह नाकं महिमानः सचन्त यत्र पूर्वे साध्याः सन्ति देवाः|	these mighty ones attained the height of heaven there where the sādhyas gods of old are dwelling.
समानमेतदुदकमुच्चैत्यव चाहभिः|	uniform with the passing days this water mounts and fails again.
भूमिं पर्जन्या जिन्वन्ति दिवं जिन्वन्त्यग्नयः|	the tempestclouds give life to earth and fires reanimate the heaven.
दिव्यं सुपर्णं वायसं बर्हन्तमपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनाम|	the bird celestial vast with noble pinion the lovely germ of plants the germ of waters.
अभीपतो वर्ष्टिभिस्तर्पयन्तं सरस्वन्तमवसे जोहवीमि|	him who delighteth us with rain in season sarasvān i invoke that he may help us.
तवया वयं मघवन पूर्व्ये धन इन्द्रत्वोताः सासह्याम पर्तन्यतो वनुयाम वनुष्यतः|	helped indra maghavan by thee in war of old may we subdue in fight the men who strive with us conquer the men who war with us.
नेदिष्ठे अस्मिन्नहन्यधि वोचा नु सुन्वते|	this day that now is close at hand bless him who pours the soma juice.
अस्मिन यज्ञे वि चयेमा भरे कर्तं वाजयन्तो भरे कर्तम|	in this our sacrifice may we divide the spoil showing our strength the spoil of war.
