स तवं न इन्द्र सूर्ये सो अप्स्वनागास्त्व आ भज जीवशंसे|	indra as such give us a share of sunlight of waters sinlessness and reputation.
मान्तरां भुजमा रीरिषो नः शरद्धितं ते महत इन्द्रियाय|	do thou no harm to our yet unborn offspring our trust is in thy mighty indrapower.
अधा मन्ये शरत ते अस्मा अधायि वर्षा चोदस्व महते धनाय|	now we i think in thee as such have trusted lead us on mighty one to ample riches.
मा नो अक्र्ते पुरुहूत योनाविन्द्र कषुध्यद्भ्यो वय आसुतिं दाः|	in no unready house give us o indra invoked of many food and drink when hungry.
मा नो वधीरिन्द्र मा परा दा मा नः परिया भोजनानि पर मोषीः|	slay us not indra do not thou forsake us steal not away the joys which we delight in.
आण्डा मा नो मघवञ्छक्र निर्भेन मा नः पात्रा भेत सहजानुषाणि|	rend not our unborn brood strong lord of bounty our vessels with the life that is within them.
अर्वां एहि सोमकामं तवाहुरयं सुतस्तस्य पिबा मदाय|	come to us they have called thee somalover here is the pressed juice drink thereof for rapture.
उरुव्यचा जथर आ वर्षस्व पितेव नः शर्णुहि हूयमानः|	widelycapacious pour it down within thee and invocated hear us like a father.
इन्द्रस्य नु वीर्याणि पर वोचं यानि चकार परथमानि वज्री|	i will declare the manly deeds of indra the first that he achieved the thunderwielder.
अहन्नहिमन्वपस्ततर्द पर वक्षणा अभिनत पर्वतानाम|	he slew the dragon then disclosed the waters and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents.
अहन्नहिं पर्वते शिश्रियाणं तवष्टास्मै वज्रं सवर्यं ततक्ष|	he slew the dragon lying on the mountain his heavenly bolt of thunder tvaṣṭar fashioned.
वाश्रा इव धेनवः सयन्दमाना अञ्जः समुद्रमव जग्मुरापः|	like lowing kine in rapid flow descending the waters glided downward to the ocean.
वर्षायमाणोअव्र्णीत सोमं तरिकद्रुकेष्वपिबत सुतस्य|	impetuous as a bull he chose the soma and in three sacred beakers drank the juices.
आसायकं मघवादत्त वज्रमहन्नेनं परथमजामहीनाम|	maghavan grasped the thunder for his weapon and smote to death this firstborn of the dragons.
यदिन्द्राहन परथमजामहीनामान मायिनाममिनाः परोत मायाः|	when indra thou hadst slain the dragons firstborn and overcome the charms of the enchanters.
आत सूर्यं जनयन दयामुषासं तादीत्नाशत्रुं न किला विवित्से|	then giving life to sun and dawn and heaven thou foundest not one foe to stand against thee.
अहन वर्त्रं वर्त्रतरं वयंसमिन्द्रो वज्रेण महता वधेन|	indra with his own great and deadly thunder smote into pieces vṛtra worst of vṛtras.
सकन्धांसीव कुलिशेना विव्र्क्णाहिः शयत उपप्र्क पर्थिव्याः|	as trunks of trees what time the axe hath felled them low on the earth so lies the prostrate dragon.
अयोद्धेव दुर्मद आ हि जुह्वे महावीरं तुविबाधं रजीषम|	he like a mad weak warrior challenged indra the great impetuous manyslaying hero.
नातारीदस्य सम्र्तिं वधानां सं रुजानाः पिपिषैन्द्रशत्रुः|	he brooking not the clashing of the weapons crushedindras foethe shattered forts in falling.
अपादहस्तो अप्र्तन्यदिन्द्रमास्य वज्रमधि सानौ जघान|	footless and handless still he challenged indra who smote him with his bolt between the shoulders.
वर्ष्णो वध्रिः परतिमानं बुभूषन पुरुत्रा वर्त्रो अशयद वयस्तः|	emasculate yet claiming manly vigour thus vṛtra lay with scattered limbs dissevered.
नदं न भिन्नममुया शयानं मनो रुहाणा अति यन्त्यापः|	there as he lies like a bankbursting river the waters taking courage flow above him.
याश्चिद वर्त्रो महिना पर्यतिष्ठत तासामहिः पत्सुतःशीर्बभूव|	the dragon lies beneath the feet of torrents which vṛtra with his greatness had encompassed.
नीचावया अभवद वर्त्रपुत्रेन्द्रो अस्या अव वधर्जभार|	then humbled was the strength of vṛtras mother indra hath cast his deadly bolt against her.
उत्तरा सूरधरः पुत्र आसीद दानुः शये सहवत्सा न धेनुः|	the mother was above the son was under and like a cow beside her calf lay danu.
अतिष्ठन्तीनामनिवेशनानां काष्ठानां मध्ये निहितंशरीरम|	rolled in the midst of neverceasing currents flowing without a rest for ever onward.
वर्त्रस्य निण्यं वि चरन्त्यापो दीर्घं तम आशयदिन्द्रशत्रुः|	the waters bear off vṛtras nameless body the foe of indra sank to during darkness.
दासपत्नीरहिगोपा अतिष्ठन निरुद्धा आपः पणिनेव गावः|	guarded by ahi stood the thralls of dāsas the waters stayed like kine held by the robber.
अपां बिलमपिहितं यदासीद वर्त्रं जघन्वानपतद ववार|	but he when he had smitten vṛtra opened the cave wherein the floods had been imprisoned.
अश्व्यो वारो अभवस्तदिन्द्र सर्के यत तवा परत्यहन देव एकः|	a horses tail wast thou when he o indra smote on thy bolt thou god without a second.
अजयो गा अजयः शूर सोममवास्र्जः सर्तवे सप्त सिन्धून|	thou hast won back the kine hast won the soma thou hast let loose to flow the seven rivers.
नास्मै विद्युन न तन्यतुः सिषेध न यां मिहमकिरद धरादुनिं च|	nothing availed him lightning nothing thunder hailstorm or mist which had spread around him.
इन्द्रश्च यद युयुधाते अहिश्चोतापरीभ्यो मघवा वि जिग्ये|	when indra and the dragon strove in battle maghavan gained the victory for ever.
अहेर्यातारं कमपश्य इन्द्र हर्दि यत ते जघ्नुषो भीरगछत|	whom sawest thou to avenge the dragon indra that fear possessed thy heart when thou hadst slain him.
नव च यन नवतिं च सरवन्तीः शयेनो न भीतोतरो रजांसि|	that like a hawk affrighted through the regions thou crossedst nineandninety flowing rivers.
इन्द्रो यातोअवसितस्य राजा शमस्य च शर्ङगिणो वज्रबाहुः|	indra is king of all that moves and moves not of creatures tame and horned the thunderwielder.
सेदु राजा कषयति चर्षणीनामरान न नेमिः परि ता बभूव|	over all living men he rules as sovran containing all as spokes within the felly.
अयं जायत मनुषो धरीमणि होता यजिष्ठ उशिजामनुव्रतमग्निः सवमनु वरतम|	by manus law was born this agni priest most skilled born for the holy work of those who yearn therefore yea born for his own holy work.
विश्वश्रुष्टिः सखीयते रयिरिव शरवस्यते|	all ear to him who seeks his love and wealth to him who strives for fame.
अदब्धो होता नि षददिळस पदे परिवीत इळस पदे|	priest neer deceived he sits in iḷās holy place girt round in iḷās holy place.
तं यज्ञसाधमपि वातयामस्य रतस्य पथा नमसा हविष्मता देवताता हविष्मता|	we call that perfecter of worship by the path or sacrifice with reverence rich in offerings with worship rich in offerings.
स न ऊर्जामुपाभ्र्त्यया कर्पा न जूर्यति|	through presentation of our food he grows not old in this his from.
यं मातरिश्वा मनवे परावतो देवं भाः परावतः|	the god whom mātariśvan brought from far away for manu brought from far away.
एवेन सद्यः पर्येति पार्थिवं मुहुर्गी रेतो वर्षभः कनिक्रदद दधद रेतह कनिक्रदत|	in ordered course forthwith he traverses the earth swiftswallowing bellowing steer bearing the genial seed bearing the seed and bellowing.
शतं चक्षाणो अक्षभिर्देवो वनेषु तुर्वणिः|	observant with a hundred eyes the god is conqueror in the wood.
सदो दधान उपरेषु सानुष्वग्निः परेषु सानुषु|	agni who hath his seat in broad plains here below and in the high lands far away.
स सुक्रतुः पुरोहितो दमे दमेअग्निर्यज्ञस्याध्वरस्य चेतति करत्वा यज्ञस्य चेतति|	that agni wise highpriest in every house takes thought for sacrifice and holy service yea takes thought with mental power for sacrifice.
करत्वा वेधा इषूयते विश्वा जातानि पस्पशे|	disposer he with mental power shows all things unto him who strives.
यतो घर्तश्रीरतिथिरजायत वह्निर्वेधा अजायत|	whence he was born a guest enriched with holy oil born as ordainer and as priest.
करत्वा यदस्य तविषीषु पर्ञ्चतेअग्नेरवेण मरुतां न भोज्येषिराय न भोज्या|	when through his power and in his strong prevailing flames the maruts gladdening boons mingle with agnis roar boons gladdening for the active one.
स हि षमा दानमिन्वति वसूनां च मज्मना|	then he accelerates the gift and by the greatness of his wealth.
स नस्त्रासते दुरितादभिह्रुतः शंसादघादभिह्रुतः|	shall rescue us from overwhelming misery from curse and overwhelming woe.
विश्वो विहाया अरतिर्वसुर्दधे हस्ते दक्षिणे तरणिर्नशिश्रथच्छ्रवस्यया न शिश्रथत|	vast universal good he was made messenger the speeder with his right hand hath not loosed his hold through love of fame not loosed his hold.
विश्वस्मा इदिषुध्यते देवत्रा हव्यमोहिषे|	he bears oblations to the gods for whosoever supplicates.
विश्वस्मा इत सुक्र्ते वारं रण्वत्यग्निर्द्वारा वय रण्वति|	agni bestows a blessing on each pious man and opens wide the doors for him.
स मानुषे वर्जने शन्तमो हितोअग्निर्यज्ञेषु जेन्यो न विश्पतिः परियो यज्ञेषु विश्पतिः|	that agni hath been set most kind in camp of men in sacrifice like a lord victorious like a dear lord in sacred rites.
स हव्या मानुषाणामिळा कर्तानि पत्यते|	his are the oblations of mankind when offered up at iḷās place.
स नस्त्रासते वरुणस्य धूर्तेर्महोदेवस्य धूर्तेः|	he shall preserve us from varuṇas chastisement yea from the great gods chastisement.
अग्निं होतारमीळते वसुधितिं परियं चेतिष्ठमरतिं नयेरिरे हव्यवाहं नयेरिरे|	agni the priest they supplicate to grant them wealth him dear most thoughtful have they made their messenger him offeringbearer have they made.
विश्वायुं विश्ववेदसं होतारं यजतं कविम|	beloved of all who knoweth all the priest the holy one the sage.
देवासो रण्वमवसे वसूयवो गीर्भीरण्वं वसूयवः|	him friend for help the gods when they are fain for wealth him friend with hymns when fain for wealth.
अश्विना यज्वरीरिषो दरवत्पाणी शुभस पती|	ye aśvins rich in treasure lords of splendour having nimble hands.
पुरुभुजाचनस्यतम|	accept the sacrificial food.
अश्विना पुरुदंससा नरा शवीरया धिया|	ye aśvins rich in wondrous deeds ye heroes worthy of our praise.
धिष्ण्या वनतं गिरः|	accept our songs with mighty thought.
दस्रा युवाकवः सुता नासत्या वर्क्तबर्हिषः|	nāsatyas wonderworkers yours are these libations with clipt grass.
आ यातंरुद्रवर्तनी|	come ye whose paths are red with flame.
इन्द्रा याहि चित्रभानो सुता इमे तवायवः|	o indra marvellously bright come these libations long for thee.
अण्वीभिस्तना पूतासः|	thus by fine fingers purified.
इन्द्रा याहि धियेषितो विप्रजूतः सुतावतः|	urged by the holy singer sped by song come indra to the prayers.
उप बरह्माणि वाघतः|	of the libationpouring priest.
इन्द्रा याहि तूतुजान उप बरह्माणि हरिवः|	approach o indra hasting thee lord of bay horses to the prayers.
सुते दधिष्वनश्चनः|	in our libation take delight.
ओमासश्चर्षणीध्र्तो विश्वे देवास आ गत|	ye viśvedevas who protect reward and cherish men approach.
दाश्वांसो दाशुषः सुतम|	your worshippers drinkoffering.
विश्वे देवासो अप्तुरः सुतमा गन्त तूर्णयः|	ye viśvedevas swift at work come hither quickly to the draught.
उस्रा इवस्वसराणि|	as milchkine hasten to their stalls.
विश्वे देवासो अस्रिध एहिमायासो अद्रुहः|	the viśvedevas changing shape like serpents fearless void of guile.
मेधं जुषन्त वह्नयः|	bearers accept the sacred draught.
पावका नः सरस्वती वाजेभिर्वाजिनीवती|	wealthy in spoil enriched with hymns may bright sarasvatī desire.
यज्ञं वष्टु धियावसुः|	with eager love our sacrifice.
चोदयित्री सून्र्तानां चेतन्ती सुमतीनाम|	inciter of all pleasant songs inspirer of all gracious thought.
यज्ञं दधे सरस्वती|	sarasvatī accept our rite.
महो अर्णः सरस्वती पर चेतयति केतुना|	sarasvatī the mighty floodshe with her light illuminates.
धियो विश्वा वि राजति|	she brightens every pious thought.
मित्रं न यं शिम्या गोषु गव्यवः सवाध्यो विदथे अप्सुजीजनन|	heaven and earth trembled at the might and voice of him whom loved and holy one helper of all mankind.
अरेजेतां रोदसी पाजसा गिरा परति परियं यजतं जनुषमवः|	the wise who longed for spoil in fight for kine brought forth with power a friend mid waters at the sacrifice.
यद ध तयद वां पुरुमीळ्हस्य सोमिनः पर मित्रासो न दधिरे सवाभुवः|	as these like friends have done this work for you these prompt servants of purumīlha somaofferer.
अध करतुं विदतं गतुमर्चत उत शरुतं वर्षणा पस्त्यावतः|	give mental power to him who sings the sacred song and hearken strong ones to the master of the house.
आ वां भूषन कषितयो जन्म रोदस्योः परवाच्यं वर्षणा दक्षसे महे|	the folk have glorified your birth from earth and heaven to be extolled ye strong ones for your mighty power.
यदीं रताय भरथो यदर्वते पर होत्रया शिम्य वीथो अध्वरम|	ye when ye bring to singer and the rite enjoy the sacrifice performed with holy praise and strength.
पर सा कषितिरसुर या महि परिय रतावानाव रतमा घोषथो बर्हत|	the people prospers asuras whom ye dearly love ye righteous ones proclaim aloud the holy law.
युवं दिवो बर्हतो दक्षमभुवं गां न धुर्युप युञ्जाथे अपः|	that efficacious power that comes from lofty heaven ye bind unto the work as to the pole an ox.
मही अत्र महिना वारं रण्वथोअरेणवस्तुज आ सद्मन धेनवः|	on this great earth ye send your treasure down with might unstained by dust the crowding kine are in the stalls.
सवरन्ति ता उपरताति सूर्यमा निम्रुच उषसस्तक्ववीरिव|	here in the neighbourhood they cry unto the sun at morning and at evening like swift birds of prey.
आ वं रताय केशिनीरनुषत मित्र यत्र वरुण गातुमर्चथः|	the flames with curling tresses serve your sacrifice whereto ye sing the song mitra and varuṇa.
अव तमन सर्जतं पिन्वतं धियो युवं विप्रस्य मन्मनमिरज्यथः|	send down of your free will prosper our holy songs ye are sole masters of the singers hymn of praise.
यो वां यज्ञैः शशमानो ह दाशति कविर्होता यजति मन्मसाधनः|	whoso with sacrifices toiling brings you gifts and worships sage and priest fulfilling your desire.
उपाह तं गछथो वीथो अध्वरमछा गिरः सुमतिं गन्तमस्मयु|	to him do ye draw nigh and taste his sacrifice come wellinclined to us unto our songs and prayer.
युवां यज्ञैः परथमा गोभिरञ्जत रतावना मनसो नप्रयुक्तिषु|	with sacrifices and with milk they deck you first ye righteous ones as if through stirrings of the mind.
भरन्ति वां मन्मना संयता गिरोअद्र्प्यता मनस रेवदशाथे|	to you they bring their hymns with their collected thought while ye with earnest soul come to us gloriously.
रेवद वयो दधाथे रेवदाशथे नरा मयाभिरितौति महिनम|	rich strength of life is yours ye heroes have obtained through your surpassing powers rich farextending might.
न वं दयावोअहभिर्नोत सिन्धवो न देवत्वं पणयो नानशुर्मघम|	not the past days conjoined with nights not rivers not the paṇis have attained your godhead and your wealth.
वायवा याहि दर्शतेमे सोमा अरंक्र्ताः|	beautiful vāyu come for thee these soma drops have been prepared.
तेषां पाहि शरुधी हवम|	drink of them hearken to our call.
वाय उक्थेभिर्जरन्ते तवामछा जरितारः|	knowing the days with soma juice poured forth the singers glorify.
सुतसोमा अहर्विदः|	thee vāyu with their hymns of praise.
वायो तव परप्र्ञ्चती धेना जिगाति दाशुषे|	vāyu thy penetrating stream goes forth unto the worshipper.
उरूची सोमपीतये|	farspreading for the soma draught.
इन्द्रवायू इमे सुता उप परयोभिरा गतम|	these indravāyu have been shed come for our offered dainties sake.
इन्दवो वामुशन्ति हि|	the drops are yearning for you both.
वायविन्द्रश्च चेतथः सुतानां वाजिनीवसू|	well do ye mark libations ye vāyu and indra rich in spoil.
तावा यातमुप दरवत|	so come ye swiftly hitherward.
वायविन्द्रश्च सुन्वत आ यातमुप निष्क्र्तम|	vāyu and indra come to what the somapresser hath prepared.
मक्ष्वित्था धिया नरा|	soon heroes thus i make my prayer.
मित्रं हुवे पूतदक्षं वरुणं च रिशादसम|	mitra of holy strength i call and foedestroying varuṇa.
धियं घर्ताचीं साधन्ता|	who make the oilfed rite complete.
रतेन मित्रावरुणाव रताव्र्धाव रतस्प्र्शा|	mitra and varuṇa through law lovers and cherishers of law.
करतुं बर्हन्तमाशाथे|	have ye obtained your might power.
कवी नो मित्रावरुणा तुविजाता उरुक्षया|	our sages mitravaruṇa wide dominion strong by birth.
दक्षं दधाते अपसम|	vouchsafe us strength that worketh well.
कथा ते अग्ने शुचयन्त आयोर्ददाशुर्वाजेभिराशुषाणाः|	how agni have the radiant ones aspiring endued thee with the vigour of the living.
उभे यत तोके तनये दधाना रतस्य सामन रणयन्तदेवाः|	so that on both sides fostering seed and offspring the gods may joy in holy laws fulfilment.
बोधा मे अस्य वचसो यविष्ठ मंहिष्ठस्य परभ्र्तस्य सवधावः|	mark this my speech divine one thou most youthful offered to thee by him who gives most freely.
पीयति तवो अनु तवो गर्णाति वन्दारुस्ते तन्वं वन्देग्ने|	one hates thee and another sings thy praises i thine adorer laud thy form o agni.
ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरितादरक्षन|	thy guardian rays o agni when they saw him preserved blind māmateya from affliction.
ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः|	lord of all riches he preserved the pious the foes who fain would harm them did no mischief.
यो नो अग्ने अररिवानघायुररातीवा मर्चयति दवयेन|	the sinful man who worships not o agni who offering not harms us with doubledealing.
मन्त्रो गुरुः पुनरस्तु सो अस्मा अनु मर्क्षीष्ट तन्वं दुरुक्तैः|	be this in turn to him a heavy sentence may he distress himself by his revilings.
उत वा यः सहस्य परविद्वान मर्तो मर्तं मर्चयति दवयेन|	yea when a mortal knowingly o victor injures with double tongue a fellowmortal.
अतः पाहि सतवमान सतुवन्तमग्ने माकिर्नो दुरिताय धायीः|	from him praised agni save thou him that lauds thee bring us not into trouble and affliction.
तयं सु मेषं महया सवर्विदं शतं यस्य सुभ्वः साकमीरते|	i glorify that ram who finds the light of heaven whose hundred noblynatured ones go forth with him.
अत्यं न वाजं हवनस्यदं रथमेन्द्रं वव्र्त्यामवसे सुव्र्क्तिभिः|	with hymns may i turn hither indra to mine aidthe car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call.
स पर्वतो न धरुणेष्वच्युतः सहस्रमूतिस्तविषीषु वाव्र्धे|	like as a mountain on firm basis unremoved he thousandfold protector waxed in mighty strength.
इन्द्रो यद वर्त्रमवधीन नदीव्र्तमुब्जन्नर्णांसिजर्ह्र्षाणो अन्धसा|	when indra joying in the draughts of soma juice forced the clouds slaying vṛtra stayer of their flow.
स हि दवरो दवरिषु वव्र ऊधनि चन्द्रबुध्नो मदव्र्द्धो मनीषिभिः|	for he stays een the stayers spread oer laden cloud rooted in light strengthened in rapture by the wise.
इन्द्रं तमह्वे सवपस्यया धिया मंहिष्ठरातिं स हि पप्रिरन्धसः|	indra with thought with skilled activity i call most liberal giver for he sates him with the juice.
आ यं पर्णन्ति दिवि सद्मबर्हिषः समुद्रं न सुभ्वः सवा अभिष्टयः|	whom those that flow in heaven on sacred grass his own assistants noblynatured fill full like the sea.
तं वर्त्रहत्ये अनु तस्थुरूतयः शुष्मािन्द्रमवाता अह्रुतप्सवः|	beside that indra when he smote down vṛtra stood his helpers straight in form mighty invincible.
अभि सवव्र्ष्टिं मदे अस्य युध्यतो रघ्वीरिव परवणे सस्रुरूतयः|	to him as in wild joy he fought with him who stayed the rain his helpers sped like swift streams down a slope.
इन्द्रो यद वज्री धर्षमाणो अन्धसा भिनद वलस्य परिधीन्रिव तरितः|	when indra thunderarmed made bold by soma draughts as tṛta cleaveth valas fences cleft him through.
परीं घर्णा चरति तित्विषे शवोअपो वर्त्वी रजसो बुध्नमाशयत|	splendour encompassed thee forth shone thy warrior might the rainobstructer lay in midairs lowest deep.
वर्त्रस्य यत परवणे दुर्ग्र्भिश्वनो निजघन्थ हन्वोरिन्द्र तन्यतुम|	what time o indra thou didst cast thy thunder down upon the jaws of vṛitra hard to be restrained.
हरदं न हि तवा नय्र्षन्त्यूर्मयो बरह्माणीन्द्र तव यानि वर्धना|	the hymns which magnify thee indra reach to thee even as waterbrooks flow down and fill the lake.
तवष्टा चित ते युज्यं वाव्र्धे शवस्ततक्ष वज्रमभिभूत्योजसम|	tvaṣṭar gave yet more force to thine appropriate strength and forged thy thunderbolt of overpowering might.
जघन्वानु हरिभिः सम्भ्र्तक्रतविन्द्र वर्त्रं मनुषे गातुयन्नपः|	when indra thou whose power is linked with thy bay steeds hadst smitten vṛtra causing floods to flow for man.
अयछथा बाह्वोर्वज्रमायसमधारयो दिव्या सूर्यं दर्शे|	thou heldst in thine arms the metal thunderbolt and settest in the heaven the sun for all to see.
बर्हत सवश्चन्द्रममवद यदुक्थ्यमक्र्ण्वत भियसा रोहणं दिवः|	in fear they raised the lofty selfresplendent hymn praise giving and effectual leading up to heaven.
यन मानुषप्रधना इन्द्रमूतयः सवर्न्र्षाचो मरुतोअमदन्ननु|	when indras helpers fighting for the good of men the maruts faithful to mankind joyed in the light.
दयौश्चिदस्यामवानहेः सवनादयोयवीद भियसा वज्र इन्द्र ते|	then heaven himself the mighty at that dragons roar reeled back in terror when indra thy thunderbolt.
वर्त्रस्य यद बद्बधानस्य रोदसी मदे सुतस्य शवसाभिनच्छिरः|	in the wild joy of soma had struck off with might the head of vṛtra tyrant of the earth and heaven.
यदिन नविन्द्र पर्थिवी दशभुजिरहानि विश्वा ततनन्तक्र्ष्टयः|	o indra were this earth extended forth tenfold and men who dwell therein multiplied day by day.
अत्राह ते मघवन विश्रुतं सहो दयामनु शवसा बर्हणा भुवत|	still here thy conquering might maghavan would be famed it hath waxed vast as heaven in majesty and power.
तवमस्य पारे रजसो वयोमनः सवभूत्योजा अवसे धर्षन्मनः|	thou bold of heart in thine own native might for help upon the limit of this midair and of heaven.
चक्र्षे भूमिं परतिमानमोजसोअपः सवः परिभूरेष्या दिवम|	hast made the earth to be the pattern of thy strength embracing flood and light thou reachest to the sky.
तवं भुवः परतिमानं पर्थिव्या रष्ववीरस्य बर्हतः पतिर्भूः|	thou art the counterpart of earth the master of lofty heaven with all its mighty heroes.
विश्वमाप्रा अन्तरिक्षं महित्वा सत्यमद्धा नकिरन्यस्त्वावान|	thou hast filled all the region with thy greatness yea of a truth there is none other like thee.
न यस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी अनु वयचो न सिन्धवो रजसो अन्तमानशुः|	whose amplitude the heaven and earth have not attained whose bounds the waters of midair have never reached.
नोत सवव्र्ष्टिं मदे अस्य युध्यत एको अन्यच्चक्र्षे विश्वमानुषक|	not when in joy he fights the stayer of the rain thou and none else hast made all things in order due.
आर्चन्नत्र मरुतः सस्मिन्नाजौ विश्वे देवासो अमदन्ननुत्वा|	the maruts sang thy praise in this encounter and in thee all the deities delighted.
वर्त्रस्य यद भर्ष्टिमता वधेन नि तवमिन्द्र परत्यानं जघन्थ|	what time thou indra with thy spiky weapon thy deadly bolt smotest the face of vṛtra.
यद ध सया त इन्द्र शरुष्टिरस्ति यया बभूथ जरित्र्भ्य ऊती|	if indra thou hast given that gracious hearing where with thou helpest those who sang thy praises.
मा नः कामं महयन्तमा धग विश्वा ते अश्याम्पर्याप आयोः|	blast not the wish that would exalt us may i gain all from thee and pay all mans devotions.
न घा राजेन्द्र आ दभन नो या नु सवसारा कर्णवन्त योनौ|	let not the sovran indra disappoint us in what shall bring both sisters to our dwelling.
आपश्चिदस्मै सुतुका अवेषन गमन न इन्द्रः सख्या वयश्च|	to him have run the quickly flowing waters may indra come to us with life and friendship.
जेता नर्भिरिन्द्रः पर्त्सु शूरः शरोता हवं नाधमानस्य कारोः|	victorious with the men hero in battles indra who hears the singers supplication.
परभर्ता रथं दाशुष उपक उद्यन्त गिरो यदि च तमना भूत|	will bring his car nigh to the man who offers if he himself upholds the songs that praise him.
एवा नर्भिरिन्द्रः सुश्रवस्या परखादः पर्क्षो अभि मित्रिणो भूत|	yea indra with the men through love of glory consumes the sacred food which friends have offered.
समर्य इष सतवते विवाचि सत्राकरो यजमानस्यशंसः|	the everstrengthening song of him who worships is sung in fight amid the clash of voices.
तवया वयं मघवन्निन्द्र शत्रुनभि षयम महतो मन्यमनान|	aided by thee o maghavan o indra may we subdue our foes who count them mighty.
तवं तराता तवमु नो वर्धे भुर्वि|	be our protector strengthen and increase us may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
दिवश्चिदस्य वरिमा वि पप्रथ इन्द्रं न मह्ना पर्थिवीचन परति|	though een this heavens wide space and earth have spread them out nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness indras match.
भीमस्तुविष्माञ्चर्षणिभ्य आतपः शिशीते वज्रं तेजसे न वंसगः|	awful and very mighty causing woe to men he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness as a bull.
सो अर्णवो न नद्यः समुद्रियः परति गर्भ्णाति विश्रिता वरीमभिः|	like as the watery ocean so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width.
इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये वर्षायते सनात स युध्म ओजसा पनस्यते|	he bears him like a bull to drink of soma juice and will as warrior from of old be praised for might.
तवं तमिन्द्र पर्वतं न भोजसे महो नर्म्णस्य धर्मणामिरज्यसि|	thou swayest indra all kinds of great manly power so as to bend ast were even that famed mountain down.
पर वीर्येण देवताति चेकिते विश्वस्मा उग्रः कर्मणे पुरोहितः|	foremost among the gods is he through hero might set in the van the strong one for each arduous deed.
स इद वने नमस्युभिर्वचस्यते चारु जनेषु परब्रुवाण इन्द्रियम|	he only in the wood is praised by worshippers when he shows forth to men his own fair indrapower.
वर्षा छन्दुर्भवति हर्यतो वर्षा कषेमेण धेनाम्मघवा यदिन्वति|	a friendly bull is he a bull to be desired when maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice.
स इन महानि समिथानि मज्मना कर्णोति युध्म ओजसा जनेभ्यः|	yet verily the warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind.
अधा चन शरद दधति तविषीमत इन्द्राय वज्रं निघनिघ्नते वधम|	and men have faith in indra the resplendent one what time he hurleth down his bolt his dart of death.
स हि शरवस्युः सदनानि कर्त्रिमा कष्मया वर्धान ओजसाविनाशयन|	though fain for glory and with strength increased on earth he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art.
जयोतींषि कर्ण्वन्नव्र्काणि यज्यवेअव सुक्रतुः सर्तवा अपः सर्जत|	he makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure he bids exceeding wise the floods flow for his worshipper.
दानाय मनः सोमपावन्नस्तु तेअर्वाञ्चा हरी वन्दनश्रुदा कर्धि|	drinker of soma let thy heart incline to give bring thy bays hitherward o thou who hearest praise.
यमिष्ठासः सारथयो य इन्द्र ते न तवा केताा दभ्नुवन्ति भूर्णयः|	those charioteers of thine best skilled to draw the rein the rapid sunbeams indra lead thee not astray.
अप्रक्षितं वसु बिभर्षि हस्तयोरषाळ्हं सहस्तन्वि शरुतो दधे|	thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails the famed one in his body holds unvanquished might.
आव्र्तासोअवतासो न कर्त्र्भिस्तनूषु ते करतवैन्द्र भूरयः|	o indra in thy members many powers abide like wells surrounded by the ministering priests.
यं तवं रथमिन्द्र मेधसातयेअपाका सन्तमिषिर परणयसि परानवद्य नयसि|	the car which indra thou for service of the gods though it be far away o swift one bringest near which blameless one thou bringest near.
सद्यश्चित तमभिष्टये करो वशश्च वाजिनम|	place swiftly nigh us for our help be it thy will that it be strong.
सास्माकमनवद्य तूतुजान वेधसामिमां वाचं न वेधसाम|	blameless and active hear this speech of orderers this speech of us like orderers.
स शरुधि यः समा पर्तनासु कासु चिद दक्षाय्य इन्द्र भरहूतये नर्भिरसि परतूर्तये नर्भिः|	hear indra thou whom men in every fight must call to show thy strength for cry of battle with the men with men of war for victory.
यः शूरैः सवः सनिता यो विप्रैर्वाजं तरुता|	he who with heroes wins the light who with the singers gains the prize.
तमीशानास इरधन्त वाजिनं पर्क्षमत्यं न वाजिनम|	him the rich seek to gain even as a swift strong steed even as a courser fleet and strong.
दस्मो हि षमा वर्षणं पिन्वसि तवचं कं चिद यावीरररुं शूर मर्त्यं परिव्र्णक्षि मर्त्यम|	thou mighty pourest forth the hide that holds the rain thou keepest far away hero the wicked man thou shuttest out the wicked man.
इन्द्रोत तुभ्यं तद्दिवे तद रुद्राय सवयशसे|	indra to thee i sing to dyaus to rudra glorious in himself.
मित्राय वोचं वरुणाय सप्रथः सुम्र्ळीकाय सप्रथः|	to mitra varuṇa i sing a farfamed hymn to the kind god a farfamed hymn.
अस्माकं व इन्द्रमुश्मसीष्टये सखायं विश्वायुं परासहं युजं वाजेषु परासहं युजम|	we wish our indra here that he may further you the friend beloved of all the very strong ally in wars the very strong ally.
अस्माकंब्रह्मोत्येअवा पर्त्सुषु कासु चित|	in all encounters strengthen thou our prayer to be a help to us.
नहि तवा शत्रु सतरते सत्र्णोषि यंविश्वं शत्रुं सत्र्णोषि यम|	no enemywhom thou smitest downsubdueth thee no enemy whom thou smitest down.
नि षू नमातिमतिं कयस्य चित तेजिष्ठाभिररणिभिर्नोतिभिरुग्राभिरुग्रोतिभिः|	bow down the overweening pride of every foe with succour like to kindlingwood in fiercest flame with mighty succour mighty one.
नेषि णो यथा पुरानेनाः शूर मन्यसे|	guide us thou hero as of old so art thou counted blameless still.
विश्वानि पूरोरप पर्षि वह्निरासा वह्निर्नो अछ|	thou drivest as a priest all sins of man away as priest in person seeking us.
पर तद वोचेयं भव्यायेन्दवे हव्यो न य इषवान मन्म रेजति रक्षोहा मन्म रेजति|	this may i utter to the present somadrop which meet to be invoked with power awakes the prayer awakes the demonslaying prayer.
सवयं सो अस्मदा निदो वधैरजेत दुर्मतिम|	may he himself with darts of death drive far from us the scorners hate.
अव सरवेदघशंसोअवतरमव कषुद्रमिव सरवेत|	far let him flee away who speaketh wickedness and vanish like a mote of dust.
वनेम तद धोत्रया चितन्त्या वनेम रयिं रयिवः सुवीर्यं रण्वं सन्तं सुवीर्यम|	by thoughtful invocation this may we obtain obtain great wealth o wealthy one with hero sons wealth that is sweet with hero sons.
दुर्मन्मानं सुमन्तुभिरेमिषा पर्चीमहि|	him who is wroth we pacify with sacred food and eulogies.
आ सत्याभिरिन्द्रं दयुम्नहूतिभिर्यजत्रं दयुम्नहूतिभिः|	indra the holy with our calls inspired and true the holy one with calls inspired.
परपरा वो अस्मे सवयशोभिरूती परिवर्ग इन्द्रो दुर्मतीनां दरीमन दुर्मतीनाम|	on for your good and ours come indra with the aid of his own lordliness to drive the wicked hence to rend the evilhearted ones.
सवयं सा रिषयध्यै या न उपेषे अत्रैः|	the weapon which devouring fiends cast at us shall destroy themselves.
हतेमसन न वक्षति कषिप्ता जूर्णिर्न वक्षति|	struck down it shall not reach the mark hurled forth the firebrand shall not strike.
तवं न इन्द्र राया परीणसा याहि पथननेहसा पुरो याह्यरक्षसा|	with riches in abundance indra come to us come by an unobstructed path come by a path from demons free.
सचस्व नः पराक आ सचस्वास्तमीक आ|	be with us when we stray afar be with us when our home is nigh.
पाहि नो दूरादारादभिष्टिभिः सदा पाह्यभिष्टिभिः|	protect us with thy help both near and far away protect us ever with thy help.
तवं न इन्द्र राया तरूषसोग्रं चित तवा महिमा सक्षदवसे महे मित्रं नावसे|	thou art our own o indra with victorious wealth let might accompany thee the strong to give us aid like mitra to give mighty aid.
ओजिष्ठ तरातरविता रथं कं चिदमर्त्य|	o strongest saviour helper thou immortal of each warriors car.
अन्यमस्मद रिरिषेः कं चिदद्रिवो रिरिक्षन्तं चिदद्रिवः|	hurt thou another and not us o thunderarmed one who would hurt o thunderarmed.
पाहि न इन्द्र सुष्टुत सरिधोअवयाता सदमिद दुर्मतीनान्देवः सन दुर्मतीनाम|	save us from injury thou who art well extolled ever the warderoff art thou of wicked ones even as a god of wicked ones.
हन्ता पापस्य रक्षसस्त्राता विप्रस्य मावतः|	thou slayer of the evil fiend saviour of singer such as i.
अधा हि तवा जनिता जीजनद वसो रक्षोहणं तवा जीजनद वसो|	good lord the father made thee slayer of the fiends made thee good lord to slay the fiends.
कङकतो न कङकतोअथो सतीनकङकतः|	venomous slightly venomous or venomous aquatic worm.
दवाविति पलुषी इति नयद्र्ष्ट अलिप्सत|	both creatures stinging unobserved with poison have infected me.
अद्र्ष्टान हन्त्यायत्यथो हन्ति परायती|	coming it kills the unobserved it kills them as it goes away.
अथो अवघ्नती हन्त्यथो पिनष्टि पिंषती|	it kills them as it drives them off and bruising bruises them to death.
शरासः कुशरासो दर्भासः सैर्या उत|	sara grass darbha kuśara and sairya muñja vīraṇa.
मौञ्जा अद्र्ष्टा वैरिणाः सर्वे साकं नयलिप्सत|	where all these creatures dwell unseen with poison have infected me.
नि गावो गोष्ठे असदन नि मर्गासो अविक्षत|	the cows had settled in their stalls the beasts of prey had sought their lairs.
नि केतवो जनानां नयद्र्ष्टा अलिप्सत|	extinguished were the lights of men when things unseen infected me.
एत उ तये परत्यद्र्श्रन परदोषं तस्करा इव|	or these these reptiles are observed like lurking thieves at evening time.
अद्र्ष्टा विश्वद्र्ष्टाः परतिबुद्धा अभूतन|	seers of all themselves unseen be therefore very vigilant.
दयौर्वः पिता पर्थिवी माता सोमो भरातादितिः सवसा|	heaven is your sire your mother earth soma your brother aditi.
अद्र्ष्टा विश्वद्र्ष्टास्तिष्ठतेलयता सु कम|	your sister seeing all unseen keep still and dwell ye happily.
ये अंस्या ये अङगयाः सूचीका ये परकङकताः|	biters of shoulder or of limb with needlestings most venomous.
अद्र्ष्टाः किं चनेह वः सर्वे साकं नि जस्यत|	unseen whatever ye may be vanish together and be gone.
उत पुरस्तात सूर्य एति विश्वद्र्ष्टो अद्र्ष्टहा|	slayer of things unseen the sun beheld of all mounts eastward up.
अद्र्ष्टान सर्वाञ जम्भयन सर्वाश्च यातुधान्यः|	consuming all that are not seen and evil spirits of the night.
उदपप्तदसौ सूर्यः पुरु विश्वानि जूर्वन|	there hath the sungod mounted up who scorches much and everything.
आदित्यः पर्वतेभ्यो विश्वद्र्ष्टो अद्र्ष्टहा|	even the Āditya from the hills allseen destroying things unseen.
सूर्ये विषमा सजामि दर्तिं सुरावतो गर्हे|	i hang the poison in the sun a wineskin in a vintners house.
सो चिन नु नमराति नो वयं मरामारे अस्य योजनं हरिष्ठा मधु तवामधुला चकार|	he will not die nor shall we die his path is far he whom bay horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.
इयत्तिका शकुन्तिका सका जघास ते विषम|	this little bird so very small hath swallowed all thy poison up.
सो चिन नु|	she will not die nor shall we die his path is far he whom bay horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.
तरिः सप्त विष्पुलिङगका विषस्य पुष्यमक्षन|	the threetimesseven bright sparks of fire have swallowed up the poisons strength.
ताश्चिन्नु न मरन्ति नो वयं म|	they will not die nor shall we die his path is far he whom bay horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.
नवानां नवतीनां विषस्य रोपुषीणाम|	of ninety rivers and of nine with power to stay the venoms course.
सर्वासामग्रभं नामारे अस्य यो|	the names of all i have secured his path is far he whom bay horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.
तरिः सप्त मयूर्यः सप्त सवसारो अग्रुवः|	so have the peahens threetimesseven so have the maiden sisters seven.
तास्ते विषं वि जभ्रिर उदकं कुम्भिनीरिव|	carried thy venom far away as girls bear water in their jars.
इयत्तकः कुषुम्भकस्तकं भिनद्म्यश्मना|	the poisoninsect is so small i crush the creature with a stone.
ततो विषं पर वाव्र्ते पराचीरनु संवतः|	i turn the poison hence away departed unto distant lands.
कुषुम्भकस्तदब्रवीद गिरेः परवर्तमानकः|	forth issuing from the mountains side the poisoninsect spake and said.
वर्श्चिकस्यारसं विषमरसं वर्श्चिक ते विषम|	scorpion they venom is but weak.
इन्द्रो मदाय वाव्र्धे शवसे वर्त्रहा नर्भिः|	the men have lifted indra up the vṛtra slayer to joy and strength.
तमिन महत्स्वाजिषूतेमर्भे हवामहे स वाजेषु पर नोअविषत|	him verily we invocate in battles whether great or small be he our aid in deeds of might.
असि हि वीर सेन्योअसि भूरि पराददिः|	thou hero art a warrior thou art giver of abundant spoil.
असि दभ्रस्य चिद्व्र्धो यजमानाय शिक्षसि सुन्वते भूरि ते वसु|	strengthening een the feeble thou aidest the sacrificer thou givest the offerer ample wealth.
यदुदीरत आजयो धर्ष्णवे धीयते धना|	when war and battles are on foot booty is laid before the bold.
युक्ष्वा मदच्युता हरी कं हनः कं वसौ दधोअस्मानिन्द्र वसौ दधः|	yoke thou thy wildlyrushing bays whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich do thou o indra make us rich.
करत्वामहाननुष्वधं भीम आ वाव्र्धे शवः|	mighty through wisdom as he lists terrible he hath waxed in strength.
शरियर्ष्व उपाकयोर्नि शिप्री हरिवान दधे हस्तयोर्वज्रमायसम|	lord of bay steeds strongjawed sublime he in joined hands for glorys sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt.
आ पप्रौ पार्थिवं रजो बद्बधे रोचना दिवि|	he filled the earthly atmosphere and pressed against the lights in heaven.
न तवावानिन्द्र कश्चन न जातो न जनिष्यतेअति विश्वं ववक्षिथ|	none like thee ever hath been born none indra will be born like thee thou hast waxed mighty over all.
यो अर्यो मर्तभोजनं पराददाति दाशुषे|	may he who to the offerer gives the foemans mansustaining food.
इन्द्रो अस्मभ्यंशिक्षतु वि भजा भूरि ते वसु भक्षीय तव राधसः|	may indra lend his aid to us deal forthabundant is thy wealththat in thy bounty i may share.
मदेमदे हि नो ददिर्यूथा गवां रजुक्रतुः|	he righteoushearted at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine.
सं गर्भायपुरू शतोभयाहस्त्या वसु शिशीहि राय आ भर|	gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts sharpen thou us and bring us wealth.
मादयस्व सुते सचा शवसे शूर राधसे|	refresh thee hero with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength.
विद्मा हि तवापुरूवसुमुप कामान सस्र्ज्महेअथा नोअविता भव|	we know thee lord of ample store to thee have sent our hearts desires be therefore our protector thou.
एते त इन्द्र जन्तवो विश्वं पुष्यन्ति वार्यम|	these people indra keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice.
अन्तर्हि खयोजनानामर्यो वेदो अदाशुषां तेषां नो वेद आ भर|	discover thou as lord the wealth of men who offer up no gifts bring thou to us this wealth of theirs.
यत्र गरावा पर्थुबुध्न ऊर्ध्वो भवति सोतवे|	there where the broadbased stone raised on high to press the juices out.
उलूखलसुतानामवेद विन्द्र जल्गुलः|	o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.
यत्र दवाविव जघनाधिषवण्या कर्ता|	where like broad hips to hold the juice the platters of the press are laid.
उलू|	o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.
यत्र नार्यपच्यवमुपच्यवं च शिक्षते|	there where the woman marks and leans the pestles constant rise and fall.
उलू|	o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.
यत्र मन्थां विबध्नते रश्मीन यमितवा इव|	where as with reins to guide a horse they bind the churningstaff with cords.
उलू|	o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.
यच्चिद धि तवं गर्हेग्र्ह उलूखलक युज्यसे|	if of a truth in every house o mortar thou art set for work.
इह दयुमत्तमं वद यजतामिव दुन्दुभिः|	here give thou forth thy clearest sound loud as the drum of conquerors.
उत सम ते वनस्पते वातो वि वात्यग्रमित|	o sovran of the forest as the wind blows soft in front of thee.
अथो इन्द्राय पातवे सुनु सोममुलूखल|	mortar for indra press thou forth the soma juice that he may drink.
आयजी वाजसातमा ता हयुच्चा विजर्भ्र्तः|	best strengthgivers ye stretch wide jaws o sacrificial implements.
हरी इवान्धांसि बप्सता|	like two bay horses champing herbs.
ता नो अद्य वनस्पती रष्वाव रष्वेभिः सोत्र्भिः|	ye sovrans of the forest both swift with swift pressers press today.
इन्द्राय मधुमत सुतम|	sweet soma juice for indras drink.
उच्छिष्टं चम्वोर्भर सोमं पवित्र आ सर्ज|	take up in beakers what remains the soma on the filter pour.
नि धेहि गोरधि तवचि|	and on the oxhide set the dregs.
एष पर पूर्वीरव तस्य चम्रिषोअत्यो न योषामुदयंस्त भुर्वणिः|	for this mans full libations held in ladles he hath roused him eager as a horse to meet the mare.
दक्षं महे पाययते हिरण्ययं रथमाव्र्त्या हरियोगं रभ्वसम|	he stays his golden car yoked with bay horses swift and drinks the soma juice which strengthens for great deeds.
तं गूर्तयो नेमन्निषः परीणसः समुद्रं न संचरणे सनिष्यवः|	to him the guidancefollowing songs of praise flow full as those who seek gain go in company to the flood.
पतिं दक्षस्य विदथस्य नू सहो गिरिं न वेना अधि रोह तेजसा|	to him the lord of power the holy synods might as to a hill with speed ascend the loving ones.
स तुर्वणिर्महानरेणु पौंस्ये गिरेर्भ्र्ष्टिर्न भराजते तुजा शवः|	victorious great is he in manly battle shines unstained with dust his might as shines a mountain peak.
येन शुष्णं मायिनमायसो मदे दुध्राभूषु रामयन नि दामनि|	wherewith the iron one fierce een against the strong in rapture fettered wily Śushṇa fast in bonds.
देवी यदि तविषी तवाव्र्धोतय इन्द्रं सिषक्त्युषसं न सूर्यः|	when strength the goddess made more strong for help by thee waits upon indra as the sun attends the dawn.
यो धर्ष्णुना शवसा बाधते तम इयर्ति रेणुं बर्हदर्हरिष्वणिः|	then he who with his might unflinching kills the gloom stirs up the dust aloft with joy and triumphing.
वि यत तिरो धरुणमच्युतं रजोअतिष्ठिपो दिव आतासुबर्हणा|	when thou with might upon the framework of the heaven didst fix across airs region firmly unremoved.
सवर्मीळ्हे यन मद इन्द्र हर्ष्याहन वर्त्रं निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम|	in the lightwinning war indra in rapturous joy thou smotest vṛtra dead and broughtest floods of rain.
तवं दिवो धरुणं धिष ओजसा पर्थिव्या इन्द्र सदनेषु माहिनः|	thou with thy might didst grasp the holderup of heaven thou who art mighty also in the seats of earth.
तवं सुतस्य मदे अरिणा अपो वि वर्त्रस्य समया पाष्यारुजः|	thou gladdened by the juice hast set the waters free and broken vṛtras stony fences through and through.
वेदिषदे परियधामाय सुद्युते धासिम इव पर भरा योनिम अग्नये|	to splendid agni seated by the altar loving well his home i bring the food as twere his place of birth.
वस्त्रेणेव वासया मन्मना शुचिं जयोतीरथं शुक्रवर्णं तमोहनम|	i clothe the bright one with my hymn as with a robe him with the car of light brighthued dispelling gloom.
अभि दविजन्मा तरिव्र्दन्नं रज्यते संवत्सरे वाव्र्धे जग्धमी पुनः|	child of a double birth he grasps at triple food in the years course what he hath swallowed grows anew.
अन्यस्यासा जिह्वय जेन्यो वर्षा नयन्येन वनिनोम्र्ष्ट वरणः|	he by anothers mouth and tongue a noble bull with other as an elephant consumes the trees.
कर्ष्णप्रुतौ वेविजे अस्य सक्षिता उभा तरेते अभि मतरा शिशुम|	the pair who dwell together moving in the dark bestir themselves both parents hasten to the babe.
पराचजिह्वं धवसयन्तं तर्षुच्युतमा साच्यं कुपयं वर्धनं पितुः|	impetuoustongued destroying springing swiftly forth one to be watched and cherished strengthener of his sire.
मुमुक्ष्वो मनवे मनवस्यते रघुद्रुवः कर्ष्णसीतास ऊ जुवः|	for man thou friend of men these steeds of thine are yoked impatient lightly running ploughing blackened lines.
असमना अजिरासो रघुष्यदो वातजूता उप युज्यन्त आशवः|	discordantminded fleet gliding with easy speed urged onward by the wind and rapid in their course.
आदस्य ते धवसयन्तो वर्थेरते कर्ष्णमभ्वं महि वर्पःकरिक्रतः|	dispelling on their way the horror of black gloom making a glorious show these flames of his fly forth.
यत सीं महीमवनिं पराभि मर्म्र्शदभिश्वसन सतनयन्नेति नानदत|	when oer the spacious tract he spreads himself abroad and rushes panting on with thunder and with roar.
भूषन न योअधि बभ्रूषु नम्नते वर्षेव पत्नीरभ्येति रोरुवत|	amid brown plants he stoops as if adorning them and rushes bellowing like a bull upon his wives.
ओजायमानस्तन्वश्च शुम्भते भीमो न शर्न्गादविधव दुर्ग्र्भिः|	proving his might he decks the glory of his form and shakes his horns like one terrific hard to stay.
स संस्तिरो विष्टिरः सं गर्भयति जनन्नेव जानतीर्नित्य आ शये|	now covered now displayed he grasps as one who knows his restingplace in those who know him well.
पुनर्वर्धन्ते अपि यन्ति देव्यमन्यद वर्पः पित्रोः कर्ण्वते सचा|	a second time they wax and gather godlike power and blending both together change their parents form.
तमग्रुवः केशिनीः सं हि रेभिर ऊर्ध्वास्तस्थुर्मम्रुषीः परायवे पुनः|	the maidens with long tresses hold him in embrace dead they rise up again to meet the living one.
तासां जरां परमुञ्चन्नेति नानददसुं परं जनयञ जीवमस्त्र्तम|	releasing them from age with a loud roar he comes filling them with new spirit living unsubdued.
अधीवसं परि मतु रिहन्नह तुविग्रेभिः सत्वभिर्याति वि जरयः|	licking the mantle of the mother far and wide he wanders over fields with beasts that flee apace.
वयो दधत पद्वते रेरिहत सदानु शयेनी सचतेवर्तनीरह|	strengthening all that walk licking up all around a blackened path forsooth he leaves whereer he goes.
अस्माकमग्ने मघवत्सु दीदिह्यध शवसीवान वर्षभो दमूनाः|	o agni shine resplendent with our wealthy chiefs like a loudsnorting bull accustomed to the house.
अवास्या शिशुमतीरदीदेर्वर्मेव युत्सु परिजर्भुराणः|	thou casting off thine infant wrappings blazest forth as though thou hadst put on a coat of mail for war.
इदमग्ने सुधितं दुर्धितादधि परियादु चिन मन्मनः परेयो अस्तु ते|	may this our perfect prayer be dearer unto thee than an imperfect prayer although it please thee well.
यत ते शुक्रं तन्वो रोचते शुचि तेनास्मभ्यंवनसे रत्नमा तवम|	with the pure brilliancy that radiates from thy form mayest thou grant to us abundant store of wealth.
रथाय नावमुत नो गर्हाय नित्यारित्रां पद्वतीं रास्यग्ने|	grant to our chariot to our house o agni a boat with moving feet and constant oarage.
अस्माकं वीरानुत नो मघोनो जनांश्च या पारयाच्छर्म या च|	one that may further well our wealthy princes and all the folk and be our certain refuge.
अभी नो अग्न उक्थमिज्जुगुर्या दयावाक्षामा सिन्धवश्च सवगूर्ताः|	welcome our laud with thine approval agni may earth and heaven and freely flowing rivers.
गव्यं यव्यं यन्तो दीर्घाहेषं वरमरुण्यो वरन्त|	yield us long life and food and corn and cattle and may the red dawns choose for us their choicest.
सह वामेन न उषो वयुछा दुहितर्दिवः|	dawn on us with prosperity o uṣas daughter of the sky.
सह दयुम्नेन बर्हता विभावरि राया देवि दास्वती|	dawn with great glory goddess lady of the light dawn thou with riches bounteous one.
अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्विश्वसुविदो भूरि चयवन्त वस्तवे|	they bringing steeds and kine boongivers of all wealth have oft sped forth to lighten us.
उदीरय परति मा सून्र्ता उषश्चोद राधो मघोनाम|	o uṣas waken up for me the sounds of joy send us the riches of the great.
उवासोषा उछाच्च नु देवी जीरा रथानाम|	uṣas hath dawned and now shall dawn the goddess driver forth of cars.
ये अस्या आचरणेषु दध्रिरे समुद्रे न शरवस्यवः|	which as she cometh nigh have fixed their thought on her like gloryseekers on the flood.
उषो ये ते पर यामेषु युञ्जते मनो दानाय सूरयः|	here kaṇva chief of kaṇvas race sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes names.
अत्राह तत कण्व एषां कण्वतमो नाम गर्णाति नर्णाम|	the princes who o uṣas as thou comest near direct their thoughts to liberal gifts.
आ घा योषेव सूनर्युषा याति परभुञ्जती|	like a good matron uṣas comes carefully tending everything.
जरयन्ती वर्जनं पद्वदीयत उत पातयति पक्षिणः|	rousing all life she stirs all creatures that have feet and makes the birds of air fly up.
वि या सर्जति समनं वयर्थिनः पदां न वेत्योदती|	she sends the busy forth each man to his pursuit delay she knows not as she springs.
वयो नकिष टे पप्तिवांस आसते वयुष्टौ वाजिनीवति|	o rich in opulence after thy dawning birds that have flown forth no longer rest.
एषायुक्त परावतः सूर्यस्योदयनादधि|	this dawn hath yoked her steeds afar beyond the rising of the sun.
शतं रथेभिः सुभगोषा इयं वि यात्यभि मानुषान|	borne on a hundred chariots she auspicious dawn advances on her way to men.
विश्वमस्या नानाम चक्षसे जगज्ज्योतिष कर्णोति सूनरी|	to meet her glance all living creatures bend them down excellent one she makes the light.
अप दवेषो मघोनी दुहिता दिव उषा उछदप सरिधः|	uṣas the daughter of the sky the opulent shines foes and enmities away.
उष आ भाहि भानुना चन्द्रेण दुहितर्दिवः|	shine on us with thy radiant light o uṣas daughter of the sky.
आवहन्ती भूर्यस्मभ्यं सौभगं वयुछन्ती दिविष्टिषु|	bringing to us great store of high felicity and beaming on our solemn rites.
विश्वस्य हि पराणनं जीवनं तवे वि यदुछसि सूनरि|	for in thee is each living creatures breath and life when excellent thou dawnest forth.
सा नो रथेन बर्हता विभावरि शरुधि चित्रामघे हवम|	borne on thy lofty car o lady of the light hear thou of wondrous wealth our call.
उषो वाजं हि वंस्व यश्चित्रो मानुषे जने|	o uṣas win thyself the strength which among men is wonderful.
तेना वह सुक्र्तो अध्वरानुप ये तवा गर्णन्ति वह्नयः|	bring thou thereby the pious unto holy rites those who as priests sing praise to thee.
विश्वान देवाना वह सोमपीतयेअन्तरिक्षादुषस्त्वम|	bring from the firmament o uṣas all the gods that they may drink our soma juice.
सास्मासु धा गोमदश्वावदुक्थ्यमुषो वाजं सुवीर्यम|	and being what thou art vouchsafe us kine and steeds strength meet for praise and hero might.
यस्या रुशन्तो अर्चयः परति भद्रा अद्र्क्षत|	may uṣas whose auspicious rays are seen resplendent round about.
सा नो रयिं विश्ववारं सुपेशसमुषा ददातु सुग्म्यम|	grant us great riches fair in form of all good things wealth which light labour may attain.
ये चिद धि तवां रषयः पूर्व ऊतये जुहूरेअवसे महि|	mighty one whom the Ṛṣis of old time invoked for their protection and their help.
सा न सतोमानभि गर्णीहि राधसोषः शुक्रेण शोचिषा|	o uṣas graciously answer our songs of praise with bounty and with brilliant light.
उषो यदद्य भानुना वि दवाराव रणवो दिवः|	uṣas as thou with light to day hast opened the twin doors of heaven.
पर नो यछतादव्र्कं पर्थु छर्दिः पर देवि गोमतीरिषः|	so grant thou us a dwelling wide and free from foes o goddess give us food with kine.
सं नो राया बर्हता विश्वपेशसा मिमिक्ष्वा समिळाभिरा|	bring us to wealth abundant sent in every shape to plentiful refreshing food.
सं दयुम्नेन विश्वतुरोषो महि सं वाजैर्वाजिनीवति|	to allsubduing splendour uṣas mighty one to strength thou rich in spoil and wealth.
मा नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुरिन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतः परिख्यन|	slight us not varuṇa aryaman or mitra Ṛbhukṣan indra Āyu or the maruts.
यद वाजिनो देवजतस्य सप्तेः परवक्ष्यामो विदथे वीर्याणि|	when we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong steed goddescended.
यन निर्णिजा रेक्णसा पराव्र्तस्य रतिं गर्भीतां मुखतो नयन्ति|	what time they bear before the courser covered with trappings and with wealth the grasped oblation.
सुप्रनजो मेम्यद विश्वरूप इन्द्रापूष्णोः परियमप्येति पाथः|	the dappled goat goeth straightforward bleating to the place dear to indra and to pūṣan.
एष छागः पुरो अश्वेन वाजिना पूष्णो भागो नीयते विश्वदेव्यः|	dear to all gods this goat the share of pūṣan is first led forward with the vigorous courser.
अभिप्रियं यत पुरोळाशमर्वता तवष्टेदेनं सौश्रवसाय जिन्वति|	while tvaṣṭar sends him forward with the charger acceptable for sacrifice to glory.
यद धविष्यं रतुशो देवयानं तरिर्मानुषाः पर्यश्वं नयन्ति|	when thrice the men lead round the steed in order who goeth to the gods as meet oblation.
अत्रा पूष्णः परथमो भाग एति यज्ञं देवेभ्यः परतिवेदयन्नजः|	the goat precedeth him the share of pūṣan and to the gods the sacrifice announceth.
होताध्वर्युरावया अग्निमिन्धो गरावग्राभ उत शंस्ता सुविप्रः|	invoker ministering priest atoner firekindler somapresser sage reciter.
तेन यज्ञेन सवरंक्र्तेन सविष्टेन वक्षणा आप्र्णध्वम|	with this well ordered sacrifice well finished do ye fill full the channels of the rivers.
यूपव्रस्का उत ये यूपवाहाश्चषालं ये अश्वयूपाय तक्षति|	the hewers of the post and those who carry it and those who carve the knob to deck the horses stake.
ये चार्वते पचनं सम्भरन्त्युतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु|	those who prepare the cookingvessels for the steedmay the approving help of these promote our work.
उप परागात सुमन मेअधायि मन्म देवानामाशा उप वीतप्र्ष्ठः|	forth for the regions of the gods the charger with his smooth back is come my prayer attends him.
अन्वेनं विप्रा रषयो मदन्ति देवानां पुष्टे चक्र्मा सुबन्धुम|	in him rejoice the singers and the sages a good friend have we won for the gods banquet.
यद वाजिनो दाम सुन्दानमर्वतो या शीर्षण्या रशनारज्जुरस्य|	may the fleet coursers halter and his heelropes the headstall and the girths and cords about him.
यद वा घास्य परभ्र्तमास्ये तर्णं सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु|	and the grass put within his mouth to bait himamong the gods too let all these be with thee.
यदश्वस्य करविषो मक्षिकाश यद वा सवरौ सवधितौ रिप्तमस्ति|	what part of the steeds flesh the fly hath eaten or is left sticking to the post or hatchet.
यद धस्तयोः शमितुर्यन नखेषु सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु|	or to the slayers hands and nails adherethamong the gods too may all this be with thee.
यदूवध्यमुदरस्यापवाति य आमस्य करविषो गन्धो अस्ति|	food undigested steaming from his belly and any odour of raw flesh remaining.
सुक्र्ता तच्छमितारः कर्ण्वन्तूत मेधं शर्तपाकं पचन्तु|	this let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice with perfect cooking.
यत ते गात्रादग्निना पच्यमानादभि शूलं निहतस्यावधावति|	what from thy body which with fire is roasted when thou art set upon the spit distilleth.
मा तद भूम्यामा शरिषन मा तर्णेषु देवेभ्यस्तदुशद्भ्यो रातमस्तु|	let not that lie on earth or grass neglected but to the longing gods let all be offered.
ये वाजिनं परिपश्यन्ति पक्वं य ईमाहुः सुरभिर्निर्हरेति|	they who observing that the horse is ready call out and say the smell is good remove it.
ये चार्वतो मांसभिक्षामुपासत उतो तेषामभिगूर्तिर्न इन्वतु|	and craving meat await the distributionmay their approving help promote labour.
यन नीक्षणं मांस्पचन्या उखाया या पात्राणि यूष्णासेचनानि|	the trialfork of the fleshcooking caldron the vessels out of which the broth is sprinkled.
ऊष्मण्यापिधाना चरूणामङकाः सूनाःपरि भूषन्त्यश्वम|	the warmingpots the covers of the dishes hooks carvingboardsall these attend the charger.
निक्रमणं निषदनं विवर्तनं यच्च पड्बीशमर्वतः|	the startingplace his place of rest and rolling the ropes wherewith the chargers feet were fastened.
यच्च पपौ यच्च घासिं जघास सर्वा ता ते अपि देवेष्वस्तु|	the water that he drank the food he tastedamong the gods too may all these attend thee.
मा तवाग्निर्ध्वनयीद धूमगन्धिर्मोखा भराजन्त्यभि विक्त जघ्रिः|	let not the fire smokescented make thee crackle nor glowing caldron smell and break to pieces.
इष्टं वीतमभिगूर्तं वषट्क्र्तं तं देवासः परति गर्भ्णन्त्यश्वम|	offered beloved approved and consecratedsuch charger do the gods accept with favour.
यदश्वाय वास उपस्त्र्णन्त्यधीवासं या हिरण्यान्यस्मै|	the robe they spread upon the horse to clothe him the upper covering and the golden trappings.
सन्दानमर्वन्तं पड्बीशं परिया देवेष्वा यामयन्ति|	the halters which restrain the steed the heelropesall these as grateful to the gods they offer.
यत ते सादे महसा शूक्र्तस्य पार्ष्ण्या वा कशया वा तुतोद|	if one when seated with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee.
सरुचेव ता हविषो अध्वरेषु सर्वा ता ते बरह्मणासूदयामि|	all these thy woes as with the oblations ladle at sacrifices with my prayer i banish.
चतुस्त्रिंशद वाजिनो देवबन्धोर्वङकरीरश्वस्य सवधितिःसमेति|	the fourandthirty ribs of the swift charger kin to the gods the slayers hatchet pierces.
अछिद्रा गात्रा वयुना कर्णोत परुषपरुरनुघुष्य वि शस्त|	cut ye with skill so that the parts be flawless and piece by piece declaring them dissect them.
एकस्त्वष्तुरश्वस्या विशस्ता दवा यन्तारा भवतस्तथर्तुः|	of tvaṣṭars charger there is one dissectorthis is the customtwo there are who guide him.
या ते गात्राणां रतुथा कर्णोमि ताता पिण्डनां पर जुहोम्यग्नौ|	such of his limbs as i divide in order these amid the balls in fire i offer.
मा तवा तपत परिय आत्मापियन्तं मा सवधितिस्तन्व आ तिष्ठिपत ते|	let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest let not the hatchet linger in thy body.
मा ते गर्ध्नुरविशस्तातिहाय छिद्रा गात्रण्यसिना मिथू कः|	let not a greedy clumsy immolator missing the joints mangle thy limbs unduly.
न वा उ एतन मरियसे न रिष्यसि देवानिदेषि पथिभिः सुगेभिः|	no here thou diest not thou art not injured by easy paths unto the gods thou goest.
हरी ते युञ्जा पर्षती अभूतामुपास्थाद वाजी धुरि रासभस्य|	both bays both spotted mares are now thy fellows and to the asss pole is yoked the charger.
सुगव्यं नो वाजी सवश्व्यं पुंसः पुत्रानुत विश्वापुषं रयिम|	may this steed bring us allsustaining riches wealth in good kine good horses manly offspring.
अनागास्त्वं नो अदितिः कर्णोतु कषत्रं नो अश्वो वनतां हविष्मान|	freedom from sin may aditi vouchsafe us the steed with our oblations gain us lordship.
इन्द्रेहि मत्स्यन्धसो विश्वेभिः सोमपर्वभिः|	come indra and delight thee with the juice at all the soma feasts.
महानभिष्टिरोजसा|	protector mighty in thy strength.
एमेनं सर्जता सुते मन्दिमिन्द्राय मन्दिने|	to indra pour ye forth the juice the active gladdening juice to him.
चक्रिं विश्वानि चक्रये|	the gladdening omnific god.
मत्स्वा सुशिप्र मन्दिभिः सतोमेभिर्विश्वचर्षणे|	o lord of all men fair of cheek rejoice thee in the gladdening lauds.
सचैषुसवनेष्वा|	present at these drinkofferings.
अस्र्ग्रमिन्द्र ते गिरः परति तवामुदहासत|	songs have outpoured themselves to thee indra the strong the guardian lord.
अजोषा वर्षभं पतिम|	and raised themselves unsatisfied.
सं चोदय चित्रमर्वाग राध इन्द्र वरेण्यम|	send to us bounty manifold o indra worthy of our wish.
असदित ते विभु परभु|	for power supreme is only thine.
अस्मान सु तत्र चोदयेन्द्र राये रभस्वतः|	o indra stimulate thereto us emulously fain for wealth.
तुविद्युम्न यशस्वतः|	and glorious o most splendid one.
सं गोमदिन्द्र वाजवदस्मे पर्थु शरवो बर्हत|	give indra wide and lofty fame wealthy in cattle and in strength.
विश्वायुर्धेह्यक्षितम|	lasting our lifetime failing not.
अस्मे धेहि शरवो बर्हद दयुम्नं सहस्रसातमम|	grant us high fame o indra grant riches bestowing thousands those.
इन्द्र ता रथिनीरिषः|	fair fruits of earth borne home in wains.
वसोरिन्द्रं वसुपतिं गीर्भिर्ग्र्णन्त रग्मियम|	praising with songs the praiseworthy who cometh to our aid we call.
होम गन्तारमूतये|	indra the treasurelord of wealth.
सुतेसुते नयोकसे बर्हद बर्हत एदरिः|	to lofty indra dweller by each libation the pious man.
इन्द्राय शूषमर्चति|	sings forth aloud a strengthening hymn.
आ चर्षणिप्रा वर्षभो जनानां राजा कर्ष्टीनां पुरुहूत इन्द्रः|	the bull of men who cherishes all people king of the races indra called of many.
सतुतः शरवस्यन्नवसोप मद्रिग युक्त्वा हरीव्र्षणा याह्यर्वां|	fameloving praised hither to me with succour turn having yoked both vigorous bay horses.
ये ते वर्षणो वर्षभास इन्द्र बरह्मयुजो वर्षरथासो अत्याः|	thy mighty stallions yoked by prayer o indra thy coursers to thy mighty chariot harnessed.
ताना तिष्ठ तेभिरा याह्यर्वां हवामहे तवा सुत इन्द्र सोमे|	ascend thou these and borne by them come hither with soma juice outpoured indra we call thee.
आ तिष्ठ रथं वर्षणं वर्षा ते सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि|	ascend thy mighty car the mighty soma is poured for thee and sweets are sprinkled round us.
युक्त्वा वर्षभ्यां वर्षभ कषितीनां हरिभ्यां याहि परवतोप मद्रिक|	come down to usward bull of human races come having harnessed them with strong bay horses.
अयं यज्ञो देवया अयं मियेध इमा बरह्मण्ययमिन्द्र सोमः|	here is godreaching sacrifice here the victim here indra are the prayers here is the soma.
सतीर्णं बर्हिरा तु शक्र पर याहि पिबा निषद्यवि मुचा हरी इह|	strewn is the sacred grass come hither Śakra seat thee and drink unyoke thy two bay coursers.
ओ सुष्टुत इन्द्र याह्यर्वां उप बरह्माणि मान्यस्य कारोः|	come to us indra come thou highly lauded to the devotions of the singer māna.
विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गर्णन्तो वि|	singing may we find early through thy succour may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
आ वां रथं पुरुमायं मनोजुवं जीराश्वं यज्ञियं जीवसे हुवे|	hither that i may live i call unto the feast your wondrous car thoughtswift borne on by rapid steeds.
सहस्रकेतुं वनिनं शतद्वसुं शरुष्टीवानं वरिवोधामभि परयः|	with thousand banners hundred treasures pouring gifts promptly obedient bestowing ample room.
ऊर्ध्वा धीतिः परत्यस्य परयामन्यधायि शस्मन समयन्त आ दिशः|	even as it moveth near my hymn is lifted up and all the regions come together to sing praise.
सवदामि घर्मं परति यन्त्यूतय आ वामूर्जानी रथमश्विनारुहत|	i sweeten the oblations now the helpers come Ūrjānī hath o aśvins mounted on your car.
सं यन मिथः पस्प्र्धानासो अग्मत शुभे मखा अमिता जायवो रणे|	when striving man with man for glory they have met brisk measureless eager for victory in fight.
युवोरह परवणे चेकिते रथो यदश्विना वहथः सूरिमा वरम|	then verily your car is seen upon the slope when ye o aśvins bring some choice boon to the prince.
युवं भुज्युं भुरमाणं विभिर्गतं सवयुक्तिभिर्निवहन्ता पित्र्भ्य आ|	ye came to bhujyu while he struggled in the flood with flying birds selfyoked ye bore him to his sires.
यासिष्टं वर्तिर्व्र्षणा विजेन्यं दिवोदासाय महि चेति वामवः|	ye went to the fardistant home o mighty ones and famed is your great aid to divodāsa given.
युवोरश्विना वपुषे युवायुजं रथं वाणी येमतुरस्य शर्ध्यम|	aśvins the car which you had yoked for glorious show your own two voices urged directed to its goal.
आ वां पतित्वं सख्याय जग्मुषी योषाव्र्णीतजेन्या युवां पती|	then she who came for friendship maid of noble birth elected you as husbands you to be her lords.
युवं रेभं परिषूतेरुरुष्यथो हिमेन घर्मं परितप्तमत्रये|	rebha ye saved from tyranny for atris sake ye quenched with cold the fiery pit that compassed him.
युवं शयोरवसं पिप्यथुर्गवि पर दीर्घेण वन्दनस्तार्यायुषा|	ye made the cow of Śayu stream refreshing milk and vandana was holpen to extended life.
युवं वन्दनं निर्र्तं जरण्यया रथं न दस्रा करणा समिन्वथः|	doers of marvels skilful workers ye restored vandana like a car worn out with length of days.
कषेत्रादा विप्रं जनथो विपन्यया पर वामत्र विधते दंसना भुवत|	from earth ye brought the sage to life in wondrous mode be your great deeds done here for him who honours you.
अगछतं कर्पमाणं परावति पितुः सवस्य तयजसा निबाधितम|	ye went to him who mourned in a far distant place him who was left forlorn by treachery of his sire.
सवर्वतीरित ऊतीर्युवोरह चित्रा अभीके अभवन्नभिष्टयः|	rich with the light of heaven was then the help ye gave and marvellous your succour when ye stood by him.
उत सया वां मधुमन मक्षिकारपन मदे सोमस्यौशिजो हुवन्यति|	to you in praise of sweetness sang the honeybee auśija calleth you in somas rapturous joy.
युवं दधीचो मन आ विवासथोअथा शिरः परति वामश्व्यं वदत|	ye drew unto yourselves the spirit of dadhyac and then the horses head uttered his words to you.
युवं पेदवे पुरुवारमश्विना सप्र्धां शवेतं तरुतारन्दुवस्यथः|	a horse did ye provide for pedu excellent white o ye aśvins conqueror of combatants.
शर्यैरभिद्युं पर्तनासु दुष्टरं चर्क्र्त्यमिन्द्रमिव चर्षणीसहम|	invincible in war by arrows seeking heaven worthy of fame like indra vanquisher of men.
समिद्धो अद्य राजसि देवो देवैः सहस्रजित|	winner of thousands kindled thou shinest a god with gods today.
दूतो हव्या कविर्वह|	bear out oblations envoy sage.
तनुनपाद रतं यते मध्वा यज्ञः समज्यते|	child of thyself the sacrifice is for the righteous blent with meath.
दधत सहस्रिणीरिषः|	presenting viands thousandfold.
आजुह्वानो न ईड्यो देवाना वक्षि यज्ञियान|	invoked and worthy of our praise bring gods whose due is sacrifice.
अग्ने सहस्रसा असि|	thou agni givest countless gifts.
पराचीनं बर्हिरोजसा सहस्रवीरमस्त्र्णन|	to seat a thousand heroes they eastward have strewn the grass with might.
यत्रादित्या विराजथ|	whereon Ādityas ye shine forth.
विराट सम्राड विभ्वीः परभ्वीर्बह्वीश्च भूयसीश्चयाः|	the sovran allimperial doors wide good many and manifold.
दुरो घर्तान्यक्षरन|	have poured their streams of holy oil.
सुरुक्मे हि सुपेशसाधि शरिया विराजतः|	with gay adornment fair to see in glorious beauty shine they forth.
उषासावेहसीदताम|	let night and morning rest them here.
परथमा हि सुवाचसा होतारा दैव्या कवी|	let these two sages first of all heralds divine and eloquent.
यज्ञं नो यक्षतामिमम|	perform for us this sacrifice.
भारतीळे सरस्वति या वः सर्वा उपब्रुवे|	you i address sarasvatī and bhāratī and iḷā all.
ता नश्चोदयत शरिये|	urge ye us on to glorious fame.
तवष्टा रूपाणि हि परभुः पशुन विश्वान समानजे|	tvaṣṭar the lord hath made all forms and all the cattle of the field.
तेषां नः सफातिमा यज|	cause them to multiply for us.
उप तमन्या वनस्पते पाथो देवेभ्यः सर्ज|	send to the gods vanaspati thyself the sacrificial draught.
अग्निर्हव्यानि सिष्वदत|	let agni make the oblations sweet.
पुरोगा अग्निर्देवानां गायत्रेण समज्यते|	agni preceder of the gods is honoured with the sacred song.
सवाहाक्र्तीषु रोचते|	he glows at offerings blest with hail.
आ तवेता नि षीदतेन्द्रमभि पर गायत|	o come ye hither sit ye down to indra sing ye forth your song.
सखाय सतोमवाहसः|	companions bringing hymns of praise.
पुरूतमं पुरूणामीशानं वार्याणाम|	to him the richest of the rich the lord of treasures excellent.
इन्द्रं सोमे सचा सुते|	indra with soma juice outpoured.
स घा नो योग आ भुवत स राये स पुरन्ध्याम|	may he stand by us in our need and in abundance for our wealth.
गमद वाजेभिरा स नः|	may he come nigh us with his strength.
यस्य संस्थे न वर्ण्वते हरी समत्सु शत्रवः|	whose pair of tawny horses yoked in battles foemen challenge not.
तस्मा इन्द्राय गायत|	to him to indra sing your song.
सुतपाव्ने सुता इमे शुचयो यन्ति वीतये|	nigh to the somadrinker come for his enjoyment these pure drops.
सोमासो दध्याशिरः|	the somas mingled with the curd.
तवं सुतस्य पीतये सद्यो वर्द्धो अजायथाः|	thou grown at once to perfect strength wast born to drink the soma juice.
इन्द्र जयैष्ठ्याय सुक्रतो|	strong indra for preëminence.
आ तवा विशन्त्वाशवः सोमास इन्द्र गिर्वणः|	o indra lover of the song may these quick somas enter thee.
शं ते सन्तु परचेतसे|	may they bring bliss to thee the sage.
तवां सतोमा अवीव्र्धन तवामुक्था शतक्रतो|	our chants of praise have strengthened thee o Śatakratu and our lauds.
तवां वर्धन्तु नो गिरः|	so strengthen thee the songs we sing.
अक्षितोतिः सनेदिमं वाजमिन्द्रः सहस्रिणम|	indra whose succour never fails accept these viands thousandfold.
यस्मिन विश्वानि पौंस्या|	wherein all manly powers abide.
मा नो मर्ता अभि दरुहन तनूनामिन्द्र गिर्वणः|	o indra thou who lovest song let no man hurt our bodies keep.
ईशानो यवया वधम|	slaughter far from us for thou canst.
तं युञ्जाथां मनसो यो जवीयान तरिवन्धुरो वर्षण यस्त्रिचक्रः|	make ready that which passes thought in swiftness that hath three wheels and triple seat ye mighty.
येनोपयाथः सुक्र्तो दुरोणं तरिधातुन पतथोविर्न पर्णैः|	whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious whereon threefold ye fly like birds with pinions.
सुव्र्द रथो वर्तते यन्नभि कषां यत तिष्ठथः करतुमन्तानु पर्क्षे|	light rolls your easy chariot faring earthward what time for food ye full of wisdom mount it.
वपुर्वपुष्या सचतामियं गीर्दिवो दुहित्रोषसा सचेथे|	may this song wondrous fair attend your glory ye as ye travel wait on dawn heavens daughter.
आ तिष्ठतं सुव्र्तं यो रथो वामनु वरतानि वर्तते हविष्मान|	ascend your lightly rolling car approaching the worshipper who turns him to his duties.
येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयायत्मने च|	whereon ye come unto the house to quicken man and his offspring o nāsatyas heroes.
मा वां वर्को मा वर्कीरा दधर्षीन मा परि वर्क्तमुतमाति धक्तम|	let not the wolf let not the shewolf harm you forsake me not nor pass me by or others.
अयं वां भागो निहित इयं गीर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम|	here stands your share here is your hymn ye mighty yours are these vessels full of pleasant juices.
युवां गोतमः पुरुमीळ्हो अत्रिर्दस्रा हवतेअवसे हविष्मान|	gotama purumīlha atri bringing oblations all invoke you for protection.
दिशं न दिष्टां रजूयेव यन्ता मे हवं नासत्योप यातम|	like one who goes straight to the point directed ye nāsatyas to mine invocation.
अतारिष्म तमसस पारमस्य परति वां सतोमो अश्विनावधायि|	we have passed oer the limit of this darkness our praise hath been bestowed on you o aśvins.
एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्वि|	come hitherward by paths which gods have travelled may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
करीळं वः शर्धो मारुतमनर्वाणं रथेशुभम|	sing forth o kaṇvas to your band of maruts unassailable.
कण्वा अभि पर गायत|	sporting resplendent on their car.
ये पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिः साकं वाशीभिरञ्जिभिः|	they who selfluminous were born together with the spotted deer.
अजायन्त सवभानवः|	spears swords and glittering ornaments.
इहेव शर्ण्व एषां कशा हस्तेषु यद वदान|	one hears as though twere close at hand the cracking of the whips they hold.
नि यामञ्चित्रं रञ्जते|	they gather glory on their way.
पर वः शर्धाय घर्ष्वये तवेषद्युम्नाय शुष्मिणे|	now sing ye forth the godgiven hymn to your exultant marut host.
देवत्तं बरह्म गायत|	the fiercelyvigorous the strong.
पर शंसा गोष्वघ्न्यं करीळं यच्छर्धो मारुतम|	praise ye the bull among the cows for tis the maruts sportive band.
जम्भे रसस्य वाव्र्धे|	it strengthened as it drank the rain.
को वो वर्षिष्ठ आ नरो दिवश्च गमश्च धूतयः|	who is your mightiest heroes when o shakers of the earth and heaven.
यत सीम अन्तं न धूनुथ|	ye shake them like a garments hem.
नि वो यामाय मानुषो दध्र उग्राय मन्यवे|	at your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath.
जिहीत पर्वतो गिरिः|	the ruggedjointed mountain yields.
येषाम अज्मेषु पर्थिवी जुजुर्वां इव विश्पतिः|	they at whose racings forth the earth like an ageweakened lord of men.
भिया यामेषु रेजते|	trembles in terror on their ways.
सथिरं हि जानम एषां वयो मातुर निरेतवे|	strong is their birth vigour have they to issue from their mother strength.
यत सीम अनु दविता शवः|	yea even twice enough is theirs.
उद उ तये सूनवो गिरः काष्ठा अज्मेष्व अत्नत|	and these the sons the singers in their racings have enlarged the bounds.
वाश्रा अभिज्ञु यातवे|	so that the kine must walk kneedeep.
तयं चिद घा दीर्घम पर्थुम मिहो नपातम अम्र्ध्रम|	before them on the ways they go they drop this offspring of the cloud.
पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः|	long broad and inexhaustible.
मरुतो यद ध वो बलं जनां अचुच्यवीतन|	o maruts as your strength is great so have ye cast men down on earth.
गिरींर अचुच्यवीतन|	so have ye made the mountains fall.
यद ध यान्ति मरुतः सं ह बरुवते ऽधवन्न आ|	the while the maruts pass along they talk together on the way.
शर्णोति कश चिद एषाम|	doth any hear them as they speak.
पर यात शीभम आशुभिः सन्ति कण्वेषु वो दुवः|	come quick with swift steeds for ye have worshippers among kaṇvas sons.
तत्रो षु मादयाध्वै|	may you rejoice among them well.
अस्ति हि षमा मदाय वः समसि षमा वयम एषाम|	all is prepared for your delight we are their servants evermore.
विश्वं चिद आयुर जीवसे|	to live as long as life may last.
अप नः शोशुचदघमग्ने शुशुग्ध्या रयिम|	chasing with light our sin away o agni shine thou wealth on us.
अप नः शोशुचदघम|	may his light chase our sin away.
सुक्षेत्रिया सुगातुया वसूया च यजामहे|	for goodly fields for pleasant homes for wealth we sacrifice to thee.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
पर यद भन्दिष्ठ एषां परास्माकासश्च सूरयः|	best praiser of all these be he foremost our chiefs who sacrifice.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
पर यत ते अग्ने सूरयो जायेमहि पर ते वयम|	so that thy worshippers and we thine agni in our sons may live.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
पर यदग्नेः सहस्वतो विश्वतो यन्ति भानवः|	as everconquering agnis beams of splendour go to every side.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
तवं हि विश्वतोमुख विश्वतः परिभूरसि|	to every side thy face is turned thou art triumphant everywhere.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
दविषो नो विश्वतोमुखाति नावेव पारय|	o thou whose face looks every way bear us past foes as in a ship.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
स नः सिन्धुमिव नावयाति पर्षा सवस्तये|	as in a ship convey thou us for our advantage oer the flood.
अप|	may his light chase our sin away.
इन्द्रं विश्वा अवीव्र्धन समुद्रव्यचसं गिरः|	all sacred songs have magnified indra expansive as the sea.
रथीतमंरथीनां वाजानां सत्पतिं पतिम|	the best of warriors borne on cars the lord the very lord of strength.
सख्ये त इन्द्र वाजिनो मा भेम शवसस पते|	strong in thy friendship indra lord of power and might we have no fear.
तवामभि परणोनुमो जेतारमपराजितम|	we glorify with praises thee the neverconquered conqueror.
पूर्वीरिन्द्रस्य रातयो न वि दस्यन्त्यूतयः|	the gifts of indra from of old his saving succours never fail.
यदी वाजस्य गोमत सतोत्र्भ्यो मंहते मघम|	when to the praisesingers he gives the boon of substance rich in kine.
पुरां भिन्दुर्युवा कविरमितौजा अजायत|	crusher of forts the young the wise of strength unmeasured was he born.
इन्द्रो विश्वस्यकर्मणो धर्ता वज्री पुरुष्टुतः|	sustainer of each sacred rite indra the thunderer muchextolled.
तवं वलस्य गोमतोअपावरद्रिवो बिलम|	lord of the thunder thou didst burst the cave of vala rich in cows.
तवां देवा अबिभ्युषस्तुज्यमानास आविषुः|	the gods came pressing to thy side and free from terror aided thee.
तवाहं शूर रातिभिः परत्यायं सिन्धुमावदन|	i hero through thy bounties am come to the flood addressing thee.
उपातिष्ठन्त गिर्वणो विदुष टे तस्य कारवः|	songlover here the singers stand and testify to thee thereof.
मायाभिरिन्द्र मायिनं तवं शुष्णमवातिरः|	the wily Śuṣṇa indra thou oerthrewest with thy wondrous powers.
विदुष टे तस्य मेधिरास्तेषां शरवांस्युत तिर|	the wise beheld this deed of thine now go beyond their eulogies.
इन्द्रमीशानमोजसाभि सतोमा अनूषत|	our songs of praise have glorified indra who ruleth by his might.
सहस्रं यस्य रातय उत वा सन्ति भूयसीः|	whose precious gifts in thousands come yea even more abundantly.
वैश्वानरस्य सुमतौ सयाम राजा हि कं भुवनानामभिश्रीः|	still in vaiśvānaras grace may we continue yea he is king supreme oer all things living.
इतो जातो विश्वमिदं वि चष्टे वैश्वानरो यतते सूर्येण|	sprung hence to life upon this all he looketh vaiśvānara hath rivalry with sūrya.
पर्ष्टो दिवि पर्ष्टो अग्निः पर्थिव्यां पर्ष्टो विश्वा ओषधीरा विवेश|	present in heaven in earth allpresent agniall plants that grow on ground hath he pervaded.
वैश्वानरः सहसा पर्ष्टो अग्निः स नो दिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम|	may agni may vaiśvānara with vigour present preserve us day and night from foemen.
वैश्वानर तव तत सत्यमस्त्वस्मान रायो मघवानः सचन्ताम|	be this thy truth vaiśvānara to usward let wealth in rich abundance gather round us.
तन नो|	this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
पर मन्महे शवसानाय शूषमाङगूषं गिर्वणसे अङगिरस्वत|	like aṅgiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song exceeding mighty.
सुव्र्क्तिभिः सतुवत रग्मियायार्चामार्कं नरे विश्रुताय|	let us sing glory to the farfamed hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.
पर वो महे महि नमो भरध्वमाङगूष्यं शवसानाय साम|	unto the great bring ye great adoration a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty.
येना नः पूर्वे पितरः पदज्ञा अर्चन्तो अङगिरसो गा अविन्दन|	through whom our sires aṅgirases singing praises and knowing well the places found the cattle.
इन्द्रस्याङगिरसां चेष्टौ विदत सरमा तनयाय धासिम|	when indra and the aṅgirases desired it saramā found provision for her offspring.
बर्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः समुस्रियाभिर्वावशन्त नरः|	bṛhaspati cleft the mountain found the cattle the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph.
स सुष्टुभा स सतुभा सप्त विप्रैः सवरेणाद्रिं सवर्यो नवग्वैः|	mid shout loud shout and roar with the navagvas seven singers hast thou heavenly rent the mountain.
सरण्युभिः फलिगमिन्द्र शक्र वलं रवेणदरयो दशग्वैः|	thou hast with speeders with daśagvas indra Śakra with thunder rent obstructive vala.
गर्णानो अङगिरोभिर्दस्म वि वरुषसा सूर्येण गोभिरन्धः|	praised by aṅgirases thou foedestroyer hast with the dawn sun rays dispelled the darkness.
वि भूम्या अप्रथय इन्द्र सानु दिवो रज उपरमस्तभायः|	thou indra hast spread out the earths high ridges and firmly fixed the region under heaven.
तदु परयक्षतममस्य कर्म दस्मस्य चारुतममस्ति दंसः|	this is the deed most worthy of all honour the fairest marvel of the wonderworker.
उपह्वरे यदुपरा अपिन्वन मध्वर्णसो नद्यश्चतस्रः|	that nigh where heaven bends down he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water.
दविता वि वव्रे सनजा सनीळे अयास्य सतवमानेभिरर्कैः|	unwearied won with lauding hymns he parted of old the ancient pair united ever.
भगो न मेने परमे वयोमन्नधारयद रोदसी सुदंसाः|	in highest sky like bhaga he the doer of marvels set both dames and earth and heaven.
सनाद दिवं परि भूमा विरूपे पुनर्भुवा युवती सवेभिरेवैः|	still born afresh young dames each in her manner unlike in hue the pair in alternation.
कर्ष्णेभिरक्तोषा रुशद्भिर्वपुर्भिरा चरतो अन्यान्या|	round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled night with her dark limbs dawn with limbs of splendour.
सनेमि सख्यं सवपस्यमानः सूनुर्दाधार शवसा सुदंसाः|	rich in good actions skilled in operation the son with might maintains his perfect friendship.
आमासु चिद दधिषे पक्वमन्तः पयः कर्ष्णासु रुशद रोहिणीषु|	thou in the raw cows black of hue or ruddy storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour.
सनात सनीला अवनीरवाता वरता रक्षन्ते अम्र्ताः सहोभिः|	their paths of old connected rest uninjured they with great might preserve the immortal statutes.
पुरू सहस्रा जनयो न पत्नीर्दुवस्यन्ति सवसारो अह्रयाणम|	for many thousand holy works the sisters wait on the haughty lord like wives and matrons.
सनायुवो नमसा नव्यो अर्कैर्वसूयवो मतयो दस्म दद्रुः|	thoughts ancient seeking wealth with adoration with newest lauds have sped to thee o mighty.
पतिं न पत्नीरुशतीरुशन्तं सप्र्शन्ति तवा शवसावन्मनीषाः|	as yearning wives cleave to their yearning husband so cleave our hymns to thee o lord most potent.
सनादेव तव रायो गभस्तौ न कषीयन्ते नोप दस्यन्ति दस्म|	strong god the riches which thy hands have holden from days of old have perished not nor wasted.
दयुमानसि करतुमानिन्द्र धीरः शिक्षा शचीवस्तव नः शचीभिः|	splendid art thou o indra wise unbending strengthen us with might o lord of power.
सनायते गोतम इन्द्र नव्यमतक्षद बरह्म हरियोजनाय|	o mighty indra gotamas son nodhas hath fashioned this new prayer to thee eternal.
सुनीथाय नः शवसान नोधाः परातर मक्षू धियावसुर जगम्यात|	sure leader yoker of the tawny coursers may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
पर तव्यसीं नव्यसीं धीतिमग्नये वाचो मतिं सहसःसूनवे भरे|	to agni i present a newer mightier hymn i bring my words and song unto the son of strength.
अपां नपाद यो वसुभिः सह परियो होता पर्थिव्यां नयसीदद रत्वियः|	who offspring of the waters bearing precious things sits on the earth in season dear invoking priest.
स जायमानः परमे वयोमन्याविरग्निरभवन मातरिश्वने|	soon as he sprang to birth that agni was shown forth to mātariśvan in the highest firmament.
अस्य करत्वा समिधानस्य मज्मना पर दयावा शोचिः पर्थिवी अरोचयत|	when he was kindled through his power and majesty his fiery splendour made the heavens and earth to shine.
अस्य तवेषा अजरा अस्य भानवः सुसन्द्र्शः सुप्रतीकस्यसुद्युतः|	his flames that wax not old beams fair to look upon of him whose face is lovely shine with beauteous sheen.
भात्वक्षसो अत्यक्तुर्न सिन्धवोअग्ने रेजन्ते अससन्तो अजराः|	the rays of agni him whose active force is light through the nights glimmer sleepless ageless like the floods.
यमेरिरे भर्गवो विश्ववेदसं नाभा पर्थिव्या भुवनस्य मज्मना|	send thou with hymns that agni to his own abode who rules one sovran lord of wealth like varuṇa.
अग्निं तं गीर्भिर्हिनुहि सव आ दमे य एको वस्वो वरुणो न राजति|	him allpossessor whom the bhṛgus with their might brought to earths central point the centre of the world.
न यो वराय मरुतामिव सवनः सेनेव सर्ष्टा दिव्या यथाशनिः|	he whom no force can stay even as the maruts roar like to a dart sent forth even as the bolt from heaven.
अग्निर्जम्भैस्तिगितैरत्ति भर्वति योधो न शत्रून स वना नय रञ्जते|	agni with sharpened jaws chews up and eats the trees and conquers them as when the warrior smites his foes.
कुविन नो अग्निरुचथस्य वीरसद वसुष कुविद वसुभिः काममावरत|	and will not agni find enjoyment in our praise will not the vasu grant our wish with gifts of wealth.
चोदः कुवित तुतुज्यात सातये धियः शुचिप्रतीकं तमया धिया गर्णे|	will not the inspirer speed our prayers to gain their end him with the radiant glance i laud with this my song.
घर्तप्रतीकं व रतस्य धूर्षदमग्निं मित्रं न समिधान रञ्जते|	the kindler of the flame wins agni as a friend promoter of the law whose face is bright with oil.
इन्धानो अक्रो विदथेषु दीद्यच्छुक्रवर्णामुदु नो यंसते धियम|	inflamed and keen refulgent in our gatherings he lifts our hymn on high clad in his radiant hues.
अप्रयुछन्नप्रयुछद्भिरग्ने शिवेभिर्नः पायुभिः पाहि शग्मैः|	keep us incessantly with guards that cease not agni with guards auspicious very mighty.
अदब्धेभिरद्र्पितेभिरिष्टेअनिमिषद्भिः परि पाहि नो जाः|	with guards that never slumber never heedless never beguiled o helper keep our children.
वह्निं यशसं विदथस्य केतुं सुप्राव्यं दूतं सद्योर्थम|	as twere some goodly treasure mātariśvan brought as a gift the glorious priest to bhṛgu.
दविजन्मानं रयिमिव परशस्तं रातिं भरद भर्गवेमातरिश्वा|	banner of sacrifice the good protector child of two births the swiftly moving envoy.
अस्य शासुरुभयासः सचन्ते हविष्मन्त उशिजो ये च मर्ताः|	both gods and men obey this rulers order gods who are worshipped men who yearn and worship.
दिवश्चित पूर्वो नयसादि होताप्र्छ्यो विश्पतिर्विक्षुवेधाः|	as priest he takes his seat ere break of morning houselord adorable with men ordainer.
तं नव्यसी हर्द आ जायमानमस्मत सुकीर्तिर्मधुजिह्वमश्याः|	may our fair praise heartborn most recent reach him whose tongue een at his birth is sweet as honey.
यं रत्विजो वर्जने मानुषासः परयस्वन्त आयवो जीजनन्त|	whom mortal priests men with their strong endeavour supplied with dainty viands have created.
उशिक पावको वसुर्मानुषेषु वरेण्यो होताधायि विक्षु|	good to mankind the yearning purifier hath among men been placed as priest choiceworthy.
दमूना गर्हपतिर्दम आ अग्निर्भुवद रयिपती रयीणाम|	may agni be our friend lord of the household protector of the riches in the dwelling.
तं तवा वयं पतिमग्ने रयीणां पर शंसामो मतिभिर्गोतमासः|	as such we gotamas with hymns extol thee o agni as the guardian lord of riches.
आशुं न वाजम्भरं मर्जयन्तः परातर्मक्षू धियावसुर्जगम्यात|	decking thee like a horse the swift prizewinner may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
हिरण्यकेशो रजसो विसारेअहिर्धुनिर्वात इव धरजीमान|	he in midairs expanse hath golden tresses a raging serpent like the rushing tempest.
शुचिभ्राजा उषसो नवेदा यशस्वतीरपस्युवो न सत्याः|	purely refulgent knowing well the morning like honourable dames true active workers.
आ ते सुपर्णा अमिनन्तमेवैः कर्ष्णो नोनाव वर्षभो यदीदम|	thy wellwinged flashes strengthen in their manner when the black bull hath bellowed round about us.
शिवाभिर्न समयमानाभिरागात पतन्ति मिहः सतनयन्त्यभ्रा|	with drops that bless and seem to smile he cometh the waters fall the clouds utter their thunder.
यदीं रतस्य पयसा पियानो नयन्न्र्तस्य पथिभी रजिष्ठैः|	when he comes streaming with the milk of worship conducting by directest paths of order.
अर्यमा मित्रो वरुनः परिज्मा तवचं पर्ञ्चन्त्युपरस्य योनौ|	aryaman mitra varuṇa parijman fill the hide full where lies the nether pressstone.
अग्ने वाजस्य गोमत ईशानः सहसो यहो|	o agni thou who art the lord of wealth in kine thou son of strength.
अस्मे धेहि जातवेदो महि शरवः|	vouchsafe to us o jātavedas high renown.
स इधनो वसुष कविरग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा|	he agni kindled good and wise must be exalted in our song.
रेवदस्मभ्यम्पुर्वणीक दीदिहि|	shine thou of many forms shine radiantly on us.
