यानि मनुरव्र्णीता पिता नस्ता शं च योश्चरुद्रस्य वश्मि|	those which our father manu hath selected i crave from rudra for our gain and welfare.
परि णो हेती रुद्रस्य वर्ज्याः परि तवेषस्य दुर्मतिर्महीगात|	may rudras missile turn aside and spare us the great wrath of the impetuous one avoid us.
अव सथिरा मघवद्भ्यस्तनुष्व मीढ्वस्तोकाय तनयाय मर्ळ|	turn bounteous god thy strong bow from our princes and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.
एवा बभ्रो वर्षभ चेकितान यथा देव न हर्णीषे न हंसि|	o tawny bull thus showing forth thy nature as neither to be wroth o god nor slay us.
हवनश्रुन नो रुद्रेह बोधि बर्हद व व स|	here rudra listen to our invocation loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
उपेमस्र्क्षि वाजयुर्वचस्यां चनो दधीत नाद्यो गिरो मे|	eager for spoil my flow of speech i utter may the floods child accept my songs with favour.
अपां नपादाशुहेमा कुवित स सुपेशसस करति जोषिषद धि|	will not the rapid son of waters make them lovely for he it is who shall enjoy them.
इमं सवस्मै हर्द आ सुतष्टं मन्त्रं वोचेम कुविदस्य वेदत|	to him let us address the song wellfashioned forth from the heart shall he not understand it.
अपां नपादसुर्यस्य मह्ना विश्वान्यर्यो भुवना जजान|	the friendly son of waters by the greatness of godhead hath produced all things existing.
समन्या यन्त्युप यन्त्यन्याः समानमूर्वं नद्यः पर्णन्ति|	some floods unite themselves and others join them die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse.
तमू शुचिं शुचयो दीदिवांसमपां नपातं परि तस्थुरापः|	on every side the bright floods have encompassed the bright resplendent offspring of the waters.
तमस्मेरा युवतयो युवानं मर्म्र्ज्यमानाः परि यन्त्यापः|	the neversullen waters youthful maidens carefully decking wait on him the youthful.
स शुक्रेभिः शिक्वभी रेवदस्मे दीदायानिध्मो घर्तनिर्णिगप्सु|	he with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty unfed with wood in waters oilenveloped.
अस्मै तिस्रो अव्यथ्याय नारीर्देवाय देवीर्दिधिषन्त्यन्नम|	to him three dames are offering food to feed him goddesses to the god whom none may injure.
कर्ता इवोप हि परसर्स्रे अप्सु स पीयूषं धयति पूर्वसूनाम|	within the waters hath he pressed as hollows and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.
अश्वस्यात्र जनिमास्य च सवर्द्रुहो रिषः सम्प्र्चः पाहिसूरीन|	here was the horses birth his was the sunlight save thou our princes from the oppressors onslaught.
आमासु पूर्षु परो अप्रम्र्ष्यं नारातयो वि नशन नान्र्तानि|	him indestructible dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.
सव आ दमे सुदुघा यस्य धेनुः सवधां पीपाय सुभ्वन्नमत्ति|	he in whose mansion is the teeming milchcow swells the gods nectar and cats noble viands.
सो अपां नपादूर्जयन्नप्स्वन्तर्वसुदेयाय विधते वि भाति|	the son of waters gathering strength in waters shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.
यो अप्स्वा सुचिना दैव्येन रतावाजस्र उर्विया विभाति|	he who in waters with his own pure godhead shines widely lawabiding everlasting.
वया इदन्या भुवनान्यस्य पर जायन्ते वीरुधश्च परजाभिः|	the other worlds are verily his branches and plants are born of him with all their offspring.
अपां नपादा हयस्थादुपस्थं जिह्मानामूर्ध्वो विद्युतं वसानः|	the waters son hath risen and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled clouds bosom.
तस्य जयेष्ठं महिमानं वहन्तीर्हिरण्यवर्णाः परि यन्ति यह्वीः|	and bearing with them his supremest glory the youthful ones goldcoloured move around him.
हिरण्यरूपः स हिरण्यसन्द्र्गपां नपात सेदु हिरण्यवर्णः|	golden in form is he like gold to look on his colour is like gold the son of waters.
हिरण्ययात परि योनेर्निषद्या हिरण्यदा ददत्यन्नमस्मै|	when he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.
तदस्यानीकमुत चारु नामापीच्यं वर्धते नप्तुरपाम|	this the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the waters son increase in secret.
यमिन्धते युवतयः समित्था हिरण्यवर्णं घर्तमन्नमस्य|	whom here the youthful maids together kindle his food is sacred oil of golden colour.
अस्मै बहूनामवमाय सख्ये यज्ञैर्विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः|	him nearest friend of many will we worship with sacrifice and reverence and oblation.
सं सानु मार्ज्मि दिधिषामि बिल्मैर्दधाम्यन्नैःपरि वन्द रग्भिः|	i make his back to shine with chips provide him i offer food and with my songs exalt him.
स ईं वर्षाजनयत तासु गर्भं स ईं सिशुर्धयति तं रिहन्ति|	the bull hath laid his own lifegerm within them he sucks them as an infant and they kiss him.
सो अपां नपादनभिम्लातवर्णोअन्यस्येवेह तन्वा विवेष|	he son of waters of unfading colour hath entered here as in anothers body.
अस्मिन पदे परमे तस्थिवांसमध्वस्मभिर्विश्वहा दीदिवांसाम|	while here he dwelleth in sublimest station resplendent with the rays that never perish.
आपो नप्त्रे घर्तमन्नं वहन्तीः सवयमत्कैः परि दीयन्ति यह्वीः|	the waters bearing oil to feed their offspring flow youthful ones in wanderings about him.
अयांसमग्ने सुक्षितिं जनायायांसमु मघवद्भ्यः सुव्र्क्तिम|	agni i gave good shelter to the people and to the princes goodly preparation.
विश्वं तद|	blessed is all that gods regard with favour loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
गरावाणेव तदिदथं जरेथे गर्ध्रेव वर्क्षं निधिमन्तमछ|	sing like the two pressstones for this same purpose come like two misers to the tree of treasure.
बरह्माणेव विदथ उक्थशासा दूतेव हव्या जन्या पुरुत्रा|	like two laudsinging brahmans in the assembly like the folks envoys called in many places.
परातर्यावाणा रथ्येव वीराजेव यमा वरमा सचेथे|	moving at morning like two carborne heroes like to a pair of goats ye come electing.
मेने इव तन्वा शुम्भमाने दम्पतीव करतुविदा जनेषु|	like two fair dames embellishing their bodies like a wise married pair among the people.
शर्ङगेव नः परथमा गन्तमर्वाक छफाविव जर्भुराणातरोभिः|	like to a pair of horns come first to usward like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion.
चक्रवाकेव परति वस्तोरुस्रार्वाञ्चा यातं रथ्येव शक्रा|	come like two cakavās in the grey of morning come like two chariot wheels at dawn ye mighty.
नावेव नः पारयतं युगेव नभ्येव न उपधीव परधीव|	bear us across the rivers like two vessels save us as ye were yokes naves spokes and fellies.
शवानेव नो अरिषण्या तनूनां खर्गलेव विस्रसः पातमस्मान|	be like two dogs that injure not our bodies preserve us like two crutches that we fall not.
वातेवाजुर्या नद्येव रीतिरक्षी इव चक्षुषा यातमर्वाक|	like two winds ageing not two confluent rivers come with quick vision like two eyes before us.
हस्ताविव तन्वे शम्भविष्ठा पादेव नो नयतं वस्यो अछ|	come like two hands most helpful to the body and guide us like two feet to what is precious.
ओष्ठाविव मध्वास्ने वदन्ता सतनाविव पिप्यतं जीवसेनः|	even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey even as two breasts that nourish our existence.
नासेव नस्तन्वो रक्षितारा कर्णाविव सुश्रुता भूतमस्मे|	like the two nostrils that protect our being be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.
हस्तेव शक्तिमभि सन्ददी नः कषामेव नः समजतं रजांसि|	like two hands give ye us increasing vigour like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions.
इमा गिरो अश्विना युष्मयन्तीः कष्णोत्रेणेव सवधितिं सं शिशीतम|	aśvins these hymns that struggle to approach you sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.
एतानि वामश्विना वर्धनानि बरह्म सतोमं गर्त्समदासो अक्रन|	these prayers of ours exalting you o aśvins have the gṛtsamadas for a laud made ready.
तानि नरा जुजुषाणोप यातं बर्हद|	welcome them o ye heroes and come hither loud may we speak with brave men in assembly.
रजुरिच्छंसो वनवद वनुष्यतो देवयन्निददेवयन्तमभ्यसत|	the righteous singer shall oercome his enemies and he who serves the gods subdue the godless man.
सुप्रावीरिद वनवत पर्त्सु दुष्टरं यज्वेदयज्योर्वि भजाति भोजनम|	the zealous man shall vanquish the invincible the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.
यजस्व वीर पर विहि मनायतो भद्रं मनः कर्णुष्व वर्त्रतूर्ये|	worship thou hero chase the arrogant afar put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes.
हविष कर्णुष्व सुभगो यथाससि बरह्मणस पतेरव आ वर्णीमहे|	prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success we crave the favouring help of brahmaṇaspati.
स इज्जनेन स विशा स जन्मना स पुत्रैर्वाजं भरतेधना नर्भिः|	he with his folk his house his family his sons gains booty for himself and with the heroes wealth.
देवानां यः पितरमाविवासति शरद्धामना हविषा बरह्मणस पतिम|	who with oblation and a true believing heart serves brahmaṇaspati the father of the gods.
यो अस्मै हव्यैर्घ्र्तवद्भिरविधत पर तं पराचा नयति बरह्मणस पतिः|	whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil him brahmaṇaspati leads forward on his way.
उरुष्यतीमंहसो रक्षती रिषोअंहोश्चिदस्मा उरुचक्रिरद्भुतः|	saves him from sorrow frees him from his enemy and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.
वाजयन्निव नू रथान योगानग्नेरुप सतुहि|	now praise as one who strives for strength the harnessing of agnis car.
यशस्तमस्य मीळ्हुषः|	the liberal the most splendid one.
यः सुनीथो ददाशुषेअजुर्यो जरयन्नरिम|	who guiding worshippers aright withers untouched by age the foe.
चारुप्रतीकाहुतः|	when worshipped fair to look upon.
य उ शरिया दमेष्वा दोषोषसि परशस्यते|	who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes.
यस्य वरतं न मीयते|	whose statute is inviolate.
आ यः सवर्ण भानुना चित्रो विभात्यर्चिषा|	who shines refulgent like the sun with brilliance and with fiery flame.
अञ्जानोजरैरभि|	decked with imperishable sheen.
अत्रिमनु सवराज्यमग्निमुक्थानि वाव्र्धुः|	him atri agni have our songs strengthened according to his sway.
विश्वा अधि शरियो दधे|	all glories hath he made his own.
अग्नेरिन्द्रस्य सोमस्य देवानामूतिभिर्वयम|	may we with agnis indras help with somas yea of all the gods.
अरिष्यन्तःसचेमह्यभि षयाम पर्तन्यतः|	uninjured dwell together still and conquer those who fight with us.
रतं देवाय कर्ण्वते सवित्र इन्द्रायाहिघ्ने न रमन्त आपः|	the streams unceasing flow to indra slayer of ahi savitar god laws fulfiller.
अहरअहर्यात्यक्तुरपां कियात्या परथमः सर्ग आसाम|	day after day goes on the sheen of waters what time hath past since they were first set flowing.
यो वर्त्राय सिनमत्राभरिष्यत पर तं जनित्री विदुष उवाच|	his motherfor she knewspake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at vṛtra.
पथो रदन्तीरनु जोषमस्मै दिवेदिवे धुनयो यन्त्यर्थम|	cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.
ऊर्ध्वो हयस्थादध्यन्तरिक्षेअधा वर्त्राय पर वधंजभार|	aloft he stood above the airy region and against vṛtra shot his deadly missile.
मिहं वसान उप हीमदुद्रोत तिग्मायुधो अजयच्छत्रुमिन्द्रः|	enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons.
बर्हस्पते तपुषाश्नेव विध्य वर्कद्वरसो असुरस्य वीरान|	as with a bolt bṛhaspati fiercely flaming pierce thou vṛkadvaras the asuras heroes.
यथा जघन्थ धर्षता पुरा चिदेवा जहि शत्रुमस्माकमिन्द्र|	even as in time of old with might thou slewest so slay even now our enemy o indra.
अव कषिप दिवो अश्मानमुच्चा येन शत्रुं मन्दसानो निजूर्वाः|	cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman.
तोकस्य सातौ तनयस्य भूरेरस्मानर्धं कर्णुतादिन्द्र गोनाम|	for gain of children make us thine o indra of many childrens children and of cattle.
पर हि करतुं वर्हथो यं वनुथो रध्रस्य सथो यजमानस्य चोदौ|	whomso ye love his power ye aid and strengthen ye twain are the rich worshippers advancers.
इन्द्रासोमा युवमस्मानविष्टमस्मिन भयस्थे कर्णुतमु लोकम|	graciously favour us indra and soma give us firm standing in this time of danger.
न मा तमन न शरमन नोत तन्द्रन न वोचाम मा सुनोतेति सोमम|	let it not vex me tire me make me slothful and never let us say press not the soma.
यो मे पर्णाद यो ददद यो निबोधाद यो मा सुन्वन्तमुप गोभिरायत|	for him who cares for me gives gifts supports me who comes with kine to me who pour libations.
सरस्वति तवमस्मानविड्ढि मरुत्वती धर्षती जेषि शत्रून|	sarasvatī protect us with the maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen.
तयं चिच्छर्धन्तं तविषीयमाणमिन्द्रो हन्ति वर्षभं शण्डिकानाम|	while indra does to death the daring chieftain of Śaṇḍikas exulting in his prowess.
यो नः सनुत्य उत वा जिघत्नुरभिख्याय तं तिगितेन विध्य|	him who waylays yea him who would destroy usaim at him pierce him with thy sharpened weapon.
बर्हस्पत आयुधैर्जेषि शत्रून दरुहे रीषन्तं परि धेहि राजन|	bṛhaspati with arms thou slayest foemen o king give up the spoiler to destruction.
अस्माकेभिः सत्वभिः शूर शूरैर्वीर्य कर्धि यानि ते कर्त्वानि|	perform o hero with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish.
जयोगभूवन्ननुधूपितासो हत्वी तेशामा भरानो वसूनि|	long have they been inflated with presumption slay them and bring us hither their possessions.
तं वः शर्धं मारुतं सुम्नयुर्गिरोप बरुवे नमसा दैव्यं जनम|	i craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host the company of maruts.
यथा रयिं सर्ववीरं नशामहा अपत्यसाचं शरुत्यं दिवेदिवे|	that we may gain wealth with full store of heroes each day more famous and with troops of children.
सोमापूषणा जनना रयीणां जनना दिवो जनना पर्थिव्याः|	soma and pūṣan parents of all riches parents of earth and parents of high heaven.
जातौ विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपौ देवा अक्र्ण्वन्नम्र्तस्य नाभिम|	you twain brought forth as the whole worlds protectors the gods have made centre of life eternal.
इमौ देवौ जायमानौ जुषन्तेमौ तमांसि गूहतामजुष्टा|	at birth of these two gods all gods are joyful they have caused darkness which we hate to vanish.
आभ्यामिन्द्रः पक्वमामास्वन्तः सोमापूषभ्यां जनदुस्रियासु|	with these with soma and with pūṣan india generates ripe warm milk in the raw milchcows.
सोमापूषणा रजसो विमानं सप्तचक्रं रथमविश्वमिन्वम|	soma and pūṣan urge your chariot hither the sevenwheeled car that measures out the region.
विषूव्र्तं मनसा युज्यमानं तं जिन्वथो वर्षणा पञ्चरश्मिम|	that stirs not all that moves to every quarter fivereined and harnessed by the thought ye mighty.
दिव्यन्यः सदनं चक्र उच्चा पर्थिव्यामन्यो अध्यन्तरिक्षे|	one in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling on earth and in the firmament the other.
तावस्मभ्यं पुरुवारं पुरुक्षुं रायस पोषं वि षयतां नाभिमस्मे|	may they disclose to us great store of treasure muchlonged for rich in food source of enjoyment.
विश्वान्यन्यो भुवना जजान विश्वमन्यो अभिचक्षाण एति|	one of you twain is parent of all creatures the other journeys onward allbeholding.
सोमापूषणाववतं धियं मे युवाभ्यां विश्वाः पर्तना जयेम|	soma and pūṣan aid my thought with favour with you may we o’ercome in all encounters.
धियं पूषा जिन्वतु विश्वमिन्वो रयिं सोमो रयिपतिर्दधातु|	may pūṣan stir our thought the allimpelling may soma lord of riches grant us riches.
अवतु देव्यदितिरनर्वा बर|	may aditi the perfect goddess aid us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
विश्वजिते धनजिते सवर्जिते सत्राजिते नर्जित उर्वराजिते|	to him the lord of all the lord of wealth of light him who is lord for ever lord of men and tilth.
अश्वजिते गोजिते अब्जिते भरेन्द्राय सोमं यजताय हर्यतम|	him who is lord of horses lord of kine of floods to indra to the holy bring sweet soma juice.
अभिभुवेअभिभङगाय वन्वतेअषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे|	to him the potent one who conquers and breaks down the victor never vanquished who disposes all.
तुविग्रये वह्नये दुष्टरीतवे सत्रासाहे नम इन्द्राय वोचत|	the mightyvoiced the rider unassailable to indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.
सत्रासाहो जनभक्षो जनंसहश्च्यवनो युध्मो अनु जोषमुक्षितः|	still victor loved by mortals ruler over men oerthrower warrior he hath waxen as he would.
वर्तंचयः सहुरिर्विक्ष्वारित इन्द्रस्य वोचं पर कर्तानि वीर्या|	hostgatherer triumphant honoured mid the folk indras heroic deeds will i tell forth to all.
अनानुदो वर्षभो दोधतो वधो गम्भीर रष्वो असमष्टकाव्यः|	the strong who never yields who slew the furious fiend the deep the vast of wisdom unattainable.
रध्रचोदः शनथनो वीळितस पर्थुरिन्द्रः सुयज्ञ उषसः सवर्जनत|	who speeds the good the breakerdown the firm the vastindra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of dawn.
यज्णेन गातुमप्तुरो विविद्रिरे धियो हिन्वाना उशिजो मनीषिणः|	by sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood.
अभिस्वरा निषदा गा अवस्यव इन्द्रे हिन्वाना दरविणान्याशत|	in indra seeking help with worship and with hymn they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.
इन्द्र शरेष्ठानि दरविणानि धेहि चित्तिं दक्षस्य सुभगत्वं अस्मे|	indra bestow on us the best of treasures the spirit of ability and fortune.
पोषं रयीणामरिष्टिं तनूनां सवाद्मानं वाचः सुदिनत्वमह्नाम|	increase of riches safety of our bodies charm of sweet speech and days of pleasant weather.
इमां मे अग्ने समिधमिमामुपसदं वनेः|	agni accept this flaming brand this waiting with my prayer on thee.
इमा उ षु शरुधी गिरः|	hear graciously these songs of praise.
अया ते अग्ने विधेमोर्जो नपादश्वमिष्टे|	with this hymn let us honour thee seeker of horses son of strength.
एना सूक्तेन सुजात|	with this fair hymn thou nobly born.
तं तवा गीर्भिर्गिर्वणसं दरविणस्युं दरविणोदः|	as such lover of song with songs wealthlover giver of our wealth.
सपर्येम सपर्यवः|	with reverence let us worship thee.
स बोधि सूरिर्मघवा वसुपते वसुदावन|	be thou for us a liberal prince giver and lord of precious things.
युयोध्यस्मद दवेषांसि|	drive those who hate us far away.
स नो वर्ष्तिं दिवस परि स नो वाजमनर्वाणम|	such as thou art give rain from heaven give strength which no man may resist.
स नः सहस्रिणीरिषः|	give food exceeding plentiful.
ईळानायावस्यवे यविष्ठ दूत नो गिरा|	to him who lauds thee craving help most youthful envoy through our song.
यजिष्ठ होतरा गहि|	most holy herald come thou nigh.
अन्तर्ह्यग्न ईयसे विद्वान जन्मोभया कवे|	between both races agni sage well skilled thou passest to and fro.
दूतो जन्येवमित्र्यः|	as envoy friendly to mankind.
स विद्वाना च पिप्रयो यक्षि चिकित्व आनुषक|	befriend us thou as knowing all sage duly worship thou the gods.
आ चास्मिन सत्सि बर्हिषि|	and seat thee on this sacred grass.
वायो ये ते सहस्रिणो रथासस्तेभिरा गहि|	o vĀyu come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine.
नियुत्वान सोमपीतये|	teamborne to drink the soma juice.
नियुत्वान वायवा गह्ययं शुक्रो अयामि ते|	drawn by thy team o vāyu come to thee is offered this the pure.
गन्तासि सुन्वतो गर्हम|	thou visitest the pressers house.
शुक्रस्याद्य गवाशिर इन्द्रवायू नियुत्वतः|	indra and vāyu drawn by teams ye heroes come today and drink.
आ यातं पिबतं नरा|	of the bright juice when blent with milk.
अयं वां मित्रावरुणा सुतः सोम रताव्र्धा|	this soma hath been shed for you lawstrengtheners mitravaruṇa.
ममेदिह शरुतं हवम|	listen ye here to this my call.
राजानावनभिद्रुहा धरुवे सदस्युत्तमे|	both kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home.
सहस्रस्थूण आसाते|	the thousandpillared firmlybased.
ता सम्राजा घर्तासुती आदित्या दानुनस पती|	fed with oblation sovran kings Ādityas lords of liberal gifts.
सचेते अनवह्वरम|	they wait on him whose life is true.
गोमदू षु नासत्याश्वावद यातमश्विना|	with kine nāsatyas and with steeds come aśvins rudras to the house.
वर्ती रुद्रा नर्पाय्यम|	that will protect its heroes well.
न यत परो नान्तर आदधर्षद वर्षण्वसू|	such wealthy gods as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm.
दुःशंसो मर्त्यो रिपुः|	yea no malicious mortal foe.
ता न आ वोळ्हमश्विना रयिं पिशङगसन्द्र्शम|	as such o longedfar aśvins lead us on to wealth of varied sort.
धिष्न्यावरिवोविदम|	wealth that shall bring us room and rest.
इन्द्रो अङग महद भयमभी षदप चुच्यवत|	verily indra conquering all driveth een mighty fear away.
स हि सथिरो विचर्षणिः|	for firm is he and swift to act.
इन्द्रश्च मर्ळयाति नो न नः पश्चादघं नशत|	indra be gracious unto us sin shall not reach us afterward.
भद्रं भवाति नः पुरः|	and good shall be before us still.
इन्द्र आशाभ्यस परि सर्वाभ्यो अभयं करत|	from all the regions of the world let indra send security.
जेता शत्रून विचर्शणिः|	the foesubduer swift to act.
विश्वे देवास आ गत शर्णुता म इमं हवम|	o all ye gods come hitherward hear this mine invocation seat.
एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत|	yourselves upon this sacred grass.
तीव्रो वो मधुमानयं शुनहोत्रेषु मत्सरः|	among the Śunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught.
एतं पिबतकाम्यम|	drink ye of this delightsome juice.
इन्द्रज्येष्ठा|	ye maruts led by indra gods with pūṣan for your bounteousest.
अम्बितमे नदीतमे देवितमे सरस्वति|	hear all of you this call of mine.
अप्रशस्ता इव समसि परशस्तिमम्ब नस कर्धि|	best mother best of rivers best of goddesses sarasvatī we are as twere of no repute and dear mother give thou us renown.
तवे विश्वा सरस्वति शरितायूंषि देव्याम|	in thee sarasvatī divine all generations have their stay.
शुनहोत्रेषु मत्स्व परजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः|	be glad with Śunahotras sons o goddess grant us progeny.
इमा बरह्म सरस्वति जुषस्व वाजिनीवति|	enriched with sacrifice accept sarasvatī these prayers of ours.
या ते मन्म गर्त्समदा रतावरि परिया देवेषु जुह्वति|	thoughts which gṛtsamadas beloved of gods bring holy one to thee.
परेतां यज्ञस्य शम्भुवा युवामिदा वर्णीमहे|	ye who bless sacrifice go forth for verily we choose you both.
अग्निंच हव्यवाहनम|	and agni who conveys our gifts.
दयावा नः पर्थिवी इमं सिध्रमद्य दिविस्प्र्शम|	this our effectual sacrifice reaching the sky shall heaven and earth.
यज्णन्देवेषु यछताम|	present unto the gods today.
आ वामुपस्थमद्रुहा देवाः सीदन्तु यज्ञियाः|	in both your laps ye guileless ones the holy gods shall sit them down.
इहाद्यसोमपीतये|	today to drink the soma here.
नि होता होत्र्षदने विदानस्त्वेषो दीदिवानसदत सुदक्षः|	accustomed to the heralds place the herald hath seated him bright splendid passing mighty.
अदब्धव्रतप्रमतिर्वसिष्ठः सहस्रम्भरः शुचिजिह्वो अग्निः|	whose foresight keeps the law from violation excellent puretongued bringing thousands agni.
तवं दूतस्त्वमु नः परस्पास्त्वं वस्य आ वर्षभ परणेता|	envoy art thou protector from the foeman strong god thou leadest us to higher blessings.
अग्ने तोकस्य नस्तने तनूनामप्रयुछन दीद्यद बोधि गोपाः|	refulgent be an everheedful keeper agni for us and for our seed offspring.
विधेम ते परमे जन्मन्नग्ने विधेम सतोमैरवरे सधस्थे|	may we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace and with our praises in thy lower station.
यस्माद योनेरुदारिथा यजे तं पर तवे हवींषि जुहुरेसमिद्धे|	the place whence thou issued forth i worship to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.
अग्ने यजस्व हविषा यजीयाञ्छ्रुष्टी देष्णमभि गर्णीहि राधः|	agni best priest pay worship with oblation quickly commend the gift to be presented.
तवं हयसि रयिपती रयीणां तवं शुक्रस्य वचसो मनोता|	for thou art lord of gathered wealth and treasure of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.
उभयं ते न कषीयते वसव्यं दिवेदिवे जायमानस्य दस्म|	the twofold opulence o wonderworker of thee newborn each day never decreases.
कर्धि कषुमन्तं जरितारमग्ने कर्धि पतिं सवपत्यस्य रायः|	enrich with food the man who lauds thee agni make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.
सैनानीकेन सुविदत्रो अस्मे यष्टा देवानायजिष्ठः सवस्ति|	may he benevolent with this fair aspect best sacrificer bring the gods to bless us.
अदब्धो गोपा उत नः परस्पा अग्ने दयुमदुत रेवद दिदीहि|	sure guardian our protector from the foemen shine agni with thine affluence and splendour.
तुभ्यं हिन्वानो वसिष्ट गा अपोअधुक्षन सीमविभिरद्रिभिर्नरः|	water and milk hath he endued sent forth to thee the men have drained him with the filters and the stones.
पिबेन्द्र सवाहा परहुतं वषत्क्र्तं होत्रादासोमं परथमो य ईशिषे|	drink indra from the hotars bowlfirst right is thinesoma hallowed and poured with vaṣaṭ and svāhā.
यज्ञैः सम्मिश्लाः पर्षतीभिर्र्ष्टिभिर्यामञ्छुभ्रासो अञ्जिषु परिया उत|	busied with sacrifice with spotted deer and spears gleaming upon your way with ornaments yea our friends.
आसद्या बर्हिर्भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रादा सोमं पिबता दिवो नरः|	sitting on sacred grass ye sons of bhārata drink soma from the potars bowl o men of heaven.
अमेव नः सुहवा आ हि गन्तन नि बर्हिषि सदतना रणिष्टन|	come unto us ye swift to listen as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves.
अथा मन्दस्व जुजुषाणो अन्धसस्त्वष्टर्देवेभिर्जनिभिः सुमद्गणः|	and tvaṣṭar wellcontent be joyful in the juice with gods and goddesses in gladsome company.
आ वक्षि देवानिह विप्र यक्षि चोशन होतर्नि षदा योनिषु तरिषु|	bring the gods hither sage and offer sacrifice at the three altars seat thee willingly o priest.
परति वीहि परस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पिबाग्नीध्रात्तव भागस्य तर्प्णुहि|	accept for thy delight the proffered soma meath drink from the kindlers bowl and fill thee with thy share.
एष सय ते तन्वो नर्म्णवर्धनः सह ओजः परदिवि बाह्वोर्हितः|	this is the strengthener of thy bodys manly might strength victory for all time are placed within thine arms.
तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन तुभ्यमाभ्र्तस्त्वमस्य बराह्मनादा तर्पत पिब|	pressed for thee maghavan it is offered unto thee drink from the chalice of this brahman drink thy fill.
जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे सत्तो होता निविदः पूर्व्या अनु|	accept the sacrifice mark both of you my call the priest hath seated him after the ancient texts.
अछा राजाना नम एत्याव्र्तं परशास्त्रादा पिबतं सोम्यं मधु|	my prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the kings drink ye the soma meath from the directors bowl.
शरुधी हवमिन्द्र मा रिशण्यः सयाम ते दावने वसूनाम|	hear thou my call o indra be not heedless thine may we be for thee to give us treasures.
इमा हि तवामूर्जो वर्धयन्ति वसूयवः सिन्धवो न कषरन्तः|	for these presented viands seeking riches increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.
सर्जो महीरिन्द्र या अपिन्वः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः|	floods great and many compassed by the dragon thou badest swell and settest free o hero.
अमर्त्यं चिद दासं मन्यमानमवाभिनदुक्थैर्वाव्र्धानः|	strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the dāsa him who deemed himself immortal.
उक्थेष्विन नु शूर येषु चाकन सतोमेष्विन्द्र रुद्रियेषु च|	for hero in the lauds wherein thou joyedst in hymns of praise o indra songs of rudras.
तुभ्येदेता यासु मन्दसानः पर वायवे सिस्रते न शुभ्राः|	these streams in which is thy delight approach thee even as the brilliant ones draw near to vāyu.
शुभ्रं नु ते शुष्मं वर्धयन्तः शुभ्रं वज्रं बाह्वोर्दधानाः|	we who add strength to thine own splendid vigour laying within thine arms the splendid thunder.
शुभ्रस्त्वमिन्द्र वाव्र्धानो अस्मे दासीर्विशः सूर्येण सह्याः|	with us mayst thou o indra waxen splendid with sūrya overcome the dāsa races.
गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्स्वपीव्र्तं मायिनं कषियन्तम|	hero thou slewest in thy valour ahi concealed in depths mysterious great enchanter.
उतो अपो दयां तस्तभ्वांसमहन्नहिं शूर वीर्येण|	dwelling enveloped deep within the waters him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.
सतवा नु त इन्द्र पूर्व्या महान्युत सतवाम नूतना कर्तानि|	indra we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime we laud thine exploits later of achievement.
सतवा वज्रं बाह्वोरुशन्तं सतवा हरी सूर्यस्य केतू|	we laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager we laud thy two bay steeds heralds of sūrya.
हरी नु त इन्द्र वाजयन्ता घर्तश्चुतं सवारमस्वार्ष्टाम|	indra thy bay steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness.
वि समना भूमिरप्रथिष्टारंस्त पर्वतश्चित सरिष्यन|	the earth hath spread herself in all her fulness the cloud that was about to move hath rested.
नि पर्वतः साद्यप्रयुछन सं मात्र्भिर्वावशानो अक्रान|	down never ceasing hath the raincloud settled bellowing it hath wandered with the mothers.
दूरे पारे वाणीं वर्धयन्त इन्द्रेषितां धमनिं पप्रथन नि|	swelling the roar in the far distant limits they have spread wide the blast sent forth by indra.
इन्द्रो महां सिन्धुमाशयानं मायाविनं वर्त्रमस्फुरन निः|	indra hath hurled down the magician vṛtra who lay beleaguering the mighty river.
अरेजेतां रोदसी भियाने कनिक्रदतो वर्ष्णो अस्य वज्रात|	then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong heros thunder when he bellowed.
अरोरवीद वर्ष्णो अस्य वज्रोअमानुषं यन मानुषो निजूर्वात|	loud roared the mighty heros bolt of thunder when he the friend of man burnt up the monster.
नि मायिनो दानवस्य माया अपादयत पपिवान सुतस्य|	and having drunk his fill of flowing soma baffled the guileful dānavas devices.
पिबापिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मन्दन्तु तवा मन्दिनः सुतासः|	drink thou o hero indra drink the soma let the joygiving juices make thee joyful.
पर्णन्तस्ते कुक्षी वर्धयन्त्वित्था सुतः पौर इन्द्रमाव|	they filling both thy flanks shall swell thy vigour the juice that satisfies hath helped indra.
तवे इन्द्राप्यभूम विप्रा धियं वनेम रतया सपन्तः|	singers have we become with thee o indra may we serve duly and prepare devotion.
अवस्यवो धीमहि परशस्तिं सद्यस्ते रायो दावने सयाम|	seeking thy help we meditate thy praises may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.
सयाम ते त इन्द्र ये त ऊती अवस्यव ऊर्जं वर्धयन्तः|	may we be thine such by thy help o indra as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour.
शुष्मिन्तमं यं चाकनाम देवास्मे रयिं रासि वीरवन्तम|	give us thou god the riches that we long for most powerful with stare of noble children.
रासि कषयं रासि मित्रमस्मे रासि शर्ध इन्द्र मारुतंनः|	give us a friend give us an habitation indra give us the company of maruts.
सजोषसो ये च मन्दसानाः पर वायवः पान्त्यग्रणीतिम|	and those whose minds accord with theirs the vāyus who drink the first libation of the soma.
वयन्त्विन नु येषु मन्दसानस्त्र्पत सोमं पाहि दरह्यदिन्द्र|	let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted indra drink soma for thy strength and gladness.
अस्मान सु पर्त्स्वा तरुत्रावर्धयो दयां बर्हद्भिरर्कैः|	thou hast exalted us to heaven preserver in battles through the lofty hymns that praise thee.
बर्हन्त इन नु ये ते तरुत्रोक्थेभिर्वा सुम्नमाविवासान|	great verily are they o thou protector who by their songs of praise have won the blessing.
सत्र्णानासो बर्हिः पस्त्यावत तवोता इदिन्द्र वाजमग्मन|	they who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling helped by thee have got them strength o indra.
उग्रेष्विन नु शूर मन्दसानस्त्रिकद्रुकेषु पाहि सोममिन्द्र|	upon the great trikadruka days hero rejoicing thee o indra drink the soma.
परदोधुवच्छ्मश्रुषु परीणानो याहि हरिभ्यां सुतस्यपीतिम|	come with bay steeds to drink of libation shaking the drops from out thy beard contented.
धिष्वा शवः शूर येन वर्त्रमवाभिनद दानुमौर्णवाभम|	hero assume the might wherewith thou clavest vṛtra piecemeal the dānava aurṇavābha.
अपाव्र्णोर्ज्योतिरार्याय नि सव्यतः सादि दस्युरिन्द्र|	thou hast disclosed the light to light the Ārya on thy left hand o indra sank the dasyu.
सनेम ये त ऊतिभिस्तरन्तो विश्वा सप्र्ध आर्येण दस्यून|	may we gain wealth subduing with thy succour and with the Ārya all our foes the dasyus.
अस्मभ्यं तत तवाष्ट्रं विश्वरूपमरन्धयः साख्यस्य तरिताय|	our gain was that to tṛta of our party thou gavest up tvaṣṭars son viśvarūpa.
अस्य सुवानस्य मन्दिनस्त्रितस्य नयर्बुदं वाव्र्धानो अस्तः|	he cast down arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by tṛta.
अवर्तयत सूर्यो न चक्रं भिनद वलमिन्द्रो अङगिरस्वान|	indra sent forth his whirling wheel like sūrya and aided by the aṅgirases rent vala.
नूनं सा ते परति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी|	now let that wealthy cow of thine o indra yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
शिक्षा सतोत्र्भ्यो माति धग भगो नो बर्हद वदेम व स|	give to thy praisers let not fortune fail us loud may we speak with brave men in the assembly.
उदु षय देवः सविता सवाय शश्वत्तमं तदपा वह्निरस्थात|	uprisen is savitar this god to quicken priest who neglects not this most constant duty.
नूनं देवेभ्यो वि हि धाति रत्नमथाभजद वीतिहोत्रं सवस्तौ|	to the gods verily he gives rich treasure and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.
विश्वस्य हि शरुष्टये देव ऊर्ध्वः पर बाहवा पर्थुपाणिः सिसर्ति|	having gone up on high the god broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him.
आपश्चिदस्य वरत आ निम्र्ग्रा अयं चिद वातो रमते परिज्मन|	even the waters bend them to his service even this wind rests in the circling region.
आशुभिश्चिद यान वि मुचाति नूनमरीरमदतमानं चिदेतोः|	though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them e’en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going.
अह्यर्षूणां चिन नययानविष्यामनु वरतं सवितुर्मोक्यागात|	he hath checked e’en their haste who glide like serpents night closely followed savitars dominion.
पुनः समव्यद विततं वयन्ती मध्या कर्तोर्न्यधाच्छक्म धीरः|	what was spread out she weaves afresh reweaving the skilful leaves his labour halfcompleted.
उत संहायास्थाद वय रतूं अदर्धररमतिःसविता देव आगात|	he hath arisen from rest and parted seasons savitar hath approached god holyminded.
नानौकांसि दुर्यो विश्वमायुर्वि तिष्ठते परभवः शोको अग्नेः|	through various dwellings through entire existence spreads manifest the household light of agni.
जयेष्ठं माता सूनवे भागमाधादन्वस्यकेतमिषितं सवित्रा|	the mother gives her son the goodliest portion and savitar hath sped to meet his summons.
समाववर्ति विष्ठितो जिगीषुर्विश्वेषां कामश्चरताममाभूत|	he comes again unfolded fain for conquest at home was he the love of all things moving.
शश्वानपो विक्र्तं हित्व्यागादनु वरतं सवितुर्दैव्यस्य|	each man hath come leaving his evil doings after the godlike savitars commandment.
तवया हितमप्यमप्सु भागं धन्वान्वा मर्गयसो वि तस्थुः|	the wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters.
वनानि विभ्यो नकिरस्य तानि वरता देवस्य सवितुर्मिनन्ति|	the woods are given to the birds these statutes of the god savitar none disobeyeth.
याद्राध्यं वरुणो योनिमप्यमनिशितं निमिषि जर्भुराणः|	with utmost speed in restless haste at sunset varuṇa seeks his watery habitation.
विश्वो मार्ताण्डो वरजमा पशुर्गात सथशो जन्मानि सविता वयाकः|	then seeks each bird his nest each beast his lodging in due place savitar hath set each creature.
न यस्येन्द्रो वरुणो न मित्रो वरतमर्यमा न मिनन्ति रुद्रः|	him whose high law not varuṇa nor indra not mitra aryaman nor rudra breaketh.
नारातयस्तमिदं सवस्ति हुवे देवं सवितारं नमोभिः|	nor evilhearted fiends here for my welfare him i invoke god savitar with worship.
भगं धियं वाजयन्तः पुरन्धिं नराशंसो गनास्पतिर्नो अव्याः|	may they who strengthen bliss and thought and wisdom and the dames’ lord and narāśaṁsa aid us.
आये वामस्य संगथे रयीणां परिया देवस्य सवितुः सयाम|	that good may come to us and wealth be gathered may we be savitar the gods beloved.
अस्मभ्यं तद दिवो अद्भ्यः पर्थिव्यास्त्वया दत्तं काम्यं राध आ गात|	so come to us our hearts desire the bounty bestowed by thee from heaven and earth and waters.
शं यत सतोत्र्भ्य आपये भवात्युरुशंसाय सवितर्जरित्रे|	that it be well with friends and those who praise thee and savitar with the loudlauding singer.
हुवे वः सुद्योत्मानं सुव्र्क्तिं विशामग्निमतिथिं सुप्रयसम|	for you i call the glorious refulgent agni the guest of men rich in oblations.
मित्र इव यो दिधिषाय्यो भूद देव आदेवे जने जातवेदाः|	whom all must strive to win even as a lover god among godly people jātavedas.
इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे दवितादधुर्भ्र्गवो विक्ष्वायोः|	bhṛgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living.
एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु भूमा देवानामग्निररतिर्जीराश्वः|	over all worlds let agni be the sovran the messenger of gods with rapid coursers.
अग्निं देवासो मानुषीषु विक्षु परियं धुः कषेष्यन्तो नमित्रम|	among the tribes of men the gods placed agni as a dear friend when they would dwell among them.
स दीदयदुशतीरूर्म्या आ दक्षाय्यो यो दास्वते दम आ|	against the longing nights may he shine brightly and show the offerer in the house his vigour.
अस्य रण्वा सवस्येव पुष्टिः सन्द्र्ष्टिरस्य हियानस्य दक्षोः|	sweet is his growth as of ones own possessions his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely.
वि यो भरिभ्रदोषधीषु जिह्वामत्यो न रथ्यो दोधवीति वारान|	he darts his tongue forth like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail among the bushes.
आ यन मे अभ्वं वनदः पनन्तोशिग्भ्यो नामिमीत वर्णम|	since they who honour me have praised my greatnesshe gave as twere his hue to those who love him.
स चित्रेण चिकिते रंसु भासा जुजुर्वान यो मुहुरा युवा भूत|	known is he by his bright delightful splendour and waxing old renews his youth for ever.
आ यो वना तात्र्षाणो न भाति वार्ण पथा रथ्येवस्वानीत|	like one athirst he lighteth up the forests like water down the chariot ways he roareth.
कर्ष्णाध्वा तपू रण्वश्चिकेत दयौरिव समयमानो नभोभिः|	on his black path he shines in burning beauty marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.
स यो वयस्थादभि दक्षदुर्वीं पशुर्नैति सवयुरगोपाः|	around consuming the broad earth he wanders free roaming like an ox without a herdsman.
अग्निः शोचिष्मानतसान्युष्णन कर्ष्णव्यथिरस्वदयन न भूम|	agni refulgent burning up the bushes with blackened lines as though the earth he seasoned.
नू ते पूर्वस्यावसो अधीतौ तर्तीये विदथे मन्म शंसि|	i in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly.
अस्मे अग्ने संयद्वीरं बर्हन्तं कषुमन्तं वाजं सवपत्यंरयिं दाः|	o agni give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.
तवया यथा गर्त्समदासो अग्ने गुहा वन्वन्त उपरानभि षयुः|	may the gṛtsamadas serving in secret through thee o agni overcome their neighbours.
सुवीरासो अभिमातिषाहः समत सूरिभ्यो गर्णते तद वयो धाः|	rich in good heroes and subduing foemen that vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.
अस्माकं मित्रावरुणावतं रथमादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा|	help varuṇa and mitra o ye twain allied with vasus rudras and Ādityas help our car.
पर यद वयो न पप्तन वस्मनस परि शरवस्यवोह्र्षीवन्तो वनर्षदः|	that as the wild birds of the forest from their home our horses may fly forth glad eager for renown.
अध समा न उदवता सजोषसो रथं देवासो अभि विक्षु वाजयुम|	yea now ye gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might.
यदाशवः पद्याभिस्तित्रतो रजः पर्थिव्याः सानौ जङघनन्त पाणिभिः|	when hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.
उत सय न इन्द्रो विश्वचर्षणिर्दिवः शर्धेन मारुतेन सुक्रतुः|	or may our indra here the friend of all mankind coming from heaven most wise girt by the marut host.
अनु नु सथात्यव्र्काभिरूतिभी रथं महे सनये वाजसातये|	accompany with aid untroubled by a foe our car to mighty gain to win the meed of strength.
उत सय देवो भुवनस्य सक्षणिस्त्वष्टा गनाभिः सजोषा जूजुवद रथम|	or may this tvaṣṭar god who rules the world with power oneminded with the goddesses speed forth our car.
इळा भगो बर्हद्दिवोत रोदसी पूषा पुरन्धिरश्विनावधा पती|	iḷā and bhaga the celestial earth and heaven pūṣan purandhi and the aśvins ruling lords.
उत तये देवी सुभगे मिथूद्र्शोषासानक्ता जगतामपीजुवा|	or seen alternate those two blessed goddesses morning and night who stir all living things to act.
सतुषे यद वां पर्थिवि नव्यसा वच सथातुश्च वयस्त्रिवया उपस्तिरे|	while with my newest song i praise you both o earth that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.
उत वः शंसमुशिजामिव शमस्यहिर्बुध्न्योअज एकपादुत|	your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire the dragon of the deep and ajaekapād.
तरित रभुक्षाः सविता चनो दधेअपां नपादाशुहेमा धिया शमि|	trita Ṛbhukṣan savitar shall joy in us and the floods swift child in our worship and our prayer.
एता वो वश्म्युद्यता यजत्रा अतक्षन्नायवो नव्यसे सम|	these earnest prayers i pray to you ye holy to pay you honour living men have formed them.
शरवस्यवो वाजं चकानाः सप्तिर्न रथ्यो अह धीतिमश्याः|	men fain to win the prize and glory may they win as a carhorse might the goal your notice.
जोहूत्रो अग्निः परथमः पितेवेळस पदे मनुषा यत समिद्धः|	agni first loudly calling like a father kindled by man upon the seat of worship.
शरियं वसानो अम्र्तो विचेता मर्म्र्जेन्यः शरवस्यःस वाजी|	clothed in his glory deathless keen of insight must be adorned by all the strong the famous.
शरूया अग्निश्चित्रभानुर्हवं मे विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरम्र्तो विचेताः|	may agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs immortal keen of insight.
शयावा रथं वहतो रोहिता वोतारुषाह चक्रे विभ्र्त्रः|	dark steeds or ruddy draw his car or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.
उत्तानायामजनयन सुषूतं भुवदग्निः पुरुपेशासु गर्भः|	on wood supine they got the wellformed infant a germ in variousfashioned plants was agni.
शिरिणायां चिदक्तुना महोभिरपरीव्र्तो वसति परचेताः|	and in the night not compassed round by darkness he dwells exceeding wise with rays of splendour.
जिघर्म्यग्निं हविषा घर्तेन परतिक्षियन्तं भुवनानि विश्वा|	with oil and sacred gifts i sprinkle agni who makes his home in front of all things living.
पर्थुं तिरश्चा वयसा बर्हन्तं वयचिष्ठमन्नै रभसं दर्शानम|	broad vast through vital power oer all expanded conspicuous strong with all the food that feeds him.
आ विश्वतः परत्यञ्चं जिघर्म्यरक्षसा मनसा तज्जुषेत|	i pour to him who looks in all directions may he accept it with a friendly spirit.
मर्यश्रीः सप्र्हयद्वर्णो अग्निर्नाभिम्र्शे तन्वा जर्भुराणः|	agni with bridegrooms grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.
जञेया भागं सहसानो वरेण तवादूतासो मनुवद वदेम|	by choice victorious recognize thy portion with thee for envoy may we speak like manu.
अनूनमग्निं जुह्वा वचस्या मधुप्र्चं धनसाजोहवीमि|	obtaining wealth i call on perfect agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.
परत्यु अदर्श्यायत्युछन्ती दुहिता दिवः|	advancing sending forth her rays the daughter of the sky is seen.
अपो महि वययति चक्षसे तमो जयोतिष कर्णोति सूनरी|	uncovering that we may see the mighty gloom the friendly lady makes the light.
उदुस्रियाः सर्जते सूर्यः सचानुद्यन नक्षत्रमर्चिवत|	the sun ascending the refulgent star pours down his beams together with the dawn.
तवेदुषो वयुषि सूर्यस्य च सं भक्तेन गमेमहि|	o dawn at thine arising and the suns may we attain the share allotted us.
परति तवा दुहितर्दिव उषो जीरा अभुत्स्महि|	promptly we woke to welcome thee o uṣas daughter of the sky.
या वहसि पुरुस्पार्हं वनन्वति रत्नं न दाशुषे मयः|	thee bounteous one who bringest all we long to have and to the offerer health and wealth.
उछन्ती या कर्णोषि मंहना महि परख्यै देवि सवर्द्र्शे|	thou dawning workest fain to light the great world yea heaven goddess that it may be seen.
तस्यास्ते रत्नभाज ईमहे वयं सयाम मातुर्न सूनवः|	we yearn to be thine own dealer of wealth may we be to this mother like her sons.
तच्चित्रं राध आ भरोषो यद दीर्घश्रुत्तमम|	bring us that wondrous bounty dawn that shall be famed most far away.
यत तेदिवो दुहितर्मर्तभोजनं तद रास्व भुनजामहै|	what child of heaven thou hast of nourishment for man bestow thou on us to enjoy.
शरवः सूरिभ्यो अम्र्तं वसुत्वनं वाजानस्मभ्यं गोमतः|	give to our princes opulence and immortal fame and strength in herds of kine to us.
चोदयित्री मघोनः सून्र्तावत्युषा उछदप सरिधः|	may she who prompts the wealthy lady of sweet strains may uṣas dawn our foes away.
आ वो वाहिष्ठो वहतु सतवध्यै रथो वाजा रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तः|	let your bestbearing car that must be lauded neer injured bring you vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.
अभि तरिप्र्ष्ठैः सवनेषु सोमैर्मदे सुशिप्रा महभिः पर्णध्वम|	fill you fairhelmeted with mighty soma thricemixed at our libations to delight you.
यूयं ह रत्नं मघवत्सु धत्थ सवर्द्र्श रभुक्षणो अम्र्क्तम|	ye who behold the light of heaven Ṛbhukṣans give our rich patrons unmolested riches.
सं यज्ञेषु सवधावन्तः पिबध्वं वि नो राधांसि मतिभिर्दयध्वम|	drink heavenlynatured at our sacrifices and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.
उवोचिथ हि मघवन देष्णं महो अर्भस्य वसुनो विभागे|	for thou o bounteous one art used to giving at parting treasure whether small or ample.
उभा ते पूर्णा वसुना गभस्ती न सून्र्ता नि यमते वसव्या|	filled full are both thine arms with great possessions thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches.
तवमिन्द्र सवयशा रभुक्षा वाजो न साधुरस्तमेष्य रक्वा|	indra highfamed as vāja and Ṛbhukṣans thou goest working singing to the dwelling.
वयं नु ते दाश्वांसः सयाम बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तो हरिवो वसिष्ठाः|	lord of bay steeds this day may we vasisthas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.
सनितासि परवतो दाशुषे चिद याभिर्विवेषो हर्यश्व धीभिः|	thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant through hymns lord of bay steeds which thou hast favoured.
ववन्मा नु ते युज्याभिरूती कदा न इन्द्र राय आ दशस्येः|	for thee with friendly succour have we battled and when o indra wilt thou grant us riches.
वासयसीव वेधसस्त्वं नः कदा न इन्द्र वचसो बुबोधः|	to us thy priests a home as twere thou givest when indra wilt thou recognize our praises.
अस्तं तात्या धिया रयिं सुवीरं पर्क्षो नो अर्वा नयुहीत वाजी|	may thy strong steed through our ancestral worship bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.
अभि यं देवी निरतिश्चिदीशे नक्षन्त इन्द्रं शरदःसुप्र्क्षः|	though nirrti the goddess reigneth round him autumns with food in plenty come to indra.
उप तरिबन्धुर्जरदष्टिमेत्यस्ववेशं यं कर्णवन्त मर्ताः|	with three close friends to length of days he cometh he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.
आ नो राधांसि सवितः सतवध्या आ रायो यन्तु पर्वतस्यरातौ|	promise us gifts o savitar may riches come unto us in parvatas full bounty.
सदा नो दिव्यः पायुः सिषक्तु यूयं पात|	may the celestial guardian still attend us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
अग्निं वो देवमग्निभिः सजोषा यजिष्ठं दूतमध्वरेक्र्णुध्वम|	associate with fires make your god agni envoy at sacrifice best skilled in worship.
यो मर्त्येषु निध्रुविरतावा तपुर्मूर्धा घर्तान्नः पावकः|	established firm among mankind the holy flamecrowned and fed with oil the purifier.
परोथदश्वो न यवसेअविष्यन यदा महः संवरणाद वयस्थात|	like a steed neighing eager for the pasture when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure.
आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरध सम ते वरजनं कर्ष्णमस्ति|	then the wind following blows upon his splendour and straight the path is black which thou hast travelled.
उद यस्य ते नवजातस्य वर्ष्णोअग्ने चरन्त्यजरा इधानाः|	from thee a bull but newly born o agni the kindled everlasting flames rise upward.
अछा दयामरुषो धूम एति सं दूतो अग्न ईयसे हि देवान|	aloft to heaven thy ruddy smoke ascendeth agni thou speedest to the gods as envoy.
वि यस्य ते पर्थिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत तर्षु यदन्ना समव्र्क्तजम्भैः|	thou whose fresh lustre oer the earth advanceth when greedily with thy jaws thy food thou eatest.
सेनेव सर्ष्टा परसितिष ट एति यवं न दस्म जुह्वा विवेक्षि|	like a host hurried onward comes thy lasso fierce with thy tongue thou piercest as twere barley.
तमिद दोषा तमुषसि यविष्ठमग्निमत्यं न मर्जयन्त नरः|	the men have decked him both at eve and morning most youthful agni as they tend a courser.
निशिशाना अतिथिमस्य योनौ दीदाय शोचिराहुतस्य वर्ष्णः|	they kindle him a guest within his dwelling bright shines the splendour of the worshipped hero.
सुसन्द्र्क ते सवनीक परतीकं वि यद रुक्मो न रोचस उपाके|	o fair of face beautiful is thine aspect when very near at hand like gold thou gleamest.
दिवो न ते तन्यतुरेति शुष्मश्चित्रो न सूरः परति चक्षि भानुम|	like heavens thundering roar thy might approaches and like the wondrous sun thy light thou showest.
यथा वः सवाहाग्नये दाशेम परीळाभिर्घ्र्तवद्भिश्च हव्यैः|	that we may worship with your hail to agni with sacrificial cakes and fat oblations.
तेभिर्नो अग्ने अमितैर्महोभिः शतं पूर्भिरायसीभिर्नि पाहि|	guard us o agni with those boundless glories as with a hundred fortresses of iron.
या वा ते सन्ति दाशुषे अध्र्ष्टा गिरो वा याभिर्न्र्वतीरुरुष्याः|	thine are resistless songs for him who offers and herogiving hymns wherewith thou savest.
ताभिर्नः सूनो सहसो नि पाहि समत सूरीञ जरितॄञ जातवेदः|	with these o son of strength o jātavedas guard us preserve these princes and the singers.
निर्यत पूतेव सवधितिः शुचिर्गात सवया कर्पा तन्वा रोचमानः|	when forth he cometh like an axe newsharpened pure in his form resplendent in his body.
आ यो मात्रोरुशेन्यो जनिष्ट देवयज्याय सुक्रतुः पावकः|	sprung sought with eager longing from his parents for the gods worship sage and purifier.
एता नो अग्ने सौभगा दिदीह्यपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतेम|	shine this felicity on us o agni may we attain to perfect understanding.
विश्वा सतोत्र्भ्यो गर्णते च सन्तु यूयं पात|	all happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
पर साकमुक्षे अर्चता गणाय यो दैव्यस्य धाम्नस्तुविष्मान|	sing to the troop that pours down rain in common the mighty company of celestial nature.
उत कषोदन्ति रोदसी महित्वा नक्षन्ते नाकं निरतेरवंशात|	they make the worldhalves tremble with their greatness from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven.
जनूश्चिद वो मरुतस्त्वेष्येण भीमासस्तुविमन्यवोअयासः|	yea your birth maruts was with wild commotion ye who move swiftly fierce in wrath terrific.
पर ये महोभिरोजसोत सन्ति विश्वो वो यामन भयते सवर्द्र्क|	ye allsurpassing in your might and vigour each looker on the light fears at your coming.
बर्हद वयो मघवद्भ्यो दधात जुजोषन्निन मरुतः सुष्टुतिं नः|	give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the maruts.
गतो नाध्वा वि तिराति जन्तुं पर ण सपार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेत|	as the way travelled helpeth people onward so further us with your delightful succours.
युष्मोतो विप्रो मरुतः शतस्वी युष्मोतो अर्वा सहुरिः सहस्री|	your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand.
युष्मोतः सम्राळ उत हन्ति वर्त्रं पर तद वो अस्तु धूतयो देष्णम|	the sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman may this your gift ye shakers be distinguished.
ताना रुद्रस्य मीळ्हुषो विवासे कुविन नंसन्ते मरुतः पुनर्नः|	i call as such the sons of bounteous rudra will not the maruts turn again to usward.
यत सस्वर्ता जिहीळिरे यदाविरव तदेन ईमहे तुराणाम|	what secret sin or open stirs their anger that we implore the swift ones to forgive us.
परा सा वाचि सुष्टुतिर्मघोनामिदं सूक्तं मरुतो जुषन्त|	this eulogy of the bounteous hath been spoken accept ye maruts this our hymn of praises.
आराच्चिद दवेषो वर्षणो युयोत यूयं पात|	ye bulls keep those who hate us at a distance preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
आ विश्ववाराश्विना गतं नः पर तत सथानमवाचि वां पर्थिव्याम|	rich in all blessings aśvins come ye hither this place on earth is called your own possession.
अश्वो न वाजी शुनप्र्ष्ठो अस्थादा यत सेदथुर्ध्रुवसे न योनिम|	like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth whereon as in a lap ye seat you firmly.
सिषक्ति सा वां सुमतिश्चनिष्ठातापि घर्मो मनुषो दुरोणे|	this most delightful eulogy awaits you in the mans house drinkoffering hath been heated.
यो वां समुद्रान सरितः पिपर्त्येतग्वा चिन न सुयुजा युजानः|	which bringeth you over the seas and rivers yoking astwere two wellmatched shining horses.
यानि सथानान्यश्विना दधाथे दिवो यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु|	whatever dwellings ye possess o aśvins in fields of men or in the streams of heaven.
नि पर्वतस्य मूर्धनि सदन्तेषं जनाय दाशुषेवहन्ता|	resting upon the summit of the mountain or bringing food to him who gives oblation.
चनिष्टं देवा ओषधीष्वप्सु यद योग्या अश्नवैथे रषीणाम|	delight yourselves ye gods in plants and waters when Ṛṣis give them and ye find they suit you.
पुरूणि रत्ना दधतौ नयस्मे अनु पूर्वाणि चख्यथुर्युगानि|	enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.
शुश्रुवांसा चिदश्विना पुरूण्यभि बरह्माणि चक्षाथे रषीणाम|	aśvins though ye have heard them oft aforetime regard the many prayers which Ṛṣis offer.
परति पर यातं वरमा जनायास्मे वामस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा|	come to the man even as his heart desireth may we enjoy your most delightful favour.
यो वां यज्ञो नासत्या हविष्मान कर्तब्रह्मा समर्यो भवाति|	come to the sacrifice offered you nāsatyas with men oblations and prayer duly uttered.
उप पर यातं वरमा वसिष्ठमिमा बरह्माण्य रच्यन्ते युवभ्याम|	come to vasiṣṭha as his heart desireth for unto you these holy hymns are chanted.
इयं मनीषा इयमश्विना गीरिमां सुव्र्क्तिं वर्षणा जुषेथाम|	this is the thought this is the song o aśvins accept this hymn of ours ye steers with favour.
इमा बरह्माणि युवयून्यग्मन यूयं पात|	may these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
वयुषा आवो दिविजा रतेनाविष्क्र्ण्वाना महिमानमागात|	born in the heavens the dawn hath flushed and showing her majesty is come as law ordaineth.
अप दरुहस्तम आवरजुष्टमङगिरस्तमा पथ्या अजीगः|	she hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness best of aṅgirases hath waked the pathways.
महे नो अद्य सुविताय बोध्युषो महे सौभगाय पर यन्धि|	rouse us this day to high and happy fortune to great felicity o dawn promote us.
चित्रं रयिं यशसं धेह्यस्मे देवि मर्तेषु मानुषि शरवस्युम|	vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches famed among mortals manbefriending goddess.
एते तये भानवो दर्शतायाश्चित्रा उषसो अम्र्तास आगुः|	see lovely mornings everlasting splendours bright with their varied colours have approached us.
जनयन्तो दैव्यानि वरतान्याप्र्णन्तो अन्तरिक्षा वयस्थुः|	filling the region of midair producing the rites of holy worship they have mounted.
एषा सया युजाना पराकात पञ्च कषितीः परि सद्यो जिगाति|	she yokes her chariot far away and swiftly visits the lands where the five tribes are settled.
अभिपश्यन्ती वयुना जनानां दिवो दुहिता भुवनस्यपत्नी|	looking upon the works and ways of mortals daughter of heaven the worlds imperial lady.
वाजिनीवती सूर्यस्य योषा चित्रामघा राय ईशे वसूनाम|	she who is rich in spoil the spouse of sūrya wondrously opulent rules all wealth and treasures.
रषिष्टुता जरयन्ती मघोन्युषा उछति वह्निभिर्ग्र्णाना|	consumer of our youth the seers extol her lauded by priests rich dawn shines out refulgent.
परति दयुतानामरुषासो अश्वाश्चित्रा अद्र्श्रन्नुषसं वहन्तः|	apparent are the steeds of varied colour the red steeds carrying resplendent morning.
याति शुभ्रा विश्वपिशा रथेन दधाति रत्नंविधते जनाय|	on her alllovely car she comes the fair one and brings rich treasure for her faithful servant.
सत्या सत्येभिर्महती महद्भिर्देवी देवेभिर्यजता यजत्रैः|	true with the true and mighty with the mighty with gods a goddess holy with the holy.
रुजद दर्ळ्हानि दददुस्रियाणां परति गाव उषसं वावशन्त|	she brake strong fences down and gave the cattle the kine were lowing as they greeted morning.
नू नो गोमद वीरवद धेहि रत्नमुषो अश्वावद पुरुभोजो अस्मे|	o dawn now give us wealth in kine and heroes and horses fraught with manifold enjoyment.
मा नो बर्हिः पुरुषता निदे कर्यूयं पात|	protect our sacred grass from mans reproaches preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
अमीवहा वास्तोष पते विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन|	vastospati who killest all disease and wearest every form.
सखा सुशेव एधि नः|	be an auspicious friend to us.
यदर्जुन सारमेय दतः पिशङग यछसे|	when o bright son of saramā thou showest tawnyhued thy teeth.
वीव भराजन्त रष्टय उप सरक्वेषु बप्सतो नि षु सवप|	they gleam like lances points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite go thou to steep.
सतेनं राय सारमेय तस्करं वा पुनःसर|	saramās son retrace thy way bark at the robber and the thief.
सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य रायसि किमस्मान दुछुनायसे नि षु सवप|	at indras singers barkest thou why dust thou seek to terrify us go to sleep.
तवं सूकरस्य दर्द्र्हि तव दर्दर्तु सूकरः|	be on thy guard against the boar and let the boar beware of thee.
सतोतॄनिन्द्रस्य|	at indras singers barkest thou why dost thou seek to terrify us go to sleep.
सस्तु माता सस्तु पिता सस्तु शवा सस्तु विश्पतिः|	sleep mother let the father sleep sleep dog and master of the house.
ससन्तु सर्वे जञातयः सस्त्वयमभितो जनः|	let all the kinsmen sleep sleep all the people who are round about.
य आस्ते यश्च चरति यश्च पश्यति नो जनः|	the man who sits the man who walks and whosoever looks on us.
तेषांसं हन्मो अक्षाणि यथेदं हर्म्यं तथा|	of these we closely shut the eyes even as we closely shut this house.
सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभो यः समुद्रादुदाचरत|	the bull who hath a thousand horns who rises up from out the sea.
तेना सहस्येना वयं नि जनान सवापयामसि|	by him the strong and mighty one we lull and make the people sleep.
परोष्ठशया वह्येशया नारीर्यास्तल्पशीवरीः|	the women sleeping in the court lying without or stretched on beds.
सत्रियो याः पुण्यगन्धास्ताः सर्वाः सवापयामसि|	the matrons with their odorous sweetsthese one and all we lull to sleep.
पर दयावा यज्ञैः पर्थिवी नमोभिः सबाध ईळे बर्हतीयजत्रे|	as priest with solemn rites and adorations i worship heaven and earth the high and holy.
ते चिद धि पूर्वे कवयो गर्णन्तः पुरो मही दधिरे देवपुत्रे|	to them great parents of the gods have sages of ancient time singing assigned precedence.
पर पूर्वजे पितरा नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिः कर्णुध्वं सदने रतस्य|	with newest hymns set in the seat of order those the two parents born before all others.
आ नो दयावाप्र्थिवी दैव्येन जनेन यातं महि वां वरूथम|	come heaven and earth with the celestial people hither to us for strong is your protection.
उतो हि वां रत्नधेयानि सन्ति पुरूणि दयावाप्र्थिवी सुदासे|	yea heaven and earth ye hold in your possession full many a treasure for the liberal giver.
अस्मे धत्तं यदसदस्क्र्धोयु यूयं पात|	grant us that wealth which comes in free abundance preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
समिधा जातवेदसे देवाय देवहूतिभिः|	with reverence and with offered gifts serve we the god whose flame is bright.
हविर्भिः शुक्रशोचिषे नमस्विनो वयं दाशेमाग्नये|	let us bring jātavedas fuel and adore agni when we invoke the gods.
वयं ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम वयं दाशेम सुष्टुती यजत्र|	agni may we perform thy rites with fuel and honour thee o holy one with praises.
वयं घर्तेनाध्वरस्य होतर्वयं देव हविषा भद्रशोचे|	honour thee priest of sacrifice with butter thee god of blessed light with our oblation.
आ नो देवेभिरुप देवहूतिमग्ने याहि वषट्क्र्तिं जुषाणः|	come agni with the gods to our invoking come pleased to offerings sanctified with vaṣaṭ.
तुभ्यं देवाय दाशतः सयाम यूयं पात|	may we be his who pays thee god due honour ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
संवत्सरं शशयाना बराह्मणा वरतचारिणः|	they who lay quiet for a year the brahmans who fulfil their vows.
वाचं पर्जन्यजिन्वितां पर मण्डूका अवादिषुः|	the frogs have lifted up their voice the voice parjanya hath inspired.
दिव्या आपो अभि यदेनमायन दर्तिं न शुष्कं सरसी शयानम|	what time on these as on a dry skin lying in the pools bed the floods of heaven descended.
गवामह न मायुर्वत्सिनीनां मण्दूकानां वग्नुरत्रा समेति|	the music of the frogs comes forth in concert like the cows lowing with their calves beside them.
यदीमेनानुशतो अभ्यवर्षीत तर्ष्यावतः पराव्र्ष्यागतायाम|	when at the coming of the rains the water has poured upon them as they yearned and thirsted.
अख्खलीक्र्त्या पितरं न पुत्रो अन्यो अन्यमुप वदन्तमेति|	one seeks another as he talks and greets him with cries of pleasure as a son his father.
अन्यो अन्यमनु गर्भ्णात्येनोरपां परसर्गे यदमन्दिषाताम|	each of these twain receives the other kindly while they are revelling in the flow of waters.
मण्डूको यदभिव्र्ष्टः कनिष्कन पर्ष्निः सम्प्र्ङकते हरितेन वाचम|	when the frog moistened by the rain springs forward and green and spotty both combine their voices.
यदेषामन्यो अन्यस्य वाचं शाक्तस्येव वदति शिक्षमाणः|	when one of these repeats the others language as he who learns the lesson of the teacher.
सर्वं तदेषां सम्र्धेव पर्व यत सुवाचो वदथनाध्यप्सु|	your every limb seems to be growing larger as ye converse with eloquence on the waters.
गोमायुरेको अजमायुरेकः पर्श्निरेको हरित एक एषाम|	onc is cowbellow and goatbleat the other one frog is green and one of them is spotty.
समानं नाम बिभ्रतो विरूपाः पुरुत्रा वाचं पिपिशुर्वदन्तः|	they bear one common name and yet they vary and talking modulate the voice diversely.
बराह्मणासो अतिरात्रे न सोमे सरो न पूर्णमभितो वदन्तः|	as brahmans sitting round the brimful vessel talk at the somarite of atiratra.
संवत्सरस्य तदहः परि षठ यन मण्डूकाः पराव्र्षीणं बभूव|	so frogs ye gather round the pool to honour this day of all the year the first of raintime.
बराह्मणासः सोमिनो वाचमक्रत बरह्म कर्ण्वन्तः परिवत्सरीणम|	these brahmans with the soma juice performing their yearlong rite have lifted up their voices.
अध्वर्यवो घर्मिणः सिष्विदाना आविर्भवन्ति गुह्या न के चित|	and these adhvaryus sweating with their kettles come forth and show themselves and none are hidden.
देवहितिं जुगुपुर्द्वादशस्य रतुं नरो न पर मिनन्त्येते|	they keep the twelve months godappointed order and never do the men neglect the season.
संवत्सरे पराव्र्ष्यागतायां तप्ता घर्मा अश्नुवते विसर्गम|	soon as the raintime in the year returneth these who were heated kettles gain their freedom.
गोमायुरदादजमायुरदात पर्श्निरदाद धरितो नो वसूनि|	cowbellow and goatbleat have granted riches and green and spotty have vouchsafed us treasure.
गवां मण्डूका ददतः शतानि सहस्रसावे पर तिरन्त आयुः|	the frogs who give us cows in hundreds lengthen our lives in this most fertilizing season.
पर सम्राजो असुरस्य परशस्तिं पुंसः कर्ष्टीनामनुमाद्यस्य|	praise of the asura high imperial ruler the manly one in whom the folk shall triumph.
इन्द्रस्येव पर तवसस कर्तानि वन्दे दारुं वन्दमानोविवक्मि|	i laud his deeds who is as strong as indra and lauding celebrate the fortdestroyer.
कविं केतुं धासिं भानुमद्रेर्हिन्वन्ति शं राज्यं रोदस्योः|	sage sing food lightthey bring him from the mountain the blessed sovran of the earth and heaven.
पुरन्दरस्य गीर्भिरा विवासेअग्नेर्व्रतानि पूर्व्या महानि|	i decorate with songs the mighty actions which agni fortdestroyer did aforetime.
नयक्रतून गरथिनो मर्ध्रवाचः पणीन्रश्रद्धानव्र्धानयज्ञान|	the foolish faithless rudelyspeaking niggards without belief or sacrifice or worship.
परपर तान दस्यून्रग्निर्विवाय पूर्वश्चकारापरानयज्यून|	far far sway hath agni chased those dasytis and in the cast hath turned the godless westward.
यो अपाचीने तमसि मदन्तीः पराचीश्चकार नर्तमः शचीभिः|	him who brought eastward manliest with his prowess the maids rejoicing in the western darkness.
तमीशानं वस्वो अग्निं गर्णीषेअनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून|	that agni i extol the lord of riches unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.
यो देह्यो अनमयद वधस्नैर्यो अर्यपत्नीरुषसश्चकार|	him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons and gave the mornings to anoble husband.
स निरुध्या नहुषो यज्वो अग्निर्विशश्चक्रे बलिह्र्तः सहोभिः|	young agni who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of nahus made them bring their tribute.
यस्य शर्मन्नुप विश्वे जनास एवैस्तस्थुः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणाः|	in whose protection all men rest by nature desiring to enjoy his gracious favour.
वैश्वानरो वरमा रोदस्योराग्निः ससाद पित्रोरुपस्थम|	agni vaiśvānara in his parents bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.
आ देवो ददे बुध्न्या वसूनि वैश्वानर उदिता सूर्यस्य|	vaiśvānara the god at the suns setting hath taken to himself deephidden treasures.
आ समुद्रादवरादा परस्मादाग्निर्ददे दिव आ पर्थिव्याः|	agni hath taken them from earth and heaven from the sea under and the sea above us.
नू मर्तो दयते सनिष्यन यो विष्णव उरुगायाय दाशत|	neer doth the man repent who seeking profit bringeth his gift to the farstriding viṣṇu.
पर यः सत्राचा मनसा यजात एतावन्तं नर्यम आविवासात|	he who adoreth him with all his spirit winneth himself so great a benefactor.
तवं विष्णो सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम अप्रयुताम एवयावो मतिं दाः|	thou viṣṇu constant in thy courses gavest goodwill to all men and a hymn that lasteth.
पर्चो यथा नः सुवितस्य भूरेर अश्वावतः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः|	that thou mightst move us to abundant comfort of very splendid wealth with store of horses.
तरिर देवः पर्थिवीम एष एतां वि चक्रमे शतर्चसम महित्वा|	three times strode forth this god in all his grandeur over this earth bright with a hundred splendours.
पर विष्णुर अस्तु तवसस तवीयान तवेषं हय अस्य सथविरस्य नाम|	foremost be viṣṇu stronger than the strongest for glorious is his name who lives for ever.
वि चक्रमे पर्थिवीम एष एतां कषेत्राय विष्णुर मनुषे दशस्यन|	over this earth with mighty step strode viṣṇu ready to give it for a home to manu.
धरुवासो अस्य कीरयो जनास उरुक्षितिं सुजनिमा चकार|	in him the humble people trust for safety he nobly born hath made them spacious dwellings.
पर तत ते अद्य शिपिविष्ट नामार्यः शंसामि वयुनानि विद्वान|	today i laud this name o gipivista i skilled in rules the name of thee the noble.
तं तवा गर्णामि तवसम अतव्यान कषयन्तम अस्य रजसः पराके|	yea i the poor and weak praise thee the mighty who dwellest in the realm beyond this region.
किम इत ते विष्णो परिचक्ष्यम भूत पर यद ववक्षे शिपिविष्टो अस्मि|	what was there to be blamed in thee o viṣṇu when thou declaredst i am sipivista.
मा वर्पो अस्मद अप गूह एतद यद अन्यरूपः समिथे बभूथ|	hide not this form from us nor keep it secret since thou didst wear another shape in battle.
वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम|	o viṣṇu unto thee my lips cry vaṣaṭ let this mine offering sipivista please thee.
वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः|	may these my songs of eulogy exalt thee preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
दिवि कषयन्ता रजसः पर्थिव्यां पर वां घर्तस्य निर्णिजोददीरन|	ye twain who rule in heaven and earth the region clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness.
हव्यं नो मित्रो अर्यमा सुजातो राजा सुक्षत्रो वरुणो जुषन्त|	may the imperial varuṇa and mitra and highborn aryaman accept our presents.
आ राजाना मह रतस्य गोपा सिन्धुपती कषत्रिया यातमर्वाक|	kings guards of rrtighty everlasting order come hitherward ye princes lords of rivers.
इळां नो मित्रावरुणोत वर्ष्टिमव दिव इन्वतं जीरदानू|	send us from heaven o varuṇa and mitra rain and sweet food ye who pour down your bounties.
मित्रस्तन नो वरुणो देवो अर्यः पर साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभिर्नयन्तु|	may the dear god and varuṇa and mitra conduct us by the most effective pathways.
बरवद यथा न आदरिः सुदास इषा मदेम सह देवगोपाः|	that foes may say unto sudās our chieftain may we too joy in food with gods to guard us.
यो वां गर्तं मनसा तक्षदेतमूर्ध्वां धीतिं कर्णवद धारयच्च|	him who hath wrought for you this car in spirit who makes the song rise upward and sustains it.
उक्षेथां मित्रावरुणा घर्तेन ता राजानासुक्षितीस्तर्पयेथाम|	bedew with fatness varuṇa nd mitra ye kings make glad the pleasant dwellingplaces.
एष सतोमो वरुण मित्र तुभ्यं सोमः शुक्रो न वायवेअयामि|	to you this laud o varuṇa and mitra is offered like bright soma juice to vāyu.
अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तं पुरम्धीर्यूयं पात|	favour our songs of praise wake thought and spirit preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
आ वायो भूष शुचिपा उप नः सहस्रं ते नियुतो विश्ववार|	o vĀyu drinker of the pure be near us a thousand teams are thine allbounteous giver.
उपो ते अन्धो मद्यमयामि यस्य देव दधिषे पूर्वपेयम|	to thee the rapturebringing juice is offered whose first draught god thou takest as thy portion.
पर सोता जीरो अध्वरेष्वस्थात सोममिन्द्राय वायवे पिबध्यै|	prompt at the holy rites forth came the presser with somadraughts for indra and for vāyu.
पर यद वां मध्वो अग्रियं भरन्त्यध्वर्यवो देवयन्तः शचीभिः|	when ministering priests with strong devotion bring to you twain the first taste of the soma.
पर याभिर्यासि दाश्वांसमछा नियुद्भिर्वायविष्टयेदुरोणे|	the teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers within his home o viyu to direct him.
नि नो रयिं सुभोजसं युवस्व नि वीरं गव्यमश्व्यं च राधः|	therewith send wealth to us with full enjoyment a hero son and gifts of kine and horses.
ये वायव इन्द्रमादनास आदेवासो नितोशनासो अर्यः|	near to the gods and making indra joyful devout and offering precious gifts to vāyu.
घनन्तो वर्त्राणि सूरिभिः षयाम सासह्वांसो युधा नर्भिरमित्रान|	allied with princes smiting down the hostile may we with heroes conquer foes in battle.
आ नो नियुद्भिः शतिनीभिरध्वरं सहस्रिणीभिरुप याहि यज्ञम|	with thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come to our sacrifice and solemn worship.
वायो अस्मिन सवने मादयस्व यूयं पात|	come vāyu make thee glad at this libation preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
वास्तोष पते परति जानीह्यस्मान सवावेशो अनमीवो भवा नः|	acknowledge us o guardian of the homestead bring no disease and give us happy entrance.
यत तवेमहे परति तन नो जुषस्व शं नो भव दविपदे शं चतुष्पदे|	whateer we ask of thee be pleased to grant it and prosper thou quadrupeds and bipeds.
वास्तोष पते परतरणो न एधि गयस्फानो गोभिरश्वेभिरिन्दो|	protector of the home be our promoter increase our wealth in kine and steeds o indu.
अजरासस्ते सख्ये सयाम पितेव पुत्रान परति नो जुषस्व|	may we be everyouthful in thy friendship be pleased in us as in his sons a father.
वास्तोष पते शग्मया संसदा ते सक्षीमहि रण्वया गातुमत्या|	through thy dear fellowship that bringeth welfare may we be victors guardian of the dwelling.
पाहि कषेम उत योगे वरं नो यूयं पात|	protect our happiness in rest and labour preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
अबोधि जार उषसामुपस्थाद धोता मन्द्रः कवितमः पावकः|	roused from their bosom is the dawns beloved the joyous priest most sapient purifier.
दधाति केतुमुभयस्य जन्तोर्हव्या देवेषु दरविणं सुक्र्त्सु|	he gives a signal both to gods and mortals to gods oblations riches to the pious.
स सुक्रतुर्यो वि दुरः पणीनां पुनानो अर्कं पुरुभोजसं नः|	most wise is he who forcing doors of paṇis brought the bright sun to us who feedeth many.
होता मन्द्रो विशां दमूनास्तिरस्तमो दद्र्शे राम्याणाम|	the cheerful priest mens friend and homecompanion through still nights darkness he is made apparent.
अमूरः कविरदितिर्विवस्वान सुसंसन मित्रो अतिथिः शिवोनः|	wise neer deceived uncircumscribed refulgent our gracious guest a friend with good attendants.
चित्रभानुरुषसां भात्यग्रेअपां गर्भः परस्वा विवेश|	shines forth with wondrous light before the mornings the young plants hath he entered child of waters.
ईळेन्यो वो मनुषो युगेषु समनगा अशुचज्जातवेदाः|	seeking our gatherings he your jātavedas hath shone adorable through human ages.
सुसन्द्र्शा भानुना यो विभाति परति गावः समिधानं बुधन्त|	who gleams refulgent with his lovely lustre the kine have waked to meet him when enkindled.
अग्ने याहि दूत्यं मा रिषण्यो देवानछा बरह्मक्र्ता गणेन|	go on thy message to the gods and fail not o agni with their band who pray and worship.
सरस्वतीं मरुतो अश्विनापो यक्षि देवान रत्नधेयायविश्वान|	bring all the gods that they may give us riches sarasvatī the maruts aśvins waters.
तवामग्ने समिधानो वसिष्ठो जरूथं हन यक्षि राये पुरन्धिम|	vasiṣṭha when enkindling thee o agni hath slain jarutha give us wealth in plenty.
पुरुणीथा जातवेदो जरस्व यूयं पात|	sing praise in choral song o jātavedas ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
यस्तिग्मश्र्ङगो वर्षभो न भीम एकः कर्ष्टीश्च्यावयति पर विश्वाः|	he like a bull with sharpened horns terrific singly excites and agitates all the people.
यः शश्वतो अदाशुषो गयस्य परयन्तासिसुष्वितराय वेदः|	thou givest him who largely pours libations his goods who pours not for his own possession.
तवं ह तयदिन्द्र कुत्समावः शुश्रूषमाणस्तन्वा समर्ये|	thou verily indra gavest help to kutsa willingly giving car to him in battle.
दासं यच्छुष्णं कुयवं नयस्मा अरन्धय आर्जुनेयाय शिक्षन|	when aiding Ārjuneya thou subduedst to him both kuyava and the dāsa Śuṣṇa.
तवं धर्ष्णो धर्षता वीतहव्यं परावो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सुदासम|	o bold one thou with all thine aids hast boldly holpen sudās whose offerings were accepted.
पर पौरुकुत्सिं तरसदस्युमावः कषेत्रसाता वर्त्रहत्येषु पूरुम|	pūru in winning land and slaying foemen and trasadasyu son of purukutsa.
तवं नर्भिर्न्र्मणो देववीतौ भूरीणि वर्त्रा हर्यश्व हंसि|	at the gods banquet herosouled with heroes lord of bay steeds thou slewest many foemen.
तवं नि दस्युं चुमुरिं धुनिं चास्वापयो दभीतये सुहन्तु|	thou sentest in swift death to sleep the dasyu both cumuri and dhuni for dabhīti.
तव चयौत्नानि वज्रहस्त तानि नव यत पुरो नवतिं च सद्यः|	these were thy mighty powers that thunderwielder thou swiftly crushedst nineandninety castles.
निवेशने शततमाविवेषीरहञ्च वर्त्रं नमुचिमुताहन|	thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught thou slewest namuci thou slewest vṛtra.
सना ता त इन्द्र भोजनानि रातहव्याय दाशुषे सुदासे|	old are the blessings indra which thou gavest sudās the worshipper who brought oblations.
वर्ष्णे ते हरी वर्षणा युनज्मि वयन्तु बरह्माणि पुरुशाक वाजम|	for thee the strong i yoke thy strong bay horses may our prayers reach thee and win strength most mighty.
मा ते अस्यां सहसावन परिष्टावघाय भूम हरिवः परादै|	give us not up lord of bay horses victor in this thine own assembly to the wicked.
तरायस्व नोअव्र्केभिर्वरूथैस्तव परियासः सूरिषु सयाम|	deliver us with true and faithful succours dear may we be to thee among the princes.
परियास इत ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरो मदेम शरणे सखायः|	may we men maghavan the friends thou lovest near thee be joyful under thy protection.
नि तुर्वशं नि याद्वं शिशीह्यतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन|	fain to fulfil the wish of atithigva humble the pride of turvaśa and yadva.
सद्यश्चिन नु ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरः शंसन्त्युक्थशास उक्था|	swiftly in truth o maghavan about thee men skilled in hymning sing their songs and praises.
ये ते हवेभिर्वि पणीन्रदाशन्नस्मान वर्णीष्व युज्याय तस्मै|	elect us also into their assembly who by their calls on thee despoiled the niggards.
एते सतोमा नरां नर्तम तुभ्यमस्मद्र्यञ्चो ददतो मघानि|	thine are these lauds o manliest of heroes lauds which revert to us and give us riches.
तेषामिन्द्र वर्त्रहत्ये शिवो भूः सखा च शूरोअविताच नर्णाम|	favour these indra when they fight with faemen as friend and hero and the heroes helper.
नू इन्द्र शूर सतवमान ऊती बरह्मजूतस्तन्वा वाव्र्धस्व|	now lauded for thine aid heroic indra sped by our prayer wax mighty in thy body.
उप नो वाजान मिमीह्युप सतीन यूयं पात|	apportion to us strength and habitations ye gods protect us evermore with blessings.
परो मात्रया तन्व्र वर्धान न ते महित्वम अन्व अश्नुवन्ति|	men come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body.
उभे ते विद्म रजसी पर्थिव्या विष्णो देव तवम परमस्य वित्से|	both thy two regions of the earth o viṣṇu we know thou god knowest the highest also.
न ते विष्णो जायमानो न जातो देव महिम्नः परम अन्तम आप|	none who is born or being born god viṣṇu hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur.
उद अस्तभ्ना नाकम रष्वम बर्हन्तं दाधर्थ पराचीं ककुभम पर्थिव्याः|	the vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported and fixed earths eastern pinnacle securely.
इरावती धेनुमती हि भूतं सूयवसिनी मनुषे दशस्या|	rich in sweet food be ye and rich in milchkine with fertile pastures fain to do men service.
वय अस्तभ्ना रोदसी विष्णव एते दाधर्थ पर्थिवीम अभितो मयूखैः|	both these worlds viṣṇu hast thou stayed asunder and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.
उरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुर उलोकं जनयन्ता सूर्यम उषासम अग्निम|	ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating sūrya dawn and agni.
दासस्य चिद वर्षशिप्रस्य माया जघ्नथुर नरा पर्तनाज्येषु|	o heroes ye have conquered in your battles even the bulljawed dāsas wiles and magic.
इन्द्राविष्णू दरंहिताः शम्बरस्य नव पुरो नवतिं च शनथिष्टम|	ye have destroyed thou indra and thou viṣṇu Śambaras nineandninety fenced castles.
शतं वर्चिनः सहस्रं च साकं हथो अप्रत्य असुरस्य वीरान|	ye twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal varcin.
इयम मनीषा बर्हती बर्हन्तोरुक्रमा तवसा वर्धयन्ती|	this is the lofty hymn of praise exalting the lords of mighty stride the strong and lofty.
ररे वां सतोमं विदथेषु विष्णो पिन्वतम इषो वर्जनेष्व इन्द्र|	i laud you in the solemn synods viṣṇu pour ye food on us in our camps o indra.
वषट ते विष्णव आस आ कर्णोमि तन मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम|	o viṣṇu unto thee my lips cry vaṣaṭ let this mine offering sipivista please thee.
वर्धन्तु तवा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः|	may these my songs of eulogy exalt thee preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
इन्द्रं नरो नेमधिता हवन्ते यत पार्या युनजते धियस्ताः|	men call on indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive.
शूरो नर्षाता शवसश्चकान आ गोमति वरजे भजात्वं नः|	hero rejoicing in thy might in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle.
य इन्द्र शुष्मो मघवन ते अस्ति शिक्षा सखिभ्यः पुरुहूतन्र्भ्यः|	grant indra maghavan invoked of many to these my friends the strength which thou possessest.
तवं हि दर्ळ्हा मघवन विचेता अपा वर्धि परिव्र्तं न राधः|	thou maghavan hast rent strong places open unclose for us wise god thy hidden bounty.
इन्द्रो राजा जगतश्चर्षणीनामधि कषमि विषुरूपं यदस्ति|	king of the living world of men is indra of all in varied form that earth containeth.
ततो ददाति दाशुषे वसूनि चोदद राध उपस्तुतश्चिदर्वाक|	thence to the worshipper he giveth riches may he enrich us also when we laud him.
नू चिन न इन्द्रो मघवा सहूती दानो वाजं नि यमते न ऊती|	maghavan indra when we all invoke him bountiful ever sendeth strength to aid us.
अनूना यस्य दक्षिणा पीपाय वामं नर्भ्यो अभिवीता सखिभ्यः|	whose perfect guerdon never failing bringeth wealth to the men to friends the thing they covet.
नू इन्द्र राये वरिवस कर्धी न आ ते मनो वव्र्त्याम मघाय|	quick indra give us room and way to riches and let us bring thy mind to grant us treasures.
गोमदश्वावद रथवद वयन्तो यूयं पात|	that we may win us cars and steeds and cattle preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
आ शुभ्रा यातमश्विना सवश्वा गिरो दस्रा जुजुषाणा युवाकोः|	come radiant aśvins with your noble horses accept your servants hymns ye wonderworkers.
हव्यानि च परतिभ्र्ता वीतं नः|	enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.
पर वामन्धांसि मद्यान्यस्थुररं गन्तं हविषो वीतये मे|	the gladdening juices stand prepared before you come quickly and partake of mine oblation.
तिरो अर्यो हवनानि शरुतं नः|	pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.
पर वां रथो मनोजवा इयर्ति तिरो रजांस्यश्विना शतोतिः|	your chariot with a hundred aids o aśvins beareth you swift as thought across the regions.
अस्मभ्यं सूर्यावसू इयानः|	speeding to us o ye whose wealth is sūrya.
अयं ह यद वां देवया उ अद्रिरूर्ध्वो विवक्ति सोमसुद युवभ्याम|	what time this stone of yours the gods adorer upraised sounds forth for you as somapresser.
आ वल्गू विप्रो वव्र्तीत हव्यैः|	let the priest bring you fair ones through oblations.
चित्रं ह यद वां भोजनं नवस्ति नयत्रये महिष्वन्तं युयोतम|	the nourishment ye have is truly wondrous ye gave thereof a quickening store to atri.
यो वामोमानं दधते परियः सन|	who being dear to you receives your favour.
उत तयद वां जुरते अश्विना भूच्च्यवानाय परतीत्यं हविर्दे|	that gift which all may gain ye gave cyavāna when he grew old who offered you oblations.
अधि यद वर्प इतूति धत्थः|	when ye bestowed on him enduring beauty.
उत तयं भुज्युमश्विना सखायो मध्ये जहुर्दुरेवासः समुद्रे|	what time his wicked friends abandoned bhujyu o aśvins in the middle of the ocean.
निरीं पर्षदरावा यो युवाकुः|	your horse delivered him your faithful servant.
वर्काय चिज्जसमानाय शक्तमुत शरुतं शयवे हूयमाना|	ye lent your aid to vrka when exhausted and listened when invoked to Śayus calling.
यावघ्न्यामपिन्वतमपो न सतर्यं चिच्छक्त्यश्विनाशचीभिः|	ye made the cow pour forth her milk like water and aśvins strengthened with your strength the barren.
एष सय कारुर्जरते सूक्तैरग्रे बुधान उषसां सुमन्मा|	with his fair hymns this singer too extols you waking with glad thoughts at the break of morning.
इषा तं वर्धदघ्न्या पयोभिर्यूयं पात|	may the cow nourish him with milk to feed llim preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
आ मां मित्रावरुणेह रक्षतं कुलाययद विश्वयन मा न आ गन|	o mitravaruna guard and protect me here let not that come to me which nests within and swells.
अजकावं दुर्द्र्शीकं तिरो दधे मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत तसरुः|	i drive afar the scorpion hateful to the sight let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.
यद विजामन परुषि वन्दनं भुवदष्ठीवन्तौ परि कुल्फौ च देहत|	eruption that appears upon the twofold joints and that which overspreads the ankles and the knees.
अग्निष टच्छोचन्नप बाधतामितो मा माम्पद्येन|	may the refulgent agni banish far away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.
यच्छल्मलौ भवति यन नदीषु यदोषधीभ्यः परि जायते विषम|	the poison that is formed upon the salmali that which is found in streams that which the plants produce.
विश्वे देवा निरितस्तत सुवन्तु मा मां पद्येन|	all this may all the gods banish and drive away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.
याः परवतो निवत उद्वत उदन्वतीरनुदकाश्च याः|	the steep declivities the valleys and the heights the channels full of water and the waterless.
ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः शिवा देवीरशिपदा भवन्तु सर्वा नद्यो अशिमिदा भवन्तु|	may those who swell with water gracious goddesses never afflict us with the sipada disease may all the rivers keep us free from simida.
रदत पथो वरुणः सूर्याय परार्णांसि समुद्रिया नदीनाम|	varuna cut a pathway out for sūrya and led the watery floods of rivers onward.
सर्गो न सर्ष्टो अर्वतीरतायञ्चकार महीरवनीरहभ्यः|	the mares as in a race speed on in order he made great channels for the days to follow.
आत्मा ते वातो रज आ नवीनोत पशुर्न भूर्णिर्यवसे ससवान|	the wind thy breath hath sounded through the region like a wild beast that seeks his food in pastures.
अन्तर्मही बर्हती रोदसीमे विश्वा ते धाम वरुण परियाणि|	within these two exalted earth and heaven o varuṇa are all the forms thou lovest.
परि सपशो वरुणस्य समदिष्टा उभे पश्यन्ति रोदसी सुमेके|	varuṇas spies sent forth upon their errand survey the two worldhalves well formed and fashioned.
रतावानः कवयो यज्ञधीराः परचेतसो य इषयन्त मन्म|	wise are they holy skilled in sacrifices the furtherers of the praisesongs of the prudent.
उवाच मे वरुणो मेधिराय तरिः सप्त नामाघ्न्या बिभर्ति|	to me who understand hath varuṇa spoken the names borne by the cow are three times seven.
विद्वान पदस्य गुह्या न वोचद युगाय विप्र उपराय शिक्षन|	the sapient god knowing the places secret shall speak as twere to teach the race that cometh.
तिस्रो दयावो निहिता अन्तरस्मिन तिस्रो भूमीरुपराः षड्विधानाः|	on him three heavens rest and are supported and the three earths are there in sixfold order.
गर्त्सो राजा वरुणश्चक्र एतं दिवि परेङखंहिरण्ययं शुभे कम|	the wise king varuṇa hath made in heaven that golden swing to cover it with glory.
अव सिन्धुं वरुणो दयौरिव सथाद दरप्सो न शवेतो मर्गस्तुविष्मान|	like varuṇa from heaven he sinks in sindhu like a whiteshining spark a strong wild creature.
गम्भीरशंसो रजसो विमानः सुपारक्षत्रः सतो अस्य राजा|	ruling in depths and meting out the region great saving power hath he this worlds controller.
यो मर्ळयाति चक्रुषे चिदागो वयं सयाम वरुणे अनागाः|	before this varuṇa may we be sinless him who shows mercy even to the sinner.
अनु वरतान्यदितेरधन्तो यूयं पात|	while we are keeping aditis ordinances preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
