आदित्या विश्वे मरुतश्च विश्वे देवाश्च विश्व रभवश्च विश्वे|	all universal deities the maruts all the Ādityas yea and all the Ṛbhus.
इन्द्रो अग्निरश्विना तुष्टुवाना यूयं पात|	indra and agni and the aśvins lauded preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
उग्रो जज्ञे वीर्याय सवधावाञ्चक्रिरपो नर्यो यत करिष्यन|	strong godlynatured born for hero exploit mans friend hedoth whatever deed he willeth.
जग्मिर्युवा नर्षदनमवोभिस्त्राता न इन्द्र एनसो महश्चित|	saving us een from great transgression indra the youthful visiteth mans home with favour.
हन्त वर्त्रमिन्द्रः शूशुवानः परावीन नु वीरो जरितारमूती|	waxing greatness indra slayeth vṛtra the hero with his aid hath helped the singer.
कर्ता सुदासे अह वा उ लोकं दाता वसु मुहुरा दाशुषे भूत|	he gave sudās wide room and space and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.
युध्मो अनर्वा खजक्र्त समद्वा शूरः सत्राषाड जनुषेमषाळ्हः|	soldier unchecked warrousing battling hero unconquered from of old victorious ever.
वयास इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा अधा विश्वंशत्रूयन्तं जघान|	indra the very strong hath scattered armies yea he hath slain each foe who fought against him.
उभे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी महित्वा पप्राथ तविषीभिस्तुविष्मः|	thou with thy greatness hast filled full o indra even both the worlds with might o thou most mighty.
नि वज्रमिन्द्रो हरिवान मिमिक्षन समन्धसा मदेषु वाुवोच|	lord of bays indra brandishing his thunder is gratified with soma at the banquet.
वर्षा जजान वर्षणं रणाय तमु चिन नारी नर्यं ससूव|	a bull begat the bull for joy of battle and a strong mother brought forth him the manly.
पर यः सेनानीरध नर्भ्यो अस्तीनः सत्वा गवेषणः स धर्ष्णुः|	he who is chief of men their armies leader is strong hero bold and fain for booty.
नू चित स भरेषते जनो न रेषन मनो यो अस्य घोरमाविवासात|	the people falter not nor suffer sorrow who win themselves this gods terrific spirit.
यज्ञैर्य इन्द्रे दधते दुवांसि कषयत स राय रतपा रतेजाः|	he who with sacrifices worships indra is lord of wealth lawborn and laws protector.
यदिन्द्र पूर्वो अपराय शिक्षन्नयज्ज्यायान कनीयसो देष्णम|	wheneer the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lessers present.
अम्र्त इत पर्यासीत दूरमा चित्र चित्र्यं भरा रयिं नः|	shall the immortal sit aloof inactive o wondrous indra bring us wondrous riches.
यस्त इन्द्र परियो जनो ददाशदसन निरेके अद्रिवः सखा ते|	thy dear folk indra who present oblations are in chief place thy friends o thunderwielder.
वयं ते अस्यां सुमतौ चनिष्ठाः सयाम वरूथे अघ्नतो नर्पीतौ|	may we be best content in this thy favour sheltered by one who slays not but preserves us.
एष सतोमो अचिक्रदद वर्षा त उत सतामुर्मघवन्नक्रपिष्ट|	to thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly and maghavan the eloquent hath besought thee.
रायस कामो जरितारं त आगन तवमङग शक्र वस्व आशको नः|	desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer help us then gakra to our share of riches.
स न इन्द्र तवयताया इषे धास्त्मना च ये मघवानो जुनन्ति|	place us by food which thou hast given o indra us and the wealthy patrons who command us.
वस्वी षु ते जरित्रे अस्तु शक्तिर्यूयं पात|	let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
शुचिं नु सतोमं नवजातमद्येन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा जुषेथाम|	slayers of enemies indra and agni accept this day our newborn pure laudation.
उभा हि वां सुहवा जोहवीमि ता वाजं सद्य उशतेधेष्ठा|	again again i call you prompt to listen best to give quickly strength to him who craves it.
ता सानसी शवसाना हि भूतं साकंव्र्धा शवसा शूशुवांसा|	for ye were strong to gain exceeding mighty growing together waxing in your vigour.
कषयन्तौ रायो यवसस्य भूरेः पर्ङकतं वाजस्य सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः|	lords of the pasture filled with ample riches bestow upon us strength both fresh and lasting.
उपो ह यद विदथं वाजिनो गुर्धीभिर्विप्राः परमतिमिछमानाः|	yea when the strong have entered our assembly and singers seeking with their hymns your favour.
अर्वन्तो न काष्ठां नक्षमाणा इन्द्राग्नी जोहुवतो नरस्ते|	they are like steeds who come into the racecourse those men who call aloud on indraagni.
गीर्भिर्विप्रः परमतिमिछमान ईट्टे रयिं यशसं पूर्वभाजम|	the singer seeking with his hymns your favour begs splendid riches of their first possessor.
इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहणा सुवज्रा पर नो नव्येभिस्तिरतं देष्णैः|	further us with new bounties indraagni armed with strong thunder slayers of the foeman.
सं यन मही मिथती सपर्धमाने तनूरुचा शूरसाता यतैते|	when two great hosts arrayed against each other meet clothed with brightness in the fierce encounter.
अदेवयुं विदथे देवयुभिः सत्रा हतं सोमसुता जनेन|	stand ye beside the godly smite the godless and still assist the men who press the soma.
इमामु षु सोमसुतिमुप न एन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम|	to this our somapressing indraagni come ye prepared to show your lovingkindness.
नू चिद धि परिमम्नाथे अस्माना वां शश्वद्भिर्वव्र्तीय वाजैः|	for not at any time have ye despised us so may i draw you with all strengthenings hither.
सो अग्न एना नमसा समिद्धोअछा मित्रं वरुणमिन्द्रं वोचेः|	so agni kindled mid this adoration invite thou mitra varuṇa and indra.
यत सीमागश्चक्र्मा तत सु मर्ळ तदर्यमादितिःशिश्रथन्तु|	forgive whatever sin we have committed may aryaman and aditi remove it.
एता अग्न आशुषाणास इष्टीर्युवोः सचाभ्यश्याम वाजान|	while we accelerate these our sacrifices may we win strength from both of you o agni.
मेन्द्रो नो विष्णुर्मरुतः परि खयन यूयं पात|	neer may the maruts indra viṣṇu slight us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
तवे ह यत पितरश्चिन न इन्द्र विश्वा वामा जरितारो असन्वन|	all is with thee o indra all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises.
तवे गावः सुदुघास्त्वे हयश्वास्त्वं वसु देवयतेवनिष्ठः|	with thee are milchkine good to milk and horses best winner thou of riches for the pious.
राजेव हि जनिभिः कषेष्येवाव दयुभिरभि विदुष कविः सन|	for like a king among his wives thou dwellest with glories as a sage surround and help us.
पिशा गिरो मघवन गोभिरश्वैस्त्वायतः शिशीहिराये अस्मान|	make us thy servants strong for wealth and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.
इमा उ तवा पस्प्र्धानासो अत्र मन्द्रा गिरो देवयन्तीरुप सथुः|	here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee.
अर्वाची ते पथ्या राय एतु सयाम ते सुमताविन्द्र शर्मन|	hitherward come thy path that leads to riches may we find shelter in thy favour indra.
धेनुं न तवा सूयवसे दुदुक्षन्नुप बरह्माणि सस्र्जे वसिष्ठः|	vasiṣṭha hath poured forth his prayers desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture.
तवामिन मे गोपतिं विश्व आहा न इन्द्रः सुमतिं गन्त्वछ|	all these my people call thee lord of cattle may indra come unto the prayer we offer.
अर्णांसि चित पप्रथाना सुदास इन्द्रो गाधान्यक्र्णोत सुपारा|	what though the floods spread widely indra made them shallow and easy for sudās to traverse.
शर्धन्तं शिम्युमुचथस्य नव्यः शापं सिन्धूनामक्र्णोदशस्तीः|	he worthy of our praises caused the simyu foe of our hymn to curse the rivers fury.
पुरोळा इत तुर्वशो यक्षुरासीद राये मत्स्यासो निशिता अपीव|	eager for spoil was turvaśa purodas fain to win wealth like fishes urged by hunger.
शरुष्टिं चक्रुर्भ्र्गवो दरुह्यवश्च सखा सखायमतरद विषूचोः|	the bhṛgus and the druhyus quickly listened friend rescued friend mid the two distant peoples.
आ पक्थासो भलानसो भनन्तालिनासो विषाणिनः शिवासः|	together came the pakthas the bhalanas the alinas the sivas the visanins.
आ योअनयत सधमा आर्यस्य गव्या तर्त्सुभ्यो अजगन युधा नर्न|	yet to the trtsus came the Āryas comrade through love of spoil and heroes war to lead them.
दुराध्यो अदितिं सरेवयन्तोअचेतसो वि जग्र्भ्रे परुष्णीम|	fools in their folly fain to waste her waters they parted inexhaustible paruṣṇī.
मह्नाविव्यक पर्थिवीं पत्यमानः पशुष कविरशयच्चायमानः|	lord of the earth he with his might repressed them still lay the herd and the affrighted herdsman.
ईयुरर्थं न नयर्थं परुष्णीमाशुश्चनेदभिपित्वं जगाम|	as to their goal they sped to their destruetion they sought paruṣṇī een the swift returned not.
सुदास इन्द्रः सुतुकानमित्रानरन्धयन मानुषे वध्रिवाचः|	indra abandoned to sudās the manly the swiftly flying foes unmanly babblers.
ईयुर्गावो न यवसादगोपा यथाक्र्तमभि मित्रं चितासः|	they went like kine unherded from the pasture each clinging to a friend as chance directed.
पर्श्निगावः पर्श्निनिप्रेषितासः शरुष्टिं चक्रुर्नियुतो रन्तयश्च|	they who drive spotted steeds sent down by pṛśni gave ear the warriors and the harnessed horses.
एकं च यो विंशतिं च शरवस्या वैकर्णयोर्जनान राजा नयस्तः|	the king who scattered oneandtwenty people of both vaikarna tribes through lust of glory.
दस्मो न सद्मन नि शिशाति बर्हिः शूरः सर्गमक्र्णोदिन्द्र एषाम|	as the skilled priest clips grass within the chamber so hath the hero indra wrought their downfall.
अध शरुतं कवषं वर्द्धमप्स्वनु दरुह्युं नि वर्णग वज्रबाहुः|	thou thunderarmed oerwhelmedst in the waters famed ancient kavasa and then the druhyu.
वर्णाना अत्र सख्याय सख्यं तवायन्तो ये अमदन्ननु तवा|	others here claiming friendship to their friendship devoted unto thee in thee were joyful.
वि सद्यो विश्वा दरंहितान्येषामिन्द्रः पुरः सहसा सप्त दर्दः|	indra at once with conquering might demolished all their strong places and their seven castles.
वयानवस्य तर्त्सवे गयं भाग जेष्म पूरुं विदथे मर्ध्रवाचम|	the goods of anus son he gave to trtsu may we in sacrifice conquer scorned pūru.
नि गव्यवोअनवो दरुह्यवश्च षष्टिः शता सुषुपुः षट सहस्रा|	the anavas and druhyus seeking booty have slept the sixty hundred yea six thousand.
षष्टिर्वीरासो अधि षड दुवोयु विश्वेदिन्द्रस्य वीर्या कर्तानि|	and sixandsixty heroes for the pious were all these mighty exploits done by indra.
इन्द्रेणैते तर्त्सवो वेविषाणा आपो न सर्ष्टा अधवन्त नीचीः|	these trtsus under indras careful guidance came speeding like loosed waters rushing downward.
दुर्मित्रासः परकलविन मिमाना जहुर्विश्वानि भोजना सुदासे|	the foemen measuring exceeding closely abandoned to sudās all their provisions.
अर्धं वीरस्य शर्तपामनिन्द्रं परा शर्धन्तं नुनुदे अभि कषाम|	the heros side who drank the dressed oblation indras denier far oer earth he scattered.
इन्द्रो मन्युं मन्युम्यो मिमाय भेजे पथो वर्तनिम्पत्यमानः|	indra brought down the fierce destroyers fury he gave them various roads the paths controller.
आध्रेण चित तद वेकं चकार सिंह्यं चित पेत्वेना जघान|	een with the weak he wrought this matchless exploit een with a goat he did to death a lion.
अव सरक्तीर्वेश्याव्र्श्चदिन्द्रः परायछद विश्वा भोजना सुदासे|	he pared the pillars angles with a needle thus to sudās indra gave all provisions.
शश्वन्तो हि शत्रवो रारधुष टे भेदस्य चिच्छर्धतो विन्द रन्धिम|	to thee have all thine enemies submitted een the fierce bheda hast thou made thy subject.
मर्तानेन सतुवतो यः कर्णोति तिग्मं तस्मिन नि जहि वज्रमिन्द्र|	cast down thy sharpened thunderbolt o indra on him who harms the men who sing thy praises.
आवदिन्द्रं यमुना तर्त्सवश्च परात्र भेदं सर्वतातामुषायत|	yamuna and the trtsus aided indra there he stripped bheda bare of all his treasures.
अजासश्च शिग्रवो यक्षवश्च बलिं शीर्षाणि जभ्रुरश्व्यानि|	the ajas and the sigrus and the yaksus brought in to him as tribute heads of horses.
न त इन्द्र सुमतयो न रायः संचक्षे पूर्वा उषसो न नूत्नाः|	not to be scorned but like dawns past and recent o indra are thy favours and thy riches.
देवकं चिन मान्यमानं जघन्थाव तमना बर्हतः शम्बरं भेत|	devaka mānyamanas son thou slewest and smotest Śambara from the lofty mountain.
पर ये गर्हादममदुस्त्वाया पराशरः शतयातुर्वसिष्ठः|	they who from home have gladdened thee thy servants parasara vasiṣṭha satayatu.
न ते भोजस्य सख्यं मर्षन्ताधा सूरिभ्यः सुदिना वयुछान|	will not forget thy friendship liberal giver so shall the days dawn prosperous for the princes.
दवे नप्तुर्देववतः शते गोर्द्वा रथा वधूमन्ता सुदासः|	priestlike with praise i move around the altar earning paijavanas reward o agni.
अर्हन्नग्ने पैजवनस्य दानं होतेव सद्म पर्येमि रेभन|	two hundred cows from devavans descendant two chariots from sudās with mares to draw them.
चत्वारो मा पैजवनस्य दानाः समद्दिष्टयः कर्शनिनो निरेके|	gift of paijavana four horses bear me in foremost place trained steeds with pearl to deck them.
रज्रासो मा पर्थिविष्ठाः सुदासस्तोकं तोकाय शरवसे वहन्ति|	sudāss brown steeds firmlystepping carry me and my son for progeny and glory.
यस्य शरवो रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी शीर्ष्णेशीर्ष्णे विबभाजा विभक्ता|	him whose fame spreads between wide earth and heaven who as dispenser gives each chief his portion.
सप्तेदिन्द्रं न सरवतो गर्णन्ति नि युध्यामधिमशिशादभीके|	seven flowing rivers glorify like indra he slew yudhyamadhi in close encounter.
इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चतानु दिवोदासं न पितरं सुदासः|	attend on him o ye heroic maruts as on sudāss father divodāsa.
अविष्टना पैजवनस्य केतं दूणाशं कषत्रमजरं दुवोयु|	further paijavanas desire with favour guard faithfully his lasting firm dominion.
अगन्म महा नमसा यविष्ठं यो दीदाय समिद्धः सवे दुरोणे|	we with great reverence have approached the youngest who hath shone forth wellkindled in his dwelling.
चित्रभानुं रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी सवाहुतं विश्वतः परत्यञ्चम|	with wondrous light between wide earth and heaven wellworshipped looking forth in all directions.
स मह्ना विश्वा दुरितानि साह्वानग्निः षटवे दम आ जातवेदाः|	through his great might oercoming all misfortunes praised in the house is agni jātavedas.
स नो रक्षिषद दुरितादवद्यादस्मान गर्णत उत नो मघोनः|	may he protect us from disgrace and trouble both us who laud him and our noble patrons.
तवं वरुण उत मित्रो अग्ने तवां वर्धन्ति मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः|	o agni thou art varuṇa and mitra vasisthas with their holy hymns exalt thee.
तवे वसु सुषणनानि सन्तु यूयं पात|	with thee be most abundant gain of treasure ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
तिस्रो वाचः पर वद जयोतिरग्रा या एतद दुह्रे मधुदोघम ऊधः|	speak forth three words the words which light precedeth which milk this udder that produceth nectar.
स वत्सं कर्ण्वन गर्भम ओषधीनां सद्यो जातो वर्षभो रोरवीति|	quickly made manifest the bull hath bellowed engendering the germ of plants the infant.
यो वर्धन ओषधीनां यो अपां यो विश्वस्य जगतो देव ईशे|	giver of growth to plants the god who ruleth over the waters and all moving creatures.
स तरिधातु शरणं शर्म यंसत तरिवर्तु जयोतिः सवभिष्ट्य अस्मे|	vouchsafe us triple shelter for our refuge and threefold light to succour and befriend us.
सतरीर उ तवद भवति सूत उ तवद यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः|	now he is sterile now begetteth offspring even as he willeth doth he change his figure.
पितुः पयः परति गर्भ्णाति माता तेन पिता वर्धते तेन पुत्रः|	the fathers genial flow bedews the mother therewith the sire therewith the son is nourished.
यस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुस तिस्रो दयावस तरेधा सस्रुर आपः|	in him all living creatures have their being and the three heavens with triplyflowing waters.
तरयः कोशास उपसेचनासो मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम|	three reservoirs that sprinkle down their treasure shed their sweet streams around him with a murmur.
इदं वचः पर्जन्याय सवराजे हर्दो अस्त्व अन्तरं तज जुजोषत|	may this my song to sovran lord parjanya come near unto his heart and give him pleasure.
मयोभुवो वर्ष्टयः सन्त्व अस्मे सुपिप्पला ओषधीर देवगोपाः|	may we obtain the showers that bring enjoyment and godprotected plants with goodly fruitage.
स रेतोधा वर्षभः शश्वतीनां तस्मिन्न आत्मा जगतस तस्थुषश च|	he is the bull of all and their impregner he holds the life of all things fixed and moving.
तन म रतम पातु शतशारदाय यूयम पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः|	may this rite save me till my hundredth autumn preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
बरह्मा ण इन्द्रोप याहि विद्वानर्वाञ्चस्ते हरयः सन्तु युक्ताः|	come to our prayers o indra thou who knowest let thy bay steeds be yoked and guided hither.
विश्वे चिद धि तवा विहवन्त मर्ता अस्माकमिच्छ्र्णुहि विश्वमिन्व|	though mortal men on every side invoke thee still give thine ear to us o allimpeller.
हवं त इन्द्र महिमा वयानड बरह्म यत पासि शवसिन्न्र्षीणाम|	thy greatness reacheth to our invocation the sages prayer which potent god thou guardest.
आ यद वज्रं दधिषे हस्त उग्र घोरः सन करत्वा जनिष्ठा अषाळः|	what time thy hand o mighty holds the thunder awful in strength thou hast become resistless.
तव परणीतीन्द्र जोहुवानान सं यन नॄन न रोदसी निनेथ|	what time thou drewest both worldhalves together like heroes led by thee who call each other.
महे कषत्राय शवसे हि जज्ञेअतूतुजिं चित तूतुजिरशिश्नत|	for thou wast born for strength and high dominionthen een the active overthrew the sluggish.
एभिर्न इन्द्राहभिर्दशस्य दुर्मित्रासो हि कषितयः पवन्ते|	honour us in these present days o indra for hostile men are making expiation.
परति यच्चष्टे अन्र्तमनेना अव दविता वरुणो मायीनः सात|	our sin that sinless varuṇa discovered the wondrouswise hath long ago forgiven.
वोचेमेदिन्द्रं मघवानमेनं महो रायो राधसो यद ददन्नः|	we will address this liberal lord this indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches.
यो अर्चतो बरह्मक्र्तिमविष्ठो यूयं पात|	best favourer of the singers prayer and praises preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
योनिष ट इन्द्र सदने अकारि तमा नर्भिः पुरुहूत पर याहि|	a home is made for thee to dwell in indra o muchinvoked go thitherwith the heroes.
असो यथा नोअविता वर्धे च ददो वसूनि ममदश्च सोमैः|	that thou to prosper us mayst be our helper vouchsafe us wealth rejoice with draughts of soma.
गर्भीतं ते मन इन्द्र दविबर्हाः सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि|	indra thy wish twicestrong is comprehended pressed is the soma poured are pleasant juices.
विस्र्ष्टधेना भरते सुव्र्क्तिरियमिन्द्रं जोहुवती मनीषा|	this hymn of praise from loosened tongue made perfect draws indra to itself with loud invoking.
आ नो दिव आ पर्थिव्या रजीषिन्निदं बर्हिः सोमपेयाय याहि|	come thou impetuous god from earth or heaven come to our holy grass to drink the soma.
वहन्तु तवा हरयो मद्र्यञ्चमाङगूषमछा तवसं मदाय|	hither to me let thy bay horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful.
आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सजोषा बरह्म जुषाणो हर्यश्वयाहि|	come unto us with all thine aids accordant lord of bay steeds accepting our devotions.
वरीव्र्जत सथविरेभिः सुशिप्रास्मे दधद वर्षणं शुष्ममिन्द्र|	fairhelmeted oercoming with the mighty and lending us the strength of bulls o indra.
एष सतोमो मह उग्राय वाहे धुरीवात्यो न वाजयन्नधायि|	as to the chariot pole a vigorous courser this laud is brought to the great strong upholder.
इन्द्र तवायमर्क ईट्टे वसूनां दिवीव दयामधि नः शरोमतं धाः|	this hymn solicits wealth of thee in heaven as twere above the sky set thou our glory.
एवा न इन्द्र वार्यस्य पूर्धि पर ते महीं सुमतिं वेविदाम|	with precious things o indra thus content us may we attain to thine exalted favour.
इषं पिन्व मघवद्भ्यः सुवीरां यूयं पात|	send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
मध्वो वो नाम मारुतं यजत्राः पर यज्ञेषु शवसा मदन्ति|	yea through the power of your sweet juice ye holy the marut host is glad at sacrifices.
ये रेजयन्ति रोदसी चिदुर्वी पिन्वन्त्युत्सं यदयासुरुग्राः|	they cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble they make the spring flow when they come the mighty.
निचेतारो हि मरुतो गर्णन्तं परणेतारो यजमानस्य मन्म|	the maruts watch the man who sings their praises promoters of the thought of him who worships.
अस्माकमद्य विदथेषु बर्हिरा वीतये सदत पिप्रियाणाः|	seat you on sacred grass in our assembly this day with friendly minds to share the banquet.
नैतावदन्ये मरुतो यथेमे भराजन्ते रुक्मैरायुधैस्तनूभिः|	no others gleam so brightly as these maruts with their own forms their golden gauds their weapons.
आ रोदसी विश्वपिशः पिशानाः समानमञ्ज्यञ्जते शुभे कम|	with all adornments decking earth and heaven they heighten for bright show their common splendour.
रधक सा वो मरुतो दिद्युदस्तु यद व आगः पुरुषता कराम|	far from us be your blazing dart o maruts when we through human frailty sin against you.
मा वस्तस्यामपि भूमा यजत्रा अस्मे वो अस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा|	let us not he exposed to that ye holy may your most loving favour still attend us.
कर्ते चिदत्र मरुतो रणन्तानवद्यासः शुचयः पावकाः|	may even what we have done delight the maruts the blameless ones the bright the purifying.
पर णोअवत सुमतिभिर्यजत्राः पर वाजेभिस्तिरत पुष्यसे नः|	further us o ye holy with your kindness advance us mightily that we may prosper.
उत सतुतासो मरुतो वयन्तु विश्वेभिर्नामभिर्नरो हवींषि|	and may the maruts praised by all their titles heroes enjoy the taste of our oblations.
ददात नो अम्र्तस्य परजायै जिग्र्त रायः सून्र्ता मघानि|	give us of amṛta for the sake of offspring awake the excellent fair stores of riches.
आ सतुतासो मरुतो विश्व ऊती अछा सूरीन सर्वताता जिगात|	hither ye maruts praised with all your succours with all felicity come to our princes.
ये नस्त्मना शतिनो वर्धयन्ति यूयं पात|	who of themselves a hundredfold increase us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
आ गोमता नासत्या रथेनाश्वावता पुरुश्चन्द्रेण यातम|	come o nāsatyas on your car resplendent rich in abundant wealth of kine and horses.
अभि वां विश्वा नियुतः सचन्ते सपार्हया शरिया तन्वा शुभाना|	as harnessed steeds all our laudations follow you whose forms shine with most delightful beauty.
आ नो देवेभिरुप यातमर्वाक सजोषसा नासत्या रथेन|	come with the gods associate come ye hither to us nāsatyas with your car accordant.
युवोर्हि नः सख्या पित्र्याणि समानो बन्धुरुत तस्य वित्तम|	twixt you and us there is ancestral friendship and common kin remember and regard it.
उदु सतोमासो अश्विनोरबुध्रञ जामि बरह्माण्युषसश्च देवीः|	awakened are the songs that praise the aśvins the kindred prayers and the celestial mornings.
आविवासन रोदसी धिष्ण्येमे अछा विप्रो नासत्या विवक्ति|	inviting those we long for earth and heaven the singer calleth these nāsatyas hither.
वि चेदुछन्त्यश्विना उषासः पर वां बरह्माणि कारवो भरन्ते|	what time the dawns break forth in light o aśvins to you the poets offer their devotions.
ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सविता देवो अश्रेद बर्हदग्नयः समिधा जरन्ते|	god savitar hath sent aloft his splendour and fires sing praises with the kindled fuel.
आ पश्चातान नासत्या पुरस्तादाश्विना यातमधरादुदक्तात|	come from the west come from the cast nāsatyas come aśvins from below and from above us.
आ विश्वतः पाञ्चजन्येन राया यूयं पात|	bring wealth from all sides for the fivefold people preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
यदद्य सूर्य बरवोअनागा उद्यन मित्राय वरुणाय सत्यम|	when thou o sun this day arising sinless shalt speak the truth to varuṇa and mitra.
वयं देवत्रादिते सयाम तव परियासो अर्यमन गर्णन्तः|	o aditi may all the deities love us and thou o aryaman while we are singing.
एष सय मित्रावरुणा नर्चक्षा उभे उदेति सूर्यो अभि जमन|	looking on man o varuṇa and mitra this sun ascendeth up by both the pathways.
विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्च गोपा रजु मर्तेषु वर्जिना चपश्यन|	guardian of all things fixt of all that moveth beholding good and evil acts of mortals.
अयुक्त सप्त हरितः सधस्थाद या ईं वहन्ति सूर्यं घर्ताचीः|	he from their home hath yoked the seven gold coursers who dropping oil and fatness carry sūrya.
धामानि मित्रावरुणा युवाकुः सं यो यूथेव जनिमानि चष्टे|	yours varuṇa and mitra he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.
उद वां पर्क्षासो मधुमन्तो अस्थुरा सूर्यो अरुहच्छुक्रमर्णः|	your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted to the bright ocean sūrya hath ascended.
यस्मा आदित्या अध्वनो रदन्ति मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणःसजोषाः|	for whom the Ādityas make his pathway ready aryaman mitra varuṇa accordant.
इमे चेतारो अन्र्तस्य भूरेर्मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो हि सन्ति|	for these even aryaman varuṇa and mitra are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood.
इम रतस्य वाव्र्धुर्दुरोणे शग्मासः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धाः|	these aditis sons infallible and mighty have waxen in the home of law eternal.
इमे मित्रो वरुणो दूळभासोअचेतसं चिच्चितयन्ति दक्षैः|	these mitra varuṇa whom none deceiveth with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom.
अपि करतुं सुचेतसं वतन्तस्तिरश्चिदंहः सुपथानयन्ति|	and wakening moreover thoughtful insight lead it by easy paths oer grief and trouble.
इमे दिवो अनिमिषा पर्थिव्याश्चिकित्वांसो अचेतसं नयन्ति|	they ever vigilant with eyes that close not caring for heaven and earth lead on the thoughtless.
परव्राजे चिन नद्यो गाधमस्ति पारं नो अस्य विष्पितस्य पर्षन|	even in the rivers bed there is a shallow across this broad expanse may they conduct us.
यद गोपावददितिः शर्म भद्रं मित्रो यछन्ति वरुणः सुदासे|	when aditi and varuṇa and mitra like guardians give sudās their friendly shelter.
तस्मिन्ना तोकं तनयं दधाना मा कर्म देवहेळनं तुरासः|	granting him sons and lineal succession let us not bold ones move the gods to anger.
अव वेदिं होत्राभिर्यजेत रिपः काश्चिद वरुणध्रुतः सः|	may he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of varuṇas reviler.
परि दवेषोभिरर्यमा वर्णक्तूरुं सुदासे वर्षणा उ लोकम|	aryaman save us us all those who hate us give room and freedom to sudās ye mighty.
सस्वश्चिद धि सम्र्तिस्त्वेष्येषामपीच्येन सहसा सहन्ते|	hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting by their mysterious might they hold dominion.
युष्मद भिया वर्षणो रेजमाना दक्षस्य चिन महिना मर्ळता नः|	heroes we cry trembling in fear before you even in the greatness of your power have mercy.
यो बरह्मणे सुमतिमायजाते वाजस्य सातौ परमस्य रायः|	he who wins favour for his prayer by worship that he may gain him strength and highest riches.
सीक्षन्त मन्युं मघवानो अर्य उरु कषयाय चक्रिरे सुधातु|	that good mans mind the mighty ones will follow they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.
इयं देव पुरोहितिर्युवभ्यां यज्ञेषु मित्रावरुणावकारि|	this priestly task gods varuṇa and mitra hath been performed for you at sacrifices.
विश्वानि दुर्गा पिप्र्तं तिरो नो यूयं पात|	convey us safely over every peril preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
उत सूर्यो बर्हदर्चींष्यश्रेत पुरु विश्वा जनिम मानुषाणाम|	surya hath sent aloft his beams of splendour oer all the tribes of men in countless places.
समो दिवा दद्र्शे रोचमानः करत्वा कर्तः सुक्र्तःकर्त्र्भिर्भूत|	together with the heaven he shines apparent formed by his makers well with power and wisdom.
स सूर्य परति पुरो न उद गा एभिः सतोमेभिरेतशेभिरेवैः|	so hast thou mounted up before us sūrya through these our praises with fleet dappled horses.
पर नो मित्राय वरुणाय वोचोअनागसो अर्यम्णे अग्नये च|	declare us free from all offence to mitra and varuṇa and aryaman and agni.
वि नः सहस्रं शुरुधो रदन्त्व रतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः|	may holy agni varuṇa and mitra send down their riches upon us in thousands.
यछन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कमा नः कामं पूपुरन्तुस्तवानाः|	may they the bright ones make our praisesong perfect and when we laud them grant us all our wishes.
दयावाभूमी अदिते तरासीथां नो ये वां जज्ञुः सुजनिमान रष्वे|	o undivided heaven and earth preserve us us lofty ones your nobiyborn descendants.
मा हेळे भूम वरुणस्य वायोर्मा मित्रस्य परियतमस्य नर्णाम|	let us not anger varuṇa nor vāyu nor him the dearest friend of mortals mitra.
पर बाहवा सिस्र्तं जीवसे न आ नो गव्यूतिमुक्षतं घर्तेन|	stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle.
आ नो जने शरवयतं युवाना शरुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमा|	ye youthful make us famed among the people hear mitravaruṇa these mine invocations.
नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा नस्त्मने तोकाय वरिवो दधन्तु|	now mitra varuṇa aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room for us and for our children.
सुगा नो विश्वा सुपथानि सन्तु यूयं पात|	may we find paths all fair and good to travel preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
उदु बरह्माण्यैरत शरवस्येन्द्रं समर्ये महया वसिष्ठ|	prayers have been offered up through love of glory vasiṣṭha honour indra in the battle.
आ यो विश्वानि शवसा ततानोपश्रोता म ईवतो वचांसि|	he who with might extends through all existence hears words which i his faithful servant utter.
अयामि घोष इन्द्र देवजामिरिरज्यन्त यच्छुरुधो विवाचि|	a cry was raised which reached the gods o indra a cry to them to send us strength in combat.
नहि सवमायुश्चिकिते जनेषु तानीदंहांस्यति पर्ष्यस्मान|	none among men knows his own lifes duration bear us in safety over these our troubles.
युजे रथं गवेषणं हरिभ्यामुप बरह्माणि जुजुषाणमस्थुः|	the bays the bootyseeking car i harness my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly.
वि बाधिष्ट सय रोदसी महित्वेन्द्रो वर्त्राण्यप्रती जघन्वान|	indra when he had slain resistless foemen forced with his might the two worldhalves asunder.
आपश्चित पिप्यु सतर्यो न गावो नक्षन्न्र्तं जरितारस्त इन्द्र|	like barren cows moreover swelled the waters the singen sought thy holy rite o indra.
याहि वायुर्न नियुतो न अछा तवं हि धीभिर्दयसे वि वाजान|	come unto us as with his team comes vāyu thou through our solemn hymns bestowest booty.
ते तवा मदा इन्द्र मादयन्तु शुष्मिणं तुविराधसं जरित्रे|	so may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee indra the mighty very bounteous to the singer.
एको देवत्रा दयसे हि मर्तानस्मिञ्छूर सवने मादयस्व|	alone among the gods thou pitiest mortals o hero make thee glad at this libation.
एवेदिन्द्रं वर्षणं वज्रबाहुं वसिष्ठासो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः|	thus the vasisthas glorify with praises indra the powerful whose arm wields thunder.
स न सतुतो वीरवत पातु गोमद यूयं पात|	praised may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
शवित्यञ्चो मा दक्षिणतस्कपर्दा धियंजिन्वासो अभि हि परमन्दुः|	these who wear hairknots on the right the movers of holy thought whiterobed have won me over.
उत्तिष्ठन वोचे परि बर्हिषो नॄन न मे दूरादवितवे वसिष्ठाः|	i warned the men when from the grass i raised me not from afar can my vasisthas help you.
दूरादिन्द्रमनयन्ना सुतेन तिरो वैशन्तमति पान्तमुग्रम|	with soma they brought indra from a distance over vaisanta from the strong libation.
पाशद्युम्नस्य वायतस्य सोमात सुतादिन्द्रोअव्र्णीतावसिष्ठान|	indra preferred vasisthas to the soma pressed by the son of vayata pasadyumna.
एवेन नु कं सिन्धुमेभिस्ततारेवेन नु कं भेदमेभिर्जघान|	so verily with these he crossed the river in company with these he slaughtered bheda.
एवेन नु कं दाशराज्ञे सुदासं परावदिन्द्रो बरह्मणा वो वसिष्ठाः|	so in the fight with the ten kings vasisthas did indra help sudās through your devotions.
जुष्टी नरो बरह्मणा वः पितॄणामक्षमव्ययं न किला रिषाथ|	i gladly men i with prayer prayed by our fathers have fixed your axle ye shall not be injured.
यच्छक्वरीषु बर्हता रवेणेन्द्रे शुष्ममदधाता वसिष्ठाः|	since when ye sang aloud the sakvari verses vasisthas ye invigorated indra.
उद दयामिवेत तर्ष्णजो नाथितासोअदीधयुर्दाशराज्ञे वर्तासः|	like thirsty men they looked to heaven in battle with the ten kings surrounded and imploring.
वसिष्ठस्य सतुवत इन्द्रो अश्रोदुरुं तर्त्सुभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकम|	then indra heard vasiṣṭha as he praised him and gave the trtsus ample room and freedom.
दण्डा इवेद गोजनास आसन परिछिन्ना भरता अर्भकासः|	like sticks and staves wherewith they drive the cattle stripped bare the bharatas were found defenceless.
अभवच्च पुरेता वसिष्ठ आदित तर्त्सूनां विशो अप्रथन्त|	vasiṣṭha then became their chief and leader then widely were the trtsus clans extended.
तरयः कर्ण्वन्ति भुवनेषु रेतस्तिस्रः परजा आर्या जयोतिरग्राः|	three fertilize the worlds with genial moisture three noble creatures cast a light before them.
तरयो घर्मास उषसं सचन्ते सर्वानित ताननुविदुर्वसिष्ठाः|	three that give warmth to all attend the morning all these have they discovered these vasisthas.
सूर्यस्येव वक्षथो जयोतिरेषां समुद्रस्येव महिमा गभीरः|	like the suns growing glory is their splendour and like the seas is their unflathomed greatness.
वातस्येव परजवो नान्येन सतोमो वसिष्ठा अन्वेतवे वः|	their course is like the winds your laud vasisthas can never be attained by any other.
त इन निण्यं हर्दयस्य परकेतैः सहस्रवल्शमभि संचरन्ति|	they with perceptions of the heart in secret resort to that which spreads a thousand branches.
यमेन ततं परिधिं वयन्तोअप्सरस उप सेदुर्वसिष्ठाः|	the apsaras brought hither the vasisthas wearing the vesture spun for them by yama.
विद्युतो जयोतिः परि संजिहानं मित्रावरुणा यदपश्यतां तवा|	a form of lustre springing from the lightning wast thou when varuṇa and mitra saw thee.
तत ते जन्मोतैकं वसिष्ठागस्त्यो यत तवा विशाजभार|	tliy one and only birth was then vasiṣṭha when from thy stock agastya brought thee hither.
उतासि मैत्रावरुणो वसिष्ठोर्वश्या बरह्मन मनसोअधि जातः|	born of their love for urvasi vasiṣṭha thou priest art son of varuṇa and mitra.
दरप्सं सकन्नं बरह्मणा दैव्येन विश्वे देवाः पुष्करे तवाददन्त|	and as a fallen drop in heavenly fervour all the gods laid thee on a lotusblossorn.
स परकेत उभयस्य परविद्वान सहस्रदान उत वा सदानः|	he thinker knower both of earth and heaven endowed with many a gift bestowing thousands.
यमेन ततं परिधिं वयिष्यन्नप्सरसः परि जज्ञे वसिष्ठः|	destined to wear the vesture spun by yama sprang from the apsaras to life vasiṣṭha.
सत्रे ह जाताविषिता नमोभिः कुम्भे रेतः सिषिचतुः समानम|	born at the sacrifice urged by adorations both with a common flow bedewed the pitcher.
ततो ह मान उदियाय मध्यात ततो जातं रषिमाहुर्वसिष्ठम|	then from the midst thereof there rose up māna and thence they say was born the sage vasiṣṭha.
उक्थभ्र्तं सामभ्र्तं बिभर्ति गरावाणं बिभ्रत पर वदात्यग्रे|	he brings the bearer of the laud and sāman first shall he speak bringing the stone for pressing.
उपैनमाध्वं सुमनस्यमाना आ वो गछाति परत्र्दो वसिष्ठः|	with grateful hearts in reverence approach him to you o pratrdas vasiṣṭha cometh.
पर वो देवं चित सहसानमग्निमश्वं न वाजिनं हिषे नमोभिः|	i send forth even your god victorious agni like a strong courser with mine adoration.
भवा नो दूतो अध्वरस्य विद्वान तमना देवेषु विविदे मितद्रुः|	herald of sacrifice be he who knoweth he hath reached gods himself with measured motion.
आ याह्यग्ने पथ्या अनु सवा मन्द्रो देवानां सख्यं जुषाणः|	by paths that are thine own come hither agni joyous delighting in the gods alliance.
आ सानु शुष्मैर्नदयन पर्थिव्या जम्भेभिर्विश्वमुशधग वनानि|	making the heights of earth roar with thy fury burning with eager teeth the woods and forests.
पराचीनो यज्ञः सुधितं हि बर्हिः परीणीते अग्निरीळितो न होता|	the grass is strewn the sacrifice advances adored as priest agni is made propitious.
आ मातरा विश्ववारे हुवानो यतो यविष्ठ जज्ञिषे सुशेवः|	invoking both allboonbestowing mothers of whom most youthful thou wast born to help us.
सद्यो अध्वरे रथिरं जनन्त मानुषासो विचेतसो य एषाम|	forthwith the men the best of these for wisdom have made him leader in the solemn worship.
विशामधायि विश्पतिर्दुरोणेअग्निर्मन्द्रो मधुवचा रतावा|	as lord in homes of men is agni stablished the holy one the joyous sweetly speaking.
असादि वर्तो वह्निराजगन्वानग्निर्ब्रह्मा नर्षदने विधर्ता|	he hath come chosen bearer and is seated in mans home brahman agni the supporter.
दयौश्च यं पर्थिवी वाव्र्धाते आ यं होता यजति विश्ववारम|	he whom both heaven anct earth exalt and strengthenwhom giver of all boons the hotar worships.
एते दयुम्नेभिर्विश्वमातिरन्त मन्त्रं ये वारं नर्या अतक्षन|	these have passed all in glory who the manly have wrought with skill the hymn of adoration.
पर ये विशस्तिरन्त शरोषमाणा आ ये मे अस्य दीधयन्न्र्तस्य|	who listening have advanced the peoples welfare and set their thoughts on this my holy statute.
नू तवामग्न ईमहे वसिष्ठा ईशानं सूनो सहसो वसूनाम|	we the vasisthas now implore thee agni o son of strength the lord of wealth and treasure.
इषं सतोत्र्भ्यो मघवद्भ्य आनड यूयं पात सवस्तिभिः सदा नः|	thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
पर वो यज्ञेषु देवयन्तो अर्चन दयावा नमोभिः परिथिवी इषध्यै|	sing out the pious at your sacrifices to move with adorations earth and heaven.
येषां बरह्माण्यसमानि विप्रा विष्वग वियन्ति वनिनो न शाखाः|	the holy singers whose unmatched devotions like a trees branches part in all directions.
पर यज्ञ एतु हेत्वो न सप्तिरुद यछध्वं समनसो घर्ताचीः|	let sacrifice proceed like some fleet courser with one accord lift ye on high the ladles.
सत्र्णीत बर्हिरध्वराय साधूर्ध्वा शोचींषि देवयून्यस्थुः|	strew sacred grass meet for the solenm service bright flames that love the gods have mounted upward.
आ पुत्रासो न मातरं विभ्र्त्राः सानौ देवासो बर्हिषःसदन्तु|	like babes in arms reposing on their mother let the gods sit upon the grasss summit.
आ विश्वाची विदथ्यामनक्त्वग्ने मा नो देवताता मर्धस कः|	let general fire make bright the flame of worship scorn us not agni in the gods assembly.
ते सीषपन्त जोषमा यजत्रा रतस्य धाराः सुदुघा दुहानाः|	gladly the gods have let themselves be honoured milking the copious streams of holy order.
जयेष्ठं वो अद्य मह आ वसूनामा गन्तन समनसो यति षठ|	the highest might today is yours the vasits come ye as many as ye are oneminded.
एवा नो अग्ने विक्ष्वा दशस्य तवया वयं सहसावन्नास्क्राः|	so agni send us wealth among the people may we be closely knit to thee o victor.
राया युजा सधमादो अरिष्टा यूयं पात|	unharmed and rich and taking joy together preserve us evermore ye ods with blessings.
आपो यं वः परथमं देवयन्त इन्द्रपानमूर्मिमक्र्ण्वतेळः|	may we obtain this day from you o waters that wave of pure refreshment which the pious.
तं वो वयं शुचिमरिप्रमद्य घर्तप्रुषं मधुमन्तं वनेम|	made erst the special beverage of indra bright stainless rich in sweets and dropping fatness.
तमूर्मिमापो मधुमत्तमं वोअपां नपादवत्वाशुहेमा|	may the floods offspring he whose course is rapid protect that wave most rich in sweets o waters.
यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वसुभिर्मादयाते तमश्याम देवयन्तो वो अद्य|	that shall make indra and the vasus joyful this may we gain from you today we pious.
शतपवित्राः सवधया मदन्तीर्देवीर्देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः|	allpurifying joying in their nature to paths of gods the goddesses move onward.
ता इन्द्रस्य न मिनन्ति वरतानि सिन्धुभ्यो हव्यं घर्तवज्जुहोत|	they never violate the laws of indra present the oilrich offering to the rivers.
याः सूर्यो रश्मिभिराततान याभ्य इन्द्रो अरदद गातुमूर्मिम|	whom sūrya with his bright beams hath attracted and indra dug the path for them to travel.
ते सिन्धवो वरिवो धातना नो यूयं पात|	may these streams give us ample room and freedom preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
परति वां रथं नर्पती जरध्यै हविष्मता मनसा यज्ञियेन|	i with a holy heart that brings oblation will sing forth praise to meet your car ye princes.
यो वां दूतो न धिष्ण्यावजीगरछा सूनुर्न पितरा विवक्मि|	which muchdesired hath wakened as your envoy i call you hither as a son his parents.
अशोच्यग्निः समिधानो अस्मे उपो अद्र्श्रन तमसश्चिदन्ताः|	brightly hath agni shone by us enkindled the limits even of darkness were apparent.
अचेति केतुरुषसः पुरस्ताच्छ्रिये दिवो दुहितुर्जायमानः|	eastward is seen the banner of the morning the banner born to give heavens daughter glory.
अभि वां नूनमश्विना सुहोता सतोमैः सिषक्ति नासत्या विवक्वान|	with hymns the deft priest is about you aśvins the eloquent priest attends you now nāsatyas.
पूर्वीभिर्यातं पथ्याभिरर्वाक सवर्विदा वसुमता रथेन|	come by the paths that ye are wont to travel on car that finds the light laden with treasure.
अवोर्वां नूनमश्विना युवाकुर्हुवे यद वां सुते माध्वीवसूयुः|	when suppliant for your help lovers of sweetness i seeking wealth call you to our libation.
आ वां वहन्तु सथविरासो अश्वाः पिबाथो अस्मेसुषुता मधूनि|	hitherward let your vigorous horses bear you drink ye with us the wellpressed soma juices.
पराचीमु देवाश्विना धियं मेअम्र्ध्रां सातये कर्तं वसूयुम|	bring forward aśvins gods to its fulfilment my neverwearied prayer that asks for riches.
विश्वा अविष्टं वाज आ पुरन्धीस्ता नः शक्तं शचीपती शचीभिः|	vouchsafe us all high spirit in the combat and with your powers o lords of power assist us.
अविष्टं धीष्वश्विना न आसु परजावद रेतो अह्रयं नो अस्तु|	favour us in these prayers of ours o aśvins may we have genial vigour neer to fail us.
आ वां तोके तनये तूतुजानाः सुरत्नासो देववीतिंगमेम|	so may we strong in children and descendants go wealthy to the banquet that awaits you.
एष सय वां पूर्वगत्वेव सख्ये निधिर्हितो माध्वी रातो अस्मे|	lovers of sweetness we have brought this treasure to you as twere an envoy sent for friendship.
अहेळता मनसा यातमर्वागश्नन्ता हव्यं मानुषीषु विक्षु|	come unto us with spirits free from anger in homes of men enjoying our oblation.
एकस्मिन योगे भुरणा समाने परि वां सप्त सरवतो रथो गात|	with one the same intention ye swift movers oer the seven rivers hath your chariot travelled.
न वायन्ति सुभ्वो देवयुक्ता ये वां धूर्षु तरणयोवहन्ति|	yoked by the gods your strong steeds never weary while speeding forward at the pole they bear you.
असश्चता मघवद्भ्यो हि भूतं ये राया मघदेयं जुनन्ति|	exhaustless be your bounty to our princes who with their wealth incite the gift of riches.
पर ये बन्धुं सून्र्ताभिस्तिरन्ते गव्या पर्ञ्चन्तो अश्व्या मघानि|	who further friendship with their noble natures combining wealth in kine with wealth in herses.
नू मे हवमा शर्णुतं युवाना यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत|	now hear o youthful twain mine invocation come aśvins to the home where food aboundeth.
धत्तं रत्नानि जरतं च सूरीन यूयं पात|	vouchsafe us wealth do honour to our nobles preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
धेनुः परत्नस्य काम्यं दुहानान्तः पुत्रश्चरति दक्षिणायाः|	the ancients milchcow yields the things we long for the son of dakṣiṇā travels between them.
आ दयोतनिं वहति शुभ्रयामोषस सतोमो अश्विनावजीगः|	she with the splendid chariot brings refulgence the praise of uṣas hath awoke the aśvins.
सुयुग वहन्ति परति वां रतेनोर्ध्वा भवन्ति पितरेव मेधाः|	they bear you hither by wellorderd statute our sacred offerings rise as if to parents.
जरेथामस्मद वि पणेर्महीषां युवोरवश्चक्र्मा यातमर्वाक|	destroy in us the counsel of the niggard come hitherward for we have shown you favour.
सुयुग्भिरश्वैः सुव्र्ता रथेन दस्राविमं शर्णुतं शलोकमद्रेः|	with lightlyrolling car and wellyoked horses hear this the pressstones song ye wonderworkers.
किमङग वां परत्यवर्तिं गमिष्ठाहुर्विप्रासो अश्विना पुराजाः|	have not the sages of old time ye aśvins called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune.
आ मन्येथामा गतं कच्चिदेवैर्विश्वे जनासो अश्विना हवन्ते|	remember us and come to us for ever men as their wont is invocate the aśvins.
इमा हि वां गोर्जीका मधूनि पर मित्रासो न ददुरुस्रो अग्रे|	friends as it were have offered you these juices sweet blent with milk at the first break of morning.
तिरः पुरू चिदश्विना रजांस्याङगूषो वां मघवाना जनेषु|	even through many regions o ye aśvins high praise is yours among mankind ye mighty.
एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम|	come helpers on the paths which gods have travelled here your libations of sweet meath are ready.
पुराणमोकः सख्यं शिवं वां युवोर्नरा दरविणं जह्नाव्याम|	ancient your home auspicious is your friendship heroes your wealth is with the house of jahnu.
पुनः कर्ण्वानाः सख्या शिवानि मध्वा मदेमसह नू समानाः|	forming again with you auspicious friendship let us rejoice with draughts of meath together.
अश्विना वायुना युवं सुदक्षा नियुद्भिष च सजोषसा युवाना|	o aśvins very mighty ones with vāyu and with his steeds oneminded everyouthful.
नासत्या तिरोह्न्यं जुषाणा सोमं पिबतमस्रिधा सुदानू|	nāsatyas joying in the third days soma drink it not hostile very bounteous givers.
अश्विना परि वामिषः पुरूचीरीयुर्गीर्भिर्यतमाना अम्र्ध्राः|	aśvins to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs unceasing.
रथो ह वां रतजा अद्रिजूतः परि दयावाप्र्थिवी याति सद्यः|	sprung from high law your car urged on by pressstones goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment.
अश्विना मधुषुत्तमो युवाकुः सोमस्तं पातमा गतं दुरोणे|	aśvins your soma sheds delicious sweetness drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling.
रथो ह वां भूरि वर्पः करिक्रत सुतावतो निष्क्र्तमागमिष्ठः|	your car assuming many a shape most often goes to the somapressers place of meeting.
भवा नो अग्ने सुमना उपेतौ सखेव सख्ये पितरेव साधुः|	agni be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend as sire and mother.
पुरुद्रुहो हि कषितयो जनानां परति परतीचीर्दहतादरातीः|	the races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.
तपो शवग्ने अन्तरानमित्रान तपा शंसमररुषः परस्य|	agni burn up the unfriendly who are near us burn thou the foemans curse who pays no worship.
तपो वसो चिकितानो अचित्तान वि ते तिष्ठन्तामजरा अयासः|	burn vasu thou who markest well the foolish let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.
इध्मेनाग्न इछमानो घर्तेन जुहोमि हव्यं तरसे बलाय|	with fuel agni and with oil desirous mine offering i present for strength and conquest.
यावदीशे बरह्मणा वन्दमान इमां धियं शतसेयाय देवीम|	with prayer so far as i have power adoringthis hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.
उच्छोचिषा सहसस पुत्र सतुतो बर्हद वयः शशमानेषु धेहि|	give with thy glow thou son of strength when lauded great vital power to those who toil to serve thee.
रेवदग्ने विश्वामित्रेषु शं योर्मर्म्र्ज्मा ते तन्वं भूरि कर्त्वः|	give richly agni to the viśvāmitras in rest and stir oft have we decked thy body.
कर्धि रत्नं सुसनितर्धनानां स घेदग्ने भवसि यत समिद्धः|	give us o liberal lord great store of riches for agni such art thou when duly kindled.
सतोतुर्दुरोणे सुभगस्य रेवत सर्प्रा करस्ना दधिषे वपूंषि|	thou in the happy singers home bestowest amply with arms extended things of beauty.
पर पर्वतानामुशती उपस्थादश्वे इव विषिते हासमाने|	forth from the bosom of the mountains eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending.
गावेव शुभ्रे मातरा रिहाणे विपाट छुतुद्री पयसाजवेते|	like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling vipāś and sutudri speed down their waters.
इन्द्रेषिते परसवं भिक्षमाणे अछा समुद्रं रथ्येव याथः|	impelled by indra whom ye pray to urge you ye move as twere on chariots to the ocean.
समाराणे ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमाने अन्या वामन्यामप्येति शुभ्रे|	flowing together swelling with your billows o lucid streams each of you seeks the other.
अछा सिन्धुं मात्र्तमामयासं विपाशमुर्वीं सुभगामगन्म|	i have attained the most maternal river we have approached vipāś the broad the blessed.
वत्समिव मातरा संरिहाणे समानं योनिमनु संचरन्ती|	licking as twere their calf the pair of mothers flow onward to their common home together.
एन वयं पयसा पिन्वमाना अनु योनिं देवक्र्तं चरन्तीः|	we two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which gods have made us.
न वर्तवे परसवः सर्गतक्तः किंयुर्विप्रो नद्यो जोहवीति|	our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion what would the singer calling to the rivers.
रमध्वं मे वचसे सोम्याय रतावरीरुप मुहूर्तमेवैः|	linger a little at my friendly bidding rest holy ones a moment in your journey.
पर सिन्धुमछा बर्हती मनीषावस्युरह्वे कुशिकस्य सूनुः|	with hymn sublime soliciting your favour kuśikas son hath called unto the river.
इन्द्रो अस्मानरदद वज्रबाहुरपाहन वर्त्रं परिधिं नदीनाम|	indra who wields the thunder dug our channels he smote down vṛtra him who stayed our currents.
देवोअनयत सवित सुपाणिस्तस्य वयं परसवे याम उर्वीः|	savitar god the lovelyhanded led us and at his sending forth we flow expanded.
परवाच्यं शश्वधा वीर्यं तदिन्द्रस्य कर्म यदहिंविव्र्श्चत|	that hero deed of indra must be lauded for ever that he rent ahi in pieces.
वि वज्रेण परिषदो जघानायन्नापोअयनमिछमानाः|	he smote away the obstructors with his thunder and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.
एतद वचो जरितर्मापि मर्ष्ठा आ यत ते घोषानुत्तरा युगानि|	never forget this word of thine o singer which future generations shall reecho.
उक्थेषु कारो परति नो जुषस्व मा नो नि कः पुरुषत्रा नमस्ते|	in hymns o bard show us thy loving kindness humble us not mid men to thee be honour.
ओ षु सवसारः कारवे शर्णोत ययौ वो दूरादनसा रथेन|	list quickly sisters to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon.
नि षू नमध्वं भवता सुपारा अधोक्षाः सिन्धवःस्रोत्याभिः|	bow lowly down be easy to be traversed stay rivers with your floods below our axles.
आ ते कारो शर्णवामा वचांसि ययाथ दूरादनसा रथेन|	yea we will listen to thy words o singer with wain and car from far away thou comest.
नि ते नंसै पीप्यानेव योषा मर्यायेव कन्या शश्वचै ते|	low like a nursing mother will i bend me and yield me as a maiden to her lover.
यदङग तवा भरताः सन्तरेयुर्गव्यन गराम इषित इन्द्रजूतः|	soon as the bharatas have fared across thee the warrior band urged on and sped by indra.
अर्षादह परसवः सर्गतक्त आ वो वर्णे सुमतिं यज्ञियानाम|	then let your streams flow on in rapid motion i crave your favour who deserve our worship.
अतारिषुर्भरता गव्यवः समभक्त विप्रः सुमतिं नदीनाम|	the warrior host the bharatas fared over the singer won the favour of the rivers.
पर पिन्वध्वमिषयन्तीः सुराधा आ वक्षणाः पर्णध्वं यात शीभम|	swell with your billows hasting pouring riches fill full your channels and roll swiftly onward.
उद व ऊर्मिः शम्या हन्त्वापो योक्त्राणि मुञ्चत|	so let your wave bear up the pins and ye o waters spare the thongs.
मादुष्क्र्तौ वयेनसाघ्न्यौ शूनमारताम|	and never may the pair of bulls harmless and sinless waste away.
आ तू न इन्द्र मद्र्यग घुवानः सोमपीतये|	invoked to drink the soma juice come with thy bay steeds thunderarmed.
हरिभ्यां याह्यद्रिवः|	come indra hitherward to me.
सत्तो होता न रत्वियस्तिस्तिरे बर्हिरानुषक|	our priest is seated true to time the grass is regularly strewn.
अयुज्रन परातरद्रयः|	the pressingstones were set at morn.
इमा बरह्म बरह्मवाहः करियन्त आ बर्हिः सीद|	these prayers o thou who hearest prayer are offered seat thee on the grass.
वीहि शूर पुरोळाशम|	hero enjoy the offered cake.
रारन्धि सवनेषु ण एषु सतोमेषु वर्त्रहन|	o vṛtraslayer be thou pleased with these libations with these hymns.
उक्थेष्विन्द्र गिर्वणः|	songloving indra with our lauds.
मतयः सोमपामुरुं रिहन्ति शवसस पतिम|	our hymns caress the lord of strength vast drinker of the somas juice.
इन्द्रं वत्सं न मातरः|	indra as mothercows their calf.
स मन्दस्वा हयन्धसो राधसे तन्वा महे|	delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence.
न सतोतारं निदे करः|	yield not thy singer to reproach.
वयमिन्द्र तवायवो हविष्मन्तो जरामहे|	we indra dearly loving thee bearing oblation sing thee hymns.
उत तवमस्मयुर्वसो|	thou vasu dearly lovest us.
मारे अस्मद वि मुमुचो हरिप्रियार्वां याहि|	o thou to whom thy bays are dear loose not thy horses far from us.
इन्द्र सवधावोमत्स्वेह|	here glad thee indra lord divine.
अर्वाञ्चं तवा सुखे रथे वहतामिन्द्र केशिना|	may longmaned coursers dropping oil bring thee on swift car hitherward.
घर्तस्नूबर्हिरासदे|	indra to seat thee on the grass.
अग्निमुषसमश्विना दधिक्रां वयुष्टिषु हवते वह्निरुक्थैः|	with lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh agni dawn dadhikrās and both the aśvins.
सुज्योतिषो नः शर्ण्वन्तु देवाः सजोषसो अध्वरं वावशानाः|	with one consent the gods whose light is splendid longing to taste our sacrifice shall hear us.
अग्ने तरी ते वाजिना तरी षधस्था तिस्रस्ते जिह्वा रतजात पूर्वीः|	three are thy powers o agni three thy stations three are thy tongues yea many child of order.
तिस्र उ ते तन्वो देववातास्ताभिर्नः पाहि गिरो अप्रयुछन|	three bodies hast thou which the gods delight in with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.
अग्ने भूरीणि तव जातवेदो देव सवधावोअम्र्तस्य नाम|	o agni many are the names thou bearest immortal god divine and jātavedas.
याश्च माया मायिनां विश्वमिन्व तवे पूर्वीः सन्दधुःप्र्ष्टबन्धो|	and many charms of charmers allinspirer have they laid in thee lord of true attendants.
अग्निर्नेता भग इव कषितीनां दैवीनां देव रतुपा रतावा|	agni like bhaga leads the godly people he who is true to law and guards the seasons.
स वर्त्रहा सनयो विश्ववेदाः पर्षद विश्वाति दुरिता गर्णन्तम|	ancient allknowing he the vṛtraslayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.
ददहिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीं बर्हस्पतिं सवितारं चदेवम|	i call on savitar the god on morning bṛhaspati and dadhikrās and agni.
अश्विना मित्रावरुणा भगं च वसून रुद्रानादित्यानिह हुवे|	on varuṇa and mitra on the aśvins bhaga the vasus rudras and Ādityas.
उप नः सुतमा गहि सोममिन्द्र गवाशिरम|	come to the juice that we have pressed to soma indra bleat with milk.
हरिभ्यां यस्ते अस्मयुः|	come favouring us thy baydrawn car.
तमिन्द्र मदमा गहि बर्हिष्ठां गरावभिः सुतम|	come indra to this gladdening drink placed on the grass pressed out with stones.
कुविन नवस्य तर्प्णवः|	wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof.
इन्द्रमित्था गिरो ममाछागुरिषिता इतः|	to indra have my songs of praise gone forth thus rapidly sent hence.
आव्र्ते सोमपीतये|	to turn him to the somadraught.
इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये सतोमैरिह हवामहे|	hither with songs of praise we call indra to drink the soma juice.
उक्थेभिः कुविदागमत|	will he not come to us by lauds.
इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तान दधिष्व शतक्रतो|	indra these somas are expressed take them within thy belly lord.
जठरे वाजिनीवसो|	of hundred powers thou prince of wealth.
विद्मा हि तवा धनंजयं वाजेषु दध्र्षं कवे|	we know thee winner of the spoil and resolute in battles sage.
अधा तेसुम्नमीमहे|	therefore thy blessing we implore.
इममिन्द्र गवाशिरं यवाशिरं च नः पिब|	borne hither by thy stallions drink indra this juice which we have pressed.
आगत्या वर्षभिः सुतम|	mingled with barley and with milk.
तुभ्येदिन्द्र सव ओक्ये सोमं चोदामि पीतये|	indra for thee in thine own place i urge the soma for thy draught.
एष रारन्तु ते हर्दि|	deep in thy heart let it remain.
तवां सुतस्य पीतये परत्नमिन्द्र हवामहे|	we call on thee the ancient one indra to drink the soma juice.
कुशिकासो अवस्यवः|	we kuśikas who seek thine aid.
इहेह वो मनसा बन्धुता नर उशिजो जग्मुरभि तानि वेदसा|	here is your ghostly kinship here o men they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth.
याभिर्मायाभिः परतिजूतिवर्पसः सौधन्वना यज्ञियं भागमानश|	with wondrous arts whereby with schemes to meet each need ye gained sudhanvans sons your share in sacrifice.
याभिः शचीभिश्चमसानपिंशत यया धिया गामरिणीत चर्मणः|	the mighty powers wherewith ye formed the chalices the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide.
येन हरी मनसा निरतक्षत तेन देवत्वं रभवः समानश|	the intellect wherewith ye wrought the two bay steedsthrough these o Ṛbhus ye attained divinity.
इन्द्रस्य सख्यं रभवः समानशुर्मनोर्नपातो अपसो दधन्विरे|	friendship with indra have the Ṛbhus fully gained grandsons of manu they skilfully urged the work.
सौधन्वनासो अम्र्तत्वमेरिरे विष्ट्वी शमीभिः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया|	sudhanvans children won them everlasting life serving with holy rites pious with noble acts.
इन्द्रेण याथ सरथं सुते सचानथो वशानां भवथासह शरिया|	in company with indra come ye to the juice then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled.
न वः परतिमै सुक्र्तानि वाघतः सौधन्वना रभवो वीर्याणि च|	not to be paragoned ye priests are your good deeds nor your heroic acts Ṛbhus sudhanvans sons.
इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजवद्भिः समुक्षितं सुतं सोममा वर्षस्वा गभस्त्योः|	o indra with the Ṛbhus mighty ones pour down the soma juice effused wellblent from both thy hands.
धियेषितो मघवन दाशुषो गर्हे सौधन्वनेभिः सह मत्स्वा नर्भिः|	maghalan urged by song in the drinkofferers house rejoice thee with the heroes with sudhanvans sons.
इन्द्र रभुमान वाजवान मत्स्वेह नोअस्मिन सवने शच्या पुरुष्टुत|	with Ṛbhu near and vāja indra here exult with saci praised of many in the juice we pour.
इमानि तुभ्यं सवसराणि येमिरे वरता देवानां मनुषश्च धर्मभिः|	these homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee devotions to the gods as laws of men ordain.
इन्द्र रभुभिर्वाजिभिर्वाजयन्निह सतोमं जरितुरुप याहि यज्ञियम|	come with the mighty Ṛbhus indra come to us strengthening with thy help the singers holy praise.
शतं केतेभिरिषिरेभिरायवे सहस्रणीथोध्वरस्य होमनि|	at hundred eager calls come to the living man with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice.
युध्मस्य ते वर्षभस्य सवराज उग्रस्य यून सथविरस्य घर्ष्वेः|	of thee the bull the warrior sovran ruler joyous and fierce ancient and ever youthful.
अजूर्यतो वज्रिणो वीर्याणीन्द्र शरुतस्य महतो महानि|	the undecaying one who wields the thunder renowned and great great are the exploits indra.
महानसि महिष वर्ष्ण्येभिर्धनस्प्र्दुग्र सहमानो अन्यान|	great art thou mighty lord through manly vigour o fierce one gathering spoil subduing others.
एको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा स योधया च कषयया च जनान|	thyself alone the universes sovran so send forth men to combat and to rest them.
पर मात्राभी रिरिचे रोचमानः पर देवेभिर्विश्वतो अप्रतीतः|	he hath surpassed all measure in his brightness yea and the gods for none may be his equal.
पर मज्मना दिव इन्द्रः पर्थिव्याः परोरोर्महो अन्तरिक्षाद रजीषी|	impetuous indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast midair and heaven and earth together.
उरुं गभीरं जनुषाभ्युग्रं विश्वव्यचसमवतं मतीनाम|	to indra even as rivers to the ocean flow forth from days of old the soma juices.
इन्द्रं सोमासः परदिवि सुतासः समुद्रं न सरवता विशन्ति|	to him wide deep and mighty from his birthtime the well of holy thoughts ailcomprehending.
यं सोममिन्द्र पर्थिवीद्यावा गर्भं न माता बिभ्र्तस्त्वाया|	the soma indra which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant.
तं ते हिन्वन्ति तमु ते मर्जन्त्यध्वर्यवो वर्षभ पातवा उ|	this they send forth to thee this vigorous hero adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.
अग्ने जुषस्व नो हविः पुरोळाशं जातवेदः|	agni who knowest all accept our offering and the cake of meal.
परातःसावेधियावसो|	at dawns libation rich in prayer.
पुरोळा अग्ने पचतस्तुभ्यं वा घा परिष्क्र्तः|	agni the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee.
तं जुषस्व यविष्ठ्य|	accept it o most youthful god.
अग्ने वीहि पुरोळाषमाहुतं तिरोह्न्यम|	agni enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old.
सहसः सूनुरस्यध्वरे हितः|	thou son of strength art stablished at our sacrifice.
माध्यन्दिने सवने जातवेदः पुरोळाशमिह कवे जुषस्व|	here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake wise jātavedas.
अग्ने यह्वस्य तव भागधेयं न पर मिनन्ति विदथेषु धीराः|	agni the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the mighty.
अग्ने तर्तीये सवने हि कानिषः पुरोळाशं सहसः सूनवाहुतम|	o agni at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice thou son of strength.
अथा देवेष्वध्वरं विपन्यया धा रत्नवन्तमम्र्तेषु जाग्र्विम|	through skill in song bear to the gods our sacrifice watchful and fraught with riches to immortal god.
अग्ने वर्धान आहुतिं पुरोळाशं जातवेदः|	o waxing agni knower thou of all accept our gifts the cake.
जुषस्व तिरोह्न्यम|	and that prepared ere yesterday.
मित्रो जनान यातयति बरुवाणो मित्रो दाधार पर्थिवीमुत दयाम|	mitra when speaking stirreth men to labour mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven.
मित्रः कर्ष्टीरनिमिषाभि चष्टे मित्राय हव्यंघ्र्तवज्जुहोत|	mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not to mitra bring with holy oil oblation.
पर स मित्र मर्तो अस्तु परयस्वान यस्त आदित्य शिक्षति वरतेन|	foremost be he who brings thee food o mitra who strives to keep thy sacred law Āditya.
न हन्यते न जीयते तवोतो नैनमंहो अश्नोत्यन्तितो न दूरात|	he whom thou helpest neer is slain or conquered on him from near or far falls no affliction.
अनमीवास इळया मदन्तो मितज्ञवो वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्याः|	joying in sacred food and free from sickness with knees bent lowly on the earths broad surface.
आदित्यस्य वरतमुपक्षियन्तो वयं मित्रस्य सुमतौ सयाम|	following closely the Ādityas statute may we remain in mitras gracious favour.
अयं मित्रो नमस्यः सुशेवो राजा सुक्षत्रो अजनिष्ट वेधाः|	auspicious and adorable this mitra was born with fair dominion king disposer.
तस्य वयं|	may we enjoy the grace of him the holy yea rest in his propitious lovingkindness.
महानादित्यो नमसोपसद्यो यातयज्जनो गर्णते सुशेवः|	the great Āditya to be served with wor ship who stirreth men is gracious to the singer.
तस्मा एतत पन्यतमाय जुष्टमग्नौ मित्राय हविरा जुहोत|	to mitra him most highly to be lauded offer in fire oblation that he loveth.
मित्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तोअवो देवस्य सानसि|	the gainful grace of mitra god supporter of the race of man.
दयुम्नं चित्रश्रवस्तमम|	gives splendour of mostglorious fame.
अभि यो महिना दिवं मित्रो बभूव सप्रथाः|	mitra whose glory spreads afar he who in might surpasses heaven.
अभि शरवोभिः पर्थिवीम|	surpasses earth in his renown.
मित्राय पञ्च येमिरे जना अभिष्टिशवसे|	all the five races have repaired to mitra ever strong to aid.
स देवान विश्वान बिभर्ति|	for he sustaineth all the gods.
मित्रो देवेष्वायुषु जनाय वर्क्तबर्हिषे|	mitra to gods to living men to him who strews the holy grass.
इष इष्टव्रताकः|	gives food fulfilling sacred law.
पर मे विविक्वानविदन मनीषां धेनुं चरन्तीं परयुतामगोपाम|	my thought with fine discernment hath discovered the cow who wanders free without a herdsman.
सद्यश्चिद या दुदुहे भूरि धासेरिन्द्रस्तदग्निः पनितारो अस्याः|	her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty indra and agni therefore are her praisers.
इन्द्रः सु पूषा वर्षणा सुहस्ता दिवो न परीताः शशयं दुदुह्रे|	indra and pūṣan deft of hand and mighty wellpleased have drained the heavens exhaustless udder.
विश्वे यदस्यां रणयन्त देवाः पर वोअत्र वसवः सुम्नमश्याम|	as in this praise the gods have all delighted may i win blessing here from you o vasus.
या जामयो वर्ष्ण इछन्ति शक्तिं नमस्यन्तीर्जानते गर्भमस्मिन|	fain to lend vigour to the bull the siste with reverence recognize the germ within him.
अछा पुत्रं धेनवो वावशाना महश्चरन्ति बिभ्रतं वपूंषि|	the cows come lowing hither to the youngling to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.
अछा विवक्मि रोदसी सुमेके गराव्णो युजानो अध्वरे मनीषा|	fixing with thought at sacrifice the pressstones i bid the wellformed heaven and earth come hither.
इमा उ ते मनवे भूरिवारा ऊर्ध्वा भवन्ति दर्शता यजत्राः|	for these thy flames which give men boons in plenty rise up on high the beautiful the holy.
या ते जिह्वा मधुमती सुमेधा अग्ने देवेषूच्यत उरूची|	agni thy meathsweet tongue that tastes fair viands which among gods is called the farextended.
तयेह विश्वानवसे यजत्राना सादय पायया चा मधूनि|	therewith make all the holy odes be seated here for our help and feed them with sweet juices.
या ते अग्ने पर्वतस्येव धारासश्चन्ती पीपयद देव चित्रा|	let thy stream give us drink o god o agni wonderful and exhaustless like the rainclouds.
तामस्मभ्यं परमतिं जातवेदो वसो रास्व सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम|	thus care for us o vasu jātavedas show us thy lovingkindness reaching all men.
अगने दिवः सूनुरसि परचेतास्तना पर्थिव्या उत विश्ववेदाः|	thou art the sapient son of dyaus o agni yes and the child of earth who knowest all things.
रधग देवानिह यजा चिकित्वः|	bring the gods specially thou sage for worship.
अग्निः सनोति वीर्याणि विद्वान सनोति वाजमम्र्ताय भूषन|	agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food preparing it for nectar.
स नो देवानेह वहा पुरुक्षो|	thou who art rich in food bring the gods hither.
अग्निर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी विश्वजन्ये आ भाति देवी अम्र्ते अमूरः|	agni infallible lights earth and heaven immortal goddesses gracious to all men.
कषयन वाजैः पुरुश्चन्द्रो नमोभिः|	lord through his strength splendid through adorations.
अग्न इन्द्रश्च दाशुषो दुरोने सुतावतो यज्ञमिहोप यातम|	come to the sacrifice agni and indra come to the offerers house who hath the soma.
अमर्धन्ता सोमपेयाय देवा|	come friendlyminded gods to drink the soma.
अग्ने अपां समिध्यसे दुरोणे नित्यः सूनो सहसो जातवेदः|	in the floods home art thou enkindled agni o jātavedas son of strength eternal.
सधस्थानि महयमान ऊती|	exalting with thine help the gatheringplaces.
वैश्वानराय पर्थुपाजसे विपो रत्ना विधन्त धरुणेषु गातवे|	to him who shines afar vaiśvānara shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths.
अग्निर्हि देवानम्र्तो दुवस्यत्यथा धर्माणि सनता न दूदुषत|	for agni the immortal serves the deities and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.
अन्तर्दूतो रोदसी दस्म ईयते होता निषत्तो मनुषः पुरोहितः|	he wondrous envoy goes between the earth and heaven firm seated as the herald great high priest of men.
कषयं बर्हन्तं परि भूषति दयुभिर्देवेभिरग्निरिषितो धियावसुः|	he compassethwith rays the lofty dwellingplace agni sent forward by the gods enriched with piayer.
केतुं यज्ञानां विदथस्य सा धनं विप्रासो अग्निं महयन्त चित्तिभिः|	sages shall glorify agni with earnest thoughts ensign of sacrifice who fills the synod full.
अपांसि यस्मिन्नधि सन्दधुर्गिरस्तस्मिन सुम्नानि यजमान आ चके|	in whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.
पिता यज्ञानामसुरो विपश्चितां विमानमग्निर्वयुनं च वाघताम|	the sire of sacrifice great god of holy bards agni the measure and the symbol of the priests.
आ विवेश रोदसी भूरिवर्पसा पुरुप्रियो भन्दते धामभिः कविः|	hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form the sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.
चन्द्रमग्निं चन्द्ररथं हरिव्रतं वैश्वानरमप्सुषदं सवर्विदम|	bright agni with the bright car lord of green domains vaiśvānara dweller in the floods who finds the light.
विगाहं तूर्णिं तविषीभिराव्र्तं भूर्णिं देवास इह सुश्रियं दधुः|	pervading swift and wild encompassed round with powers him very glorious have the gods established here.
अग्निर्देवेभिर्मनुषश्च जन्तुभिस्तन्वानो यज्ञं पुरुपेशसं धिया|	agni together with the gods and manus folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form.
रथीरन्तरीयते साधदिष्टिभिर्जीरो दमूना अभिशस्तिचातनः|	goes carborne to and fro with those who crown each rite the fleet the household friend who turns the curse aside.
अग्ने जरस्व सवपत्य आयुन्यूर्जा पिन्वस्व समिषो दिदीहि नः|	sing agni for long life to us and noble sons teem thou with plenty shine upon us store of food.
वयांसि जिन्व बर्हतश्च जाग्र्व उशिग देवानामसि सुक्रतुर्विपाम|	increase the great mans strength thou evervigilant thou longing for the gods knowest their hymns full well.
विश्पतिं यह्वमतिथिं नरः सदा यन्तारं धीनामुशिजं च वाघताम|	the mighty one lord of the people and their guest the leader of their thoughts devoted friend of priests.
अध्वराणां चेतनं जातवेदसं पर शंसन्ति नमसा जूतिभिर्व्र्धे|	our solemn rites announcer jātavedas men with worship ever praise with urgings for their weal.
विभावा देवः सुरणः परि कषितीरग्निर्बभूव शवसासुमद्रथः|	agni the god resplendent giver of great joy hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with might.
तस्य वरतानि भूरिपोषिणो वयमुप भूषेमदम आ सुव्र्क्तिभिः|	let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.
वैश्वानर तव धामान्या चके येभिः सवर्विदभवो विचक्षण|	i celebrate thy glories o vaiśvānara wherewith thou o farsighted god has found the light.
जात आप्र्णो भुवनानि रोदसी अग्ने ता विस्वा परिभूरसि तमना|	thou filledst at thy birth both worlds the earth and heaven all this o agni hast thou compassed of thyself.
वैश्वानरस्य दंसनाभ्यो बर्हदरिणादेकः सवपस्यया कविः|	by his great skill the sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed mightier than vaiśvānaras wondrous acts.
उभा पितरा महयन्नजायताग्निर्द्यावाप्र्थिवी भूरिरेतसा|	agni sprang into being magnifying both his parents heaven and earth rich in prolific seed.
उषो वाजेन वाजिनि परचेता सतोमं जुषस्व गर्णतो मघोनि|	o uṣas strong with strength endowed witli knowledge accept the singers praise o wealthy lady.
पुराणी देवि युवतिः पुरन्धिरनु वरतं चरसि विश्ववारे|	thou goddess ancient young and full of wisdom movest allbounteous as the law ordaineth.
उषो देव्यमर्त्या वि भाहि चन्द्ररथा सून्र्ता ईरयन्ती|	shine forth o morning thou auspicious goddess on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices.
आ तवा वहन्तु सुयमासो अश्वा हिरण्यवर्णां पर्थुपाजसो ये|	let docile horses of farreaching splendour convey thee hitherward the goldencoloured.
उषः परतीची भुवनानि विश्वोर्ध्वा तिष्ठस्यम्र्तस्य केतुः|	thou morning turning thee to every creature standest on high as ensign of the immortal.
समानमर्थं चरणीयमाना चक्रमिव नव्यस्या वव्र्त्स्व|	to one same goal ever and ever wending now like a wheel o newlyborn roll hi ther.
अव सयूमेव चिन्वती मघोन्युषा याति सवसरस्य पत्नी|	letting her reins drop downward morning cometh the wealthy dame the lady of the dwelling.
सवर्जनन्ती सुभगा सुदंसा आन्ताद दिवः पप्रथ आ पर्थिव्याः|	bringing forth light the wonderful the blessed hath spread her from the bounds of earth and heaven.
अछा वो देवीमुषसं विभातीं पर वो भरध्वं नमसा सुव्र्क्तिम|	hither invoke the radiant goddess morning and bring with reverence your hymn to praise her.
ऊर्ध्वं मधुधा दिवि पाजो अश्रेत पर रोचना रुरुचे रण्वसन्द्र्क|	she dropping sweets hath set in heaven her brightness and fair to look on hath beamed forth her splendour.
रतावरी दिवो अर्कैरबोध्या रेवती रोदसी चित्रमस्थात|	from heaven with hymns the holy one was wakened brightly to both worlds came the wealthy lady.
आयतीमग्न उषसं विभातीं वाममेषि दरविणं भिक्षमाणः|	to morning agni when she comes refulgent thou goest forth soliciting fair riches.
रतस्य बुध्न उषसामिषण्यन वर्षा मही रोदसी आ विवेश|	on laws firm base the speeder of the mornings the bull hath entered mighty earth and heaven.
मही मित्रस्य वरुणस्य माया चन्द्रेव भानुं वि दधे पुरुत्रा|	great is the power of varuṇa and mitra which bright hath spread in every place its splendour.
आ मन्द्रैरिन्द्र हरिभिर्याहि मयूररोमभिः|	come hither indra with bay steeds joyous with tails like peacocks plumes.
मा तवा केचिन नि यमन विं न पाशिनोअति धन्वेव तानिहि|	let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird pass oer them as oer desert lands.
वर्त्रखादो वलंरुजः पुरां दर्मो अपामजः|	he who slew vṛtra burst the cloud brake the strongholds and drave the floods.
सथाता रथस्य हर्योरभिस्वर इन्द्रो दर्ळ्हा चिदारुजः|	indra who mounts his chariot at his bay steeds cry shatters een things that stand most firm.
गम्भीरानुदधीन्रिव करतुं पुष्यसि गा इव|	like pools of water deep and full like kine thou cherishest thy might.
पर सुगोपायवसं धेनवो यथा हरदं कुल्या इवाशत|	like the milchcows that go wellguarded to the mead like waterbrooks that reach the lake.
आ नस्तुजं रयिं भरांशं न परतिजानते|	bring thou us wealth with power to strike our share gainst him who calls it his.
वर्क्षं पक्वं फलमङकीव धूनुहीन्द्र सम्पारणं वसु|	shake indra as with hooks the tree for ripened fruit for wealth to satisfy our wish.
सवयुरिन्द्र सवराळ असि समद्दिष्टिः सवयशस्तरः|	indra selfruling lord art thou good leader of most glorious fame.
स वाव्र्धान ओजसा पुरुष्टुत भवा नः सुश्रवस्तमः|	so waxen in thy strength o thou whom many praise be thou most swift to hear our call.
पर वो देवायाग्नये बर्हिष्ठमर्चास्मै|	to agni to this god of yours i sing aloud with utmost power.
गमद देवेभिरास नो यजिष्ठो बर्हिरा सदत|	may he come to us with the gods and sit best offerer on the grass.
रतावा यस्य रोदसी दक्षं सचन्त ऊतयः|	the holy whose are earth and heaven and succour waits upon his strength.
हविष्मन्तस्तमीळते तं सनिष्यन्तोअवसे|	him men who bring oblations laud and they who wish to gain for grace.
स यन्ता विप्र एषां स यज्ञानामथा हि षः|	he is the sage who guides these men leader of sacred rites is he.
अग्निं तं वो दुवस्यत दाता यो वनिता मघम|	him your own agni serve ye well who winneth and bestoweth wealth.
स नः शर्माणि वीतयेअग्निर्यछतु शन्तमा|	so may the gracious agni grant most goodly shelter for our use.
यतो नःप्रुष्णवद वसु दिवि कषितिभ्यो अप्स्वा|	whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.
दीदिवांसमपूर्व्यं वस्वीभिरस्य धीतिभिः|	the singers kindle him the priest agni the lord of tribes of men.
रक्वाणो अग्निमिन्धते होतारं विश्पतिं विशाम|	resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.
उत नो बरह्मन्नविष उक्थेषु देवहूतमः|	help us thou brahman best of all invokers of the gods in song.
शं नः शोचामरुद्व्र्धोअग्ने सहस्रसातमः|	beam friend of maruts bliss on us o agni a most liberal god.
नू नो रास्व सहस्रवत तोकवत पुष्टिमद वसु|	yea grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment.
दयुमदग्ने सुवीर्यं वर्षिष्थमनुपक्षितम|	and agni splendid hero strength exalted wasting not away.
चर्षणीध्र्तं मघवानमुक्थ्यमिन्द्रं गिरो बर्हतीरभ्यनूषत|	high hymns have sounded forth the praise of maghavan supporter of mankind of indra meet for lauds.
वाव्र्धानं पुरुहूतं सुव्र्क्तिभिरमर्त्यं जरमाणं दिवेदिवे|	him who hath waxen great invoked with beauteous songs immortal one whose praise each day is sung aloud.
शतक्रतुमर्णवं शाकिनं नरं गिरो म इन्द्रमुप यन्ति विश्वतः|	to indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise the lord of hundred powers strong hero like the sea.
वाजसनिं पूर्भिदं तूर्णिमप्तुरं धामसाचमभिषाचं सवर्विदम|	swift winner of the booty breakerdown of forts faithful and everglorious finder of the light.
आकरे वसोर्जरिता पनस्यतेअनेहस सतुभ इन्द्रो दुवस्यति|	where battles spoil is piled the singer winneth praise for indra taketh care of matchless worshippers.
विवस्वतः सदन आ हि पिप्रिये सत्रासाहमभिमातिहनं सतुहि|	he in vivasvāns dwelling findeth his delight praise thou the everconquering slayer of the foe.
नर्णामु तवा नर्तमं गीर्भिरुक्थैरभि पर वीरमर्चता सबाधः|	thee valorous most heroic of the heroes shall the priests glorify with songg and praises.
सं सहसे पुरुमायो जिहीते नमो अस्य परदिव एक ईशे|	full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest worship is his sole lord from days aforetime.
पूर्वीरस्य निष्षिधो मर्त्येषु पुरू वसूनि पर्थिवी बिभर्ति|	abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures.
इन्द्राय दयाव ओषधीरुतापो रयिं रक्षन्ति जीरयो वनानि|	the heavens the growing plants the living waters the forest trees preserve their wealth for indra.
तुभ्यं बरह्माणि गिर इन्द्र तुभ्यं सत्रा दधिरे हरिवो जुषस्व|	to thee o indra lord of bays for ever are offered prayers and songs accept them gladly.
बोध्यापिरवसो नूतनस्य सखे वसो जरित्र्भ्यो वयोधाः|	as kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance good friend give strength and life to those who praise thee.
इन्द्र मरुत्व इह पाहि सोमं यथा शार्याते अपिबः सुतस्य|	here indra drink thou soma with the maruts as thou didst drink the juice beside Śāryāta.
तव परणीती तव शूर शर्मन्ना विवासन्ति कवयःसुयज्ञाः|	under thy guidance in thy keeping hero the singers serve skilled in fair sacrifices.
स वावशान इह पाहि सोमं मरुद्भिरिन्द्र सखिभिः सुतं नः|	so eagerly desirous drink the soma our juice o indra with thy friends the maruts.
जातं यत तवा परि देवा अभूषन महे भराय पुरुहूत विश्वे|	since at thy birth all deities adorned thee for the great fight o thou invoked of many.
अप्तूर्ये मरुत आपिरेषोअमन्दन्निन्द्रमनु दातिवाराः|	he was your comrade in your zeal o maruts they rich in noble gifts rejoiced in indra.
तेभिः साकं पिबतु वर्त्रखादः सुतं सोमं दाशुषः सवे सधस्थे|	with them together let the vṛtraslayer drink in his home the worshippers libation.
इदं हयन्वोजसा सुतं राधानां पते|	so lord of affluent gifts this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength.
पिबा तवस्य गिर्वणः|	drink of it thou who lovest song.
यस्ते अनु सवधामसत सुते नि यछ तन्वम|	incline thy body to this juice which suits thy godlike nature well.
स तवा ममत्तु सोम्यम|	may it cheer thee who lovest it.
पर ते अश्नोतु कुक्ष्योः परेन्द्र बरह्मणा शिरः|	brave indra let it work through both thy flanks and through thy head by prayer.
पर बाहू शूर राधसे|	and through thine arms to prosper us.
वार्त्रहत्याय शवसे पर्तनाषाह्याय च|	o indra for the strength that slays vṛtra and conquers in the fight.
इन्द्र तवा वर्तयामसि|	we turn thee hitherward to us.
अर्वाचीनं सु ते मन उत चक्षुः शतक्रतो|	o indra lord of hundred powers may those who praise thee hitherward.
इन्द्र कर्ण्वन्तु वाघतः|	direct thy spirit and thine eye.
नामानि ते शतक्रतो विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरीमहे|	o indra lord of hundred powers with all our songs we invocate.
इन्द्राभिमातिषाह्ये|	thy names for triumph over foes.
पुरुष्टुतस्य धामभिः शतेन महयामसि|	we strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise.
इन्द्रस्य चर्षणीध्र्तः|	of indra who supports mankind.
इन्द्रं वर्त्राय हन्तवे पुरुहूतमुप बरुवे|	for vṛtras slaughter i address indra whom many invocate.
भरेषु वाजसातये|	to win us booty in the wars.
वाजेषु सासहिर्भव तवामीमहे शतक्रतो|	in battles be victorious we seek thee lord of hundred powers.
इन्द्र वर्त्रायहन्तवे|	indra that vṛtra may be slain.
दयुम्नेषु पर्तनाज्ये पर्त्सुतूर्षु शरवस्सु च|	in splendid combats of the hosts in glories where the fight is won.
इन्द्र साक्ष्वाभिमातिषु|	indra be victor over foes.
शुष्मिन्तमं न ऊतये दयुम्निनं पाहि जाग्र्विम|	drink thou the soma for our help bright vigilant exceeding strong.
इन्द्र सोमंशतक्रतो|	o indra lord of hundred powers.
इन्द्रियाणि शतक्रतो या ते जनेषु पञ्चसु|	o Śatakratu powers which thou mid the five races hast displayed.
इन्द्र तानि ता वर्णे|	these indra do i claim of thee.
अगन्निन्द्र शरवो बर्हद दयुम्नं दधिष्व दुष्टरम|	indra great glory hast thou gained win splendid fame which none may mar.
उत ते शुष्मं तिरामसि|	we make thy might perpetual.
अर्वावतो न आ गह्यथो शक्र परावतः|	come to us either from anear or Śakra come from far away.
उ लोको यस्ते अद्रिव इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि|	indra wherever be thy home come to us thence o thunderarmed.
सोमस्य मा तवसं वक्ष्यग्ने वह्निं चकर्थ विदथे यजध्यै|	thou agni who wilt have the strong hast made me the somas priest to worship in assembly.
देवानछा दीद्यद युञ्जे अद्रिं शमाये अग्ने तन्वंजुषस्व|	thou shinest to the gods i set the pressstones i toil be joyful in thyself o agni.
पराञ्चं यज्ञं चक्र्म वर्धतां गीः समिद्भिरग्निं नमसा दुवस्यन|	east have we turned the rite may the hymn aid it with wood and worship shall they honour agni.
दिवः शशासुर्विदथा कवीनां गर्त्साय चित तवसे गातुमीषुः|	from heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it een for the quick and strong they seek advancement.
मयो दधे मेधिरः पूतदक्षो दिवः सुबन्धुर्जनुषा पर्थिव्याः|	the prudent he whose will is pure brought welfare allied by birth to heaven and earth in kinship.
अविन्दन्नु दर्शतमप्स्वन्तर्देवासो अग्निमपसि सवसॄणाम|	the gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful agni with the sisters labour.
अवर्धयन सुभगं सप्त यह्वीः शवेतं जज्ञानमरुषम्महित्वा|	him blessed one the seven strong floods augmented him white at birth and red when waxen mighty.
शिशुं न जातमभ्यारुरश्वा देवासो अग्निंजनिमन वपुष्यन|	as mother mares run to their newborn you ling so at his birth the gods wondered at agni.
शुक्रेभिरङगै रज आततन्वान करतुं पुनानः कविभिः पवित्रैः|	spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region purging his power with wise purifications.
शोचिर्वसानः पर्यायुरपां शरियो मिमीते बर्हतीरनूनाः|	robing himself in light the life of waters he spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.
वव्राजा सीमनदतीरदब्धा दिवो यह्वीरवसाना अनग्नाः|	he sought heavens mighty ones the unconsuming the unimpaired not clothed and yet not naked.
सना अत्र युवतयः सयोनीरेकं गर्भं दधिरे सप्त वाणीः|	then they ancient and young who dwell together seven sounding rivers as one germ received him.
सतीर्णा अस्य संहतो विश्वरूपा घर्तस्य योनौ सरवथे मधूनाम|	his piles assuming every form are scattered where flow sweet waters at the spring of fatness.
अस्थुरत्र धेनवः पिन्वमाना मही दस्मस्य मातरा समीची|	there stood the milchkine with fullladen udders and both paired mighty mothers of the wondrous.
बभ्राणः सूनो सहसो वयद्यौद दाधानः शुक्रा रभसा वपूंषि|	carefully cherished son of strength thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties.
शचोतन्ति धारा मधुनो घर्तस्य वर्षा यत्र वाव्र्धे काव्येन|	full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended there where the mighty one grew strong by wisdom.
पितुश्चिदूधर्जनुषा विवेद वयस्य धारा अस्र्जद वि धेनाः|	from birth he knew even his fathers bosom he set his voices and his streams in motion.
गुहा चरन्तं सखिभिः शिवेभिर्दिवो यह्वीभिर्नगुहा बभूव|	knew him who moved with blessed friends in secret with the young dames of heaven he stayed not hidden.
पितुश्च गर्भं जनितुश्च बभ्रे पूर्वीरेको अधयत पीप्यानाः|	he nursed the infant of the sire and maker alone the babe sucked many a teeming bosom.
वर्ष्णे सपत्नी शुचये सबन्धू उभे अस्मै मनुष्येनि पाहि|	guard for the bright and strong the fellowspouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.
उरौ महाननिबाधे ववर्धापो अग्निं यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः|	the mighty one increased in space unbounded full many a glorious flood gave strength to agni.
रतस्य योनावशयद दमूना जामीनामग्निरपसिस्वसॄणाम|	friend of the house within the lap of order lay agni in the sister rivers service.
अक्रो न बभ्रिः समिथे महीनां दिद्र्क्षेयः सूनवे भार्जीकः|	as keen supporter where great waters gather lightshedder whom the brood rejoice to look on.
उदुस्रिया जनिता यो जजानापां गर्भो नर्तमो यह्वो अग्निः|	he who begat and will beget the dawnlights most manly child of floods is youthful agni.
अपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनां वना जजान सुभगा विरूपम|	him varied in his form the lovely infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered.
देवासश्चिन मनसा सं हि जग्मुः पनिष्ठं जातं तवसं दुवस्यन|	gods even moved in spirit came around him and served him at his birth the strong the wondrous.
बर्हन्त इद भानवो भार्जीकमग्निं सचन्त विद्युतो न शुक्राः|	like brilliant lightnings mighty luminaries accompany the lightdiffusing agni.
गुहेव वर्द्धं सदसि सवे अन्तरपार ऊर्वे अम्र्तन्दुहानाः|	waxen as twere in secret in his dwelling while in the boundless stall they milk out amṛta.
ईळे च तवा यजमानो हविर्भिरीळे सखित्वं सुमतिं निकामः|	i sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy goodwill and friendship.
देवैरवो मिमीहि सं जरित्रे रक्षा च नो दम्येभिरनीकैः|	grant with the gods thy grace to him who lauds thee protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.
उपक्षेतारस्तव सुप्रणीतेअग्ने विश्वानि धन्या दधानाः|	may we o agni thou who leadest wisely thy followers and masters of all treasures.
सुरेतसा शरवसा तुञ्जमाना अभि षयाम पर्तनायून्रदेवान|	strong in the glory of our noble offspring subdue the godless when they seek the battle.
आ देवानामभवः केतुरग्ने मन्द्रो विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान|	ensign of gods hast thou become o agni joygiver knower of all secret wisdom.
परति मर्तानवासयो दमूना अनु देवान रथिरो यासिसाधन|	friend of the homestead thou hast lightened mortals carborne thou goest to the gods fulfilling.
नि दुरोणे अम्र्तो मर्त्यानां राजा ससाद विदथानि साधन|	within the house hath sate the king immortal of mortals filling full their sacred synods.
घर्तप्रतीक उर्विया वयद्यौदग्निर्विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान|	bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely agni the knower of all secret wisdom.
आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन|	come unto us with thine auspicious friendship come speeding mighty with thy mighty succours.
