नू न इद धि वार्यम आसा सचन्त सूरयः|	now too the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips.
ऊर्जो नपाद अभिष्टये पाहि शग्धि सवस्तय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे|	protect us for our welfare lend thy succour o thou son of strength be near in fight to prosper us.
रतेन रतम अपिहितं धरुवं वां सूर्यस्य यत्र विमुचन्त्य अश्वान|	by your high law firm order is established there where they loose for travel sūryas horses.
दश शता सह तस्थुस तद एकं देवानां शरेष्ठं वपुषाम अपश्यम|	ten hundred stood together there i looked on this the most marvellous deities one chief glory.
तत सु वाम मित्रावरुणा महित्वम ईर्मा तस्थुषीर अहभिर दुदुह्रे|	this mitravaruṇa is your special greatness floods that stood there they with the days attracted.
विश्वाः पिन्वथः सवसरस्य धेना अनु वाम एकः पविर आ ववर्त|	ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.
अधारयतम पर्थिवीम उत दयाम मित्रराजाना वरुणा महोभिः|	o mitravaruṇa ye by your greatness both kings have firmly stablished earth and heaven.
वर्धयतम ओषधीः पिन्वतं गा अव वर्ष्टिं सर्जतं जीरदानू|	ye caused the cows to stream the plants to flourish and scattering swift drops sent down the rainflood.
आ वाम अश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्तु यतरश्मय उप यन्त्व अर्वाक|	let your wellharnessed horses bear you hither hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly.
घर्तस्य निर्णिग अनु वर्तते वाम उप सिन्धवः परदिवि कषरन्ति|	a covering cloud of sacred oil attends you and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.
अनु शरुताम अमतिं वर्धद उर्वीम बर्हिर इव यजुषा रक्षमाणा|	to make the lustre wider and more famous guarding the sacred grass with veneration.
नमस्वन्ता धर्तदक्षाधि गर्ते मित्रासाथे वरुणेळास्व अन्तः|	ye mitravaruṇa firm strong aweinspiring are seated on a throne amid oblations.
अक्रविहस्ता सुक्र्ते परस्पा यं तरासाथे वरुणेळास्व अन्तः|	with hands that shed no blood guarding the pious whom varuni3 ye save amid oblations.
राजाना कषत्रम अह्र्णीयमाना सहस्रस्थूणम बिभ्र्थः सह दवौ|	ye twain together kings of willing spirit uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.
हिरण्यनिर्णिग अयो अस्य सथूणा वि भराजते दिव्य अश्वाजनीव|	adorned with gold its columns are of iron in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses.
भद्रे कषेत्रे निमिता तिल्विले वा सनेम मध्वो अधिगर्त्यस्य|	or stablished on a field deepspoiled and fruitful so may we share the meath that loads your carseat.
हिरण्यरूपम उषसो वयुष्टाव अयस्थूणम उदिता सूर्यस्य|	ye mount your car goldhued at break of morning and ironpillared when the sun is setting.
आ रोहथो वरुण मित्र गर्तम अतश चक्षाथे अदितिं दितिं च|	and from that place o varuṇa and mitra behold infinity and limittion.
यद बंहिष्ठं नातिविधे सुदानू अछिद्रं शर्म भुवनस्य गोपा|	bountiful guardians of the world the shelter that is impenetrable strongest flawless.
तेन नो मित्रावरुणाव अविष्टं सिषासन्तो जिगीवांसः सयाम|	aid us with that o varuṇa and mitra and when we long to win may we be victors.
को वेद जानम एषां को वा पुरा सुम्नेष्व आस मरुताम|	who knows the birth of these or who lived in the maruts favour in the days of old.
यद युयुज्रे किलास्यः|	what time their spotted deer were yoked.
ऐतान रथेषु तस्थुषः कः शुश्राव कथा ययुः|	who when they stood upon their cars hath heard them tell the way they went.
कस्मै सस्रुः सुदासे अन्व आपय इळाभिर वर्ष्टयः सह|	who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice.
ते म आहुर य आययुर उप दयुभिर विभिर मदे|	to me they told it and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught.
नरो मर्या अरेपस इमान पश्यन्न इति षटुहि|	youths heroes free from spot or stain behold us here and praise thou us.
ये अञ्जिषु ये वाशीषु सवभानवः सरक्षु रुक्मेषु खादिषु|	who shine selfluminous with ornaments and swords with breastplates armlets and with wreaths.
शराया रथेषु धन्वसु|	arrayed on chariots and with bows.
युष्माकं समा रथां अनु मुदे दधे मरुतो जीरदानवः|	o swift to pour your bounties down ye maruts with delight i look upon your cars.
वर्ष्टी दयावो यतीर इव|	like splendours coming through the rain.
आ यं नरः सुदानवो ददाशुषे दिवः कोशम अचुच्यवुः|	munificent heroes they have cast heavens treasury down for the worshippers behoof.
वि पर्जन्यं सर्जन्ति रोदसी अनु धन्वना यन्ति वर्ष्टयः|	they set the stormcloud free to stream through both the worlds and rainfloods flow oer desert spots.
तत्र्दानाः सिन्धवः कषोदसा रजः पर सस्रुर धेनवो यथा|	the bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad like milchkine oer the firmament.
सयन्ना अश्वा इवाध्वनो विमोचने वि यद वर्तन्त एन्यः|	like swift steeds hasting to their journeys restingplace to every side run glittering brooks.
आ यात मरुतो दिव आन्तरिक्षाद अमाद उत|	hither o maruts come from heaven from midair or from near at hand.
माव सथात परावतः|	tarry not far away from us.
मा वो रसानितभा कुभा करुमुर मा वः सिन्धुर नि रीरमत|	so let not rasā krumu or anitabha kubha or sindhu hold you back.
मा वः परि षठात सरयुः पुरीषिण्य अस्मे ईत सुम्नम अस्तु वः|	let not the watery sarayti obstruct your way with us be all the bliss ye give.
तं वः शर्धं रथानां तवेषं गणम मारुतं नव्यसीनाम|	that brilliant gathering of your cars the company of maruts of the youthful ones.
अनु पर यन्ति वर्ष्टयः|	the rainshowers speeding on attend.
शर्धंशर्धं व एषां वरातंवरातं गणंगणं सुशस्तिभिः|	with eulogies and hymns may we follow your army troop by troop and band by band.
अनु करामेम धीतिभिः|	and company by company.
कस्मा अद्य सुजाताय रातहव्याय पर ययुः|	to what oblationgiver sprung of noble ancestry have sped.
एना यामेन मरुतः|	the maruts on this course today.
येन तोकाय तनयाय धान्यम बीजं वहध्वे अक्षितम|	vouchsafe to us the bounty that which we implore through which for child and progeny.
अस्मभ्यं तद धत्तन यद व ईमहे राधो विश्वायु सौभगम|	ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away and bliss that reacheth to all life.
अतीयाम निदस तिरः सवस्तिभिर हित्वावद्यम अरातीः|	may we in safety pass by those who slander us leaving behind disgrace and hate.
वर्ष्ट्वी शं योर आप उस्रि भेषजं सयाम मरुतः सह|	maruts may we be there when ye at dawn in rest and toil rain waters down and balm.
सुदेवः समहासति सुवीरो नरो मरुतः स मर्त्यः|	favoured by gods shall he the man o heroes marutr and possessed of noble sons.
यं तरायध्वे सयाम ते|	whom ye protect such may we be.
सतुहि भोजान सतुवतो अस्य यामनि रणन गावो न यवसे|	praise the freegivers at this liberal patrons rite they joy like cattle in the mead.
यतः पूर्वां इव सखींर अनु हवय गिरा गर्णीहि कामिनः|	so call thou unto them who come as ancient friends hymn those who love thee with a song.
रतस्य गोपाव अधि तिष्ठथो रथं सत्यधर्माणा परमे वयोमनि|	guardians of order ye whose laws are ever true in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend.
यम अत्र मित्रावरुणावथो युवं तस्मै वर्ष्टिर मधुमत पिन्वते दिवः|	o mitravaruṇa whomsoeer ye favour here to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.
सम्राजाव अस्य भुवनस्य राजथो मित्रावरुणा विदथे सवर्द्र्शा|	this worlds imperial kings o mitravaruṇa ye rule in holy synod looking on the light.
वर्ष्टिं वां राधो अम्र्तत्वम ईमहे दयावाप्र्थिवी वि चरन्ति तन्यवः|	we pray for rain your boon and immortality through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.
सम्राजा उग्रा वर्षभा दिवस पती पर्थिव्या मित्रावरुणा विचर्षणी|	imperial kings strong heroes lords of earth and heaven mitra and varuṇa ye ever active ones.
चित्रेभिर अभ्रैर उप तिष्ठथो रवं दयां वर्षयथो असुरस्य मायया|	ye wait on thunder with the manytinted clouds and by the asuras magic power cause heaven to rain.
माया वाम मित्रावरुणा दिवि शरिता सूर्यो जयोतिश चरति चित्रम आयुधम|	your magic mitravaruṇa resteth in the heaven the sun the wondrous weapon cometh forth as light.
तम अभ्रेण वर्ष्ट्या गूहथो दिवि पर्जन्य दरप्सा मधुमन्त ईरते|	ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain and waterdrops parjanya full of sweetness flow.
रथं युञ्जते मरुतः शुभे सुखं शूरो न मित्रावरुणा गविष्टिषु|	the maruts yoke their easy car for victory o mitravaruṇa as a hero in the wars.
रजांसि चित्रा वि चरन्ति तन्यवो दिवः सम्राजा पयसा न उक्षतम|	the thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues imperial kings bedew us with the milk of heaven.
वाचं सु मित्रावरुणाव इरावतीम पर्जन्यश चित्रां वदति तविषीमतीम|	refreshing is your voice o mitravaruṇa parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice.
अभ्रा वसत मरुतः सु मायया दयां वर्षयतम अरुणाम अरेपसम|	with magic power the maruts clothe them with the clouds ye two cause heaven to rain the red the spotless one.
धर्मणा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता वरता रक्षेथे असुरस्य मायया|	wise with your law and through the asuras magic power ye guard the ordinances mitravaruṇa.
रतेन विश्वम भुवनं वि राजथः सूर्यम आ धत्थो दिवि चित्र्यं रथम|	ye by eternal order govern all the world ye set the sun in heaven as a refulgent car.
तरी रोचना वरुण तरींर उत दयून तरीणि मित्र धारयथो रजांसि|	three spheres of light o varuṇa three heavens three firmaments ye comprehend o mitra.
वाव्र्धानाव अमतिं कषत्रियस्यानु वरतं रक्षमाणाव अजुर्यम|	waxed strong ye keep the splendour of dominion guarding the ordinance that lasts for ever.
इरावतीर वरुण धेनवो वाम मधुमद वां सिन्धवो मित्र दुह्रे|	ye varuṇa have kine who yield refreshment mitra your floods pour water full of sweetness.
तरयस तस्थुर वर्षभासस तिस्र्णां धिषणानां रेतोधा वि दयुमन्तः|	there stand the three steers splendid in their brightness who fill the three worldbowls with genial moisture.
परातर देवीम अदितिं जोहवीमि मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य|	i call at dawn on aditi the goddess i call at noon and when the sun is setting.
राये मित्रावरुणा सर्वतातेळे तोकाय तनयाय शं योः|	i pray o mitravaruṇa for safety for wealth and progeny in rest and trouble.
या धर्तारा रजसो रोचनस्योतादित्या दिव्या पार्थिवस्य|	ye who uphold the region sphere of brightness ye who support earths realm divine Ādityas.
न वां देवा अम्र्ता आ मिनन्ति वरतानि मित्रावरुणा धरुवाणि|	the immortal gods o varuṇa and mitra never impair your everlasting statutes.
कव सय वीरः को अपश्यद इन्द्रं सुखरथम ईयमानं हरिभ्याम|	where is that hero who hath looked on indra borne on lightrolling car by tawny coursers.
यो राया वज्री सुतसोमम इछन तद ओको गन्ता पुरुहूत ऊती|	who thunderer seeks with wealth the somapresser and to his house goes muchinvoked to aid him.
अवाचचक्षम पदम अस्य सस्वर उग्रं निधातुर अन्व आयम इछन|	i have beheld his strong and secret dwelling longing have sought the founders habitation.
अप्र्छम अन्यां उत ते म आहुर इन्द्रं नरो बुबुधाना अशेम|	i asked of others and they said in answer may we awakened men attain to indra.
पर नु वयं सुते या ते कर्तानीन्द्र बरवाम यानि नो जुजोषः|	we will tell indra when we pour libation what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us.
वेदद अविद्वाञ छर्णवच च विद्वान वहते ऽयम मघवा सर्वसेनः|	let him who knows not learn who knows them listen hither rides maghavan with all his army.
सथिरम मनश चक्र्षे जात इन्द्र वेषीद एको युधये भूयसश चित|	indra when born thou madest firm thy spirit alone thou seekest war to fight with many.
अश्मानं चिच छवसा दिद्युतो वि विदो गवाम ऊर्वम उस्रियाणाम|	with might thou clavest een the rock asunder and foundest out the stable of the milchkine.
परो यत तवम परम आजनिष्ठाः परावति शरुत्यं नाम बिभ्रत|	when thou wast born supremest at a distance bearing a name renowned in faroff regions.
अतश चिद इन्द्राद अभयन्त देवा विश्वा अपो अजयद दासपत्नीः|	since then een gods have been afraid of indra he conquered all the floods which served the dāsa.
तुभ्येद एते मरुतः सुशेवा अर्चन्त्य अर्कं सुन्वन्त्य अन्धः|	these blissful maruts sing their psalm to praise thee and pour to thee libation of the soma.
अहिम ओहानम अप आशयानम पर मायाभिर मायिनं सक्षद इन्द्रः|	indra with wondrous powers subdued the dragon the guileful lurker who beset the waters.
वि षू मर्धो जनुषा दानम इन्वन्न अहन गवा मघवन संचकानः|	thou maghavan from the first didst scatter foemen speeding while joying in the milk the giver.
अत्रा दासस्य नमुचेः शिरो यद अवर्तयो मनवे गातुम इछन|	there seeking mans prosperity thou torest away the head of namuci the dāsa.
युजं हि माम अक्र्था आद इद इन्द्र शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर मथायन|	pounding the head of namuci the dāsa me too thou madest thine associate indra.
अश्मानं चित सवर्यं वर्तमानम पर चक्रियेव रोदसी मरुद्भ्यः|	yea and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds as on a car brought to the maruts.
सत्रियो हि दास आयुधानि चक्रे किम मा करन्न अबला अस्य सेनाः|	women for weapons hath the dāsa taken what injury can his feeble armies to me.
अन्तर हय अख्यद उभे अस्य धेने अथोप परैद युधये दस्युम इन्द्रः|	well he distinguished his two different voices and indra then advanced to fight the dasyu.
सम अत्र गावो ऽभितो ऽनवन्तेहेह वत्सैर वियुता यद आसन|	divided from their calves the cows went lowing around on every side hither and thither.
सं ता इन्द्रो अस्र्जद अस्य शाकैर यद ईं सोमासः सुषुता अमन्दन|	these indra reunited with his helpers what time the wellpressed soma made him joyful.
यद ईं सोमा बभ्रुधूता अमन्दन्न अरोरवीद वर्षभः सादनेषु|	what time the somas mixed by babhru cheered him loud the steer bellowed in his habitations.
पुरंदरः पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य पुनर गवाम अददाद उस्रियाणाम|	so indra drank thereof the fortdestroyer and gave him guerdon in return of milchkine.
भद्रम इदं रुशमा अग्ने अक्रन गवां चत्वारि ददतः सहस्रा|	this good deed have the rusamas done agni that they have granted me four thousand cattle.
रणंचयस्य परयता मघानि परत्य अग्रभीष्म नर्तमस्य नर्णाम|	we have received rnancayas wealth of heroes the most heroic which was freely offered.
सुपेशसम माव सर्जन्त्य अस्तं गवां सहस्रै रुशमासो अग्ने|	the rusamas o agni sent me homeward with fair adornment and with kine in thousands.
तीव्रा इन्द्रम अममन्दुः सुतासो ऽकतोर वयुष्टौ परितक्म्यायाः|	the strong libations have made indra joyful when night whose course was ending changed to morning.
औछत सा रात्री परितक्म्या यां रणंचये राजनि रुशमानाम|	night wellnigh ended at rnancayas coming king of the rusamas was changed to morning.
अत्यो न वाजी रघुर अज्यमानो बभ्रुश चत्वार्य असनत सहस्रा|	like a strong courser fleet of foot urged onward babhru hath gained four thousand as his guerdon.
चतुःसहस्रं गव्यस्य पश्वः परत्य अग्रभीष्म रुशमेष्व अग्ने|	we have received four thousand head of cattle presented by the rusamas o agni.
घर्मश चित तप्तः परव्र्जे य आसीद अयस्मयस तं व आदाम विप्राः|	and we the singers have received the caldron of metal which was heated for pravargya.
बळ इत्था देव निष्क्र्तम आदित्या यजतम बर्हत|	ye gods Ādityas varuṇa aryaman mitra verily.
वरुण मित्रार्यमन वर्षिष्ठं कषत्रम आशाथे|	have here obtained supremest sway high holy set apart for you.
आ यद योनिं हिरण्ययं वरुण मित्र सदथः|	when varuṇa and mitra ye sit in your golden dwellingplace.
धर्तारा चर्षणीनां यन्तं सुम्नं रिशादसा|	ye twain supporters of mankind foeslayers give felicity.
विश्वे हि विश्ववेदसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	all these possessors of all wealth varuṇa mitra aryaman.
वरता पदेव सश्चिरे पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः|	follow their ways as if with feet and guard from injury mortal man.
ते हि सत्या रतस्प्र्श रतावानो जनेजने|	for they are true they cleave to law held holy among every race.
सुनीथासः सुदानवो ऽंहोश चिद उरुचक्रयः|	good leaders bounteous in their gifts deliverers even from distress.
को नु वाम मित्रास्तुतो वरुणो वा तनूनाम|	which of your persons varuṇa or mitra merits not our praise.
तत सु वाम एषते मतिर अत्रिभ्य एषते मतिः|	therefore our thought is turned to you the atris thought is turned to you.
को नु वाम मित्रावरुणाव रतायन दिवो वा महः पार्थिवस्य वा दे|	who mitravaruṇa is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven.
रतस्य वा सदसि तरासीथां नो यज्ञायते वा पशुषो न वाजान|	preserve us in the seat of holy order and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.
ते नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुर इन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतो जुषन्त|	may mitra varuṇa aryaman and Āyu indra Ṛbhukṣan and the maruts love us.
नमोभिर वा ये दधते सुव्र्क्तिं सतोमं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः|	and they who of one mind with bounteous rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.
आ वां येष्ठाश्विना हुवध्यै वातस्य पत्मन रथ्यस्य पुष्टौ|	you will i call to feed the carhorse aśvins with the winds flight swiftest of those who travel.
उत वा दिवो असुराय मन्म परान्धांसीव यज्यवे भरध्वम|	or also to the asura of heaven worshipful bring a hymn as twere libation.
पर सक्षणो दिव्यः कण्वहोता तरितो दिवः सजोषा वातो अग्निः|	the heavenly victor he whose priest is kaṇva tṛta with dyaus accordant vāta agni.
पूषा भगः परभ्र्थे विश्वभोजा आजिं न जग्मुर आश्वश्वतमाः|	allfeeding pūṣan bhaga sought the oblation as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.
पर वो रयिं युक्ताश्वम भरध्वं राय एषे ऽवसे दधीत धीः|	bring ye your riches forward borne on horses let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure.
सुशेव एवैर औशिजस्य होता ये व एवा मरुतस तुराणाम|	blest he the priest of auśija through courses the courses which are yours the fleet o maruts.
पर वो वायुं रथयुजं कर्णुध्वम पर देवं विप्रम पनितारम अर्कैः|	bring hither him who yokes the car your vāyu who praises with his songs the god and singer.
इषुध्यव रतसापः पुरंधीर वस्वीर नो अत्र पत्नीर आ धिये धुः|	and praying and devout noble and prudent may the gods spouses in their thoughts retain us.
उप व एषे वन्द्येभिः शूषैः पर यह्वी दिवश चितयद्भिर अर्कैः|	i speed to you with powers that should be honoured with songs distinguishing heavens mighty daughters.
उषासानक्ता विदुषीव विश्वम आ हा वहतो मर्त्याय यज्ञम|	morning and night the two as twere allknowing these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.
अभि वो अर्चे पोष्यावतो नॄन वास्तोष पतिं तवष्टारं रराणः|	you i extol the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts vastospati and tvaṣṭar.
धन्या सजोषा धिषणा नमोभिर वनस्पतींर ओषधी राय एषे|	rich dhiṣaṇā accords through our obeisance  andtrees and plants for the swift gain of riches.
तुजे नस तने पर्वताः सन्तु सवैतवो ये वसवो न वीराः|	ours be the parvatas even they for offspring freemoving who are heroes like the vasus.
पनित आप्त्यो यजतः सदा नो वर्धान नः शंसं नर्यो अभिष्टौ|	may holy Āptya friend of man exalted strengthen our word for ever and be near us.
वर्ष्णो अस्तोषि भूम्यस्य गर्भं तरितो नपातम अपां सुव्र्क्ति|	tṛta praised him germ of the earthly hero with pure songs him the offspring of the waters.
गर्णीते अग्निर एतरी न शूषैः शोचिष्केशो नि रिणाति वना|	agn with might neighs loudly like a charger he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.
कथा महे रुद्रियाय बरवाम कद राये चिकितुषे भगाय|	how shall we speak to the great might of rudra how speak to bhaga who takes thought for riches.
आप ओषधीर उत नो ऽवन्तु दयौर वना गिरयो वर्क्षकेशाः|	may plants the waters and the sky preserve us and woods and mountains with their trees for tresses.
शर्णोतु न ऊर्जाम पतिर गिरः स नभस तरीयां इषिरः परिज्मा|	may the swift wanderer lord of refreshments listen to our songs who speeds throuih cloudy heaven.
शर्ण्वन्त्व आपः पुरो न शुभ्राः परि सरुचो बब्र्हाणस्याद्रेः|	and may the waters bright like castles hear us as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.
विदा चिन नु महान्तो ये व एवा बरवाम दस्मा वार्यं दधानाः|	we know your ways ye mighty ones receiving choice meed ye wonderful we will proclaim it.
वयश चन सुभ्व आव यन्ति कषुभा मर्तम अनुयतं वधस्नैः|	even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.
आ दैव्यानि पार्थिवानि जन्मापश चाछा सुमखाय वोचम|	celestial and terrestrial generations and waters will i summon to the feasting.
वर्धन्तां दयावो गिरश चन्द्राग्रा उदा वर्धन्ताम अभिषाता अर्णाः|	may days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper and may the conquered streams increase their waters.
पदेपदे मे जरिमा नि धायि वरूत्री वा शक्रा या पायुभिश च|	duly to each one hath my laud been offered strong be varūtrī with her powers to succour.
सिषक्तु माता मही रसा नः समत सूरिभिर रजुहस्त रजुवनिः|	may the great mother rasā here befriend us straighthanded with the princes striving forward.
कथा दाशेम नमसा सुदानून एवया मरुतो अछोक्तौ परश्रवसो मरुतो अछोक्तौ|	how may we serve the liberal ones with worship the maruts swift of course in invocation the maruts farrenowned in invocation.
मा नो ऽहिर बुध्न्यो रिषे धाद अस्माकम भूद उपमातिवनिः|	let not the dragon of the deep annoy us and gladly may he welcome our addresses.
इति चिन नु परजायै पशुमत्यै देवासो वनते मर्त्यो व आ देवासो वनते मर्त्यो वः|	thus thinking o ye gods the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle the mortal wins him o ye gods your favour.
अत्रा शिवां तन्वो धासिम अस्या जरां चिन मे निर्र्तिर जग्रसीत|	here he wins wholesome food to feed this body as for mine old age nirrti consume it.
तां वो देवाः सुमतिम ऊर्जयन्तीम इषम अश्याम वसवः शसा गोः|	o gods may we obtain from you this favour strengthening food through the cows praise ye vasus.
सा नः सुदानुर मर्ळयन्ती देवी परति दरवन्ती सुविताय गम्याः|	may she who gives good gifts the gracious goddes s come speeding nigh to us for our wellbeing.
अभि न इळा यूथस्य माता समन नदीभिर उर्वशी वा गर्णातु|	may iḷā mother of the herds of cattle and urvasi with all the streams accept us.
उर्वशी वा बर्हद्दिवा गर्णानाभ्यूर्ण्वाना परभ्र्थस्यायोः|	may urvasi in lofty heaven accepting as she partakes the oblation of the living.
सिषक्तु न ऊर्जव्यस्य पुष्टेः|	visit us while she shares urjavyas food.
अबोध्य अग्निः समिधा जनानाम परति धेनुम इवायतीम उषासम|	agni is wakened by the peoples fuel to meet the dawn who cometh like a milchcow.
यह्वा इव पर वयाम उज्जिहानाः पर भानवः सिस्रते नाकम अछ|	like young trees shooting up on high their branches his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.
अबोधि होता यजथाय देवान ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमनाः परातर अस्थात|	for worship of the gods the priest was wakened at morning gracious agni hath arisen.
समिद्धस्य रुशद अदर्शि पाजो महान देवस तमसो निर अमोचि|	kindled his radiant might is made apparent and the great deity set free from darkness.
यद ईं गणस्य रशनाम अजीगः शुचिर अङकते शुचिभिर गोभिर अग्निः|	when he hath stirred the line of his attendants with the pure milk pure agni is anointed.
आद दक्षिणा युज्यते वाजयन्त्य उत्तानाम ऊर्ध्वो अधयज जुहूभिः|	the strengthbestowing gift is then made ready which spread in front with tongues erect he drinketh.
अग्निम अछा देवयताम मनांसि चक्षूंषीव सूर्ये सं चरन्ति|	the spirits of the pious turn together to agni as the eyes of all to sūrya.
यद ईं सुवाते उषसा विरूपे शवेतो वाजी जायते अग्रे अह्नाम|	he when both dawns of different hues have borne him springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.
जनिष्ट हि जेन्यो अग्रे अह्नां हितो हितेष्व अरुषो वनेषु|	the noble one was born at days beginning laid red in colour mid the welllaid fuel.
दमेदमे सप्त रत्ना दधानो ऽगनिर होता नि षसादा यजीयान|	yielding in every house his seven rich treasures agni is seated priest most skilled in worship.
अग्निर होता नय असीदद यजीयान उपस्थे मातुः सुरभा उलोके|	agni hath sat him down a priest most skilful on a sweetsmelling place his mothers bosom.
युवा कविः पुरुनिष्ठ रतावा धर्ता कर्ष्टीनाम उत मध्य इद्धः|	young faithful sage preeminent oer many kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.
पर णु तयं विप्रम अध्वरेषु साधुम अग्निं होतारम ईळते नमोभिः|	this singer excellent at sacrifices agni the priest they glorify with homage.
आ यस ततान रोदसी रतेन नित्यम मर्जन्ति वाजिनं घर्तेन|	him who spread out both worlds by law eternal they balm with oil strong steed who never faileth.
मार्जाल्यो मर्ज्यते सवे दमूनाः कविप्रशस्तो अतिथिः शिवो नः|	he worshipful housefriend in his home is worshipped our own auspicious guest lauded by sages.
सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभस तदोजा विश्वां अग्ने सहसा परास्य अन्यान|	that strength the bull with thousand horns possesses in might o agni thou excellest others.
पर सद्यो अग्ने अत्य एष्य अन्यान आविर यस्मै चारुतमो बभूथ|	thou quickly passest by all others agni for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely.
ईळेन्यो वपुष्यो विभावा परियो विशाम अतिथिर मानुषीणाम|	wondrously fair adorable effulgent the guest of men the darling of the people.
तुभ्यम भरन्ति कषितयो यविष्ठ बलिम अग्ने अन्तित ओत दूरात|	to thee most youthful god to thee o agni from near and far the people bring their tribute.
आ भन्दिष्ठस्य सुमतिं चिकिद्धि बर्हत ते अग्ने महि शर्म भद्रम|	mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee great high auspicious agni is thy shelter.
आद्य रथम भानुमो भानुमन्तम अग्ने तिष्ठ यजतेभिः समन्तम|	ascend today thy splendid car o agni in splendour with the holy ones around it.
विद्वान पथीनाम उर्व अन्तरिक्षम एह देवान हविरद्याय वक्षि|	knowing the paths by midairs spacious region bring hither gods to feast on our oblation.
अवोचाम कवये मेध्याय वचो वन्दारु वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे|	to him adorable sage strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage.
गविष्ठिरो नमसा सतोमम अग्नौ दिव्ञ्व रुक्मम उरुव्यञ्चम अश्रेत|	gavisthira hath raised with prayer to agni this laud farreaching like gold light to heaven.
मनुष्वत तवा नि धीमहि मनुष्वत सम इधीमहि|	we stablish thee as manus used as manus used we kindle thee.
अग्ने मनुष्वद अङगिरो देवान देवयते यज|	like manus for the pious man  aṅgiras agni worship gods.
तवं हि मानुषे जने ऽगने सुप्रीत इध्यसे|	for well o agni art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind.
सरुचस तवा यन्त्य आनुषक सुजात सर्पिरासुते|	straight go the ladles unto thee thou highborn god whose food is oil.
तवां विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दूतम अक्रत|	thee have all gods of one accord established as their messenger.
सपर्यन्तस तवा कवे यज्ञेषु देवम ईळते|	serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a god o sage.
देवं वो देवयज्ययाग्निम ईळीत मर्त्यः|	let mortal man adore your god agni with worship due to gods.
समिद्धः शुक्र दीदिह्य रतस्य योनिम आसदः ससस्य योनिम आसदः|	shine forth enkindled radiant one sit in the chamber of the law sit in the chamber of the food.
यश चिकेत स सुक्रतुर देवत्रा स बरवीतु नः|	full wise is he who hath discerned let him speak to us of the gods.
वरुणो यस्य दर्शतो मित्रो वा वनते गिरः|	the man whose praisesongs varuṇa the beautiful or mitra loves.
ता हि शरेष्ठवर्चसा राजाना दीर्घश्रुत्तमा|	for they are kings of noblest might of glorious fame most widely spread.
ता सत्पती रताव्र्ध रतावाना जनेजने|	lords of the brave who strengthen law the holy ones with every race.
ता वाम इयानो ऽवसे पूर्वा उप बरुवे सचा|	approaching you with prayer for aid together i address you first.
सवश्वासः सु चेतुना वाजां अभि पर दावने|	we who have good steeds call on you most sage to give us strength besides.
मित्रो अंहोश चिद आद उरु कषयाय गातुं वनते|	een out of misery mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case.
मित्रस्य हि परतूर्वतः सुमतिर अस्ति विधतः|	for he who worships hath the grace of mitra fighter in the van.
वयम मित्रस्यावसि सयाम सप्रथस्तमे|	in mitras shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell.
अनेहसस तवोतयः सत्रा वरुणशेषसः|	unmenaced guarded by the care ever as sons of varuṇa.
युवम मित्रेमं जनं यतथः सं च नयथः|	ye mitra urge this people on and to one end direct their ways.
मा मघोनः परि खयतम मो अस्माकम रषीणां गोपीथे न उरुष्यतम|	neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs neglect not us the Ṛṣis be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.
विश्वो देवस्य नेतुर मर्तो वुरीत सख्यम|	let every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding god.
विश्वो राय इषुध्यति दयुम्नं वर्णीत पुष्यसे|	each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.
ते ते देव नेतर ये चेमां अनुशसे|	these leading god are thine and these here ready to speak after us.
ते राया ते हय रप्र्चे सचेमहि सचथ्यः|	as such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.
अतो न आ नञ्न अतिथीन अतः पत्नीर दशस्यत|	so further honour as our guests the hero gods and then the dames.
आरे विश्वम पथेष्ठां दविषो युयोतु यूयुविः|	may he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.
यत्र वह्निर अभिहितो दुद्रवद दरोण्यः पशुः|	where fire is set and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough.
नर्मणा वीरपस्त्यो ऽरणा धीरेव सनिता|	he wins with heroes in his home friendly to man like constant streams.
एष ते देव नेता रथस्पतिः शं रयिः|	may these thy riches leader god that rule the car be blest to us.
शं राये शं सवस्तय इषस्तुतो मनामहे देवस्तुतो मनामहे|	yea blest to us for wealth and weal this will we ponder praising strength this ponder as we praise the god.
तर्य अर्यमा मनुषो देवताता तरी रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त|	mans worship of the gods hath three great lustres and three celestial lights have they established.
अर्चन्ति तवा मरुतः पूतदक्षास तवम एषाम रषिर इन्द्रासि धीरः|	the maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee for thou o indra art their sapient Ṛṣi.
अनु यद ईम मरुतो मन्दसानम आर्चन्न इन्द्रम पपिवांसं सुतस्य|	what time the maruts sang their song to indra joyous when he had drunk of soma juices.
आदत्त वज्रम अभि यद अहिं हन्न अपो यह्वीर अस्र्जत सर्तवा उ|	he grasped his thunderbolt to slay the dragon and loosed that they might flow the youthful waters.
उत बरह्माणो मरुतो मे अस्येन्द्रः सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पेयाः|	and o ye brahmans maruts so may indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed soma.
तद धि हव्यम मनुषे गा अविन्दद अहन्न अहिम पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य|	for this oblation found for man the cattle and indra having quaffed it slew the dragon.
आद रोदसी वितरं वि षकभायत संविव्यानश चिद भियसे मर्गं कः|	then heaven and earth he sundered and supported wrapped even in these he struck the beast with terror.
जिगर्तिम इन्द्रो अपजर्गुराणः परति शवसन्तम अव दानवं हन|	so indra forced the engulfer to disgorgement and slew the dānava panting against him.
अध करत्वा मघवन तुभ्यं देवा अनु विश्वे अददुः सोमपेयम|	thus all the gods o maghavan delivered to thee of their free will the draught of soma.
यत सूर्यस्य हरितः पतन्तीः पुरः सतीर उपरा एतशे कः|	when thou for etaśa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of sūrya racing forward.
नव यद अस्य नवतिं च भोगान साकं वज्रेण मघवा विव्र्श्चत|	when maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nineandninety castles all together.
अर्चन्तीन्द्रम मरुतः सधस्थे तरैष्टुभेन वचसा बाधत दयाम|	the maruts where they met glorified indra ye with the tṛṣṭup hymn obstructed heaven.
सखा सख्ये अपचत तूयम अग्निर अस्य करत्वा महिषा तरी शतानि|	as friend to aid a friend agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes even as he willed it.
तरी साकम इन्द्रो मनुषः सरांसि सुतम पिबद वर्त्रहत्याय सोमम|	and indra from mans gift for vṛtras slaughter drank ofr at once three lakes of pressedout soma.
तरी यच छता महिषाणाम अघो मास तरी सरांसि मघवा सोम्यापाः|	when thou three hundred buffaloes flesh hadst eaten and drunk as maghavan three lakes of soma.
कारं न विश्वे अह्वन्त देवा भरम इन्द्राय यद अहिं जघान|	all the gods raised as twere a shout of triumph to indra praise because he slew the dragon.
उशना यत सहस्यैर अयातं गर्हम इन्द्र जूजुवानेभिर अश्वैः|	what time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding o uśanā and indra to the dwelling.
वन्वानो अत्र सरथं ययाथ कुत्सेन देवैर अवनोर ह शुष्णम|	thou camest thither conquering together with kutsa and the gods thou slewest Śuṣṇa.
परान्यच चक्रम अव्र्हः सूर्यस्य कुत्सायान्यद वरिवो यातवे ऽकः|	one carwheel of the sun thou rolledst forward and one thou settest free to move for kutsa.
अनासो दस्यूंर अम्र्णो वधेन नि दुर्योण आव्र्णङ मर्ध्रवाचः|	thou slewest noseless dasyus with thy weapon and in their home oerthrewest hostile speakers.
सतोमासस तवा गौरिवीतेर अवर्धन्न अरन्धयो वैदथिनाय पिप्रुम|	the lauds of gauriviti made thee mighty to vidathins son as prey thou gavest pipru.
आ तवाम रजिश्वा सख्याय चक्रे पचन पक्तीर अपिबः सोमम अस्य|	rjisivan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food and thou hast drunk his soma.
नवग्वासः सुतसोमास इन्द्रं दशग्वासो अभ्य अर्चन्त्य अर्कैः|	navagvas and dasgvas with libations of soma juice sing hymns of praise to indra.
गव्यं चिद ऊर्वम अपिधानवन्तं तं चिन नरः शशमाना अप वरन|	labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of kine though firmly closed and fastened.
कथो नु ते परि चराणि विद्वान वीर्य्र मघवन या चकर्थ|	how shall i serve thee maghavan though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished.
या चो नु नव्या कर्णवः शविष्ठ परेद उ ता ते विदथेषु बरवाम|	and the fresh deeds which thou wilt do most mighty these too will we tell forth in sacred synods.
एता विश्वा चक्र्वां इन्द्र भूर्य अपरीतो जनुषा वीर्येण|	resistless from of old through hero courage thou hast done all these many acts o indra.
या चिन नु वज्रिन कर्णवो दध्र्ष्वान न ते वर्ता तविष्या अस्ति तस्याः|	what thou wilt do in bravery thunderwielder none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.
इन्द्र बरह्म करियमाणा जुषस्व या ते शविष्ठ नव्या अकर्म|	indra accept the prayers which now are offered accept the new prayers mightiest which we utter.
वस्त्रेव भद्रा सुक्र्ता वसूयू रथं न धीरः सवपा अतक्षम|	like fair and wellmade robes i seeking riches as a deft craftsman makes a car have wrought them.
यम अग्ने वाजसातम तवं चिन मन्यसे रयिम|	agni best winner of the spoil cause us to praise before the gods.
तं नो गीर्भिः शरवाय्यं देवत्रा पनया युजम|	as our associate meet for lauds wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.
ये अग्ने नेरयन्ति ते वर्द्धा उग्रस्य शवसः|	agni the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might.
अप दवेषो अप हवरो ऽनयव्रतस्य सश्चिरे|	stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.
होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे ऽगने दक्षस्य साधनम|	thee agni would we choose as priest the perfecter of strength and skill.
यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं गिरा परयस्वन्तो हवामहे|	we who bring sacred food invoke with song thee chief at holy rites.
इत्था यथा त ऊतये सहसावन दिवेदिवे|	here as is needful for thine aid we toil o conqueror day by day.
राय रताय सुक्रतो गोभिः षयाम सधमादो वीरैः सयाम सधमादः|	for wealth for law may we rejoice most wise one at the feast with kine rejoice with heroes at the feast.
स आ गमद इन्द्रो यो वसूनां चिकेतद दातुं दामनो रयीणाम|	may indra come to us he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches.
धन्वचरो न वंसगस तर्षाणश चकमानः पिबतु दुग्धम अंशुम|	even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milkedout soma.
आ ते हनू हरिवः शूर शिप्रे रुहत सोमो न पर्वतस्य पर्ष्ठे|	lord of bay horses hero may the soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountainridges.
अनु तवा राजन्न अर्वतो न हिन्वन गीर्भिर मदेम पुरुहूत विश्वे|	may we o king as he who driveth coursers all joy in thee with hymns invoked of many.
चक्रं न वर्त्तम पुरुहूत वेपते मनो भिया मे अमतेर इद अद्रिवः|	invoked of many caster of the stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury.
रथाद अधि तवा जरिता सदाव्र्ध कुविन नु सतोषन मघवन पुरूवसुः|	shall not puruvasu the singer give thee praise o everprospering maghavan mounted on thy car.
एष गरावेव जरिता त इन्द्रेयर्ति वाचम बर्हद आशुषाणः|	like the pressstone is this thy praiser indra loudly he lifts his voice with strong endeavour.
पर सव्येन मघवन यंसि रायः पर दक्षिणिद धरिवो मा वि वेनः|	with thy left hand o maghavan give us riches with thy right lord of bays be not reluctant.
वर्षा तवा वर्षणं वर्धतु दयौर वर्षा वर्षभ्यां वहसे हरिभ्याम|	may the strong heaven make thee the strong wax stronger strong thou art borne by thy two strong bay horses.
स नो वर्षा वर्षरथः सुशिप्र वर्षक्रतो वर्षा वज्रिन भरे धाः|	so fair of cheek with mighty chariot mighty uphold us strongwilled thunderarmed in battle.
यो रोहितौ वाजिनौ वाजिनीवान तरिभिः शतैः सचमानाव अदिष्ट|	maruts let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful srutaratha.
यूने सम अस्मै कषितयो नमन्तां शरुतरथाय मरुतो दुवोया|	who rich in steeds gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle.
देवं वो अद्य सवितारम एषे भगं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः|	this day i bring god savitar to meet you and bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals.
आ वां नरा पुरुभुजा वव्र्त्यां दिवेदिवे चिद अश्विना सखीयन|	you aśvins heroes rich in treasures daily seeking your friendship fain would i turn hither.
परति परयाणम असुरस्य विद्वान सूक्तैर देवं सवितारं दुवस्य|	knowing full well the asuras time of coming worship god savitar with hymns and praises.
उप बरुवीत नमसा विजानञ जयेष्ठं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः|	let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out mans noblest treasure.
अदत्रया दयते वार्याणि पूषा भगो अदितिर वस्त उस्रः|	not for reward doth pūṣan send his blessings bhaga or aditi his garb is splendour.
इन्द्रो विष्णुर वरुणो मित्रो अग्निर अहानि भद्रा जनयन्त दस्माः|	may indra visniu varuṇa mitra agni produce auspicious days the wonderworkers.
तन नो अनर्वा सविता वरूथं तत सिन्धव इषयन्तो अनु गमन|	sending the shelter which we ask the foeless savitar and the rivers shall approach us.
उप यद वोचे अध्वरस्य होता रायः सयाम पतयो वाजरत्नाः|	when i the sacrifices priest invite them may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.
पर ये वसुभ्य ईवद आ नमो दुर ये मित्रे वरुणे सूक्तवाचः|	they who devote such worship to the vasus singing their hymns to varuṇa and mitra.
अवैत्व अभ्वं कर्णुता वरीयो दिवस्प्र्थिव्योर अवसा मदेम|	vouchsafe them ample room far off be danger through grace of heaven and earth may we be happy.
परयुञ्जती दिव एति बरुवाणा मही माता दुहितुर बोधयन्ती|	urging to toil and making proclamation seeking heavens daughter comes the mighty mother.
आविवासन्ती युवतिर मनीषा पित्र्भ्य आ सदने जोहुवाना|	she comes the youthful hymn unto the fathers inviting to her home and loudly calling.
अजिरासस तदप ईयमाना आतस्थिवांसो अम्र्तस्य नाभिम|	swift in their motion hasting to their duty reaching the central point of life immortal.
अनन्तास उरवो विश्वतः सीम परि दयावाप्र्थिवी यन्ति पन्थाः|	on every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.
उक्षा समुद्रो अरुषः सुपर्णः पूर्वस्य योनिम पितुर आ विवेश|	steer sea red bird with strong wings he hath entered the dwellingplace of the primeval father.
मध्ये दिवो निहितः पर्श्निर अश्मा वि चक्रमे रजसस पात्य अन्तौ|	a gayhued stone set in the midst of heaven he hath gone forth and guards midairs two limits.
चत्वार ईम बिभ्रति कषेमयन्तो दश गर्भं चरसे धापयन्ते|	four bear him up and give him rest and quiet and ten invigorate the babe for travel.
तरिधातवः परमा अस्य गावो दिवश चरन्ति परि सद्यो अन्तान|	his kine most excellent of threefold nature pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.
इदं वपुर निवचनं जनासश चरन्ति यन नद्यस तस्थुर आपः|	wondrous o people is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing.
दवे यद ईम बिभ्र्तो मातुर अन्ये इहेह जाते यम्य्र सबन्धू|	that separate from his mother two support him closelyunited twins here made apparent.
वि तन्वते धियो अस्मा अपांसि वस्त्रा पुत्राय मातरो वयन्ति|	for him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship the mothers weave garments for him their offspring.
उपप्रक्षे वर्षणो मोदमाना दिवस पथा वध्वो यन्त्य अछ|	rejoicing for the steers impregning contact his spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.
तद अस्तु मित्रावरुणा तद अग्ने शं योर अस्मभ्यम इदम अस्तु शस्तम|	be this our praise o varuṇa and mitra may this be health and force to us o agni.
अशीमहि गाधम उत परतिष्ठां नमो दिवे बर्हते सादनाय|	may we obtain firm ground and room for resting glory to heaven the lofty habitation.
परति परियतमं रथं वर्षणं वसुवाहनम|	to meet your treasurebringing car the mighty car most dear to us.
सतोता वाम अश्विनाव रषि सतोमेन परति भूषति माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	aśvins the Ṛṣi is prepared your raiser with his song of praise lovers of sweetness hear my call.
अत्यायातम अश्विना तिरो विश्वा अहं सना|	pass o ye aśvins pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men.
दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी सुषुम्ना सिन्धुवाहसा माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	wonderful with your golden paths most gracious bringers of the flood lovers of sweetness hear my call.
आ नो रत्नानि बिभ्रताव अश्विना गछतं युवम|	come to us o ye aśvin pair bringing your precious treasures come.
रुद्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी जुषाणा वाजिनीवसू माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	ye rudras on your paths of gold rejoicing rich in store of wealth lovers of sweetness hear my call.
सुष्टुभो वां वर्षण्वसू रथे वाणीच्य आहिता|	o strong and good the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car.
उत वां ककुहो मर्गः पर्क्षः कर्णोति वापुषो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	and that great beast your chariotsteed fair wonderful makes dainty food lovers of sweetness hear my call.
बोधिन्मनसा रथ्येषिरा हवनश्रुता|	watchful in spirit born on cars impetuous listing to his cry.
विभिश चयवानम अश्विना नि याथो अद्वयाविनम माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	aśvins with winged steeds ye speed down to cyavana void of guile lovers of sweetness hear my call.
आ वां नरा मनोयुजो ऽशवासः परुषितप्सवः|	hither o heroes let your steeds of dappled hue yoked at the thought.
वयो वहन्तु पीतये सह सुम्नेभिर अश्विना माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	your flying steeds o aśvins bring you hitherward with bliss to drink lovers of sweetness hear my call.
अश्विनाव एह गछतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम|	o aśvins hither come to us nāsatyas be not disinclined.
तिरश चिद अर्यया परि वर्तिर यातम अदाभ्या माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home lovers of sweetness bear my call.
अस्मिन यज्ञे अदाभ्या जरितारं शुभस पती|	ye lords of splendour free from guile come stand at this our sacrifice.
अवस्युम अश्विना युवं गर्णन्तम उप भूषथो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	beside the singer aśvins who longs for your grace and lauds you both lovers of sweetness hear my call.
अभूद उषा रुशत्पशुर आग्निर अधाय्य रत्वियः|	dawn with her white herd hath appeared and in due time hath fire been placed.
अयोजि वां वर्षण्वसू रथो दस्राव अमर्त्यो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम|	harnessed is your immortal car o wonderworkers strong and kind lovers of sweetness bear my call.
अर्चन्तस तवा हवामहे ऽरचन्तः सम इधीमहि|	with songs of praise we call on thee we kindle thee with songs of praise.
अग्ने अर्चन्त ऊतये|	agni with songs of praise for help.
अग्ने सतोमम मनामहे सिध्रम अद्य दिविस्प्र्शः|	eager for wealth we meditate agnis effectual praise today.
देवस्य दरविणस्यवः|	praise of the god who touches heaven.
अग्निर जुषत नो गिरो होता यो मानुषेष्व आ|	may agni priest among mankind take pleasure in our songs of praise.
स यक्षद दैव्यं जनम|	and worship the celestial folk.
तवम अग्ने सप्रथा असि जुष्टो होता वरेण्यः|	thou agni art spread widely forth priest dear and excellent through thee.
तवया यज्ञं वि तन्वते|	men make the sacrifice complete.
तवाम अग्ने वाजसातमं विप्रा वर्धन्ति सुष्टुतम|	singers exalt thee agni well lauded best giver of our strength.
स नो रास्व सुवीर्यम|	so grant thou us heroic might.
अग्ने नेमिर अरां इव देवांस तवम परिभूर असि|	thou agni as the felly rings the spokes encompassest the gods.
आ राधश चित्रम रञ्जसे|	i yearn for bounty manifold.
उरोष ट इन्द्र राधसो विभ्वी रातिः शतक्रतो|	wide indra Śatakratu spreads the bounty of thine ample grace.
अधा नो विश्वचर्षणे दयुम्ना सुक्षत्र मंहय|	so lord of fair dominion friend of all men give us splendid wealth.
यद ईम इन्द्र शरवाय्यम इषं शविष्ठ दधिषे|	the food which mightiest indra thou possessest worthy of renown.
पप्रथे दीर्घश्रुत्तमं हिरण्यवर्ण दुष्टरम|	is bruited as most widely famed invincible o goldenhued.
शुष्मासो ये ते अद्रिवो मेहना केतसापः|	o darter of the stone the powers which readily obey thy will.
उभा देवाव अभिष्टये दिवश च गमश च राजथः|	divinities both thou and they ye rule to guard them earth and heaven.
उतो नो अस्य कस्य चिद दक्षस्य तव वर्त्रहन|	and from whatever power of thine o vṛtraslayer it may be.
अस्मभ्यं नर्म्णम आ भरास्मभ्यं नर्मणस्यसे|	bring thou to us heroic strength thou hast a mans regard for us.
नू त आभिर अभिष्टिभिस तव शर्मञ छतक्रतो|	in thy protection with these aids of thine o lord of hundred powers.
इन्द्र सयाम सुगोपाः शूर सयाम सुगोपाः|	indra may we be guarded well hero may we be guarded well.
परातर अग्निः पुरुप्रियो विश सतवेतातिथिः|	at dawn let agni muchbeloved guest of the house be glorified.
विश्वानि यो अमर्त्यो हव्या मर्तेषु रण्यति|	immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.
दविताय मर्क्तवाहसे सवस्य दक्षस्य मंहना|	for dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings.
इन्दुं स धत्त आनुषक सतोता चित ते अमर्त्य|	thy praiser even gains at once the somadrops immortal gods.
तं वो दीर्घायुशोचिषं गिरा हुवे मघोनाम|	nobles with song i call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life.
अरिष्टो येषां रथो वय अश्वदावन्न ईयते|	for god who givest steeds that car hither and thither goes unharmed.
चित्रा वा येषु दीधितिर आसन्न उक्था पान्ति ये|	they who have varied ways of thought who guard the lauds within their lips.
सतीर्णम बर्हिः सवर्णरे शरवांसि दधिरे परि|	and strew the grass before the light have decked themselves with high renown.
ये मे पञ्चाशतं ददुर अश्वानां सधस्तुति|	immortal agni give the chiefs heroes who institute the rite.
दयुमद अग्ने महि शरवो बर्हत कर्धि मघोनां नर्वद अम्र्त नर्णाम|	heroes illustrious lofty fame who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.
बळ इत्था पर्वतानां खिद्रम बिभर्षि पर्थिवि|	thou of a trutho prthivi bearest the tool that rends the hills.
पर या भूमिम परवत्वति मह्ना जिनोषि महिनि|	thou rich in torrents who with might quickenest earth o mighty one.
सतोमासस तवा विचारिणि परति षटोभन्त्य अक्तुभिः|	to thee o wanderer at will ring out the lauds with beams of day.
पर या वाजं न हेषन्तम पेरुम अस्यस्य अर्जुनि|	who drivest like a neighing steed the swelling cloud o bright of hue.
दर्ळ्हा चिद या वनस्पतीन कष्मया दर्धर्ष्य ओजसा|	who graspest with thy might on earth een the strong sovrans of the wood.
यत ते अभ्रस्य विद्युतो दिवो वर्षन्ति वर्ष्टयः|	when from the lightning of thy cloud the rainfloods of the heaven descend.
अग्ने शर्धन्तम आ गणम पिष्टं रुक्मेभिर अञ्जिभिः|	agni that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold.
विशो अद्य मरुताम अव हवये दिवश चिद रोचनाद अधि|	the people of the maruts i call down today even from the luminous realm of heaven.
यथा चिन मन्यसे हर्दा तद इन मे जग्मुर आशसः|	even as thou thinkest in thy heart thither my wishes also tend.
ये ते नेदिष्ठं हवनान्य आगमन तान वर्ध भीमसंद्र्शः|	those who have come most near to thine invoking calls strengthen them fearful to behold.
मीळ्हुष्मतीव पर्थिवी पराहता मदन्त्य एत्य अस्मद आ|	earth like a bounteous lady liberal of her gifts struck down and shaken yet exultant comes to us.
रक्षो न वो मरुतः शिमीवां अमो दुध्रो गौर इव भीमयुः|	impetuous as a bear o maruts is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull.
नि ये रिणन्त्य ओजसा वर्था गावो न दुर्धुरः|	they who with mighty strength oerthrow like oxen difficult to yoke.
अश्मानं चित सवर्यम पर्वतं गिरिम पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः|	cause een the heavenly stone to shake  yea shake the rocky mountain as they race along.
उत तिष्ठ नूनम एषां सतोमैः समुक्षितानाम|	rise up even now with lauds i call the very numerous company.
मरुताम पुरुतमम अपूर्व्यं गवां सर्गम इव हवये|	unequalled of these maruts like a herd of kine grown up together in their strength.
युङगध्वं हय अरुषी रथे युङगध्वं रथेषु रोहितः|	bind to your car the bright red mares yoke the red coursers to your car.
युङगध्वं हरी अजिरा धुरि वोळ्हवे वहिष्ठा धुरि वोळ्हवे|	bind to the pole to draw the fleetfoot tawny steeds the best at drawing to the pole.
उत सय वाज्य अरुषस तुविष्वणिर इह सम धायि दर्शतः|	yea and this loudlyneighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned fair to see.
मा वो यामेषु मरुतश चिरं करत पर तं रथेषु चोदत|	let him not cause delay o maruts in your course urge ye him onward in your cars.
रथं नु मारुतं वयं शरवस्युम आ हुवामहे|	the maruts chariot ever fain to gather glory we invoke.
आ यस्मिन तस्थौ सुरणानि बिभ्रती सचा मरुत्सु रोदसी|	which rodasī hath mounted bringing pleasant gifts with maruts in her company.
तं वः शर्धं रथेशुभं तवेषम पनस्युम आ हुवे|	i call that brilliant band of yours adorable rapid on the car.
यस्मिन सुजाता सुभगा महीयते सचा मरुत्सु मीळ्हुषी|	whereon the bounteous dame auspicious nobly born shows glorious with the marut host.
आ चिकितान सुक्रतू देवौ मर्त रिशादसा|	o sapient man call the two gods the very wise who slay the foe.
वरुणाय रतपेशसे दधीत परयसे महे|	for varuṇa whose form is law place offerings for his great delight.
ता हि कषत्रम अविह्रुतं सम्यग असुर्यम आशाते|	for they have won unbroken sway in full perfection power divine.
अध वरतेव मानुषं सवर ण धायि दर्शतम|	and like high laws the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.
ता वाम एषे रथानाम उर्वीं गव्यूतिम एषाम|	therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours.
रातहव्यस्य सुष्टुतिं दध्र्क सतोमैर मनामहे|	you who accept the eulogy of ratahavya with his hymns.
अधा हि काव्या युवं दक्षस्य पूर्भिर अद्भुता|	and ye show wmom wondrous gods with fulness of intelligence.
नि केतुना जनानां चिकेथे पूतदक्षसा|	by mens discernment are ve marked o ye whose might is purified.
तद रतम पर्थिवि बर्हच छरवेष रषीणाम|	this is the law sublime o earth to aid the Ṛṣis toil for fame.
जरयसानाव अरम पर्थ्व अति कषरन्ति यामभिः|	the two widespreading are prepared they come with ample overflow.
आ यद वाम ईयचक्षसा मित्र वयं च सूरयः|	mitra ye gods with wandering eyes would that the worshippers and we.
वयचिष्ठे बहुपाय्ये यतेमहि सवराज्ये|	might strive to reach the realm ye rule most spacious and protected well.
कुमारम माता युवतिः समुब्धं गुहा बिभर्ति न ददाति पित्रे|	the youthful mother keeps the boy in secret pressed to her close nor yields him to the father.
अनीकम अस्य न मिनज जनासः पुरः पश्यन्ति निहितम अरतौ|	but when he lies upon the arm the people see his unfading countenance before them.
कम एतं तवं युवते कुमारम पेषी बिभर्षि महिषी जजान|	what child is this thou carriest as handmaid o youthful one the consortqueen hath borne him.
पूर्वीर हि गर्भः शरदो ववर्धापश्यं जातं यद असूत माता|	the babe unborn increased through many autumns i saw him born what time his mother bare him.
हिरण्यदन्तं शुचिवर्णम आरात कषेत्राद अपश्यम आयुधा मिमानम|	i saw him from afar goldtoothed brightcoloured hurling his weapons from his habitation.
ददानो अस्मा अम्र्तं विप्र्क्वत किम माम अनिन्द्राः कर्णवन्न अनुक्थाः|	what time i gave him amṛta free from mixture how can the indraless the hymnless harm me.
कषेत्राद अपश्यं सनुतश चरन्तं सुमद यूथं न पुरु शोभमानम|	i saw him moving from the place he dwells in even as with a herd brilliantly shining.
न ता अग्र्भ्रन्न अजनिष्ट हि षः पलिक्नीर इद युवतयो भवन्ति|	these seized him not he had been born already they who were grey with age again grow youthful.
के मे मर्यकं वि यवन्त गोभिर न येषां गोपा अरणश चिद आस|	who separate my young bull from the cattle they whose protector was in truth no stranger.
य ईं जग्र्भुर अव ते सर्जन्त्व आजाति पश्व उप नश चिकित्वान|	let those whose hands have seized upon them free them may he observant drive the herd to usward.
वसां राजानं वसतिं जनानाम अरातयो नि दधुर मर्त्येषु|	mid mortal men godless have secreted the king of all who live home of the people.
बरह्माण्य अत्रेर अव तं सर्जन्तु निन्दितारो निन्द्यासो भवन्तु|	so may the prayers of atri give him freedom reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.
शुनश चिच छेपं निदितं सहस्राद यूपाद अमुञ्चो अशमिष्ट हि षः|	thou from the stake didst loose een Śunaḥśepa bound for a thousand for he prayed with fervour.
एवास्मद अग्ने वि मुमुग्धि पाशान होतश चिकित्व इह तू निषद्य|	so agni loose from us the bonds that bind us when thou art seated here o priest who knowest.
हर्णीयमानो अप हि मद ऐयेः पर मे देवानां वरतपा उवाच|	thou hast sped from me agni in thine anger this the protector of gods laws hath told me.
इन्द्रो विद्वां अनु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहम अग्ने अनुशिष्ट आगाम|	indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee by him instructed am i come o agni.
वि जयोतिषा बर्हता भात्य अग्निर आविर विश्वानि कर्णुते महित्वा|	agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour and by his greatness makes all things apparent.
परादेवीर मायाः सहते दुरेवाः शिशीते शर्ङगे रक्षसे विनिक्षे|	he conquers godless and malign enchantments and sharpens both his horns to gore the rakṣas.
उत सवानासो दिवि षन्त्व अग्नेस तिग्मायुधा रक्षसे हन्तवा उ|	loud in the heaven above be agnis roarings with keenedged weapons to destroy the demons.
मदे चिद अस्य पर रुजन्ति भामा न वरन्ते परिबाधो अदेवीः|	forth burst his splendours in the somas rapture the godless bands press round but cannot stay him.
एतं ते सतोमं तुविजात विप्रो रथं न धीरः सवपा अतक्षम|	as a skilled craftsman makes a car a singer i mighty one this hymn for thee have fashioned.
यदीद अग्ने परति तवं देव हर्याः सवर्वतीर अप एना जयेम|	if thou o agni god accept it gladly may we obtain thereby the heavenly waters.
तुविग्रीवो वर्षभो वाव्र्धानो ऽशत्र्व अर्यः सम अजाति वेदः|	may he the strongnecked steer waxing in vigour gather the foemans wealth with none to check him.
इतीमम अग्निम अम्र्ता अवोचन बर्हिष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसद धविष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसत|	thus to this agni have the immortals spoken to man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter grant shelter to the man who brings oblation.
परातर्यावाणा परथमा यजध्वम पुरा गर्ध्राद अररुषः पिबातः|	first worship those who come at early morning let the twain drink before the giftless niggard.
परातर हि यज्ञम अश्विना दधाते पर शंसन्ति कवयः पूर्वभाजः|	the aśvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak the sages yielding the first share extol them.
परातर यजध्वम अश्विना हिनोत न सायम अस्ति देवया अजुष्टम|	worship at dawn and instigate the aśvins nor is the worshipper at eve rejected.
उतान्यो अस्मद यजते वि चावः पूर्वःपूर्वो यजमानो वनीयान|	besides ourselves another craves and worships each first in worship is most highly favoured.
हिरण्यत्वङ मधुवर्णो घर्तस्नुः पर्क्षो वहन्न आ रथो वर्तते वाम|	covered with gold meathtinted dropping fatness your chariot with its freight of food comes hither.
मनोजवा अश्विना वातरंहा येनातियाथो दुरितानि विश्वा|	swift as thought aśvins rapid as the tempest wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.
यो भूयिष्ठं नासत्याभ्यां विवेष चनिष्ठम पित्वो ररते विभागे|	he who hath served most often the nāsatyas and gives the sweetest food at distribution.
स तोकम अस्य पीपरच छमीभिर अनूर्ध्वभासः सदम इत तुतुर्यात|	furthers with his own holy works his offspring and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.
सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम|	may we obtain the aśvins newest favour and gain their healthbestowing happy guidance.
आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि|	bring riches hither unto us and heroes and all felicity and joy immortals.
पर वेधसे कवये वेद्याय गिरम भरे यशसे पूर्व्याय|	to him the farrenowned the wise ordainer ancient and glorious a song i offer.
घर्तप्रसत्तो असुरः सुशेवो रायो धर्ता धरुणो वस्वो अग्निः|	enthroned in oil the asura blissgiver is agni firm support of noble riches.
रतेन रतं धरुणं धारयन्त यज्ञस्य शाके परमे वयोमन|	by holy law they kept supporting order by help of sacrifice in loftiest heaven.
दिवो धर्मन धरुणे सेदुषो नञ्ञ जातैर अजातां अभि ये ननक्षुः|	they who attained with born men to the unborn men seated on that stay heavens firm sustainer.
अङहोयुवस तन्वस तन्वते वि वयो महद दुष्टरम पूर्व्याय|	averting woe they labour hard to bring him the ancient plenteous food as power resistless.
स संवतो नवजातस तुतुर्यात सिङहं न करुद्धम अभितः परि षठुः|	may he born newly conquer his assailants round him they stand as round an angry lion.
मातेव यद भरसे पप्रथानो जनंजनं धायसे चक्षसे च|	when like a mother spreading forth to nourish to cherish and regard each man that liveth.
वयोवयो जरसे यद दधानः परि तमना विषुरूपो जिगासि|	consuming all the strength that thou hast gotten thou wanderest round thyself in varied fashion.
वाजो नु ते शवसस पात्व अन्तम उरुं दोघं धरुणं देव रायः|	may strength preserve the compass of thy vigour god that broad stream of thine that beareth riches.
पदं न तायुर गुहा दधानो महो राये चितयन्न अत्रिम अस्पः|	thou like a thief who keeps his refuge secret hast holpen atri to great wealth by teaching.
आ याह्य अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं सोमपते पिब|	come thou to what the stones have pressed drink soma o thou somas lord.
वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम|	indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong.
वर्षा गरावा वर्षा मदो वर्षा सोमो अयं सुतः|	strong is the stone the draught is strong strong is this soma that is pressed.
वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम|	indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong.
वर्षा तवा वर्षणं हुवे वज्रिञ चित्राभिर ऊतिभिः|	as strong i call on thee the strong o thunderarmed with various aids.
वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम|	indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong.
रजीषी वज्री वर्षभस तुराषाट छुष्मी राजा वर्त्रहा सोमपावा|	impetuous thunderer strong quelling the mighty king potent vṛtraslayer somadrinker.
युक्त्वा हरिभ्याम उप यासद अर्वाङ माध्यंदिने सवने मत्सद इन्द्रः|	may he come hither with his yoked bay horses may indra gladden him at the noon libation.
यत तवा सूर्य सवर्भानुस तमसाविध्यद आसुरः|	o sūrya when the asuras descendant svarbhanu pierced thee through and through with darkness.
अक्षेत्रविद यथा मुग्धो भुवनान्य अदीधयुः|	all creatures looked like one who is bewildered who knoweth not the place where he is standing.
सवर्भानोर अध यद इन्द्र माया अवो दिवो वर्तमाना अवाहन|	what time thou smotest down svarbhanus magic that spread itself beneath the sky o indra.
गूळ्हं सूर्यं तमसापव्रतेन तुरीयेण बरह्मणाविन्दद अत्रिः|	by his fourth sacred prayer atri disoovered sūrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.
मा माम इमं तव सन्तम अत्र इरस्या दरुग्धो भियसा नि गारीत|	let not the oppressor with this dread through anger swallow me up for i am thine o atri.
तवम मित्रो असि सत्यराधास तौ मेहावतं वरुणश च राजा|	mitra art thou the sender of true blessings thou and king varuṇa be both my helpers.
गराव्णो बरह्मा युयुजानः सपर्यन कीरिणा देवान नमसोपशिक्षन|	the brahman atri as he set the pressstones serving the gods with praise and adoration.
अत्रिः सूर्यस्य दिवि चक्षुर आधात सवर्भानोर अप माया अघुक्षत|	established in the heaven the eye of sūrya and caused svarbhanus magic arts to vanish.
यं वै सूर्यं सवर्भानुस तमसाविध्यद आसुरः|	the atris found the sun again him whom svarbhanu of the brood.
अत्रयस तम अन्व अविन्दन नह्य अन्ये अशक्नुवन|	of asuras had pierced with gloom this none besides had power to do.
युञ्जते मन उत युञ्जते धियो विप्रा विप्रस्य बर्हतो विपश्चितः|	the priests of him the lofty priest wellskilled in hymns harness their spirit yea harness their holy thoughts.
वि होत्रा दधे वयुनाविद एक इन मही देवस्य सवितुः परिष्टुतिः|	he only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks yea lofty is the praise of savitar the god.
विश्वा रूपाणि परति मुञ्चते कविः परासावीद भद्रं दविपदे चतुष्पदे|	the sapient one arrays himself in every form for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good.
वि नाकम अख्यत सविता वरेण्यो ऽनु परयाणम उषसो वि राजति|	excellent savitar hath looked on heavens high vault and shineth after the outgoing of the dawn.
यस्य परयाणम अन्व अन्य इद ययुर देवा देवस्य महिमानम ओजसा|	even he the god whose goingforth and majesty the other deities have followed with their might.
यः पार्थिवानि विममे स एतशो रजांसि देवः सविता महित्वना|	he who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power he is the courser savitar.
उत यासि सवितस तरीणि रोचनोत सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः सम उच्यसि|	to the three spheres of light thou goest savitar and with the rays of sidrya thou combinest thee.
उत रात्रीम उभयतः परीयस उत मित्रो भवसि देव धर्मभिः|	around on both sides thou encompassest the night yea thou o god art mitra through thy righteous laws.
उतेशिषे परसवस्य तवम एक इद उत पूषा भवसि देव यामभिः|	over all generation thou art lord alone pūṣan art thou o god in all thy goingsforth.
उतेदं विश्वम भुवनं वि राजसि शयावाश्वस ते सवित सतोमम आनशे|	yea thou hast domination over all this world Śyāvāśva hath brought praise to thee o savitar.
यद इन्द्र चित्र मेहनास्ति तवादातम अद्रिवः|	stonedarting indra wondrous one what wealth is richly given from thee.
राधस तन नो विदद्वस उभयाहस्त्य आ भर|	that bounty treasurefinder bring filling both thy hands to us.
यन मन्यसे वरेण्यम इन्द्र दयुक्षं तद आ भर|	bring what thou deemest worth the wish o indra that which is in heaven.
विद्याम तस्य ते वयम अकूपारस्य दावने|	so may we know thee as thou art boundless in thy munificence.
यत ते दित्सु परराध्यम मनो अस्ति शरुतम बर्हत|	thy lofty spirit farrenowned as fain to give and prompt to win.
तेन दर्ळ्हा चिद अद्रिव आ वाजं दर्षि सातये|	with this thou rendest een the firm stonedarter so to gain thee strength.
मंहिष्ठं वो मघोनां राजानं चर्षणीनाम|	singers with many songs have made indra propitious to their fame.
इन्द्रम उप परशस्तये पूर्वीभिर जुजुषे गिरः|	him who is king of human kind most liberal of your wealthy ones.
अस्मा इत काव्यं वच उक्थम इन्द्राय शंस्यम|	to him to indra must be sung the poets word the hymn of praise.
तस्मा उ बरह्मवाहसे गिरो वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः|	to him accepter of the prayer the atris raise their songs on high the atris beautify their songs.
यद अद्य सथः परावति यद अर्वावत्य अश्विना|	whether o aśvins ye this day be far remote or near at hand.
यद वा पुरू पुरुभुजा यद अन्तरिक्ष आ गतम|	in many spots or in midair come hither lords of ample wealth.
इह तया पुरुभूतमा पुरू दंसांसि बिभ्रता|	these here who show oer widest space bringing full many a wondrous act.
वरस्या याम्य अध्रिगू हुवे तुविष्टमा भुजे|	resistless lovingly i seek i call the mightiest to enjoy.
ईर्मान्यद वपुषे वपुश चक्रं रथस्य येमथुः|	another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car.
पर्य अन्या नाहुषा युगा मह्ना रजांसि दीयथः|	with others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.
तद ऊ षु वाम एना कर्तं विश्वा यद वाम अनु षटवे|	that deed of yours that is extolled visvas hath all been done with this.
नाना जाताव अरेपसा सम अस्मे बन्धुम एयथुः|	born otherwise and spotless ye have entered kinships bonds with us.
आ यद वां सूर्या रथं तिष्ठद रघुष्यदं सदा|	when sūrya mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly.
परि वाम अरुषा वयो घर्णा वरन्त आतपः|	birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.
युवोर अत्रिश चिकेतति नरा सुम्नेन चेतसा|	atri bethinks himself of you o heroes with a friendly mind.
घर्मं यद वाम अरेपसं नासत्यास्ना भुरण्यति|	what time nāsatyas with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.
उग्रो वां ककुहो ययिः शर्ण्वे यामेषु संतनिः|	strong is your swiftly moving steed famed his exertion in the course.
यद वां दंसोभिर अश्विनात्रिर नराववर्तति|	when by your great deeds aśvins chiefs atri is brought to us again.
मध्व ऊ षु मधूयुवा रुद्रा सिषक्ति पिप्युषी|	lovers of sweetness rudras she who streams with sweetness waits on you.
यत समुद्राति पर्षथः पक्वाः पर्क्षो भरन्त वाम|	when ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of welldressed food.
सत्यम इद वा उ अश्विना युवाम आहुर मयोभुवा|	aśvins with truth they call you twain bestowers of felicity.
ता यामन यामहूतमा यामन्न आ मर्ळयत्तमा|	at sacrifice most prompt to hear most gracious ye at sacrifice.
इमा बरह्माणि वर्धनाश्विभ्यां सन्तु शंतमा|	most pleasing to the aśvins be these prayers which magnify their might.
या तक्षाम रथां इवावोचाम बर्हन नमः|	which we have fashioned even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.
पर सम्राजे बर्हद अर्चा गभीरम बरह्म परियं वरुणाय शरुताय|	sing forth a hymn sublime and solemn grateful to glorious varuṇa imperial ruler.
वि यो जघान शमितेव चर्मोपस्तिरे पर्थिवीं सूर्याय|	who hath struck out like one who slays the victim earth as a skin to spread in front of sūrya.
वनेषु वय अन्तरिक्षं ततान वाजम अर्वत्सु पय उस्रियासु|	in the treetops the air he hath extended put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses.
हर्त्सु करतुं वरुणो अप्स्व अग्निं दिवि सूर्यम अदधात सोमम अद्रौ|	set intellect in hearts fire in the waters siurya in heaven and soma on the mountain.
नीचीनबारं वरुणः कवन्धम पर ससर्ज रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम|	varuṇa lets the big cask opening downward flow through the heaven and earth and airs midregion.
तेन विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा यवं न वर्ष्टिर वय उनत्ति भूम|	therewith the universes sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.
उनत्ति भूमिम पर्थिवीम उत दयां यदा दुग्धं वरुणो वष्ट्य आद इत|	when varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky the land and earth to her foundation.
सम अभ्रेण वसत पर्वतासस तविषीयन्तः शरथयन्त वीराः|	then straight the mountains clothe them in the raincloud the heroes putting forth their vigour loose them.
इमाम ऊ षव रसुरस्य शरुतस्य महीम मायां वरुणस्य पर वोचम|	i will declare this mighty deed of magic of glorious varuṇa the lord immortal.
मानेनेव तस्थिवां अन्तरिक्षे वि यो ममे पर्थिवीं सूर्येण|	who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the sun as with a measure.
इमाम ऊ नु कवितमस्य मायाम महीं देवस्य नकिर आ दधर्ष|	none verily hath ever let or hindered this the most wise gods mighty deed of magic.
एकं यद उद्ना न पर्णन्त्य एनीर आसिञ्चन्तीर अवनयः समुद्रम|	whereby with all their flood the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.
अर्यम्यं वरुण मित्र्यं वा सखायं वा सदम इद भरातरं वा|	if we have sinned against the man who loves us have ever wronged a brother friend or comrade.
वेशं वा नित्यं वरुणारणं वा यत सीम आगश चक्र्मा शिश्रथस तत|	the neighbour ever with us or a stranger o varuṇa remove from us the trespass.
कितवासो यद रिरिपुर न दीवि यद वा घा सत्यम उत यन न विद्म|	if we as gamesters cheat at play have cheated done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose.
सर्वा ता वि षय शिथिरेव देवाधा ते सयाम वरुण परियासः|	cast all these sins away like loosened fetters and varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.
अग्ने सहन्तम आ भर दयुम्नस्य परासहा रयिम|	by thy fair splendours mighty power o agni bring victorious wealth.
विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभ्य रसा वाजेषु सासहत|	wealth that oercometh all mankind and near us conquereth in fight.
तम अग्ने पर्तनाषहं रयिं सहस्व आ भर|	victorious agni bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war.
तवं हि सत्यो अद्भुतो दाता वाजस्य गोमतः|	for thou art wonderful and true giver of strength in herds of kine.
विश्वे हि तवा सजोषसो जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः|	for all the folk with one accord whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn.
होतारं सद्मसु परियं वयन्ति वार्या पुरु|	invite thee to their worshiphalls as a dear priest for choicest wealth.
स हि षमा विश्वचर्षणिर अभिमाति सहो दधे|	for he the god of all men hath gotten him might that quelleth foes.
अग्न एषु कषयेष्व आ रेवन नः शुक्र दीदिहि दयुमत पावक दीदिहि|	o agni in these homes shine forth bright god for our prosperity shine purifier splendidly.
तं वां रथं वयम अद्या हुवेम पर्थुज्रयम अश्विना संगतिं गोः|	we will invoke this day your car farspreading o aśvins even the gathering of the sunlight.
यः सूर्यां वहति वन्धुरायुर गिर्वाहसम पुरुतमं वसूयुम|	car praised in hymns most ample rich in treasure fitted with seats the car that beareth sūrya.
युवं शरियम अश्विना देवता तां दिवो नपाता वनथः शचीभिः|	aśvins ye gained that glory by your godhead ye sons of heaven by your own might and power.
युवोर वपुर अभि पर्क्षः सचन्ते वहन्ति यत ककुहासो रथे वाम|	food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.
को वाम अद्या करते रातहव्य ऊतये वा सुतपेयाय वार्कैः|	who bringeth you today for help with offered oblation or with hymns to drink the juices.
रतस्य वा वनुषे पूर्व्याय नमो येमानो अश्विना ववर्तत|	who for the sacrifices ancient lover turneth you hither aśvins offering homage.
हिरण्ययेन पुरुभू रथेनेमं यज्ञं नासत्योप यातम|	borne on your golden car ye omnipresent come to this sacrifice of ours nāsatyas.
पिबाथ इन मधुनः सोम्यस्य दधथो रत्नं विधते जनाय|	drink of the pleasant liquor of the soma give riches to the people who adore you.
आ नो यातं दिवो अछा पर्थिव्या हिरण्ययेन सुव्र्ता रथेन|	come hitherward to us from earth from heaven borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly.
मा वाम अन्ये नि यमन देवयन्तः सं यद ददे नाभिः पूर्व्या वाम|	suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.
नू नो रयिम पुरुवीरम बर्हन्तं दस्रा मिमाथाम उभयेष्व अस्मे|	now for us both mete out o wonderworkers riches exceeding great with store of heroes.
नरो यद वाम अश्विना सतोमम आवन सधस्तुतिम आजमीळ्हासो अग्मन|	because the men have sent you praise o aśvins and ajamīlhas come to the laudation.
इहेह यद वां समना पप्र्क्षे सेयम अस्मे सुमतिर वाजरत्ना|	wheneer i gratified you here together your grace was given us o ye rich in booty.
उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह शरितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक|	protect ye twain the singer of your praises to you nāsatyas is my wish directed.
गर्भे नु सन्न अन्व एषाम अवेदम अहं देवानां जनिमानि विश्वा|	i as i lay within the womb considered all generations of these gods in order.
शतम मा पुर आयसीर अरक्षन्न अध शयेनो जवसा निर अदीयम|	a hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth i flew with rapid speed a falcon.
न घा स माम अप जोषं जभाराभीम आस तवक्षसा वीर्येण|	not at his own free pleasure did he bear me he conquered with his strength and manly courage.
ईर्मा पुरंधिर अजहाद अरातीर उत वातां अतरच छूशुवानः|	straightway the bold one left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more mighty.
अव यच छयेनो अस्वनीद अध दयोर वि यद यदि वात ऊहुः पुरंधिम|	when with loud cry from heaven down sped the falcon thence hasting like the wind he bore the bold one.
सर्जद यद अस्मा अव ह कषिपज जयां कर्शानुर अस्ता मनसा भुरण्यन|	then wildly raging in his mind the archer kṛśānu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.
रजिप्य ईम इन्द्रावतो न भुज्युं शयेनो जभार बर्हतो अधि षणोः|	the falcon bore him from heavens lofty summit as the swift car of indras friend bore bhujyu.
अन्तः पतत पतत्र्य अस्य पर्णम अध यामनि परसितस्य तद वेः|	then downward hither fell a flying feather of the bird hasting forward in his journey.
अध शवेतं कलशं गोभिर अक्तम आपिप्यानम मघवा शुक्रम अन्धः|	and now let maghavan accept the beaker white filled with milk filled with the shining liquid.
अध्वर्युभिः परयतम मध्वो अग्रम इन्द्रो मदाय परति धत पिबध्यै शूरो मदाय परति धत पिबध्यै|	the best of sweet meath which the priests have offered that indra to his joy may drink the hero that he may take and drink it to his rapture.
अहम मनुर अभवं सूर्यश चाहं कक्षीवां रषिर अस्मि विप्रः|	i was aforetime manu i was sūrya i am the sage kakṣīvān holy singer.
अहं कुत्सम आर्जुनेयं नय ॠञ्जे ऽहं कविर उशना पश्यता मा|	kutsa the son of Ārjuni i master i am the sapient uśanā behold me.
अहम भूमिम अददाम आर्यायाहं वर्ष्टिं दाशुषे मर्त्याय|	i have bestowed the earth upon the Ārya and rain upon the man who brings oblation.
अहम अपो अनयं वावशाना मम देवासो अनु केतम आयन|	i guided forth the loudlyroaring waters and the gods moved according to my pleasure.
अहम पुरो मन्दसानो वय ऐरं नव साकं नवतीः शम्बरस्य|	in the wild joy of soma i demolished Śambaras forts ninetyandnine together.
शततमं वेश्यं सर्वताता दिवोदासम अतिथिग्वं यद आवम|	and utterly the hundredth habitation when helping divodāsa atithigva.
पर सु ष विभ्यो मरुतो विर अस्तु पर शयेनः शयेनेभ्य आशुपत्वा|	before all birds be ranked this bird o maruts supreme of falcons be this fleetwinged falcon.
अचक्रया यत सवधया सुपर्णो हव्यम भरन मनवे देवजुष्टम|	because strong pinioned with no car to bear him he brought to manu the godloved oblation.
भरद यदि विर अतो वेविजानः पथोरुणा मनोजवा असर्जि|	when the bird brought it hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried.
तूयं ययौ मधुना सोम्येनोत शरवो विविदे शयेनो अत्र|	swift he returned with sweetness of the soma and hence the falcon hath acquired his glory.
रजीपी शयेनो ददमानो अंशुम परावतः शकुनो मन्द्रम मदम|	bearing the stalk the falcon speeding onward bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens.
सोमम भरद दाद्र्हाणो देवावान दिवो अमुष्माद उत्तराद आदाय|	friend of the gods brought grasping fast the soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.
आदाय शयेनो अभरत सोमं सहस्रं सवां अयुतं च साकम|	the falcon took and brought the soma bearing thousand libations with him yea ten thousand.
अत्रा पुरंधिर अजहाद अरातीर मदे सोमस्य मूरा अमूरः|	the bold one left malignities behind him wise in wild joy of soma left the foolish.
भद्रं ते अग्ने सहसिन्न अनीकम उपाक आ रोचते सूर्यस्य|	thy blessed majesty victorious agni shines brightly in the neighbourhood of sūrya.
रुशद दर्शे दद्र्शे नक्तया चिद अरूक्षितं दर्श आ रूपे अन्नम|	splendid to see it shows even at nighttime and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.
वि षाह्य अग्ने गर्णते मनीषां खं वेपसा तुविजात सतवानः|	agni disclose his thought for him who singeth the well strong god while thou art praised with fervour.
विश्वेभिर यद वावनः शुक्र देवैस तन नो रास्व सुमहो भूरि मन्म|	vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn o mighty which radiant one with all the gods thou lovest.
तवद अग्ने काव्या तवन मनीषास तवद उक्था जायन्ते राध्यानि|	from thee o agni springs poetic wisdom from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper.
तवद एति दरविणं वीरपेशा इत्थाधिये दाशुषे मर्त्याय|	from thee flows wealth with heroes to adorn it to the truehearted man who gives oblation.
तवद वाजी वाजम्भरो विहाया अभिष्टिक्र्ज जायते सत्यशुष्मः|	from thee the hero springs who wins the booty bringer of help mighty of real courage.
तवद रयिर देवजूतो मयोभुस तवद आशुर जूजुवां अग्ने अर्वा|	from thee comes wealth sent by the gods blissgiving agni from thee the fleet impetuous charger.
तवाम अग्ने परथमं देवयन्तो देवम मर्ता अम्र्त मन्द्रजिह्वम|	immortal agni thee whose voice is pleasant as first in rank as god religious mortals.
दवेषोयुतम आ विवासन्ति धीभिर दमूनसं गर्हपतिम अमूरम|	invite with hymns thee who removest hatred friend of the home the households lord unerring.
आरे अस्मद अमतिम आरे अंह आरे विश्वां दुर्मतिं यन निपासि|	far from us thou removest want and sorrow far from us all illwill when thou protectest.
दोषा शिवः सहसः सूनो अग्ने यं देव आ चित सचसे सवस्ति|	son of strength agni blest is he at evening whom thou as god attendest for his welfare.
मम दविता राष्ट्रं कषत्रियस्य विश्वायोर विश्वे अम्र्ता यथा नः|	i am the royal ruler mine is empire as mine who sway all life are all immortals.
करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः|	varuṇas will the gods obey and follow i am the king of mens most lofty cover.
अहं राजा वरुणो मह्यं तान्य असुर्याणि परथमा धारयन्त|	i am king varuṇa to me were given these first existing high celestial powers.
करतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कर्ष्टेर उपमस्य वव्रेः|	varuṇas will the gods obey and follow i am the king of mens most lofty cover.
अहम इन्द्रो वरुणस ते महित्वोर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके|	i varuṇa am indra in their greatness these the two wide deep fairlyfashioned regions.
तवष्टेव विश्वा भुवनानि विद्वान सम ऐरयं रोदसी धारयं च|	these the two worldhalves have i even as tvaṣṭar knowing all beings joined and held together.
अहम अपो अपिन्वम उक्षमाणा धारयं दिवं सदन रतस्य|	i made to flow the moistureshedding waters and set the heaven firm in the scat of order.
रतेन पुत्रो अदितेर रतावोत तरिधातु परथयद वि भूम|	by law the son of aditi law observer hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.
मां नरः सवश्वा वाजयन्तो मां वर्ताः समरणे हवन्ते|	heroes with noble horses fain for battle selected warriors call on me in combat.
कर्णोम्य आजिम मघवाहम इन्द्र इयर्मि रेणुम अभिभूत्योजाः|	i indra maghavan excite the conflict i stir the dust lord of surpassing vigour.
अहं ता विश्वा चकरं नकिर मा दैव्यं सहो वरते अप्रतीतम|	all this i did the gods own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth.
यन मा सोमासो ममदन यद उक्थोभे भयेते रजसी अपारे|	when lauds and soma juice have made me joyful both the unbounded regions are affrighted.
विदुष ते विश्वा भुवनानि तस्य ता पर बरवीषि वरुणाय वेधः|	all beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto varuṇa thou great disposer.
तवं वर्त्राणि शर्ण्विषे जघन्वान तवं वर्तां अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून|	thou art renowned as having slain the vṛtras thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.
अस्माकम अत्र पितरस त आसन सप्त रषयो दौर्गहे बध्यमाने|	our fathers then were these the seven his what time the son of durgaha was captive.
त आयजन्त तरसदस्युम अस्या इन्द्रं न वर्त्रतुरम अर्धदेवम|	for her they gained by sacrifice trasadasyu a demigod like indra conquering foemen.
पुरुकुत्सानी हि वाम अदाशद धव्येभिर इन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः|	the spouse of purukutsa gave oblations to you o indravaruṇa with homage.
अथा राजानं तरसदस्युम अस्या वर्त्रहणं ददथुर अर्धदेवम|	then unto her ye gave king trasadasyu the demigod the slayer of the foeman.
राया वयं ससवांसो मदेम हव्येन देवा यवसेन गावः|	may we possessing much delight in riches gods in oblations and the kine in pasture.
तां धेनुम इन्द्रावरुणा युवं नो विश्वाहा धत्तम अनपस्फुरन्तीम|	and that milchcow who shrinks not from the milking o indravaruṇa give to us daily.
आ न इन्द्रो दूराद आ न आसाद अभिष्टिक्र्द अवसे यासद उग्रः|	from near or far away may mighty indra giver of succour come for our protection.
ओजिष्ठेभिर नर्पतिर वज्रबाहुः संगे समत्सु तुर्वणिः पर्तन्यून|	lord of men armed with thunder with the strongest slaying his foes in conflict in the battles.
आ न इन्द्रो हरिभिर यात्व अछार्वाचीनो ऽवसे राधसे च|	may indra come to us with tawny coursers inclined to us to favour and enrich us.
तिष्ठाति वज्री मघवा विरप्शीमं यज्ञम अनु नो वाजसातौ|	may maghavan loudvoiced and wielding thunder stand by us at this sacrifice in combat.
इमं यज्ञं तवम अस्माकम इन्द्र पुरो दधत सनिष्यसि करतुं नः|	thou honouring this our sacrifice o indra shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage.
शवघ्नीव वज्रिन सनये धनानां तवया वयम अर्य आजिं जयेम|	to win the booty thunderarmed like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.
उशन्न उ षु णः सुमना उपाके सोमस्य नु सुषुतस्य सवधावः|	loving us well benevolent close beside us drink godlike indra of the wellpressed soma.
पा इन्द्र परतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वः सम अन्धसा ममदः पर्ष्ठ्येन|	drink of the meath we offer and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.
वि यो ररप्श रषिभिर नवेभिर वर्क्षो न पक्वः सर्ण्यो न जेता|	him who is sung aloud by recent sages like a ripefruited tree a scythearmed victor.
मर्यो न योषाम अभि मन्यमानो ऽछा विवक्मि पुरुहूतम इन्द्रम|	i like a bridegroom thinking of his consort call hither indra him invoked of many.
गिरिर न यः सवतवां रष्व इन्द्रः सनाद एव सहसे जात उग्रः|	him who in native strength is like a mountain the lofty indra born or old for conquest.
आदर्ता वज्रं सथविरं न भीम उद्नेव कोशं वसुना नयॄष्टम|	terrific wielder of the ancient thunder filled full with splendour as a jar with water.
न यस्य वर्ता जनुषा नव अस्ति न राधस आमरीता मघस्य|	whom from of old there is not one to hinder none to curtail the riches of his bounty.
उद्वाव्र्षाणस तविषीव उग्रास्मभ्यं दद्धि पुरुहूत रायः|	pouring forth freely o thou strong and mighty vouchsafe us riches god invoked of many.
ईक्षे रायः कषयस्य चर्षणीनाम उत वरजम अपवर्तासि गोनाम|	of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler and opener of the stable of the cattle.
शिक्षानरः समिथेषु परहावान वस्वो राशिम अभिनेतासि भूरिम|	helper of men winner of spoil in combats thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.
कया तच छर्ण्वे शच्या शचिष्ठो यया कर्णोति मुहु का चिद रष्वः|	by what great might is he renowned as strongest wherewith the lofty one stirs up wild battles.
पुरु दाशुषे विचयिष्ठो अंहो ऽथा दधाति दरविणं जरित्रे|	best soother of the worshippers great sorrow he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.
मा नो मर्धीर आ भरा दद्धि तन नः पर दाशुषे दातवे भूरि यत ते|	slay us not bring bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers.
नव्ये देष्णे शस्ते अस्मिन त उक्थे पर बरवाम वयम इन्द्र सतुवन्तः|	at this new gift with this laud sung before thee extolling thee we indra will declare it.
नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः|	now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः|	a new hymn lord of bays for thee is fashioned may we carborn through song be victors ever.
आ न सतुत उप वाजेभिर ऊती इन्द्र याहि हरिभिर मन्दसानः|	come lauded unto us with powers and succours o indra with thy tawny steeds exulting.
तिरश चिद अर्यः सवना पुरूण्य आङगूषेभिर गर्णानः सत्यराधाः|	past even the foemans manifold libations glorified with our hymns true wealthbestower.
आ हि षमा याति नर्यश चिकित्वान हूयमानः सोत्र्भिर उप यज्ञम|	mans friend to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by somapressers.
सवश्वो यो अभीरुर मन्यमानः सुष्वाणेभिर मदति सं ह वीरैः|	fearless and conscious that his steeds are noble he joyeth with the somapouring heroes.
शरावयेद अस्य कर्णा वाजयध्यै जुष्टाम अनु पर दिशम मन्दयध्यै|	make his cars hear that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth.
उद्वाव्र्षाणो राधसे तुविष्मान करन न इन्द्रः सुतीर्थाभयं च|	may mighty indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety.
अछा यो गन्ता नाधमानम ऊती इत्था विप्रं हवमानं गर्णन्तम|	he who with succour comes to his implorer the singer here who with his song invites him.
उप तमनि दधानो धुर्य आशून सहस्राणि शतानि वज्रबाहुः|	he who himself sets to the pole swift coursers he who hath hundreds thousands thunderwielder.
तवोतासो मघवन्न इन्द्र विप्रा वयं ते सयाम सूरयो गर्णन्तः|	o indra maghavan by thee protected may we be thine princes and priests and singers.
भेजानासो बर्हद्दिवस्य राय आकाय्यस्य दावने पुरुक्षोः|	sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food and all desire its bounty.
यो मर्त्येष्व अम्र्त रतावा देवो देवेष्व अरतिर निधायि|	the faithful one immortal among mortals a god among the gods appointed envoy.
होता यजिष्ठो मह्ना शुचध्यै हव्यैर अग्निर मनुष ईरयध्यै|	priest best at worship must shine forth in glory  agni shall be raised high with mans oblations.
इह तवं सूनो सहसो नो अद्य जातो जातां उभयां अन्तर अग्ने|	born for us here this day o son of vigour between both races of born beings agni.
दूत ईयसे युयुजान रष्व रजुमुष्कान वर्षणः शुक्रांश च|	thou farest as an envoy having harnessed sublime one thy strongmuscled radiant stallions.
अत्या वर्धस्नू रोहिता घर्तस्नू रतस्य मन्ये मनसा जविष्ठा|	i laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing dropping oil flectest through the thoualit of order.
अन्तर ईयसे अरुषा युजानो युष्मांश च देवान विश आ च मर्तान|	yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you deities and mortal races.
अर्यमणं वरुणम मित्रम एषाम इन्द्राविष्णू मरुतो अश्विनोत|	aryaman mitra varuṇa and indra with viṣṇu of the gods maruts and aśvins.
