सवश्वो अग्ने सुरथः सुराधा एद उ वह सुहविषे जनाय|	these agni with good car and steeds bring hither most bountiful to folk with fair oblations.
गोमां अग्ने ऽविमां अश्वी यज्ञो नर्वत्सखा सदम इद अप्रम्र्ष्यः|	agni be this our sacrifice eternal with brave friends rich in kine and sheep and horses.
इळावां एषो असुर परजावान दीर्घो रयिः पर्थुबुध्नः सभावान|	rich asura in sacred food and children in full assembly wealth broadbased and during.
यस त इध्मं जभरत सिष्विदानो मूर्धानं वा ततपते तवाया|	the man who sweating brings for thee the fuel and makes his head to ache thy faithful servant.
भुवस तस्य सवतवांः पायुर अग्ने विश्वस्मात सीम अघायत उरुष्य|	agni to him be a selfstrong protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.
यस ते भराद अन्नियते चिद अन्नं निशिषन मन्द्रम अतिथिम उदीरत|	who brings thee food though thou hast food in plenty welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward.
आ देवयुर इनधते दुरोणे तस्मिन रयिर धरुवो अस्तु दास्वान|	who kindles thee devoutly in his dwellingto him be wealth secure and freely giving.
यस तवा दोषा य उषसि परशंसात परियं वा तवा कर्णवते हविष्मान|	whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning and with oblation doth the thing thou lovest.
अश्वो न सवे दम आ हेम्यावान तम अंहसः पीपरो दाश्वांसम|	in his own home even as a goidgirt courser rescue him from distress the bounteous giver.
यस तुभ्यम अग्ने अम्र्ताय दाशद दुवस तवे कर्णवते यतस्रुक|	whoso brings gifts to thee immortal agni and doth thee service with uplifted ladle.
न स राया शशमानो वि योषन नैनम अंहः परि वरद अघायोः|	let him not sorely toiling lose his riches let not the sinners wickedness enclose him.
यस्य तवम अग्ने अध्वरं जुजोषो देवो मर्तस्य सुधितं रराणः|	whose wellwrought worship thou acceptest agni thou god a mortals gift thou liberal giver.
परीतेद असद धोत्रा सा यविष्ठासाम यस्य विधतो वर्धासः|	dear be his sacrifice to thee most youthful and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.
चित्तिम अचित्तिं चिनवद वि विद्वान पर्ष्ठेव वीता वर्जिना च मर्तान|	may he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men like straight and crooked backs of horses.
राये च नः सवपत्याय देव दितिं च रास्वादितिम उरुष्य|	lead us o god to wealth and noble offspring keep penury afar and grant us plenty.
कविं शशासुः कवयो ऽदब्धा निधारयन्तो दुर्यास्व आयोः|	this sage the sages neer deceived commanded setting him down in dwellings of the living.
अतस तवं दर्श्यां अग्न एतान पड्भिः पश्येर अद्भुतां अर्य एवैः|	hence mayst thou friendly god with rapid footsteps behold the gods wonderful fair to look on.
तवम अग्ने वाघते सुप्रणीतिः सुतसोमाय विधते यविष्ठ|	good guidance hast thou for the priest o agni who youngest god with outpoured soma serves thee.
रत्नम भर शशमानाय घर्ष्वे पर्थु शचन्द्रम अवसे चर्षणिप्राः|	ruler of men thou joyous god bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.
अधा ह यद वयम अग्ने तवाया पड्भिर हस्तेभिश चक्र्मा तनूभिः|	now all that we thy faithful servants agni have done with feet with hands and with our bodies.
रथं न करन्तो अपसा भुरिजोर रतं येमुः सुध्य आशुषाणाः|	the wise with toil the holy rite have guided as those who frame a car with manual cunning.
अधा मातुर उषसः सप्त विप्रा जायेमहि परथमा वेधसो नॄन|	may we seven sages first in rank engender from dawn the mother men to be ordainers.
दिवस पुत्रा अङगिरसो भवेमाद्रिं रुजेम धनिनं शुचन्तः|	may we aṅgirases be sons of heaven and radiant burst the wealthcontaining mountain.
अधा यथा नः पितरः परासः परत्नासो अग्न रतम आशुषाणाः|	as in the days of old our ancient fathers speeding the work of holy worship agni.
शुचीद अयन दीधितिम उक्थशासः कषामा भिन्दन्तो अरुणीर अप वरन|	sought pure light and devotion singing praises they cleft the ground and made red dawns apparent.
सुकर्माणः सुरुचो देवयन्तो ऽयो न देवा जनिमा धमन्तः|	gods doing holy acts devout resplendent smelting like ore their human generations.
शुचन्तो अग्निं वव्र्धन्त इन्द्रम ऊर्वं गव्यम परिषदन्तो अग्मन|	enkindling agni and exalting indra they came encompassing the stall of cattle.
आ यूथेव कषुमति पश्वो अख्यद देवानां यज जनिमान्त्य उग्र|	strong one he marked themand the gods before themlike herds of cattle in a foodful pasture.
मर्तानां चिद उर्वशीर अक्र्प्रन वर्धे चिद अर्य उपरस्यायोः|	there they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals to aid the true the nearest one the living.
अकर्म ते सवपसो अभूम रतम अवस्रन्न उषसो विभातीः|	we have worked for thee we have laboured noblybright dawns have shed their light upon our worship.
अनूनम अग्निम पुरुधा सुश्चन्द्रं देवस्य मर्म्र्जतश चारु चक्षुः|	adding a beauty to the perfect agni and the gods beauteous eye that shines for ever.
एता ते अग्न उचथानि वेधो ऽवोचाम कवये ता जुषस्व|	agni disposer we have sung these praises to thee the wise do thou accept them gladly.
उच छोचस्व कर्णुहि वस्यसो नो महो रायः पुरुवार पर यन्धि|	blaze up on high and ever make us richer give us great wealth o thou whose boons are many.
तवम महां इन्द्र तुभ्यं ह कषा अनु कषत्रम मंहना मन्यत दयौः|	great art thou indra yea the earth with gladness and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion.
तवं वर्त्रं शवसा जघन्वान सर्जः सिन्धूंर अहिना जग्रसानान|	thou in thy vigour having slaughtered vṛtra didst free the floods arrested by the dragon.
तव तविषो जनिमन रेजत दयौ रेजद भूमिर भियसा सवस्य मन्योः|	heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure.
रघायन्त सुभ्वः पर्वतास आर्दन धन्वानि सरयन्त आपः|	the stedfast mountains shook in agitation  the waters flowed and desert spots were flooded.
भिनद गिरिं शवसा वज्रम इष्णन्न आविष्क्र्ण्वानः सहसान ओजः|	hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain while putting forth his strength he showed his vigour.
वधीद वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः सरन्न आपो जवसा हतव्र्ष्णीः|	he slaughtered vṛtra with his bolt exulting and their lord slain forth flowed the waters swiftly.
सुवीरस ते जनिता मन्यत दयौर इन्द्रस्य कर्ता सवपस्तमो भूत|	thy father dyaus esteemed himself a hero most noble was the work of indras maker.
य ईं जजान सवर्यं सुवज्रम अनपच्युतं सदसो न भूम|	his who begat the strong bolts lord who roareth immovable like earth from her foundation.
य एक इच चयावयति पर भूमा राजा कर्ष्टीनाम पुरुहूत इन्द्रः|	he who alone oerthrows the world of creatures indra the peoples king invoked of many.
सत्यम एनम अनु विश्वे मदन्ति रातिं देवस्य गर्णतो मघोनः|	verily all rejoice in him extolling the boons which maghavan the god hath sent them.
सत्रा सोमा अभवन्न अस्य विश्वे सत्रा मदासो बर्हतो मदिष्ठाः|	all soma juices are his own for ever most gladdening draughts are ever his the mighty.
सत्राभवो वसुपतिर वसूनां दत्रे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः|	thou ever wast the treasurelord of treasures indra thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.
तवम अध परथमं जायमानो ऽमे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कर्ष्टीः|	moreover when thou first wast born o indra thou struckest terror into all the people.
तवम परति परवत आशयानम अहिं वज्रेण मघवन वि वर्श्चः|	thou maghavan rentest with thy bolt the dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.
सत्राहणं दाध्र्षिं तुम्रम इन्द्रम महाम अपारं वर्षभं सुवज्रम|	the everslaying bold and furious indra the bright bolts lord infinite strong and mighty.
हन्ता यो वर्त्रं सनितोत वाजं दाता मघानि मघवा सुराधाः|	who slayeth vṛtra and acquireth booty giver of blessings maghavan the bounteous.
अयं वर्तश चातयते समीचीर य आजिषु मघवा शर्ण्व एकः|	alone renowned as maghavan in battles he frighteneth away assembled armies.
अयं वाजम भरति यं सनोत्य अस्य परियासः सख्ये सयाम|	he bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we wellloved continue in his friendship.
अयं शर्ण्वे अध जयन्न उत घनन्न अयम उत पर कर्णुते युधा गाः|	renowned is he when conquering and when slaying fis he who winneth cattle in the combat.
यदा सत्यं कर्णुते मन्युम इन्द्रो विश्वं दर्ळ्हम भयत एजद अस्मात|	when indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.
सम इन्द्रो गा अजयत सं हिरण्या सम अश्विया मघवा यो ह पूर्वीः|	indra hath won all kine all gold all horsesmaghavan he who breaketh forts in pieces.
एभिर नर्भिर नर्तमो अस्य शाकै रायो विभक्ता सम्भरश च वस्वः|	most manly with these men of his who help him dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.
कियत सविद इन्द्रो अध्य एति मातुः कियत पितुर जनितुर यो जजान|	what is the care of indra for his mother what cares he for the father who begat him.
यो अस्य शुष्मम मुहुकैर इयर्ति वातो न जूत सतनयद्भिर अभ्रैः|	his care is that which speeds his might in conflicts like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.
कषियन्तं तवम अक्षियन्तं कर्णोतीयर्ति रेणुम मघवा समोहम|	maghavan makes the settled man unsettled he scatters dust that he hath swept together.
विभञ्जनुर अशनिमां इव दयौर उत सतोतारम मघवा वसौ धात|	breaking in pieces like heaven armed with lightning maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds hm.
अयं चक्रम इषणत सूर्यस्य नय एतशं रीरमत सस्र्माणम|	he urged the chariotwheel of sūrya forward etaśa speeding on his way he rested.
आ कर्ष्ण ईं जुहुराणो जिघर्ति तवचो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ|	him the black undulating cloud bedeweth in this midairs depth at the base of darkness.
असिक्न्यां यजमानो न होता|	as in the night the sacrificing priest.
गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तो वर्षणं वाजयन्तः|	eager for booty craving strength and horses wesingers stir indra the strong for friendship.
जनीयन्तो जनिदाम अक्षितोतिम आ चयावयामो ऽवते न कोशम|	who gives the wives we seek whose succour fails not to hasten like a pitcher to the fountain.
तराता नो बोधि दद्र्शान आपिर अभिख्याता मर्डिता सोम्यानाम|	be thou our guardian show thyself our kinsman watching and blessing those who pour the soma.
सखा पिता पित्र्तमः पित्णां कर्तेम उलोकम उशते वयोधाः|	as friend as sire most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.
सखीयताम अविता बोधि सखा गर्णान इन्द्र सतुवते वयो धाः|	be helping friend of those who seek thy friendship  give life when lauded indra to the singer.
वयं हय आ ते चक्र्मा सबाध आभिः शमीभिर महयन्त इन्द्र|	for indra we the priests have paid thee worship exalting thee with these our sacrifices.
सतुत इन्द्रो मघवा यद ध वर्त्रा भूरीण्य एको अप्रतीनि हन्ति|	alone when indra maghavan is lauded he slayeth many neerresisted vṛtras.
अस्य परियो जरिता यस्य शर्मन नकिर देवा वारयन्ते न मर्ताः|	him in whose keeping is the wellloved singer never do gods or mortals stay or hinder.
एवा न इन्द्रो मघवा विरप्शी करत सत्या चर्षणीध्र्द अनर्वा|	een so let maghavan the loudvoiced indra give us true blessings foeless mens upholder.
तवं राजा जनुषां धेह्य अस्मे अधि शरवो माहिनं यज जरित्रे|	king of all creatures give us glory amply exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.
नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः|	now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः|	for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
यस तस्तम्भ सहसा वि जमो अन्तान बर्हस्पतिस तरिषधस्थो रवेण|	him who with might hath propped earths ends who sitteth in threefold seat bṛhaspati with thunder.
तम परत्नास रषयो दीध्यानाः पुरो विप्रा दधिरे मन्द्रजिह्वम|	him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages deepthinking holy singers set before them.
धुनेतयः सुप्रकेतम मदन्तो बर्हस्पते अभि ये नस ततस्रे|	wild in their course in wellmarked wise rejoicing were they bṛhaspati who pressed around us.
पर्षन्तं सर्प्रम अदब्धम ऊर्वम बर्हस्पते रक्षताद अस्य योनिम|	preserve bṛhaspati the stall uninjured this companys raining evermoving birthplace.
बर्हस्पते या परमा परावद अत आ त रतस्प्र्शो नि षेदुः|	bṛhaspati from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal.
तुभ्यं खाता अवता अद्रिदुग्धा मध्व शचोतन्त्य अभितो विरप्शम|	for thee were dug wells springing from the mountain which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.
बर्हस्पतिः परथमं जायमानो महो जयोतिषः परमे वयोमन|	bṛhaspati when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven.
सप्तास्यस तुविजातो रवेण वि सप्तरश्मिर अधमत तमांसि|	strong with his sevenfold mouth with noise of thunder with his seven rays blew and dispersed the darkness.
स सुष्टुभा स रक्वता गणेन वलं रुरोज फलिगं रवेण|	with the loudshouting band who sang his praises with thunder he destroyed obstructive vala.
बर्हस्पतिर उस्रिया हव्यसूदः कनिक्रदद वावशतीर उद आजत|	bṛhaspati thundering drave forth the cattle the lowing cows who make oblations ready.
एवा पित्रे विश्वदेवाय वर्ष्णे यज्ञैर विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः|	serve we with sacrifices gifts and homage even thus the steer of all the gods the father.
बर्हस्पते सुप्रजा वीरवन्तो वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम|	bṛhaspati may we be lords of riches with noble progeny and store of heroes.
स इद राजा परतिजन्यानि विश्वा शुष्मेण तस्थाव अभि वीर्य्ण|	surely that king by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes possesions.
बर्हस्पतिं यः सुभ्र्तम बिभर्ति वल्गूयति वन्दते पूर्वभाजम|	who cherishes bṛhaspati welltended adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.
स इत कषेति सुधित ओकसि सवे तस्मा इळा पिन्वते विश्वदानीम|	in his own house he dwells in peace and comfort to him for ever holy food flows richly.
तस्मै विशः सवयम एवा नमन्ते यस्मिन बरह्मा राजनि पूर्व एति|	to him the people with free will pay homagethe king with whom the brahman hath precedence.
अप्रतीतो जयति सं धनानि परतिजन्यान्य उत या सजन्या|	he unopposed is master of the riches of his own subjects and of hostile people.
अवस्यवे यो वरिवः कर्णोति बरह्मणे राजा तम अवन्ति देवाः|	the gods uphold that king with their protection who helps the brahman when he seeks his favour.
इन्द्रश च सोमम पिबतम बर्हस्पते ऽसमिन यज्ञे मन्दसाना वर्षण्वसू|	indra bṛhaspati rainers of treasure rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the soma.
आ वां विशन्त्व इन्दवः सवाभुवो ऽसमे रयिं सर्ववीरं नि यछतम|	let the abundant drops sink deep within you vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.
बर्हस्पत इन्द्र वर्धतं नः सचा सा वां सुमतिर भूत्व अस्मे|	bṛhaspati and indra make us prosper may this be your benevolence to usward.
अविष्टं धियो जिग्र्तम पुरंधीर जजस्तम अर्यो वनुषाम अरातीः|	assist our holy thoughts wake up our spirit weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.
दधिक्राव्ण इद उ नु चर्किराम विश्वा इन माम उषसः सूदयन्तु|	let us recite the praise of dadhikrāvan may all the mornings move me to exertion.
अपाम अग्नेर उषसः सूर्यस्य बर्हस्पतेर आङगिरसस्य जिष्णोः|	praise of the lord of waters dawn and agni bṛhaspati son of aṅgiras and sūrya.
सत्वा भरिषो गविषो दुवन्यसच छरवस्याद इष उषसस तुरण्यसत|	brave seeking war and booty dwelling with the good and with the swift may he hasten the food of dawn.
सत्यो दरवो दरवरः पतंगरो दधिक्रावेषम ऊर्जं सवर जनत|	may he the true the fleet the lover of the course the birdlike dadhikrāvan bring food strength and light.
उत समास्य दरवतस तुरण्यतः पर्णं न वेर अनु वाति परगर्धिनः|	his pinion rapid runner fans him m his way as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim.
शयेनस्येव धरजतो अङकसम परि दधिक्राव्णः सहोर्जा तरित्रतः|	and as it were a falcons gliding through the air strikes dadhikrāvans side as he speeds on with might.
उत सय वाजी कषिपणिं तुरण्यति गरीवायाम बद्धो अपिकक्ष आसनि|	bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth the vigorous courser lends new swiftness to his speed.
करतुं दधिक्रा अनु संतवीत्वत पथाम अङकांस्य अन्व आपनीफणत|	drawing himself together as his strength allows dadhikrās springs along the windings of the paths.
हंसः शुचिषद वसुर अन्तरिक्षसद धोता वेदिषद अतिथिर दुरोणसत|	the haṁsa homed in light the vasu in midair the priest beside the altar in the house the guest.
नर्षद वरसद रतसद वयोमसद अब्जा गोजा रतजा अद्रिजा रतम|	dweller in noblest place mid men in truth in sky born of flood kine truth mountain he is holy law.
कया नश चित्र आ भुवद ऊती सदाव्र्धः सखा|	with what help will he come to us wonderful everwaxing friend.
कया शचिष्ठया वर्ता|	with what most mighty company.
कस तवा सत्यो मदानाम मंहिष्ठो मत्सद अन्धसः|	what genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst.
दर्ळ्हा चिद आरुजे वसु|	open een stronglyguarded wealth.
अभी षु णः सखीनाम अविता जरित्णाम|	do thou who art protector of us thy friends who praise thee.
शतम भवास्य ऊतिभिः|	with hundred aids approach us.
अभी न आ वव्र्त्स्व चक्रं न वर्त्तम अर्वतः|	like as a coursers circling wheel so turn thee hitherward to us.
नियुद्भिश चर्षणीनाम|	attracted by the hymns of men.
परवता हि करतूनाम आ हा पदेव गछसि|	thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers.
अभक्षि सूर्ये सचा|	i share thee even with the sun.
सं यत त इन्द्र मन्यवः सं चक्राणि दधन्विरे|	what time thy courage and his wheels together indra run their course.
अध तवे अध सूर्ये|	with thee and with the sun alike.
उत समा हि तवाम आहुर इन मघवानं शचीपते|	so even lord of power and might the people call thee maghavan.
दातारम अविदीधयुम|	giver who pauses not to think.
उत समा सद्य इत परि शशमानाय सुन्वते|	and verily to him who toils and presses soma juice for thee.
पुरू चिन मंहसे वसु|	thou quickly givest ample wealth.
नहि षमा ते शतं चन राधो वरन्त आमुरः|	no not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bountys flow.
न चयौत्नानि करिष्यतः|	nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.
अस्मां अवन्तु ते शतम अस्मान सहस्रम ऊतयः|	may thine assistance keep us safe thy hundred and thy thousand aids.
अस्मान विश्वा अभिष्टयः|	may all thy favours strengthen us.
अस्मां इहा वर्णीष्व सख्याय सवस्तये|	do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity.
महो राये दिवित्मते|	and great celestial opulence.
अस्मां अविड्ढि विश्वहेन्द्र राया परीणसा|	favour us indra evermore with overflowing store of wealth.
अस्मान विश्वाभिर ऊतिभिः|	with all thy succours aid thou us.
अस्मभ्यं तां अपा वर्धि वरजां अस्तेव गोमतः|	with new protections indra like an archer open thou for us.
नवाभिर इन्द्रोतिभिः|	the stables that are filled with kine.
अस्माकं धर्ष्णुया रथो दयुमां इन्द्रानपच्युतः|	our chariot indra boldly moves endued with splendour neer repulsed.
गव्युर अश्वयुर ईयते|	winning for us both kine and steeds.
अस्माकम उत्तमं कर्धि शरवो देवेषु सूर्य|	o sūrya make our fame to be most excellent among the gods.
वर्षिष्ठं दयाम इवोपरि|	most lofty as the heaven on high.
उप नो वाजा अध्वरम रभुक्षा देवा यात पथिभिर देवयानैः|	come to our sacrifice vājas Ṛbhukṣans gods by the paths which gods are wont to travel.
यथा यज्ञम मनुषो विक्ष्व आसु दधिध्वे रण्वाः सुदिनेष्व अह्नाम|	as ye gay gods accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of manus.
ते वो हर्दे मनसे सन्तु यज्ञा जुष्टासो अद्य घर्तनिर्णिजो गुः|	may these rites please you in your heart and spirit may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you.
पर वः सुतासो हरयन्त पूर्णाः करत्वे दक्षाय हर्षयन्त पीताः|	may the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength and when imbibed delight you.
तर्युदायं देवहितं यथा व सतोमो वाजा रभुक्षणो ददे वः|	your threefold going near is godappointed so praise is given you vājas and Ṛbhukṣans.
जुह्वे मनुष्वद उपरासु विक्षु युष्मे सचा बर्हद्दिवेषु सोमम|	so manuslike mid younger folk i offer to you who are aloft in heaven the soma.
पीवोश्वाः शुचद्रथा हि भूतायःशिप्रा वाजिनः सुनिष्काः|	strong with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron ye have a splendid car and wellfed horses.
इन्द्रस्य सूनो शवसो नपातो ऽनु वश चेत्य अग्रियम मदाय|	ye sons of strength ye progeny of indra to you the best is offered to delight you.
रभुम रभुक्षणो रयिं वाजे वाजिन्तमं युजम|	Ṛbhukṣans him for handy wealth the mightiest comrade in the fight.
इन्द्रस्वन्तं हवामहे सदासातमम अश्विनम|	him indras equal we invoke most bounteous ever rich in steeds.
सेद रभवो यम अवथ यूयम इन्द्रश च मर्त्यम|	the mortal man whom Ṛbhus ye and indra favour with your help.
स धीभिर अस्तु सनिता मेधसाता सो अर्वता|	must be successful by his thoughts at sacrifice and with the steed.
वि नो वाजा रभुक्षणः पथश चितन यष्टवे|	o vājas and Ṛbhukṣans free for us the paths to sacrifice.
अस्मभ्यं सूरय सतुता विश्वा आशास तरीषणि|	ye princes lauded that we may press forward to each point of heaven.
तं नो वाजा रभुक्षण इन्द्र नासत्या रयिम|	o vājas and Ṛbhukṣans ye nāsatyas indra bless this wealth.
सम अश्वं चर्षणिभ्य आ पुरु शस्त मघत्तये|	and before other mens the steed that ample riches may be won.
अभूद देवः सविता वन्द्यो नु न इदानीम अह्न उपवाच्यो नर्भिः|	now must we praise and honour savitar the god at this time of the day the men must call to him.
वि यो रत्ना भजति मानवेभ्यः शरेष्ठं नो अत्र दरविणं यथा दधत|	him who distributes wealth to manus progeny that he may grant us here riches most excellent.
देवेभ्यो हि परथमं यज्ञियेभ्यो ऽमर्तत्वं सुवसि भागम उत्तमम|	for thou at first producest for the holy gods the noblest of all portions immortality.
आद इद दामानं सवितर वय ्र्णुषे ऽनूचीना जीविता मानुषेभ्यः|	thereafter as a gift to men o savitar thou openest existence life succeeding life.
अचित्ती यच चक्र्मा दैव्ये जने दीनैर दक्षैः परभूती पूरुषत्वता|	if we men as we are have sinned against the gods through want of thought in weakness or through insolence.
देवेषु च सवितर मानुषेषु च तवं नो अत्र सुवताद अनागसः|	absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin o savitar alike among both gods and men.
न परमिये सवितुर दैव्यस्य तद यथा विश्वम भुवनं धारयिष्यति|	none may impede that power of savitar the god whereby he will maintain the universal world.
यत पर्थिव्या वरिमन्न आ सवङगुरिर वर्ष्मन दिवः सुवति सत्यम अस्य तत|	what the fairfingered god brings forth on earths expanse or in the height of heaven that work of his stands sure.
इन्द्रज्येष्ठान बर्हद्भ्यः पर्वतेभ्यः कषयां एभ्यः सुवसि पस्त्यावतः|	to lofty hills thou sendest those whom indra leads and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these.
यथायथा पतयन्तो वियेमिर एवैव तस्थुः सवितः सवाय ते|	however they may fly and draw themselves apart still savitar they stand obeying thy behest.
ये ते तरिर अहन सवितः सवासो दिवेदिवे सौभगम आसुवन्ति|	may the libations poured to thee thrice daily day after day o savitar bring us blessing.
इन्द्रो दयावाप्र्थिवी सिन्धुर अद्भिर आदित्यैर नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत|	may indra heaven earth sindhu with the waters aditi with Ādityas give us shelter.
एष सय भानुर उद इयर्ति युज्यते रथः परिज्मा दिवो अस्य सानवि|	yonder goes up that light your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven.
पर्क्षासो अस्मिन मिथुना अधि तरयो दर्तिस तुरीयो मधुनो वि रप्शते|	within this car are stored three kindred shares of food and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.
उद वाम पर्क्षासो मधुमन्त ईरते रथा अश्वास उषसो वयुष्टिषु|	forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn.
अपोर्णुवन्तस तम आ परीव्र्तं सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः|	stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom and spreading through midair bright radiance like the sun.
मध्वः पिबतम मधुपेभिर आसभिर उत परियम मधुने युञ्जाथां रथम|	drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught harness for the meaths sake the chariot that ye love.
आ वर्तनिम मधुना जिन्वथस पथो दर्तिं वहेथे मधुमन्तम अश्विना|	refresh the way ye go refresh the paths with meath hither o aśvins bring the skin that holds the meath.
हंसासो ये वाम मधुमन्तो अस्रिधो हिरण्यपर्णा उहुव उषर्बुधः|	the swans ye have are friendly rich in store of meath goldpinioned strong to draw awake at early morn.
उदप्रुतो मन्दिनो मन्दिनिस्प्र्शो मध्वो न मक्षः सवनानि गछथः|	swimming the flood exultant fain for draughts that cheer ye come like flies to our libations of the meath.
सवध्वरासो मधुमन्तो अग्नय उस्रा जरन्ते परति वस्तोर अश्विना|	well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath the fires sing to the morning aśvins at the break of day.
यन निक्तहस्तस तरणिर विचक्षणः सोमं सुषाव मधुमन्तम अद्रिभिः|	when with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the soma rich in meath.
आकेनिपासो अहभिर दविध्वतः सवर ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः|	the rays advancing nigh chasing with day the gloom spread through the firmament bright radiance like the sun.
सूरश चिद अश्वान युयुजान ईयते विश्वां अनु सवधया चेतथस पथः|	and the sun harnessing his horses goeth forth ye through your godlike nature let his paths be known.
पर वाम अवोचम अश्विना धियंधा रथः सवश्वो अजरो यो अस्ति|	devout in thought i have declared o aśvins your chariot with good steeds which lasts for ever.
येन सद्यः परि रजांसि याथो हविष्मन्तं तरणिम भोजम अछ|	wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.
मही दयावाप्र्थिवी इह जयेष्ठे रुचा भवतां शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः|	may mighty heaven and earth most meet for honour be present here with light and gleaming splendours.
यत सीं वरिष्ठे बर्हती विमिन्वन रुवद धोक्षा पप्रथानेभिर एवैः|	when fixing them apart vast most extensive the steer roars loudly in farreaching courses.
देवी देवेभिर यजते यजत्रैर अमिनती तस्थतुर उक्षमाणे|	the goddesses with gods holy with holy the two stand pouring out their rain exhaustless.
रतावरी अद्रुहा देवपुत्रे यज्ञस्य नेत्री शुचयद्भिर अर्कैः|	faithful and guileless having gods for children leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.
स इत सवपा भुवनेष्व आस य इमे दयावाप्र्थिवी जजान|	sure in the worlds he was a skilful craftsman he who produced these twain the earth and heaven.
उर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके अवंशे धीरः शच्या सम ऐरत|	wise with his power he brought both realms together spacious and deep wellfashioned unsupported.
नू रोदसी बर्हद्भिर नो वरूथैः पत्नीवद्भिर इषयन्ती सजोषाः|	o heaven and earth with one accord promoting with high protection as of queens our welfare.
उरूची विश्वे यजते नि पातं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः|	farreaching universal holy guard us may we carborne through song be victors ever.
पर वाम महि दयवी अभ्य उपस्तुतिम भरामहे|	to both of you o heaven and earth we bring our lofty song of praise.
शुची उप परशस्तये|	pure ones to glorify you both.
पुनाने तन्वा मिथः सवेन दक्षेण राजथः|	ye sanctify each others form by your own proper might ye rule.
ऊह्याथे सनाद रतम|	and from of old observe the law.
मही मित्रस्य साधथस तरन्ती पिप्रती रतम|	furthering and fulfilling ye o mighty perfect mitras law.
परि यज्ञं नि षेदथुः|	ye sit around our sacrifice.
इहोप यात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना रभवो माप भूत|	come hither o ye sons of strength ye Ṛbhus stay not afar ye children of sudhanvan.
अस्मिन हि वः सवने रत्नधेयं गमन्त्व इन्द्रम अनु वो मदासः|	at this libation is your gift of treasure let gladdening draughts approach you after indras.
आगन्न रभूणाम इह रत्नधेयम अभूत सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पीतिः|	hither is come the Ṛbhus gift of riches here was the drinking of the wellpressed soma.
सुक्र्त्यया यत सवपस्यया चं एकं विचक्र चमसं चतुर्धा|	since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold.
वय अक्र्णोत चमसं चतुर्धा सखे वि शिक्षेत्य अब्रवीत|	ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single ye spake these words and said o friend assist us.
अथैत वाजा अम्र्तस्य पन्थां गणं देवानाम रभवः सुहस्ताः|	then vājas gained the path of life eternal defthanded Ṛbhus to the gods assembly.
किम्मयः सविच चमस एष आस यं काव्येन चतुरो विचक्र|	out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom.
अथा सुनुध्वं सवनम मदाय पात रभवो मधुनः सोम्यस्य|	now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor and drink o Ṛbhus of die meath of soma.
शच्याकर्त पितरा युवाना शच्याकर्त चमसं देवपानम|	ye with your cunning made your parents youthful the cup for gods to drink ye formed with cunning.
शच्या हरी धनुतराव अतष्टेन्द्रवाहाव रभवो वाजरत्नाः|	with cunning Ṛbhus rich in treasure fashioned the two swift tawny steeds who carry indra.
यो वः सुनोत्य अभिपित्वे अह्नां तीव्रं वाजासः सवनम मदाय|	whoso pours out for you when days are closing the sharp libation for your joy o vājas.
तस्मै रयिम रभवः सर्ववीरम आ तक्षत वर्षणो मन्दसानाः|	for him o mighty Ṛbhus ye rejoicing have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.
परातः सुतम अपिबो हर्यश्व माध्यंदिनं सवनं केवलं ते|	lord of bay steeds at dawn the juice thou drankest thine only thine is the noonday libation.
सम रभुभिः पिबस्व रत्नधेभिः सखींर यां इन्द्र चक्र्षे सुक्र्त्या|	now drink thou with the wealthbestowing Ṛbhus whom for their skill thou madest friends o indra.
ये देवासो अभवता सुक्र्त्या शयेना इवेद अधि दिवि निषेद|	ye whom your artist skill hath raised to godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons.
ते रत्नं धात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना अभवताम्र्तासः|	so give us riches children of sudhanvan o sons of strength ye have become immortal.
यत तर्तीयं सवनं रत्नधेयम अक्र्णुध्वं सवपस्या सुहस्ताः|	the third libation that bestoweth treasure which ye have won by skill ye dexteroushanded.
तद रभवः परिषिक्तं व एतत सम मदेभिर इन्द्रियेभिः पिबध्वम|	this drink hath been effused for you o Ṛbhus  drink it with high delight with joy like indras.
पर रभुभ्यो दूतम इव वाचम इष्य उपस्तिरे शवैतरीं धेनुम ईळे|	i send my voice as herald to the Ṛbhus i crave the white cow for the overspreading.
ये वातजूतास तरणिभिर एवैः परि दयां सद्यो अपसो बभूवुः|	windsped the skillful ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.
यदारम अक्रन्न रभवः पित्र्भ्याम परिविष्टी वेषणा दंसनाभिः|	what time the rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their parents.
आद इद देवानाम उप सख्यम आयन धीरासः पुष्टिम अवहन मनायै|	they won the friendship of the gods the sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.
पुनर ये चक्रुः पितरा युवाना सना यूपेव जरणा शयाना|	may they who made their parents who were lying like posts that moulder young again for ever.
ते वाजो विभ्वां रभुर इन्द्रवन्तो मधुप्सरसो नो ऽवन्तु यज्ञम|	may vāja vibhvan Ṛbhu joined with indra  protect our sacrifice the somalovers.
यत संवत्सम रभवो गाम अरक्षन यत संवत्सम रभवो मा अपिंशन|	as for a year the Ṛbhus kept the milchcow throughout a year fashioned and formed her body.
यत संवत्सम अभरन भासो अस्यास ताभिः शमीभिर अम्र्तत्वम आशुः|	and through a years space still sustained her brightness through these their labours they were made immortal.
जयेष्ठ आह चमसा दवा करेति कनीयान तरीन कर्णवामेत्य आह|	two beakers let us makethus said the eldest let us make threethis was the youngers sentence.
कनिष्ठ आह चतुरस करेति तवष्ट रभवस तत पनयद वचो वः|	four beakers let us makethus spoke the youngest tvaṣṭar approved this rede of yours o Ṛbhus.
सत्यम ऊचुर नर एवा हि चक्रुर अनु सवधाम रभवो जग्मुर एताम|	the men spake truth and even so they acted this godlike way of theirs the Ṛbhus followed.
विभ्राजमानांश चमसां अहेवावेनत तवष्टा चतुरो दद्र्श्वान|	and tvaṣṭar when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day was moved with envy.
दवादश दयून यद अगोह्यस्यातिथ्ये रणन्न रभवः ससन्तः|	when for twelve days the Ṛbhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden.
सुक्षेत्राक्र्ण्वन्न अनयन्त सिन्धून धन्वातिष्ठन्न ओषधीर निम्नम आपः|	they made fair fertile fields they brought the rivers plants spread oer deserts waters filled the hollows.
रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं नरेष्ठां ये धेनुं विश्वजुवं विश्वरूपाम|	may they who formed the swift car bearing heroes and the cow omniform and allimpelling.
त आ तक्षन्त्व रभवो रयिं नः सववसः सवपसः सुहस्ताः|	even may they form wealth for usthe Ṛbhus dexteroushanded deft in work and gracious.
अपो हय एषाम अजुषन्त देवा अभि करत्वा मनसा दीध्यानाः|	so in their work the gods had satisfaction pondering it with thought and mental insight.
वाजो देवानाम अभवत सुकर्मेन्द्रस्य रभुक्षा वरुणस्य विभ्वा|	the gods expert artificer was vāja indras Ṛbhukṣan varuṇas was vibhvan.
ये हरी मेधयोक्था मदन्त इन्द्राय चक्रुः सुयुजा ये अश्वा|	they who made glad with sacrifice and praises wrought the two bays his docile steeds for indra.
ते रायस पोषं दरविणान्य अस्मे धत्त रभवः कषेमयन्तो न मित्रम|	Ṛbhus as those who wish a friend to prosper bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.
इदाह्नः पीतिम उत वो मदं धुर न रते शरान्तस्य सख्याय देवाः|	this day have they set gladdening drink before you not without toil are gods inclined to friendship.
ते नूनम अस्मे रभवो वसूनि तर्तीये अस्मिन सवने दधात|	therefore do ye who are so great o Ṛbhus vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.
यस तवाम अग्न इनधते यतस्रुक तरिस ते अन्नं कर्णवत सस्मिन्न अहन|	whoso enkindles thee with lifted ladle and thrice this day offers thee food o agni.
स सु दयुम्नैर अभ्य अस्तु परसक्षत तव करत्वा जातवेदश चिकित्वान|	may he excel triumphant through thy splendours wise through thy mental power o jātavedas.
इध्मं यस ते जभरच छश्रमाणो महो अग्ने अनीकम आ सपर्यन|	whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel serving the majesty of mighty agni.
स इधानः परति दोषाम उषासम पुष्यन रयिं सचते घनन्न अमित्रान|	he kindling thee at evening and at morning prospers and comes to wealth and slays his foemen.
अग्निर ईशे बर्हतः कषत्रियस्याग्निर वाजस्य परमस्य रायः|	agni is master of sublime dominion agni is lord of strength and lofty riches.
दधाति रत्नं विधते यविष्ठो वय आनुषङ मर्त्याय सवधावान|	straightway the selfreliant god most youthful gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.
यच चिद धि ते पुरुषत्रा यविष्ठाचित्तिभिश चक्र्मा कच चिद आगः|	most youthful god whatever sin through folly we here as human beings have committed.
कर्धी षव अस्मां अदितेर अनागान वय एनांसि शिश्रथो विष्वग अग्ने|	in sight of aditi make thou us sinless remit entirely agni our offences.
महश चिद अग्न एनसो अभीक ऊर्वाद देवानाम उत मर्त्यानाम|	even in the presence of great sin o agni free us from prison of the gods or mortals.
मा ते सखायः सदम इद रिषाम यछा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः|	never may we who are thy friends be injured grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.
यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताम अमुञ्चता यजत्राः|	even as ye here gods excellent and holy have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered.
एवो षव अस्मन मुञ्चता वय अंहः पर तार्य अग्ने परतरं न आयुः|	so also set us free from this affliction long let our life o agni be extended.
आ यात्व इन्द्रो ऽवस उप न इह सतुतः सधमाद अस्तु शूरः|	may indra come to us for our protection here be the hero praised our feastcompanion.
वाव्र्धानस तविषीर यस्य पूर्वीर दयौर न कषत्रम अभिभूति पुष्यात|	may he whose powers are many waxen mighty cherish like dyaus his own supreme dominion.
तस्येद इह सतवथ वर्ष्ण्यानि तुविद्युम्नस्य तुविराधसो नॄन|	here magnify his great heroic exploits most glorious one enriching men with bounties.
यस्य करतुर विदथ्यो न सम्राट साह्वान तरुत्रो अभ्य अस्ति कर्ष्टीः|	whose will is like a sovran in assembly who rules the people conqueror allsurpassing.
आ यात्व इन्द्रो दिव आ पर्थिव्या मक्षू समुद्राद उत वा पुरीषात|	hither let indra come from earth or heaven hither with speech from firmament or ocean.
सवर्णराद अवसे नो मरुत्वान परावतो वा सदनाद रतस्य|	with maruts from the realm of light to aid us or from a distance from the seat of order.
सथूरस्य रायो बर्हतो य ईशे तम उ षटवाम विदथेष्व इन्द्रम|	that indra will we laud in our assemblies him who is lord of great and lasting riches.
यो वायुना जयति गोमतीषु पर धर्ष्णुया नयति वस्यो अछ|	victor with vāyu where the herds are gathered who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.
उप यो नमो नमसि सतभायन्न इयर्ति वाचं जनयन यजध्यै|	may the priest lord of many blessings strivingwho fixing reverence on reverence giving.
रञ्जसानः पुरुवार उक्थैर एन्द्रं कर्ण्वीत सदनेषु होता|	vent to his voice inciteth men to worshipwith lauds bring indra hither to our dwellings.
धिषा यदि धिषण्यन्तः सरण्यान सदन्तो अद्रिम औशिजस्य गोहे|	when sitting pondering in deep devotion in auśijas abode they ply the pressstone.
आ दुरोषाः पास्त्यस्य होता यो नो महान संवरणेषु वह्निः|	may he whose wrath is fierce the mighty bearer come as the houselords priest within our chambers.
सत्रा यद ईम भार्वरस्य वर्ष्णः सिषक्ति शुष्म सतुवते भराय|	surely the power of bhārvara the mighty for ever helpeth to support the singer.
गुहा यद ईम औशिजस्य गोहे पर यद धिये परायसे मदाय|	that which in auśijas abode lies hidden to come forth for delight and for devotion.
वि यद वरांसि पर्वतस्य वर्ण्वे पयोभिर जिन्वे अपां जवांसि|	when he unbars the spaces of the mountains and quickens with his floods the watertorrents.
विदद गौरस्य गवयस्य गोहे यदी वाजाय सुध्यो वहन्ति|	he finds in lair the buffalo and wildox when the wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.
भद्रा ते हस्ता सुक्र्तोत पाणी परयन्तारा सतुवते राध इन्द्र|	auspicious are thy hands thine arms wellfashioned which proffer bounty indra to thy praiser.
का ते निषत्तिः किम उ नो ममत्सि किं नोदउद उ हर्षसे दातवा उ|	what sloth is this why dost thou not rejoice thee why dost thou not delight thyself with giving.
एवा वस्व इन्द्रः सत्यः सम्राड ढन्ता वर्त्रं वरिवः पूरवे कः|	so indra is the truthful lord of treasure freedom he gave to man by slaying vṛtra.
पुरुष्टुत करत्वा नः शग्धि रायो भक्षीय ते ऽवसो दैव्यस्य|	muchlauded help us with thy power to riches may i be sharer of thy godlike favour.
नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः|	now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः|	for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we careborne through song be victors ever.
कथा महाम अव्र्धत कस्य होतुर यज्ञं जुषाणो अभि सोमम ऊधः|	how what priests sacrifice hath he made mighty rejoicing in the soma and its fountain.
पिबन्न उशानो जुषमाणो अन्धो ववक्ष रष्वः शुचते धनाय|	delighting in juice eagerly drinking the lofty one hath waxed for splendid riches.
को अस्य वीरः सधमादम आप सम आनंश सुमतिभिः को अस्य|	what hero hath been made his feastcompanion who hath been partner in his lovingkindness.
कद अस्य चित्रं चिकिते कद ऊती वर्धे भुवच छशमानस्य यज्योः|	what know we of his wondrous acts how often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler.
कथा शर्णोति हूयमानम इन्द्रः कथा शर्ण्वन्न अवसाम अस्य वेद|	how heareth indra offered invocation how hearing marketh he the invokers wishes.
का अस्य पूर्वीर उपमातयो ह कथैनम आहुः पपुरिं जरित्रे|	what are his ancient acts of bounty wherefore call they him one who filleth full the singer.
कथा सबाधः शशमानो अस्य नशद अभि दरविणं दीध्यानः|	how doth the priest who laboureth ever longing win for himself the wealth which he possesseth.
देवो भुवन नवेदा म रतानां नमो जग्र्भ्वां अभि यज जुजोषत|	may he the god mark well my truthful praises having received the homage which he loveth.
कथा कद अस्या उषसो वयुष्टौ देवो मर्तस्य सख्यं जुजोष|	how and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the god chosen as this morn is breaking.
कथा कद अस्य सख्यं सखिभ्यो ये अस्मिन कामं सुयुजं ततस्रे|	how and what love hath he for those who love him who have entwined in him their firm affection.
किम आद अमत्रं सख्यं सखिभ्यः कदा नु ते भरात्रम पर बरवाम|	is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty thy brotherhood with uswhen may we tell it.
शरिये सुद्र्शो वपुर अस्य सर्गाः सवर ण चित्रतमम इष आ गोः|	the streams of milk move as most wondrous sunlight the beauty of the lovely one for glory.
दरुहं जिघांसन धवरसम अनिन्द्रां तेतिक्ते तिग्मा तुजसे अनीका|	about to stay the indraless destructive spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her.
रणा चिद यत्र रणया न उग्रो दूरे अज्ञाता उषसो बबाधे|	whereby the strong although our debts exactor drives in the distant mornings that we know not.
रतस्य हि शुरुधः सन्ति पूर्वीर रतस्य धीतिर वर्जिनानि हन्ति|	eternal law hath varied food that strengthens thought of eternal law removes transgressions.
रतस्य शलोको बधिरा ततर्द कर्णा बुधानः शुचमान आयोः|	the praisehymn of eternal law arousing glowing hath oped the deaf ears of the living.
रतस्य दर्ळ्हा धरुणानि सन्ति पुरूणि चन्द्रा वपुषे वपूंषि|	firmseated are eternal laws foundations in its fair form are many splendid beauties.
रतेन दीर्घम इषणन्त पर्क्ष रतेन गाव रतम आ विवेशुः|	by holy law long lasting food they bring us by holy law have cows come to our worship.
रतं येमान रतम इद वनोत्य रतस्य शुष्मस तुरया उ गव्युः|	fixing eternal law he too upholds it swift moves the might of law and wins the booty.
रताय पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे रताय धेनू परमे दुहाते|	to law belong the vast deep earth and heaven milchkine supreme to law their milk they render.
नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः|	now indra laudedglorified with praises let power swell high like rivers to the singer.
अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः|	for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
अग्रम पिबा मधूनां सुतं वायो दिविष्टिषु|	drink the best draught of somajuice o vāyu at our holy rites.
तवं हि पूर्वपा असि|	for thou art he who drinketh first.
शतेना नो अभिष्टिभिर नियुत्वां इन्द्रसारथिः|	come teamdrawn with thy hundred helps with indra seated in the car.
वायो सुतस्य तर्म्पतम|	vāyu and drink your fill of juice.
आ वां सहस्रं हरय इन्द्रवायू अभि परयः|	may steeds a thousand bring you both indra and vāyu hitherward.
वहन्तु सोमपीतये|	to drink the soma to the feast.
रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरम इन्द्रवायू सवध्वरम|	for ye o indravāyu mount the goldenseated car that aids.
आ हि सथाथो दिविस्प्र्शम|	the sacrifice that reaches heaven.
रथेन पर्थुपाजसा दाश्वांसम उप गछतम|	on farrefulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts.
इन्द्रवायू इहा गतम|	come indravāyu hitherward.
इन्द्रवायू अयं सुतस तं देवेभिः सजोषसा|	here indravāyu is the juice drink it accordant with the gods.
पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे|	within the givers dwellingplace.
इह परयाणम अस्तु वाम इन्द्रवायू विमोचनम|	hither o indravāyu be your journey here unyoke your steeds.
इह वां सोमपीतये|	here for your draught of soma juice.
रभुर विभ्वा वाज इन्द्रो नो अछेमं यज्ञं रत्नधेयोप यात|	to this our sacrifice come Ṛbhu vibhvan vāja and indra with the gift of riches.
इदा हि वो धिषणा देव्य अह्नाम अधात पीतिं सम मदा अग्मता वः|	because this day hath dhiṣaṇā the goddess set drink for you the gladdening draughts have reached you.
विदानासो जन्मनो वाजरत्ना उत रतुभिर रभवो मादयध्वम|	knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure Ṛbhus rejoice together with the Ṛtus.
सं वो मदा अग्मत सम पुरंधिः सुवीराम अस्मे रयिम एरयध्वम|	the gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you send ye us riches with good store of heroes.
अयं वो यज्ञ रभवो ऽकारि यम आ मनुष्वत परदिवो दधिध्वे|	for you was made this sacrifice o Ṛbhus which ye like men won for yourselves aforetime.
पर वो ऽछा जुजुषाणासो अस्थुर अभूत विश्वे अग्रियोत वाजाः|	to you come all who find in you their pleasure ye all wereeven the two eldervājas.
अभूद उ वो विधते रत्नधेयम इदा नरो दाशुषे मर्त्याय|	now for the mortal worshipper o heroes for him who served you was the gift of riches.
पिबत वाजा रभवो ददे वो महि तर्तीयं सवनम मदाय|	drink vājas Ṛbhus unto you is offered to gladden you the third and great libation.
आ वाजा यातोप न रभुक्षा महो नरो दरविणसो गर्णानाः|	come to us heroes vājas and Ṛbhukṣans glorified for the sake of mighty treasure.
आ वः पीतयो ऽभिपित्वे अह्नाम इमा अस्तं नवस्व इव गमन|	these draughts approach you as the day is closing as cows whose calves are newlyborn their stable.
आ नपातः शवसो यातनोपेमं यज्ञं नमसा हूयमानाः|	come to this sacrifice of ours ye children of strength invoked with humble adoration.
सजोषसः सूरयो यस्य च सथ मध्वः पात रत्नधा इन्द्रवन्तः|	drink of this meath wealthgivers joined with indra with whom ye are in full accord ye princes.
सजोषा इन्द्र वरुणेन सोमं सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः|	close knit with varuṇa drink the soma indra closeknit hymnlover with the maruts drink it.
अग्रेपाभिर रतुपाभिः सजोषा गनास्पत्नीभी रत्नधाभिः सजोषाः|	closeknit with drinkers first who drink in season closeknit with heavenly dames who give us treasures.
सजोषस आदित्यैर मादयध्वं सजोषस रभवः पर्वतेभिः|	rejoice in full accord with the Ādityas in concord with the parvatas o Ṛbhus.
सजोषसो दैव्येना सवित्रा सजोषसः सिन्धुभी रत्नधेभिः|	in full accord with savitar divine one in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.
ये अश्विना ये पितरा य ऊती धेनुं ततक्षुर रभवो ये अश्वा|	Ṛbhus who helped their parents and the aśvins who formed the milchcow and the pair of horses.
ये अंसत्रा य रधग रोदसी ये विभ्वो नरः सवपत्यानि चक्रुः|	made armour set the heaven and earth asunderfar reaching heroes they have made good offspring.
ये गोमन्तं वाजवन्तं सुवीरं रयिं धत्थ वसुमन्तम पुरुक्षुम|	ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty in heroes in rich sustenance and treasure.
ते अग्रेपा रभवो मन्दसाना अस्मे धत्त ये च रातिं गर्णन्ति|	such o ye Ṛbhus first to drink rejoicing give unto us and those who laud our present.
नापाभूत न वो ऽतीत्र्षामानिःशस्ता रभवो यज्ञे अस्मिन|	ye were not far we have not left you thirsting blameless in this our sacrifice o Ṛbhus.
सम इन्द्रेण मदथ सम मरुद्भिः सं राजभी रत्नधेयाय देवाः|	rejoice you with the maruts and with indra with the kings gods that ye may give us riches.
अग्ने मर्ळ महां असि य ईम आ देवयुं जनम|	agni show favour great art thou who to this pious man art come.
इयेथ बर्हिर आसदम|	to seat thee on the sacred grass.
स मानुषीषु दूळभो विक्षु परावीर अमर्त्यः|	may he the immortal helper bard to be deceived among mankind.
दूतो विश्वेषाम भुवत|	become the messenger of all.
स सद्म परि णीयते होता मन्द्रो दिविष्टिषु|	around the altar is he led welcome chief priest at solemn rites.
उत पोता नि षीदति|	or as the potar sits him down.
उत गना अग्निर अध्वर उतो गर्हपतिर दमे|	agni in fire at sacrifice and in the house as lord thereof.
उत बरह्मा नि षीदति|	and as a brahman takes his seat.
वेषि हय अध्वरीयताम उपवक्ता जनानाम|	thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice.
हव्या च मानुषाणाम|	and to oblations brought by men.
वेषीद व अस्य दूत्यं यस्य जुजोषो अध्वरम|	thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well.
हव्यम मर्तस्य वोळ्हवे|	to bear the mortals gifts to heaven.
अस्माकं जोष्य अध्वरम अस्माकं यज्ञम अङगिरः|	accept our solemn rite be pleased aṅgiras with our sacrifice.
अस्माकं शर्णुधी हवम|	give ear and listen to our call.
परि ते दूळभो रथो ऽसमां अश्नोतु विश्वतः|	may thine inviolable car wherewith thou guardest those who give.
येन रक्षसि दाशुषः|	come near to us from every side.
कर्णुष्व पाजः परसितिं न पर्थ्वीं याहि राजेवामवां इभेन|	put forth like a widespreading net thy vigour go like a mighty king with his attendants.
तर्ष्वीम अनु परसितिं दरूणानो ऽसतासि विध्य रक्षसस तपिष्ठैः|	thou following thy swift net shootest arrows transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.
तव भरमास आशुया पतन्त्य अनु सप्र्श धर्षता शोशुचानः|	forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons follow them closely glowing in thy fury.
तपूंष्य अग्ने जुह्वा पतंगान असंदितो वि सर्ज विष्वग उल्काः|	spread with thy tongue the winged flames o agni unfettered cast thy firebrands all around thee.
परति सपशो वि सर्ज तूर्णितमो भवा पायुर विशो अस्या अदब्धः|	send thy spies forward fleetest in thy motion be neer deceived the guardian of this people.
यो नो दूरे अघशंसो यो अन्त्य अग्ने माकिष टे वयथिर आ दधर्षीत|	from him who near or far is bent on evil and let no trouble sent from thee oercome us.
उद अग्ने तिष्ठ परत्य आ तनुष्व नय अमित्रां ओषतात तिग्महेते|	rise up o agni spread thee out before us burn down our foes thou who hast sharpened arrows.
यो नो अरातिं समिधान चक्रे नीचा तं धक्ष्य अतसं न शुष्कम|	him blazing agni who hath worked us mischief consume thou utterly like driedup stubble.
ऊर्ध्वो भव परति विध्याध्य अस्मद आविष कर्णुष्व दैव्यान्य अग्ने|	rise agni drive off those who fight against us make manifest thine own celestial vigour.
अव सथिरा तनुहि यातुजूनां जामिम अजामिम पर मर्णीहि शत्रून|	slacken the strong bows of the demondriven destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.
स ते जानाति सुमतिं यविष्ठ य ईवते बरह्मणे गातुम ऐरत|	most youthful god he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion.
विश्वान्य अस्मै सुदिनानि रायो दयुम्नान्य अर्यो वि दुरो अभि दयौत|	all fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good mans portals.
सेद अग्ने अस्तु सुभगः सुदानुर यस तवा नित्येन हविषा य उक्थैः|	blest agni be the man the liberal giver who with his lauds and regular oblation.
पिप्रीषति सव आयुषि दुरोणे विश्वेद अस्मै सुदिना सासद इष्टिः|	is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling may all his days be bright be this his longing.
अर्चामि ते सुमतिं घोष्य अर्वाक सं ते वावाता जरताम इयं गीः|	i praise thy gracious favour sing in answer may this my song sing like a loved one with thee.
सवश्वास तवा सुरथा मर्जयेमास्मे कषत्राणि धारयेर अनु दयून|	lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.
इह तवा भूर्य आ चरेद उप तमन दोषावस्तर दीदिवांसम अनु दयून|	here of free choice let each one serve thee richly resplendent day by day at eve and morning.
करीळन्तस तवा सुमनसः सपेमाभि दयुम्ना तस्थिवांसो जनानाम|	so may we honour thee content and joyous passing beyond the glories of the people.
यस तवा सवश्वः सुहिरण्यो अग्न उपयाति वसुमता रथेन|	whoso with good steeds and fine gold o agni comes nigh thee on a car laden with treasure.
तस्य तराता भवसि तस्य सखा यस त आतिथ्यम आनुषग जुजोषत|	his friend art thou yea thou art his protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.
महो रुजामि बन्धुता वचोभिस तन मा पितुर गोतमाद अन्व इयाय|	through words and kinship i destroy the mighty this power i have from gotama my father.
तवं नो अस्य वचसश चिकिद्धि होतर यविष्ठ सुक्रतो दमूनाः|	mark thou this speech of ours o thou most youthful friend of the house exceeding wise invoker.
अस्वप्नजस तरणयः सुशेवा अतन्द्रासो ऽवर्का अश्रमिष्ठाः|	knowing no slumber speedy and propitious alert and ever friendly most unwearied.
ते पायवः सध्र्यञ्चो निषद्याग्ने तव नः पान्त्व अमूर|	may thy protecting powers unerring agni taking their places here combined preserve us.
ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरिताद अरक्षन|	thy guardian rays o agni when they saw him preserved blind māmateya from affliction.
ररक्ष तान सुक्र्तो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद रिपवो नाह देभुः|	lord of all riches he preserved the pious the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief.
तवया वयं सधन्यस तवोतास तव परणीत्य अश्याम वाजान|	aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward.
उभा शंसा सूदय सत्यताते ऽनुष्ठुया कर्णुह्य अह्रयाण|	fulfil the words of both o ever truthful straightway do this thou god whom power emboldens.
अया ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम परति सतोमं शस्यमानं गर्भाय|	o agni with this fuel will we serve thee accept the laud we sing to thee with favour.
दहाशसो रक्षसः पाह्य अस्मान दरुहो निदो मित्रमहो अवद्यात|	destroy the cursing rākṣasas preserve us o rich in friends from guile and scorn and slander.
आ सत्यो यातु मघवां रजीषी दरवन्त्व अस्य हरय उप नः|	impetuous true let maghavan come hither and let his tawny coursers speed to reach us.
तस्मा इद अन्धः सुषुमा सुदक्षम इहाभिपित्वं करते गर्णानः|	for him have we pressed juice exceeding potent here praised with song let him effect his visit.
अव सय शूराध्वनो नान्ते ऽसमिन नो अद्य सवने मन्दध्यै|	unyoke as at thy journeys end o hero to gladden thee today at this libation.
शंसात्य उक्थम उशनेव वेधाश चिकितुषे असुर्याय मन्म|	like uśanā the priest a laud shall utter a hymn to thee the lord divine who markest.
कविर न निण्यं विदथानि साधन वर्षा यत सेकं विपिपानो अर्चात|	when the bull quaffing praises our libation as a sage paying holy rites in secret.
दिव इत्था जीजनत सप्त कारून अह्ना चिच चक्रुर वयुना गर्णन्तः|	seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten who een by day have wrought their works while singing.
सवर यद वेदि सुद्र्शीकम अर्कैर महि जयोती रुरुचुर यद ध वस्तोः|	when heavens fair light by hymns was made apparent they made great splendour shine at break of morning.
अन्धा तमांसि दुधिता विचक्षे नर्भ्यश चकार नर्तमो अभिष्टौ|	he with his succour best of heroes scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.
ववक्ष इन्द्रो अमितम रजीष्य उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा|	indra impetuous one hath waxed immensely he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven.
अतश चिद अस्य महिमा वि रेच्य अभि यो विश्वा भुवना बभूव|	een beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.
विश्वानि शक्रो नर्याणि विद्वान अपो रिरेच सखिभिर निकामैः|	Śakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager friends let loose the waters.
अश्मानं चिद ये बिभिदुर वचोभिर वरजं गोमन्तम उशिजो वि वव्रुः|	they with their songs cleft een the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.
अपो वर्त्रं वव्रिवांसम पराहन परावत ते वज्रम पर्थिवी सचेताः|	he smote away the floods obstructer vṛtra earth conscious lent her aid to speed thy thunder.
परार्णांसि समुद्रियाण्य ऐनोः पतिर भवञ छवसा शूर धर्ष्णो|	thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean as lord through power and might o daring hero.
अपो यद अद्रिम पुरुहूत दर्दर आविर भुवत सरमा पूर्व्यं ते|	when muchinvoked the waters rock thou cleftest saramā showed herself and went before thee.
स नो नेता वाजम आ दर्षि भूरिं गोत्रा रुजन्न अङगिरोभिर गर्णानः|	hymned by aṅgirases bursting the cowstalls much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.
अछा कविं नर्मणो गा अभिष्टौ सवर्षाता मघवन नाधमानम|	come maghavan friend of man to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight.
ऊतिभिस तम इषणो दयुम्नहूतौ नि मायावान अब्रह्मा दस्युर अर्त|	speed him with help in his inspired invokings down sink the sorcerer the prayerless dasyu.
आ दस्युघ्ना मनसा याह्य अस्तम भुवत ते कुत्सः सख्ये निकामः|	come to our home resolved to slay the dasyu kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship.
सवे योनौ नि षदतं सरूपा वि वां चिकित्सद रतचिद ध नारी|	alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful lady was in doubt between you.
यासि कुत्सेन सरथम अवस्युस तोदो वातस्य हर्योर ईशानः|	thou comest fain to succour him with kutsaa goad that masters both the windgods horses.
रज्रा वाजं न गध्यं युयूषन कविर यद अहन पार्याय भूषात|	that holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture the sage may on the final day be present.
कुत्साय शुष्णम अशुषं नि बर्हीः परपित्वे अह्नः कुयवं सहस्रा|	for kutsa with thy thousand thou at daybreak didst hurl down greedy Śuṣṇa foe of harvest.
सद्यो दस्यून पर मर्ण कुत्स्येन पर सूरश चक्रं वर्हताद अभीके|	quickly with kutsas friend destroy the dasyus and roll the chariotwheel of sūrya near us.
तवम पिप्रुम मर्गयं शूशुवांसम रजिश्वने वैदथिनाय रन्धीः|	thou to the son of vidathin Ṛjiśvan gavest up mighty mṛgaya and pipru.
पञ्चाशत कर्ष्णा नि वपः सहस्रात्कं न पुरो जरिमा वि दर्दः|	thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.
सूर उपाके तन्वं दधानो वि यत ते चेत्य अम्र्तस्य वर्पः|	what time thou settest near the sun thy body thy form immortal one is seen expanding.
मर्गो न हस्ती तविषीम उषाणः सिंहो न भीम आयुधानि बिभ्रत|	thou a wild elephant with might invested like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.
इन्द्रं कामा वसूयन्तो अग्मन सवर्मीळ्हे न सवने चकानाः|	wishes for wealth have gone to indra longing for him in war for light and at libation.
शरवस्यवः शशमानास उक्थैर ओको न रण्वा सुद्र्शीव पुष्टिः|	eager for glory labouring with praisesongs he is like home like sweet and fair nutrition.
तम इद व इन्द्रं सुहवं हुवेम यस ता चकार नर्या पुरूणि|	call we for you that indra prompt to listen him who hath done so much for mens advantage.
यो मावते जरित्रे गध्यं चिन मक्षू वाजम भरति सपार्हराधाः|	who lord of envied bounty to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.
तिग्मा यद अन्तर अशनिः पताति कस्मिञ चिच छूर मुहुके जनानाम|	when the sharppointed arrow o thou hero flieth mid any conflict of the people.
घोरा यद अर्य सम्र्तिर भवात्य अध समा नस तन्वो बोधि गोपाः|	when faithful one the dread encounter cometh then be thou the protector of our body.
भुवो ऽविता वामदेवस्य धीनाम भुवः सखाव्र्को वाजसातौ|	further the holy thoughts of vamadeva be thou a guileless friend in fight for booty.
तवाम अनु परमतिम आ जगन्मोरुशंसो जरित्रे विश्वध सयाः|	we come to thee whose providence protects us wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.
एभिर नर्भिर इन्द्र तवायुभिष टवा मघवद्भिर मघवन विश्व आजौ|	o indra with these men who love thee truly free givers maghavan in every battle.
दयावो न दयुम्नैर अभि सन्तो अर्यः कषपो मदेम शरदश च पूर्वीः|	may we rejoice through many autumns quelling our foes as days subdue the nights with splendour.
एवेद इन्द्राय वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे बरह्माकर्म भर्गवो न रथम|	now as the bhṛgus wrought a car for indra the strong the mighty we our prayer have fashioned.
नू चिद यथा नः सख्या वियोषद असन न उग्रो ऽविता तनूपाः|	that he may neer withdraw from us his friendship but be our bodies guard and strong defender.
नू षटुत इन्द्र नू गर्णान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः|	now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
अकारि ते हरिवो बरह्म नव्यं धिया सयाम रथ्यः सदासाः|	for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
आशुं दधिक्रां तम उ नु षटवाम दिवस पर्थिव्या उत चर्किराम|	now give we praise to dadhikrās the rapid and mention in our laud the earth and heaven.
उछन्तीर माम उषसः सूदयन्त्व अति विश्वानि दुरितानि पर्षन|	may the dawns flushing move me to exertion and bear me safely over every trouble.
महश चर्कर्म्य अर्वतः करतुप्रा दधिक्राव्णः पुरुवारस्य वर्ष्णः|	i praise the mighty steed who fills my spirit the stallion dadhikrāvan rich in bounties.
यम पूरुभ्यो दीदिवांसं नाग्निं ददथुर मित्रावरुणा ततुरिम|	whom swift of foot and shining bright as agni ye varuṇa and mitra gave to pūrus.
यो अश्वस्य दधिक्राव्णो अकारीत समिद्धे अग्ना उषसो वयुष्टौ|	him who hath honoured when the flame is kindled at break of dawn the courser dadhikrāvan.
अनागसं तम अदितिः कर्णोतु स मित्रेण वरुणेना सजोषाः|	him of one mind with varuṇa and mitra may aditi make free from all transgression.
दधिक्राव्ण इष ऊर्जो महो यद अमन्महि मरुतां नाम भद्रम|	when we remember mighty dadhikrāvan our food and strength then the blest name of maruts.
सवस्तये वरुणम मित्रम अग्निं हवामह इन्द्रं वज्रबाहुम|	varuṇa mitra we invoke for welfare and agni and the thunderwielding indra.
इन्द्रम इवेद उभये वि हवयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञम उपप्रयन्तः|	both sides invoke him as they call on indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing.
दधिक्राम उ सूदनम मर्त्याय ददथुर मित्रावरुणा नो अश्वम|	to us have varuṇa and mitra granted the courser dadhikrās a guide for mortals.
दधिक्राव्णो अकारिषं जिष्णोर अश्वस्य वाजिनः|	so have i glorified with praise strong dadhikrāvan conquering steed.
सुरभि नो मुखा करत पर ण आयूंषि तारिषत|	sweet may he make our mouths may he prolong the days we have to live.
अयम इह परथमो धायि धात्र्भिर होता यजिष्ठो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यः|	here by ordainers was this god appointed first invoker best at worship to be praised at rites.
यम अप्नवानो भर्गवो विरुरुचुर वनेषु चित्रं विभ्वं विशेविशे|	whom apnavāna and the bhṛgus caused to shine brightcoloured in the wood spreading from home to home.
अग्ने कदा त आनुषग भुवद देवस्य चेतनम|	when shall thy glory as a god agni be suddenly shown forth.
अधा हि तवा जग्र्भ्रिरे मर्तासो विक्ष्व ईड्यम|	for mortal men have held thee fast adorable in all their homes.
रतावानं विचेतसम पश्यन्तो दयाम इव सत्र्भिः|	seeing thee faithful to the law most sapient like the starry heaven.
विश्वेषाम अध्वराणां हस्कर्तारं दमेदमे|	illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.
आशुं दूतं विवस्वतो विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभि|	vivasvāns envoy living men have taken as their ensign swift.
आ जभ्रुः केतुम आयवो भर्गवाणं विशेविशे|	the ruler over all mankind moving like bhṛgu in each home.
तम ईं होतारम आनुषक चिकित्वांसं नि षेदिरे|	him the intelligent have they placed duly as invoking priest.
रण्वम पावकशोचिषं यजिष्ठं सप्त धामभिः|	welcome with sanctifying flame best worshipper with sevenfold might.
तं शश्वतीषु मात्र्षु वन आ वीतम अश्रितम|	in his eternal mothers in the wood concealed and unapproached.
चित्रं सन्तं गुहा हितं सुवेदं कूचिदर्थिनम|	kept secret though his flames are bright seeking on all sides quickly found.
ससस्य यद वियुता सस्मिन्न ऊधन्न रतस्य धामन रणयन्त देवाः|	that as food spreads forth in this earthly udder gods may rejoice them in the home of order.
महां अग्निर नमसा रातहव्यो वेर अध्वराय सदम इद रतावा|	great agni served with reverence and oblation flies ever to the sacrifice the faithful.
वेर अध्वरस्य दूत्यानि विद्वान उभे अन्ता रोदसी संचिकित्वान|	bird of each rite skilled in an envoys duties knowing both worlds and that which lies between them.
दूत ईयसे परदिव उराणो विदुष्टरो दिव आरोधनानि|	thou goest from of old a willing herald knowing full well heavens innermost recesses.
कर्ष्णं त एम रुशतः पुरो भाश चरिष्ण्व अर्चिर वपुषाम इद एकम|	bright god thy path is black light is before thee thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders.
यद अप्रवीता दधते ह गर्भं सद्यश चिज जातो भवसीद उ दूतः|	when she yet unimpregnate hath conceived thee even when newly born thou art an envoy.
सद्यो जातस्य दद्र्शानम ओजो यद अस्य वातो अनुवाति शोचिः|	yet newly born his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour.
वर्णक्ति तिग्माम अतसेषु जिह्वां सथिरा चिद अन्ना दयते वि जम्भैः|	his sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood and with his teeth een solid food consumeth.
तर्षु यद अन्ना तर्षुणा ववक्ष तर्षुं दूतं कर्णुते यह्वो अग्निः|	when he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly strong agni makes himself a speedy envoy.
वातस्य मेळिं सचते निजूर्वन्न आशुं न वाजयते हिन्वे अर्वा|	follows the rustling of the wind consuming and courserlike speeds drives the swift horse onward.
अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुर उक्थ्यो रथस तरिचक्रः परि वर्तते रजः|	the car that was not made for horses or for reins threewheeled worthy of lauds rolls round the firmament.
महत तद वो देव्यस्य परवाचनं दयाम रभवः पर्थिवीं यच च पुष्यथ|	that is the great announcement of your deity that o ye Ṛbhus ye sustain the earth and heaven.
रथं ये चक्रुः सुव्र्तं सुचेतसो ऽविह्वरन्तम मनसस परि धयया|	ye sapient ones who made the lightlyrolling car out of your mind by thought the car that never errs.
तां ऊ नव अस्य सवनस्य पीतय आ वो वाजा रभवो वेदयामसि|	you being such to drink of this drinkoffering you o ye vājas and ye Ṛbhus we invoke.
तद वो वाजा रभवः सुप्रवाचनं देवेषु विभ्वो अभवन महित्वनम|	o vājas Ṛbhus reaching far among the gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared.
जिव्री यत सन्ता पितरा सनाजुरा पुनर युवाना चरथाय तक्षथ|	in that your aged parents worn with length of days ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.
एकं वि चक्र चमसं चतुर्वयं निश चर्मणो गाम अरिणीत धीतिभिः|	the chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold and by your wisdom brought the cow forth from the hide.
अथा देवेष्व अम्र्तत्वम आनश शरुष्टी वाजा रभवस तद व उक्थ्यम|	so quickly mid the gods ye gained immortal life vājas and Ṛbhus your great work must be extolled.
रभुतो रयिः परथमश्रवस्तमो वाजश्रुतासो यम अजीजनन नरः|	wealth from the Ṛbhus is most glorious in renown that which the heroes famed for vigour have produced.
विभ्वतष्टो विदथेषु परवाच्यो यं देवासो ऽवथा स विचर्षणिः|	in synods must be sung the car which vibhvan wrought that which ye favour gods is famed among mankind.
स वाज्य अर्वा स रषिर वचस्यया स शूरो अस्ता पर्तनासु दुष्टरः|	strong is the steed the man a sage in eloquence the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight.
स रायस पोषं स सुवीर्यं दधे यं वाजो विभ्वां रभवो यम आविषुः|	great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom vāja vibhvan Ṛbhus have looked kindly on.
शरेष्ठं वः पेशो अधि धायि दर्शतं सतोमो वाजा रभवस तं जुजुष्टन|	to you hath been assigned the fairest ornament the hymn of praise vājas and Ṛbhus joy therein.
धीरासो हि षठा कवयो विपश्चितस तान व एना बरह्मणा वेदयामसि|	for ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill as such with this our prayer we call on you to come.
यूयम अस्मभ्यं धिषणाभ्यस परि विद्वांसो विश्वा नर्याणि भोजना|	according to the wishes of our hearts may ye who have full knowledge of all the delights of men.
दयुमन्तं वाजं वर्षशुष्मम उत्तमम आ नो रयिम रभवस तक्षता वयः|	fashion for us o Ṛbhus power and splendid wealth rich in high courage excellent and vital strength.
इह परजाम इह रयिं रराणा इह शरवो वीरवत तक्षता नः|	bestowing on us here riches and offspring here fashion fame for us befitting heroes.
येन वयं चितयेमात्य अन्यान तं वाजं चित्रम रभवो ददा नः|	vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort o Ṛbhus that we may make us more renowned than others.
ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु णो अध्वरस्य होतर अग्ने तिष्ठ देवताता यजीयान|	priest of our rite stand up erect o agni in the gods service best of sacrificers.
तवं हि विश्वम अभ्य असि मन्म पर वेधसश चित तिरसि मनीषाम|	for over evei y thought thou art the ruler thou furtherest een the wisdom of the pious.
अमूरो होता नय असादि विक्ष्व अग्निर मन्द्रो विदथेषु परचेताः|	he was set down mid men as priest unerring agni wise welcome in our holy synods.
ऊर्ध्वम भानुं सवितेवाश्रेन मेतेव धूमं सतभायद उप दयाम|	like savitar he hath lifted up his splendour and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.
यता सुजूर्णी रातिनी घर्ताची परदक्षिणिद देवतातिम उराणः|	the glowing ladle filled with oil is lifted choosing gods service to the right he circles.
उद उ सवरुर नवजा नाक्रः पश्वो अनक्ति सुधितः सुमेकः|	eager he rises like the newwrought pillar which firmly set and fixed anoints the victims.
सतीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्ना ऊर्ध्वो अध्वर्युर जुजुषाणो अस्थात|	when sacred grass is strewn and agni kindled the adhvaryu rises to his task rejoicing.
पर्य अग्निः पशुपा न होता तरिविष्ट्य एति परदिव उराणः|	agni the priest like one who tends the cattle goes three times round as from of old he wills it.
परि तमना मितद्रुर एति होताग्निर मन्द्रो मधुवचा रतावा|	agni himself the priest with measured motion goes round with sweet speech cheerful true to order.
दरवन्त्य अस्य वाजिनो न शोका भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना यद अभ्राट|	his fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.
भद्रा ते अग्ने सवनीक संद्र्ग घोरस्य सतो विषुणस्य चारुः|	beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect o lovely agni terrible when spreading.
न यत ते शोचिस तमसा वरन्त न धवस्मानस तन्व रेप आ धुः|	thy splendours are not covered by the darkness detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.
न यस्य सातुर जनितोर अवारि न मातरापितरा नू चिद इष्टौ|	naught hindered his production bounteous giver his mother and his sire were free to send him.
अधा मित्रो न सुधितः पावको ऽगनिर दीदाय मानुषीषु विक्षु|	then as friend benevolent refulgent agni shone forth in human habitations.
दविर यम पञ्च जीजनन संवसानाः सवसारो अग्निम मानुषीषु विक्षु|	he agni whom the twicefive sisters dwelling together in the homes of men engendered.
उषर्बुधम अथर्यो न दन्तं शुक्रं सवासम परशुं न तिग्मम|	bright like a spears tooth wakened in the morning with powerful mouth and like an axe wellsharpened.
तव तये अग्ने हरितो घर्तस्ना रोहितास रज्वञ्चः सवञ्चः|	these thy bay coursers agni dropping fatness ruddy vigorous speeding straightly forward.
अरुषासो वर्षण रजुमुष्का आ देवतातिम अह्वन्त दस्माः|	and red steeds wonderful of mighty muscle are to this service of the gods invited.
ये ह तये ते सहमाना अयासस तवेषासो अग्ने अर्चयश चरन्ति|	these brightlyshining games of thine o agni that move for ever restless allsubduing.
शयेनासो न दुवसनासो अर्थं तुविष्वणसो मारुतं न शर्धः|	like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry roar loudly like the army of the maruts.
अकारि बरह्म समिधान तुभ्यं शंसात्य उक्थं यजते वय  धाः|	to thee o flaming god hath prayer been offered let the priest laud thee give to him who worships.
होतारम अग्निम मनुषो नि षेदुर नमस्यन्त उशिजः शंसम आयोः|	men have established agni as invoker fain to adore the glory of the living.
दूतं वो विश्ववेदसं हव्यवाहम अमर्त्यम|	your envoy who possesses all immortal bearer of your gifts.
यजिष्ठम रञ्जसे गिरा|	best worshipper i woo with song.
स हि वेदा वसुधितिम महां आरोधनं दिवः|	he mighty knows the gift of wealth he knows the deep recess of heaven.
स देवां एह वक्षति|	he shall bring hitherward the gods.
स वेद देव आनमं देवां रतायते दमे|	he knows a god himself to guide gods to the righteous in his home.
दाति परियाणि चिद वसु|	he gives een treasures that we love.
स होता सेद उ दूत्यं चिकित्वां अन्तर ईयते|	he is the herald wellinformed he doth his errand to and fro.
विद्वां आरोधनं दिवः|	knowing the deep recess of heaven.
ते सयाम ये अग्नये ददाशुर हव्यदातिभिः|	may we be they who gratify agni with sacrificial gifts.
य ईम पुष्यन्त इन्धते|	who cherish and enkindle him.
ते राया ते सुवीर्यैः ससवांसो वि शर्ण्विरे|	illustrious for wealth are they and hero deeds victorious.
ये अग्ना दधिरे दुवः|	who have served agni reverently.
अस्मे रायो दिवेदिवे सं चरन्तु पुरुस्प्र्हः|	so unto us day after day may riches craved by many come.
अस्मे वाजास ईरताम|	and power and might spring up for us.
स विप्रश चर्षणीनां शवसा मानुषाणाम|	that holy singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than.
अति कषिप्रेव विध्यति|	the swift shafts of the tribes of men.
तवा युजा तव तत सोम सख्य इन्द्रो अपो मनवे सस्रुतस कः|	allied with thee in this thy friendship soma indra for man made waters flow together.
अहन्न अहिम अरिणात सप्त सिन्धून अपाव्र्णोद अपिहितेव खानि|	slew ahi and sent forth the seven rivers and opened as it were obstructed fountains.
तवा युजा नि खिदत सूर्यस्येन्द्रश चक्रं सहसा सद्य इन्दो|	indu with thee for his confederate indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of sūrya.
अधि षणुना बर्हता वर्तमानम महो दरुहो अप विश्वायु धायि|	what rolled all lifes support on heavens high summit was separated from the great oppressor.
अहन्न इन्द्रो अदहद अग्निर इन्दो पुरा दस्यून मध्यंदिनाद अभीके|	indra smote down agni consumed o indu the dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict.
दुर्गे दुरोणे करत्वा न याताम पुरू सहस्रा शर्वा नि बर्हीत|	of those who gladly sought a hardwon dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.
विश्वस्मात सीम अधमां इन्द्र दस्यून विशो दासीर अक्र्णोर अप्रशस्ताः|	lower than all besides hast thou o indra cast down the dasyus abject tribes of dāsas.
अबाधेथाम अम्र्णतं नि शत्रून अविन्देथाम अपचितिं वधत्रैः|	ye drave away ye put to death the foemen and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.
एवा सत्यम मघवाना युवं तद इन्द्रश च सोमोर्वम अश्व्यं गोः|	so of a truth indra and soma heroes ye burst the stable of the kine and horses.
आदर्द्र्तम अपिहितान्य अश्ना रिरिचथुः कषाश चित तत्र्दाना|	the stable which the bar or stone obstructed and piercing through set free the habitations.
उतो हि वां दात्रा सन्ति पूर्वा या पूरुभ्यस तरसदस्युर नितोशे|	from you two came the gifts in days aforetime which trasadasyu granted to the pūrus.
कषेत्रासां ददथुर उर्वरासां घनं दस्युभ्यो अभिभूतिम उग्रम|	ye gave the winner of our fields and ploughlands and the strong smiter who subdued the dasyus.
उत वाजिनम पुरुनिष्षिध्वानं दधिक्राम उ ददथुर विश्वक्र्ष्टिम|	and ye gave mighty dadhikrās the giver of many gifts who visiteth all people.
रजिप्यं शयेनम परुषितप्सुम आशुं चर्क्र्त्यम अर्यो नर्पतिं न शूरम|	impetuous hawk swift and of varied colour like a brave king whom each true man must honour.
यं सीम अनु परवतेव दरवन्तं विश्वः पूरुर मदति हर्षमाणः|	whom as twere down a precipice swift rushing each pūru praises and his heart rejoices.
पड्भिर गर्ध्यन्तम मेधयुं न शूरं रथतुरं वातम इव धरजन्तम|	springing forth like a hero fain for battle whirling the car and flying like the tempest.
यः समारुन्धानो गध्या समत्सु सनुतरश चरति गोषु गछन|	who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth winning spoil among the cattle.
आविर्र्जीको विदथा निचिक्यत तिरो अरतिम पर्य आप आयोः|	shown in bright colour looking on the assemblies beyond the churl to worship of the living.
उत समैनं वस्त्रमथिं न तायुम अनु करोशन्ति कषितयो भरेषु|	loudly the folk cry after him in battles as twere a thief who steals away a garment.
नीचायमानं जसुरिं न शयेनं शरवश चाछा पशुमच च यूथम|	speeding to glory or a herd of cattle even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.
उत समासु परथमः सरिष्यन नि वेवेति शरेणिभी रथानाम|	and fain to come forth first amid these armies this way and that with rows of cars he rushes.
सरजं कर्ण्वानो जन्यो न शुभ्वा रेणुं रेरिहत किरणं ददश्वान|	gay like a bridesman making him a garland tossing the dust champing the rein that holds him.
उत सय वाजी सहुरिर रतावा शुश्रूषमाणस तन्वा समर्ये|	and that strong steed victorious and faithful obedient with his body in the combat.
तुरं यतीषु तुरयन्न रजिप्यो ऽधि भरुवोः किरते रेणुम रञ्जन|	speeding straight on amid the swiftly pressing casts oer his brows the dust he tosses upward.
उत समास्य तन्यतोर इव दयोर रघायतो अभियुजो भयन्ते|	and at his thunder like the roar of heaven those who attack tremble and are affrighted.
यदा सहस्रम अभि षीम अयोधीद दुर्वर्तुः समा भवति भीम रञ्जन|	for when he fights against embattled thousands dread is he in his striving none may stay him.
उत समास्य पनयन्ति जना जूतिं कर्ष्टिप्रो अभिभूतिम आशोः|	the people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet steed who giveth men abundance.
उतैनम आहुः समिथे वियन्तः परा दधिक्रा असरत सहस्रैः|	of him they say when drawing back from battle dadhikrās hath sped forward with his thousands.
आ दधिक्राः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इव जयोतिषापस ततान|	dadhikrās hath oerspread the fivefold people with vigour as the sun lightens the waters.
सहस्रसाः शतसा वाज्य अर्वा पर्णक्तु मध्वा सम इमा वचांसि|	may the strong steed who winneth hundreds thousands requite with sweetness these my words and praises.
अग्निर होता नो अध्वरे वाजी सन परि णीयते|	agni the herald like a horse is led forth at our solemn rite.
देवो देवेषु यज्ञियः|	god among gods adorable.
परि तरिविष्ट्य अध्वरं यात्य अग्नी रथीर इव|	three times unto our solemn rite comes agni like a charioteer.
आ देवेषु परयो दधत|	bearing the viands to the gods.
परि वाजपतिः कविर अग्निर हव्यान्य अक्रमीत|	round the oblations hath he paced agni the wise the lord of strength.
दधद रत्नानि दाशुषे|	giving the offerer precious boons.
अयं यः सर्ञ्जये पुरो दैववाते समिध्यते|	he who is kindled eastward for sṛñjaya devāvatas son.
दयुमां अमित्रदम्भनः|	resplendent tamer of the foe.
अस्य घा वीर ईवतो ऽगनेर ईशीत मर्त्यः|	so mighty be the agni whom the mortal hero shall command.
तिग्मजम्भस्य मीळ्हुषः|	with sharpened teeth and bountiful.
तम अर्वन्तं न सानसिम अरुषं न दिवः शिशुम|	day after day they dress him as they clean a horse who wins the prize.
मर्म्र्ज्यन्ते दिवेदिवे|	dress the red scion of the sky.
बोधद यन मा हरिभ्यां कुमारः साहदेव्यः|	when sahadevas princely son with two bay horses thought of me.
अछा न हूत उद अरम|	summoned by him i drew not back.
उत तया यजता हरी कुमारात साहदेव्यात|	and truly those two noble bays i straightway took when offered me.
परयता सद्य आ ददे|	from sahadevas princely son.
एष वां देवाव अश्विना कुमारः साहदेव्यः|	long o ye aśvins may he live your care ye gods the princely son.
दीर्घायुर अस्तु सोमकः|	of sahadeva somaka.
तं युवं देवाव अश्विना कुमारं साहदेव्यम|	cause him the youthful prince the son of sahadeva to enjoy.
दीर्घायुषं कर्णोतन|	long life o aśvins o ye gods.
अयम पन्था अनुवित्तः पुराणो यतो देवा उदजायन्त विश्वे|	this is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all gods have come into existence.
अतश चिद आ जनिषीष्ट परव्र्द्धो मा मातरम अमुया पत्तवे कः|	hereby could one be born though waxen mighty let him not otherwise destroy his mother.
नाहम अतो निर अया दुर्गहैतत तिरश्चता पार्श्वान निर गमाणि|	not this way go i forth hard is the passage forth from the side obliquely will i issue.
बहूनि मे अक्र्ता कर्त्वानि युध्यै तवेन सं तवेन पर्छै|	much that is yet undone must i accomplish one must i combat and the other question.
परायतीम मातरम अन्व अचष्ट न नानु गान्य अनु नू गमानि|	he bent his eye upon the dying mother my word i now withdraw that way i follow.
तवष्टुर गर्हे अपिबत सोमम इन्द्रः शतधन्यं चम्वोः सुतस्य|	in tvaṣṭars dwelling india drank the soma a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.
किं स रधक कर्णवद यं सहस्रम मासो जभार शरदश च पूर्वीः|	what strange act shall he do he whom his mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns.
नही नव अस्य परतिमानम अस्त्य अन्तर जातेषूत ये जनित्वाः|	no peer hath he among those born already nor among those who shall be born hereafter.
अवद्यम इव मन्यमाना गुहाकर इन्द्रम माता वीर्येणा नयॄष्टम|	deeming him a reproach his mother hid him indra endowed with all heroic valour.
अथोद अस्थात सवयम अत्कं वसान आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज जायमानः|	then up he sprang himself assumed his vesture and filled as soon as born the earth and heaven.
एता अर्षन्त्य अललाभवन्तीर रतावरीर इव संक्रोशमानाः|	with lively motion onward flow these waters the holy ones shouting as twere together.
एता वि पर्छ किम इदम भनन्ति कम आपो अद्रिम परिधिं रुजन्ति|	ask them to tell thee what the floods are saying what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.
किम उ षविद अस्मै निविदो भनन्तेन्द्रस्यावद्यं दिधिषन्त आपः|	are they addressing him with words of welcome will the floods take on them the shame of indra.
ममैतान पुत्रो महता वधेन वर्त्रं जघन्वां अस्र्जद वि सिन्धून|	with his great thunderbolt my son hath slaughtered vṛtra and set these rivers free to wander.
ममच चन तवा युवतिः परास ममच चन तवा कुषवा जगार|	i cast thee from me minethy youthful mother thee mine own offspring kusava hath swallowed.
ममच चिद आपः शिशवे मम्र्ड्युर ममच चिद इन्द्रः सहसोद अतिष्ठत|	to him mine infant were the waters gracious indra my son rose up in conquering vigour.
ममच चन ते मघवन वयंसो निविविध्वां अप हनू जघान|	thou art mine own o maghavan whom vyaṁsa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces.
अधा निविद्ध उत्तरो बभूवाञ छिरो दासस्य सम पिणक वधेन|	but smitten through the mastery thou wonnest and with thy bolt the dāsas head thou crushedst.
गर्ष्टिः ससूव सथविरं तवागाम अनाध्र्ष्यं वर्षभं तुम्रम इन्द्रम|	the heifer hath brought forth the strong the mighty the unconquerable bull the furious indra.
अरीळ्हं वत्सं चरथाय माता सवयं गातुं तन्व इछमानम|	the mother left her unlicked calf to wander seeking himself the path that he would follow.
उत माता महिषम अन्व अवेनद अमी तवा जहति पुत्र देवाः|	then to her mighty child the mother turned her saying my son these deities forsake thee.
अथाब्रवीद वर्त्रम इन्द्रो हनिष्यन सखे विष्णो वितरं वि करमस्व|	then indra said about to slaughter vṛtra o my friend vṛtra stride full boldly forward.
कस ते मातरं विधवाम अचक्रच छयुं कस तवाम अजिघांसच चरन्तम|	who was he then who made thy mother widow who sought to stay thee lying still or moving.
कस ते देवो अधि मार्डीक आसीद यत पराक्षिणाः पितरम पादग्र्ह्य|	what god when by the foot thy sire thou tookest and slewest was at hand to give thee comfort.
अवर्त्या शुन आन्त्राणि पेचे न देवेषु विविदे मर्डितारम|	in deep distress i cooked a dogs intestines among the gods i found not one to comfort.
अपश्यं जायाम अमहीयमानाम अधा मे शयेनो मध्व आ जभार|	my consort i beheld in degradation the falcon then brought me the pleasant soma.
इदम उ तयत पुरुतमम पुरस्ताज जयोतिस तमसो वयुनावद अस्थात|	forth from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hatb mounted.
नूनं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर गातुं कर्णवन्न उषसो जनाय|	now verily the farrefulgent mornings daughters of heaven bring welfare to the people.
अस्थुर उ चित्रा उषसः पुरस्तान मिता इव सवरवो ऽधवरेषु|	the richlycoloured dawns have mounted eastward like pillars planted at our sacrifices.
वय ऊ वरजस्य तमसो दवारोछन्तीर अव्रञ छुचयः पावकाः|	and flushing far splendid and purifying unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.
उछन्तीर अद्य चितयन्त भोजान राधोदेयायोषसो मघोनीः|	dispelling gloom this day the wealthy mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures.
अचित्रे अन्तः पणयः ससन्त्व अबुध्यमानास तमसो विमध्ये|	in the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.
कुवित स देवीः सनयो नवो वा यामो बभूयाद उषसो वो अद्य|	o goddesses is this your car i ask you ancient this day or is it new ye mornings.
येना नवग्वे अङगिरे दशग्वे सप्तास्ये रेवती रेवद ऊष|	wherewith rich dawns ye seek with wealth navagva daśagva aṅgira the seventoned singer.
यूयं हि देवीर रतयुग्भिर अश्वैः परिप्रयाथ भुवनानि सद्यः|	with horses harnessed by eternal order goddesses swiftly round the worlds ye travel.
परबोधयन्तीर उषसः ससन्तं दविपाच चतुष्पाच चरथाय जीवम|	arousing from their rest o dawns the sleeping and all that lives man bird and beast to motion.
कव सविद आसां कतमा पुराणी यया विधाना विदधुर रभूणाम|	which among these is eldest and where is she through whom they fixed the Ṛbhus regulations.
शुभं यच छुभ्रा उषसश चरन्ति न वि जञायन्ते सद्र्शीर अजुर्याः|	what time the splendid dawns go forth for splendour they are not known apart alike unwasting.
ता घा ता भद्रा उषसः पुरासुर अभिष्टिद्युम्ना रतजातसत्याः|	blest were these dawns of old shining with succour true with the truth that springs from holy order.
यास्व ईजानः शशमान उक्थै सतुवञ छंसन दरविणं सद्य आप|	with whom the toiling worshipper by praises hymning and lauding soon attained to riches.
ता आ चरन्ति समना पुरस्तात समानतः समना पप्रथानाः|	hither from eastward all at once they travel from one place spreading in the selfsame manner.
रतस्य देवीः सदसो बुधाना गवां न सर्गा उषसो जरन्ते|	awaking from the seat of holy order the godlike dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.
ता इन नव एव समना समानीर अमीतवर्णा उषसश चरन्ति|	thus they go forth with undiminished colours these mornings similar in selfsame fashion.
गूहन्तीर अभ्वम असितं रुशद्भिः शुक्रास तनूभिः शुचयो रुचानाः|	concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.
रयिं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीः परजावन्तं यछतास्मासु देवीः|	o goddesses o heavens refulgent daughters bestow upon us wealth with store of children.
सयोनाद आ वः परतिबुध्यमानाः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः सयाम|	as from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.
तद वो दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर उप बरुव उषसो यज्ञकेतुः|	wellskilled in lore of sacrifice ye daughters of heaven refulgent dawns i thus address you.
वयं सयाम यशसो जनेषु तद दयौश च धत्ताम पर्थिवी च देवी|	may we be glorious among the people may heaven vouchsafe us this and earth the goddess.
का सुष्टुतिः शवसः सूनुम इन्द्रम अर्वाचीनं राधस आ ववर्तत|	what worthy praise will bring before us indra the son of strength that he may grant us riches.
ददिर हि वीरो गर्णते वसूनि स गोपतिर निष्षिधां नो जनासः|	for he the hero gives the singer treasures he is the lord who sends us gifts ye people.
स वर्त्रहत्ये हव्यः स ईड्यः स सुष्टुत इन्द्रः सत्यराधाः|	to be invoked and hymned in fight with vṛtra that wellpraised indra gives us real bounties.
