उप नो यातमश्विना राया विश्वपुषा सह|	with allsustaining opulence aśvins come hitherward to us.
मघवाना सुवीरावनपच्युता|	ye rich and noble heroes neer to be oerthrown.
आ मे अस्य परतीव्यमिन्द्रनासत्या गतम|	to welcome this mine offering o ye indralike nāsatyas come.
देवा देवेभिरद्य सचनस्तमा|	as gods of best accord this day with other gods.
वयं हि वां हवामह उक्षण्यन्तो वयश्ववत|	for we like vyaśva lifting up our voice like oxen call on you.
सुमतिभिरुप विप्राविहा गतम|	with all your loving kindness sages come to us.
अश्विना सव रषे सतुहि कुवित ते शरवतो हवम|	o Ṛṣi laud the aśvins well will they not listen to thy call.
नेदीयसः कूळयातः पणीन्रुत|	will they not burn the paṇis who are nearer them.
वैयश्वस्य शरुतं नरोतो मे अस्य वेदथः|	o heroes listen to the son of vyaśva and regard me here.
सजोषसा वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	varuṇa mitra aryaman of one accord.
युवादत्तस्य धिष्ण्या युवानीतस्य सूरिभिः|	gods whom we yearn for of your gifts of what ye bring to us bestow.
अहरअहर्व्र्षण मह्यं शिक्षतम|	by princes hands on me ye mighty day by day.
यो वां यज्ञेभिराव्र्तोअधिवस्त्र वधूरिव|	him whom your sacrifices clothe even as a woman with her robe.
सपर्यन्त शुभे चक्राते अश्विना|	the aśvins help to glory honouring him well.
यो वामुरुव्यचस्तमं चिकेतति नर्पाय्यम|	whoso regards your care of men as succour widest in its reach.
वर्तिरश्विना परि यातमस्मयू|	about his dwelling go ye aśvins loving us.
अस्मभ्यं सु वर्षण्वसू यातं वर्तिर्न्र्पय्यम|	come to us ye who pour down wealth come to the home which men must guard.
विषुद्रुहेव यज्ञमूहथुर्गिरा|	like shafts ye are made meet for sacrifice by song.
वाहिष्ठो वां हवानां सतोमो दूतो हुवन नरा|	most fetching of all calls the laud as envoy heroes called to you.
युवाभ्यां भूत्वश्विना|	be it your own o aśvin pair.
यददो दिवो अर्णव इषो व मदथो गर्हे|	be ye in yonder sea of heaven or joying in the home of food.
शरुतमिन मे अमर्त्या|	listen to me immortal ones.
उत सया शवेतयावरी वाहिष्ठा वां नदीनाम|	this river with his lucid flow attracts you more than all the streams.
सिन्धुर्हिरण्यवर्तनिः|	even sindhu with his path of gold.
समदेतय सुकीर्त्याश्विना शवेतया धिया|	o aśvins with that glorious fame come hither through our brilliant song.
वहेथे शुभ्रयावाना|	come ye whose ways are marked with light.
युक्ष्वा हि तवं रथासहा युवस्व पोष्या वसो|	harness the steeds who draw the car o vasu bring the wellfed pair.
आन नो वायो मधु पिबास्माकं सवना गहि|	o vāyu drink thou of our meath come unto our drinkofferings.
तव वायव रतस्पते तवष्टुर्जामातरद्भुत|	wonderful vāyu lord of right thou who art tvaṣṭars soninlaw.
अवांस्या वर्णीमहे|	thy saving succour we elect.
तवष्टुर्जामातरं वयमीशानं राय ईमहे|	to tvaṣṭars soninlaw we pray for wealth whereof he hath control.
सुतावन्तो वयुं दयुम्ना जनासः|	for glory we seek vayu men with juice effused.
वायो याहि शिवा दिवो वहस्व सु सवश्व्यम|	from heaven auspicious vāyu come drive hither with thy noble steeds.
वहस्व महःप्र्थुपक्षसा रथे|	come on thy mighty car with wideextending seat.
तवां हि सुप्सरस्तमं नर्षदनेषु हूमहे|	we call thee to the homes of men thee wealthiest in noble food.
गरावाणं नाश्वप्र्ष्ठं मंहना|	and liberal as a pressstone with a horses back.
स तवं नो देव मनसा वायो मन्दानो अग्रियः|	so glad and joyful in thine heart do thou god vāyu first of all.
कर्धि वाजानपो धियः|	vouchsafe us water strength and thought.
आ याहि सुषुमा हि त इन्द्र सोमं पिबा इमम|	come we have pressed the juice for thee o indra drink this soma here.
एदं बर्हिः सदो मम|	sit thou on this my sacred grass.
आ तवा बरह्मयुजा हरी वहतामिन्द्र केशिना|	o indra let thy longmaned bays yoked by prayer bring thee hitherward.
उप बरह्मणि नः शर्णु|	give car and listen to our prayers.
बरह्माणस्त्वा वयं युजा सोमपामिन्द्र सोमिनः|	we somabearing brahmans call thee somadrinker with thy friend.
सुतावन्तो हवामहे|	we indra bringing soma juice.
आ नो याहि सुतावतोअस्माकं सुष्टुतीरुप|	come unto us who bring the juice come unto this our eulogy.
पिबा सु शिप्रिन्नन्धसः|	fairvisored drink thou of the juice.
आ ते सिञ्चामि कुक्ष्योरनु गात्रा वि धावतु|	i pour it down within thee so through all thy members let it spread.
गर्भाय जिह्वया मधु|	take with thy tongue the pleasant drink.
सवादुष टे अस्तु संसुदे मधुमान तन्वे तव|	sweet to thy body let it be delicious be the savoury juice.
सोमः शमस्तु ते हर्दे|	sweet be the soma to thine heart.
अयमु तवा विचर्षणे जनीरिवाभि संव्र्तः|	like women let this somadraught invested with its robe approach.
पर सोम इन्द्र सर्पतु|	o active indra close to thee.
तुविग्रीवो वपोदरः सुबाहुरन्धसो मदे|	indra transported with the juice vast in his bulk strong in his neck.
इन्द्रो वर्त्राणि जिघ्नते|	and stout arms smites the vṛtras down.
इन्द्र परेहि पुरस्त्वं विश्वस्येशान ओजसा|	o indra go thou forward thou who rulest over all by might.
वर्त्राणि वर्त्रहञ जहि|	thou vṛtraslayer slay the fiends.
दीर्घस्ते अस्त्वङकुशो येना वसु परयछसि|	long be thy graspinghook wherewith thou givest ample wealth to him.
यजमानाय सुन्वते|	who sheds the juice and worships thee.
अयं त इन्द्र सोमो निपूतो अधि बर्हिषि|	here indra is thy somadraught made pure upon the sacred grass.
एहीमस्य दरवापिब|	run hither come and drink thereof.
शाचिगो शाचिपूजनायं रणाय ते सुतः|	famed for thy radiance worshipped well this juice is shed for thy delight.
आखण्डल पर हूयसे|	thou art invoked akhandala.
यस्ते शर्ङगव्र्षो नपात परणपात कुण्डपाय्यः|	to kundapayya grandsons son grandson of srngavrs to thee.
नयस्मिन दध्र आ मनः|	to him have i addressed my thought.
वास्तोष पते धरुवा सथूणांसत्रं सोम्यानाम|	strong pillar thou lord of the home armour of somaofferers.
दरप्सो भेत्ता पुरां शश्वतीनामिन्द्रो मुनीनां सखा|	the drop of soma breaketh all the strongholds down and indra is the Ṛṣis friend.
पर्दाकुसानुर्यजतो गवेषण एकः सन्नभि भूयसः|	holy prdikusanu winner of the spoil one eminent oer many men.
भूर्णिमश्वं नयत तुजा पुरो गर्भेन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये|	lead on the wild horse indra with his vigorous grasp forward to drink the soma juice.
दूरादिहेव यत सत्यरुणप्सुरशिश्वितत|	when even as she were present here red dawn hath shone from far away.
वि भानुं विश्वधातनत|	she spreadeth light on every side.
नर्वद दस्रा मनोयुजा रथेन पर्थुपाजसा|	like heroes on your willyoked car farshining wonderworkers ye.
सचेथे अश्विनोषसम|	attend o aśvins on the dawn.
युवाभ्यां वाजिनीवसू परति सतोम अद्र्क्षत|	by you o lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed.
वाचं दूतोयथोहिषे|	as envoy have i brought the prayer.
पुरुप्रिया ण ऊतये पुरुमन्द्रा पुरूवसू|	kaṇvas must praise the aśvins dear to many making many glad.
सतुषे कण्वासोश्विना|	most rich that they may succour us.
मंहिष्ठा वाजसातमेषयन्ता शुभस पती|	most liberal best at winning strength inciters lords of splendour who.
गन्तारा दाशुषो गर्हम|	visit the worshippers abode.
ता सुदेवाय दाशुषे सुमेधामवितारिणीम|	so for devout sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead.
घर्तैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतम|	and make it rich for sacrifice.
आ न सतोममुप दरवत तूयं शयेनेभिराशुभिः|	hitherward running speedily with horses as with rapid hawks.
यातमश्वेभिरश्विना|	come aśvins to our song of praise.
येभिस्तिस्रः परावतो दिवो विश्वानि रोचना|	wherewith the three wide distances and all the lights that are in heaven.
तरीन्रक्तून परिदीयथः|	ye traverse and three times of night.
उत नो गोमतीरिष उत सातीरहर्विदा|	o finders of the day that we may win us food of kine and wealth.
वि पथः सातये सितम|	open the paths for us to tread.
आ नो गोमन्तमश्विना सुवीरं सुरथं रयिम|	o aśvins bring us wealth in kine in noble heroes and in cars.
वोळ्हमश्वावतीरिषः|	bring us the strength that horses give.
वाव्र्धाना शुभस पती दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी|	ye lords of splendour glorified ye wonderworkers borne on paths.
पिबतं सोम्यं मधु|	of gold drink sweets with somajuice.
अस्मभ्यं वाजिनीवसू मघवद्भ्यश्च सप्रथः|	to us ye lords of ample wealth and to our wealth chiefs extend.
छर्दिर्यन्तमदाभ्यम|	wide shelter neer to be assailed.
नि षु बरह्म जनानां याविष्टं तूयमा गतम|	come quickly downward to the prayer of people whom ye favour most.
मो षवन्यानुपारतम|	approach not unto other folk.
अस्य पिबतमश्विना युवं मदस्य चारुणः|	ye aśvins whom our minds perceive drink of this lovely gladdening draught.
मध्वो रातस्यधिष्ण्या|	the mcath which we present to you.
अस्मे आ वहतं रयिं शतवन्तं सहस्रिणम|	bring riches hither unto us in hundreds and in thousands source.
पुरुक्षुं विश्वधायसम|	of plenteous food sustaining all.
पुरुत्रा चिद धि वां नरा विह्वयन्ते मनीषिणः|	verily sages call on you ye heroes in full many a place.
वाघद्भिरश्विना गतम|	moved by the priests o aśvins conic.
जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषो हविष्मन्तो अरंक्र्तः|	men who have trimmed the sacred grass bringing oblations and prepared.
युवां हवन्ते अश्विना|	o aśvins are invoking you.
अस्माकमद्य वामयं सतोमो वाहिष्ठो अन्तमः|	may this our hymn of praise today most powerful to bring you be.
युवाभ्यां भूत्वश्विना|	o aśvins nearest to your hearts.
यो ह वां मधुनो दर्तिराहितो रथचर्षणे|	the skin filled full of savoury meath laid in the pathway of your car.
ततः पिबतमश्विना|	o aśvins drink ye both therefrom.
तेन नो वाजिनीवसू पश्वे तोकाय शं गवे|	for this ye lords of ample wealth bring blessing for our herd our kine.
वहतं पीवरीरिषः|	our progeny and plenteous food.
उत नो दिव्या इष उत सिन्धून्रहर्विदा|	ye too unclose to us like doors the strengthening waters of the sky.
अप दवारेव वर्षथः|	and rivers ye who find the day.
कदा वां तौग्र्यो विधत समुद्रे जहितो नरा|	when did the son of tugra serve you men abandoned in the sea.
यद वां रथो विभिष पतात|	that with winged steeds your car might fly.
युवं कण्वाय नासत्यापिरिप्ताय हर्म्ये|	ye o nāsatyas ministered to kaṇva with repeated aid.
शश्वदूतीर्दशस्यथः|	when cast into the heated pit.
ताभिरा यातमूतिभिर्नव्यसीभिः सुशस्तिभिः|	come near with those most recent aids of yours which merit eulogy.
यद वां वर्षण्वसू हुवे|	when i invoke you wealthy gods.
यथा चित कण्वमावतं परियमेधमुपस्तुतम|	as ye protected kaṇva erst priyamedha and upastuta.
अत्रिं शिञ्जारमश्विना|	atri sinjara aśvins twain.
यथोत कर्त्व्ये धनेअंशुं गोष्वगस्त्यम|	and amsu in decisive fight agastya in the fray for kine.
यथा वाजेषु सोभरिम|	and in his battles sobhari.
एतावद वां वर्षण्वसू अतो वा भूयो अश्विना|	for so much bliss or even more o aśvins wealthy gods than this.
गर्णन्तः सुम्नमीमहे|	we pray white singing hymns to you.
रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरं हिरण्याभीशुमश्विना|	ascend your car with golden seat o aśvins and with reins of gold.
आ हि सथाथो दिविस्प्र्शम|	that reaches even to the sky.
हिरण्ययी वां रभिरीषा अक्षो हिरण्ययः|	golden is its supporting shaft the axle also is of gold.
उभा चक्रा हिरण्यया|	and both the wheels are made of gold.
तेन नो वाजिनीवसू परावतश्चिदा गतम|	thereon ye lords of ample wealth come to us even from afar.
उपेमां सुष्टुतिं मम|	come ye to this mine eulogy.
आ वहेथे पराकात पूर्वीरश्नन्तावश्विना|	from far away ye come to us aśvins enjoying plenteous food.
इषो दासीरमर्त्या|	of dāsas o immortal ones.
आ नो दयुम्नैरा शरवोभिरा राया यातमश्विना|	with splendour riches and renown o aśvins hither come to us.
पुरुश्चन्द्रा नासत्या|	nāsatyas shining brilliantly.
एह वां परुषितप्सवो वयो वहन्तु पर्णिनः|	may dappled horses steeds who fly with pinions bring you hitherward.
अछा सवध्वरं जनम|	to people skilled in sacrifice.
रथं वामनुगायसं य इषा वर्तते सह|	the whcel delayeth not that car of yours accompanied by song.
न चक्रमभि बाधते|	that cometh with a store of food.
हिरण्ययेन रथेन दरवत्पाणिभिरश्वैः|	borne on that chariot wrought of gold with coursers very fleet of foot.
धीजवना नासत्या|	come o nāsatyas swift as thought.
युवं मर्गं जाग्र्वांसं सवदथो वा वर्षण्वसू|	o wealthy gods ye taste and find the brisk and watchful wild beast good.
ता नःप्र्ङकतमिषा रयिम|	associate wealth with food for us.
ता मे अश्विना सनीनां विद्यातं नवानाम|	as such o aśvins find for me my share of newpresented gifts.
यथा चिच्चैद्यः कशुः शतमुष्ट्रानां ददत सहस्रा दश गोनाम|	as kasu cedis son gave me a hundred head of buffaloes and ten thousand kine.
यो मे हिरण्यसन्द्र्शो दश राज्ञो अमंहत|	he who hath given me for mine own ten kings like gold to look upon.
अधस्पदा इच्चैद्यस्य कर्ष्टयश्चर्मम्ना अभितो जनाः|	at caidyas feet are all the people round about all those who think upon the shield.
माकिरेना पथा गाद येनेमे यन्ति चेदयः|	no man not any goes upon the path on which the cedis walk.
अन्यो नेत सूरिरोहते भूरिदावत्तरो जनः|	no other prince no folk is held more liberal of gifts than they.
ओ तयमह्व आ रथमद्या दंसिष्ठमूतये|	hitherward have i called today for succour that most wondrous car.
यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी आ सूर्यायै तस्थथुः|	which ye ascended aśvins ye whose paths are red swift to give car for sūryas sake.
पूर्वायुषं सुहवं पुरुस्प्र्हं भुज्युं वाजेषु पूर्व्यम|	car ever young much longedfor easily invoked soon guided first in deeds of might.
सचनावन्तं सुमतिभिः सोभरे विद्वेषसमनेहसम|	which waits and serves o sobhari with benevolence without a rival or a foe.
इह तया पुरुभूतमा देवा नमोभिरश्विना|	these aśvins with our homage these two omnipresent deities.
अर्वाचीना सववसे करामहे गन्तारा दशुषो गर्हम|	hitherward will we bring for kind help these who seek the dwelling of the worshipper.
युवो रथस्य परि चक्रमीयत ईर्मान्यद वामिषण्यति|	one of your chariot wheels is moving swiftly round one speeds for you its onward course.
अस्मानछा सुमतिर्वां शुभस पती आ धेनुरिव धावतु|	like a milchcow o lords of splendour and with haste let your benevolence come to us.
रथो यो वां तरिवन्धुरो हिरण्यभीशुरश्विना|	that chariot of yours which hath a triple seat and reins of gold.
परि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूषति शरुतस्तेन नासत्या गतम|	the famous car that traverseth the heaven and earth thereon nāsatyas aśvins come.
दशस्यन्ता मनवे पूर्व्यं दिवि यवं वर्केण कर्षथः|	ye with your plough when favouring manu with your help ploughed the first harvest in the sky.
ता वामद्य सुमतिभिः शुभस पती अश्विना पर सतुवीमहि|	as such will we exalt you lords of splendour now o aśvins with our prayer and praise.
उप नो वजिनीवसू यातं रतस्य पथिभिः|	come to us lords of ample wealth by paths of everlasting law.
येभिस्त्र्क्षिं वर्षणा तरसदस्यवं महे कषत्राय जिन्वथः|	whereby to high dominion ye with mighty strength raised trksi trasadasyus son.
अयं वामद्रिभिः सुतः सोमो नर वर्षण्वसु|	this soma pressed with stones is yours ye heroes lords of plenteous wealth.
आ यातं सोमपीतये पिबतं दाशुषो गर्हे|	approach to drink the soma come drink in the worshippers abode.
आ हि रुहतमश्विना रथे कोशे हिरण्यये वर्षण्वसू|	o aśvins mount the chariot mount the golden seat ye who are lords of plenteous wealth.
युञ्जाथां पीवरीरिषः|	and bring to us abundant food.
याभिः पक्थमवथो याभिरध्रिगुं याभिर्बभ्रुं विजोषसम|	the aids wherewith ye helped paktha and adhrigt and babhru severed from his friends.
ताभिर्नो मक्षू तूयमश्विना गतं भिषज्यतंयदातुरम|	with those o aśvins come hither with speed and soon and heal whatever is diseased.
यदध्रिगावो अध्रिगू इदा चिदह्नो अश्विना हवामहे|	when we continually invoke the aśvins the resistless at this time of day.
वयं गीर्भिर्विपन्यवः|	we lovers of the song with songs.
ताभिरा यातं वर्षणोप मे हवं विश्वप्सुं विश्ववार्यम|	through these ye mighty ones come hither to my call which brings all blessings wears all forms.
इषा मंहिष्ठा पुरुभूतमा नरा याभिः करिविं वव्र्धुस्ताभिरा गतम|	tlirough which allpresent heroes lavishest of food ye strengthened krvi come through these.
ताविदा चिदहानां तावश्विना वन्दमान उप बरुवे|	i speak to both of these as such these aśvins whom i reverence at this time of day.
ता उ नमोभिरीमहे|	with homage we entreat them both.
ताविद दोषा ता उषसि शुभस पती ता यामन रुद्रवर्तनी|	ye who are lords of splendour ye whose paths are red at eve at mom at sacrifice.
मा नो मर्ताय रिपवे वाजिनीवसू परो रुद्रावति खयतम|	give us not utterly as prey to mortal foe ye rudras lords of ample wealth.
आ सुग्म्याय सुग्म्यं पराता रथेनाश्विना वा सक्षणी|	for bliss i call the blissful car at morn the inseparable aśvins with their car.
हुवे पितेव सोभरी|	i call like sobhari our sire.
मनोजवसा वर्षणा मदच्युता मक्षुंगमाभिरुतिभिः|	rapid as thought and strong and speeding to thejoy bringingyour swiftlycoming help.
आरात्ताच्चिद भूतमस्मे अवसे पुर्वीभिः पुरुभोजसा|	be to us a protection even from far away lords of great wealth with many aids.
आ नो अश्वावदश्विना वर्तिर्यासिष्टं मधुपातमा नरा|	come wonderworkers to our home our home o aśvins rich in cattle steeds and gold.
गोमद दस्रा हिरण्यवत|	chief drinkers of the somas juice.
सुप्रावर्गं सुवीर्यं सुष्ठु वार्यमनाध्र्ष्टं रक्षस्विना|	choiceworthy strength heroic firm and excellent uninjured by the rakṣas foe.
अस्मिन्ना वामायाने वाजिनीवसू विश्वा वामानि धीमहि|	at this your coming nigh ye lords of ample wealth and all good things may we obtain.
पर कर्तान्य रजीषिणः कण्वा इन्द्रस्य गाथया|	kanvas tell forth with song the deeds of indra the impetuous.
मदे सोमस्य वोचत|	wrought in the somas wild delight.
यः सर्बिन्दमनर्शनिं पिप्रुं दासमहीशुवम|	strong god he slew anarsani srbinda pipru and the fiend.
वधीदुग्रो रिणन्नपः|	ahīśuva and loosed the floods.
नयर्बुदस्य विष्टपं वर्ष्माणं बर्हतस्तिर|	thou broughtest down the dwellingplace the height of lofty arbuda.
कर्षे तदिन्द्र पौंस्यम|	that exploit indra must be famed.
परति शरुताय वो धर्षत तूर्णाशं न गिरेरधि|	bold to your famous soma i call the fairvisored god for aid.
हुवेसुशिप्रमूतये|	down like a torrent from the hill.
स गोरश्वस्य वि वरजं मन्दानः सोम्येभ्यः|	rejoicing in the somadraughts hero burst open like a fort.
पुरं नशूर दर्षसि|	the stall of horses and of kine.
यदि मे रारणः सुत उक्थे वा दधसे चनः|	if my libation gladdens if thou takest pleasure in my laud.
आरादुपस्वधा गहि|	come with thy godhead from afar.
वयं घा ते अपि षमसि सतोतार इन्द्र गिर्वणः|	o indra lover of the song the singers of thy praise are we.
तवं नो जिन्व सोमपाः|	o somadrinker quicken us.
उत नः पितुमा भर संरराणो अविक्षितम|	and taking thy delight with us bring us still undiminished food.
मघवन भूरि ते वसु|	great is thy wealth o maghavan.
उत नो गोमतस कर्धि हिरण्यवतो अश्विनः|	make thou us rich in herds of kine in steeds in gold let us exert.
इळाभिः सं रभेमहि|	our strength in sacrificial gifts.
बर्बदुक्थं हवामहे सर्प्रकरस्नमूतये|	let us call him to aid whose hands stretch far to whom high laud is due.
साधु कर्ण्वन्तमवसे|	who worketh well to succour us.
यः संस्थे चिच्छतक्रतुरादीं कर्णोति वर्त्रहा|	he Śatakratu even in fight acts as a vṛtraslayer still.
जरित्र्भ्यः पुरूवसुः|	he gives his worshippers much wealth.
स नः शक्रश्चिदा शकद दानवानन्तराभरः|	may he this aakra strengthen us boon god who satisfies our needs.
इन्द्रोविश्वाभिरूतिभिः|	indra with all lhis saving helps.
यो रायोअवनिर्महान सुपारः सुन्वतः सखा|	to him the mighty stream of wealth the somapressers rescuing friend.
तमिन्द्रमभि गायत|	to indra sing your song of praise.
आयन्तारं महि सथिरं पर्तनासु शरवोजितम|	who bringeth what is great and firm who winneth glory in his wars.
भूरेरीशानमोजसा|	lord of vast wealth through power and might.
नकिरस्य शचीनां नियन्ता सून्र्तानाम|	there liveth none to cheek or stay his energies and gracious deeds.
नकिर्वक्ता नदादिति|	none who can say he giveth not.
न नूनं बरह्मणां रणं पराशूनामस्ति सुन्वताम|	no debt is due by brahmans now by active men who press the juice.
न सोमो अप्रता पपे|	well hath each somadraught been paid.
पन्य इदुप गायत पन्य उक्थानि शंसत|	sing ye to him who must be praised say lauds to him who must be praised.
बरह्मा कर्णोतपन्य इत|	bring prayer to him who must be praised.
पन्य आ दर्दिरच्छता सहस्रा वाज्यव्र्तः|	may be unchecked strong meet for praise bring hundreds thousands forth to light.
इन्द्रो यो यज्वनो वर्धः|	indra who aids the worshipper.
वि षू चर सवधा अनु कर्ष्टीनामन्वाहुवः|	go with thy godlike nature forth go where the folk are calling thee.
इन्द्र पिब सुतानाम|	drink indra of the drops we pour.
पिब सवधैनवानामुत यस्तुग्र्ये सचा|	drink milky draughts which are thine own this too which was with tugrya once.
उतायमिन्द्र यस्तव|	this is it indra that is thine.
अतीहि मन्युषाविणं सुषुवांसमुपारणे|	pass him who psours libations out in angry mood or after sin.
इमं रातंसुतं पिब|	here drink the juice we offer thee.
इहि तिस्रः परावत इहि पञ्च जनानति|	over the three great distances past the five peoples go thy way.
धेना इन्द्रावचाकशत|	o indra noticing our voice.
सूर्यो रश्मिं यथा सर्जा तवा यछन्तु मे गिरः|	send forth thy ray like sūrya let my songs attract thee hitherward.
निम्नमापो न सध्र्यक|	like waters gathering to the vale.
अध्वर्यवा तु हि षिञ्च सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे|	now to the hero fair of cheek adhvaryu pour the soma forth.
भरासुतस्य पीतये|	bring of the juice that he may drink.
य उद्नः फलिगं भिनन नयक सिन्धून्रवास्र्जत|	who cleft the watercloud in twain loosed rivers for their downward flow.
यो गोषुपक्वं धारयत|	and set the ripe milk in the kine.
अहन वर्त्रं रचीषम और्णवाभमहीशुवम|	he meet for praise slew vṛtra slew ahīśuva urnavabhas son.
हिमेनाविध्यदर्बुदम|	and pierced through arbuda with frost.
पर व उग्राय निष्टुरेअषाळ्हाय परसक्षिणे|	to him your matchless mighty one unconquerable conqueror.
देवत्तं बरह्म गायत|	sing forth the prayer which gods have given.
यो विश्वान्यभि वरता सोमस्य मदे अन्धसः|	indra who in the wild delight of soma juice considers here.
इन्द्रो देवेषु चेतति|	all holy laws among the gods.
इह तया सधमाद्या हरी हिरण्यकेश्या|	hither let these thy bays who share thy banquet steeds with golden manes.
वोळ्हामभि परयो हितम|	convey thee to the feast prepared.
अर्वाञ्चं तवा पुरुष्टुत परियमेधस्तुता हरी|	hither o thou whom many laud the bays whom priyamedha praised.
सोमपेयायवक्षतः|	shall bring thee to the somadraught.
कदा वसो सतोत्रं हर्यत आव शमशा रुधद वाः|	when vasu wilt thou love the laud now let the channel bring the stream.
दीर्घं सुतं वाताप्याय|	the juice is ready to ferment.
हरी यस्य सुयुजा विव्रता वेरर्वन्तानु शेपा|	he whose two bay steeds harnessed well swerving pursue the birds tailplumes.
उभारजी न केशिना पतिर्दन|	with rowing manes like heaven and earth he is the lord with power to give.
अप योरिन्द्रः पापज आ मर्तो न शश्रमाणो बिभीवान|	bereft of skill is indra if like some outwearied man he fears.
शुभे यद युयुजे तविषीवान|	the sinner when the mighty hath prepared himself for victory.
सचायोरिन्द्रश्चर्क्र्ष आनुपानसः सपर्यन|	indra with these drives round until he meets with one to worship him.
नदयोर्विव्रतयोः शूर इन्द्रः|	indra is master of the pair who snort and swerve upon their way.
अधि यस्तस्थौ केशवन्ता वयचस्वन्ता न पुष्ट्यै|	borne onward by the longmaned steeds who stretch themselves as twere for food.
वनोति शिप्राभ्यां शिप्रिणीवान|	the god who wears the helm defends them with his jaws.
परास्तौद रष्वौजा रष्वेभिस्ततक्ष शूरः शवसा|	the mighty sang with lofty ones the hero fashioned with his strength.
रभुर्न करतुभिर्मातरिश्वा|	like skilful mātariśvan with his power and might.
वज्रं यश्चक्रे सुहनाय दस्यवे हिरीमशो हिरीमान|	the bolt which pierced at once the vitals of the dasyu easy to be slain.
अरुतहनुरद्भुतं न रजः|	with jaw uninjured like the wondrous firmament.
अव नो वर्जिना शिशीह्य रचा वनेमान्र्चः|	grind off our sins with song will we conquer the men who sing no hymns.
नाब्रह्मा यज्ञर्धग जोषति तवे|	not easily art thou pleased with prayerless sacrifice.
ऊर्ध्वा यत ते तरेतिनी भूद यज्ञस्य धूर्षु सद्मन|	when threefold flame burns high for thee to rest on poles of sacrifice.
सजूर्नावं सवयशसं सचायोः|	thou with the living joyest in the selfbright ship.
शरिये ते पर्श्निरुपसेचनी भूच्छ्रिये दर्विररेपाः|	thy glory was the speckled cup thy glory was the flawless scoop.
यया सवे पात्रे सिञ्चस उत|	wherewith thou pourest into thy receptacle.
शतं वा यदसुर्य परति तवा सुमित्र इत्थास्तौद दुर्मित्रैत्थास्तौ|	as hundreds o immortal god have sung to thee so hath sumitra yea durmitra praised thee here.
आवो यद दस्युहत्ये कुत्सपुत्रं परावो यद्दस्युहत्ये कुत्सवत्सम|	what time thou holpest kutsas son when dasyus fell yea holpest kutsas darling when the dasyus died.
मनीषिणः पर भरध्वं मनीषां यथायथा मतयःसन्ति नर्णाम|	bring forth your sacred song ye prudent singers even as are the thoughts of human beings.
इन्द्रं सत्यैरेरयामा कर्तेभिः स हिवीरो गिर्वणस्युर्विदानः|	let us draw indra with true deeds anear us he loves our songs the hero and is potent.
रतस्य हि सदसो धीतिरद्यौत सं गार्ष्टेयो वर्षभोगोभिरानट|	the hymn shone brightly from the seat of worship to the kine came the bull the heifers offipring.
उदतिष्ठत तविषेणा रवेण महान्ति चित्सं विव्याचा रजांसि|	with mighty bellowing hath he arisen and hath pervaded even the spacious regions.
इन्द्रः किल शरुत्या अस्य वेद स हि जिष्णुः पथिक्र्त्सूर्याय|	indra knows verily how to hear our singing for he victorious made a path for sūrya.
आन मेनां कर्ण्वन्नच्युतो भुवद गोः पतिर्दिवः सनजा अप्रतीतः|	he made the cow and be became the sovran of heaven primeval matchless and unshaken.
इन्द्रो मह्ना महतो अर्णवस्य वरतामिनादङगिरोभिर्ग्र्णानः|	praised by aṅgirases indra demolished with might the works of the great watery monster.
पुरूणि चिन नि तताना रजांसि दाधार योधरुणं सत्यताता|	full many regions too hath he pervaded and by his truth supported earths foundation.
इन्द्रो दिवः परतिमानं पर्थिव्या विश्वा वेद सवना हन्तिशुष्णम|	the counterpart of heaven and earth is indra he knoweth all libations slayeth Śuṣṇa.
महीं चिद दयामातनोत सूर्येण चास्कम्भ चित्कम्भनेन सकभीयान|	the vast sky with the sun hath he extended and best otpillars stayed it with a pillar.
वज्रेण हि वर्त्रहा वर्त्रमस्तरदेवस्य शूशुवानस्यमायाः|	the vṛtraslaver with his bolt felled vṛtra the magic of the godless waxen mighty.
वि धर्ष्णो अत्र धर्षता जघन्थाथाभवोमघवन बाह्वोजाः|	here hast thou bold assailant boldly conquered yea then thine arms o maghavan were potent.
सचन्त यदुषसः सूर्येण चित्रामस्य केतवो रामविन्दन|	when the dawns come attendant upon sūrya their rays discover wealth of divers colours.
आ यन नक्षत्रं दद्र्शे दिवो न पुनर्यतो नकिरद्धा नु वेद|	the star of heaven is seen as twere approaching none knoweth aught of it as it departeth.
दूरं किल परथमा जग्मुरासामिन्द्रस्य याः परसवेसस्रुरापः|	far have they gone the first of all these waters the waters that flowed forth when indra sent them.
कव सविदग्रं कव बुध्न आसामापोमध्यं कव वो नूनमन्तः|	where is their spring and where is their foundation where now ye waters is your inmost centre.
सर्जः सिन्धून्रहिना जग्रसानानादिदेताः पर विविज्रेजवेन|	thou didst free rivers swallowed by the dragon and rapidly they set themselves in motion.
मुमुक्षमाणा उत या मुमुच्रेअधेदेता नरमन्ते नितिक्ताः|	those that were loosed and those that longed for freedom excited now to speed they run unresting.
सध्रीचीः सिन्धुमुशतीरिवायन सनाज्जार आरितःपूर्भिदासाम|	yearning together they have sped to sindhu the fortdestroyer praised of old hath loved them.
अस्तमा ते पार्थिवा वसून्यस्मे जग्मुःसून्र्ता इन्द्र पूर्वीः|	indra may thy terrestrial treasures reach us and our full songs of joy approach thy dwelling.
उषासानक्ता बर्हती सुपेशसा दयावाक्षामा वरुणोमित्रो अर्यमा|	there are the dawn and night the grand and beauteous pair earth heaven and varuṇa mitra and aryaman.
इन्द्रं हुवे मरुतः पर्वतानप आदित्यान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अपः सवः|	indra i call the maruts mountains and the floods Ādityas heaven and earth the waters and the sky.
दयौश्च नः पर्थिवी च परचेतस रतावरी रक्षतामंहसोरिषः|	may dyaus and prthivi wise true to holy law keep us in safety from distress and injury.
मा दुर्विदत्रा निरतिर्न ईशत तद देवानामवोद्या वर्णीमहे|	let not malignant nirrti rule over us we crave today this gracious favour of the gods.
विश्वस्मान नो अदितिः पात्वंहसो माता मित्रस्य वरुणस्यरेवतः|	mother of mitra and of opulent varuṇa may aditi preserve us safe from all distress.
सवर्वज्ज्योतिरव्र्कं नशीमहि तद देवानां|	may we obtain the light of heaven without a foe we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
गरावा वदन्नप रक्षांसि सेधतु दुष्वप्न्यं निरतिंविश्वमत्रिणम|	may ringing pressstones keep the rākṣasas afar ill dream and nirrti and each voracious fiend.
आदित्यं शर्म मरुतामशीमहि तद्देवानां|	may the Ādityas and the maruts shelter us we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
एन्द्रो बर्हिः सीदतु पिन्वतामिळा बर्हस्पतिः सामभिरकवो अर्चतु|	full flow libations on our grass let indra sit bṛhaspati the singer laud with sāma hymns.
सुप्रकेतं जीवसे मन्म धीमहि तद्देवानां|	wise be our hearts imaginings that we may live we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
दिविस्प्र्शं यज्ञमस्माकमश्विना जीराध्वरं कर्णुतंसुम्नमिष्टये|	ye aśvins make our sacrifice ascend to heaven and animate the rite that it may send us bliss.
पराचीनरश्मिमाहुतं घर्तेन तद्देवानां|	offered with holy oil with forwardspeeding rein we crave the gracious favour of the gods today.
उप हवये सुहवं मारुतं गणं पावकं रष्वं सख्यायशम्भुवम|	hither i call the band of maruts swift to hear great purifying bringing bliss to he our friends.
रायस पोषं सौश्रवसाय धीमहि तद्देवानां|	may we increase our wealth to glorify our name we crave this graciousfavour of the gods today.
अपां पेरुं जीवधन्यं भरामहे देवाव्यं सुहवमध्वरश्रियम|	we bring the stay of life who makes the waters swell swifthearing friend of gods who waits on sacrifice.
सुरश्मिं सोममिन्द्रियं यमीमहि तद्देवानां|	may we control that power soma whose rays are bright we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
सनेम तत सुसनिता सनित्वभिर्वयं जीवा जीवपुत्रानागसः|	alive ourselves with living sons devoid of guilt may we win this with winners by fair means to win.
बरह्मद्विषो विष्वगेनो भरेरत तद्देवानां|	let the prayerhaters bear our sin to every side we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
ये सथा मनोर्यज्ञियास्ते शर्णोतन यद वो देवा ईमहेतद ददातन|	hear us o ye who claim the worship of mankind and give us o ye gods the gift for which we pray.
जैत्रं करतुं रयिमद वीरवद यशस्तद्देवानां|	victorious wisdom fame with heroes and with wealth we crave today this gracious favour of the gods.
महदद्य महतामा वर्णीमहेअवो देवानां बर्हतामनर्वणाम|	we crave the gracious favour of the gods today great favour of great gods sublime and free from foes.
यथा वसु वीरजातं नशामहै तद्देवानां|	that we may gain rich treasure sprung from hero sons we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
महो अग्नेः समिधानस्य शर्मण्यनागा मित्रे वरुणेस्वस्तये|	in great enkindled agnis keeping and for bliss free from all sin before mitra and varuṇa.
शरेष्ठे सयाम सवितुः सवीमनि तद्देवानां|	may we share savitars best animating help we crave this gracious favour of the gods today.
ये सवितुः सत्यसवस्य विश्वे मित्रस्य वरते वरुणस्यदेवाः|	all ye the gods whom savitar the father of truth and varuṇa and mitra govern.
ते सौभगं वीरवद गोमदप्नो दधातनद्रविणं चित्रमस्मे|	give us prosperity with hero children and opulence in kine and various treasure.
सविता पश्चातात सविता पुरस्तात सवितोत्तरात्तात्सविताधरात्तात|	savitar savitar from cast and westward savitar savitar from north and southward.
सविता नः सुवतु सर्वतातिं सविता नोरासतां दीर्घमयुः|	savitar send us perfect health and comfort savitar let our days of life be lengthened.
वने न वा यो नयधायि चाकञ्छुचिर्वां सतोमो भुरणावजीगः|	as sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing ye swift pair have been roused by clear laudation.
यस्येदिन्द्रः पुरुदिनेषु होता नर्णां नर्योन्र्तमः कषपावान|	whose heraldpriest through many days is indra earths guardian friend of men the best of heroes.
पर ते अस्या उषसः परापरस्या नर्तौ सयाम नर्तमस्यन्र्णाम|	may we when this dawn and the next dance hither be thy best servants most heroic hero.
अनु तरिशोकः शतमावहन नॄन कुत्सेन रथो योसत ससवान|	let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with kutsa.
कस्ते मद इन्द्र रन्त्यो भूद दुरो गिरो अभ्युग्रो वि धाव|	what was the gladdening draught that pleased thee indra speed through our doors to songs for thou art mighty.
कद वाहो अर्वागुप मा मनीषा आ तवा शक्यमुपमंराधो अन्नैः|	why comest thou to me what gift attracts thee fain would i bring thee food most meet to offer.
कदु दयुम्नमिन्द्र तवावतो नॄन कया धिया करसे कन नागन|	indra what fame hath one like thee mid heroes with what plan wilt thou act why hast thou sought us.
मित्रो न सत्य उरुगाय भर्त्या अन्ने समस्य यदसन्मनीषाः|	as a true friend widestrider to sustain us since food absorbs the thought of each among us.
परेरय सूरो अर्थं न पारं ये अस्य कामं जनिधा इवग्मन|	speed happily those as sūrya ends his journey who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses.
गिरश्च ये ते तुविजात पूर्वीर्नर इन्द्रप्रतिशिक्षन्त्यन्नैः|	men who present o indra strong by nature with food the many songs that tell thy praises.
मात्रे नु ते सुमिते इन्द्र पूर्वी दयौर्मज्मना पर्थिवीकाव्येन|	thine are two measures indra widewellmeted heaven for thy majesty earth for thy wisdom.
वराय ते घर्तवन्तः सुतासः सवाद्मन भवन्तुपीतये मधूनि|	here for thy choice are somas mixed with butter may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.
आ मध्वो अस्मा असिचन्नमत्रमिन्द्राय पूर्णं स हिसत्यराधाः|	they have poured out a bowl to him to indra full of sweet juice for faithful is his bounty.
स वाव्र्धे वरिमन्ना पर्थिव्या अभि करत्वानर्यः पौंस्यैश्च|	oer earths expanse hath he grown great by wisdom the friend of man and by heroic exploits.
वयानळ इन्द्रः पर्तनाः सवोजा आस्मै यतन्ते सख्यायपूर्वीः|	indra hath conquered in his wars the mighty men strive in multitudes to win his friendship.
आ समा रथं न पर्तनासु तिष्ठ यं भद्रयासुमत्या चोदयासे|	ascend thy chariot as it were in battle which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour.
इन्द्र दर्ह्य मघवन तवावदिद भुज इह सतुतः सुतपाबोधि नो वर्धे|	be like thyself o indra strong for our delight here lauded aid us maghavan drinker of the juice.
देवेभिर्नः सविता परावतु शरुतमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	savitar with the gods protect us hear ye twain we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
भराय सु भरत भागं रत्वियं पर वायवे शुचिपेक्रन्ददिष्टये|	bring swift for offering the snare that suits the time to the puredrinker vāyu roaring as he goes.
गौरस्य यः पयसः पीतिमानश आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	to him who hath approached the draught of shining milk we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
आ नो देवः सविता साविषद वय रजूयते यजमानायसुन्वते|	may savitar the god send us full life to each who sacrifices lives aright and pours the juice.
यथा देवान परतिभूषेम पाकवदा सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	that we with simple hearts may wait upon the gods we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
इन्द्रो अस्मे सुमना अस्तु विश्वहा राजा सोमः सुवितस्याध्येतु नः|	may indra evermore be gracious unto us and may king soma meditate our happiness.
यथायथा मित्रधितानि सन्दधुरा सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	even as men secure the comfort of a friend we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
इन्द्र उक्थेन शवसा परुर्दधे बर्हस्पते परतरीतास्यायुषः|	indra hath given the body with its song and strength bṛhaspati thou art the lengthener of life.
यज्ञो मनुः परमतिर्नः पिता हि कमासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	the sacrifice is manu providence our sire we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
इन्द्रस्य नु सुक्र्तं दैव्यं सहोअग्निर्ग्र्हे जरितामेधिरः कविः|	indra possesseth might celestial nobly formed the singer in the house is agni prudent sage.
यज्ञश्च भूद विदथे चारुरन्तम आसर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	he is the sacrifice in synod fair most near we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
न वो गुहा चक्र्म भूरि दुष्क्र्तं नाविष्ट्यं वसवोदेवहेळनम|	not often have we sinned against you secretly nor vasus have we openly provoked the gods.
माकिर्नो देवा अन्र्तस्य वर्पस आ सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	not one of its ye gods hath worn an alien shape we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
अपामीवां सविता साविषन नयग वरीय इदप सेधन्त्वद्रयः|	may savitar remove from us our malady and may the mountains keep it far away from where.
गरावा यत्र मधुषुदुच्यते बर्हदासर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	the pressstone as it sheds the meath rings loudly forth we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
ऊर्ध्वो गरावा वसवोअस्तु सोतरि विश्वा दवेषांसि सनुतर्युयोत|	ye vasus let the stone the presser stand erect avert all enmities and keep them far remote.
स नो देवः सविता पायुरीड्य आ सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	our guard to be adored is savitar this god we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
ऊर्जं गावो यवसे पीवो अत्तन रतस्य याः सदने कोशेङगध्वे|	eat strength and fatness in the pasture kine who are balmed at the reservoir and at the seat of law.
तनूरेव तन्वो अस्तु भेषजमा सर्वतातिंदितिं वर्णीमहे|	so let your body be our bodys medicine we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
करतुप्रावा जरिता शश्वतामव इन्द्र इद भद्राप्रमतिः सुतावताम|	the singer fills the spirit all mens love hath he indra takes kindly care of those who pour the juice.
पूर्णमूधर्दिव्यं यस्य सिक्तया सर्वतातिमदितिं वर्णीमहे|	for his libation is the heavenly udder full we ask for freedom and complete felicity.
चित्रस्ते भानुः करतुप्रा अभिष्टिः सन्ति सप्र्धोजरणिप्रा अध्र्ष्टाः|	wondrous thy spiritfilling light triumpliant thy hosts save from decay and are resistless.
रजिष्ठया रज्या पश्व आ गोस्तूतूर्षत्य पर्यग्रं दुवस्युः|	the pious votary by straightest pathway speeds to possess the best of all the cattle.
अक्षीभ्यां ते नासिकाभ्यां कर्णाभ्यां छुबुकादधि|	from both thy nostrils from thine eyes from both thine ears and from thy chin.
यक्ष्मं शीर्षण्यं मस्तिष्काज्जिह्वाया वि वर्हामि ते|	forth from thy head and brain and tongue i drive thy malady away.
गरीवाभ्यस्त उष्णिहाभ्यः कीकसाभ्यो अनूक्यात|	from the necktendons and the neck from the breastbones and from the spine.
यक्ष्मं दोषण्यमंसाभ्यां बाहुभ्यां वि वर्हामि ते|	from shoulders upper lower arms i drive thy malady away.
आन्त्रेभ्यस्ते गुदाभ्यो वनिष्ठोर्ह्र्दयादधि|	from viscera and all within forth from the rectum from the heart.
यक्ष्मम्मतस्नाभ्यां यक्नः पलाशिभ्यो वि वर्हामि ते|	from kidneys liver and from spleen i drive thy malady away.
ऊरुभ्यां ते अष्ठीवद्भ्यां पार्ष्णिभ्यां परपदाभ्याम|	from thighs from kneecaps and from heels and from the forepart of the feet.
यक्ष्मं शरोणिभ्यां भासदाद भंससो वि वर्हामि ते|	from hips from stomach and from groin i drive thy malady away.
मेहनाद वनंकरणाल लोमभ्यस्ते नखेभ्यः|	from what is voided from within and from thy hair and from they nails.
यक्ष्मंसर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वर्हामि ते|	from all thyself from top to toe i drive thy malady away.
अङगादअङगाल लोम्नोलोम्नो जातं पर्वणिपर्वणि|	from every member every hair disease that comes in every joint.
यक्ष्मंसर्वस्मादात्मनस्तमिदं वि वर्हामि ते|	from all thyself from top to toe i drive thy malady away.
पर ते रथं मिथूक्र्तमिन्द्रोअवतु धर्ष्णुया|	for thee may indra boldly speed the car that works on either side.
अस्मिन्नाजौ पुरुहूत शरवाय्ये धनभक्षेषु नोअव|	favour us muchinvoked in this most glorious fight against the raiders of our wealth.
उत सम वातो वहति वासोअस्या अधिरथं यदजयत सहस्रम|	loose in the wind the womans robe was streaming what time she won a carload worth a thousand.
रथीरभून मुद्गलानी गविष्टौ भरे कर्तं वयचेदिन्द्रसेना|	the charioteer in fight was mudgalani she indras dart heaped up the prize of battle.
अन्तर्यछ जिघांसतो वज्रमिन्द्राभिदासतः|	o indra cast thy bolt among assailants who would slaughter us.
दासस्यवा मघवन्नार्यस्य वा सनुतर्यवया वधम|	the weapon both of dāsa and of Ārya foe keep far away o maghavan.
उद्नो हरदमपिबज्जर्ह्र्षाणः कूटं सम तरंहदभिमातिमेति|	the bull in joy had drunk a lake of water his shattering horn encountered an opponent.
पर मुष्कभारः शरव इछमानोअजिरम्बाहू अभरत सिषासन|	swiftly in vigorous strength eager for glory he stretched his forefeet fain to win and triumph.
नयक्रन्दयन्नुपयन्त एनममेहयन वर्षभं मध्य आजेः|	they came anear the bull they made him thunder made him pour rain down ere the fight was ended.
तेन सूभर्वं शतवत सहस्रं गवां मुद्गलः परधनेजिगाय|	and mudgala thereby won in the contest wellpastured kine in hundreds and in thousands.
ककर्दवे वर्षभो युक्त आसीदवावचीत सारथिरस्य केशी|	in hope of victory that bull was harnessed kesi the driver urged him on with shouting.
दुधेर्युक्तस्य दरवतः सहानस रछन्ति षमा निष्पदोमुद्गलानीम|	as he ran swiftly with the car behind him his lifted heels pressed close on mudgalani.
उत परधिमुदहन्नस्य विद्वानुपायुनग वंसगमत्रशिक्षन|	deftly for him he stretched the carpole forward guided the bull thereto and firmly yoked him.
इन्द्र उदावत पतिमघ्न्यानामरंहतपद्याभिः ककुद्मान|	indra vouchsafed the lord of cows his favour with mighty steps the buffalo ran onward.
शुनमष्त्राव्यचरत कपर्दी वरत्रायां दार्वानह्यमानः|	touched by the goad the shaggy beast went nobly bound to the pole by the yokes thong of leather.
नर्म्णानि कर्ण्वन बहवे जनाय गाःपस्पशानस्तविषीरधत्त|	performing deeds of might for many people he looking on the cows gained strength and vigour.
इमं तं पश्य वर्षभस्य युञ्जं काष्ठाया मध्येद्रुघणं शयानम|	here look upon this mace this bulls companion now lying midway on the field of battle.
येन जिगाय शतवत सहस्रं गवाम्मुद्गलः पर्तनाज्येषु|	therewith hath mudgala in ordered contest won for cattle for himself a hundred thousand.
आरे अघा को नवित्था ददर्श यं युञ्जन्ति तं वास्थापयन्ति|	far is the evil who hath here beheld it hither they bring the bull whom they are yoking.
नास्मै तर्णं नोदकमा भरन्त्युत्तरो धुरोवहति परदेदिशत|	to this they give not either food or water reaching beyond the pole it gives directions.
परिव्र्क्तेव पतिविद्यमानट पीप्याना कूचक्रेणेव सिञ्चन|	like one forsaken she hath found a husband and teemed as if her breast were full and flowing.
एषैष्या चिद रथ्या जयेम सुमङगलं सिनवदस्तु सातम|	with swiftlyracing chariot may we conquer and rich and blessed be our gains in battle.
तवं विश्वस्य जगतश्चक्षुरिन्द्रासि चक्षुषः|	thou indra art the mark whereon the eyes of all life rest when thou.
वर्षायदाजिं वर्षणा सिषाससि चोदयन वध्रिणा युजा|	a bull who drivest with thy bull wilt win the race together with thy weakling friend.
घर्मा समन्ता तरिव्र्तं वयापतुस्तयोर्जुष्टिम्मातरिश्वा जगाम|	two perfect springs of heat pervade the threefold and come for their delight is mātariśvan.
दिवस पयो दिधिषाणा अवेषन विदुर्देवाः सहसामानमर्कम|	craving the milk of heaven the gods are present well do they know the praisesong and the sāman.
तिस्रो देष्ट्राय निरतीरुपासते दीर्घश्रुतो वि हिजानन्ति वह्नयः|	the priests beard far away as they are ordered serve the three nirrtis for well they know them.
तासां नि चिक्युः कवयो निदानम्परेषु या गुह्येषु वरतेषु|	sages have traced the cause that first produced them dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.
चतुष्कपर्दा युवतिः सुपेशा घर्तप्रतीका वयुनानि वस्ते|	the youthful one wellshaped with four locks braided brightened with oil puts on the ordinances.
तस्यां सुपर्णा वर्षणा नि षेदतुर्यत्र देवा दधिरेभागधेयम|	two birds of mighty power are seated near her there where the deities receive their portion.
एकः सुपर्णः स समुद्रमा विवेष स इदं विश्वम्भुवनं वि चष्टे|	one of these birds hath passed into the sea of air thence he looks round and views this universal world.
तं पाकेन मनसापश्यमन्तितस्तम्माता रेळि स उ रेळि मातरम|	with simple heart i have beheld him from anear his mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.
सुपर्णं विप्राः कवयो वचोभिरेकं सन्तं बहुधाकल्पयन्ति|	him with fair wings though only one in nature wise singers shape with songs in many figures.
छन्दांसि च दधतो अध्वरेषु गरहान सोमस्यमिमते दवादश|	while they at sacrifices fix the metres they measure out twelve chalices of soma.
षट्त्रिंशांश्च चतुरः कल्पयन्तश्छन्दांसि चदधत आद्वादशम|	while they arrange the four and sixandthirty and duly order up to twelve the measures.
यज्ञं विमाय कवयो मनीषर्क्सामाभ्यां पर रथं वर्तयन्ति|	having disposed the sacrifice thoughtful sages send the car forward with the rc and sāman.
चतुर्दशान्ये महिमानो अस्य तं धीरा वाचा पर णयन्तिसप्त|	the chariots majesties are fourteen others seven sages lead it onward with their voices.
आप्नानं तीर्थं क इह पर वोचद येन पथाप्रपिबन्ते सुतस्य|	who will declare to us the ford apnana the path whereby they drink first draughts of soma.
सहस्रधा पञ्चदशान्युक्था यावद दयावाप्र्थिवीतावदित तत|	the fifteen lauds are in a thousand places that is as vast as heaven and earth in measure.
सहस्रधा महिमानः सहस्रं यावद्ब्रह्म विष्ठितं तावती वाक|	a thousand spots contain the mighty thousand vāk spreadeth forth as far as prayer extendeth.
कश्छन्दसां योगमा वेद धीरः को धिष्ण्यां परतिवाचं पपाद|	what sage hath learned the metres application who hath gained vāk the spirits aim and object.
कं रत्विजामष्टमं शूरमाहुर्हरीिन्द्रस्य नि चिकाय कः सवित|	which ministering priest is called eighth hero who then hath tracked the two bay steeds of indra.
भूम्या अन्तं पर्येके चरन्ति रथस्य धूर्षु युक्तासोस्थुः|	yoked to his chariotpole there stood the coursers they only travel round earths farthest limits.
शरमस्य दायं वि भजन्त्येभ्यो यदा यमो भवतिहर्म्ये हितः|	these when their driver in his home is settled receive the allotted meed of their exertion.
हविष पान्तमजरं सवर्विदि दिविस्प्र्श्याहुतं जुष्टमग्नौ|	dear ageless sacrificial drink is offered in lightdiscovering heavenpervading agni.
तस्य भर्मणे भुवनाय देवा धर्मणे कंस्वधया पप्रथन्त|	the gods spread forth through his celestial nature that he might bear the world up and sustain it.
गीर्णं भुवनं तमसपगूळमाविः सवरभवज्जातेग्नौ|	the world was swallowed and concealed in darkness agni was born and light became apparent.
तस्य देवाः पर्थिवि दयौरुतापोअरणयन्नोषधीः सख्ये अस्य|	the deities the broad earth and the heavens and plants and waters gloried in his friendship.
देवेभिर्न्विषितो यज्ञियेभिरग्निं सतोषाण्यजरम्ब्र्हन्तम|	inspired by gods who claim our adoration i now will laud eternal lofty agni.
यो भानुना पर्थिविं दयामुतेमामाततानरोदसी अन्तरिक्षम|	him who hath spread abroad the earth with lustre this heaven and both the worlds and airs midregion.
यो होतासीत परथमो देवजुष्टो यं समञ्जन्नाज्येनाव्र्णानः|	earliest priest whom all the gods accepted and chose him and anointed him with butter.
स पतत्रीत्वरं सथ जगद यच्छ्वात्रमग्निरक्र्नोज्जातवेदः|	he swiftly made all things that fly stand travel all that hath motion agni jātavedas.
यज्जतवेदो भुवनस्य मूर्धन्नतिष्ठो अग्ने सह रोचनेन|	because thou agni jātavedas stoodest at the worlds head with thy refulgent splendour.
तं तवहेम मतिभिर्गीर्भिरुक्थैः स यज्ञियो अभवोरोदसिप्राः|	we sent thee forth with hymns and songs and praises thou filledst heaven and earth god meet for worship.
मूर्धा भुवो भवति नक्तमग्निस्ततः सुर्यो जायतेप्रातरुद्यन|	head of the world is agni in the nighttime then as the sun at morn springs up and rises.
मयामु तु यज्ञियानामेतमपो यत्तूर्णिश्चरति परजानन|	then to his task goes the prompt priest foreknowing the wondrous power of gods who must be honoured.
दर्शेन्यो यो महिना समिद्धोअरोचत दिवियोनिर्विभावा|	lovely is he who kindled in his greatness hath shone forth seated in the heavens refulgent.
तस्मिन्नग्नौ सूक्तवाकेन देवा हविर्विश्व अजुहवुस्तनूपाः|	with resonant hymns all gods who guard our bodies have offered up oblation in this agni.
सूक्तवकं परथममादिदग्निमादिद धविरजनयन्तदेवाः|	first the gods brought the hymnal into being then they engendered agni then oblation.
स एषां यज्ञो अभवत तनूपस्तं दयौर्वेदतं परिथिवि तमापः|	he was their sacrifice that guards our bodies him the heavens know the earth the waters know him.
यं देवासो अजनयन्ताग्निं यस्मिन्नाजुहवुर्भुवनानिविश्वा|	he agni whom the gods have generated in whom they offered up all worlds and creatures.
सो अर्चिषा पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां रजूयमानोतपन महित्वा|	he with his bright glow heated earth and heaven urging himself right onward in his grandeur.
सतोमेन हि दिवि देवासो अग्निमजीजनञ्छक्तिभीरोदसिप्राम|	then by the laud the gods engendered agni in heaven who fills both worlds through strength and vigour.
तमू अक्र्ण्वन तरेधा भुवे कं स ओषधीःपचति विश्वरूपाः|	they made him to appear in threefold essence he ripens plants of every form and nature.
यदेदेनमदधुर्यज्ञियासो दिवि देवाः सूर्यमादितेयम|	what time the gods whose due is worship set him as sūrya son of aditi in heaven.
यदा चरिष्णू मिथुनावभूतामादित परापश्यन्भुवनानि विश्वा|	when the pair ever wandering sprang to being all creatures that existed looked upon them.
विश्वस्मा अग्निं भुवनाय देवा वैश्वानरं केतुमह्नामक्र्ण्वन|	for all the world of life the gods made agni vaiśvānara to be the days bright banner.
आ यस्ततानोषसो विभातीरपो ऊर्णोति तमोर्चिषा यन|	him who hath spread abroad the radiant mornings and coming with his light unveils the darkness.
वैश्वानरं कवयो यज्ञियासोअग्निं देवा अजनयन्नजुर्यम|	the wise and holy deities engendered agni vaiśvānara whom age neer touches.
नक्षत्रं परत्नममिनच्चरिष्णु यक्षस्याध्यक्षन्तविषं बर्हन्तम|	the ancient star that wanders on for ever lofty and strong lord of the living being.
वैश्वानरं विश्वहा दीदिवांसं मन्त्रैरग्निं कविमछा वदामः|	we call upon the sage with holy verses agni vaiśvānara the everbeaming.
यो महिम्ना परिबभूवोर्वी उतावस्तादुतदेवः परस्तात|	who hath surpassed both heaven and earth in greatness he is a god below a god above us.
दवे सरुती अश्र्णवं पितॄणामहं देवानामुतमर्त्यानाम|	i have heard mention of two several pathways ways of the fathers and of gods and mortals.
ताभ्यामिदं विश्वमेजत समेति यदन्तरापितरं मातरं च|	on these two paths each moving creature travels each thing between the father and the mother.
दवे समीची बिभ्र्तश्चरन्तं शीर्षतो जातं मनसाविम्र्ष्टम|	these two united paths bear him who journeys born from the head and pondered with the spirit.
स परत्यं विश्वा भुवनानि तस्थावप्रयुछन्तरणिर्भ्राजमानः|	he stands directed to all things existing hasting unresting in his fiery splendour.
यत्रा वदेते अवरः परश्च यज्ञन्योः कतरो नौ वि वेद|	which of us twain knows where they speak together upper and lower of the two riteleaders.
आ शेकुरित सधमादं सखायो नक्षन्त यज्ञं कैदं वि वोचत|	our friends have helped to gather our assembly they came to sacrifice who will announce it.
कत्यग्नयः कति सूर्यासः कत्युषासः कत्यु सविदापः|	how many are the fires and suns in number what is the number of the dawns and waters.
नोपस्पिजं वः पितरो वदामि पर्छामि वः कवयोविद्मने कम|	not jestingly i speak to you o fathers sages i ask you this for information.
यावन्मात्रमुषसो न परतीकं सुपर्ण्यो वसतेमातरिश्वः|	as great as is the fairwinged mornings presence to him who dwells beside us mātariśvan.
तावद दधात्युप यज्ञमायन बराह्मणोहोतुरवरो निषीदन|	is what the brahman does when he approaches to sacrifice and sits below the hotar.
यज्ञस्य वो रथ्यं विश्पतिं विशां होतारमक्तोरतिथिं विभावसुम|	i praise your charioteer of sacrifice the lord of men priest of the tribes refulgent guest of night.
शोचञ्छुष्कासु हरिणीषु जर्भुरद्व्र्षा केतुर्यजतो दयामशायत|	blazing amid dry plants snatching amid the green the strong the holy herald hath attained to heaven.
इममञ्जस्पामुभये अक्र्ण्वत धर्माणमग्निं विदथस्यसाधनम|	him agni gods and men have made their chief support who drinks the fatness and completes the sacrifice.
अक्तुं न यह्वमुषसः पुरोहितं तनूनपातमरुषस्य निंसते|	with kisses they caress the grandson of the red like the swift ray of light the household priest of dawn.
बळ अस्य नीथा वि पणेश्च मन्महे वया अस्य परहुताासुरत्तवे|	yea we discriminate his and the niggards ways his branches evermore are sent forth to consume.
यदा घोरासो अम्र्तत्वमाशतादिज्जनस्यदैव्यस्य चर्किरन|	when his terrific flames have reached the immortals world then men remember and extol the heavenly folk.
रतस्य हि परसितिर्द्यौरुरु वयचो नमो मह्यरमतिःपनीयसी|	for then the net of law dyaus and the wide expanse earth worship and devotion meet for highest praise.
इन्द्रो मित्रो वरुणः सं चिकित्रिरेअथो भगःसविता पूतदक्षसः|	varuṇa indra mitra were of one accord and savitar and bhaga lords of holy might.
पर रुद्रेण ययिना यन्ति सिन्धवस्तिरो महीमरमतिन्दधन्विरे|	onward with everroaming rudra speed the floods over aramati the mighty have they run.
येभिः परिज्मा परियन्नुरु जरयो वि रोरुवज्जठरे विश्वमुक्षते|	with them parijman moving round his vast domain loud bellowing bedews all things that are within.
कराणा रुद्रा मरुतो विश्वक्र्ष्टयो दिवः शयेनासोसुरस्य नीळयः|	straightway the rudras maruts visiting all men falcons of dyaus homedwellers with the asura.
तेभिश्चष्टे वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमेन्द्रोदेवेभिरर्वशेभिरर्वशः|	varuṇa mitra aryaman look on with these and the swiftmoving indra with swiftmoving gods.
इन्द्रे भुजं शशमानास आशत सूरो दर्शीके वर्षणश्च पौंस्ये|	with indra have they found enjoyment they who toil in the lights beauty in the very strong ones strength.
पर ये नवस्यार्हणा ततक्षिरे युजं वज्रंन्र्षदनेषु कारवः|	the singers who in mens assemblies forged for him according to his due his friend the thunderbolt.
सूरश्चिदा हरितो अस्य रीरमदिन्द्रादा कश्चिद भयतेतवीयसः|	even the suns bay coursers hath lie held in check each one fears indra as the mightiest of all.
भीमस्य वर्ष्णो जठरादभिश्वसो दिवेदिवेसहुरि सतन्नबाधितः|	unhindered from the airs vault thunders day by day the loud triumphant breathing of the fearful bull.
सतोमं वो अद्य रुद्राय शिक्वसे कषयद्वीराय नमसादिदिष्टन|	with humble adoration show this day your song of praise to mighty rudra ruler of the brave.
येभिः शिवः सववानेवयावभिर्दिवःसिषक्ति सवयशा निकामभिः|	with whom the eager ones going their ordered course he comes from heaven selfbright auspicious strong to guard.
ते हि परजाया अभरन्त वि शरवो बर्हस्पतिर्व्र्षभःसोमजामयः|	for these have spread abroad the fame of human kind the bull bṛhaspati and somas brotherhood.
यज्ञैरथर्वा परथमो वि धारयद देवादक्षैर्भ्र्गवः सं चिकित्रिरे|	atharvan first by sacrifices made men sure through skill the bhṛgus were esteemed of all as gods.
ते हि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूरिरेतसा नराशंसश्चतुरङगोयमोअदितिः|	for these the earth and heaven with their abundant seed fourbodied narāśaṁsa yama aditi.
देवस्त्वष्टा दरविणोदा रभुक्षणः पररोदसी मरुतो विष्णुरर्हिरे|	god tvaṣṭar wealthbestower the Ṛbhukṣaṇas rodasī maruts viṣṇu claim and merit praise.
उत सय न उशिजामुर्विया कविरहिः शर्णोतु बुध्न्योहवीमनि|	and may he too give car the sage from far away the dragon of the deep to this our yearning call.
सूर्यामासा विचरन्ता दिविक्षिता धियाशमीनहुषी अस्य बोधतम|	ye sun and moon who dwell in heaven and move in turn and with your thought o earth and sky observe this well.
पर नः पूषा चरथं विश्वदेव्योअपां नपादवतुवायुरिष्टये|	dear to all gods may pūṣan guard the ways we go the waters child and vāyu help us to success.
आत्मानं वस्यो अभि वातमर्चत तदश्विना सुहवा यामनि शरुतम|	sing lauds for your great bliss to wind the breath of all ye aśvins prompt to hear hear this upon your way.
विशामासामभयानामधिक्षितं गीर्भिरु सवयशसंग्र्णीमसि|	with hymns of praise we sing him who is throned as lord over these fearless tribes the selfresplendent one.
गनाभिर्विश्वाभिरदितिमनर्वणमक्तोर्युवानं नर्मणा अधा पतिम|	we praise nights youthful lord benevolent to men the foeless one the free with all celestial dames.
रेभदत्र जनुषा पूर्वो अङगिरा गरावाण ऊर्ध्वा अभिचक्षुरध्वरम|	by reason of his birth here aṅgiras first sang the pressingstones upraised beheld the sacrifice.
येभिर्विहाया अभवद विचक्षणःपाथः सुमेकं सवधितिर्वनन्वति|	the stones through which the sage became exceeding vast and the sharp axe obtains in fight the beauteous place.
तीव्रस्याभिवयसो अस्य पाहि सर्वरथा वि हरी इह मुञ्च|	taste this strong draught enriched with offered viands with all thy chariot here unyoke thy coursers.
इन्द्र मा तवा यजमानासो अन्ये नि रीरमन तुभ्यमिमेसुतासः|	let not those other sacrificers stay thee indra these juices shed for thee are ready.
तुभ्यं सुतास्तुभ्यमु सोत्वासस्त्वां गिरः शवात्र्याा हवयन्ति|	thine is the juice effused thine are the juices yet to be pressed our resonant songs invite thee.
इन्द्रेदमद्य सवनं जुषाणो विश्वस्यविद्वानिह पाहि सोमम|	o indra pleased today with this libation come thou who knowest all and drink the soma.
य उशता मनसा सोममस्मै सर्वह्र्दा देवकामः सुनोति|	whoso devoted to the god effuses soma for him with yearning heart and spirit.
न गा इन्द्रस्तस्य परा ददाति परशस्तमिच्चारुमस्मैक्र्णोति|	never doth indra give away his cattle for him he makes the lovely soma famous.
अनुस्पष्टो भवत्येषो अस्य यो अस्मै रेवान न सुनोति सोमम|	he looks with ioving favour on the mortal who like a rich man pours for him the soma.
निररत्नौ मघवा तं दधाति बरह्मद्विषो हन्त्यनानुदिष्टः|	maghavan in his bended arm supports him he slays unasked the men who hate devotion.
अश्वायन्तो गव्यन्तो वाजयन्तो हवामहे तवोपगन्तवा उ|	we call on thee to come to us desirous of goods and spoil of cattle and of horses.
आभूषन्तस्ते सुमतौ नवायां वयमिन्द्र तवा शुनंहुवेम|	for thy new love and favour are we present let us invoke thee indra as our welfare.
ईजानमिद दयौर्गूर्तावसुरीजानं भूमिरभिप्रभूषणि|	may dyaus the lord of lauded wealth and earth stand by the man who offers sacrifice.
ईजानं देवावश्विनावभि सुम्नैरवर्धताम|	and may the aśvins both the gods strengthen the worshipper with bliss.
ता वां मित्रावरुणा धारयत्क्षिती सुषुम्नेषितत्वतायजामसि|	as such we honour you mitra and varuṇa with hasty zeal most blest you who sustain the folk.
युवोः कराणाय सख्यैरभि षयाम रक्षसः|	so may we through your friendship for the worshipper subdue the fiends.
अधा चिन नु यद दिधिषामहे वामभि परियं रेक्णःपत्यमानाः|	and when we seek to win your love and friendship weẉho have precious wealth in our possession.
दद्वान वा यत पुष्यति रेक्णः सं वारन्नकिरस्य मघानि|	or when the worshipper augments his riches let not his treasures be shut up.
असावन्यो असुर सूयत दयौस्त्वं विश्वेषां वरुणासिराजा|	that other asura too was born of heaven thou art o varuṇa the king of all men.
मूर्धा रथस्य चाकन नैतावतैनसान्तकध्रुक|	the chariots lord was well content forbearing to anger death by sin so great.
अस्मिन सवेतच्छकपूत एनो हिते मित्रे निगतान हन्ति वीरान|	this sin hath sakaputa here committed heroes who fled to their dear friend he slayeth.
अवोर्वा यद धात तनूष्ववः परियासु यज्ञियास्वर्वा|	when the steed bringeth down your grace and favour in bodies dear and worshipful.
युवोर्हि मातादितिर्विचेतसा दयौर्न भूमिः पयसापुपूतनि|	your mother aditi ye wise was purified with water even as earth is purified from heaven.
अव परिया दिदिष्टन सूरो निनिक्त रश्मिभिः|	show love and kindness here below wash her in rays of heavenly light.
युवं हयप्नराजावसीदतं तिष्ठद रथं नधूर्षदं वनर्षदम|	ye twain have seated you as lords of wealth as one who mounts a car to him who sits upon the pole upon the wood.
ता नः कणूकयन्तीर्न्र्मेधस्तत्रे अंहसः सुमेधस्तत्रे अंहसः|	these our disheartened tribes nrmedhas saved from woe sumedhas saved from woe.
परावेपा मा बर्हतो मादयन्ति परवातेजा इरिणे वर्व्र्तानाः|	sprung from tall trees on windy heights these rollers transport me as they turn upon the table.
सोमस्येव मौजवतस्य भक्षो विभीदको जाग्र्विर्मह्यमछान|	dearer to me the die that never slumbers than the deep draught of mujavans own soma.
न मा मिमेथ न जिहीळ एषा शिवा सखिभ्य उत मह्यमासीत|	she never vexed me nor was angry with me but to my friends and me was ever gracious.
अक्षस्याहमेकपरस्य हेतोरनुव्रतामप जायामरोधम|	for the dies sake whose single point is final mine own devoted wife i alienated.
दवेष्टि शवश्रूरप जाया रुणद्धि न नाथितो विन्दतेमर्डितारम|	my wife holds me aloof her mother hates me the wretched man finds none to give him comfort.
अश्वस्येव जरतो वस्न्यस्य नाहं विन्दामिकितवस्य भोगम|	as of a costly horse grown old and feeble i find not any profit of the gamester.
अन्ये जायां परि मर्शन्त्यस्य यस्याग्र्धद वेदने वाज्यक्षः|	others caress the wife of him whose riches the die hath coveted that rapid courser.
पिता मता भरातर एनमाहुर्न जानीमो नयताबद्धमेतम|	of him speak father mother brothers saying we know him not bind him and take him with you.
यदादीध्ये न दविषाण्येभिः परायद्भ्योअव हीयेसखिभ्यः|	when i resolve to play with these no longer my friends depart from me and leave me lonely.
नयुप्ताश्च बभ्रवो वाचमक्रतनेमीदेषां निष्क्र्तं जारिणीव|	when the brown dice thrown on the board have rattled like a fond girl i seek the place of meeting.
सभामेति कितवः पर्छमानो जेष्यामीति तन्वाशूशुजानः|	the gamester seeks the gamblinghouse and wonders his body all afire shall i be lucky.
अक्षासो अस्य वि तिरन्ति कामं परतिदीव्नेदधत आ कर्तानि|	still do the dice extend his eager longing staking his gains against his adversary.
अक्षास इदनकुशिनो नितोदिनो निक्र्त्वानस्तपनास्तापयिष्णवः|	dice verily are armed with goads and drivinghooks deceiving and tormenting causing grievous woe.
कुमारदेष्णा जयतः पुनर्हणो मध्वासम्प्र्क्ताः कितवस्य बर्हणा|	they give frail gifts and then destroy the man who wins thickly anointed with the players fairest good.
तरिपञ्चाशः करीळति वरात एषां देव इव सवितासत्यधर्मा|	merrily sports their troop the threeandfifty like savitar the god whose ways are faithful.
उग्रस्य चिन मन्यवे ना नमन्ते राजा चिदेभ्योनम इत कर्णोति|	they bend not even to the mightys anger the king himself pays homage and reveres them.
नीचा वर्तन्त उपरि सफुरन्त्यहस्तासो हस्तवन्तं सहन्ते|	downward they roll and then spring quickly upward and handless force the man with hands to serve them.
दिव्या अङगारा इरिणे नयुप्ताः शीताः सन्तो हर्दयंनिर्दहन्ति|	cast on the board like lumps of magic charcoal though cold themselves they burn the heart to ashes.
जाया तप्यते कितवस्य हीना माता पुत्रस्य चरतः कवस्वित|	the gamblers wife is left forlorn and wretched the mother mourns the son who wanders homeless.
रणावा बिभ्यद धनमिछमानोअन्येषामस्तमुपनक्तमेति|	in constant fear in debt and seeking riches he goes by night unto the home of others.
सत्रियं दर्ष्ट्वाय कितवं ततापान्येषां जायांसुक्र्तं च योनिम|	sad is the gambler when he sees a matron anothers wife and his wellordered dwelling.
पूर्वाह्णे अश्वान युयुजे हि बभ्रून सोग्नेरन्ते वर्षलः पपाद|	he yokes the brown steeds in the early morning and when the fire is cold sinks down an outcast.
यो वः सेनानीर्महतो गणस्य राजा वरातस्य परथमोबभूव|	to the great captain of your mighty army who hath become the hosts imperial leader.
तस्मै कर्णोमि न धना रुणध्मि दशाहम्प्राचीस्तद रतं वदामि|	to him i show my ten extended fingers i speak the truth no wealth am i withholding.
अक्षैर्मा दीव्यः कर्षिमित कर्षस्व वित्ते रमस्व बहुमन्यमानः|	play not with dice no cultivate thy cornland enjoy the gain and deem that wealth sufficient.
तत्र गावः कितव तत्र जाया तन मे विचष्टे सवितायमर्यः|	there are thy cattle there thy wife o gambler so this good savitar himself hath told me.
मित्रं कर्णुध्वं खलु मर्लता नो मा नो घोरेण चरताभिध्र्ष्णु|	make me your friend show us some little mercy assail us not with your terrific fierceness.
नि वो नु मन्युर्विशतामरातिरन्यो बभ्रूणाम्प्रसितौ नवस्तु|	appeased be your malignity and anger and let the brown dice snare some other captive.
अग्निं हिन्वन्तु नो धियः सप्तिमाशुमिवाजिषु|	let songs of ours speed agni forth like a fleet courser in the race.
तेन जेष्मधनंधनम|	and we will win each prize through him.
यया गा आकरामहे सेनयाग्ने तवोत्या|	agni the dart whereby we gain kine for ourselves with help from thee.
तां नो हिन्वमघत्तये|	that send us for the gain of wealth.
आग्ने सथूरं रयिं भर पर्थुं गोमन्तमश्विनम|	o agni bring us wealth secure vast wealth in horses and in kine.
अंधिखं वर्तया पणिम|	oil thou the socket turn the wheel.
अग्ने नक्षत्रमजरमा सूर्यं रोहयो दिवि|	o agni thou hast made the sun eternal star to mount the sky.
दधज्ज्योतिर्जनेभ्यः|	bestowing light on living men.
अग्ने केतुर्विशामसि परेष्ठः शरेष्ठ उपस्थसत|	thou agni art the peoples light best dearest seated in thy shrine.
बोधा सतोत्रे वयो दधत|	watch for the singer give him life.
अयमग्ने जरिता तवे अभूदपि सहसः सूनो नह्यन्यदस्त्याप्यम|	with thee o agni was this singer of the laud he hath no other kinship o thou son of strength.
भद्रं हि शर्म तरिवरूथमस्ति त आरेहिंसानामप दिद्युमा कर्धि|	thou givest blessed shelter with a triple guard keep the destructive lightning far away from us.
परवत ते अग्ने जनिमा पितूयतः साचीव विश्वा भुवना नय्र्ञ्जसे|	thy birth who seekest food is in the falling flood agni as comrade thou winnest all living things.
पर सप्तयः पर सनिषन्त नो धियः पुरश्चरन्तिपशुपा इव तमना|	our coursers and our songs shall be victorious they of themselves advance like one who guards the herd.
उत वा उ परि वर्णक्षि बप्सद बहोरग्न उलपस्य सवधावः|	and thou o agni thou of godlike nature sparest the stones while caring up the brushwood.
उत खिल्या उर्वराणां भवन्ति मा ते हेतिं तविषींचुक्रुधाम|	then are thy tracks like deserts in the cornlands let us not stir to wrath thy mighty arrow.
यदुद्वतो निवतो यासि बप्सत पर्थगेषि परगर्धिनीवसेना|	oer hills through vales devouring as thou goest thou partest like an army fain for booty.
यदा ते वातो अनुवाति शोचिर्वप्तेव शमश्रु वपसिप्र भूम|	as when a barber shaves a beard thou shavest earth when the wind blows on thy flame and fans it.
परत्यस्य शरेणयो दद्र्श्र एकं नियानं बहवो रथासः|	apparent are his lines as he approaches the course is single but the cars are many.
बाहू यदग्ने अनुमर्म्र्जानो नयंं उत्तानामन्वेषिभूमिम|	when agni thou making thine arms resplendent advancest oer the land spread out beneath thee.
उत ते शुष्मा जिहतामुत ते अर्चिरुत ते अग्ने शशमानस्यवाजाः|	now let thy strength thy burning flames fly upward thine energies o agni as thou toilest.
उच्छ्वञ्चस्व नि नम वर्धमान आ तवाद्य विश्वेवसवः सदन्तु|	gape widely bend thee waxing in thy vigour let all the vasus sit this day beside thee.
अपामिदं नययनं समुद्रस्य निवेशनम|	this is the waters reservoir the great abode of gathered streams.
अन्यंक्र्णुष्वेतः पन्थां तेन याहि वशाननु|	take thou another path than this and as thou listest walk thereon.
आयने ते परायणे दूर्वा रोहन्तु पुष्पिणिः|	on thy way hitherward and hence let flowery durva grass spring up.
हरदाश्चपुण्डरीकाणि समुद्रस्य गर्हा इमे|	let there be lakes with lotus blooms these are the mansions of the flood.
न तमंहो न दुरितं देवासो अष्ट मर्त्यम|	no peril no severe distress ye gods affects the mortal man.
सजोषसोयमर्यमा मित्रो नयन्ति वरुणो अति दविषः|	whom aryaman and mitra lead and varima of one accord beyond his foes.
तद धि वयं वर्णीमहे वरुण मित्रार्यमन|	this very thing do we desire varuṇa mitra aryaman.
येना निरंहसो यूयं पाथ नेथा च मर्त्यमति दविषः|	whereby ye guhrd the mortal man from sore distress and lead him safe beyond his foes.
ते नूनं नोअयमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	these are each one our present helps varuṇa mitra aryaman.
नयिष्था उनो नेषणि पर्षिष्ठा उ नः पर्षण्यति दविषः|	best leaders best deliverers to lead us on and bear as safe beyond our foes.
यूयं विश्वं परि पाथ वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	ye compass round and guard each man varuṇa mitra aryaman.
युष्माकंशर्मणि परिये सयाम सुप्रणीतयोअति दविषः|	in your dear keeping may we be ye who are excellent as guides beyond our foes.
आदित्यासो अति सरिधो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	Ādityas are beyond all foesvaruṇa mitra aryaman.
उग्रं मरुद्भीरुद्रं हुवेमेन्द्रमग्निं सवस्तयेअति दविषः|	strong rudra with the marut host indra agni let us call for weal beyond our foes.
नेतार ऊ षु णस्तिरो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	these lead us safely over all varuṇa mitra aryaman.
अति विश्वानिदुरिता राजानश्चर्षणीनामति दविषः|	these who are kings of living men over all troubles far away beyond our foes.
शुनमस्मभ्यमूतये वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा|	may they give bliss to aid us well varuṇa mitra aryaman.
शर्म यछन्तुसप्रथ आदित्यासो यदीमहे अति दविषः|	may the Ādityas when we pray grant us wide shelter and defence beyond our foes.
यथा ह तयद वसवो गौर्यं चित पदि षिताममुञ्चतायजत्राः|	as in this place o holy ones ye vasus freed even the gaud when her feet were fettered.
एवो षवस्मन मुञ्चता वयंहः पर तार्यग्नेप्रतरं न आयुः|	so free us now from trouble and affliction and let our life be lengthened still o api.
पिबा सोमं महत इन्द्रियाय पिबा वर्त्राय हन्तवेशविष्ठ|	drink soma juice for mighty power and vigour drink strongest one that thou mayst smite down vṛtra.
पिब राये शवसे हूयमानः पिब मध्वस्त्र्पदिन्द्रा वर्षस्व|	drink thou invoked for strength and riches drink thou thy fill of meath and pour it down o indra.
अस्य पिब कषुमतः परस्थितस्येन्द्र सोमस्य वरमासुतश्य|	drink of the foodful juice stirred into motion drink what thou choosest of the flowing soma.
सवस्तिदा मनसा मादयस्वार्वाचीनो रेवतेसौभगाय|	giver of weal be joyful in thy spirit and turn thee hitherward to bless and prosper.
ममत्तु तवा दिव्यः सोम इन्द्र ममत्तु यः सूयतेपार्थिवेषु|	let heavenly soma gladden thee o indra let that effused among mankind delight thee.
ममत्तु येन वरिवश्चकर्थ ममत्तु येननिरिणासि शत्रून|	rejoice in that whereby thou gavest freedom and that whereby thou conquerest thy foemen.
आ दविबर्हा अमिनो यात्विन्द्रो वर्षा हरिभ्यां परिषिक्तमन्धः|	let indra come impetuous doubly mighty to the poured juice the bull with two bay coursers.
गव्या सुतस्य परभ्र्तस्य मध्वः सत्रा खेदामरुशहा वर्षस्व|	with juices pressed in milk with meath presented glut evermore thy bolt o foedestroyer.
नि तिग्मानि भराशयन भराश्यान्यव सथिरा तनुहियातुजूनाम|	dash down outffaming their sharp flaming weapons the strongholds of the men urged on by demons.
उग्राय ते सहो बलं ददामि परतीत्याशत्रून विगदेषु वर्श्च|	i give thee mighty one great strength and conquest go meet thy foes and rend them in the battle.
वयर्य इन्द्र तनुहि शरवांस्योज सथिरेव धन्वनोऽभिमातीः|	extend afar the votarys fame and glory as the firm archers strength drives off the foeman.
अस्मद्र्यग वाव्र्धानः सहोभिरनिभ्र्ष्टस्तन्वं वाव्र्धस्व|	ranged on our side grown strong in might that conquers never defeated still increase thy body.
इदं हविर्मघवन तुभ्यं रातं परति सम्राळ अह्र्णानोग्र्भाय|	to thee have we presented this oblation accept it sovran ruler free from anger.
तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन तुभ्यं पक्वोअद्धीन्द्र पिबच परस्थितस्य|	juice maghavan for thee is pressed and ripened eat indra drink of that which stirs to meet thee.
अद्धीदिन्द्र परस्थितेमा हवींषि चनो दधिष्व पचतोतसोमम|	eat indra these oblations which approach thee be pleased with food made ready and with soma.
परयस्वन्तः परति हर्यामसि तवा सत्याः सन्तुयजमानस्य कामाः|	with entertainment we receive thee friendly effectual be the sacrificers wishes.
परेन्द्राग्निभ्यां सुवचस्यामियर्मि सिन्धाविव परेरयंनावमर्कैः|	i send sweet speech to indra and to agni with hymns i speed it like a boat through waters.
अया इव परि चरन्ति देवा ये अस्मभ्यन्धनदा उद्भिदश्च|	even thus the gods seem moving round about me the fountains and bestowers of our riches.
वसुं न चित्रमहसं गर्णीषे वामं शेवमतिथिमद्विषेण्यम|	i praise the god of wondrous might like indra the lovely pleasant guest whom all must welcome.
स रासते शुरुधो विश्वधायसोअग्निर्होताग्र्हपतिः सुवीर्यम|	may agni priest and master of the household give hero strength and allsustaining riches.
जुषाणो अग्ने परति हर्य मे वचो विश्वानि विद्वान वयुनानिसुक्रतो|	o agni graciously accept this song of mine thou passingwise who knowest every ordinance.
घर्तनिर्णिग बरह्मणे गातुमेरय तव देवाजनयन्ननु वरतम|	enwrapped in holy oil further the course of prayer the gods bestow according to thy holy law.
सप्त धामानि परियन्नमर्त्यो दाशद दाशुषे सुक्र्तेमामहस्व|	immortal wandering round the seven stations give a liberal giver to the pious worshipper.
सुवीरेण रयिणाग्ने सवाभुवा यस्त आनट्समिधा तं जुषस्व|	wealth agni with brave sons and ready for his use welcome the man who comes with fuel unto thee.
यज्ञस्य केतुं परथमं पुरोहितं हविष्मन्त ईळते सप्तवाजिनम|	the seven who bring oblations worship thee the strong the first the great chief priest ensign of sacrifice.
शर्ण्वन्तमग्निं घर्तप्र्ष्ठमुक्षणम्प्र्णन्तं देवं पर्णते सुवीर्यम|	the oilanointed bull agni who hears who sends as god full hero strength to him who freely gives.
टवं दूतः परथमो वरेण्यः स हूयमानो अम्र्तायमत्स्व|	first messenger art thou meet for election drink thou thy fill invited to the anirta.
तवां मर्जयन मरुतो दाशुषो गर्हे तवां सतोमेभिर्भ्र्गवो वि रुरुचुः|	the maruts in the votarys house adorned thee with lauds the bhṛgus gave thee light and glory.
इषं दुहन सुदुघां विश्वधायसं यज्ञप्रियेयजमानाय सुक्रतो|	milking the teeming cow for allsustaining food o wise one for the worshiploving worshipper.
अग्ने घर्तस्नुस्त्रिरतानि दीद्यद्वर्तिर्यज्ञं परियन सुक्रतूयसे|	thou agni dropping oil thrice lighting works of law showest thy wisdom circling home and sacrifice.
तवामिदस्या उषसो वयुष्टिषु दूतं कर्ण्वाना अयजन्तमानुषाः|	they who at flushing of this dawn appointed thee their messenger these men have paid thee reverence.
तवां देवा महयाय्याय वाव्र्धुराज्यमग्नेनिम्र्जन्तो अध्वरे|	gods strengthened thee for work that must be glorified agni while they made butter pure for sacrifice.
नि तवा वसिष्ठा अह्वन्त वाजिनं गर्णन्तो अग्ने विदथेषुवेधसः|	arrangers in our synods agni while they sang vasisistha s sons have called thee down the potent one.
रायस पोषं यजमानेषु धारय यूयं पातस्वस्तिभिः सदा नः|	maintain the growth of wealth with men who sacrifice ye gods preserve us with your blessings evermore.
सवस्ति नो दिवो अग्ने पर्थिव्या विश्वायुर्धेहि यजथाय देव|	o agni shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven.
सचेमहि तव दस्म परकेतैरुरुष्या ण उरुभिर्देवशंसैः|	with us be thine intelligence wonderworker protect us god with thy farreaching blessings.
इमा अग्ने मतयस्तुभ्यं जाता गोभिरश्वैरभि गर्णन्तिरधः|	these hymns brought forth for thee o agni laud thee for bounteous gifts with cattle and with horses.
यदा ते मर्तो अनु भोगमानड वसो दधानोमतिभिः सुजात|	good lord when man from thee hath gained enjoyment by hymns o noblyborn hath he obtained it.
अग्निं मन्ये पितरमग्निमापिमग्निं भरातरं सदमित्सखायम|	agni i deem my kinsman and my father count him my brother and my friend for ever.
अग्नेरनीकं बर्हतः सपर्यं दिवि शुक्रंयजतं सूर्यस्य|	i honour as the face of lofty agni in heaven the bright and holy light of sūrya.
सिध्रा अग्ने धियो अस्मे सनुत्रीर्यं तरायसे दम आनित्यहोता|	effectual agni are our prayers for profit he whom at home thou priest for ever guardest.
रतवा स रोहिदश्वः पुरुक्षुर्द्युभिरस्माहभिर्वाममस्तु|	is rich in food drawn by red steeds and holy by day and night to him shall all be pleasant.
दयुभिर्हितं मित्रमिव परयोगं परत्नं रत्विजमध्वरस्यजारम|	men with their arms have generated agni helpful as some kind friend adorned with splendours.
बाहुभ्यामग्निमायवोअजनन्त विक्षु होतारं नयसादयन्त|	and stablished as invoker mid the people the ancient priest the sacrifices lover.
सवयं यजस्व दिवि देव देवान किं ते पाकः कर्णवदप्रचेताः|	worship thyself o god the gods in heaven what void of knowledge shall the fool avail thee.
यथायज रतुभिर्देव देवानेवा यजस्वतन्वं सुजात|	as thou o god hast worshipped gods by seasons so noblyborn to thine own self pay worship.
भवा नो अग्नेअवितोत गोपा भवा वयस्क्र्दुत नोवयोधाः|	agni be thou our guardian and protector bestow upon us life and vital vigour.
रास्वा च नः सुमहो हव्यदातिं तरास्वोत नस्तन्वो अप्रयुछन|	accept o mighty one the gifts we offer and with unceasing care protect our bodies.
अग्निरिन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा वायुः पूषा सरस्वतीसजोषसः|	may agni indra mitra varuṇa consent aryaman vāyu pūṣan and sarasvatī.
आदित्या विष्णुर्मरुतः सवर्ब्र्हत सोमो रुद्रोदितिर्ब्रह्मणस पतिः|	Ādityas maruts viṣṇu soma lofty sky rudra and aditi and brahmaṇaspati.
इन्द्राग्नी वर्त्रहत्येषु सत्पती मिथो हिन्वाना तन्वासमोकसा|	indra and agni herolords when vṛtra fell dwelling together speeding emulously on.
अन्तरिक्षं मह्या पप्रुरोजसा सोमो घर्तश्रीर्महिमानमीरयन|	and soma blent with oil putting his greatness forth have with their power filled full the mighty firmament.
तेषां हि मह्ना महतामनर्वणां सतोमानियर्म्य्र्तज्ञा रताव्र्धाम|	skilled in the law i lift the hymn of praise to these lawstrengtheners unassailed and great in majesty.
ये अप्सवमर्णवं चित्रराधसस्तेनो रासन्तां महये सुमित्र्याः|	these in their wondrous bounty send the watery sea may they as kindly friends send gifts to make us great.
सवर्णरमन्तरिक्षाणि रोचना दयावाभूमी पर्थिवींस्कम्भुरोजसा|	they with their might have stayed heaven earth and prthivi the lord of light the firmament the lustrous spheres.
पर्क्षा इव महयन्तः सुरातयो देवास्तवन्ते मनुषाय सूरयः|	even as fleetfoot steeds who make their masters glad the princely gods are praised most bountiful to man.
मित्राय शिक्ष वरुणाय दाशुषे या सम्राजा मनसा नप्रयुछतः|	bring gifts to mitra and to varuṇa who lords of all in spirit never fail the worshipper.
ययोर्धाम धर्मणा रोचते बर्हद ययोरुभेरोदसी नाधसी वर्तौ|	whose statute shines on high through everlasting law whose places of sure refuge are the heavens and earth.
या गौर्वर्तनिं पर्येति निष्क्र्तं पयो दुहाना वरतनीरवारतः|	the cow who yielding milk goes her appointed way hither to us as leader of holy rites.
सा परब्रुवाणा वरुणाय दाशुषे देवेभ्योदाशद धविषा विवस्वते|	speaking aloud to varuṇa and the worshipper shall with oblation serve vivasvān and the gods.
दिवक्षसो अग्निजिह्वा रताव्र्ध रतस्य योनिं विम्र्शन्त आसते|	the gods whose tongue is agni dwell in heaven and sit aiders of law reflecting in the seat of law.
दयां सकभित्व्यप आ चक्रुरोजसा यज्ञं जनित्वीतन्वी नि माम्र्जुः|	they propped up heaven and then brought waters with their might got sacrifice and in a body made it fair.
परिक्षिता पितरा पूर्वजावरी रतस्य योना कषयतःसमोकसा|	born in the oldest time the parents dwelling round are sharers of one mansion in the home of law.
दयावाप्र्थिवी वरुणाय सव्रते घर्तवत पयोमहिषाय पिन्वतः|	bound by their common vow dyaus prthivi stream forth the moisture rich in oil to varuṇa the steer.
पर्जन्यावाता वर्षभा पुरीषिणेन्द्रवायू वरुणो मित्रोर्यमा|	parjanya vāta mighty senders of the rain indra and vāyu varuṇa mitra aryaman.
देवानादित्यानदितिं हवामहे ये पार्थिवासोदिव्यासो अप्सु ये|	we call on aditi Ādityas and the gods those who are on the earth in waters and in heaven.
तवष्टारं वायुं रभवो य ओहते दैव्या होतारा उषसंस्वस्तये|	tvaṣṭar and vāyu those who count as Ṛbhus both celestial hotarpriests and dawn for happiness.
बर्हस्पतिं वर्त्रखादं सुमेधसमिन्द्रियंसोमं धनसा उ ईमहे|	winners of wealth we call and wise bṛhaspati destroyer of our foes and soma indras friend.
बरह्म गामश्वं जनयन्त ओषधीर्वनस्पतीन पर्थिवीम्पर्वतानपः|	they generated prayer the cow the horse the plants the forest trees the earth the waters and the hills.
सूर्यं दिवि रोहयन्तः सुदानव आर्याव्रता विस्र्जन्तो अधि कषमि|	these very bounteous gods made the sun mount to heaven and spread the righteous laws of Āryas oer the land.
भुज्युमंहसः पिप्र्थो निरश्विना शयावं पुत्रंवध्रिमत्या अजिन्वतम|	o aśvins ye delivered bhujyu from distress ye animated Śyāva vadhrmatis son.
कमद्युवं विमदायोहथुर्युवंविष्णाप्वं विश्वकायाव सर्जथः|	to vimada ye brought his consort kamadyu and gave his lost viṣṇāpū back to viśvaka.
पावीरवी तन्यतुरेकपादजो दिवो धर्ता सिन्धुरापःसमुद्रियः|	thunder the lightnings daughter ajaekapād heavens bearer sindhu and the waters of the sea.
विश्वे देवासः शर्णवन वचांसि मे सरस्वतीसह धीभिः पुरन्ध्या|	hear all the gods my words sarasvatī give ear together with purandhi and with holy thoughts.
विश्वे देवाः सह धीभिः पुरन्ध्या मनोर्यजत्राम्र्ता रतज्ञाः|	with holy thoughts and with purandhi may all gods knowing the law immortal manus holy ones.
रातिषाचो अभिषाचः सवर्विदः सवर्गिरो बरह्म सूक्तं जुषेरत|	boongivers favourers finders of light and heaven with gracious love accept my songs my prayer my hymn.
देवान वसिष्ठो अम्र्तान ववन्दे ये विश्वा भुवनाभिप्रतस्थुः|	immortal gods have i vasiṣṭha lauded gods set on high above all other beings.
ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पातस्वस्तिभिः सदा नः|	may they this day grant us wide space and freedom ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings.
बर्हस्पतिर्नयतु दुर्गहा तिरः पुनर्नेषदघशंसायमन्म|	bṚhaspati lead us safely over troubles and turn his evil thought against the sinner.
कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः|	repel the curse and drive away illfeeling and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.
नराशंसो नोअवतु परयाजे शं नो अस्त्वनुयाजो हवेषु|	may narāśaṁsa aid us at prayāja blest be our anuyāja at invokings.
कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद यजमानायशं योः|	may he repel the curse and chase illfeeling and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.
तपुर्मूर्धा तपतु रक्षसो ये बरह्मद्विषः शरवेहन्तवा उ|	may he whose head is flaming burn the demons haters of prayer so that the arrow slay them.
कषिपदशस्तिमप दुर्मतिं हन्नथा करद्यजमानाय शं योः|	may he repel the curse and chase illfeeling and give the sacrificer peace and comfort.
तदिदास भुवनेषु जयेष्ठं यतो जज्ञ उग्रस्त्वेषन्र्म्णः|	in all the worlds that was the best and highest whence sprang the mighty gods of splendid valour.
सद्यो जज्ञानो नि रिणाति शत्रूननु यंविश्वे मदन्त्यूमाः|	as soon as born he overcomes his foemen be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.
वाव्र्धानः शवसा भूर्योजाः शत्रुर्दासाय भियसन्दधाति|	grown mighty in his strength with ample vigour he as a foe strikes fear into the dāsa.
अव्यनच्च वयनच्च सस्नि सं ते नवन्त परभ्र्तामदेषु|	eager to win the breathing and the breathless all sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.
तवे करतुमपि वर्ञ्जन्ति विश्वे दविर्यदेते तरिर्भवन्त्यूमाः|	all concentrate on thee their mental vigour what time these twice or thrice are thine assistants.
सवादोः सवादीयः सवादुना सर्जा समदः सुमधु मधुनाभि योधीः|	blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness win quickly with our meath that meath in battle.
इति चिद धि तवा धना जयन्तं मदेमदे अनुमदन्ति विप्राः|	therefore in thee too thou who winnest riches at every banquet are the sages joyful.
ओजीयो धर्ष्णो सथिरमा तनुष्व मा तवा दभन्यातुधाना दुरेवाः|	with mightier power bold god extend thy firmness let not malignant yātudhānas harm thee.
तवया वयं शाशद्महे रणेषु परपश्यन्तो युधेन्यानिभूरि|	proudly we put our trust in thee in battles when we behold great wealth the prize of combat.
चोदयामि त आयुधा वचोभिः सं ते शिशामिब्रह्मणा वयांसि|	i with my words impel thy weapons onward and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.
सतुषेय्यं पुरुवर्पसं रभ्वमिनतममाप्त्यमाप्त्यानाम|	worthy of praises manyshaped most skilful most energetic Āptya of the aptyas.
आ दर्षते शवसा सप्त दानून पर साक्षते परतिमानानिभूरि|	he with his might destroys the seven danus subduing many who were deemed his equals.
