नि तद दधिषेअवरं परं च यस्मिन्नाविथावसा दुरोणे|	thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest wealth the higher and the lower.
आ मातरा सथापयसे जिगत्नू अत इनोषि कर्वरा पुरूणि|	thou stablishest the two muchwandering mothers and bringest many deeds to their completion.
इमा बरह्म बर्हद्दिवो विवक्तीन्द्राय शूषमग्रियःस्वर्षाः|	brhaddiva the foremost of lightwinners repeats these holy prayers this strength of indra.
महो गोत्रस्य कषयति सवराजो दुरश्च विश्वाव्र्णोदप सवाः|	he rules the great selfluminous fold of cattle and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.
एवा महान बर्हद्दिवो अथर्वावोचत सवां तन्वमिन्द्रमेव|	thus hath brhaddiva the great atharvan spoken to indra as himself in person.
सवसारो मातरिभ्वरीररिप्रा हिन्वन्ति च शवसावर्धयन्ति च|	the spotless sisters they who are his mothers with power exalt him and impel him onward.
अप पराच इन्द्र विश्वानमित्रानपापाचो अभिभूते नुदस्व|	drive all our enemies away o indra the western mighty conqueror and the eastern.
अपोदीचो अप शूराधराच उरौ यथा तव शर्मन्मदेम|	hero drive off our northern foes and southern that we in thy wide shelter may be joyful.
कुविदङग यवमन्तो यवं चिद यथा दान्त्यनुपूर्वंवियूय|	what then as men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in order.
इहेहैषां कर्णुहि भोजनानि ये बर्हिषोनमोव्र्क्तिं न जग्मुः|	so bring the food of those men bring it hither who went not to prepare the grass for worship.
नहि सथूर्य रतुथा यातमस्ति नोत शरवो विविदेसंगमेषु|	men come not with one horse at sacred seasons thus they obtain no honour in assemblies.
गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तोव्र्षणं वाजयन्तः|	sages desiring herds of kine and horses strengthen the mighty indra for his friendship.
युवं सुराममश्विना नमुचावासुरे सचा|	ye aśvins lords of splendour drank full draughts of grateful soma juice.
विपिपानाशुभस पती इन्द्रं कर्मस्वावतम|	and aided indra in his work with namuci of asura birth.
पुत्रमिव पितरावश्विनोभेन्द्रावथुः काव्यैर्दंसनाभिः|	as parents aid a son both aśvins indra aided thee with their wondrous powers and wisdom.
यत सुरामं वयपिबः शचीभिः सरस्वतीत्वा मघवन्नभिष्णक|	when thou with might hadst drunk the draught that gladdens sarasvatī o maghavan refreshed thee.
इन्द्रः सुत्रामा सववानवोभिः सुम्र्ळीको भवतुविश्ववेदाः|	indra is strong to save rich in assistance may he possessing all be kind and gracious.
बाधतां दवेषो अभयं कर्णोतु सुवीर्यस्यपतयः सयाम|	may he disperse our foes and give us safety and may we be the lords of hero vigou r.
तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे सयाम|	may we enjoy his favour his the holy may we enjoy his blessed loving kindness.
स सुत्रामा सववानिन्द्रो अस्मे आराच्चिद दवेषः सनुतर्युयोतु|	may this rich indra as our good protector drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.
यत ते यमं वैवस्वतं मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away to yama to vivasvāns son.
तत त आवर्तयामसीह कषयाय जीवसे|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते दिवं यत पर्थिवीं मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away that passed away to earth and heaven.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते भूमिं चतुर्भ्र्ष्टिं मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away away to the fourcornered earth.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते चतस्रः परदिशो मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away to the four quarters of the world.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते समुद्रमर्णवं मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away away unto the billowy sea.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते मरीचीः परवतो मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away to beams of light that flash and flow.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते अपो यदोषधीर्मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away went to the waters and the plants.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते सूर्यं यदुषसं मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away that visited the sun and dawn.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते पर्वतान बर्हतो मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away away to lofty mountain heights.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते विश्वमिदं जगन मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away into this all that lives and moves.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते पराः परावतो मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away to distant realms beyond our ken.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn here.
यत ते भूतं च भव्यं च मनो जगाम दूरकम|	thy spirit that went far away to all that is and is to be.
तत त|	we cause to come to thee again that thou mayst live and sojourn heie.
आ नो देवानामुप वेतु शंसो विश्वेभिस्तुरैरवसेयजत्रः|	may benediction of the gods approach us holy to aid us with all rapid succours.
तेभिर्वयं सुषखायो भवेम तरन्तो विश्वादुरिता सयाम|	therewith may we be happily befriended and pass triumphant over all our troubles.
परि चिन मर्तो दरविणं ममन्याद रतस्य पथा नमसाविवासेत|	a man should think on wealth and strive to win it by adoration on the path of order.
अत सवेन करतुना सं वदेत शरेयांसन्दक्षं मनसा जग्र्भ्यात|	counsel himself with his own mental insight and grasp still nobler vigour with his spirit.
अधायि धीतिरसस्र्ग्रमंशास्तीर्थे न दस्ममुपयन्त्युमाः|	the hymn is formed poured are the allotted portions as to a ford friends come unto the wondrous.
अभ्यानश्म सुवितस्य शूषं नवेदसोम्र्तानामभूम|	we have obtained the power of case and comfort we have become acquainted with immortals.
नित्यश्चाकन्यात सवपतिर्दामूना यस्मा उ देवः सवितजजान|	pleased be the eternal lord who loves the household with this man whom god savitar created.
भगो वा गोभिरर्यमेमनज्यात सो अस्मै चरुश्छदयदुत सयात|	may bhaga aryaman grace him with cattle may he appear to him and be delightful.
इयं सा भूया उषसामिव कष यद ध कषुमन्तःशवसा समायन|	like the dawns dwellingplace be this assembly where in their might men rich in food have gathered.
अस्य सतुतिं जरितुर्भिक्षमाणा आनः शग्मास उप यन्तु वाजाः|	striving to share the praises of this singer to us come strengthening and effectual riches.
अस्येदेषा सुमतिः पप्रथानाभवत पूर्व्या भुमनागौः|	this bulls most gracious farextended favour existed first of all in full abundance.
अस्य सनीळा असुरस्य योनौ समान आ भरणेबिभ्रमाणाः|	by his support they are maintained in common who in the asuras mansion dwell together.
किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः|	what was the tree what wood in sooth produced it from which they fashioned forth the earth and heaven.
सन्तस्थाने अजरे इतूती अहानि पूर्वीरुषसो जरन्त|	these twain stand fast and wax not old for ever these have sung praise to many a day and morning.
नैतावदेना परो अन्यदस्त्युक्षा स दयावाप्र्थिवीबिभर्ति|	not only here is this more is beyond us he is the bull the heavens and earths supporter.
तवदं पवित्रं कर्णुत सवधावान यदींसूर्यं न हरितो वहन्ति|	with power divine he makes his skin a filter when the bay coursers bear him on as sūrya.
सतेगो न कषामत्येति पर्थ्वीं मिहं न वातो वि हवाति भूम|	he passes oer the broad earth like a stega he penetrates the world as wind the mistcloud.
मित्रो यत्र वरुणो अज्यमानोअग्निर्वने न वयस्र्ष्ट शोकम|	he balmed with oil near varuṇa and mitra like agni in the wood hath shot forth splendour.
सतरीर्यत सूत सद्यो अज्यमाना वयथिरव्यथिः कर्णुतस्वगोपा|	when suddenly called the cow that erst was barren she selfprotected ended all her troubles.
पुत्रो यत पुर्वः पित्रोर्जनिष्ट शम्यां गौर्जगार यद ध पर्छान|	earth when the first son sprang from sire and mother cast up the gami that which men were seeking.
उत कण्वं नर्षदः पुत्रमाहुरुत शयावो धनमादत्तवाजि|	to nṛṣads son they gave the name of kainva and he the brownhued courser won the treasure.
पर कर्ष्णाय रुशदपिन्वतोधरतमत्र नकिरस्मा अपीपेत|	for him darkcoloured streamed the shining udder none made it swell for him thus order willed it.
यजामह इन्द्रं वज्रदक्षिणं हरीणां रथ्यंविव्रतानाम|	indra whose right hand wields the bolt we worship driver of bay steeds seeking sundered courses.
पर शमश्रु दोधुवदूर्ध्वथा भूद विसेनाभिर्दयमानो वि राधसा|	shaking his beard with might he hath arisen casting his weapons forth and dealing bounties.
हरी नवस्य या वने विदे वस्विन्द्रो मघैर्मघवाव्र्त्रहा भुवत|	the treasure which his bay steeds found at sacrificethis wealth made opulent indra slayer of the foe.
रभुर्वाज रभुक्षाः पत्यते शवोअवक्ष्णौमि दासस्य नाम चित|	Ṛbhu Ṛbhukṣan vājahe is lord of might the dāsas very name i utterly destroy.
यदा वज्रं हिरण्यमिदथा रथं हरी यमस्यवहतो वि सूरिभिः|	when with the princes maghavari famed of old comes nigh the thunderbolt of gold and the controllers car.
आ तिष्ठति मघवा सनश्रुत इन्द्रोवाजस्य दीर्घश्रवसस पतिः|	which his two tawny coursers draw then indra is the sovran lord of power whose glory spreads afar.
सो चिन नु वर्ष्टिर्यूथ्या सवा सचानिन्द्रः शमश्रूणिहरिताभि परुष्णुते|	with him too is this rain of his that comes like herds indra throws drops of moisture on his yellow beard.
अव वेति सुक्षयं सुते मधूदिद्धूनोति वातो यथा वनम|	when the sweet juice is shed he seeks the pleasant place and stirs the worshipper as wind disturbs the wood.
यो वाचा विवाचो मर्ध्रवाचः पुरू सहस्राशिवा जघान|	we laud and praise his several deeds of valour who fatherlike with power hath made us stronger.
तततदिदस्य पौंस्यं गर्णीमसि पितेव यस्तविषींवाव्र्धे शवः|	who with his voice slew many thousand wicked ones who spake in varied manners with contemptuous cries.
सतोमं त इन्द्र विमदा अजीजनन्नपूर्व्यं पुरुतमंसुदानवे|	indra the vimadas have formed for thee a laud copious unparalleled for thee most bountiful.
विद्मा हयस्य भोजनमिनस्य यदा पशुं नगोपाः करामहे|	we know the good we gain from him the mighty one when we attract him as a herdsman calls the kine.
माकिर्न एना सख्या वि यौशुस्तव चेन्द्र विमदस्य चर्शेः|	neer may this bond of friendship be dissevered the Ṛṣi vimadas and thine o indra.
विद्मा हि ते परमतिं देव जामिवदस्मे ते सन्तुसख्या शिवानि|	we know thou carest for us as a brother with us o god be thine auspicious friendship.
युजे वां बरह्म पूर्व्यं नमोभिर्वि शलोक एतु पथ्येवसूरेः|	i yoke with prayer your ancient inspiration may the laud rise as on the princes pathway.
शर्ण्वन्तु विश्वे अम्र्तस्य पुत्रा आ ये धामानिदिव्यानि तस्थुः|	all sons of immortality shall hear it all the possessors of celestial natures.
यमे इव यतमाने यदैतं पर वां भरन मानुषादेवयन्तः|	when speeding ye came nigh us like twin sisters religioushearted votaries brought you forward.
आ सीदतं सवमु लोकं विदाने सवासस्थेभवतमिन्दवे नः|	take your place ye who know your proper station be near be very near unto our soma.
पञ्च पदानि रुपो अन्वरोहं चतुष्पदीमन्वेमि वरतेन|	five paces have i risen from earth i follow her who hath four feet with devout observance.
अक्षरेण परति मिम एतां रतस्य नाभावधि सं पुनामि|	this by the sacred syllable have i measured i purify in the central place of order.
देवेभ्यः कमव्र्णीत मर्त्युं परजायै कमम्र्तंनाव्र्णीत|	he for gods sake chose death to be his portion he chose not for mens good a life eternal.
बर्हस्पतिं यज्ञमक्र्ण्वत रषिं परियांयमस्तन्वं परारिरेचीत|	they sacrificed bṛhaspati the Ṛṣi yama delivered up his own dear body.
सप्त कषरन्ति शिशवे मरुत्वते पित्रे पुत्रासो अप्यवीवतन्न्र्तम|	the seven flow to the youth on whom the maruts wait the sons unto the father brought the sacrifice.
उभे इदस्योभयस्य राजत उभे यतेते उभयस्यपुष्यतः|	both these are his as his they are the lords of both both toil belonging unto both they prosper well.
यस्मिन वर्क्षे सुपलाशे देवैः सम्पिबते यमः|	in the tree clothed with goodly leaves where yama drinketh with the gods.
अत्रा नोविश्पतिः पिता पुराणाननु वेनति|	the father master of the house tendeth with love our ancient sires.
पुराणाननुवेनन्तं चरन्तं पापयामुया|	i looked reluctantly on him who cherishes those men of old.
असूयन्नभ्यचाक्षं तस्मा अस्प्र्हयं पुनः|	on him who treads that evil path and then i yearned for this again.
यं कुमार नवं रथमचक्रं मनसाक्र्णोः|	thou mountest though thou dost not see o child the new and wheelless car.
एकेषंविश्वतः पराञ्चमपश्यन्नधि तिष्ठसि|	which thou hast fashioned mentally onepoled but turning every way.
यं कुमार परावर्तयो रथं विप्रेभ्यस परि|	the car which thou hast made to roll hitherward from the sages child.
तंसामानु परावर्तत समितो नाव्याहितम|	this hath the sāman followed close hence laid together on a ship.
कः कुमारमजनयद रथं को निरवर्तयत|	who was the father of the child who made the chariot roll away.
कः सवित तदद्य नो बरूयादनुदेयी यथाभवत|	who will this day declare to us how the funeral gift was made.
यथाभवदनुदेयी ततो अग्रमजायत|	when the funeral gift was placed straightway the point of flame appeared.
पुरस्ताद बुध्नाततः पश्चान निरयणं कर्तम|	a depth extended in the front a passage out was made behind.
इदं यमस्य सादनं देवमानं यदुच्यते|	here is the seat where yama dwells that which is called the home of gods.
इयमस्यधम्यते नाळीरयं गीर्भिः परिष्क्र्तः|	here minstrels blow the flute for him here he is glorified with songs.
उत देवा अवहितं देवा उन नयथा पुनः|	ye gods raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low.
उतागश्चक्रुषं देवा देवा जीवयथा पुनः|	o gods restore to life again the man who hatb committed sin.
दवाविमौ वातौ वात आ सिन्धोरा परावतः|	two several winds are blowing here from sindhu from a distant land.
दक्षन्ते अन्य आ वातु परान्यो वातु यद रपः|	may one breathe energy to thee the other blow disease away.
आ वात वाहि भेषजं वि वात वाहि यद रपः|	hither o wind blow healing balm blow all disease away thou wind.
तवं हिविश्वभेषजो देवानां दूत ईयसे|	for thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the gods.
आ तवागमं शन्तातिभिरथो अरिष्टतातिभिः|	i am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe.
दक्षन्ते भद्रमाभार्षं परा यक्ष्मं सुवामि ते|	i bring thee blessed strength i drive thy weakening malady away.
तरायन्तामिह देवास्त्रायतां मरुतां गणः|	here let the gods deliver him the maruts band deliver him.
तरायन्तां विश्वा भूतानि यथायमरपा असत|	all things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.
आप इद वा उ भेषजीरापो अमीवचातनीः|	the waters have their healing power the waters drive disease away.
आपःसर्वस्य भेषजीस्तास्ते कर्ण्वन्तु भेषजम|	the waters have a balm for all let them make medicine for thee.
हस्ताभ्यां दशशाखा भयां जिह्वा वाचः पुरोगवी|	the tongue that leads the voice precedes then with our tenfold branching hands.
अनामयित्नुभ्यां तवा तभ्यां तवोप सप्र्शामसि|	with these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.
अग्रे बर्हन्नुषसामूर्ध्वो अस्थान निर्जगन्वान तमसोज्योतिषागात|	high hath the mighty risen before the dawning and come to us with light from out the darkness.
अग्निर्भानुना रुशता सवङग आ जातोविश्वा सद्मान्यप्राः|	fairshapen agni with whiteshining splendour hath filled at birth all human habitations.
स जातो गर्भो असि रोदस्योरग्ने चारुर्विभ्र्त ओषधीषु|	thou being born art child of earth and heaven parted among the plants in beauty agni.
चित्रः शिशुः परि तमांस्यक्तून पर मात्र्भ्यो अधिकनिक्रदत गाः|	the glooms of night thou brilliant babe subduest and art come forth loud roaring from thy mothers.
विष्णुरित्था परममस्य विद्वाञ जातो बर्हन्नभि पातित्र्तीयम|	here being manifested lofty viṣṇu full wise protects his own supremest station.
आसा यदस्य पयो अक्रत सवं सचेतसो अभ्यर्चन्त्यत्र|	when they have offered in his mouth their sweet milk to him with one accord they sing forth praises.
अत उ तवा पितुभ्र्तो जनित्रीरन्नाव्र्धं परति चरन्त्यन्नैः|	thence bearing food the mothers come to meet thee with food for thee who givest food its increase.
ता ईं परत्येषि पुनरन्यरूपा असि तवं विक्षुमानुषीषु होता|	these in their altered form again thou meetest thou art invoking priest in homes of mortals.
होतारं चित्ररथमध्वरस्य यज्ञस्ययज्ञस्य केतुंरुशन्तम|	priest of the holy rite with car that glitters refulgent banner of each act of worship.
परत्यर्धिं देवस्यदेवस्य मह्ना शरिया तवग्निमतिथिं जनानाम|	sharinging every god through might and glory even agni guest of men i summon hither.
स तु वस्त्राण्यध पेशनानि वसानो अग्निर्नाभाप्र्थिव्याः|	so agni stands on earths most central station invested in welldecorated garments.
अरुषो जातः पद इळायाः पुरोहितो राजन्यक्षीह देवान|	born red of hue where men pour out libations o king as great high priest bring the gods hither.
आ हि दयावाप्र्थिवी अग्न उभे सदा पुत्रो न मातराततन्थ|	over the earth and over heaven o agni thou son hast ever spread above thy parents.
पर याह्यछोशतो यविष्ठाथा वह सहस्येहदेवान|	come youthfullest to those who long to meet thee and hither bring the gods o mighty victor.
अहं रुद्रेभिर्वसुभिश्चराम्यहमादित्यैरुतविश्वदेवैः|	i travel with the rudras and the vasus with the Ādityas and allgods i wander.
अहं मित्रावरुणोभा बिभर्म्यहमिन्द्राग्नीहमश्विनोभा|	i hold aloft both varuṇa and mitra indra and agni and the pair of aśvins.
अहं सोममाहनसं बिभर्म्यहं तवष्टारमुतपूषणं भगम|	i cherish and sustain highswelling soma and tvaṣṭar i support pūṣan and bhaga.
अहं दधामि दरविणं हविष्मतेसुप्राव्ये यजमानाय सुन्वते|	i load with wealth the zealous sdcrificer who pours the juice and offers his oblation.
अहं राष्ट्री संगमनी वसूनां चिकितुषी परथमायज्ञियानाम|	i am the queen the gathererup of treasures most thoughtful first of those who merit worship.
तां मा देवा वयदधुः पुरुत्राभूरिस्थात्रां भूर्यावेशयन्तीम|	thus gods have stablished me in many places with many homes to enter and abide in.
मया सो अन्नमत्ति यो विपश्यति यः पराणिति य ईंश्र्णोत्युक्तम|	through me alone all eat the food that feeds themeach man who sees brewhes hears the word outspoken.
अमन्तवो मां त उप कषियन्ति शरुधिश्रुत शरद्धिवं ते वदामि|	they know it not but yet they dwell beside me hear one and all the truth as i declare it.
अहमेव सवयमिदं वदामि जुष्टं देवेभिरुतमानुषेभिः|	verily myself announce and utter the word that gods and men alike shall welcome.
यं कामये तंतमुग्रं कर्णोमि तम्ब्रह्माणं तं रषिं तं सुमेधाम|	i make the man i love exceeding mighty make him a sage a Ṛṣi and a brahman.
अहं रुद्राय धनुरा तनोमि बरह्मद्विषे शरवे हन्तवाु|	i bend the bow for rudra that his arrow may strike and slay the hater of devotion.
अहं जनाय समदं कर्णोम्यहं दयावाप्र्थिवी आविवेश|	i rouse and order battle for the people and i have penetrated earth and heaven.
अहं सुवे पितरमस्य मूर्धन मम योनिरप्स्वन्तः समुद्रे|	on the worlds summit i bring forth the father my home is in the waters in the ocean.
ततो वि तिष्ठे भुवनानु विश्वोतामूं दयांवर्ष्मणोप सप्र्शामि|	thence i extend oer all existing creatures and touch even yonder heaven with my forehead.
अहमेव वात इव पर वाम्यारभमाणा भुवनानि विश्वा|	i breathe a strong breath like the wind and tempest the while i hold together all existence.
परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्यैतावती महिना सं बभूव|	beyond this wide earth and beyond the heavens i have become so mighty in my grandeur.
पर सु व आपो महिमानमुत्तमं कारुर्वोचाति सदनेविवस्वतः|	the singer o ye waters in vivasvāns place shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare.
पर सप्तसप्त तरेधा हि चक्रमुः परस्र्त्वरीणामति सिन्धुरोजसा|	the rivers have come forward triply seven and seven sindhu in might surpasses all the streams that flow.
पर तेअरदद वरुणो यातवे पथः सिन्धो यद वाजानभ्यद्रवस्त्वम|	varuṇa cut the channels for thy forward course o sindhu when thou rannest on to win the race.
भूम्या अधि परवता यासि सानुना यदेषामग्रं जगतामिरज्यसि|	thou speedest oer precipitous ridges of the earth when thou art lord and leader of these moving floods.
दिवि सवनो यतते भूम्योपर्यनन्तं शुष्ममुदियर्तिभानुना|	his roar is lifted up to heaven above the earth he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of light.
अभ्रादिव पर सतनयन्ति वर्ष्टयः सिन्धुर्यदेति वर्षभो न रोरुवत|	like floods of rain that fall in thunder from the cloud so sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull.
अभि तवा सिन्धो शिशुमिन न मातरो वाश्रा अर्षन्तिपयसेव धेनवः|	like mothers to their calves like milch kine with their milk so sindhu unto thee the roaring rivers run.
राजेव युध्वा नयसि तवमित सिचौ यदासामग्रं परवतामिनक्षसि|	thou leadest as a warrior king thine armys wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift streams.
इमं मे गङगे यमुने सरस्वति शुतुद्रि सतेमं सचता परुष्ण्या|	favour ye this my laud o gangā yamunā o sutudri paruṣṇī and sarasvatī.
असिक्न्या मरुद्व्र्धे वितस्तयार्जीकीये शर्णुह्यासुषोमया|	with asikni vitasta o marudvrdha o Ārjīkīya with susoma hear my call.
तर्ष्टामया परथमं यातवे सजूः ससर्त्वा रसयाश्वेत्या तया|	first with trstama thou art eager to flow forth with rasā and susartu and with svetya here.
तवं सिन्धो कुभया गोमतीं करुमुम्मेहत्न्वा सरथं याभिरीयसे|	with kubha and with these sindhu and mehatnu thou seekest in thy course krumu and gomati.
रजीत्येनी रुशती महित्वा परि जरयांसि भरते रजांसि|	flashing and whitelygleaming in her mightiness she moves along her ample volumes through the realms.
अदब्धा सिन्धुरपसामपस्तमाश्वा न चित्रावपुषीव दर्शता|	most active of the active sindhu unrestrained like to a dappled mare beautiful fair to see.
सवश्वा सिन्धुः सुरथा सुवासा हिरण्ययी सुक्र्तावाजिनीवती|	rich in good steeds is sindhu rich in cars and robes rich in gold noblyfashioned rich in ample wealth.
ऊर्णावती युवतिः सीलमावत्युताधि वस्तेसुभगा मधुव्र्धम|	blest silamavati and young urnavati invest themselves with raiment rich in store of sweets.
सुखं रथं युयुजे सिधुरश्विनं तेन वाजं सनिषदस्मिन्नाजौ|	sindhu hath yoked her car lightrolling drawn by steeds and with that car shall she win booty in this fight.
महान हयस्य महिमा पनस्यतेअदब्धस्यस्वयशसो विरप्शिनः|	so have i praised its power mighty and unrestrained of independent glory roaring as it runs.
इमां खनाम्योषधिं वीरुधं बलवत्तमाम|	from out the earth i dig this plant a herb of most effectual power.
ययासपत्नीं बाधते यया संविन्दते पतिम|	wherewith one quells the rival wife and gains the husband for oneself.
उत्तानपर्णे सुभगे देवजूते सहस्वति|	auspicious with expanded leaves sent by the gods victorious plant.
सपत्नीं मे पराधम पतिं मे केवलं कुरु|	blow thou the rival wife away and make my husband only mine.
उत्तराहमुत्तर उत्तरेदुत्तराभ्यः|	stronger am  o stronger one yea mightier than the mightier.
अथा सपत्नी याममाधरा साधराभ्यः|	and she who is my rival wife is lower than the lowest dames.
नह्यस्या नाम गर्भ्णामि नो अस्मिन रमते जने|	her very name i utter not she takes no pleasure in this man.
परामेवपरावतं सपत्नीं गमयामसि|	far into distance most remote drive we the rival wife away.
अहमस्मि सहमानाथ तवमसि सासहिः|	i am the conqueror and thou thou also act victorious.
उभे सहस्वतीभूत्वी सपत्नीं मे सहावहै|	as victory attends us both we will subdue my fellowwife.
उप तेअधां सहमानामभि तवाधां सहीयसा|	i have gained thee for vanquisher have grasped thee with a stronger spell.
मामनुप्र ते मनो वत्सं गौरिव धावतु पथा वारिव धावतु|	as a cow hastens to her calf so let thy spirit speed te me hasten like water on its way.
इमं नो अग्न उप यज्ञमेहि पञ्चयामं तरिव्र्तंसप्ततन्तुम|	come to this sacrifice of ours o agni threefold with seven threads and five divisions.
असो हव्यवाळ उत नः पुरोगा जयोगेवदीर्घं तम आशयिष्ठाः|	be our oblationbearer and preceder thou hast lain long enough in during darkness.
अदेवाद देवः परचता गुहा यन परपश्यमानो अम्र्तत्वमेमि|	i come a god foreseeing from the godless to immortality by secret pathways.
शिवं यत सन्तमशिवो जहामि सवात सख्यादरणींनाभिमेमि|	while i ungracious one desert the gracious leave mine own friends and seek the kin of strangers.
पश्यन्नन्यस्या अतिथिं वयाया रतस्य धाम वि मिमेपुरूणि|	looking to the guest of other lineage have founded many a rule of law and order.
शंसामि पित्रे असुराय शेवमयज्ञियाद्यज्ञियं भागमेमि|	i bid farewell to the great god the father and for neglect obtain my share of worship.
बह्वीः समा अकरमन्तरस्मिन्निन्द्रं वर्णानः पितरंजहामि|	i tarried many a year within this altar i leave the father for my choice is indra.
अग्निः सोमो वरुणस्ते चयवन्ते पर्यावर्द्राष्ट्रं तदवाम्यायन|	away pass agni varuṇa and soma rule ever changes this i come to favour.
निर्माया उ तये असुरा अभूवन तवं च मा वरुण कामयासे|	these asuras have lost their powers of magic but thou o varuṇa if thou dost love me.
रतेन राजन्नन्र्तं विविञ्चन मम राष्ट्रस्याधिपत्यमेहि|	o king discerning truth and right from falsehood come and be lord and ruler of my kingdom.
इदं सवरिदमिदास वाममयं परकाश उर्वन्तरिक्षम|	here is the light of heaven here allis lovely here there is radiance here is airs wide region.
हनाव वर्त्रं निरेहि सोम हविष टवा सन्तं हविषायजाम|	let us two slaughter vṛtra forth o soma thou art oblation we therewith will serve thee.
कविः कवित्वा दिवि रूपमासजदप्रभूती वरुणो निरपः सर्जत|	the sage hath fixed his form by wisdom in the heavens varuṇa with no violence let the waters flow.
कषेमं कर्ण्वाना जनयो न सिन्धवश ता अस्यवर्णं शुचयो भरिभ्रति|	like womenfolk the floods that bring prosperity have eau lit his hue and colour as they gleamed and shone.
ता अस्य जयेष्ठमिन्द्रियं सचन्ते ता ईमा कषेतिस्वधया मदन्तीः|	these wait upon his loftiest power and vigour he dwells in these who triumph in their godhead.
ता इं विशो न राजानं वर्णानाबीभत्सुवो अप वर्त्रादतिष्ठन|	and they like people who elect their ruler have in abhorrence turned away from vṛtra.
बीभत्सूनां सयुजं हंसमाहुरपां दिव्यानांसख्ये चरन्तम|	they call him swan the abhorrent floods companion moving in friendship with celestial waters.
अनुष्टुभमनु चर्चूर्यमाणमिन्द्रं निचिक्युः कवयो मनीषा|	the poets in their thought have looked on indra swiftly approaching when anustup calls him.
इन्द्र सोममिमं पिब मधुमन्तं चमू सुतम|	o indra drink this soma pressed out in the mortar full of sweets.
अस्मे रयिंनि धारय वि वो मदे सहस्रिणं पुरूवसो विवक्षसे|	send down to us great richesat your glad carousein thousands o most healthy thou art waxing great.
तवां यज्ञेभिरुक्थैरुप हव्येभिरीमहे|	to thee with sacrifices with oblations and with lauds we come.
शचीपतेशचीनां वि वो मदे शरेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यं विवक्षसे|	lord of all strength and power grantat your glad carousethe best choiceworthy treasure thou art waxing great.
यस पतिर्वार्याणामसि रध्रस्य चोदिता|	thou who art lord of precious boons inciter even of the churl.
इन्द्रस्तोतॄणामविता वि वो मदे दविषो नः पाह्यंहसोविवक्षसे|	guardian of singers indraat your glad carousesave us from woe and hatred thou art waxing great.
युवं शक्रा मायाविना समीची नीरमन्थतम|	strong lords of magic power ye twain churned the united worlds apart.
विमदेनयदिळित नसत्य निरमन्थतम|	when ye implored by vimada nāsatyas forced apart the pair.
विश्वे देवा अक्र्पन्त समिच्योर्निष्पतन्त्योः|	when the united pair were rent asunder all the gods complained.
नसत्यवब्रुवन्देवः पुनरा वहतदिति|	the gods to the nāsatyas cried bring these together once again.
मधुमन मे परायणं मधुमत पुनरयनम|	sweet be my going forth and rich in sweets be my approach to home.
त नो देवदेवतय युवं मधुमतस कर्तम|	so through your deity both gods enrich us with all pleasantness.
संसमिद युवसे वर्षन्नग्ने विश्वान्यर्य आ|	thou mighty agni gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend.
इळस पदेसमिध्यसे स नो वसून्या भर|	bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libations place.
सं गछध्वं सं वदध्वं सं वो मनांसि जानताम|	assemble speak together let your minds be all of one accord.
देवा भागं यथा पूर्वे संजानाना उपासते|	as ancient gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share.
समानो मन्त्रः समितिः समानी समानं मनः सह चित्तमेषाम|	the place is common common the assembly common the mind so be their thought united.
समानं मन्त्रमभि मण्त्रये वः समानेन वोहविषा जुहोमि|	a common purpose do i lay before you and worship with your general oblation.
समानी व आकूतिः समाना हर्दयानि वः|	one and the same be your resolve and be your minds of one accord.
समानमस्तु वोमनो यथा वः सुसहासति|	united be the thoughts of all that all may happily agree.
एकः समुद्रो धरुणो रयीणामस्मद धर्दो भूरिजन्मा विचष्टे|	he only is the sea holder of treasures born many a time he views the hearts within us.
सिषक्त्यूधर्निण्योरुपस्थ उत्सस्य मध्येनिहितं पदं वेः|	he hides him in the secret couples bosom the bird dwells in the middle of the fountain.
समानं नीळं वर्षणो वसानाः सं जग्मिरे महिषार्वतीभिः|	inhabiting one dwellingplace in common strong stallions and the mares have come together.
रतस्य पदं कवयो नि पान्ति गुहा नामानिदधिरे पराणि|	the sages guard the seat of holy order and keep the highest names concealed within them.
रतायिनी मायिनी सं दधाते मित्वा शिशुं जज्ञतुर्वर्धयन्ती|	the holy pair of wondrous power have coupled they formed the infant they who bred produced him.
विश्वस्य नाभिं चरतो धरुवस्य कवेश्चित्तन्तुं मनसा वियन्तः|	the central point of all that moves and moves not the while they wove the sages thread with insight.
रतस्य हि वर्तनयः सुजातमिषो वाजाय परदिवःसचन्ते|	for tracks of order and refreshing viands attend from ancient times the goodly infant.
अधीवासं रोदसी वावसाने घर्तैरन्नैर्वाव्र्धाते मधूनाम|	wearing him as a mantle earth and heaven grow strong by food of pleasant drink and fatness.
सप्त सवसॄररुषीर्वावशानो विद्वान मध्व उज्जभाराद्र्शे कम|	he calling loudly to the seven red sisters hath skilled in sweet drink brought them to be looked on.
अन्तर्येमे अन्तरिक्षे पुराजा इछन वव्रिमविदत्पूषणस्य|	he born of old in middle air hath halted and sought and found the covering robe of pūṣan.
सप्त मर्यादाः कवयस्ततक्षुस्तासामेकामिदभ्यंहुरो गात|	seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned to one of these may come the troubled mortal.
आयोर्ह सकम्भ उपमस्य नीळे पथांविसर्गे धरुणेषु तस्थौ|	he standeth in the dwelling of the highest a pillar on sure ground where paths are parted.
असच्च सच्च परमे वयोमन दक्षस्य जन्मन्नदितेरुपस्थे|	not being being in the highest heaven in aditis bosom and in dakṣas birthplace.
अग्निर्ह नः पर थमजा रतस्य पूर्व आयुनि वर्षभश्चधेनुः|	is agni our firstborn of holy order the milchcow and the bull in lifes beginning.
भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनो दक्षमुत करतुम|	send us a good and happy mind send energy and mental power.
अधा तेसख्ये अन्धसो वि वो मदे रणन गवो न यवसे विवक्षसे|	thenat your glad carouselet men joy in thy love sweet juice as kine in pasture thou art waxing great.
हर्दिस्प्र्शस्त असते विश्वेषु सोम ध मसु|	rn all thy forms o soma rest thy powers that influence the heart.
अधा कामा इमेमम वि वो मदे वि तिष्ठन्ते वसूयवो विवक्षसे|	so also these my longingsat your glad carousespread themselves seeking riches thou art waxing great.
उत वरतनि सोम ते परहं मिनामि पाक्या|	even if o soma i neglect thy laws through my simplicity.
अधा पितेवसूनवे वि वो मदे मर्ळ नो अभि चिद वधाद विवक्षसे|	be graciousat your glad carouseas sire to son preserve us even from slaughter thou art waxing great.
समु पर यन्ति धीतयः सर्गासोअवतानिव|	our songs in concert go to thee as streams of water to the wells.
करतुं नःसोम जिवसे वि वो मदे धरया चमसानिव विवक्षसे|	soma that we may live grantat your glad carousefull powers of mind like beakers thou art waxing great.
तव तये सोम शक्तिभिर्निकामासो वय रण्विरे|	o soma through thy might who art skilful and strong these longing men.
गर्त्सस्यधिरस्तवसो वि वो मदे वरजं गोमन्तमश्विनं विवक्षसे|	these sages have thrown openat your glad carousethe stall of kine and horses thou art waxing great.
पशुं नः सोम रक्षसि पुरुत्र विष्ठितं जगत|	our herds thou guardest soma and the moving world spread far and wide.
समाक्र्णोषि जीवसे वि वो मदे विश्वा सम्पश्यन भुवनविवक्षसे|	thou fittest them for livingat your glad carouselooking upon all beings thou art waxing great.
तवं नः सोम विश्वतो गोप अदभ्यो भव|	on all sides soma be to us a guardian neer to be deceived.
सेध राजन्नपस्रिधो वि वो मदे म नो दुः शंस ईशता विवक्षसे|	king drive away our foemenat your glad carouselet not the wicked rule us thou art waxing great.
तवं नः सोम सुक्रतुर्व योधेयाय जाग्र्हि|	be watchful soma passing wise to give us store of vital strength.
कषेत्रवित्तरोमनुषो वि वो मदे दरुहो नः पाह्यंहसो विवक्षसे|	more skilled than man to guide usat your glad carousesave us from harm and sorrow thou art waxing great.
तवं नो वर्त्र हन्तमेन्द्रस्येन्दो शिवः सखा|	chief slayer of our foemen thou indu art indras gracious friend.
यत सिंहवन्ते समिथे वि वो मदे युध्यमनस्तोकसातौविवक्षसे|	when warriors invoke himat your glad carouse in fight to win them offspring thou art waxing great.
अयं घ स तुरो मद इन्द्रस्य वर्धत परियः|	victorious is this gladdening drink to indra dear it grows in strength.
अयंकक्षीवतो महो वि वो मदे मतिं विप्रस्य वर्धयद्विवक्षसे|	thisat your glad carouse enhanced the mighty hymn of the great sage kakṣīvān thou art waxing great.
अयं विप्रय दशुषे वजनियर्ति गोमतः|	this to the sage who offers gifts brings power that comes from wealth in kine.
अयंसप्तभ्य आ वरं वि वो मदे परन्धं शरोणं चतरिषद विवक्षसे|	this better than the seven hathat your glad carousefurthered the blind the cripple thou art waxing great.
आ तवाहार्षमन्तरेधि धरुवस्तिष्ठाविचाचलिः|	be with us i have chosen thee stand stedfast and immovable.
विशस्त्वा सर्वा वाञ्छन्तु मा तवद राष्ट्रमधि भरशत|	let all the people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away.
इहैवैधि माप चयोष्ठाः पर्वत इवाविचाचलिः|	be even here fall not away be like a mountain unremoved.
इन्द्रैवेह धरुवस्तिष्ठेह राष्ट्रमु धारय|	stand stedfast here like indras self and hold the kingship in the grasp.
इममिन्द्रो अदीधरद धरुवं धरुवेण हविषा|	this man hath indra stablished made secure by strong oblations power.
तस्मै सोमोधि बरवत तस्मा उ बरह्मणस पतिः|	may soma speak a benison and brahmaṇaspati on him.
धरुवा दयौर्ध्रुवा पर्थिवी धरुवासः पर्वता इमे|	firm is the sky and firm the earth and stedfast also are these hills.
धरुवं विश्वमिदं जगद धरुवो राजा विशामयम|	stedfast is all this living world and stedfast is this king of men.
धरुवं ते राजा वरुणो धरुवं देवो बर्हस्पतिः|	stedfast may varuṇa the king stedfast the god bṛhaspati.
धरुवं त इन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च राष्ट्रं धारयतां धरुवम|	stedfast may indra stedfast too may agni keep thy stedfast reign.
धरुवं धरुवेण हविषाभि सोमं मर्शामसि|	on constant soma let us think with constant sacrificial gift.
अथो तैन्द्रः केवलीर्विशो बलिह्र्तस करत|	and then may indra make the clans bring tribute unto thee alone.
इति वा इति मे मनो गामश्वं सनुयामिति|	this even this was my resolve to win a cow to win a steed.
कुवित्सोमस्यापामिति|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
पर वाता इव दोधत उन मा पीता अयंसत|	like violent gusts of wind the draughts that i have drunk have lifted me.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
उन मा पीता अयंसत रथमश्वा इवाशवः|	the draughts i drank have borne me up as fleetfoot horses draw a car.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
उप मा मतिरस्थित वाश्रा पुत्रमिव परियम|	the hymn hath reached me like a cow who lows to meet her darling calf.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
अहं तष्टेव वन्धुरं पर्यचामि हर्दा मतिम|	as a wright bends a chariotseat so round my heart i bend the hymn.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
नहि मे अक्षिपच्चनाछान्त्सुः पञ्च कर्ष्टयः|	not as a mote within the eye count the five tribes of men with me.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
नहि मे रोदसी उभे अन्यं पक्षं चन परति|	the heavens and earth themselves have not grown equal to one half of me.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
अभि दयां महिना भुवमभीमां पर्थिवीं महीम|	i in my grandeur have surpassed the heavens and all this spacious earth.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
हन्ताहं पर्थिवीमिमां नि दधानीह वेह वा|	aha this spacious earth will i deposit either here or there.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
ओषमित पर्थिवीमहं जङघनानीह वेह वा|	in one short moment will i smite the earth in fury here or there.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
दिवि मे अन्यः पक्षोअधो अन्यमचीक्र्षम|	one of my flanks is in the sky i let the other trail below.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
अहमस्मि महामहोअभिनभ्यमुदीषितः|	greatest of the mighty ones am lifted to the firmament.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
गर्हो याम्यरंक्र्तो देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहनः|	i seek the worshippers abode oblationbearer to the gods.
कुवित|	have i not drunk of soma juice.
उभे यदिन्द्र रोदसी आपप्राथोषा इव|	as like the morning thou hast filled o indra both the earth and heaven.
महान्तं तवामहीनां सम्राजं चर्षणीनां देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद्भद्रा जनित्र्यजीजनत|	so as the mighty one great king of all the mighty world of men the goddess mother brought thee forth the blessed mother gave thee life.
अव सम दुर्हणायतो मर्तस्य तनुहि सथिरम|	relax that mortals stubborn strength whose heart is bent on wickedness.
अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि यो अस्मानादिदेशति देवी जनित्र्यजीजनद भद्राजनित्र्यजीजनत|	trample him down beneath thy feet who watches for and aims at us the goddess mother brought thee forth the blessed mother gave thee life.
अव तया बर्हतीरिषो विश्वश्चन्द्रा अमित्रहन|	shake down o slayer of the foe those great all splendid enemies.
शचीभिःशक्र धूनुहीन्द्र विश्वाभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य|	with all thy powers o Śakra all thine helps o indra shake them down.
अव यत तवं शतक्रतविन्द्र विश्वानि धूनुषे|	as thou o Śatakratu thou o indrv shakest all things down.
रयिंन सुन्वते सचा सहस्रिणीभिरूतिभिर्देवी जनित्र्य|	as wealth for him who sheds the juice with thine assistance thousandfold.
अव सवेदा इवाभितो विष्वक पतन्तु दिद्यवः|	around on every side like drops of sweat let lightningflashes fall.
दूर्वाया इवतन्तवो वयस्मदेतु दुर्मतिर्देवी जनीत्र्य|	let all malevolence pass away from us like threads of darva grass.
दीर्घं हयङकुशं यथा शक्तिं बिभर्षि मन्तुमः|	thou bearest in thine hand a lance like a long hook great counsellor.
पूर्वेण मघवन पदाजो वयां यथा यमो देवी जनित्र्य|	as with his foremost foot a goat draw down the branch o maghavan.
नकिर्देवा मिनीमसि नकिरा योपयामसि मन्त्रश्रुत्यंचरामसि|	never o gods do we offend nor are we ever obstinate we walk as holy texts command.
पक्षेभिरपिकक्षेभिरत्राभि सं रभामहे|	closely we clasp and cling to you cling to your sides beneath your arms.
सविता यन्त्रैः पर्थिवीमरम्णादस्कम्भने सविता दयामद्रंहत|	savitar fixed the earth with bands to bind it and made heaven stedfast where no prop supported.
अश्वमिवाधुक्षद धुनिमन्तरिक्षमतूर्तेबद्धं सविता समुद्रम|	savitar milked as twere a restless courser air sea bound fast to what no foot had trodden.
यत्रा समुद्र सकभितो वयौनदपां नपात सविता तस्यवेद|	well knoweth savitar o child of waters where ocean firmly fixt oerflowed its limit.
अतो भूरत आ उत्थितं रजोअतो दयावाप्र्थिवीप्रथेताम|	thence sprang the world from that uprose the region thence heaven spread out and the wide earth expanded.
पश्चेदमन्यदभवद यजत्रममर्त्यस्य भुवनस्य भूना|	then with a full crowd of immortal beings this other realm came later high and holy.
सुपर्णो अङग सवितुर्गरुत्मान पूर्वो जातः स उ अस्यानुधर्म|	first verily savitars strongpinioned eagle was born and he obeys his law for ever.
गाव इव गरामं यूयुधिरिवाश्वान वाश्रेव वत्संसुमना दुहाना|	as warriors to their steeds kine to their village as fond milk giving cows approach their youngling.
पतिरिव जायामभि नो नयेतु धर्तादिवः सविता विश्ववारः|	as man to wife let savitar come downward to us heavens bearer lord of every blessing.
हिरण्यस्तूपः सवितर्यथा तवाङगिरसो जुह्वे वाजे अस्मिन|	like the aṅgirasa hiranvastupa i call thee savitar to this achievement.
एवा तवार्चन्नवसे वन्दमानः सोमस्येवाण्शुं परतिजागराहम|	so worshipping and lauding thee for favour i watch for thee as for the stalk of soma.
रक्षोहणं वाजिनमा जिघर्मि मित्रं परथिष्ठमुपयामि शर्म|	i balm with oil the mighty rakṣasslayer to the most famous friend i come for shelter.
शिशानो अग्निः करतुभिः समिद्धः स नोदिवा स रिषः पातु नक्तम|	enkindled sharpened by our rites may agni protect us in the day and night from evil.
अयोदंष्ट्रो अर्चिषा यातुधानानुप सप्र्श जातवेदःसमिद्धः|	o jātavedas with the teeth of iron enkindled with thy flame attack the demons.
आ जिह्वया मुरदेवान रभस्व करव्यादो वर्क्त्व्यपि धत्स्वासन|	seize with thy longue the foolish gods adorers rend put within thy mouth the rawflesh caters.
उभोभयाविन्नुप धेहि दंष्ट्रा हिंस्रः शिशानोअवरम्परं च|	apply thy teeth the upper and the lower thou who hast both enkindled and destroying.
उतान्तरिक्षे परि याहि राजञ जम्भैः सन्धेह्यभि यातुधानान|	roam also in the air o king around us and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits.
यज्ञैरिषूः संनममानो अग्ने वाचा शल्यानशनिभिर्दिहानः|	bending thy shafts through sacrifices agni whetting their points with song as if with whetstones.
ताभिर्विध्य हर्दये यातुधानान परतीचो बाहून्प्रति भंध्येषाम|	pierce to the heart therewith the yātudhānas and break their arms uplifed to attack thee.
अग्ने तवचं यातुधानस्य भिन्धि हिंस्राशनिर्हरसाहन्त्वेनम|	pierce through the yātudhānas skin o agni let the destroying dart with fire consume him.
पर पर्वाणि जातवेदः शर्णीहि करव्यात्क्रविष्णुर्वि चिनोतु वर्क्णम|	rend his joints jātavedas let the cater of flesh fleshseeking track his mangled body.
यत्रेदानीं पश्यसि जातवेदस्तिष्ठन्तमग्न उत वाचरन्तम|	where now thou seest agni jātavedas one of these demons standing still or roaming.
यद वान्तरिक्षे पथिभिः पतन्तं तमस्ताविध्य शर्वा शिशानः|	or flying on those paths in airs midregion sharpen the shaft and as an archer pierce him.
उतालब्धं सप्र्णुहि जातवेद आलेभानाद रष्टिभिर्यातुधानात|	tear from the evil spirit jātavedas what he hath seized and with his spears hath captured.
अग्ने पूर्वो नि जहि शोशुचान आमादःक्ष्विङकास्तमदन्त्वेनीः|	blazing before him strike him down o agni let spotted carrioneating kites devour him.
इह पर बरूहि यतमः सो अग्ने यो यातुधानो य इदंक्र्णोति|	here tell this forth o agni whosoever is he himself or acteth as a demon.
तमा रभस्व समिधा यविष्ठ नर्चक्षसश्चक्षुषे रन्धयैनम|	him grasp o thou most youthful with thy fuel to the matiseers eye give him as booty.
तीक्ष्णेनाग्ने चक्षुषा रक्ष यज्ञं पराञ्चं वसुभ्यःप्र णय परचेतः|	with keen glance guard the sacrifice o agni thou sage conduct it onward to the vasus.
हिंस्रं रक्षांस्यभि शोशुचानम्मा तवा दभन यातुधाना नर्चक्षः|	let not the fiends o manbeholder harm thee burning against the rākṣasas to slay them.
नर्चक्षा रक्षः परि पश्य विक्षु तस्य तरीणि परतिश्र्णीह्यग्रा|	look on the fiend mid men as manbeholder rend thou his three extremities in pieces.
तस्याग्ने पर्ष्टीर्हरसा शर्णीहि तरेधामूलं यातुधानस्य वर्श्च|	demolish with thy flame his ribs o agni the yātudhānas root destroy thou triply.
तरिर्यातुधानः परसितिं त एत्व रतं यो अग्ने अन्र्तेन हन्ति|	thrice agni let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures holy order.
तमर्चिषा सफूर्जयञ जातवेदः समक्षमेनं गर्णतेनि वरंधि|	loud roaring with thy flame o jātavedas crush him and cast him down before the singer.
तदग्ने चक्षुः परति धेहि रेभे शफारुजं येनपश्यसि यातुधानम|	lead thou the worshipper that eye o agni wherewith thou lookest on the hoofarmed demon.
अथर्ववज्ज्योतिषा दैव्येन सत्यन्धूर्वन्तमचितं नयोष|	with light celestial in atharvans manner burn up the foot who ruins truth with falsehood.
यदग्ने अद्य मिथुना शपातो यद वाचस्त्र्ष्टं जनयन्तरेभाः|	agni what curse the pair this day have uttered what heated word the worshippers have spoken.
मन्योर्मनसः शरव्या जायते या तया विध्यह्र्दये यातुधानान|	each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spiritpierce to the heart therewith the yātudhānas.
परा शर्णीहि तपसा यातुधानान पराग्ने रक्षो हरसाश्र्णीहि|	with fervent heat exterminate the demons destroy the fiends with burning flame o agni.
परार्चिषा मूरदेवाञ्छ्र्णीहि परासुत्र्पो अभिशोशुचानः|	destroy with fire the foolish gods adorers blaze and destrepy the insatiable monsters.
पराद्य देवा वर्जिनं शर्णन्तु परत्यगेनं शपथा यन्तुत्र्ष्टाः|	may gods destroy this day the evildoer may each hot curse of his return and blast him.
वाचास्तेनं शरव रछन्तु मर्मन विश्वस्यैतुप्रसितिं यातुधानः|	let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals and visvas net enclose the yātudhāna.
यः पौरुषेयेण करविषा समङकते यो अश्वेयेन पशुनायातुधानः|	the fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle with flesh of horses and of human bodies.
यो अघ्न्याया भरति कषीरमग्ने तेषांशीर्षाणि हरसापि वर्श्च|	who steals the milchcows milk away o agnitear off the heads of such with fiery fury.
संवत्सरीणं पय उस्रियायास्तस्य माशीद यातुधानोन्र्चक्षः|	the cow gives milk each year o manregarder let not the yātudhāna ever taste it.
पीयूषमग्ने यतमस्तित्र्प्सात तं परत्यञ्चमर्चिषा विध्य मर्मन|	if one would glut him with the biesting agni pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee.
विषं गवां यातुधानाः पिबन्त्वा वर्श्च्यन्तामदितयेदुरेवाः|	let the fiends drink the poison of the cattle may aditi cast off the evildoers.
परैनान देवः सविता ददातु परा भागमोषधीनां जयन्ताम|	may the god savitar give them up to ruin and be their share of plants and herbs denied them.
सनादग्ने मर्णसि यातुधानान न तवा रक्षांसि पर्तनासुजिग्युः|	agni from days of old thou slayest demons never shall rākṣasas in fight oercome thee.
अनु दह सहमूरान करव्यादो मा ते हेत्या मुक्षतदैव्यायाः|	burn up the foolish ones the fleshdevourers let none of them escape thine heavenly arrow.
तवं नो अग्ने अधरादुदक्तात तवं पश्चादुत रक्षापुरस्तात|	guard us o agni from above and under protect us flom behind us and before us.
परति ते ते अजरासस्तपिष्ठा अघशंसंशोशुचतो दहन्तु|	and may thy flames most fierce and never wasting glowing with fervent heat consume the sinner.
पश्चात पुरस्तादधरादुदक्तात कविः काव्येन परि पाहिराजन|	from rear from front from under from above us o king protect us as a sage with wisdom.
सखे सखायमजरो जरिम्णेअग्ने मर्तानमर्त्यस्त्वं नः|	guard to old age thy friend o friend eternal o agni as immortal guard us mortals.
परि तवाग्ने पुरं वयं विप्रं सहस्य धीमहि|	we set thee round us as a fort victorious agni thee a sage.
धर्षद्वर्णं दिवेदिवे हन्तारं भङगुरावताम|	of hero lineage day by day destroyer of our treacherous foes.
विषेण भङगुरावतः परति षम रक्षसो दह|	burn with thy poison turned against the treacherous brood of rākṣasas.
अग्नेतिग्मेन शोचिषा तपुरग्राभिरषटिभिः|	o agni with thy sharpened glow with lances armed with points of flame.
परत्यग्ने मिथुन दह यातुधाना किमीदिना|	burn thou the paired kimīdins brun agni the yātudhāna pairs.
सं तवाशिशामि जाब्र्ह्यदब्धं विप्र मन्मभिः|	i sharpen thee infallible with hymns o sage be vigilant.
परत्यग्ने हरसा हरः शर्णीहि विश्वतः परति|	shoot forth o agni with thy flame demolish them on every side.
यातुधानस्य रक्षसो बलं वि रुज वीर्यम|	break thou the yātudhānas strength the vigour of the rākṣasa.
तयं चिदत्रिं रतजुरमर्थमश्वं न यातवे|	ye made that atri worn with eld free as a horse to win the goal.
कक्षिवन्तं यदी पुना रथं न कर्णुथो नवम|	when ye restored to youth and strength kakṣīvān like a car renewed.
तयं चिदश्वं न वाजिनमरेणवो यमत्नत|	ye freed that atri like a horse and brought him newlyborn to earth.
दर्ळंग्रन्थिं न वि षयतमत्रिं यविष्ठमा रजः|	ye loosed him like a firmtied knot which gods unsoiled by dust had bound.
नरा दंसिष्ठवत्रये शुभ्रा सिषासतं धियः|	heroes who showed most wondrous power to atri strive to win fair songs.
अथा हि वां दिवो नरा पुन सतोमो न विशसे|	for then o heroes of the sky your hymn of praise shall cease no more.
चिते तद वां सुराधसा रातिः सुमतिरश्विना|	this claims your notice bounteous gods  oblation aśvins and our love.
आ यन्नः सदने पर्थौ समने पर्षथो नरा|	that ye o heroes in the fight may bring us safe to ample room.
युवं भुज्युं समुद्र आ रजसः पार ईङखितम|	ye twain to bhujyu tossed about in ocean at the regions end.
यातमछा पतत्रिभिर्नासत्या सातये कर्तम|	nāsatyas with your winged sterds came nigh and gave him strength to win.
आ वां सुम्नैः शम्यू इव मंहिष्ठा विश्ववेदसा|	come with your joys most liberal gods lords of all treasures bringing weal.
समस्मे भूषतं नरोत्सं न पिप्युषीरिषः|	like fresh full waters to a well so heroes come and be with us.
पिप्रीहि देवानुशतो यविष्ठ विद्वान रतून्रतुपतेयजेह|	gladden the yearning gods o thou most youthful bring them o lord of seasons knowing seasons.
ये दैव्या रत्विजस्तेभिरग्ने तवं होतॄणामस्यायजिष्ठः|	with all the priests celestial o agni best worshipper art thou of all invokers.
वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं जनानां मन्धातासि दरविणोदार्तावा|	thine is the heralds thine the cleansers office thinker art thou wealthgiver true to order.
सवाहा वयं कर्णवामा हवींषि देवो देवान्यजत्वग्निरर्हन|	let us with svāhā offer up oblations and agni worthy god pay the gods worship.
आ देवानामपि पन्थामगन्म यच्छक्नवाम तदनुप्रवोळुम|	to the gods pathway have we travelled ready to execute what work we may accomplish.
अग्निर्विद्वान स यजात सेदु होता सो अध्वरांस रतून कल्पयाति|	let agni for he knows complete the worship he is the priest let him fix rites and seasons.
यद वो वयं परमिनाम वरतानि विदुषं देवाविदुष्टरासः|	when we most ignorant neglect the statutes of you o deities with whom is knowledge.
अग्निष टद विश्वमा पर्णाति विद्वान्येभिर्देवान रतुभिः कल्पयाति|	wise agni shall correct our faults and failings skilled to assign each god his fitting season.
यत पाकत्रा मनसा दीनदक्षा न यज्ञस्य मन्वतेमर्त्यासः|	when weak in mind of feeble understanding mortals bethink them not of sacrificing.
अग्निष टद धोता करतुविद विजानन्यजिष्ठो देवान रतुशो यजाति|	then shall the prudent and discerning agni worship the gods best worshipper in season.
विश्वेषां हयध्वराणामनीकं चित्रं केतुं जनितात्वा जजान|	because the father hath produced thee leader of all our solemn rites their brilliant banner.
स आ यजस्व नर्वतीरनु कषा सपार्हािषः कषुमतीर्विश्वजन्याः|	so win by worship pleasant homes abounding in heroes and rich food to nourish all men.
यं तवा दयावाप्र्थिवी यं तवापस्त्वष्टा यं तवासुजनिमा जजान|	thou whom the heaven and earth thou whom the waters and tvaṣṭar maker of fair things created.
पन्थामनु परविद्वान्पित्र्याणं दयुमदग्ने समिधानो वि भाहि|	well knowing all along the fathers pathway shine with resplendent light enkindled agni.
केश्यग्निं केशी विषं केशी बिभर्ति रोदसी|	he with the long loose locks supports agni and moisture heaven and earth.
केशीविश्वं सवर्द्र्शे केशीदं जयोतिरुच्यते|	he is all sky to look upon he with long hair is called this light.
मुनयो वातरशनाः पिशङगा वसते मला|	the munis girdled with the wind wear garments soiled of yellow hue.
वातस्यानुध्राजिं यन्ति यद देवासो अविक्षत|	they following the winds swift course go where the gods have gone before.
उन्मदिता मौनेयन वाताना तस्थिमा वयम|	transported with our munihood we have pressed on into the winds.
शरीरेदस्माकं यूयं मर्तासो अभि पश्यथ|	you therefore mortal men behold our natural bodies and no more.
अन्तरिक्षेण पतति विश्वा रूपावचाकशत|	the muni made associate in the holy work of every god.
मुनिर्देवस्यदेवस्य सौक्र्त्याय सखा हितः|	looking upon all varied forms flies through the region of the air.
वातस्याश्वो वायोः सखाथो देवेषितो मुनिः|	the steed of vāta vāyus friend the muni by the gods impelled.
उभौसमुद्रावा कषेति यश्च पूर्व उतापरः|	in both the oceans hath his home in eastern and in western sea.
अप्सरसां गन्धर्वाणां मर्गाणां चरणे चरन|	treading the path of sylvan beasts gandharvas and apsarases.
केशीकेतस्य विद्वान सखा सवादुर्मदिन्तमः|	he with long locks who knows the wish is a sweet most delightful friend.
वायुरस्मा उपामन्थत पिनष्टि समा कुनन्नमा|	vāyu hath churned for him for him he poundeth things most hard to bend.
केशीविषस्य पात्रेण यद रुद्रेणापिबत सह|	when he with long loose locks hath drunk with rudra water from the cup.
इनो राजन्नरतिः समिद्धो रौद्रो दक्षाय सुषुमानदर्शि|	o king the potent and terrific envoy kindled for strength is manifest in beauty.
चिकिद वि भाति भासा बर्हतासिक्नीमेति रुशतीमपाजन|	he shines allknowing with his lotty splendour chasing black night he comes with whiterayed morning.
कर्ष्णां यदेनीमभि वर्पसा भूज्जनयन योषाम्ब्र्हतः पितुर्जाम|	having oercome the glimmering black with beauty and bringing forth the dame the great sires daughter.
ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सूर्यस्य सतभायन्दिवो वसुभिररतिर्वि भाति|	holding aloft the radiant light of sūrya as messenger of heaven he shines with treasures.
भद्रो भद्रया सचमान आगात सवसारं जारो अभ्येतिपश्चात|	attendant on the blessed dame the blessed hath come the lover followeth his sister.
सुप्रकेतैर्द्युभिरग्निर्वितिष्ठन रुशद्भिर्वर्णैरभि राममस्थात|	agni farspreading with conspicuous lustre hath compassed night with whitelyshining garments.
अस्य यामासो बर्हतो न वग्नूनिन्धाना अग्नेः सख्युःशिवस्य|	his goingsforth kindle as twere high voices the goings of the auspicious friend of agni.
इड्यस्य वर्ष्णो बर्हतः सवासो भामासो यामन्नक्तवश्चिकित्रे|	the rays the bright beams of the strongjawed mighty adorable steer are visible as he cometh.
सवना न यस्य भामासः पवन्ते रोचमानस्य बर्हतःसुदिवः|	whose radiant splendours flow like sounds about us his who is lofty brilliant and effulgent.
जयेष्ठेभिर्यस्तेजिष्ठैः करीळुमद्भिर्वर्षिष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्नक्षति दयाम|	who reaches heaven with best and brightest lustres sportive and piercing even to the summit.
अस्य शुष्मासो दद्र्शानपवेर्जेहमानस्य सवनयन नियुद्भिः|	his powers whose chariot fellies gleam and glitter have loudly roared while as with teams he hasted.
परत्नेभिर्यो रुशद्भिर्देवतमो वि रेभद्भिररतिर्भाति विभ्वा|	he the most godlike farextending envoy shines with flames ancient resonant whitelyshining.
स आ वक्षि महि न आ च सत्सि दिवस्प्र्थिव्योररतिर्युवत्योः|	so bring us ample wealth seat thee as envoy of the two youthful matrons earth and heaven.
अग्निः सुतुकः सुतुकेभिरश्वै रभस्वद्भीरभस्वानेह गम्याः|	let agni rapid with his rapid horses impetuous with impetuous steeds come hither.
तुभ्येदमिन्द्र परि षिच्यते मधु तवं सुतस्य कलशस्यराजसि|	this pleasant meath o indra is effused for thee thou art the ruling lord of beaker and of juice.
तवं रयिं पुरुवीरामु नस कर्धि तवं तपःपरितप्याजयः सवः|	bestow upon us wealth with many hero sons thou having glowed with fervour wonnest heavenly light.
सवर्जितं महि मन्दानमन्धसो हवामहे परि शक्रंसुतानुप|	let us call Śakra to libations here effused winner of light who joyeth in the potent juice.
इमं नो यज्ञमिह बोध्या गहि सप्र्धोजयन्तं मघवानमीमहे|	mark well this sacrifice of ours and come to us we pray to maghavan the vanquisher of hosts.
सोमस्य राज्ञो वरुणस्य धर्मणि बर्हस्पतेरनुमत्या उशर्मणि|	by royal somas and by varuṇas decree under bṛhaspatis and anumatis guard.
तवाहमद्य मघवन्नुपस्तुतौ धातर्विधातः कलशानभक्षयम|	this day by thine authority o maghavan maker disposer thou have i enjoyed the jars.
परसूतो भक्षमकरं चरावपि सतोमं चेमं परथमःसूरिरुन मर्जे|	too urged on have had my portion in the bowl and as first prince i drew forth this my hymn of praise.
सुते सातेन यद्यागमं वां परतिविश्वामित्रजमदग्नी दमे|	when with the prize i came unto the flowing juice o viśvāmitra jamadagni to your home.
अग्ने हंसि नयत्रिणं दीद्यन मर्त्येष्वा|	agni refulgent among men thou slayest the devouring fiend.
सवे कषयेशुचिव्रत|	bright ruler in thine own abode.
उत तिष्ठसि सवाहुतो घर्तानि परति मोदसे|	thou springest up when worshipped well the drops of butter are thy joy.
यत तवा सरुचःसमस्थिरन|	when ladies are brought near to thee.
स आहुतो वि रोचतेअग्निरीळेन्यो गिरा|	honoured with gifts he shines afar agni adorable with song.
सरुचा परतीकमज्यते|	the dripping ladle balms his face.
घर्तेनाग्निः समज्यते मधुप्रतीक आहुतः|	agni with honey in his mouth honoured with gifts is balmed with oil.
रोचमानोविभावसुः|	refulgent in his wealth of light.
जरमाणः समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन|	praised by our hymns thou kindlest thee oblationbearer for the gods.
तं तवा हवन्तमर्त्याः|	as such do mortals call on thee.
तं मर्ता अमर्त्यं घर्तेनाग्निं सपर्यत|	to that immortal agni pay worship with oil ye mortal men.
अदाभ्यंग्र्हपतिम|	lord of the house whom none deceives.
अदाभ्येन शोचिषाग्ने रक्षस्त्वं दह|	o agni burn the rākṣasas with thine unconquerable flame.
गोपा रतस्यदीदिहि|	shine guardian of eternal law.
स तवमग्ने परतीकेन परत्योष यातुधान्यः|	so agni with thy glowing face burn fierce against the female fiends.
उरुक्षयेषुदीद्यत|	shining among uruksayas.
तं तवा गीर्भिरुरुक्षया हव्यवाहं समीधिरे|	uruksayas have kindled thee oblationbearer thee with hymns.
यजिष्ठं मानुषे जने|	best worshipper among mankind.
विश्वे देवाः शास्तन मा यथेह होता वर्तो मनवै यन्निषद्य|	instruct me all ye gods how i elected your priest must seat me here and how address you.
पर मे बरूत भागधेयं यथा वो येन पथाहव्यमा वो वहानि|	instruct me how to deal to each his portion and by what  path to bring you mans oblation.
अहं होता नयसीदं यजीयान विश्वे देवा मरुतो माजुनन्ति|	i sit as priest most skilled in sacrificing the maruts and all deities impel me.
अहरअहरश्विनाध्वर्यवं वां बरह्मा समिद भवतिसाहुतिर्वाम|	aśvins each day yours is the adhvaryus duty brahman and wood are here tis yours to offer.
अयं यो होता किरु स यमस्य कमप्यूहे यत समञ्जन्तिदेवाः|	who is the priest is he the priest of yama on whom is thrust this godappointed honour.
अहरअहर्जायते मासिमास्यथा देवा दधिरेहव्यवाहम|	he springs to life each month each day that passes so gods have made him their oblationbearer.
मां देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहमपम्लुक्तं बहु कर्छ्राचरन्तम|	the gods have made me bearer of oblations who slipped away and passed through many troubles.
अग्निर्विद्वान यज्ञं नः कल्पयाति पञ्चयामन्त्रिव्र्तं सप्ततन्तुम|	wise agni shall ordain for us the worship whether fivewayed threefold or seventhreaded.
आ वो यक्ष्यम्र्तत्वं सुवीरं यथा वो देवा वरिवःकराणि|	so will i win you strength and life for ever o gods that i may give you room and freedom.
आ बाह्वोर्वज्रमिन्द्रस्य धेयामथेमाविश्वाः पर्तना जयाति|	to indras arms would i consign the thunder in all these battles shall he then be victor.
तरीणि शता तरी सहस्राण्यग्निं तरिंशच्च देवा नवचासपर्यन|	the deities three hundred and thirtynine have served and honoured agni.
औक्षन घर्तैरस्त्र्णन बर्हिरस्मा आदिद्धोतारं नयसादयन्त|	strewn sacred grass anointed him with butter and seated him as priest the gods invoker.
ममाग्ने वर्चो विहवेष्वस्तु वयं तवेन्धानास्तन्वम्पुषेम|	let me win glory agni in our battles enkindling thee may we support our bodies.
मह्यं नमन्तां परदिशश्चतस्रस्त्वयाध्यक्षेणप्र्तना जयेम|	may the four regions bend and bow before me with thee for guardian may we win in combat.
मम देवा विहवे सन्तु सर्व इन्द्रवन्तो मरुतो विष्णुरग्निः|	may all the gods be on my side in battle the maruts led by indra viṣṇu agni.
ममान्तरिक्षमुरुलोकमस्तु मह्यं वातः पवतांकामे अस्मिन|	mine be the middle airs extended region and may the wind blow favouring these my wishes.
मयि देवा दरविणमा यजन्तां मय्याशीरस्तु मयिदेवहूतिः|	may the gods grant me riches may the blessing and invocation of the gods assist me.
दैव्या होतारो वनुषन्त पूर्वेअरिष्टाःस्याम तन्वा सुवीराः|	foremost in fight be the divine invokers may we unwounded have brave heroes round us.
मह्यं यजन्तु मम यानि हव्याकूतिः सत्या मनसो मे अस्तु|	for me let them present all mine oblations and let my minds intention be accomplished.
एनो मा नि गां कतमच्चनाहं विश्वे देवासो अधिवोचता नः|	may i he guiltless of the least transgression and all ye gods do ye combine to bless us.
देवीः षळ उर्वीरुरु नः कर्णोत विश्वे देवास इहवीरयध्वम|	ye six divine expanses grant us freedom here all ye gods acquit yourselves like heroes.
मा हास्महि परजया मा तनूभिर्मा रधामद्विषते सोम राजन|	let us not lose our children or our bodies let us not benefit the foe king soma.
अग्ने मन्युं परतिनुदन परेषामदब्धो गोपाः परि पाहि नस्त्वम|	baffling the wrath of our opponents agni guard us as our infallible protector.
परत्यञ्चो यन्तु निगुतः पुनस्तेअमैषां चित्तम्प्रबुधां वि नेशत|	let these thy foes turn back and seek their houses and let their thought who watch at home be ruined.
धाता धातॄणां भुवनस्य यस पतिर्देवं तरातारमभिमातिषाहम|	lord of the world creator of creators the saviour god who overcomes the foeman.
इमं यज्ञमश्विनोभा बर्हस्पतिर्देवाः पान्तु यजमानं नयर्थात|	may gods bṛhaspati both aśvins shelter from ill this sacrifice and sacrificer.
उरुव्यचा नो महिषः शर्म यंसदस्मिन हवे पुरुहूतःपुरुक्षुः|	foodful and muchinvoked at this our calling may the great bull vouchsafe us wide protection.
स नः परजायै हर्यश्व मर्ळयेन्द्र मा नोरीरिषो मा परा दाः|	lord of bay coursers indra blew our children harm us not give us not as prey to others.
ये नः सपत्ना अप ते भवन्त्विन्द्राग्निभ्यामव बाधामहेतान|	let those who are our foemen stay afar from us with indra and with agni we will drive them off.
वसवो रुद्रा आदित्या उपरिस्प्र्शं मोग्रं चेत्तारमधिराजमक्रन|	vasus Ādityas rudras have exalted me made me farreaching mighty thinker sovran lord.
अयं हि ते अमर्त्य इन्दुरत्यो न पत्यते|	this deathless indu like a steed strong and of full vitality.
दक्षो विश्वायुर्वेधसे|	belongs to thee the orderer.
अयमस्मासु काव्य रभुर्वज्रो दास्वते|	here by us for the worshipper is the wise bolt that works with skill.
अयं बिभर्त्यूर्ध्वक्र्शनं मदं रभुर्न कर्त्व्यं मदम|	it brings the bubbling beverage as a dexterous man brings the effectual strong drink.
घर्षुः शयेनाय कर्त्वन आसु सवासु वंसगः|	impetuous ahīśuva a bull among cows of his.
अव दीधेदहीशुवः|	looked down upon the restless hawk.
यं सुपर्णः परावतः शयेनस्य पुत्र आभरत|	that the strongpinioned bird hath brought child of the falcon from afar.
शतचक्रं योअह्यो वर्तनिः|	what moves upon a hundred wheels along the female dragons path.
यं ते शयेनश्चारुमव्र्कं पदाभरदरुणं मानमन्धसः|	which fair unrobbed the falcon brought thee in his foot the redhued dwelling of the juice.
एना वयो वि तार्यायुर्जीवस एना जागारबन्धुता|	through this came vital power which lengthens out our days and kinship through its help awoke.
एवा तदिन्द्र इन्दुना देवेषु चिद धारयाते महि तयजः|	so indra is by lndus power een among gods will it repel great treachery.
करत्वा वयो वि तार्यायुः सुक्रतो करत्वायमस्मदासुतः|	wisdom most sapient one brings force that lengthens life may wisdom bring the juice to us.
ओ चित सखायं सख्या वव्र्त्यां तिरः पुरू चिदर्णवंजगन्वन|	fain would i win my friend to kindly friendship so may the sage come through the airs wide ocean.
पितुर्नपातमा दधीत वेधा अधि कषमिप्रतरं दिध्यानः|	remembering the earth and days to follow obtain a son the issue of his father.
न ते सखा सख्यं वष्ट्येतत सलक्ष्मा यद विषुरूपाभवाति|	thy friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as stranger.
महस पुत्रसो असुरस्य वीरा दिवो धर्तारौर्विया परि खयन|	sons of the mighty asura the heroes supporters of the heavens see far around them.
उशन्ति घा ते अम्र्तास एतदेकस्य चित तयजसं मर्त्यस्य|	yea this the immortals seek of thee with longing progeny of the sole existing mortal.
नि ते मनो मनसि धाय्यस्मे जन्युः पतिस्तन्वमाविविश्याः|	then let thy soul and mine be knit together and as a loving husband take thy consort.
न यत पुरा चक्र्मा कद ध नूनं रता वदन्तो अन्र्तंरपेम|	shall we do now what we neer did aforetime we who spake righteously now talk impurely.
गन्धर्वो अप्स्वप्या च योषा सा नो नाभिःपरमं जामि तन नौ|	gandharva in the floods the dame of waterssuch is our bond such our most lofty kinship.
गर्भे नु नौ जनिता दम्पती कर्देवास्त्वष्टा सविताविश्वरूपः|	even in the womb god tvaṣṭar vivifier shaping all forms creator made us consorts.
नाकिरस्य पर मिनन्ति वरतानि वेद नावस्यप्र्थिवि उत दयौः|	none violates his holy ordinances that we are his the heavens and earth acknowledge.
को अस्य वेद परथमस्याह्नः क ईं ददर्श क इह परवोचत|	who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest who hatb beheld it who can here declare it.
बर्हन मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम कदु बरव आहनोवीच्या नॄन|	great is the law of varuṇa and mitra what wanton wilt thou say to men to tempt them.
यमस्य मा यम्यं काम आगन समाने योनौ सहशेय्याय|	i yami am possessed by love of yama that i may rest on the same couch beside him.
जायेव पत्ये तन्वं रिरिच्यां वि चिद वर्हेव रथ्येव चक्रा|	i as a wife would yield me to my husband like carwheels let us speed to meet each other.
न तिष्ठन्ति न नि मिषन्त्येते देवानां सपश इह येचरन्ति|	they stand not still they never close their eyelids those sentinels of gods who wander round us.
अन्येन मदाहनो याहि तुयं तेन वि वर्ह रथ्येवचक्रा|	not mego quickly wanton with another and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him.
रात्रीभिरस्मा अहभिर्दशस्येत सूर्यस्य चक्षुर्मुहुरुन्मिमीयात|	may sūryas eye with days and nights endow him and ever may his light spread out before him.
दिवा पर्थिव्या मिथुना सबन्धू यमीर्यमस्यबिभ्र्यादजामि|	in heaven and earth the kindred pair commingle on yam be the unbrotherly act of yama.
आ घा ता गछानुत्तरा युगानि यत्र जामयः कर्णवन्नजामि|	sure there will come succeeding times when brothers and sisters will do acts unmeet for kinsfolk.
उप बर्ब्र्हि वर्षभाय बाहुमन्यमिछस्व सुभगेपतिं मत|	not me o fair oneseek another husband and make thine arm a pillow for thy consort.
किं भरतासद यदनाथं भवाति किमु सवसा यन निरतिर्निगछत|	is he a brother when no lord is left her is she a sister when destruction cometh.
काममूता बह्वेतद रपामि तन्वा मे तन्वं सम्पिप्र्ग्धि|	forced by my love these many words i utter come near and hold me in thy close embraces.
न वा उ ते तन्वा तन्वं सं पप्र्च्यां पापमाहुर्यःस्वसारं निगछात|	i will not fold mine arms about thy body they call it sin when one comes near his sister.
अन्येन मत परमुदः कल्पयस्व न तेभ्रात सुभगे वष्ट्येतत|	not meprepare thy pleasures with another thy brother seeks not this from thee o fair one.
बतो बतसि यम नैव ते मनो हर्दयं चाविदाम|	alas thou art indeed a weakling yama we find in thee no trace of heart or spirit.
अन्या किलत्वां कक्ष्येव युक्तं परि षवजाते लिबुजेव वर्क्षम|	as round the tree the woodbine clings another will cling albout thee girt as with a girdle.
अन्यमू षु तवं यम्यन्य उ तवां परि षवजाते लिबुजेवव्र्क्षम|	embrace another yami let another even as the woodbine rings the tree enfold thee.
तस्य वा तवं मन इछा स वा तवाधा कर्णुष्वसंविदं सुभद्राम|	win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy and he shall form with thee a blest alliance.
आविरभून महि माघोनमेषां विश्वं जीवं तमसो निरमोचि|	these mens great bounty hath been manifested and the whole world of life set free from darkness.
महि जयोतिः पित्र्भिर्दत्तमागादुरुः पन्थादक्षिणाया अदर्शि|	great light hath come vouchsafed us by the fathers apparent is the spacious path of guerdon.
उच्चा दिवि दक्षिणावन्तो अस्थुर्ये अश्वदाः सह तेसूर्येण|	high up in heaven abide the guerdongivers they who give steeds dwell with the sun for ever.
हिरण्यदा अम्र्तत्वं भजन्ते वासोदाः सोम परतिरन्त आयुः|	they who give gold are blest with life eternal they who give robes prolong their lives o soma.
दैवी पूर्तिर्दक्षिणा देवयज्या न कवारिभ्यो नहि तेप्र्णन्ति|	not from the niggardsfor they give not fireelycomes meed at sacrifice gods satisfaction.
अथा नरः परयतदक्षिणासोअवद्यभियाबहवः पर्णन्ति|	yea many men with hands stretched out with guerdon present their gifts because they dread dishonour.
शतधारं वायुमर्कं सवर्विदं नर्चक्षसस्ते अभिचक्षते हविः|	these who observe mankind regard oblation as streamy vāyu and lightfinding arka.
ये पर्णन्ति पर च यछन्ति संगमे तेदक्षिणां दुहते सप्तमातरम|	they satisfy and give their gifts in synod and pour in streams the sevenmothered guerdon.
दक्षिणावान परथमो हूत एति दक्षिणावान गरामणीरग्रमेति|	he who brings guerdon comes as first invited chief of the hamlet comes the guerdonbearer.
तमेव मन्ये नर्पतिं जनानां यः परथमोदक्षिणामाविवाय|	him i account the ruler of the people who was the first to introduce the guerdon.
तमेव रषिं तमु बरह्माणमाहुर्यज्ञन्यं सामगामुक्थशासम|	they call him Ṛṣi brahman sāmachanter reciter of the laud leader of worship.
स शुक्रस्य तन्वो वेद तिस्रो यः परथमोदक्षिणया रराध|	the brightlyshining gods three forms he knoweth who first bestowed the sacrificial guerdon.
दक्षिणाश्वं दक्षिणा गां ददाति दक्षिणा चन्द्रमुत यद धिरण्यम|	guerdon bestows the horse bestows the bullock guerdon bestows moreover gold that rsisters.
दक्षिणान्नं वनुते यो न आत्मादक्षिणां वर्म कर्णुते विजानन|	guerdon gives food which is our life and spirit he who is wise takes guerdon for his armour.
न भोजा मम्रुर्न नयर्थमीयुर्न रिष्यन्ति न वयथन्ते हभोजाः|	the liberal die not never are they ruined the liberal suffer neither harm nor trouble.
इदं यद विश्वं भुवनं सवश्चैतत सर्वन्दक्षिणैभ्यो ददाति|	the light of heaven the universe about usall this doth sacrificial guerdon give them.
भोजा जिग्युः सुरभिं योनिमग्रे भोजा जिग्युर्वध्वं यासुवासाः|	first have the liberal gained a fragrant dwelling and got themselves a bride in fair apparel.
भोजा जिग्युरन्तःपेयं सुराया भोजा जिग्युर्ये अहूताः परयन्ति|	the liberal have obtained their draught of liquor and conquered those who unprovoked assailed them.
भोजायाश्वं सं मर्जन्त्याशुं भोजायास्ते कन्याशुम्भमाना|	they deck the fleet steed for the bounteous giver the maid adorns herself and waits to meet him.
भोजस्येदं पुष्करिणीव वेश्म परिष्क्र्तन्देवमानेव चित्रम|	his home is like a lake with lotus blossoms like the gods palaces adorned and splendid.
भोजमश्वाः सुष्ठुवाहो वहन्ति सुव्र्द रथो वर्ततेदक्षिणायाः|	steeds good at draught convey the liberal giver and lightly rolling moves the car of guerdon.
भोजं देवासोअवता भरेषु भोजःशत्रून समनीकेषु जेता|	assist ye gods the liberal man in battles the liberal giver conquers foes in combat.
पर ससाहिषे पुरुहूत शत्रूञ जयेष्ठस्ते शुष्म इहरातिरस्तु|	o muchinvoked thou hast subdued thy foemen thy might is loftiest here display thy bounty.
इन्द्रा भर दक्षिणेना वसूनि पतिःसिन्धूनामसि रेवतीनाम|	in thy right hand o indra bring us treasures thou art the lord of rivers filled with riches.
मर्गो न भीमः कुचरो गिरिष्ठाः परावत आ जगन्थापरस्याः|	like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance.
सर्कं संशाय पविमिन्द्र तिग्मं वि शत्रून्ताळि वि मर्धो नुदस्व|	whetting thy bold and thy sharp blade o indra crush thou the foe and scatter those who hate us.
इन्द्र कषत्रमभि वाममोजोअजायथा वर्षभचर्षणीनाम|	thou mighty indra sprangest into being as strength for lovely lordship oer the people.
अपानुदो जनममित्रयन्तमुरुं देवेभ्योक्र्णोरु लोकम|	thou drovest off the folk who were unfriendly and to the gods thou gavest room and freedom.
दिवस परि परथमं जज्ञे अग्निरस्मद दवितीयं परिजातवेदाः|	first agni sprang to life from out of heaven the second time from us came jātavedas.
तर्तीयमप्सु नर्मणा अजस्रमिन्धान एनंजरते सवाधीः|	thirdly the manlysouled was in the waters the pious lauds and kindles him the eternal.
विद्मा ते अग्ने तरेधा तरयाणि विद्मा ते धाम विभ्र्तापुरुत्रा|	agni we know thy three powers in three stations we know thy forms in many a place divided.
विद्मा ते नाम परमं गुहा यद विद्मा तमुत्सं यत आजगन्थ|	we know what name supreme thou hast in secret we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.
समुद्रे तवा नर्मणा अप्स्वन्तर्न्र्चक्षा ईधे दिवो अग्नूधन|	the manlysouled lit thee in sea and waters mans viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven.
तर्तीये तवा रजसि तस्थिवांसमपामुपस्थेमहिषा अवर्धन|	there as thou stoodest in the third high region the steers increased thee in the waters bosom.
अक्रन्ददग्नि सतनयन्निव दयौः कषामा रेरिहद वीरुधःसमञ्जन|	agni roared out like dyaus what time he thunders he licked the ground about the plants he flickered.
सद्यो जज्ञानो वि हीमिद्धो अख्यदा रोदसीभानुना भात्यन्तः|	at once when born he looked around enkindled and lightened heaven and earth within with splendour.
शरीणामुदारो धरुणो रयीणां मनीषाणाम्प्रार्पणः सोमगोपाः|	the spring of glories and support of riches rouser of thoughts and guardian of the soma.
वसुः सूनुः सहसो अप्सु राजावि भात्यग्र उषसामिधानः|	good son of strength a king amid the waters in forefront of the dawns he shines enkindled.
विश्वस्य केतुर्भुवनस्य गर्भ आ रोदसी अप्र्णाज्जायमानः|	germ of the world ensign of all creation be sprang to life and filled the earth and heavens.
वीळुं चिदद्रिमभिनत परायञ जना यदग्निमयजन्त पञ्च|	even the firm rock he cleft when passing over when the five tribes brought sacrifice to agni.
उशिक पावको अरतिः सुमेधा मर्तेष्वग्निरम्र्तो नि धायि|	so among mortals was immortal agni stablished as holy wise and willing envoy.
इयर्ति धूममरुषं भरिभ्रदुच्छुक्रेण शोचिषाद्या इनक्षन|	he waves the red smoke that he lifts above him striving to reach the heavens with radiant lustre.
दर्शानो रुक्म उर्विया वयद्यौद दुर्मर्षमायुः शरियेरुचानः|	like gold to look on far he shone refulgent beaming imperishable life for glory.
अग्निरम्र्तो अभवद वयोभिर्यदेनं दयौर्जनयत सुरेताः|	agni by vital powers became immortal when his prolific father dyaus begat him.
यस्ते अद्य कर्णवद भद्रशोचेअपूपं देव घर्तवन्तमग्ने|	whoso this day o god whose flames are lovely prepares a cake o agni mixt with butter.
पर तं नय परतरं वस्यो अछाभि सुम्नं देवभक्तंयविष्ठ|	lead thou and further him to higher fortune to bliss bestowed by gods o thou most youthful.
आ तं भज सौश्रवसेष्वग्न उक्थौक्थ आ भज शस्यमाने|	endow him agni with a share of glory at every song of praise sung forth enrich him.
परियः सूर्ये परियो अग्ना भवात्युज्जातेन भिनददुज्जनित्वैः|	dear let him be to sūrya dear to agni preeminent with son and childrens children.
तवामग्ने यजमाना अनु दयून विश्वा वसु दधिरे वार्याणि|	while agni day by day men pay thee worship they win themselves all treasures worth the wishing.
तवया सह दरविणमिछमाना वरजं गोमन्तमुशिजो विवव्रुः|	allied with thee eager and craving riches they have disclosed the stable filled with cattle.
अस्ताव्यग्निर्नरां सुशेवो वैश्वानर रषिभिःसोमगोपाः|	agni the friend of men the somas keeper vaiśvānara hath been lauded by the Ṛṣis.
अद्वेषे दयावाप्र्थिवी हुवेम देवा धत्त रयिमस्मे सुवीरम|	we will invoke benignant earth and heaven ye deities give us wealth with hero children.
पर केतुना बर्हता यात्यग्निरा रोदसी वर्षभो रोरवीति|	agni advances with his lofty banner the bull is bellowing to the earth and heavens.
दिवश्चिदन्तानुपमानुदानळ अपामुपस्थे महिषोववर्ध|	he hath attained the skys supremest limits the steer hath waxen in the lap of waters.
मुमोद गर्भो वर्षभः ककुद्मानस्रेमा वत्सः शिमीवानरावीत|	the bull the youngling with the hump hath frolicked the strong and neverceasing calf hath bellowed.
स देवतात्युद्यतानि कर्ण्वन सवेषु कषयेषुप्रथमो जिगाति|	bringing our offerings to the gods assembly he moves as chief in his own dwellingplaces.
आ यो मूर्धानं पित्रोररब्ध नयध्वरे दधिरे सूरोर्णः|	him who hath grasped his parents head they stablished at sacrifice a wave of heavenly lustre.
अस्य पत्मन्नरुषीरश्वभुध्ना रतस्य योनौतन्वो जुषन्त|	in his swift flight the red dawns borne by horses refresh their bodies in the home of order.
उषउषो हि वसो अग्रमेषि तवं यमयोरभवो विभावा|	for vasu thou precedest every morning and still hast been the twins illuminator.
रताय सप्त दधिषे पदानि जनयन मित्रं तन्वे सवायै|	for sacrifice seven places thou retainest while for thine own self thou engenderest mitra.
भुवश्चक्षुर्मह रतस्य गोपा भुवो वरुणो यद रतायवेषि|	thou art the eye and guard of mighty order and varuṇa when to sacrifice thou comest.
भुवो अपां नपाज्जातवेदो भुवो दूतो यस्यहव्यं जुजोषः|	thou art the waters child o jātavedas envoy of him whose offering thou acceptest.
भुवो यज्ञस्य रजसश्च नेता यत्रा नियुद्भिः सचसेशिवाभिः|	thou art the leader of the rite and region to which with thine auspicious teams thou teadest.
दिवि मूर्धानं दधिषे सवर्षां जिह्वामग्नेचक्र्षे हव्यवाहम|	thy lightbestowing head to heaven thou liftest making thy tongue the oblationbearer agni.
अस्य तरितः करतुना वव्रे अन्तरिछन धीतिं पितुरेवैःपरस्य|	through his wise insight trita in the cavern seeking as ever the chief sires intention.
सचस्यमानः पित्रोरुपस्थे जामि बरुवाणायुधानि वेति|	carefully tended in his parents bosom calling the weapons kin goes forth to combat.
स पित्र्याण्यायुधनि विद्वनिन्द्रेषित आप्त्यो अभ्ययुध्यत|	wellskilled to use the weapons of his father Āptya urged on by indra fought the battle.
तरिशीर्षाणं सप्तरश्मिं जघन्वान तवाष्ट्रस्य चिन्निः सस्र्जे तरितो गाः|	then trita slew the foe sevenrayed threeheaded and freed the cattle of the son of tvaṣṭar.
भूरीदिन्द्र उदिनक्षन्तमोजोअवाभिनत सत्पतिर्मन्यमानम|	lord of the brave indra cleft him in pieces who sought to gain much strength and deemed him mighty.
तवाष्ट्रस्य चिद विश्वरूपस्य गोनामाचक्रणस्त्रीणि शीर्षा परा वर्क|	he smote his three heads from his body seizing the cattle of the oniniform son of tvaṣṭar.
यस्ते मन्योअविधद वज्र सायक सह ओजः पुष्यति विश्वमानुषक|	he who hath reverenced thee manyu destructive bolt breeds for himself forthwith all conquering energy.
साह्याम दासमार्यं तवया युजा सहस्क्र्तेनसहसा सहस्वता|	Ārya and dāsa will we conquer with thine aid with thee the conqueror with conquest conquestsped.
मन्युरिन्द्रो मन्युरेवास देवो मन्युर्होता वरुणोजातवेदाः|	manyu was indra yea the god was manyu manyu was hotar varuṇa jātavedas.
मन्युं विश ईळते मानुषीर्याः पाहि नोमन्यो तपसा सजोषाः|	the tribes of human lineage worship manyu accordant with thy fervour manyu guard us.
अभीहि मन्यो तवसस्तवीयान तपसा युजा वि जहि शत्रून|	come hither manyu mightier tham the mighty chase with thy fervour for ally our foemen.
अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहा च विश्वा वसून्या भरात्वं नः|	slayer of foes of vṛtra and of dasyu bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure.
तवं हि मन्यो अभिभूत्योजाः सवयम्भूर्भामोभिमातिषाहः|	for thou art manyu of surpassing vigour fierce queller of the foe and selfexistent.
विश्वचर्षणिः सहुरिः सहावानस्मास्वोजः पर्तनासु धेहि|	shared by all men victorious subduer vouchsafe to us superior strengith in battles.
अभागः सन्नप परेतो अस्मि तव करत्वा तविषस्यप्रचेतः|	i have departed still without a portion wise god according to thy will the mighty.
तं तवा मन्यो अक्रतुर्जिहीळाहं सवा तनूर्बलदेयाय मेहि|	i feeble man was wroth thee o manyu i am myself come thou to give me vigour.
अयं ते अस्म्युप मेह्यर्वां परतीचीनः सहुरे विश्वधायः|	come hither i am all thine own advancing turn thou to me victorious allsupporter.
मन्यो वज्रिन्नभि मामा वव्र्त्स्व हनाव दस्यून्रुतबोध्यापेः|	come to me manyu wielder of the thunder bethink thee of thy friend and slay the dasyus.
अभि परेहि दक्षिणतो भवा मेअधा वर्त्राणि जङघनावभूरि|	approach and on my right hand hold thy station so shall we slay a multitude of foemen.
जुहोमि ते धरुणं मध्वो अग्रमुभा उपांशुप्रथमा पिबाव|	the best of meath i offer to support thee may we be first to drink thereof in quiet.
समिद्धश्चित समिध्यसे देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन|	thou bearer of oblations though kindled art kindled for the gods.
आदित्यैरुद्रैर्वसुभिर्न आ गहि मर्ळीकाय न आ गहि|	with the Ādityas rudras vasus come to us to show us favour come to us.
इमं यज्ञमिदं वचो जुजुषाण उपागहि|	come hither and accept with joy this sacrifice and hymn of ours.
मर्तासस्त्वासमिधान हवामहे मर्ळीकाय हवामहे|	o kindled god we mortals are invoking thee calling on thee to show us grace.
तवामु जातवेदसं विश्ववारं गर्णे धिया|	i laud thee jātavedas thee lord of all blessings with my song.
अग्ने देवाना वह नः परियव्रतान मर्ळीकाय परियव्रतान|	agni bring hitherward the gods whose laws we love whose laws we love to show us grace.
अग्निर्देवो देवानामभवत पुरोहितोअग्निं मनुष्या रषयःसमीधिरे|	agni the god was made the great highpriest of gods Ṛṣis have kindled agni men of mortal mould.
अग्निं महो धनसातावहं हुवे मर्ळीकन्धनसातये|	agni i invocate for winning ample wealth kindly disposed for winning wealth.
अग्निरत्रिं भरद्वाजं गविष्ठिरं परावन नः कण्वन्त्रसदस्युमाहवे|	atri and bharadvāja and gavisthira kaṇva and trasadasyu in our fight he helped.
अग्निं वसिष्ठो हवते पुरोहितोम्र्ळीकाय पुरोहितः|	on agni calls vasiṣṭha even the household priest the household priest to win his grace.
पर तार्यायुः परतरं नवीय सथातारेव करतुमतारथस्य|	his life hath been renewed and carried forward as two men carborne by the skilful driver.
अध चयवान उत तवीत्यर्थं परातरं सग़्म|	one falls then seeks the goal with quickened vigour let nirrti depart to distant places.
सामन नु राये निधिमन नवन्नं करामहे सु पुरुधश्रवांसि|	here is the psalm for wealth and food in plenty let us do many deeds to bring us glory.
ता नो विश्वानि जरिता ममत्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम|	all these our doings shall delight the singer let nirrti depart to distant places.
अभी षवर्यः पौंस्यैर्भवेम दयौर्न भूमिं गिरयोनाज्रन|	may we oercome our foes with acts of valour as heaven is over earth hills over lowlands.
ता नो विश्वानि जरिता चिकेत परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम|	all these our deeds the singer hath considered let nirrti depart to distant places.
मो षु णः सोम मर्त्यवे परा दाः पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम|	give us not up as prey to death o soma still let us look upon the sun arising.
दयुभिर्हितो जरिमा सू नो अस्तु परातरं सुनिरतिर्जिहीताम|	let our old age with passing days be kindly let nirrti depart to distant places.
असुनीते मनो अस्मासु धारय जीवातवे सु पर तिरा नायुः|	o asuniti keep the soul within us and make the days we have to live yet longer.
रारन्धि नः सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शि घर्तेन तवन्तन्वं वर्धयस्व|	grant that we still may look upon the sunlight strengthen thy body with the oil we bring thee.
असुनीते पुनरस्मासु चक्षुः पुनः पराणमिह नो धेहिभोगम|	give us our sight again o asuniti give us again our breath and our enjoyment.
जयोक पश्येम सूर्यमुच्चरन्तमनुमते मर्ळया नह्स्वस्ति|	long may we look upon the sun uprising o anumati favour thou and bless us.
पुनर्नो असुं पर्थिवी ददातु पुनर्द्यौर्देवी पुनरन्तरिक्षम|	may earth restore to us our vital spirit may heaven the goddess and midair restore it.
पुनर्नः सोमस्तन्वं ददातु पुनः पूषापथ्यां या सवस्तिः|	may soma give us once again our body and pūṣan show the path of peace and comfort.
शं रोदसी सुबन्धवे यह्वी रतस्य मातरा|	may both worlds bless subandhu young mothers of everlasting law.
भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमा रपो मो षु ते किंचनाममत|	may heaven and earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.
अव दवके अव तरिका दिवश्चरन्ति भेषजा|	healthgiving medicines descend sent down from heaven in twos and threes.
कषमाचरिष्ण्वेककं भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमारपो मो षु ते किं चनाममत|	or wandering singly on the earth may heaven and earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.
