समिन्द्रेरय गामनड्वाहं य आवहदुशीनराण्यानः|	drive forward thou the wagonox o indra which brought usinaranis wagon hither.
भरतामप यद रपो दयौः पर्थिवि कषमा रपो मोषु ते किं चनाममत|	may heaven and earth uproot and sweep iniquity and shame away nor sin nor sorrow trouble thee.
पर सूनव रभूणां बर्हन नवन्त वर्जना|	with hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the Ṛbhus mighty deeds.
कषामा येविश्वधायसोअश्नन धेनुं न मातरम|	who allsupporting have enjoyed the earth as twere a mother cow.
पर देवं देव्या धिया भरता जातवेदसम|	bring forth the god with song divine being jātavedas hitherward.
हव्या नोवक्षदानुषक|	to bear our gifts at once to heaven.
अयमु षय पर देवयुर्होता यज्ञाय नीयते|	he here a goddevoted priest led forward comes to sacrifice.
रथो नयोरभीव्र्तो घर्णीवाञ्चेतति तमना|	like a car covered for the road he glowing knows himself the way.
अयमग्निरुरुष्यत्यम्र्तादिव जन्मनः|	this agni rescues from distress as twere from the immortal race.
सहसश्चिद्सहीयान देवो जीवातवे कर्तः|	a god yet mightier than strength a god who hath been made for life.
तवं तयमिटतो रथमिन्द्र परावः सुतावतः|	for iṭas sake who pressed the juice thou indra didst protect his car.
अश्र्णोः सोमिनो हवम|	and hear the somagivers call.
तवं मखस्य दोधतः शिरोअव तवचो भरः|	thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swiftmoving combatant.
अगछःसोमिनो गर्हम|	and sought the somapourers home.
तवं तयमिन्द्र मर्त्यमास्त्रबुध्नाय वेन्यम|	venya that mortal man hast thou for Āstrabudhna the devout.
मुहुःश्रथ्ना मनस्यवे|	o indra many a time set free.
तवं तयमिन्द्र सूर्यं पश्चा सन्तं पुरस कर्धि|	bring indra to the east again that sun who now is in the west.
देवानां चित तिरो वशम|	even against the will of gods.
अहं दां गर्णते पूर्व्यं वस्वहं बरह्म कर्णवं मह्यंवर्धनम|	i have enriched the singer with surpassing wealth i have allowed the holy hymn to strengthen me.
अहं भुवं यजमानस्य चोदितायज्वनः साक्षिविश्वस्मिन भरे|	i furtherer of him who offers sacrifice have conquered in each fight the men who worship not.
मां धुरिन्द्रं नाम देवता दिवश्च गमश्चापां चजन्तवः|	the people of the heavens the waters and the earth have stablished me among the gods with indras name.
अहं हरी वर्षणा विव्रता रघू अहंवज्रं शवसे धर्ष्ण्वा ददे|	i took unto myself the two swift vigorous bays that speed on divers paths and the fierce bolt for strength.
अहमत्कं कवये शिश्नथं हथैरहं कुत्समावमाभिरूतिभिः|	with deadly blows i smote atka for kavis sake i guarded kutsa well with these saving helps.
अहं शुष्णस्य शनथिता वधर्यमंन यो रर आर्यं नाम दस्यवे|	as Śuṣṇas slayer i brandished the dart of death i gave not up the Āryan name to dasyu foes.
अहं पितेव वेतसून्रभिष्टये तुग्रं कुत्साय समदिभंच रन्धयम|	smadibha tugra and the vetasus i gave as prey to kutsa fatherlike to succour him.
अहं भुवं यजमानस्य राजनि पर यद भरेतुजये न परियाध्र्षे|	i was a worthy king to rule the worshipper when i gave tuji dear inviolable gifts.
अहं रन्धयं मर्गयं शरुतर्वणे यन माजिहीत वयुनाचनानुषक|	i gave up mṛgaya to srutarvan as his prey because he ever followed me and kept my laws.
अहं वेशं नम्रमायवेअकरमहंसव्याय पड्ग्र्भिमरन्धयम|	for Āyus sake i caused veta to bend and bow and into savyas hand delivered padgrbhi.
अहं स यो नववास्त्वं बर्हद्रथं सं वर्त्रेव दासंव्र्त्रहारुजम|	i crushed navavāstva of the lofty car the dāsa as the vṛtraslayer kills the fiends.
यद वर्धयन्तं परथयन्तमानुषग दूरेपारे रजसो रोचनाकरम|	when straightway on the regions farthest edge i brought the god who makes the lights to broaden and increase.
अहं सूर्यस्य परि याम्याशुभिः परैतशेभिर्वहमानोजसा|	i travel round about borne onward in my might by the fleetfooted dappled horses of the sun.
यन मा सावो मनुष आह निर्णिज रधक कर्षेदासं कर्त्व्यं हथैः|	when mans libation calls me to the robe of state i soon repel the powerful dasyu with my blows.
अहं सप्तहा नहुषो नहुष्टरः पराश्राव यं शवसातुर्वशं यदुम|	stronger am i than nabus i who slew the seven i glorified with might yadu and turvaga.
अहं नयन्यं सहसा सहस करं नवव्राधतो नवतिं च वक्षयम|	i brought another low with strength i bent his strength i let the mighty nineandninety wax in power.
अहं सप्त सरवतो धारयं वर्षा दरवित्न्वः पर्थिव्यांसीरा अधि|	bull over all the streams that flow along the earth i took the seven rivers as mine own domain.
अहमर्णांसि वि तिरामि सुक्रतुर्युधा विदम्मनवे गातुमिष्टये|	i gifted with great wisdom spread the floods abroad by war i found for man the way to high success.
अहं तदासु धारयं यदासु न देवश्चनत्वष्टाधारयद रुशत|	i set within these cows the white milk which no god not even tvaṣṭars self had there deposited.
सपार्हं गवामूधस्सुवक्षणास्वा मधोर्मधु शवात्र्यं सोममाशिरम|	muchlongedfor in the breasts the udders of the kine the savoury sweets of meath the milk and soma juice.
एवा देवानिन्द्रो विव्ये नॄन पर चयौत्नेन मघवासत्यराधाः|	even thus hath indra maghavan truly bounteous sped gods and men with mighty operation.
विश्वेत ता ते हरिवः शचीवोअभितुरासः सवयशो गर्णन्ति|	the pious glorify all these thine exploits lord of bay coursers strong and selfresplendent.
कं नश्चित्रमिषण्यसि चिकित्वान पर्थुग्मानं वाश्रंवाव्र्धध्यै|	what splendid one loudvoiced farstriding dost thou well knowing urge us to exalt with praises.
कत तस्य दातु शवसो वयुष्टौ तक्षद्वज्रं वर्त्रतुरमपिन्वत|	what give we him when his might dawned he fashioned the vṛtraslaying bolt and sent us waters.
स हि दयुता विद्युता वेति साम पर्थुं योनिमसुरत्वाससाद|	he goes to end his work with lightning flashes wide is the seat his asura glory gives him.
स सनीळेभिः परसहानो अस्य भरातुर्न रतेसप्तथस्य मायाः|	with his companions not without his brother he quells saptathas magic devices.
स वाजं यातापदुष्पदा यन सवर्षाता परि षदत्सनिष्यन|	on most auspicious path he goes to battle he toiled to win heavens light full fain to gain it.
अनर्वा यच्छतदुरस्य वेदो घनञ्छिश्नदेवानभि वर्पसा भूत|	he seized the hundredgated castles treasure by craft unchecked and slew the lustful demons.
स यह्व्योअवनीर्गोष्वर्वा जुहोति परधन्यासु सस्रिः|	fighting for kine the prize of war and i roaming among the berd be brings the young streams hither.
अपादो यत्र युज्यासोअरथा दरोण्यश्वास ईरते घर्तंवाः|	where footless joined without a car to bear them with jars for steeds they pour their flood like butter.
स रुद्रेभिरशस्तवार रभ्वा हित्वी गयमारेवद्यागात|	bold unsolicited for wealth with rudras he came the blameless having left his dwelling.
वम्रस्य मन्ये मिथुना विवव्री अन्नमभीत्यारोदयन्मुषायन|	came seized the food of vamra and his consort and left the couple weeping and unsheltered.
स इद दासं तुवीरवं पतिर्दन षळक्षन्त्रिशीर्षाणं दमन्यत|	lord of the dwelling he subdued the demon who roared aloud sixeyed and tripleheaded.
अस्य तरितो नवोजसा वर्धानो विपावराहमयोग्रया हन|	tṛta made stronger by the might he lent him struck down the boar with shaft whose point was iron.
स दरुह्वणे मनुष ऊर्ध्वसान आ साविषदर्शसानायशरुम|	he raised himself on high and shot his arrow against the guileful and oppressive foeman.
स नर्तमो नहुषोअस्मत सुजातः पुरोअभिनदर्हन्दस्युहत्ये|	strong glorious manliest for us he shattered the forts of nabus when he slew the dasyus.
सो अभ्रियो न यवस उदन्यन कषयाय गातुं विदन नो अस्मे|	he like a cloud that rains upon the pasture hath found for us the way to dwell in safety.
उप यत सीददिन्दुं शरीरैः शयेनोअयोपाष्टिर्हन्तिदस्यून|	when the hawk comes in body to the soma armed with his iron claws he slays the dasyus.
स वराधतः शवसानेभिरस्य कुत्साय शुष्णं कर्पणेपरादात|	he with his potent friends gave up the mighty gave gusnia up to kutsa for affliction.
अयं कविमनयच्छस्यमानमत्कं वो अस्यसनितोत नर्णाम|	he led the lauded kavi he delivered atka as prey to him and to his heroes.
अयं दशस्यन नर्येभिरस्य दस्मो देवेभिर्वरुणो नमायी|	he with his gods who love mankind the wondrous giving like varuṇa who works with magic.
अयं कनीन रतुपा अवेद्यमिमीताररुं यश्चतुष्पात|	was known yet young as guardian of the seasons and he quelled araru fourfooted dernon.
अस्य सतोमेभिरौशिज रजिश्वा वरजं दरयद वर्षभेणपिप्रोः|	through lauds of him hath auśija Ṛjiśvan burst with the mightys aid the stall of pipru.
सुत्वा यद यजतो दीदयद गीः पुर इयानो अभिवर्पसा भूत|	when the saint pressed the juice and shone as singer he seized the forts and with his craft subdued them.
एवा महो असुर वक्षथाय वम्रकः पड्भिरुप सर्पदिन्द्रम|	so swiftly asura for exaltation hath the great vamraka come nigh to indra.
स इयानः करति सवस्तिमस्मा इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः|	he will when supplicated bring him blessing he hath brought all food strength a happy dwelling.
अस्मिन न इन्द्र पर्त्सुतौ यशस्वति शिमीवति करन्दसि परावसातये|	o indra in this battle great and glorious in this loud din of war help us to victory.
यत्र गोषाता धर्षितेषु खादिषु विष्वक्पतन्ति दिद्यवो नर्षाह्ये|	where in the strife for kine among bold ringdecked men arrows fly all around and heroes are subdued.
स नः कषुमन्तं सदने वयूर्णुहि गोर्णसं रयिमिन्द्रश्रवाय्यम|	at home disclose to us opulence rich in food streaming with milk o indra meet to be renowned.
सयाम ते जयतः शक्र मेदिनो यथा वयमुश्मसि तद वसो कर्धि|	Śakra may we be thine the friendly conquerors even as we desire o vasu so do thou.
यो नो दास आर्यो वा पुरुष्टुतादेव इन्द्र युधये चिकेतति|	the godless man muchlauded indra whether he be dāsa or be Ārya who would war with us.
अस्माभिष टे सुषहाः सन्तु शत्रवस्त्वया वयं तान्वनुयाम संगमे|	easy to conquer he for thee with us these foes with thee may we subdue them in the clash of fight.
यो दभ्रेभिर्हव्यो यश्च भूरिभिर्यो अभीके वरिवोविन्न्र्षाह्ये|	him who must be invoked by many and by few who standeth nigh with comfort in the war of men.
तं विखादे सस्निमद्य शरुतं नरमर्वाञ्चमिन्द्रमवसे करामहे|	indra famed hero winner in the deadly strife let us bring hitherward today to favour us.
सवव्र्जं हि तवामहमिन्द्र शुश्रवानानुदं वर्षभरध्रचोदनम|	for indra i have heard thee called self capturer one steer who never yields who urges even the churl.
पर मुञ्चस्व परि कुत्सादिहा गहि किमुत्वावान मुष्कयोर्बद्ध आसते|	release thyself from kutsa and come hither how shall one like thee sit still bound that he may not move.
दूरे तन नाम गुह्यं पराचैर्यत तवा भीते अह्वयेतांवयोधै|	far is that secret name by which in terror the worlds invoked thee and thou gavest vigour.
उदस्तभ्नाः पर्थिवीं दयामभीके भरातुःपुत्रान मघवन तित्विषाणः|	the earth and heaven thou settest near each other and maghavan madest bright thy brothers children.
महत तन नाम गुह्यं पुरुस्प्र्ग येन भूतं जनयो येनभव्यम|	great is that secret name and farextending whereby thou madest all that is and shall be.
परत्नं जातं जयोतिर्यदस्य परियं परियाः समविशन्त पञ्च|	the five tribes whom he loveth well have entered the light he loveth that was made aforetime.
आ रोदसी अप्र्णादोत मध्यं पञ्च देवान रतुशः सप्त सप्त|	he filled the heaven and earth and all between them gods five times sevenfold in their proper seasons.
चतुस्त्रिंशता पुरुधा वि चष्टे सरूपेण जयोतिषाविव्रतेन|	with fourandthirty lights he looks around him lights of one colour though their ways are divers.
यदुष औछः परथमा विभानामजनयो येन पुष्टस्यपुष्टम|	as first among the lights o dawn thou shonest whereby thou broughtest forth the stay of increase.
यत ते जामित्वमवरं परस्या महन महत्यासुरत्वमेकम|	great art thou matchless is thine asura nature who high above art kin to those beneath thee.
विधुं दद्राणं समने बहूनां युवानं सन्तं पलितोजगार|	the old hath waked the young moon from his slumber who runs his circling course with many round him.
देवस्य पश्य काव्यं महित्वाद्या ममार स हयःसमान|	behold the gods high wisdom in its greatness he who died yesterday today is living.
शाक्मना शाको अरुणः सुपर्ण आ यो महः शूरःसनादनीळः|	strong is the red bird in his strength great hero who from of old hath had no nest to dwell in.
यच्चिकेत सत्यमित तन न मोघं वसुस्पार्हमुत जेतोत दाता|	that which he knows is truth and never idle he wins and gives the wealth desired of many.
ऐभिर्ददे वर्ष्ण्या पौंस्यानि येभिरौक्षद वर्त्रहत्यायवज्री|	through these the thunderer gained strong manly vigour through whom he waxed in power to smite down vṛtra.
ये कर्मणः करियमाणस्य मह्न रतेकर्ममुदजायन्त देवाः|	who through the might of indras operation came forth as gods in course of law and order.
युजा कर्माणि जनयन विश्वौजा अशस्तिथा विश्वमनास्तुराषाट|	allstrong performing works with his companion allmarking rapid victor curseaverter.
पीत्वी सोमस्य दिव आ वर्धानः शूरो निर्युधाधमद दस्यून|	the hero waxing after draughts of soma blew far from heaven the dasyus with his weapon.
अयं वेनश्चोदयत पर्श्निगर्भा जयोतिर्जरायू रजसोविमाने|	see vena born in light hath driven hither on chariot of the air the calves of pṛśni.
इममपां संगमे सूर्यस्य शिशुं न विप्रामतिभी रिहन्ति|	singers with hymns caress him as an infant there where the waters and the sunlight mingle.
समुद्रादूर्मिमुदियर्ति वेनो नभोजाः पर्ष्ठंहर्यतस्य दर्शि|	vena draws up his wave from out the ocean mistborn the fair ones back is made apparent.
रतस्य सानावधि विष्टपि भराट्समानं योनिमभ्यनूषत वराः|	brightly he shone aloft on orders summit the hosts sang glory to their common birthplace.
समानं पूर्वीरभि वावशानास्तिष्ठन वत्सस्यमातरः सनीळाः|	full many lowing to their jointpossession dwelling together stood the darlings mothers.
रतस्य सानावधि चक्रमाणारिहन्ति मध्वो अम्र्तस्य वाणीः|	ascending to the lofty height of order the bands of singers sip the sweets of amṛta.
जानन्तो रूपमक्र्पन्त विप्रा मर्गस्य घोषं महिषस्य हिग्मन|	knowing his form the sages yearned to meet him they have come nigh to hear the wild bulls bellow.
रतेन यन्तो अधि सिन्धुमस्थुर्विदद गन्धर्वोम्र्तानि नाम|	performing sacrifice they reached the river for the gandharva found the immortal waters.
अप्सरा जारमुपसिष्मियाणा योषा बिभर्ति परमे वयोमन|	the apsaras the lady sweetly smiling supports her lover in sublimest heaven.
चरत परियस्य योनिषु परियः सन सीदत पक्षे हिरण्ययेस वेनः|	in his friends dwelling as a friend he wanders he vena rests him on his golden pinion.
नाके सुपर्णमुप यत पतन्तं हर्दा वेनन्तो अभ्यचक्षतत्वा|	they gaze on thee with longing in their spirit as on a strongwinged bird that mounteth skyward.
हिरण्यपक्षं वरुणस्य दूतं यमस्य योनौशकुनं भुरण्युम|	on thee with wings of gold varuṇas envoy the bird that hasteneth to the home of yama.
ऊर्ध्वो गन्धर्वो अधि नाके अस्थात परत्यं चित्रा बिभ्रदस्यायुधानि|	erect to heaven hath the gandharva mounted pointing at us his manycoloured weapons.
वसानो अत्कं सुरभिं दर्शे कं सवर्णनाम जनत परियाणि|	clad in sweet raiment beautiful to look on for he as light produceth forms that please us.
दरप्सः समुद्रमभि यज्जिगाति पश्यन गर्ध्रस्य चक्षसाविधर्मन|	when as a spark he cometh near the ocean still looking with a vultures eye to heaven.
भानुः शुक्रेण शोचिषा चकानस्त्र्तीये चक्रेरजसि परियाणि|	his lustre joying in its own bright splendour maketh dear glories in the lowest region.
अस्तेव सु परतरं लायमस्यन भूषन्निव पर भरास्तोममस्मै|	even as an archer shoots afar his arrow offer the laud to him with meet adornment.
वाचा विप्रास्तरत वाचमर्यो नि रामयजरितः सोम इन्द्रम|	quell with your voice the wickeds voice o sages singer make indra rest beside the soma.
दोहेन गामुप शिक्षा सखायं पर बोधय जरितर्जारमिन्द्रम|	draw thy friend to thee like a cow at milking o singer wake up indra as a lover.
कोशं न पूर्णं वसुना नय्र्ष्टमा चयावयमघदेयाय शूरम|	make thou the hero haste to give us riches even as a vessel filled brimful with treasure.
किमङग तवा मघवन भोजमाहुः शिशीहि मा शिशयन्त्वा शर्णोमि|	why maghavan do they call thee bounteous giver quicken me thou i hear art he who quickens.
अप्नस्वती मम धीरस्तु शक्र वसुविदम्भगमिन्द्रा भरा नः|	Śakra let my intelligence be active and bring us luck that finds great wealth o indra.
तवां जना ममसत्येष्विन्द्र सन्तस्थाना वि हवयन्तेसमीके|	standing in battle for their rights together the people indra in the fray invoke thee.
अत्रा युजं कर्णुते यो हविष्मान नासुन्वतासख्यं वष्टि शूरः|	him who brings gifts the hero makes his comrade with him who pours no juice he seeks not friendship.
धनं न सयन्द्रं बहुलं यो अस्मै तीव्रान सोमानासुनोतिप्रयस्वान|	whoso with plenteous food for him expresses strong somas as much quicklycoming treasure.
तस्मै शत्रून सुतुकान परातरह्नो निस्वष्ट्रान युवति हन्ति वर्त्रम|	for him he overthrows in early morning his swift wellweaponed foes and slays the tyrant.
यस्मिन वयं दधिमा शंसमिन्द्रे यः शिश्राय मघवाकाममस्मे|	he unto whom we offer praises indra maghavan who hath joined to ours his wishes.
आराच्चित सन भयतामस्य शत्रुर्न्यस्मैद्युम्ना जन्या नमन्ताम|	before him even afar the foe must tremble low before him must bow all human glories.
आराच्छत्रुमप बाधस्व दूरमुग्रो यः शम्बःपुरुहूत तेन|	with thy fierce bolt o god invoked of many drive to a distance from afar the foeman.
अस्मे धेहि यवमद गोमदिन्द्र कर्धी धियंजरित्रे वाजरत्नाम|	o indra give us wealth in corn and cattle and make thy singers prayer gain strength and riches.
पर यमन्तर्व्र्षसवासो अग्मन तीव्राः सोमा बहुलान्तासैन्द्रम|	indra the swallower of strong libations rich in the boons they bring the potent somas.
नाह दामानं मघवा नि यंसन नि सुन्वते वहतिभूरि वामम|	he maghavan will not restrict his bounty he brings much wealth unto the somapresser.
उत परहामतिदीव्या जयाति कर्तं यच्छ्वघ्नी विचिनोतिकाले|	yea by superior play he wins advantage when he a gambler piles his gains in season.
यो देवकामो न धना रुणद्धि समित तं रायास्र्जति सवधावान|	celestialnatured he oerwhelms with riches the devotee who keeps not back his treasure.
गोभिष टरेमामतिं दुरेवां यवेन कषुधं पुरुहूतविश्वाम|	o muchinvoked may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle.
वयं राजभिः परथमा धनान्यस्माकेनव्र्जनेना जयेम|	may we allied as first in rank with princes obtain possessions by our own exertion.
बर्हस्पतिर्नः परि पातु पश्चादुतोत्तरस्मादधरादघायोः|	bṛhaspati protect us from the rearward and from above and from below from sinners.
इद्रः पुरस्तादुत मध्यतो नः सखा सखिभ्योवरिवः कर्णोतु|	may indra from the front and from the centre as friend to friends vouchsafe us room and freedom.
शरत ते दधामि परथमाय मन्यवेअहन यद वर्त्रं नर्यंविवेरपः|	i trust in thy first wrathful deed o indra when thou slewest vṛtra and didst work to profit man.
उभे यत तवा भवतो रोदसी अनु रेजतेशुष्मात पर्थिवी चिदद्रिवः|	what time the two worldhalves fell short of thee in might and the earth trembled at thy force o thunderanned.
तवं मायाभिरनवद्य मायिनं शरवस्यता मनसा वर्त्रमर्दयः|	thou with thy magic powers didst rend the conjurer vṛtra o blameless one with heart that longed for fame.
तवमिन नरो वर्णते गविष्टिषु तवां विश्वासुहव्यास्विष्टिषु|	heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey thee in all sacrifices worthy of renown.
ऐषु चाकन्धि पुरुहूत सूरिषु वर्धासो ये मघवन्नानशुर्मघम|	god muchinvoked take pleasure in these princes here who thine exalters maghavan have come to wealth.
अर्चन्ति तोके तनये परिष्टिषु मेधसाता वाजिनमह्रये धने|	in synods when the rite succeeds they hymn the strong for sons and progeny and riches undisturbed.
स इन नु रायः सुभ्र्तस्य चाकनन मदं यो अस्य रंह्यंचिकेतति|	that man shall find delight in wellprotected wealth whose care provides for him the quicksought joyous draught.
तवाव्र्धो मघवन दाश्वध्वरो मक्षू स वाजम्भरते धना नर्भिः|	bringing oblations strengthened maghavan by thee he swiftly wins the spoil with heroes in the fight.
तवं शर्धाय महिना गर्णान उरु कर्धि मघवञ्छग्धिरायः|	now for our band o maghavan when lauded make ample room with might and grant us riches.
तवं नो मित्रो वरुणो न मायी पित्वो न दस्मदयसे विभक्ता|	magician thou our varuṇa and mitra deal food to us o wondrous as dispenser.
अरायि काणे विकटे गिरिं गछ सदान्वे|	arayi oneeyed limping hag fly everscreeching to the hill.
शिरिम्बिठस्यसत्वभिस्तेभिष टवा चातयामसि|	we frighten thee away with these the heroes of sirimbitha.
चत्तो इतश्चत्तामुतः सर्वा भरूणान्यारुषी|	scared from this place and that is she destroyer of each germ unborn.
अराय्यं बरह्मणस पते तीक्ष्णश्र्ण्गोद्र्षन्निहि|	go sharphorned brāhmaṇaspti and drive arayi far away.
अदो यद दारु पलवते सिन्धोः पारे अपूरुषम|	yon log that floats without a man to guide it on the rivers edge.
तदारभस्व दुर्हणो तेन गछ परस्तरम|	seize it thou thing with hideous jaws and go thou far away thereon.
यद ध पराचीरजगन्तोरो मण्डूरधाणिकीः|	when foul with secret stain and spot ye hastened onward to the breast.
हतािन्द्रस्य शत्रवः सर्वे बुद्बुदयाशवः|	all indras enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.
परीमे गामनेषत पर्यग्निमह्र्षत|	these men have led about the cow have duly carried agni round.
देवेष्वक्रतश्रवः क इमाना दधर्षति|	and raised their glory tg the gods who will attack them with success.
तवया मन्यो सरथमारुजन्तो हर्षमाणासो धर्षितामरुत्वः|	borne on with thee o manyu girt by maruts let our brave men impetuous bursting forward.
तिग्मेषव आयुधा संशिशाना अभि पर यन्तुनरो अग्निरूपाः|	march on like flames of fire in form exulting with pointed arrows sharpening their weapons.
अग्निरिव मन्यो तविषितः सहस्व सेनानीर्नः सहुरे हूतेधि|	flashing like fire be thou o conquering manyu invoked o victor as our armys leader.
हत्वाय शत्रून वि भजस्व वेद ओजो मिमानो वि मर्धोनुदस्व|	slay thou our foes distribute their possessions show forth thy vigour scatter those who hate us.
सहस्व मन्यो अभिमातिमस्मे रुजन मर्णन परम्र्णन परेहिशत्रून|	o manyu overcome thou our assailant on breaking slaying crushing down the foemen.
उग्रं ते पाजो नन्वा रुरुध्रे वशी वशंनयस एकज तवम|	they have not hindered thine impetuous vigour mighty sole born thou makest them thy subjects.
एको बहूनामसि मन्यवीळितो विशंविशं युधये संशिशाधि|	alone or many thou art worshipped manyu sharpen the spirit of each clan for battle.
अक्र्त्तरुक तवया युजा वयं दयुमन्तं घोषंविजयाय कर्ण्महे|	with thee to aid o thou of perfect splendour we will uplift the glorious shout for conquest.
विजेषक्र्दिन्द्र इवानवब्रवोअस्माकं मन्यो अधिपा भवेह|	unyielding bringing victory like indra o manyu be thou here our sovran ruler.
परियं ते नाम सहुरे गर्णीमसि विद्मा तमुत्सं यताबभूथ|	to thy dear name o victor we sing praises we know the spring from which thou art come hither.
आभूत्या सहजा वज्र सायक सहो बिभर्ष्यभिभूतौत्तरम|	twinborn with power destructive bolt of thunder the highest conquering might is thine subduer.
करत्वा नो मन्यो सह मेद्येधि महाधनस्य पुरुहूतसंस्र्जि|	be friendly to its in thy spirit manyu o muchinvoked in shock of mighty battle.
संस्र्ष्टं धनमुभयं समाक्र्तमस्मभ्यं दत्तांवरुणश्च मन्युः|	for spoil let varuṇa and manyu give us the wealth of both sides gathered and collected.
भियं दधाना हर्दयेषु शत्रवःपराजितासो अप नि लयन्ताम|	and let our enemies with stricken spirits oerwhelmed with terror slink away defeated.
नमो मित्रस्य वरुणस्य चक्षसे महो देवाय तद रतंसपर्यत|	do homage unto varuṇas and mitras eye offer this solemn worship to the mighty god.
दूरेद्र्शे देवजाताय केतवे दिवस पुत्रायसूर्याय शंसत|	who seeth far away the ensign born of gods sing praises unto sūrya to the son of dyaus.
सा मा सत्योक्तिः परि पातु विश्वतो दयावा च यत्रततनन्नहानि च|	may this my truthful speech guard me on every side wherever heaven and earth and days are spread abroad.
विश्वमन्यन नि विशते यदेजतिविश्वाहापो विश्वाहोदेति सूर्यः|	all else that is in motion finds a place of rest the waters ever flow and ever mounts the sun.
न ते अदेवः परदिवो नि वासते यदेतशेभिः पतरैरथर्यसि|	no godless man from time remotest draws thee down when thou art driving forth with winged dappled steeds.
पराचीनमन्यदनु वर्तते रज उदन्येनज्योतिषा यासि सूर्य|	one lustre waits upon thee moving to the cast and sūrya thou arisest with a different light.
येन सूर्य जयोतिषा बाधसे तमो जगच्च विश्वमुदियर्षिभानुना|	o sūrya with the light whereby thou scatterest gloom and with thy ray impellest every moving thing.
तेनास्मद विश्वामनिरामनाहुतिमपामीवामप दुष्वप्न्यं सुव|	keep far from us all feeble worthless sacrifice and drive away disease and every evil dream.
विश्वस्य हि परेषितो रक्षसि वरतमहेळयन्नुच्चरसिस्वधा अनु|	sent forth thou guardest well the universes law and in thy wonted way arisest free from wrath.
यदद्य तवा सूर्योपब्रवामहै तं नो देवानु मंसीरत करतुम|	when sūrya we address our prayers to thee today may the gods favour this our purpose and desire.
तं नो दयावाप्र्थिवी तन न आप इन्द्रः शर्ण्वन्तु मरुतोहवं वचः|	this invocation these our words may heaven and earth and indra and the waters and the maruts hear.
मा शूने भूम सूर्यस्य सन्द्र्शिभद्रं जीवन्तो जरणामशीमहि|	neer may we suffer want in presence of the sun and living happy lives may we attain old age.
विश्वाहा तवा सुमनसः सुचक्षसः परजावन्तो अनमीवानागसः|	cheerful in spirit evermore and keen of sight with store of children free from sickness and from sin.
उद्यन्तं तवा मित्रमहो दिवेदिवे जयोग जीवाःप्रति पश्येम सूर्य|	longliving may we look o sūrya upon thee uprising day by day thou great as mitra is.
महि जयोतिर्बिभ्रतं तवा विचक्षण भास्वन्तं चक्षुषे चक्षुषे मयः|	sūrya may we live long and look upon thee still thee o farseeing one bringing the glorious light.
आरोहन्तं बर्हतः पाजसस परि वयंजीवाः परति पश्येम सूर्य|	the radiant god the spring of joy to every eye as thou art mounting up oer the high shining flood.
यस्य ते विश्वा भुवनानि केतुना पर चेरते नि च विशन्तेक्तुभिः|	thou by whose lustre all the world of life comes forth and by thy beams again returns unto its rest.
अनागास्त्वेन हरिकेश सूर्याह्नाह्ना नोवस्यसावस्यसोदिहि|	o sūrya with the golden hair ascend for us day after day still bringing purer innocence.
शं नो भव चक्षसा शं नो अह्ना शं भानुना शंहिमा शं घर्णेन|	bless us with shine bless us with perfect daylight bless us with cold with fervent heat and lustre.
यथा शमध्वञ्छमसद दुरोणेतत सूर्य दरविणं धेहि चित्रम|	bestow on us o sūrya varied riches to bless us in our home and when we travel.
अस्माकं देवा उभयाय जन्मने शर्म यछत दविपदेचतुष्पदे|	gods to our living creatures of both kinds vouchsafe protection both to bipeds and to quadrupeds.
अदत पिबदूर्जयमानमाशितं तदस्मेशं योररपो दधातन|	that they may drink and eat invigorating food so grant us health and strength and perfect innocence.
यद वो देवाश्चक्र्म जिह्वया गुरु मनसो वा परयुतीदेवहेळनम|	if by some grievous sin we have provoked the gods o deities with the tongue or thoughtlessness of heart.
अरावा यो नो अभि दुछुनायते तस्मिन तदेनोवसवो नि धेतन|	that guilt o vasus lay upon the evil one on him who ever leads us into deep distress.
पर होता जातो महान नभोविन नर्षद्वा सीददपामुपस्थे|	stablished for thee to lend thee vital forces giver of wealth guard of his servants body.
दधिर्यो धायि स ते वयांसि यन्ता वसूनि विधतेतनूपाः|	the great priest born who knows the clouds abider with men is seated in the lap of waters.
इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे पशुं न नष्टं पदैरनु गमन|	worshipping seeking him with adoration like some lost creature followed by its footprints.
गुहा चतन्तमुशिजो नमोभिरिछन्तो धीराभ्र्गवोअविन्दन|	wise bhṛgus yearning in their hearts pursued him and found him lurking where the floods are gathered.
इमं तरितो भूर्यविन्ददिछन वैभूवसो मूर्धन्यघ्न्यायाः|	on the cows forehead with laborious searching trita the offspring of vibhiavas found him.
स शेव्र्धो जात आ हर्म्येषु नाभिर्युवाभवति रोचनस्य|	born in our houses youthful joybestower he now becomes the central point of brightness.
मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो नमोभिः पराञ्चं यज्ञं नेतारमध्वराणाम|	yearning with homage they have set and made him blithe priest among mankind oblationbearer.
विशामक्र्ण्वन्नरतिं पावकं हव्यवाहन्दधतो मानुषेषु|	leader of rites and purifier envoy of men as sacrifice that still advances.
पर भूर्जयन्तं महां विपोधां मूरा अमूरं पुरान्दर्माणम|	the foolish brought the neerbewildered forward great victor songinspirer fortdestroyer.
नयन्तो गर्भं वनां धियं धुर्हिरिश्मश्रुं नार्वाणं धनर्चम|	leading the youth goldbearded like a courser gleaming with wealth they turned their hymn to profit.
नि पस्त्यासु तरित सतभूयन परिवीतो योनौ सीददन्तः|	holding his station firmly in the houses trita sat down within his home surrounded.
अतः संग्र्भ्या विशां दमूना विधर्मणायन्त्रैरीयतेनॄन|	thence as law bids departs the tribes companion having collected men with no compulsion.
अस्याजरासो दमामरित्रा अर्चद्धूमासो अग्नयः पावकाः|	his are the fires eternal purifying that make the houses move whose smoke is shining.
शवितीचयः शवात्रासो भुरण्यवो वनर्षदो वायवो नसोमाः|	white waxing in their strength for ever stirring and sitting in the wood like winds are somas.
पर जिह्वया भरते वेपो अग्निः पर वयुनानि चेतसाप्र्थिव्याः|	the tongue of agni bears away the praisesong and through his care for earth her operations.
तमायवः शुचयन्तं पावकं मन्द्रंहोतारं दधिरे यजिष्ठम|	him bright and radiant living men have stablished as their blithe priest the chief of sacrificers.
दयावा यमग्निं पर्थिवी जनिष्टामापस्त्वष्टा भर्गवोयं सहोभिः|	that agni him whom heaven and earth engendered the waters tvaṣṭar and with might the bhṛgus.
ईळेन्यं परथमं मातरिश्वा देवास्ततक्षुर्मनवे यजत्रम|	him mātariśvan and the gods have fashioned holy for man and first to be entreated.
यं तवा देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहं पुरुस्प्र्हो मानुषासोयजत्रम|	agni whom gods have made oblationbearer and muchdesiring men regard as holy.
स यामन्नग्ने सतुवते वयो धाः पर देवयन्यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः|	give life to him who lauds thee when he worships and then shall glorious men in troops adore thee.
सूर्यरश्मिर्हरिकेशः पुरस्तात सविता जयोतिरुदयानजस्रम|	savitar goldenhaired hath lifted eastward bright with the sunbeams his eternal lustre.
तस्य पूषा परसवे याति विद्वान सम्पश्यन्विश्वा भुवनानि गोपाः|	he in whose energy wise pūṣan marches surveying all existence like a herdsman.
नर्चक्षा एष दिवो मध्य आस्त आपप्रिवान रोदसीन्तरिक्षम|	beholding men he sits amid the heaven filling the two worldhalves and airs wide region.
स विश्वाचीरभि चष्टे घर्ताचीरन्तरापूर्वमपरं च केतुम|	he looks upon the rich farspreading pastures between the eastern and the western limit.
रायो बुध्नः संगमनो वसूनां विश्वा रूपाभि चष्टेशचीभिः|	he root of wealth the gathererup of treasures looks with his might on every form and figure.
देव इव सविता सत्यधर्मेन्द्रो न तस्थौसमरे धनानाम|	savitar like a godẉhose law is constant stands in the battle for the spoil like indra.
विश्वावसुं सोम गन्धर्वमापो दद्र्शुषीस्तद रतेना वयायन|	waters from sacrifice came to the gandharva visvavasu o soma when they saw him.
तदन्ववैदिन्द्रो रारहाण आसां परि सुर्यस्यपरिधिन्रपश्यत|	indra approaching quickly marked their going and looked around upon the suns enclosures.
विश्वावसुरभि तन नो गर्णातु दिव्यो गन्धर्वो रजसोविमानः|	this song visvavasu shall sing us meter of airs midrealm celestial gandharva.
यद वा घा सत्यमुत यन न विद्म धियोहिन्वानो धिय इन नो अव्याः|	that we may know aright both truth and falsehood may he inspire our thoughts and help our praises.
सस्निमविन्दच्चरणे नदीनामपाव्र्णोद दुरो अश्मव्रजानाम|	in the floods track he found the bootyseeker the rocky cowpens doors he threw wide open.
परासां गन्धर्वो अम्र्तानि वोचदिन्द्रो दक्षं परि जानादहीनाम|	these the gandharva told him rowed with amṛta indra knew well the puissancc of the dragons.
पर वो गरावाणः सविता देवः सुवतु धर्मणा|	may savitar the god o stones stir you according to the law.
धूर्षुयुज्यध्वं सुनुत|	be harnessed to the shafts and press.
गरावाणो अप दुछुनामप सेधत दुर्मतिम|	stones drive calamity away drive ye away malevolence.
उस्राः कर्तनभेषजम|	make ye the cows our medicine.
गरावाण उपरेष्वा महीयन्ते सजोषसः|	of one accord the upper stones giving the bull his bulllike strength.
वर्ष्णेदधतो वर्ष्ण्यम|	look down with pride on those below.
गरावाणः सविता नु वो देवः सुवतु धर्मणा|	may savitar the god o stones stir you as law commands for him.
यजमानाय सुन्वते|	who sacrifices pouring juice.
अपेहि मनसस पतेअप कराम परश्चर|	avaunt thou master of the mind depart and vanish far away.
परो निरतया आचक्ष्व बहुधा जीवतो मनः|	look on destruction far from hence the live mans mind is manifold.
भद्रं वै वरं वर्णते भद्रं युञ्जन्ति दक्षिणम|	a happy boon do men elect a mighty blessing they obtain.
भद्रं वैवस्वते चक्षुर्बहुत्रा जीवतो मनः|	bliss with vaivasvata they see the live mans mind seeks many a place.
यदाशसा निःशसाभिशसोपारिम जाग्रतो यत सवपन्तः|	if by address by blame by imprecation we have committed sin awake or sleeping.
अग्निर्विश्वान्यप दुष्क्र्तान्यजुष्टान्यारे अस्मद्दधातु|	all hateful acts of ours all evil doings may agni bear away to distant places.
यदिन्द्र बरह्मणस पतेअभिद्रोहं चरामसि|	when indra brahmaṇaspati our deeds are wrongful and unjust.
परचेता नाङगिरसो दविषतां पात्यंहसः|	may provident aṅgirasa prevent our foes from troubling us.
अजैष्माद्यासनाम चाभूमानागसो वयम|	we have prevailed this day and won we are made free from sin and guilt.
जाग्रत्स्वप्नःसंकल्पः पापो यं दविष्मस्तं स रछतु यो नो दवेष्टितं रछतु|	ill thoughts that visit us awake or sleeping seize the man we hate yea seize the man who hateth us.
सहस्रशीर्षा पुरुषः सहस्राक्षः सहस्रपात|	a thousand heads hath puruṣa a thousand eyes a thousand feet.
सभूमिं विश्वतो वर्त्वात्यतिष्ठद दशाङगुलम|	on every side pervading earth he fills a space ten fingers wide.
पुरुष एवेदं सर्वं यद भूतं यच्च भव्यम|	this puruṣa is all that yet hath been and all that is to be.
उताम्र्तत्वस्येशानो यदन्नेनातिरोहति|	the lord of immortality which waxes greater still by food.
एतावानस्य महिमातो जयायांश्च पूरुषः|	so mighty is his greatness yea greater than this is puruṣa.
पादोअस्यविश्वा भूतानि तरिपादस्याम्र्तं दिवि|	all creatures are onefourth of him threefourths eternal life in heaven.
तरिपादूर्ध्व उदैत पुरुषः पादोअस्येहाभवत पुनः|	with threefourths puruṣa went up onefourth of him again was here.
ततो विष्वं वयक्रामत साशनानशने अभि|	thence he strode out to every side over what cats not and what cats.
तस्माद विराळ अजायत विराजो अधि पूरुषः|	from him virāj was born again puruṣa from virāj was born.
स जातोत्यरिच्यत पश्चाद भूमिमथो पुरः|	as soon as he was born he spread eastward and westward oer the earth.
यत पुरुषेण हविषा देवा यज्ञमतन्वत|	when gods prepared the sacrifice with puruṣa as their offering.
वसन्तोस्यासीदाज्यं गरीष्म इध्मः शरद धविः|	its oil was spring the holy gift was autumn summer was the wood.
तं यज्ञं बर्हिषि परौक्षन पुरुषं जातमग्रतः|	they balmed as victim on the grass puruṣa born in earliest time.
तेन देवा अयजन्त साध्या रषयश्च ये|	with him the deities and all sādhyas and Ṛṣis sacrificed.
तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुतः सम्भ्र्तं पर्षदाज्यम|	from that great general sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up.
पशून्तांश्चक्रे वायव्यानारण्यान गराम्याश्च ये|	he formed the creatures ofthe air and animals both wild and tame.
तस्माद यज्ञात सर्वहुत रचः सामानि जज्ञिरे|	from that great general sacrifice Ṛcas and sāmahymns were born.
छन्दांसिजज्ञिरे तस्माद यजुस्तस्मादजायत|	therefrom were spells and charms produced the yajus had its birth from it.
तस्मादश्वा अजायन्त ये के चोभयादतः|	from it were horses born from it all cattle with two rows of teeth.
गावो हजज्ञिरे तस्मात तस्माज्जाता अजावयः|	from it were generated kine from it the goats and sheep were born.
यत पुरुषं वयदधुः कतिधा वयकल्पयन|	when they divided puruṣa how many portions did they make.
मुखं किमस्य कौ बाहू का ऊरू पादा उच्येते|	what do they call his mouth his arms what do they call his thighs and feet.
बराह्मणोअस्य मुखमासीद बाहू राजन्यः कर्तः|	the brahman was his mouth of both his arms was the rājanya made.
ऊरूतदस्य यद वैश्यः पद्भ्यां शूद्रो अजायत|	his thighs became the vaiśya from his feet the Śūdra was produced.
चन्द्रमा मनसो जातश्चक्षोः सूर्यो अजायत|	the moon was gendered from his mind and from his eye the sun had birth.
मुखादिन्द्रश्चाग्निश्च पराणाद वायुरजायत|	indra and agni from his mouth were born and vāyu from his breath.
नाभ्या आसीदन्तरिक्षं शीर्ष्णो दयौः समवर्तत|	forth from his navel came midair the sky was fashioned from his head.
पद्भ्यां भूमिर्दिशः शरोत्रात तथा लोकानकल्पयन|	earth from his feet and from his car the regions thus they formed the worlds.
सप्तास्यासन परिधयस्त्रिः सप्त समिधः कर्ताः|	seven fencingsticks had he thrice seven layers of fuel were prepared.
देवायद यज्ञं तन्वाना अबध्नन पुरुषं पशुम|	when the gods offering sacrifice bound as their victim puruṣa.
यज्ञेन यज्ञमयजन्त देवास्तानि धर्माणि परथमान्यासन|	gods sacrificing sacrificed the victim these were the earliest holy ordinances.
ते ह नाकं महिमानः सचन्त यत्र पूर्वे साध्याःसन्ति देवाः|	the mighty ones attained the height of heaven there where the sādhyas gods of old are dwelling.
नि वर्तध्वं मानु गातास्मान सिषक्त रेवतीः|	turn go not farther on your way visit us o ye wealthy ones.
अग्नीषोमापुनर्वसू अस्मे धारयतं रयिम|	agni and soma ye who bring riches again secure us wealth.
पुनरेना नि वर्तय पुनरेना नया कुरु|	make these return to us again bring them beside us once again.
इन्द्र एणा नियछत्वग्निरेना उपाजतु|	may indra give them back to us and agni drive them hitherward.
पुनरेता नि वर्तन्तामस्मिन पुष्यन्तु गोपतौ|	let them return to us again under this herdsman let them feed.
इहैवाग्नेनि धारयेह तिष्ठतु या रयिः|	do thou o agni keep them here and let the wealth we have remain.
यन नियानं नययनं संज्ञानं यत परायणम|	call upon their herdsman him who knoweth well their coming nigh.
आवर्तनं निवर्तनं यो गोपा अपि तं हुवे|	their parting and their homereturn and watcheth their approach and rest.
य उदानड वययनं य उदानट परायणम|	yea let the herdsman too return who marketh well their drivingforth.
आवर्तनंनिवर्तनमपि गोपा नि वर्तताम|	marketh their wandering away their turning back and coming home.
आ निवर्त नि वर्तय पुनर्न इन्द्र गा देहि|	homeleader lead them home to us indra restore to us our kine.
जीवाभिर्भुनजामहै|	we will rejoice in them alive.
परि वो विश्वतो दध ऊर्जा घर्तेन पयसा|	offer you on every side butter and milk and strengthening food.
ये देवाः केच यज्ञियास्ते रय्या सं सर्जन्तु नः|	may all the holy deities pour down on us a flood of wealth.
आ निवर्तन वर्तय नि निवर्तन वर्तय|	o thou homeleader lead them home restore them thou who bringest home.
भूम्याश्चतस्रःप्रदिशस्ताभ्य एना नि वर्तय|	four are the quarters of the earth from these bring back to us our kine.
आ जनं तवेषसन्द्र्शं माहीनानामुपस्तुतम|	bringing our homage we have come to one magnificent in look.
अगन्मबिभ्रतो नमः|	glorified of the mighty gods.
असमातिं नितोशनं तवेषं निययिनं रथम|	to asamati spring of gifts lord of the brave a radiant car.
भजेरथस्य सत्पतिम|	the conqueror of bhajeratha.
यो जनान महिषानिवातितस्थौ पवीरवान|	who when the spear hath armed his hand or even weaponless oerthrows.
उतापवीरवान्युधा|	men strong as buffaloes in fight.
यस्येक्ष्वाकुरुप वरते रेवान मराय्येधते|	him in whose service flourishes iksvaku rich and dazzlingbright.
दिवीवपञ्च कर्ष्टयः|	as the five tribes that are in heaven.
इन्द्र कषत्रासमातिषु रथप्रोष्ठेषु धारय|	indra support the princely power of rathaprosthas matched by none.
दिवीवसूर्यं दर्शे|	even as the sun for all to see.
अगस्त्यस्य नद्भ्यः सप्ती युनक्षि रोहिता|	thou for agastyas sisters sons yokest thy pair of ruddy steeds.
पणीन नयक्रमीरभि विश्वान राजन्नराधसः|	thou troddest niggards under foot all those o king who brought no gifts.
अयं मातायं पितायं जीवातुरागमत|	this is the mother this the sire this one hath come to be thy life.
इदं तवप्रसर्पणं सुबन्धवेहि निरिहि|	what brings thee forth is even this now come subandhu get thee forth.
यथा युगं वरत्रया नह्यन्ति धरुणाय कम|	as with the leather thong they bind the chariot yoke to hold it fast.
एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवेअथो अरिष्टतातये|	so have i held thy spirit fast held it for life and not for death held it for thy security.
यथेयं पर्थिवी मही दाधारेमान वनस्पतीन|	even as this earth the mighty earth holds fast the monarchs of the wood.
एवादाधार ते मनो जीवातवे न मर्त्यवेअथो अरिष्टतातये|	so have i held thy spirit fast held it for life and not for death held it for thy security.
यमादहं वैवस्वतात सुबन्धोर्मन आभरम|	subandlins spirit i have brought from yarna from vivasvāns son.
जीवातवेन मर्त्यवेअथो अरिष्टतातये|	brought it for life and not for death yea brought it for security.
नयग वातोअव वाति नयक तपति सूर्यः|	the wind blows downward from on high downward the sungod sends his heat.
नीचीनमघ्न्यादुहे नयग भवतु ते रपः|	downward the milchcow pours her milk so downward go thy pain and grief.
अयं मे हस्तो भगवानयं मे भगवत्तरः|	felicitous is this mine hand yet more felicitous is this.
अयं मेविश्वभेषजोअयं शिवाभिमर्शनः|	this hand contains all healing balms and this makes whole with gentle touch.
अभ्रप्रुषो न वाचा परुषा वसु हविष्मन्तो न यज्ञाविजानुषः|	as with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise mans liberal sacrifices.
सुमारुतं न बरह्माणमर्हसे गणमस्तोष्येषां न शोभसे|	i praise their company that merits worship as the good martits priest to pay them honour.
शरिये मर्यासो अञ्जीन्रक्र्ण्वत सुमरुतं न पूर्विरतिक्षपः|	the youths have wrought their ornaments for glory through many nightsthis noble band of maruts.
दिवस पुत्रास एता न येतिर आदित्यासस्ते अक्रन वाव्र्धुः|	like stags the sons of dyatis have striven onward the sons of aditi grown strong like pillars.
पर ये दिवः पर्थिव्य न बर्हणा तमना रिरिच्रे अभ्रान्न सूर्यः|	they who extend beyond the earth and heaven by their own mass as from the cloud spreads sūrya.
पाजस्वन्तो न वीराः पनस्यवो रिशादसो नमर्या अभिद्यवः|	like mighty heroes covetous of glory like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked.
युष्माकं बुध्ने अपां न यामनि विथुर्यति न महीश्रथर्यति|	when ye come nigh as in the depth of waters the earth is loosened as it were and shaken.
विश्वप्सुर्यज्ञो अर्वागयं सु वःप्रयस्वन्तो न सत्राच आ गत|	this your allfeedin sacrifice approaches come all united fraught as twere with viands.
यूयं धूर्षु परयुजो न रश्मिभिर्ज्योतिष्मन्तो न भासाव्युष्टिषु|	ye are like horses fastened to the chariot poles luminous with your beams with splendour as at dawn.
शयेनासो न सवयशसो रिशादसः परवासोन परसितासः परिप्रुषः|	like selfbright falcons punishers of wicked men like hovering birds urged forward scattering rain around.
पर यद वहध्वे मरुतः पराकाद यूयं महःसंवरणस्य वस्वः|	when ye come forth o maruts from the distance from the great treasury of rich possessions.
विदानासो वसवो राध्यस्याराच्चिद्द्वेषः सनुतर्युयोत|	knowing o vasus boons that should be granted even from afar drive back the men who hate us.
य उद्र्चि यज्ञे अध्वरेष्ठा मरुद्भ्यो न मानुषो ददाशत|	he who engaged in the rites final duty brings as a man oblation to the maruts.
रेवत स वयो दधते सुवीरं स देवानामपि गोपीथेस्तु|	wins him lifes wealthy fulness blest with heroes he shall be present too where gods drink soma.
ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमा आदित्येन नाम्नाशम्भविष्ठाः|	for these are helps adored at sacrifices bringing good fortune by their name Ādityas.
ते नोअवन्तु रथतूर्मनीषां महश्चयामन्नध्वरे चकानाः|	speeding on cars let them protect our praises delighting in our sacrifice and worship.
अपश्यमस्य महतो महित्वममर्त्यस्य मर्त्यासु विक्षु|	i have beheld the might of this great being immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals.
नाना हनू विभ्र्ते सं भरेते असिन्वती बप्सती भूर्यत्तः|	his jaws now open and now shut together much they devour insatiately chewing.
गुहा शिरो निहितं रधगक्षी असिन्वन्नत्ति जिह्वयावनानि|	his eyes are turned away his head is hidden unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel.
अत्राण्यस्मै पड्भिः सं भरन्त्युत्तानहस्तानमसाधि विक्षु|	with hands upraised with reverence in the houses for him they quickly bring his food together.
पर मातुः परतरं गुह्यमिछन कुमारो न वीरुधःसर्पदुर्वीः|	seeking as twere his mothers secret bosom he like a child creeps on through widespread bushes.
ससं न पक्वमविदच्छुचन्तंरिरिह्वांसं रिप उपस्थे अन्तः|	one he finds glowing like hot food made ready and kissing deep within the earths recmes.
तद वां रतं रोदसी पर बरवीमि जायमानो मातरा गर्भोत्ति|	this holy law i tell you earth and heaven the infant at his birth dovours his parents.
नाहं देवस्य मर्त्यश्चिकेताग्निरङग विचेताः सप्रचेताः|	no knowledge of the god have i a mortal yea agni knoweth best for he hath wisdom.
यो अस्मा अन्नं तर्ष्वादधात्याज्यैर्घ्र्तैर्जुहोतिपुष्यति|	this man who quickly gives him food who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him.
तस्मै सहस्रमक्षभिर्वि चक्षेअग्ने विश्वतःप्रत्यंं असि तवम|	him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on thou showest him thy face from all sides agni.
किं देवेषु तयज एनश्चकर्थाग्ने पर्छामि नु तवामविद्वान|	agni hast thou committed sin or treason among the gods in ignorance i ask thee.
अक्रीळन करीळन हरिरत्तवेअदन वि पर्वशश्चकर्त गामिवासिः|	playing not playing he goldhued and toothless hath cut his food up as the knife a victim.
विषूचो अश्वान युयुजे वनेजा रजीतिभी रशनाभिर्ग्र्भीतान|	he born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions held with reins that glitter.
चक्षदे मित्रो वसुभिः सुजातः समान्र्धेपर्वभिर्वाव्र्धानः|	the wellborn friend hath carved his food with vasus in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered.
समिद्धो अद्य मनुषो दुरोणे देवो देवान यजसि जातवेदः|	thou in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest gods as god o jātavedas.
आ च वह मित्रमहश्चिकित्वान तवं दूतः कविरसिप्रचेताः|	observant bright as mitra bring them hither thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.
तनूनपात पथ रतस्य यानान मध्वा समञ्जन सवदयासुजिह्व|	tanūnapāt fairtongued with sweet meath balming the paths and waysof order make them pleasant.
मन्मानि धीभिरुत यज्ञं रन्धन देवत्रा चक्र्णुह्यध्वरं नः|	convey our sacrifice to heaven exalting with holy thoughts ourhymns of praise and worship.
आजुह्वान ईड्यो वन्द्यश्चा याह्यग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः|	invoked deserving prayer and adoration o agni come accordant with the vasus.
तवं देवानामसि यह्व होता स एनान यक्षीषितो यजीयान|	thou art o youthful lord the gods invoker so best of sacrificers bring them quickly.
पराचीनं बर्हिः परदिशा पर्थिव्या वस्तोरस्या वर्ज्यतेग्रे अह्नाम|	by rule the sacred grass is scattered eastward a robe to clothe this earth when dawns are breaking.
वयु परथते वितरं वरीयो देवेभ्यो अदितयेस्योनम|	widely it spreads around and farextended fair for the gods and bringing peace and freedom.
वयचस्वतीरुर्विया वि शरयन्तां पतिभ्यो न जनयःशुम्भमानाः|	let the expansive doors be widely opened like wives who deck their beauty for their husbands.
देवीर्द्वारो बर्हतीर्विश्वमिन्वा देवेभ्योभवत सुप्रायणाः|	lofty celestial allimpelling portals admit the gods and give them easy entrance.
आ सुष्वयन्ती यजते उपाके उषासानक्ता सदतां नियोनौ|	pouring sweet dews let holy night and morning each close to each he seated at their station.
दिव्ये योषणे बर्हती सुरुक्मे अधि शरियंशुक्रपिशं दधाने|	lofty celestial dames with gold to deck them assuming all their fair and radiant beauty.
दैव्या होतारा परथमा सुवाचा मिमाना यज्ञं मनुषोयजध्यै|	come the two first celestial sweetvoiced hotars arranging sacrifice for man to worship.
परचोदयन्ता विदथेषु कारू पराचीनं जयोतिःप्रदिशा दिशन्ता|	as singers who inspire us in assemblies showing the eastward light with their direction.
आ नो यज्ञं भारती तूयमेत्विळा मनुष्वदिहचेतयन्ती|	let bhāratī come quickly to our worship and iḷā showing like a human being.
तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सयोनं सरस्वतीस्वपसः सदन्तु|	so let sarasvatī and both her fellows deft goddesses on this fair grass be seated.
य इमे दयावाप्र्थिवी जनित्री रूपैरपिंशद भुवनानिविश्वा|	hotar more skilled in sacrifice bring hither with speed today god tvaṣṭar thou who knowest.
तमद्य होतरिषितो यजीयान देवं तवष्टारमिह यक्षि विद्वान|	even him who formed these two the earth and heaven the parents with their forms and every creature.
उपावस्र्ज तमन्या समञ्जन देवानां पाथ रतुथाहवींषि|	send to our offerings which thyself thou balmest the companies of gods in ordered season.
वनस्पतिः शमिता देवो अग्निः सवदन्तु हव्यम्मधुना घर्तेन|	agni vanaspati the immolator sweeten our offered gift with meath and butter.
सद्यो जातो वयमिमीत यज्ञमग्निर्देवानामभवत्पुरोगाः|	agni as soon as he was born made ready the sacrifice and was the gods preceder.
अस्य होतुः परदिश्य रतस्य वाचि सवाहाक्र्तंहविरदन्तु देवाः|	may the gods cat our offering consecrated according to this true priests voice and guidance.
अग्निः सप्तिं वाजम्भरं ददात्यग्निर्वीरं शरुत्यंकर्मनिष्ठाम|	agni bestows the fleet prizewinning courser agni the hero famed and firm in duty.
अग्नी रोदसी वि चरत समञ्जन्नग्निर्नारीं वीरकुक्षिं पुरन्धिम|	agni pervades and decks the earth and heaven and fills the fruitful dame who teems with heroes.
अग्नेरप्नसः समिदस्तु भद्राग्निर्मही रोदसी आ विवेश|	blest be the wood that feeds the active agni within the two great worlds hath agni entered.
अग्निरेकं चोदयत समत्स्वग्निर्व्र्त्राणि दयते पुरूणि|	agni impels a single man to battle and with him rends in pieces many a foeman.
अग्निर्ह तयं जरतः कर्णमावाग्निरद्भ्यो निरदहज्जरूथम|	agni rejoiced the car of him who praised lim and from the waters burnt away jarutha.
अग्निरत्रिं घर्म उरुष्यदन्तरग्निर्न्र्मेधम्प्र जयास्र्जत सम|	agni saved atri in the fiery cavem and made nrmedha rich with troops of children.
अग्निर्दाद दरविणं वीरपेशा अग्निरषिं यः सहस्रासनोति|	agni hath granted wealth that decks the hero and sent the sage who wins a thousand cattle.
अग्निर्दिवि हव्यमा ततानाग्नेर्धामानिविभ्र्ता पुरुत्रा|	agni hath made oblations rise to heaven to every place are agnis laws extended.
अग्निमुक्थैरषयो वि हवयन्तेअग्निं नरो यामनिबाधितासः|	with songs of praise the Ṛṣis call on agni on agni heroes worsted in the foray.
अग्निं वयो अन्तरिक्षे पतन्तोअग्निः सहस्रापरि याति गोनाम|	birds flying in the region call on agni around a thousand cattle agni wanders.
अग्निं विश ईळते मानुषीर्या अग्निं मनुषो नहुषो विजाताः|	races of human birth pay agni worship men who have sprung from nahus line adore him.
अग्निर्गान्धर्वीं पथ्यां रतस्याग्नेर्गव्यूतिर्घ्र्त आ निषत्ता|	stablished in holy oil is agnis pasture on the gandharva path of law and order.
अग्नये बरह्म रभवस्ततक्षुरग्निं महामवोचामा सुव्र्क्तिम|	the Ṛbhus fabricated prayer for agni and we with mighty hymns have called on agni.
अग्ने पराव जरितारं यविष्ठाग्ने महि दरविणमायजस्व|	agni most youthful god protect the singer win us by worship agni great possessions.
मुञ्चामि तवा हविषा जीवनाय कमज्ञातयक्ष्मादुतराजयक्ष्मात|	for life i set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from consumption.
गराहिर्जग्राह यदि वैतदेनं तस्यािन्द्राग्नी पर मुमुक्तमेनम|	or if the grasping demon have possessed him free him from her o indra thou and agni.
यदि कषितायुर्यदि वा परेतो यदि मर्त्योरन्तिकं नीतेव|	be his days ended be he now departed be he brought very near to death already.
तमा हरामि निरतेरुपस्थादस्पार्षमेनंशतशारदाय|	out of destructions lap again i bring him save him for life to last a hundred autumns.
सहस्राक्षेण शतशारदेन शतायुषा हविषाहार्षमेनम|	with hundredeyed oblation hundredautumned bringing a hundred lives have i restored him.
शतं यथेमं शरदो नयातीन्द्रो विश्वस्यदुरितस्य पारम|	that indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.
शतं जीव शरदो वर्धमानः शतं हेमन्ताञ्छतमुवसन्तान|	live waxing in thy strength a hundred autumns live through a hundred springs a hundred winters.
शतमिन्द्राग्नी सविता बर्हस्पतिः शतायुषाहविषेमं पुनर्दुः|	through hundredlived oblation indra agni bṛhaspati savitar yield him for a hundred.
आहार्षं तवाविदं तवा पुनरागाः पुनर्नव|	so have i found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed.
सर्वाङगसर्वं ते चक्षुः सर्वमायुश्च तेअविदम|	whole in thy members i have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.
पर हयछा मनीषा सपार्ह यन्ति नियुतः|	forward upon their way proceed the ready teams the lovely songs.
पर दस्रानियुद्रथः पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः|	further them glorious pūṣan with yoked chariot and the mighty twain.
यस्य तयन महित्वं वताप्यमयं जनः|	with sacred hymns let this man here this singer win the god to whom.
विप्र आ वंसद्धीतिभिश्चिकेत सुष्टुतीनाम|	belong this majesty and might he hath observed our eulogies.
स वेद सुष्टुतीनामिन्दुर्न पूष वर्षा|	pūṣan the strong hath knowledge of sweet praises even as indu hath.
अभि पसुरःप्रुषायति वरजं न आ परुषायति|	he dews our corn with moisture he bedews the pasture of our kine.
मंसीमहि तवा वयमस्माकं देव पूषन|	we will bethink ourselves of thee o pūṣan o thou god as one.
मत्मां चसाधनं विप्राणां चाधवम|	who brings fulfilment of our hymns and stirs the singer and the sage.
परत्यर्धिर्यज्ञनामश्वहयो रथानाम|	jointsharer of each sacrifice the driver of the chariot steeds.
रषिः स योमनुर्हितो विप्रस्य यावयत्सखः|	the Ṛṣi who is good to man the singers friend and faithful guard.
अधीषमाणायाः पतिः शुचायाश्च शुचस्य च|	one who is lord of suca lord of suca caring for herself.
वासोवयोअवीनामा वासांसि मर्म्र्जत|	weaving the raiment of the sheep and making raiment beautiful.
इनो वाजानां पतिरिनः पुष्टीनं सख|	the mighty lord of spoil and wealth strong friend of all prosperity.
पर शमश्रुहर्यतो दूधोद वि वर्थ यो अदाभ्यः|	he with light movement shakes his beard lovely and neer to be deceived.
आ ते रथस्य पूषन्नजा धुरं वव्र्त्युः|	o pūṣan may those goats of thine turn hitherward thy chariotpole.
विश्वस्यार्थिनः सखा सनोजा अनपच्युतः|	friend of all suppliants art thou born in old time and arm and sure.
अस्मकमुर्जा रथं पूषा अविष्टु माहिनः|	may the majestic pūṣan speed our chariot with his power and might.
भुवद्वजनां वर्ध इमं नः शर्णवद धवम|	may he increase our store of wealth and listen to this call of ours.
तवष्टा दुहित्रे वहतुं कर्णोतीतीदं विश्वं भुवनंसमेति|	tvastar prepares the bridal of his daughter all the world hears the tidings and assembles.
यमस्य माता पर्युह्यमाना महो जाया विवस्वतोननाश|	but yamas mother spouse of great vivasvān vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.
अपागूहन्नम्र्तां मर्त्येभ्यः कर्त्वी सवर्णामददुर्विवस्वते|	from mortal men they hid the immortal lady made one like her and gave her to vivasvān.
उताश्विनावभरद यत तदसीदजहादु दवामिथुना सरण्यूः|	saranyu brought to him the aśvin brothers and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.
पूषा तवेतश्च्यावयतु पर विद्वाननष्टपशुर्भुवनस्य गोपाः|	guard of the world whose cattle neer are injured may pūṣan bear thee hence for he hath knowledge.
स तवैतेभ्यः परि ददत पित्र्भ्योअग्निर्देवेभ्यः सुविदत्रियेभ्यः|	may he consign thee to these fathers keeping and to the gracious gods let agni give thee.
आयुर्विश्वायुः परि पासति तवा पूषा तवा पातु परपथेपुरस्तात|	may Āyu giver of all life protect thee and bear thee forward on the distant pathway.
यत्रसते सुक्र्तो यत्र ते ययुस्तत्र तवादेवः सविता दधातु|	thither let savitar the god transport thee where dwell the pious who have passedbefore thee.
पूषेमा आशा अनु वेद सर्वाः सो अस्मानभयतमेननेषत|	pūṣan knows all these realms may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger.
सवस्तिदा आघ्र्णिः सर्ववीरोअप्रयुछन पुर एतुप्रजानन|	giver of blessings glowing allheroic may he thewise and watchful go before us.
परपथे पथमजनिष्ट पूषा परपथे दिवः परपथेप्र्थिव्याः|	pūṣan was born to move on distant pathways on the road far from earth and far from heaven.
उभे अभि परियतमे सधस्थे आ च परा चचरति परजानन|	to both most wonted places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.
सरस्वतीं देवयन्तो हवन्ते सरस्वतीमध्वरे तायमाने|	the pious call sarasvatī they worship sarasvatī while sacrifice proceedeth.
सरस्वतीं सुक्र्तो अह्वयन्त सरस्वती दाशुषे वार्यं दात|	the pious called sarasvatī aforetime sarasvatī send bliss to him who giveth.
सरस्वति या सरथं ययथ सवधाभिर्देवि पित्र्भिर्मदन्ती|	sarasvatī who camest with the fathers with them rejoicing thee in our oblations.
आसद्यास्मिन बर्हिषि मादयस्वानमीवा इष आधेह्यस्मे|	seated upon this sacred grass be joyful and give us strengthening food that brings no sickness.
सरस्वतीं यां पितरो हवन्ते दक्षिणा यज्ञमभिनक्षमाणाः|	thou called on as sarasvatī by fathers who come right forward to our solemn service.
सहस्रार्घमिळो अत्र भागं रायस्पोषं यजमानेषु धेहि|	give food and wealth to present sacrificers a portion worth a thousand of refreshment.
अपो अस्मान मातरः शुन्धयन्तु घर्तेन नो घर्तप्वः पुनन्तु|	the mother floods shall make us bright and shining cleansers of holy oil with oil shall cleanse us.
विश्वं हि रिप्रं परवहन्ति देविरुदिदाभ्यः शुचिरापूत एमि|	for goddesses they bear off all defilement i rise up from them purified and brightened.
दरप्सश्चस्कन्द परथमाननु दयूनिमं च योनिमनु यश्च पुर्वः|	through days of earliest date the drop descended on this place and on that which was before it.
समानं योनिमनु संचरन्तं दरप्सं जुहोम्यनु सप्त होत्राः|	i offer up throughout the seven oblations the drop which still to one same place is moving.
यस्ते दरप्स सकन्दति यस्ते अंशुर्बाहुच्युतो धिषणायाुपस्थात|	the drop that falls thy stalk which arms have shaken which from the bosom of the press hath fallen.
अध्वर्योर्वा परि वा यः पवित्रात तं ते जुहोमिमनसा वषट्क्र्तम|	or from the adhvaryus purifying filter i offer thee with heart and cry of vaṣaṭ.
यस्ते दरप्स सकन्नो यस्ते अंशुरवश्च यः परःस्रुचा|	that fallen drop of thine the stalk which from the ladle fell away.
अयं देवो बर्हस्पतिः सं तं सिञ्चतु राधसे|	this present god bṛhaspati shall pour it forth to make us rich.
पयस्वतीरोषधयः पयस्वन मामकं वचः|	the plants of earth are rich in milk and rich in milk is this my speech.
अपाम्पयस्वदित पयस्तेन मा सह शुन्धत|	and rich in milk the essence of the waters make me pure therewith.
यो यज्ञो विश्वतस्तन्तुभिस्तत एकशतं देवकर्मेभिरायतः|	the sacrifice drawn out with threads on every side stretched by a hundred sacred ministers and one.
इमे वयन्ति पितरो य आययुः पर वयाप वयेत्यासते तते|	this do these fathers weave who hitherward are come they sit beside the warp and cry weave forth weave back.
पुमानेनं तनुत उत कर्णत्ति पुमान वि तत्ने अधि नाकेस्मिन|	the man extends it and the man unbinds it even to this vault of heaven hath he outspun it.
इमे मयूखा उप सेदुरू सदः सामानि चक्रुस्तसराण्योतवे|	these pegs are fastened to the seat of worship they made the sāmahymns their weaving shuttles.
कासीत परमा परतिमा किं निदानमाज्यं किमासीत्परिधिः क आसीत|	what were the rule the order and the model what were the wooden fender and the butter.
छन्दः किमासीत परौगं किमुक्थंयद देवा देवमयजन्त विश्वे|	what were the hymn the chant the recitation when to the god all deities paid worship.
अग्नेर्गायत्र्यभवत सयुग्वोष्णिहया सविता सं बभूव|	closely was gāyatrī conjoined with agni and closely savitar combined with usnih.
अनुष्टुभा सोम उक्थैर्महस्वान बर्हस्पतेर्ब्र्हती वाचमावत|	brilliant with ukthas soma joined anustup bṛhaspatis voice by brhati was aided.
विराण मित्रावरुणयोरभिश्रीरिन्द्रस्य तरिष्टुब इहभागो अह्नः|	virāj adhered to varuṇa and mitra here triṣṭup day by day was indras portion.
विश्वान देवाञ जगत्या विवेश तेनचाक्ळिप्र रषयो मनुष्याः|	jagatī entered all the gods together so by this knowledge men were raised to Ṛṣis.
चाक्ळिप्रे तेन रषयो मनुष्या यज्ञे जाते पितरो नःपुराणे|	so by this knowledge men were raised to Ṛṣis when ancient sacrifice sprang up our fathers.
पश्यन मन्ये मनसा चक्षसा तान य इमंयज्ञमयजन्त पूर्वे|	with the minds eye i think that i behold them who first performed this sacrificial worship.
सहस्तोमाः सहछन्दस आव्र्तः सहप्रमा रषयः सप्तदैव्याः|	they who were versed in ritual and metre in hymns and rules were the seven godlike Ṛṣis.
पूर्वेषां पन्थामनुद्र्श्य धीरा अन्वालेभिरेरथ्यो न रश्मीन|	viewing the path of those of old the sages have taken up the reins like chariotdrivers.
समानमु तयं पुरुहूतमुक्थ्यं रथं तरिचक्रं सवनागनिग्मतम|	that general car of yours invoked by many a man that comes to our libations threewheeled meet for lauds.
परिज्मानं विदथ्यं सुव्र्क्तिभिर्वयंव्युष्टा उषसो हवामहे|	that circumambient car worthy of sacrifice we call with our pure hymns at earliest flush of dawn.
परातर्युजं नासत्याधि तिष्ठथः परातर्यावाणम्मधुवाहनं रथम|	ye o nāsatyas mount that earlyharnessed car that travels early laden with its freight of balm.
विशो येन गछथो यज्वरीर्नराकीरेश्चिद यज्ञं होत्र्मन्तमश्विना|	wherewith ye heroes visit clans who sacrifice even the poor mans worship where the priest attends.
अध्वर्युं वा मधुपाणिं सुहस्त्यमग्निधं वाध्र्तदक्षं दमूनसम|	if to the deft adhvaryu with the meath in hand or to the kindler firm in strength the household friend.
विप्रस्य वा यत सवननि गछथोऽत आ यातं मधुपेयमश्विना|	or to the sages poured libations ye approach come thence o aśvins now to drink the offered meath.
उदीरतामवर उत परास उन मध्यमाः पितरःसोम्यासः|	may they ascend the lowest highest midmost the fathers who deserve a share of soma.
असुं य ईयुरव्र्का रतज्ञास्ते नोअवन्तुपितरो हवेषु|	may they who have attained the life of spirits gentle and righteous aid us when we call them.
इदं पित्र्भ्यो नमो अस्त्वद्य ये पूर्वासो य उपरास ईयुः|	now let us pay this homage to the fathers to those who passed of old and those who followed.
ये पार्थिवे रजस्या निषत्ता ये वा नूनं सुव्र्जनासुविक्षु|	those who have rested in the earthly region and those who dwell among the mighty races.
आहं पितॄन सुविदत्रानवित्सि नपातं च विक्रमणं चविष्णोः|	have attained the graciousminded fathers i have gained son and progeny from viṣṇu.
बर्हिषदो ये सवधया सुतस्य भजन्त पित्वस्तैहागमिष्ठाः|	they who enjoy pressed juices with oblation seated on sacred grass come oftenest hither.
बर्हिषदः पितर ऊत्यर्वागिमा वो हव्या चक्र्मा जुषध्वम|	fathers who sit on sacred grass come help us these offerings have we made for you accept them.
त आ गतावसा शन्तमेनाथा नः शं योररपोदधात|	so come to us with most auspicious favour and give us health and strength without a trouble.
उपहूताः पितरः सोम्यासो बर्हिष्येषु निधिषु परियेषु|	may they the fathers worthy of the soma invited to their favourite oblations.
त आ गमन्तु त इह शरुवन्त्वधि बरुवन्तु तेअवन्त्वस्मान|	laid on the sacred grass come nigh and listen may they be gracious unto us and bless us.
आच्या जानु दक्षिणतो निषद्येमं यज्ञमभि गर्णीतविश्वे|	bowing your bended knees and seated southward accept this sacrifice of ours with favour.
मा हिंसिष्ट पितरः केन चिन नो यद व आगःपुरुषता कराम|	punish us not for any sin o fathers which we through human frailty have committed.
आसीनासो अरुणीनामुपस्थे रयिं धत्त दाशुषे मर्त्याय|	lapped in the bosom of the purple mornings give riches to the man who brings oblations.
पुत्रेभ्यः पितरस्तस्य वस्वः पर यछत त इहोर्जन्दधात|	grant to your sons a portion of that treasure and present give them energy ye fathers.
ये नः पूर्वे पितरः सोम्यासोअनूहिरे सोमपीथंवसिष्ठाः|	our ancient fathers who deserve the soma who came most noble to our soma banquet.
तेभिर्यमः संरराणो हवींष्युशन्नुशद्भिः परतिकाममत्तु|	with these let yama yearning with the yearning rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure.
ये तात्र्षुर्देवत्रा जेहमाना होत्राविद सतोमतष्टासोर्कैः|	come to us agni with the gracioug fathers who dwell in glowing light the very kavyas.
आग्ने याहि सुविदत्रेभिरर्वां सत्यैः कव्यैःपित्र्भिर्घर्मसद्भिः|	who thirsted mid the gods who hasten hither oblation winners theme of singers praises.
ये सत्यासो हविरदो हविष्पा इद्रेण देवैः सरथन्दधानाः|	come agni come with countless ancient fathers dwellers in light primeval godadorers.
आग्ने याहि सहस्रं देववन्दैः परैःपूर्वैः पित्र्भिर्घर्मसद्भिः|	eaters and drinkers of oblations truthful who travel with the deities and indra.
अग्निष्वात्ताः पितर एह गछत सदःसदः सदतसुप्रणीतयः|	fathers whom agnis flames have tasted come ye nigh ye kindly leaders take ye each your proper place.
अत्ता हवींषि परयतानि बर्हिष्यथारयिं सर्ववीरं दधातन|	eat sacrificial food presented on the grass grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.
तवमग्न ईळितो जातवेदोअवाड ढव्यानि सुरभीणिक्र्त्वी|	thou agni jātavedas when entreated didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant.
परादाः पित्र्भ्यः सवधया ते अक्षन्नद्धि तवन्देव परयता हवींषि|	and give them to the fathers who did cat them with svadha eat thou god the gifts we bring thee.
ये चेह पितरो ये च नेह यांश्च विद्म यानु च नप्रविद्म|	thou jātavedas knowest well the number of fathers who are here and who are absent.
तवं वेत्थ यति ते जातवेदः सवधाभिर्यज्ञं सुक्र्तं जुषस्व|	of fathers whom we know and whom we know not accept the sacrifice wellprepared with portions.
ये अग्निदग्धा ये अनग्निदग्धा मध्ये दिवः सवधयामादयन्ते|	they who consumed by fire or not cremated joy in their offering in the midst of heaven.
तेभिः सवराळ असुनीतिमेतां यथावशन्तन्वं कल्पयस्व|	grant them o sovran lord the world of spirits and their own body as thy pleasure wills it.
परथश्च यस्य सप्रथश्च नमानुष्टुभस्य हविषोहविर्यत|	vasiṢṬha mastered the rathantara took it from radiant dhātar savitar and viṣṇu.
धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णो रथन्तरमा जभारा वसिष्ठः|	oblation portion of fourfold oblation known by the names of saprathas and prathas.
अविन्दन ते अतिहितं यदासीद यज्ञस्य धाम परमंगुहा यत|	these sages found what lay remote and hidden the sacrifices loftiest secret essence.
धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोर्भरद्वाजो बर्हदा चक्रे अग्नेः|	from radiant dhātar savitar and viṣṇu from agni bharadvāja brought the brhat.
तेअविन्दन मनसा दीध्याना यजु षकन्नं परथमन्देवयानम|	they found with mental eyes the earliest yajus a pathway to the gods that had descended.
धातुर्द्युतानात सवितुश्च विष्णोरासूर्यादभरन घर्ममेते|	from radiant dhātar savitar and viṣṇu from sūrya did these sages bring the gharma.
न वा उ देवाः कषुधमिद वधं ददुरुताशितमुपगछन्ति मर्त्यवः|	the gods have not ordained hunger to be our death even to the wellfed man comes death in varied shape.
उतो रयिः पर्णतो नोप दस्यत्युताप्र्णन्मर्डितारं न विन्दते|	the riches of the liberal never waste away while he who will not give finds none to comfort him.
य आध्राय चकमानाय पित्वोअन्नवान सन्रफितायोपजग्मुषे|	the man with food in store who when the needy comes in miserable case begging for bread to eat.
सथिरं मनः कर्णुते सेवते पुरोतोचित स मर्डितारं न विन्दते|	hardens his heart against himeven when of old he did him servicefinds not one to comfort him.
स इद भोजो यो गर्हवे ददात्यन्नकामाय चरते कर्शाय|	bounteous is he who gives unto the beggar who comes to him in want of food and feeble.
अरमस्मै भवति यामहूता उतापरीषु कर्णुते सखायम|	success attends him in the shout of battle he makes a friend of him in future troubles.
न स सखा यो न ददाति सख्ये सचाभुवे सचमानायपित्वः|	no friend is he who to his friend and comrade who comes imploring food will offer nothing.
अपास्मात परेयान न तदोको अस्ति पर्णन्तमन्यमरणं चिदिचःेत|	let him departno home is that to rest in and rather seek a stranger to support him.
पर्णीयादिन नाधमानाय तव्यान दराघीयांसमनुपश्येत पन्थाम|	let the rich satisfy the poor implorer and bend his eye upon a longer pathway.
ओ हि वर्तन्ते रथ्येव चक्रान्यमअन्यमुप तिष्ठन्त रायः|	riches come now to one now to another and like the wheels of cars are ever rolling.
मोघमन्नं विन्दते अप्रचेताः सत्यं बरवीमि वध इत सतस्य|	the foolish man wins food with fruitless labour that food i speak the truth shall be his ruin.
नार्यमणं पुष्यति नो सखायं केवलाघो भवतिकेवलादी|	he feeds no trusty friend no man to love him all guilt is he who eats with no partaker.
कर्षन्नित फाल आशितं कर्णोति यन्नध्वानमप वर्ङकतेचरित्रैः|	the ploughshare ploughing makes the food that feeds us and with its feet cuts through the path it follows.
वदन बरह्मावदतो वनीयान पर्णन्नापिरप्र्णन्तमभि षयात|	better the speaking than the silent brahman the liberal friend outyalues him who gives not.
एकपाद भूयो दविपदो वि चक्रमे दविपात तरिपादमभ्येतिपश्चात|	he with one foot hath far outrun the biped and the twofooted catches the threefooted.
चतुष्पादेति दविपदामभिस्वरे सम्पश्यन्पङकतीरुपतिष्ठमानः|	fourfooted creatures come when bipeds call them and stand and look where five are met together.
समौ चिद धस्तौ न समं विविष्टः सम्मातरा चिन नसमं दुहाते|	the hands are both alike their labour differs the yield of sister milchkine is unequal.
यमयोश्चिन न समा वीर्याणि जञाती चित्सन्तौ न समं पर्णीतः|	twins even diffier in their strength and vigour two even kinsmen differ in their bounty.
पर नूनं जातवेदसमश्वं हिनोत वाजिनम|	now send ye jātavedas forth send hitherward the vigorous steed.
इदं नोबर्हिरासदे|	to seat him on our sacred grass.
अस्य पर जातवेदसो विप्रवीरस्य मीळुषः|	i raise the lofty eulogy of jātavedas raining boons.
महीमियर्मिसुष्टुतिम|	with sages for his hero band.
या रुचो जातवेदसो देवत्रा हव्यवाहनीः|	with flames of jātavedas which carry oblation to the gods.
ताभिर्नोयज्ञमिन्वतु|	may he promote our sacrifice.
उदसौ सूर्यो अगादुदयं मामको भगः|	yon sun hath mounted up and this my happy fate hate mounted high.
अहं तद्विद्वला पतिमभ्यसाक्षि विषासहिः|	i knowing this as conqueror have won my husband for mine own.
अहं केतुरहं मूर्धाहमुग्रा विवाचनी|	i am the banner and the head a mighty arbitress am i.
ममेदनुक्रतुं पतिः सेहानाया उपाचरेत|	i am victorious and my lord shall be submissive to my will.
मम पुत्राः शत्रुहणोअथो मे दुहिता विराट|	my sons are slayers of the foe my daughter is a ruling queen.
उताहमस्मि संजया पत्यौ मे शलोक उत्तमः|	i am victorious oer my lord my song of triumph is supreme.
येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः|	oblation that which indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high.
इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्ना किलाभुवम|	this have i offered o ye gods and rid me of each rival wife.
असपत्ना सपत्नघ्नी जयन्त्यभिभूवरी|	destroyer of the rival wife sole spouse victorious conqueror.
आव्र्क्षमन्यासां वर्चो राधो अस्थेयसामिव|	the others glory have i seized as twere the wealth of weaker dames.
समजैषमिमा अहं सपत्नीरभिभूवरी|	i have subdued as conqueror these rivals these my fellowwives.
यथाहमस्य वीरस्य विराजानि जनस्य च|	that i may hold imperial sway over this hero and the folk.
भद्रं नो अपि वातय मनः|	send unto us a good and happy mind.
अग्निमीळे भुजां यविष्ठं शासा मित्रं दुर्धरीतुम|	worship agni youthfullest of gods resistless friend of laws.
यस्य धर्मन सवरेनीः सपर्यन्ति मातुरूधः|	under whose guard and heavenly light the spotted seek the mothers breast.
यमासा कर्पनीळं भासाकेतुं वर्धयन्ति|	whom with their mouth they magnify bannered with flame and homed in light.
भराजतेश्रेणिदन|	he glitters with his row of teeth.
अर्यो विशां गातुरेति पर यदानड दिवो अन्तान|	kind furtherer of men he comes when he hath reached the ends of heaven.
कविरभ्रं दिद्यानः|	sage giving splendour to the clouds.
जुषद धव्या मानुषस्योर्ध्वस्तस्थाव रभ्वा यज्ञे|	to taste mans offerings he the strong hath risen erect at sacrifice.
मिन्वन सद्म पुर एति|	fixing his dwelling he proceeds.
स हि कषेमो हविर्यज्ञः शरुष्टीदस्य गातुरेति|	here are oblation worship rest rapidly comes his furtherance.
अग्निं देवा वाशीमन्तम|	to swordarmed agni come the gods.
यज्ञासाहं दुव इषेअग्निं पूर्वस्य शेवस्य|	with service for chief bliss i seek the lord of sacrifice agni whom.
अद्रेःसूनुमायुमाहुः|	they call the living son of cloud.
नरो ये के चास्मदा विश्वेत ते वाम आ सयुः|	blest evermore be all the men who come from us who magnify.
अग्निंहविषा वर्धन्तः|	agni with sacrificial gifts.
कर्ष्णः शवेतोअरुषो यामो अस्य बरध्न रज्र उत शोणोयशस्वान|	the path he treads is black and white and red and striped and brown crimson and glorious.
हिरण्यरूपं जनिता जजान|	his sire begat him bright with hues of gold.
एवा ते अग्ने विमदो मनीषामूर्जो नपादम्र्तेभिःसजोषाः|	thus with his thoughts o son of strength o agni hath vimada accordant with the immortals.
गिर आ वक्षत सुमतीरियान इषमूर्जंसुक्षितिं विश्वमाभाः|	offered thee hymns soliciting thy favour thou hast brought all food strength a prosperous dwelling.
नासदासीन नो सदासीत तदानीं नासीद रजो नो वयोमापरो यत|	then was not nonexistent nor existent there was no realm of air no sky beyond it.
किमावरीवः कुह कस्य शर्मन्नम्भः किमासीद गहनं गभीरम|	what covered in and where and what gave shelter was water there unfathomed depth of water.
न मर्त्युरासीदम्र्तं न तर्हि न रात्र्या अह्न आसीत्प्रकेतः|	death was not then nor was there aught immortal no sign was there the days and nights divider.
आनीदवातं सवधया तदेकं तस्माद्धान्यन न परः किं चनास|	that one thing breathless breathed by its own nature apart from it was nothing whatsoever.
तम आसीत तमसा गूळमग्रेअप्रकेतं सलिलं सर्वमािदम|	darkness there was at first concealed in darkness this all was indiscriminated chaos.
तुछ्येनाभ्वपिहितं यदासीत तपसस्तन्महिनाजायतैकम|	all that existed then was void and form less by the great power of warmth was born that unit.
कामस्तदग्रे समवर्तताधि मनसो रेतः परथमं यदासीत|	thereafter rose desire in the beginning desire the primal seed and germ of spirit.
सतो बन्धुमसति निरविन्दन हर्दि परतीष्याकवयो मनीषा|	sages who searched with their hearts thought discovered the existents kinship in the nonexistent.
तिरश्चीनो विततो रश्मिरेषामधः सविदासीअअअत|	transversely was their severing line extended what was above it then and what below it.
रेतोधाासन महिमान आसन सवधा अवस्तात परयतिः परस्तात|	there were begetters there were mighty forces free action here and energy up yonder.
को अद्धा वेद क इह पर वोचत कुत आजाता कुत इयंविस्र्ष्टिः|	who verily knows and who can here declare it whence it was born and whence comes this creation.
अर्वाग देवा अस्य विसर्जनेनाथा को वेद यताबभूव|	the gods are later than this worlds production who knows then whence it first came into being.
इयं विस्र्ष्टिर्यत आबभूव यदि वा दधे यदि वा न|	he the first origin of this creation whether he formed it all or did not form it.
यो अस्याध्यक्षः परमे वयोमन सो अङग वेद यदि वा नवेद|	whose eye controls this world in highest heaven he verily knows it or perhaps he knows not.
सोम एकेभ्यः पवते घर्तमेक उपासते|	for some is soma purified some sit by sacrificial oil.
येभ्यो मधुप्रधावति तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात|	to those for whom the meath flows forth even to those let him depart.
तपसा ये अनाध्र्ष्यास्तपसा ये सवर्ययुः|	invincible through fervour those whom fervour hath advanced to heaven.
तपो येचक्रिरे महस्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात|	who showed great fervour in their lives even to those let him depart.
ये युध्यन्ते परधनेषु शूरासो ये तनूत्यजः|	the heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away.
ये वासहस्रदक्षिणास्तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात|	or who give guerdon thousandfold even to those let him depart.
ये चित पूर्व रतसाप रतावान रताव्र्धः|	yea the first followers of law laws pure and holy strengtheners.
पितॄन तपस्वतोयम तांश्चिदेवापि गछतात|	the fathers yama fervourmovedeven to those let him depart.
सहस्रणीथाः कवयो ये गोपायन्ति सूर्यम|	skilled in a thousand ways and means the sages who protect the sun.
रषीन्तपस्वतो यम तपोजानपि गछतात|	the Ṛṣis yama fervourmovedeven to those let him depart.
महि दयावाप्र्थिवी भूतमुर्वी नारी यह्वी न रोदसीसदं नः|	mighty are ye and farextended heaven and earth both worlds are evermore to us like two young dames.
तेभिर्नः पातं सह्यस एभिर्नः पातंशूषणि|	guard us thereby from stronger foe guard us hereby to give us strength.
यज्ञेयज्ञे स मर्त्यो देवान सपर्यति|	in each succeeding sacrifice that mortal honoureth the gods.
यः सुम्नैर्दीर्घश्रुत्तम आविवासत्येनान|	he who most widely known and famed for happiness inviteth them.
विश्वेषामिरज्यवो देवानां वार्महः|	ye who are rulers over all great is your sovran power as gods.
विश्वे हिविश्वमहसो विश्वे यज्ञेषु यज्ञियाः|	ye all possess all majesty all must be served in sacrifice.
ते घा राजानो अम्र्तस्य मन्द्रा अर्यमा मित्रो वरुणःपरिज्मा|	these are the joyous kings of immortality parijman mitra aryaman and varuṇa.
कद रुद्रो नर्णां सतुतो मरुतः पूषणो भगः|	what else is rudra praised of men the maruts bhaga pūṣaṇa.
उत नो नक्तमपां वर्षण्वसू सूर्यामासा सदनायसधन्या|	come also to our dwelling lords of ample wealth common partakers of our waters sun and moon.
सचा यत साद्येषामहिर्बुध्नेषु बुध्न्यः|	when the great dragon of the deep hath settled down upon their floors.
उत नो देवावश्विना शुभस पती धामभिर्मित्रावरुणाुरुष्यताम|	and let the aśvins lords of splendour set us freeboth gods and with their laws mitra and varuṇa.
महः स राय एषतेअति धन्वेव दुरिता|	through woes as over desert lands he speeds to ample opulence.
उत नो रुद्रा चिन मर्ळतामश्विना विश्वे देवासो रथस्पतिर्भगः|	yea let the aśvins twain he gracious unto us even rudras and all gods bhaga rathaspati.
रभुर्वाज रभुक्षणः परिज्मा विश्ववेदसः|	parijman Ṛbhu vāja o lords of all wealth Ṛbhukṣaṇas.
रभुरभुक्षा रभुर्विधतो मद आ ते हरी जूजुवानस्यवाजिना|	prompt is Ṛbhukṣan prompt the worshippers strong drink may thy fleet bay steeds thine who speedest on approach.
दुष्टरं यस्य साम चिद रधग यज्ञो नमानुषः|	not mans but gods is sacrifice whose psalm is unassailable.
कर्धी नो अह्रयो देव सवितः स च सतुषे मघोनाम|	o god savitar harmed by none lauded give us a place among wealthy princes.
सहो नैन्द्रो वह्निभिर्न्येषां चर्षणीनां चक्रं रश्मिं नयोयुवे|	with his carsteeds at once hath our indra guided the reins and the car of these men.
ऐषु दयावाप्र्थिवी धातं महदस्मे वीरेषु विश्वचर्षणिश्रवः|	to these men present here o heaven and earth to us grant lofty fame extending over all mankind.
पर्क्षं वाजस्य सातये पर्क्षं रायोततुर्वणे|	give us a steed to win us strength a steed with wealth for victory.
एतं शंसमिन्द्रास्मयुष टवं कूचित सन्तं सहसावन्नभिष्टये सदा पाह्यभिष्टये|	this speaker indrafor thou art our friendwherever he may be guard thou victor for help ever for help.
मेदतां वेदता वसो|	thy wisdom vasu prosper him.
एतं मे सतोमं तना न सूर्ये दयुतद्यामानं वाव्र्धन्तन्र्णाम|	so have they strengthened this mine hymn which seems to take its bright path to the sun and reconciles the men.
संवननं नाश्व्यं तष्टेवानपच्युतम|	thus forms a carpenter the yoke of horses not to be displaced.
वावर्त येषां राया युक्तैषां हिरण्ययी|	whose chariotseat hath come again laden with wealth and bright with gold.
नेमधितान पौंस्या वर्थेव विष्टान्ता|	lightly with piercing ends as twere two ranks of heroes ranged for fight.
पर तद दुःशीमे पर्थवाने वेने पर रामे वोचमसुरेमघवत्सु|	this to duḥśīma pṛthavāna have i sung to vena rama to the nobles and the king.
ये युक्त्वाय पञ्च शतास्मयु पथा विश्राव्येषाम|	they yoked five hundred and their love of us was famed upon their way.
अधीन नवत्र सप्ततिं च सप्त च|	besides they showed us sevenandseventy horses here.
सद्यो दिदिष्ट तान्वःसद्यो दिदिष्ट पार्थ्यः सद्यो दिदिष्ट मायवः|	tānva at once displayed his gift pārthya at once displayed his gift and straightway māyava showed his.
पर वो महे मन्दमानायान्धसोअर्चा विश्वानरायविश्वाभुवे|	i laud your mighty one who joyeth in the juice him who is shared by all men who created all.
इन्द्रस्य यस्य सुमखं सहो महि शरवोन्र्म्णं च रोदसी सपर्यतः|	indra whose conquering strength is powerful in war whose fame and manly vigour heaven and earth revere.
सो चिन नु सख्या नर्य इन सतुतश्चर्क्र्त्य इन्द्रो मावतेनरे|	he with his friend is active lauded good to man indra who must be glorified by one like me.
विश्वासु धूर्षु वाजक्र्त्येषु सत्पते वर्त्रे वाप्स्वभि शूर मन्दसे|	hero lord of the brave all cars are thy delight warring with vṛtra or for waters or for spoil.
के ते नर इन्द्र ये त इषे ये ते सुम्नं सधन्यमियक्षान|	who are the men whom thou wilt further indra who strive to win thy bliss allied with riches.
के ते वाजायासुर्याय हिन्विरे के अप्सु सवासूर्वरासुपौंस्ये|	who urged thee forward to exert thy power divine to valour in the war for waters on their fields.
भुवस्त्वमिन्द्र बरह्मणा महान भुवो विश्वेषु सवनेषुयज्ञियः|	thou indra through the holy prayer art mighty worthy of sacrifice at all libations.
भुवो नॄंश्च्यौत्नो विश्वस्मिन भरेज्येष्ठश्च मन्त्रो विश्वचर्षणे|	in every fight thou castest heroes on the ground thou art the noblest song o lord of all the folk.
अवा नु कं जयायान यज्ञवनसो महीं त ओमात्रांक्र्ष्टयो विदुः|	help now as highest those who toil at sacrifice well do the people know thy great protecting might.
असो नु कमजरो वर्धाश्च विश्वेदेतासवना तूतुमा कर्षे|	thou shalt be everlasing giver of success yea on all these libations thou bestowest strength.
एता विश्वा सवना तूतुमाक्र्षे सवयं सूनो सहसो यानिदधिषे|	all these libations thou makest effectual of which thou art thyself supporter son of power.
वराय ते पात्रं धर्मणे तना यज्ञो मन्त्रोब्रह्मोद्यतं वचः|	therefore thy vessel is to be esteemed the best sacrifice holy text prayer and exalted speech.
ये ते विप्र बरह्मक्र्तः सुते सचा वसूनां च वसुनश्चदावने|	they who with flowing soma pray to thee o sage to pour on them thy gifts of opulence and wealth.
पर ते सुम्नस्य मनसा पथा भुवन मदे सुतस्यसोम्यस्यान्धसः|	may they come forward through their spirit on the path of bliss in the wild joy of soma juice effused.
यो वां परिज्मा सुव्र्दश्विना रथो दोषामुषासो हव्योहविष्मता|	as twere the name of father easy to invoke we all assembled here invoke this car of yours.
शश्वत्तमासस्तमु वामिदं वयं पितुर्ननाम सुहवं हवामहे|	aśvins your swiftlyrolling circumambient car which he who worships must invoke at eve and dawn.
चोदयतं सून्र्ताः पिन्वतं धिय उत पुरन्धीरीरयतन्तदुश्मसि|	awake all pleasant strains and let the hymns flow forth raise up abundant fulness this is our desire.
यशसं भागं कर्णुतं नो अश्विना सोमं नचारुं मघवत्सु नस कर्तम|	aśvins bestow on us a glorious heritage and give our princes treasure fair as soma is.
अमाजुरश्चिद भवथो युवं भगोअनाशोश्चिदवितारापमस्य चित|	ye are the bliss of her who groweth old at home and helpers of the slow although he linger last.
अन्धस्य चिन नासत्या कर्शस्य चिद युवामिदाहुर्भिषजा रुतस्य चित|	men call you too nāsatyas healers of the blind the thin and feeble and the man with broken bones.
युवं चयवानं सनयं यथा रथं पुनर्युवानंचरथाय तक्षथुः|	ye made cyavāna weak and worn with length of days young again like a car that he had power to move.
निष टौग्र्यमूहथुरद्भ्यस परिविश्वेत ता वां सवनेषु परवाच्या|	ye lifted up the son of tugra from the floods at our libations must all these your acts be praised.
पुराणा वां वीर्या पर बरवा जनेअथो हासथुर्भिषजामयोभुवा|	we will declare among the folk your ancient deeds heroic yea ye were physicians bringing health.
ता वां नु नव्याववसे करामहेअयंनासत्या शरदरिर्यथा दधत|	you you who must be lauded will we bring for aid so that this foe of ours o aśvins may believe.
इयं वामह्वे शर्णुतं मे अश्विना पुत्रायेव पितरा मह्यंशिक्षतम|	listen to me o aśvins i have cried to you give meyour aid as sire and mother aid their son.
