अनापिरज्ञा असजात्यामतिः पुरा तस्याभिशस्तेरव सप्र्तम|	poor without kin or friend or ties of blood am i save me before it be too late from this my curse.
युवं रथेन विमदाय शुन्ध्युवं नयूहथुः पुरुमित्रस्ययोषणाम|	ye mounted on your chariot brought to vimada the comely maid of purumitra as a bride.
युवं हवं वध्रिमत्या अगछतं युवंसुषुतिं चक्रथुः पुरन्धये|	ye came unto the calling of the weaklings dame and granted noble offspring to the happy wife.
युवं विप्रस्य जरणामुपेयुषः पुनः कलेरक्र्णुतंयुवद वयः|	ye gave a ain the vigour of his youthful life to tge sage kali when old age was coming nigh.
युवं वन्दनं रश्यदादुदूपथुर्युवंसद्यो विश्पलामेतवे कर्थः|	ye rescued vandana and raised him from the pit and in a moment gave viśpalā power to move.
युवं ह रेभं वर्षणा गुहा हितमुदैरयतम्मम्र्वांसमश्विना|	ye aśvins twain endowed with manly strength brought forth reblia when hidden in the cave and wellnigh dead.
युवं रबीसमुत तप्तमत्रयोमन्वन्तं चक्रथुः सप्तवध्रये|	freed saptavadliri and for atri caused the pit heated with fire to be a pleasant restingplace.
युवं शवेतं पेदवेअश्विनाश्वं नवभिर्वाजैर्नवतीच वाजिनम|	on pedu ye bestowed aśvins a courser white mighty with nineandninety varied gifts of strength.
चर्क्र्त्यं ददथुर्द्रावयत्सखं भगं नन्र्भ्यो हव्यं मयोभुबम|	a horse to be renowned who bore his friend at speed joygiving bhagalike to be invoked of men.
न तं राजानावदिते कुतश्चन नांहो अश्नोति दुरितंनकिर्भयम|	from no side ye two kings whom none may check or stay doth grief distress or danger come u on the man.
यमश्विना सुहवा रुद्रवर्तनी पुरोरथंक्र्णुथः पत्न्या सह|	whom aśvins swift to hear borne on your glowing path ye with your consort make the foremost in the race.
आ तेन यातं मनसो जवीयसा रथं यं वां रभवश्चक्रुरश्विना|	come on that chariot which the Ṛbhus wrought for you the chariot aśvins that is speedier than thought.
यस्य योगे दुहिता जायते दिव उभे अहनीसुदिने विवस्वतः|	at harnessing whereof heavens daughter springs to birth and from vivasvān come auspicious night and day.
ता वर्तिर्यातं जयुषा वि पर्वतमपिन्वतं शयवेधेनुमश्विना|	come conquerors of the sundered mountain to our home aśvins who made the cow stream milk for Śayus sake.
वर्कस्य चिद वर्तिकामन्तरास्याद युवंशचीभिर्ग्रसिताममुञ्चतम|	ye who delivered even from the wolfs deep throat and set again at liberty the swallowed quail.
एतं वां सतोममश्विनावकर्मातक्षाम भर्गवो न रथम|	we have prepared this laud for you o aśvins and like the bhṛgus as a car have framed it.
नयम्र्क्षाम योषणां न मर्ये नित्यं न सूनुन्तनयं दधानाः|	have decked it as a maid to meet the bridegroom and brought it as a son our stay for ever.
अभीवर्तेन हविषा येनेन्द्रो अभिवाव्र्ते|	with offering for success in fight whence indra was victorious.
तेनास्मान्ब्रह्मणस पतेअभि राष्ट्राय वर्तय|	with this o brahmaṇaspati let us attain to royal sway.
अभिव्र्त्य सपत्नानभि या नो अरातयः|	subduing those who rival us subduing all malignities.
अभि पर्तन्यन्तन्तिष्ठाभि यो न इरस्यति|	withstand the man who menaces withstand the man who angers us.
अभि तवा देवः सविताभि सोमो अवीव्र्तत|	soma and savitar the god have made thee a victorious king.
अभि तवा विश्वाभूतान्यभीवर्तो यथाससि|	all elements have aided thee to make thee general conqueror.
येनेन्द्रो हविषा कर्त्व्यभवद दयुम्न्युत्तमः|	oblation that which indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high.
इदं तदक्रि देवा असपत्नः किलाभुवम|	this have i offered gods and hence now verily am rivalless.
असपत्नः सपत्नहाभिराष्ट्रो विषासहिः|	slayer of rivals rivalless victorious with royal sway.
यथाहमेषां भूतानां विराजानि जनस्य च|	over these beings may i rule may i be sovran of the folk.
मैनमग्ने वि दहो माभि शोचो मास्य तवचं चिक्षिपो माशरीरम|	burn him not up nor quite consume him agni let not his body or his skin be scattered.
यदा शर्तं कर्णवो जातवेदोअथेमेनं परहिणुतात पित्र्भ्यः|	o jātavedas when thou hast matured him then send him on his way unto the fathers.
शर्तं यदा करसि जातवेदोअथेमेनं परि दत्तात्पित्र्भ्यः|	when thou hast made him ready jātavedas then do thou give him over to the fathers.
यदा गछात्यसुनीतिमेतामथा देवानांवशनीर्भवाति|	when he attains unto the life that waits him he shall become the deities controller.
सूर्यं चक्षुर्गछतु वातमात्मा दयां च गछप्र्थिवीं च धर्मणा|	the sun receive thine eye tne wind thy spirit go as thy merit is to earth or heaven.
अपो वा गछ यदि तत्र ते हितमोषधीषु परति तिष्ठा शरीरैः|	go if it be thy lot unto the waters go make thine home in plants with all thy members.
अजो भागस्तपसा तं तपस्व तं ते शोचिस्तपतु तं तेर्चिः|	thy portion is the goat with heat consume him let thy fierce flame thy glowing splendour burn him.
यास्ते शिवास्तन्वो जातवेदस्ताभिर्वहैनंसुक्र्तामु लोकम|	with thine auspicious forms o jātavedas bear this man to the region of the pious.
अव सर्ज पुनरग्ने पित्र्भ्यो यस्त आहुतश्चरतिस्वधाभिः|	again o agni to the fathers send him who offered in thee goes with our oblations.
अयुर्वसान उप वेतु शेषः सं गछतान्तन्वा जातवेदः|	wearing new life let him increase his offspring let him rejoin a body jātavedas.
यत ते कर्ष्णः शकुन आतुतोद पिपीलः सर्प उत वाश्वापदः|	what wound soeer the dark bird hath inflicted the emmet or the serpent or the jackal.
अग्निष टद विश्वादगदं कर्णोतु सोमश्च योब्राह्मणानाविवेश|	may agni who devoureth all things heal it and soma who hath passed into the brahmans.
अग्नेर्वर्म परि गोभिर्व्ययस्व सं परोर्णुष्व पीवसामेदसा च|	shield thee with flesh against the flames of agni encompass thee about with fat and marrow.
नेत तवा धर्ष्णुर्हरसा जर्ह्र्षाणो दध्र्ग्विधक्ष्यन पर्यङखयाते|	so will the bold one eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.
इममग्ने चमसं मा वि जिह्वरः परियो देवानामुतसोम्यानाम|	forbear o agni to upset this ladle the gods and they who merit soma love it.
एष यश्चमसो देवपानस्तस्मिन देवा अम्र्तामादयन्ते|	this ladle this which serves the gods to drink from in this the immortal deities rejoice them.
करव्यादमग्निं पर हिणोमि दूरं यमराज्ञो गछतुरिप्रवाहः|	send afar flesh eating agni bearing off stains may he depart to yamas subjects.
इहैवायमितरो जातवेदा देवेभ्यो हव्यंवहतु परजानन|	but let this other jātavedas carry oblation to the gods for he is skilful.
यो अग्निः करव्यात परविवेश वो गर्हमिमं पश्यन्नितरंजातवेदसम|	i choose as god for fatherworship agni flesheater who hath past within your dwelling.
तं हरामि पित्र्यज्ञाय देवं स घर्ममिन्वात परमे सधस्थे|	while looking on this other jātavedas let him light flames in the supreme assembly.
यो अग्निः करव्यवाहनः पितॄन यक्षद रताव्र्धः|	with offerings meet let agni bring the fathers who support the law.
परेदुहव्यानि वोचति देवेभ्यश्च पित्र्भ्य आ|	let him announce oblations paid to fathers and to deities.
उशन्तस्त्वा नि धीमह्युशन्तः समिधीमहि|	right gladly would we set thee down right gladly make thee burn and glow.
उशन्नुशत आ वह पितॄन हविषे अत्तवे|	gladly bring yearning fathers nigh to cat the food of sacrifice.
यं तवमग्ने समदहस्तमु निर्वापया पुनः|	cool agni and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt.
कियाम्ब्वत्र रोहतु पाकदूर्वा वयल्कशा|	here let the waterlily grow and tender grass and leafy herb.
शीतिके शीतिकावति हलादिके हलादिकावति|	o full of coolness thou cool plant full of fresh moisture freshening herb.
मण्डूक्या सुसं गम इमं सवग्निं हर्षय|	come hither with the female frog fill with delight this agni here.
आपो हि षठा मयोभुवस्ता न ऊर्जे दधातन|	ye waters are beneficent so help ye us to energy.
महेरणाय चक्षसे|	that we may look on great delight.
यो वः शिवतमो रसस्तस्य भजयतेह नः|	give us a portion of the sap the most auspicious that ye have.
उशतीरिवमातरः|	like mothers in their longing love.
तस्मा अरं गमाम वो यस्य कषयाय जिन्वथ|	to you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on.
आपोजनयथा च नः|	and waters give us procreant strength.
शं नो देवीरभिष्टय आपो भवन्तु पीतये|	the waters be to us for drink goddesses for our aid and bliss.
शं योरभि सरवन्तु नः|	let them stream to us health and strength.
ईशाना वार्याणां कषयन्तीश्चर्षणीनाम|	beg the floods to give us balm these queens who rule oer precious things.
अपोयाचामि भेषजम|	and have supreme control of men.
अप्सु मे सोमो अब्रवीदन्तर्विश्वानि भेषजा|	within the waterssoma thus hath told medwell all balms that heal.
अग्निं चविश्वशम्भुवम|	and agni he who blesseth all.
आपः पर्णीत भेषजां वरूथं तन्वे मम|	o waters teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm.
जयोक चसूर्यं दर्शे|	so that i long may see the sun.
इदमापः पर वहत यत किं च दुरितं मयि|	whatever sin is found in me whatever evil i have wrought.
यद वाहमभिदुद्रोह यद व शेप उतान्र्तम|	if i have lied or falsely sworn waters remove it far from me.
आपो अद्यान्वचारिषं रसेन समगस्महि|	the waters i this day have sought and to their moisture have we come.
पयस्वानग्ना गहि तं मा सं सर्ज वर्चसा|	o agni rich in milk come thou and with thy splendour cover me.
अयं स यस्य शर्मन्नवोभिरग्नेरेधते जरिताभिष्टौ|	this is that agni he by whose protection favour and help the singer is successful.
जयेष्ठेभिर्यो भानुभिरषूणां पर्येति परिवीतोविभावा|	who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with farspreading lustre.
यो भनुभिर्विभावा विभात्यग्निर्देवेभिरतावाजस्रः|	agni the holy one the everlasting who shines far beaming with celestial splendours.
आ यो विवाय सख्या सखिभ्योअपरिह्व्र्तो अत्यो न सप्तिः|	he who hath come unto his friends with friendship like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles.
ईशे यो विश्वस्या देववीतेरीशे विश्वायुरुषसोव्युष्टौ|	he who is lord of all divine oblation shared by all living men at break of morning.
आ यस्मिन मना हवींष्यग्नावरिष्टरथस्कभ्नाति शूषैः|	agni to whom our offerings are devoted in whom rests he whose car through might is scatheless.
शूषेभिर्व्र्धो जुषाणो अर्कैर्देवानछा रघुपत्वाजिगाति|	increasing by his strength while lauds content him with easy flight unto the gods he travels.
मन्द्रो होता स जुह्वा यजिष्ठः सम्मिश्लो अग्निरा जिघर्ति देवान|	agni the cheerful priest best sacrificer balms with his tongue the gods with whom he mingles.
तमुस्रामिन्द्रं न रेजमानमग्निं गीर्भिर्नमोभिराक्र्णुध्वम|	with songs and adorations bring ye hither agni who stirs himself at dawn like indra.
आ यं विप्रासो मतिभिर्ग्र्णन्ति जातवेदसंजुह्वं सहानाम|	whom sages laud with hymns as jātavedas of those who wield the sacrificial ladle.
सं यस्मिन विश्वा वसूनि जग्मुर्वाजे नाश्वाःसप्तीवन्त एवैः|	in whom all goodly treasures meet together even as steeds and riders for the booty.
अस्मे ऊतीरिन्द्रवाततमा अर्वाचीनाग्न आ कर्णुष्व|	inclining hither bring us help o agni even assistance most desired by indra.
अधा हयग्ने मह्ना निषद्या सद्यो जज्ञानो हव्यो बभूथ|	yea at thy birth when thou hadst sat in glory thou agni wast the aim of invocations.
तं ते देवासो अनु केतमायन्नधावर्धन्त परथमासूमाः|	the gods came near obedient to thy sunimons and thus attained their rank as chief protectors.
वातस्य नु महिमानं रथस्य रुजन्नेति सतनयन्नस्यघोषः|	o the winds chariot o its power and glory crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder.
दिविस्प्र्ग यात्यरुणानि कर्ण्वन्नुतो एति पर्थिव्यारेणुमस्यन|	it makes the regions red and touches heaven and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered.
सं परेरते अनु वातस्य विष्ठा ऐनं गछन्ति समनं नयोषाः|	along the traces of the wind they hurry they come to him as dames to an assembly.
ताभिः सयुक सरथं देव ईयतेअस्य विश्वस्यभुवनस्य राजा|	borne on his car with these for his attendants the god speeds forth the universes monarch.
अन्तरिक्षे पथिभिरीयमानो न नि विशते कतमच्चनाहः|	travelling on the paths of airs midregion no single day doth he take rest or slumber.
अपां सखा परथमजा रतावा कव सविज्जातः कुत आबभूव|	holy and earliestborn friend of the waters where did he spring and from what region came he.
आत्मा देवानां भुवनस्य गर्भो यथावशं चरति देवेषः|	germ of the world the deities vital spirit this god moves ever as his will inclines him.
घोषा इदस्य शर्ण्विरे न रूपं तस्मै वातायहविषा विधेम|	his voice is heard his shape is ever viewless let us adore this wind with our oblation.
बर्हस्पते परथमं वाचो अग्रं यत परैरत नामधेयन्दधानाः|	whenmen bṛhaspati giving names to objects sent out vāks first and earliest utterances.
यदेषां शरेष्ठं यदरिप्रमासीत्प्रेणा तदेषां निहितं गुहाविः|	all that was excellent and spotless treasured within them was disclosed through their affection.
सक्तुमिवतितउना पुनन्तो यत्र धीरा मनसा वाचमक्रत|	where like men cleansing cornflour in a cribble the wise in spirit have created language.
अत्रा सखायः सख्यानि जानते भद्रैषांलक्ष्मीर्निहिताधि वाचि|	friends see and recognize the marks of friendship their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted.
यज्ञेन वाचः पदवीयमायन तामन्वविन्दन्न्र्षिषुप्रविष्टाम|	with sacrifice the trace of vāk they foilowed and found her harbouring within the Ṛṣis.
तामाभ्र्त्या वयदधुः पुरुत्रा तां सप्तरेभा अभि सं नवन्ते|	they brought her dealt her forth in many places seven singers make her tones resound in concert.
उत तवः पश्यन न ददर्श वाचमुत तवः शर्ण्वन नश्र्णोत्येनाम|	one man hath neer seen vāk and yet he seeth one man hath hearing but hath never heard her.
उतो तवस्मै तन्वं वि सस्रे जायेव पत्यौशती सुवासाः|	but to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond welldressed woman to her husband.
उत तवं सख्ये सथिरपीतमाहुर्नैनं हिन्वन्त्यपिवाजिनेषु|	one man they call a laggard dull in friendship they never urge him on to deeds of valour.
अधेन्वा चरति माययैष वाचं शुश्रुवानफलामपुष्पाम|	he wanders on in profitless illusion the voice he heard yields neither fruitnor blossom.
यस्तित्याज सचिविदं सखायं न तस्य वाच्यपि भागोस्ति|	no part in vāk hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship.
यदीं शर्णोत्यलकं शर्णोति नहि परवेद सुक्र्तस्यपन्थाम|	even if he hears her still in vain he listens naught knows he of the path of righteous action.
अक्षण्वन्तः कर्णवन्तः सखायो मनोजवेष्वसमाबभूवुः|	unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing.
आदघ्नास उपकक्षास उ तवे हरदा इव सनात्वा उत्वे दद्र्श्रे|	some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder others like pools of water fit to bathe in.
हर्दा तष्टेषु मनसो जवेषु यद बराह्मणाः संयजन्तेसखायः|	when friendly brahmans sacrifice together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned.
अत्राह तवं वि जहुर्वेद्याभिरोहब्रह्माणो विचरन्त्यु तवे|	they leave one far behind through their attainments and some who count as brahmans wander elsewhere.
इमे ये नार्वां न परश्चरन्ति न बराह्मणासो नसुतेकरासः|	those men who step not back and move not forward nor brahmans nor preparers of libations.
त एते वाचमभिपद्य पापया सिरीस्तन्त्रं तन्वते अप्रजज्ञयः|	having attained to vāk in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters.
सर्वे नन्दन्ति यशसागतेन सभासाहेन सख्या सखायः|	all friends are joyful in the friend who cometh in triumph having conquered in assembly.
किल्बिषस्प्र्त पितुषणिर्ह्येषामरं हितो भवतिवाजिनाय|	he is their blameaverter foodprovider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour.
रचां तवः पोषमास्ते पुपुष्वान गायत्रं तवो गायतिशक्वरीषु|	one plies his constant task reciting verses one sings the holy psalm in sakvari measures.
बरह्मा तवो वदति जातविद्यां यज्ञस्यमात्रां वि मिमीत उ तवः|	one more the brahman tells the lore of being and one lays down the rules of sacrificing.
असत सु मे जरितः साभिवेगो यत सुन्वते यजमनय शिक्षम|	this singer is my firm determination to aid the worshipper who pours the soma.
अनाशीर्दामहमस्मि परहन्ता सत्यध्व्र्तं वर्जिनायन्तमाभुम|	i slay the man who brings no milkoblation unrighteous powerful the truths perverter.
यदीदहं युधये संनयान्यदेवयून तन्वाशूशुजानान|	then will i when i lead my friends to battle against the radiant persons of the godless.
अमा ते तुम्रं वर्षभं पचानि तीव्रंसुतं पञ्चदशं नि षिञ्चम|	prepare for thee at home a vigorous bullock and pour for thee the fifteenfold strong juices.
नाहं तं वेद य इति बरवीत्यदेवयून समरणेजघन्वान|	i know not him who sayeth and declareth that he hath slain the godless in the battle.
यदावाख्यत समरणं रघावदादिद ध मेव्र्षभा पर बरुवन्ति|	soon as they see the furious combat raging men speak forth praises of my vigorous horses.
यदज्ञातेषु वर्जनेष्वासं विश्वे सतो मघवानो मासन|	while yet my deeds of might were unrecorded all passed for maghavans though i existed.
जिनामि वेत कषेम आ सन्तमाभुं पर तंक्षिणां पर्वते पादग्र्ह्य|	the potent one who dwelt in peace i conquered grasped by the foot and slew him on the mountain.
न वा उ मां वर्जने वारयन्ते न पर्वतासो यदहम्मनस्ये|	none hinder me in mine heroic exploits no not the mountains when i will and purpose.
मम सवनात कर्धुकर्णो भयात एवेदनु दयून्किरणः समेजात|	even the deaf will tremble at my roaring and every day will dust be agitated.
दर्शन नवत्र शर्तपाननिन्द्रान बाहुक्षदः शरवेपत्यमानान|	to see the indraless oblationdrinkers mean offerers oertaken by destruction.
घर्षुं वा ये निनिदुः सखायमध्यू नवेषु पवयो वव्र्त्युः|	then shall the fellies of my car pass over those who have blamed my joyous friend and scorned him.
अभूर्वौक्षीर्व्यु आयुरानड दर्षन नु पूर्वो अपरोनु दर्षत|	thou wast thou grewest to full vital vigour an earlier saw a later one shall see thee.
दवे पवस्ते परि तं न भूतो यो अस्य पारेरजसो विवेष|	two canopies as twere are round about him who reacheth to the limit of this region.
गावो यवं परयुता अर्यो अक्षन ता अपश्यं सहगोपाश्चरन्तीः|	the freed kine eat the barley of the pious  saw them as they wandered with the herdsman.
हवा इदर्यो अभितः समायन कियदासुस्वपतिश्छन्दयाते|	the calling of the pious rang around them what portion will these kine afford their owner.
सं यद वयं यवसादो जनानामहं यवाद उर्वज्रेन्तः|	when we who cat the grass of men are gathered i am with barleyeaters in the cornland.
अत्रा युक्तोअवसातारमिछादथो अयुक्तं युनजद्ववन्वान|	there shall the captor yoke the yokeless bullock and he who hath been yoked seek one to loose him.
अत्रेदु मे मंससे सत्यमुक्तं दविपाच्च यच्चतुष्पात्संस्र्जानि|	there wilt thou hold as true my spoken purpose to bring together quadrupeds and bipeds.
सत्रीभिर्यो अत्र वर्षणं पर्तन्यादयुद्धोस्य वि भजानि वेदः|	i will divide without a fight his riches who warreth here against the bull with women.
यस्यानक्षा दुहिता जात्वास कस्तां विद्वानभिमन्याते अन्धाम|	when a mans daughter hath been ever eyeless who knowing will be wroth with her for blindness.
कतरो मेनिं परति तं मुचाते य ईंवहाते य ईं वा वरेयात|	which of the two will loose on him his angerthe man who leads her home or he who woos her.
कियती योषा मर्यतो वधूयोः परिप्रीता पन्यसावार्येण|	how many a maid is pleasing to the suitor who fain would marry for her splendid riches.
भद्रा वधूर्भवति यत सुपेशाः सवयं सामित्रं वनुते जने चित|	if the girl be both good and fair of feature she finds herself a friend among the people.
पत्तो जगार परत्यञ्चमत्ति शीर्ष्णा शिरः परति दधौवरूथम|	his feet have grasped he eats the man who meets him around his head he sets the head for shelter.
आसीन ऊर्ध्वामुपसि कषिणाति नयंं उत्तानामन्वेति भूमिम|	sitting anear and right above he smites us and follows earth that lies spread out beneath him.
बर्हन्नछायो अपलाशो अर्वा तस्थौ माता विषितो अत्तिगर्भः|	high leafless shadowless and swift is heaven the mother stands the youngling loosed is feeding.
अन्यस्या वत्सं रिहती मिमाय कया भुवा निदधे धेनुरूधः|	loud hath she lowed licking anothers offspring in what world hath the cow laid down her udder.
सप्त वीरासो अधरादुदायन्नष्टोत्तरात्तात समजग्मिरन ते|	seven heroes from the nether part ascended and from the upper part came eight together.
नव पश्चातात सथिविमन्त आयन दश पराक्सानु वि तिरन्त्यश्नः|	nine from behind came armed with winnowingbaskets ten from the front pressed oer the rocks high ridges.
दशानामेकं कपिलं समानं तं हिन्वन्ति करतवेपार्याय|	one of the ten the tawny shared in common they send to execute their final purpose.
गर्भं माता सुधितं वक्षणास्ववेनन्तन्तुषयन्ती बिभर्ति|	the mother carries on her breast the infant of noble form and soothes it while it knows not.
पीवानं मेषमपचन्त वीरा नयुप्ता अक्षा अनु दीवासन|	the heroes dressed with fire the fatted wether the dice were thrown by way of sport and gaming.
दवा धनुं बर्हतीमप्स्वन्तः पवित्रवन्ता चरतःपुनन्ता|	two reach the plain amid the heavenly waters hallowing and with means of purifying.
वि करोशनासो विष्वञ्च आयन पचाति नेमो नहि पक्षदर्धः|	crying aloud they ran in all directions one half of them will cook and not the other.
अयं मे देवः सविता तदाह दर्वन्न इद वनवत्सर्पिरन्नः|	to me hath savitar this god declared it he will perform whose food is wood and butter.
अपश्यं गरामं वहमानमारादचक्रया सवधयावर्तमानम|	i saw a troop advancing from the distance moved not by wheels but their own godlike nature.
सिषक्त्यर्यः पर युगा जनानां सद्यःशिश्ना परमिनानो नवीयान|	the friendly one seeks human generations destroying still new bands of evil beings.
एतौ मे गावौ परमरस्य युक्तौ मो षु पर सेधीर्मुहुरिन्ममन्धि|	these my two bulls even pramaras are harnessed drive them not far here let them often linger.
आपश्चिदस्य वि नशन्त्यर्थं सूरश्च मर्कौपरो बभूवान|	the waters even shall aid him to his object and the allcleansing sun who is above us.
अयं यो वज्रः पुरुधा विव्र्त्तोअवः सूर्यस्य बर्हतःपुरीषात|	this is the thunderbolt which often whirleth down from the lofty misty realm of sūrya.
शरव इदेना परो अन्यदस्ति तदव्यथीजरिमाणस्तरन्ति|	beyond this realm there is another glory so through old age they pass and feel no sorrow.
वर्क्षेवर्क्षे नियता मीमयद गौस्ततो वयः पर पतान्पुरुषादः|	bound fast toevery tree the cow is lowing and thence the manconsuming birds are flying.
अथेदं विश्वं भुवनं भयात इद्रायसुन्वद रषये च शिक्षत|	then all this world though pressing juice for indra and strengthening the Ṛṣi is affrighted.
देवानां माने परथमा अतिष्ठन कर्न्तत्रदेषमुपर उदायन|	in the gods mansion stood the firstcreated and from their separation came the later.
तरयस्तपन्ति पर्थिविमनूप दव बर्बूकं वहतःपुरीषम|	three warm the earth while holding stores of water and two of these convey the murmuring moisture.
सा ते जीवातुरुत तस्य विद्धि म समैताद्र्गप गूहःसमर्ये|	this is thy life and do thou mark and know it as such hide not thyself in time of battle.
अविः सवः कर्णुते गूहते बुसं स पादुरस्यनिर्णिजो न मुच्यते|	he manifests the light and hides the vapour his foot is never free from robes that veil it.
कुह शरुत इन्द्रः कस्मिन्नद्य जने मित्रो न शरुयते|	where is famed indra heard of with what folk is he renowned today as mitra is.
रषीणां वा यः कषये गुहा व चर्क्र्षे गिर|	who in the home of Ṛṣis and in secret is extolled with song.
इह शरुत इन्द्रो अस्मे अद्य सतवे वज्र्य रचीषमः|	even here is indra famed and among us this day the glorious thunderer is praised.
मित्रो नयो जनेष्वा यशश्चक्रे असाम्या|	he who like mitra mid the folk hath won complete and full renown.
महो यस पतिः शवसो असाम्या महो नर्म्णस्य तूतुजिः|	he who is sovran lord of great and perfect strength exerter of heroic might.
भर्ता वज्रस्य धर्ष्णोः पिता पुत्रमिव परियम|	who bears the fearless thunder as a father bears his darling son.
युजानो अश्व वातस्य धुनी देवो देवस्य वज्रिवः|	harnessing to thy car as god two blustering steeds of the windgod o thunderer.
सयन्तपथा विरुक्मता सर्जान सतोष्यध्वनः|	that speed along the shining path thou making ways art glorified.
तवं तया चिद वातस्याश्वागा रज्रा तमना वहध्यै|	even to these dark steeds of wind thou of thyself hast come to ride.
ययोर्देवो न मर्त्यो यन्ता नकिर्विदाय्यः|	of which no driver may be found none be he god or mortal man.
अध गमन्तोशना पर्छते वां कदर्था न आ गर्हम|	when ye approach men ask you thee and uśanā why come ye to our dwellingplace.
आजग्मथुः पराकाद दिवश्च गमश्च मर्त्यम|	why are ye come to mortal man from distant realms of eapth and heaven.
आ न इन्द्र पर्क्षसेअस्माकं बरह्मोद्यतम|	o indra thou shalt speak us fair our holy prayer is offered up.
तत तवायाचामहेअवः शुष्णं यद धन्नमानुषम|	we pray to thee for help as thou didst strike the monster Śuṣṇa dead.
अकर्मा दस्युरभि नो अमन्तुरन्यव्रतो अमानुषः|	around us is the dasyu riteless void of sense inhuman keeping alien laws.
तवन्तस्यामित्रहन वधर्दासस्य दम्भय|	baffle thou slayer of the foe the weapon which this dāsa wields.
तवं न इन्द्र शूर शूरैरुत तवोतासो बर्हणा|	hero with heroes thou art ours yea strong are they whom thou dost help.
पुरुत्राते वि पूर्तयो नवन्त कषोणयो यथा|	in many a place are thy full gifts and men like vassals sing thy praise.
तवं तान वर्त्रहत्ये चोदयो नॄन कार्पाणे शूर वज्रिवः|	urge thou these heroes on to slay the enemy brave thunderer in the fight with swords.
गुहा यदी कवीनां विशां नक्षत्रशवसाम|	even when hid among the tribes of sages numerous as stars.
मक्षू ता त इन्द्र दानाप्नस आक्षाणे शूर वज्रिवः|	swift come those gifts of thine whose hand is prompt to rend and burn o hero thunderarmed.
यद ध शुष्णस्य दम्भयो जातं विश्वं सयावभिः|	as thou with thy companions didst destroy the whole of susnias brood.
माकुध्र्यगिन्द्र शूर वस्वीरस्मे भूवन्नभिष्टयः|	let not thine excellent assistance come to us o hero indra profitless.
वयंवयं त आसां सुम्ने सयाम वज्रिवः|	may we may we enjoy the bliss of these thy favours thunderer.
अस्मे ता त इन्द्र सन्तु सत्याहिंसन्तीरुपस्प्र्शः|	may those soft impulses of thine o indra be fruitful and innocent to us.
विद्यामयासां भुजो धेनूनां न वज्रिवः|	may we know these whose treasures are like those of milchkine thunderer.
अहस्ता यदपदी वर्धत कषाः शचीभिर्वेद्यानाम|	that earth through power of knowing things that may be known handless and footless yet might thrive.
शुष्णं परि परदक्षिणिद विश्वायवे नि शिश्नथः|	thou slewest turning to the right guna for every living man.
पिबापिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मा रिषण्यो वसवान वसुःसन|	drink drink the soma hero indra be not withheld as thou art good o treasuregiver.
उत तरायस्व गर्णतो मघोनो महश्च रायो रेवतस्क्र्धी नः|	preserve the singers and our liberal princes and make us wealthy with abundant riches.
पर देवत्रा बराह्मणे गातुरेत्वपो अछा मनसो नप्रयुक्ति|	as twere with swift exertion of the spirit let the priest speed to the celestial waters.
महीं मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धासिं पर्थुज्रयसेरीरधा सुव्र्क्तिम|	the glorious food of varuṇa and mitra to him who spreadeth far this laud i offer.
अध्वर्यवो हविष्मन्तो हि भूताछाप इतोशतीरुशन्तः|	adhvaryus he ye ready with oblations and come with longing to the longing waters.
अव याश्चष्टे अरुणः सुपर्णस्तमास्यध्वमूर्मिमद्या सुहस्ताः|	down on which looks the purpletinted eagle pour ye that flowing wave this day defthanded.
अध्वर्यवोअप इता समुद्रमपां नपातं हविषा यजध्वम|	go to the reservoir o ye adhvaryus worship the waters child with your oblations.
स वो दददूर्मिमद्या सुपूतं तस्मै सोमं मधुमन्तंसुनोत|	a consecrated wave he now will give you so press for him the soma rich in sweetness.
यो अनिध्मो दीदयदप्स्वन्तर्यं विप्रास ईळतेध्वरेषु|	he who shines bright in floods unfed with fuel whom sages worship at their sacrifices.
अपां नपान मधुमतीरपो दा याभिरिन्द्रोवाव्र्धे वीर्याय|	give waters rich in sweets child of the waters even those which gave heroic might to indra.
याभिः सोमो मोदते हर्षते च कल्याणीभिर्युवतिभिर्नमर्यः|	those in which soma joys and is delighted as a young man with fair and pleasant damsels.
ता अध्वर्यो अपो अछा परेहि यदासिञ्चाोषधीभिः पुनीतात|	go thou unto those waters o adhvaryu and purify with herbs what thou infusest.
एवेद यूने युवतयो नमन्त यदीमुशन्नुशतीरेत्यछ|	so maidens bow before the youthful gallant who comes with love to them who yearn to meet him.
सं जानते मनसा सं चिकित्रेअध्वर्यवो धिषणापश्चदेवीः|	in heart accordant and in wish oneminded are the adhvaryus and the heavenly waters.
यो वो वर्ताभ्यो अक्र्णोदु लोकं यो वो मह्या अभिशस्तेरमुञ्चत|	he who made room for you when fast imprisoned who freed you from the mighty imprecation.
तस्मा इन्द्राय मधुमन्तमूर्मिं देवमादनम्प्र हिणोतनापः|	even to that indra send the meathrich current the wave that gratifies the gods o waters.
परास्मै हिनोत मधुमन्तमूर्मिं गर्भो यो वः सिन्धवोमध्व उत्सः|	send forth to him the meathrich wave o rivers which is your offspring and a well of sweetness.
घर्तप्र्ष्ठमीड्यमध्वरेष्वापो रेवतीःश्र्णुता हवं मे|	oilbalmed to be implored at sacrifices ye wealthy waters hear mine invocation.
तं सिन्धवो मत्सरमिन्द्रपानमूर्मिं पर हेत य उभेियर्ति|	send forth the rapturegiving wave o rivers which indra drinks which sets the twain in motion.
मदच्युतमौशानं नभोजां परि तरितन्तुंविचरन्तमुत्सम|	the well that springeth from the clouds desirous that wandereth tripleformed distilling transport.
आवर्व्र्ततीरध नु दविधारा गोषुयुधो न नियवंचरन्तीः|	these winding streams which with their double current like cattleraiders seek the lower pastures.
रषे जनित्रीर्भुवनस्य पत्नीरपो वन्दस्वसव्र्धः सयोनीः|	waters which dwell together thrive together queens mothers of the world these Ṛṣi honour.
हिनोता नो अध्वरं देवयज्या हिनोत बरह्म सनयेधनानाम|	send forth our sacrifice with holy worship send forth the hymn and prayer for gain of riches.
रतस्य योगे वि शयध्वमूधः शरुष्टीवरीर्भूतनास्मभ्यमापः|	for need of sacrifice disclose the udder give gracious hearing to our call o waters.
आपो रेवतीः कषयथा हि वस्वः करतुं च भद्रम्बिभ्र्थाम्र्तं च|	for wealthy waters ye control all treasures ye bring auspicious intellect and amṛta.
रायश्च सथ सवपत्यस्य पत्नीःसरस्वती तद गर्णते वयो धात|	ye are the queens of independent riches sarasvatī give full life to the singer.
परति यदापो अद्र्श्रमायतीर्घ्र्तं पयांसि बिभ्रतीर्मधूनि|	when i behold the waters coming hither carrying with them milk and mcath and butter.
अध्वर्युभिर्मनसा संविदाना इन्द्राय सोमंसुषुतं भरन्तीः|	bearing the wellpressed soma juice to indra they harmonize in spirit with adhvaryus.
एमा अग्मन रेवतीर्जीवधन्या अध्वर्यवः सादयतासखायः|	rich they are come with wealth for living beings o friends adhvaryus seat them in their places.
नि बर्हिषि धत्तन सोम्यासोअपां नप्त्रासंविदानास एनाः|	seat them on holy grass ye somabringers in harmony with the offspring of the waters.
आग्मन्नाप उशतीर्बर्हिरेदं नयध्वरे असदन्देवयन्तीः|	now to this grass are come the longing waters the pious ones are seated at our worship.
अध्वर्यवः सुनुतेन्द्राय सोममभूदु वःसुशका देवयज्या|	adbvaryus press the soma juice for indra so will the service of the gods be easy.
बर्हस्पते परति मे देवतामिहि मित्रो वा यद वरुणो वासिपूषा|	come be thou mitra varuṇa or pūṣan come o bṛhaspati to mine oblation.
आदित्यैर्वा यद वसुभिर्मरुत्वान स पर्जन्यंशन्तनवे वर्षाय|	with maruts vasus or Ādityas make thou parjanya pour for santanu his raindrops.
आ देवो दूतो अजिरश्चिकित्वान तवद देवापे अभि मामगछत|	the god intelligent the speedy envoy whom thou hast sent hath come to me devapi.
परतीचीनः परति मामा वव्र्त्स्व दधामि ते दयुमतींवाचमासन|	address thyself to me and turn thee hither within thy lips will i put brilliant language.
अस्मे धेहि दयुमतीं वाचमासन बर्हस्पते अनमीवामिषिराम|	within my mouth bṛhaspati deposit speech lucid vigorous and free from weakness.
यया वर्ष्टिं शन्तनवे वनाव दिवो दरप्सोमधुमाना विवेश|	thereby to win for santanu the rainfall the meathrich drop from heaven hath passed within it.
आ नो दरप्सा मधुमन्तो विशन्त्विन्द्र देह्यधिरथंसहस्रम|	let the sweet drops descend on us o indra give us enough to lade a thousand wagons.
नि षीद होत्रं रतुथा यजस्व देवान देवापेहविषा सपर्य|	sit to thy hotar task pay worship duly and serve the gods devapi with oblation.
आर्ष्टिषेणो होत्रं रषिर्निषीदन देवापिर्देवसुमतिंचिकित्वान|	knowing the gods goodwill devapi Ṛṣi the son of rstisena sate as hotar.
स उत्तरस्मादधरं समुद्रमपो दिव्या अस्र्जद्वर्ष्या अभि|	he hath brought down from heavens most lofty summit the ocean of the rain celestial waters.
अस्मिन समुद्रे अध्युत्तरस्मिन्नापो देवेभिर्निव्र्ता अतिष्ठन|	gathered together in that highest ocean the waters stood by deities obstructed.
ता अद्रवन्नार्ष्टिषेणेन सर्ष्टा देवापिना परेषिताम्र्क्षिणीषु|	they burried down set free by arstisena in gaping clefts urged onward by devapi.
यद देवापिः शन्तनवे पुरोहितो होत्राय वर्तः कर्पयन्नदीधेत|	when as chief priest for santanu devapi chosen for hotars duty prayed beseeching.
देवश्रुतं वर्ष्टिवनिं रराणो बर्हस्पतिर्वाचमस्मा अयछत|	graciously pleased bṛhaspati vouchsafed him a voice that reached the gods and won the waters.
यं तवा देवापिः शुशुचानो अग्न आर्ष्टिषेणो मनुष्यःसमीधे|	o agni whom devapi arstisena the mortal man hath kindled in his glory.
विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुमद्यमानः पर पर्जन्यमीरया वर्ष्टिमन्तम|	joying in him with all the gods together urge on the sender of the rain parjanya.
तवां पूर्व रषयो गीर्भिरायन तवामध्वरेषु पुरुहूतविश्वे|	all ancient Ṛṣis with their songs approached thee even thee o muchinvoked at sacrifices.
सहस्राण्यधिरथान्यस्मे आ नो यज्ञंरोहिदश्वोप याहि|	we have provided wagonloads in thousands come to the solemn rite lord of red horses.
एतान्यग्ने नवतिर्नव तवे आहुतान्यधिरथा सहस्र|	the wagonloads the nineandninety thousand these have been offered up to thee o agni.
तेभिर्वर्धस्व तन्वः शूर पूर्वीर्दिवो नो वर्ष्टिमिषितोरिरीहि|	hero with these increase thy many bodies and stimulated send us rain from heaven.
एतान्यग्ने नवतिं सहस्रा सं पर यछ वर्ष्ण इन्द्रायभागम|	give thou these ninety thousand loads o agni to indra to the bull to be his portion.
विद्वान पथ रतुशो देवयानानप्यौलानं दिविदेवेषु धेहि|	knowing the paths which deities duly travel set mid the gods in heaven aulana also.
अग्ने बाधस्व वि मर्धो वि दुर्गहापामीवामपरक्षांसि सेध|	o agni drive afar our foes our troubles chase malady away and wicked demons.
अस्मात समुद्राद बर्हतो दिवो नोअपाम्भूमानमुप नः सर्जेह|	from this airocean from the lofty heavens send down on us a mighty flood of waters.
आ याहि वनसा सह गावः सचन्त वर्तनिं यदूधभिः|	with all thy beauty come the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path.
आ याहि वस्व्या धिया मंहिष्ठो जारयन्मखःसुदानुभिः|	come with kind thoughts most liberal rousing the warriors hymn of praise with bounteous ones.
पितुभ्र्तो न तन्तुमित सुदानवः परति दध्मो यजामसि|	as nourishers we tie the thread and liberal with our bounty offer sacrifice.
उषा अप सवसुस्तमः सं वर्तयति वर्तनिं सुजातता|	dawn drives away her sisters gloom and through her excellence makes her retrace her path.
आशुः शिशानो वर्षभो न भीमो घनाघनः कषोभणश्चर्षणीनाम|	swift rapidly striking like a bull who sharpens his horns terrific stirring up the people.
संक्रन्दनोअनिमिष एकवीरः शतं सेनाजयत साकमिन्द्रः|	with eyes that close not bellowing sole hero indra subdued at once a hundred armies.
संक्रन्दनेनानिमिषेण जिष्णुना युत्कारेण दुश्च्यवनेनध्र्ष्णुना|	with him loudroaring ever watchful victor bold hard to overthrow rouser of battle.
तदिन्द्रेण जयत तत सहध्वं युधो नरैषुहस्तेन वर्ष्णा|	indra the strong whose hand bears arrows conquer ye warriors now now vanquish in the combat.
स इषुहस्तैः स निषङगिभिर्वशी संस्रष्टा स युधैन्द्रो गणेन|	he rules with those who carry shafts and quivers indra who with his band rings hosts together.
संस्र्ष्टजित सोमपा बाहुशर्ध्युग्रधन्वाप्रतिहिताभिरस्ता|	foeconquering strong of arm the somadrinker with mighty bow shooting with welllaid arrows.
बर्हस्पते परि दीया रथेन रक्षोहामित्रानपबाधमानः|	bṛhaspati fly with thy chariot hither slayer of demons driving off our foemen.
परभञ्जन सेनाः परम्र्णो युधा जयन्नस्माकमेध्यविता रथानाम|	be thou protector of our cars destroyer victor in battle breakerup of armies.
बलविज्ञाय सथविरः परवीरः सहस्वान वाजी सहमानौग्रः|	conspicuous by thy strength firm foremost fighter mighty and fierce victorious allsubduing.
अभिवीरो अभिसत्वा सहोजा जैत्रमिन्द्र रथमातिष्ठ गोवित|	the son of conquest passing men and heroes kinewinner mount thy conquering car o indra.
गोत्रभिदं गोविदं वज्रबाहुं जयन्तमज्म परम्र्णन्तमोजसा|	cleaver of stalls kinewinner armed with thunder who quells an army and with might destroys it.
इमं सजाता अनु वीरयध्वमिन्द्रं सखायो अनुसं रभध्वम|	follow him brothers quit yourselves like heroes and like this indra show your zeal and courage.
अभि गोत्राणि सहसा गाहमानोअदयो वीरः शतमन्युरिन्द्रः|	piercing the cowstalls with surpassing vigour indra the pitiless hero wild with anger.
दुश्च्यवनः पर्तनाषाळ अयुध्योअस्माकं सेनावतु पर युत्सु|	victor in fight unshaken and resistlessmay he protect our armies in our battles.
इन्द्र आसां नेता बर्हस्पतिर्दक्षिणा यज्ञः पुर एतुसोमः|	indra guide these bṛhaspati precede them the guerdon and the sacrifice and soma.
देवसेनानामभिभञ्जतीनां जयन्तीनां मरुतोयन्त्वग्रम|	and let the banded maruts march in forefront of heavenly hosts that conquer and demolish.
इन्द्रस्य वर्ष्णो वरुणस्य राज्ञ आदित्यानां मरुतांशर्ध उग्रम|	ours be the potent host of mighty indra king varuṇa and maruts and Ādityas.
महामनसां भुवनच्यवानां घोषोदेवानां जयतामुदस्थात|	uplifted is the shout of gods who conquer highminded gods who cause the worlds to tremble.
उद धर्षय मघवन्नायुधान्युत सत्वनां मामकानाम्मनांसि|	bristle thou up o maghavan our weapons excite the spirits of my warring heroes.
उद वर्त्रहन वाजिनां वाजिनान्युद रथानांजयतां यन्तु घोषाः|	urge on the strong steeds might o vṛtraslayer and let the din of conquering cars go upward.
अस्माकमिन्द्रः सम्र्तेषु धवजेष्वस्माकं या इषवस्ताजयन्तु|	may indra aid us when our flags are gathered victorious be the arrows of our army.
अस्माकं वीरा उत्तरे भवन्त्वस्मानु देवा अवताहवेषु|	may our brave men of war prevail in battle ye gods protect us in the shout of onset.
अमीषां चित्तं परतिलोभयन्ती गर्हाणाङगान्यप्वे परेहि|	bewildering the senses of our foemen seize thou their bodies and depart o apva.
अभि परेहि निर्दह हर्त्सु शोकैरन्धेनामित्रास्तमसासचन्ताम|	attack them set their hearts on fire and burn them so let our foes abide in utter darkness.
परेता जयता नर इन्द्रो वः शर्म यछतु|	advance o heroes win the day may indra be your sure defence.
उग्रा वः सन्तुबाहवोअनाध्र्ष्या यथासथ|	exceeding mighty be your arms that none may wound or injure you.
परो षवस्मै पुरोरथमिन्द्राय शूषमर्चत|	sing strength to indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place.
अभीके चिदुलोकक्र्त संगे समत्सु वर्त्रहास्माकं बोधि चोदितानभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु|	giver of room in closest fight slayer of foes in shock of war be thou our great encourager let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.
तवं सिन्धून्रवास्र्जोअधराचो अहन्नहिम|	thou didst destroy the dragon thou sentest the rivers down to earth.
अशत्रुरिन्द्रजज्ञिषे विश्वं पुष्यसि वार्यं तं तवा परि षवजामहेनभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु|	foeless o indra wast thou born thou tendest well each choicest thing therefore we draw us close to thee let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.
वि षु विश्वा अरातयोअर्यो नशन्त नो धियः|	destroyed be all malignities and all our enemys designs.
अस्तासिशत्रवे वधं यो न इन्द्र जिघांसति या ते रातिर्ददिर्वसु नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाका अधि धन्वसु|	thy bolt thou castest at the foe o indra who would srnite us dead thy liberal bounty gives us wealth.
यो न इन्द्राभितो जनो वर्कायुरादिदेशति|	the robber people round about indra who watch and aim at us.
अधस्पदं तमीं कर्धि विबाधो असि सासहिर्नभन्तामन्यकेषां जयाकाधि धन्वसु|	trample them down beneath thy foot a conquering scatterer art thou.
यो न इन्द्राभिदासति सनाभिर्यश्च निष्ट्यः|	whoso assails us indra be the man a stranger or akin.
अव तस्यबलं तिर महीव दयौरध तमना नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु|	bring down thyself his strength although it be as vast as are the heavens.
वयमिन्द्र तवायवः सखित्वमा रभामहे|	close to thy friendship do we cling o indra and depend or thee.
रतस्य नःपथा नयाति विश्वानि दुरिता नभन्तामन्यकेषांज्याका अधि धन्वसु|	lead us beyond all pain and grief along the path of holy law.
अस्मभ्यं सु तवमिन्द्र तां शिक्ष या दोहते परति वरंजरित्रे|	do thou bestow upon us her o indra who yields according to the singers longing.
अछिद्रोध्नी पीपयद यथा नः सहस्रधारापयसा मही गौः|	that the great cow may with exhaustless udder pouring a thousand streams give milk to feed us.
तमस्य दयावाप्र्थिवी सचेतसा विश्वेभिर्देवैरनुशुष्ममावताम|	the heavens and the earth accordant with all gods encouraged graciously that vigorous might of his.
यदैत कर्ण्वानो महिमानमिन्द्रियम्पीत्वी सोमस्य करतुमानवर्धत|	when he came showing forth his majesty and power he drank of soma juice and waxed exceeding strong.
तमस्य विष्णुर्महिमानमोजसांशुं दधन्वान मधुनोवि रप्शते|	this majesty of his viṣṇu extols and lauds making the stalcthat gives the meath flow forth with inight.
देवेभिरिन्द्रो मघवा सयावभिर्व्र्त्रंजघन्वानभवद वरेण्यः|	when indra maghavan with those who followed him had smitten vṛtra he deserved the choice of gods.
वर्त्रेण यदहिना बिभ्रदायुधा समस्थिथा युधयेशंसमाविदे|	when bearing warlike weapons fain to win thee praise thou mettest vṛtra yea the dragon for the fight.
विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सह तमनावर्धन्नुग्र महिमानमिन्द्रियम|	then all the maruts who were gathered with dice there extolled o mighty one thy powerful majesty.
जज्ञान एव वयबाधत सप्र्धः परापश्यद वीरो अभिपौंस्यं रणम|	soon as he sprang to life he forced asun der hosts forward the hero looked to manly deed and war.
अव्र्श्चदद्रिमव सस्यदः सर्जदस्तभ्नान नाकं सवपस्यया पर्थुम|	he cleft the rock he let concurrent streams flow forth and with his skilful art stablished the heavens wide vault.
आदिन्द्रः सत्रा तविषीरपत्यत वरीयो दयावाप्र्थिवीबाधत|	indra hath evermore possessed surpassing power he forced far from each other heaven and earth apart.
अवाभरद धर्षितो वज्रमायसं शेवं मित्रायवरुणाय दाशुषे|	he hurled impetuous down his iron thunderbolt a joy to varuṇas and mitras worshipper.
इन्द्रस्यात्र तविषीभ्यो विरप्शिन रघायतो अरंहयन्तमन्यवे|	then to the mighty powers of indra to his wrath his the fierce stormer loud of voice they came with speed.
वर्त्रं यदुग्रो वयव्र्श्चदोजसापो बिभ्रतन्तमसा परीव्र्तम|	what time the potent one rent vṛtra with his strength who held the waters back whom darkness compassed round.
या वीर्याणि परथमानि कर्त्वा महित्वेभिर्यतमानौसमीयतुः|	even in the first of those heroic acts which they who strove together came with might to execute.
धवान्तं तमोअव दध्वसे हत इन्द्रो मह्नापूर्वहूतावपत्यत|	deep darkness fell upon the slain and indra won by victory the right of being first invoked.
विश्वे देवासो अध वर्ष्ण्यानि तेअवर्धयन सोमवत्यावचस्यया|	then all the gods extolled with eloquence inspired by draughts of soma juice thy deeds of manly might.
रद्धं वर्त्रमहिमिन्द्रस्य हन्मनाग्निर्नजम्भैस्त्र्ष्वन्नमावयत|	as agni eats the dry food with his tcetlv he ate vṛtra the dragon maimed by indras deadly dart.
भूरि दक्षेभिर्वचनेभिरकवभिः सख्येभिः सख्यानिप्र वोचत|	proclaim his many friendships met with friendship made with singers with the skilful and the eloquent.
इन्द्रो धुनिं च चुमुरिं च दम्भयञ्छ्रद्धामनस्या शर्णुते दभीतये|	indra when he subdues dhuni and cumuri lists to dabhīti for his faithful spirits sake.
तवं पुरूण्या भरा सवश्व्या येभिर्मंसै निवचनानिशंसन|	give riches manifold with noble horses to be remembered while my songs address thee.
सुगेभिर्विश्वा दुरिता तरेम विदो षु ण उर्वियागाधमद्य|	may we by easy paths pass all our troubles find us this day a ford wide and extensive.
रथं यान्तं कुह को ह वां नरा परति दयुमन्तंसुविताय भूषति|	your radiant chariotwhither goes it on its waywho decks it for you heroes for its happy course.
परातर्यावाणं विभ्वं विशेविशेवस्तोर वस्तोर्वहमानं धिया शमि|	starting at daybreak visiting each morning every house borne hitherward through prayer unto the sacrifice.
कुह सविद दोषा कुह वस्तोरश्विना कुहाभिपित्वं करतःकुहोषतुः|	where are ye aśvins in the evening where at morn where is your haltingplace where rest ye for the night.
को वां शयुत्रा विधवेव देवरं मर्यं नयोषा कर्णुते सधस्थ आ|	who brings you homeward as the widow bedward draws her husbands brother as the bride attracts the groom.
परातर्जरेथे जरणेव कापया वस्तोरवस्तोर्यजता गछथोग्र्हम|	early ye sing forth praise as with a heralds voice and meet for worship go each morning to the house.
कस्य धवस्रा भवथः कस्य वा नरा राजपुत्रेवसवनाव गछथः|	whom do ye ever bring to ruin unto whose libations come ye heroes like two sons of kings.
युवां मर्गेव वारणा मर्गण्यवो दोषा वस्तोर्हविषा निह्वयामहे|	even as hunters follow two wild elephants we with oblations call you down at morn and eve.
युवं होत्रां रतुथा जुह्वते नरेषं जनायवहथः शुभस पती|	to folk who pay you offierings at appointed times chiefs lords of splendour ye bring food to strengthen them.
युवां ह घोषा पर्यश्विना यती राज्ञ ऊचे दुहिताप्र्छे वां नरा|	to you o aśvins came the daughter of a king ghoṣā and said o heroes this i beg of you.
भूतं मे अह्न उत भूतमक्तवेऽशवावते रथिने शक्तमर्वते|	be near me in the day he near me in the night help me to gain a carborne chieftain rich in steeds.
युवं कवी षठः पर्यश्विना रथं विशो न कुत्सोजरितुर्नशायथः|	o aśvins ye are wise as kutsa comes to men bring your car nigh the folk of him who sings your praise.
युवोर्ह मक्षा पर्यश्विना मध्वासा भरत निष्क्र्तं न योषणा|	the bee o aśvins bears your honey in her mouth as the maid carries it purified in her hand.
युवं ह भुज्युं युवमश्विना वशं युवं शिञ्जारमुशनामुपारथुः|	to bhujyu and to vaśa ye come near with help o aśvins to sinjara and to uśanā.
युवो ररावा परि सख्यमासते युवोरहमवसा सुम्नमा चके|	your worshipper secures your friendship for himself through your protection i desire felicity.
युवं ह कर्शं युवमश्विना शयुं युवं विधन्तंविधवामुरुष्यथः|	krsa and Śayu ye protect ye aśvins twain ye two assist the widow and the worshipper.
युवं सनिभ्य सतनयन्तमश्विनापव्रजमूर्णुथः सप्तास्यम|	and ye throw open aśvins unto those who win the cattlestall that thunders with its serenfold mouth.
जनिष्ट योषा पतयत कनीनको वि चारुहन वीरुधोदंसना अनु|	the woman hath brought forth the infant hath appeared the plants of wondrous beauty straightway have sprung up.
आस्मै रीयन्ते निवनेव सिन्धवोअस्मा अह्नेभवति तत पतित्वनम|	to him the rivers run as down a deep descent and he this day becomes their master and their lord.
जीवं रुदन्ति वि मयन्ते अध्वरे दीर्घामनु परसितिन्दीधियुर्नरः|	they mourn the living cry aloud at sacrifice the men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast.
वामं पित्र्भ्यो य इदं समेरिरे मयःपतिभ्यो जनयः परिष्वजे|	a lovely thing for fathers who have gathered herea joy to husbandsare the wives their arms shall clasp.
न तस्य विद्म तदु षु पर वोचत युवा ह यद युवत्याःक्षेति योनिषु|	of this we have no knowledge tall it forth to us now the youth rests within the chambers of the bride.
परियोस्रियस्य वर्षभस्य रेतिनो गर्हंगमेमाश्विना तदुश्मसि|	fain would we reach the dwelling of the vigorous steer who loves the kine o aśvins this is our desire.
आ वामगन सुमतिर्वाजिनीवसू नयश्विना हर्त्सु कामायंसत|	your favouring grace hath come ye lords of ample wealth aśvins our longings are stored up within your hearts.
अभूतं गोपा मिथुना शुभस पती परियार्यम्णो दुर्यानशीमहि|	ye lords of splendour have become our twofold guard may we as welcome friends reach aryamans abode.
ता मन्दसाना मनुषो दुरोण आ धत्तं रयिं सहवीरंवचस्यवे|	even so rejoicing in the dwellingplace of man give hero sons and riches to the eloquent.
कर्तं तीर्थं सुप्रपाणं शुभस पतीस्थाणुं पथेष्ठामप दुर्मतिं हतम|	make a ford lords of splendour where men well may drink remove the spiteful treestump standing in the path.
कव सविदद्य कतमास्वश्विना विक्षु दस्रा मादयेतेशुभस पती|	o aśvins wonderworkers lords of lustre where and with what folk do ye delight yourselves today.
क ईं नि येमे कतमस्य जग्मतुर्विप्रस्य वायजमानस्य वा गर्हम|	who hath detained them with him whither are they gone unto what sages or what worshippers abode.
परं मर्त्यो अनु परेहि पन्थां यस्ते सव इतरो देवयानात|	go hence o death pursue thy special pathway apart from that which gods are wont to travel.
चक्षुष्मते शर्ण्वते ते बरवीमि मा नः परजां रीरिषोमोत वीरान|	to thee i say it who hast eyes and hearest touch not our offspring injure not our heroes.
मर्त्योः पदं योपयन्तो यदैत दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः|	as ye have come effacing mrtyus footstep to further times prolonging your existence.
आप्यायमानाः परजया धनेन शुद्धाःपूता भवत यज्ञियासः|	may ye be rich in children and possessions cleansed purified and meet for sacrificing.
इमे जीवा वि मर्तैरावव्र्त्रन्नभूद भद्रा देवहूतिर्नोद्य|	divided from the dead are these the living now be our calling on the gods successful.
पराञ्चो अगाम नर्तये हसाय दराघीय आयुःप्रतरं दधानाः|	we have gone forth for dancing and for laughter tofurther times prolonging our existence.
इमं जीवेभ्यः परिधिं दधामि मैषां नु गादपरोर्थमेतम|	here i erect this rampart for the living let none of these none other reach this limit.
शतं जीवन्तु शरदः पुरूचीरन्तर्म्र्त्युं दधतां पर्वतेन|	may they survive a hundred lengthened autumns and may they bury death beneath this mountain.
यथाहान्यनुपूर्वं भवन्ति यथ रतव रतुभिर्यन्तिसाधु|	as the days follow days in close succession as with the seasons duly come the seasons.
यथा न पूर्वमपरो जहात्येवा धातरायूंषि कल्पयैषाम|	as each successor fails not his foregoer so form the lives of these o great ordainer.
आ रोहतायुर्जरसं वर्णाना अनुपूर्वं यतमाना यतिष्ठ|	live your full lives ap find old age delightful all of you striving one behind the other.
इह तवष्टा सुजनिमा सजोषा दीर्घमायुःकरति जीवसे वः|	may tvaṣṭar maker of fair things be gracious and lengthen out the days of your existence.
इमा नारीरविधवाः सुपत्नीराञ्जनेन सर्पिषा संविशन्तु|	let these unwidowed dames with noble husbands adorn themselves with fragrant balm and unguent.
अनश्रवोअनमीवाः सुरत्ना आ रोहन्तु जनयोयोनिमग्रे|	decked with fair jewels tearless free from sorrow first let the dames go up to where he lieth.
उदीर्ष्व नार्यभि जीवलोकं गतासुमेतमुप शेष एहि|	rise come unto the world of life o woman come he is lifeless by whose side thou liest.
हस्तग्राभस्य दिधिषोस्तवेदं पत्युर्जनित्वमभि सम्बभूथ|	wifehood with this thy husband was thy portion who took thy hand and wooed thee as a lover.
धनुर्हस्तादाददानो मर्तस्यास्मे कषत्राय वर्चसेबलाय|	from his dead hand i take the bow be carried that it may be our power and might and glory.
अत्रैव तवमिह वयं सुवीरा विश्वा सप्र्धोभिमातीर्जयेम|	there art thou there and here with noble heroes may we oercome all hosts that fight against us.
उप सर्प मातरं भूमिमेतामुरुव्यचसं पर्थिवींसुशेवाम|	betake thee to the iap of earth the mother of earth farspreading very kind and gracious.
ऊर्णम्रदा युवतिर्दक्षिणावत एषा तवा पातुनिरतेरुपस्थात|	young dame woolsoft unto the guerdongiver may she preserve thee from destructions bosom.
उच्छ्वञ्चस्व पर्थिवि मा नि बाधथाः सूपायनास्मै भवसूपवञ्चना|	heave thyself earth nor press thee downward heavily afford him easy access gently tending him.
माता पुत्रं यथा सिचाभ्येनं भूमूर्णुहि|	cover him as a mother wraps her skirt about her child o earth.
उच्छ्वञ्चमाना पर्थिवी सु तिष्ठतु सहस्रं मित उप हिश्रयन्ताम|	now let the heaving earth be free from motion yealet a thousand clods remain above him.
ते गर्हासो घर्तश्चुतो भवन्तु विश्वाहास्मैशरणाः सन्त्वत्र|	be they to him a home distilling fatness here let them ever be his place of refuge.
उत ते सतभ्नामि पर्थिवीं तवत परीमं लोगं निदधन मोहं रिषम|	i stay the earth from thee while over thee i place this piece of earth may i be free from injury.
एतां सथूणां पितरो धारयन्तु तेअत्रायमः सादना ते मिनोतु|	here let the fathers keep this pillar firm for thee and there let yama make thee an abidingplace.
परतीचीने मामहनीष्वाः पर्णमिवा दधुः|	even as an arrows feathers they have set me on a fitting day.
परतीचीं जग्रभा वाचमश्वं रशनया यथा|	the fit word have i caught and held as twere a courser with the rein.
चक्षुषः पिता मनसा हि धीरो घर्तमेने अजनन्नन्नमाने|	the father of the eye the wise in spirit created both these worlds submerged in fatness.
यदेदन्ता अदद्र्हन्त पूर्व आदिद्द्यावाप्र्थिवी अप्रथेताम|	then when the eastern ends were firmly fastened the heavens and the earth were far extended.
विश्वकर्मा विमना आद विहाया धाता विधाता परमोतसन्द्र्क|	mighty in mind and power is visvakarman maker disposer and most lofty presence.
तेषामिष्टानि समिषा मदन्ति यत्रासप्तर्षीन पर एकमाहुः|	their offerings joy in rich juice where they value one only one beyond the seven Ṛṣis.
यो नः पिता जनिता यो विधाता धामानि वेद भुवनानिविश्वा|	father who made us he who as disposer knoweth all races and all things existing.
यो देवानां नामधा एक एव तं सम्प्रश्नम्भुवना यन्त्यन्या|	even he alone the deities narnegiverhim other beings seek for information.
त आयजन्त दरविणं समस्मा रषयः पूर्वे जरितारो नभूना|	to him in sacrifice they offered treasuresṚṣis of old in numerous troops as singers.
असूर्ते सूर्ते रजसि निषत्ते ये भूतानिसमक्र्ण्वन्निमानि|	who in the distant near and lower region made ready all these things that have existence.
परो दिवा पर एना पर्थिव्या परो देवेभिरसुरैर्यदस्ति|	that which is earlier than this earth and heaven before the asuras and gods had being.
कं सविद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमपश्यन्त विश्वे|	what was the germ primeval which the waters received where all the gods were seen together.
तमिद गर्भं परथमं दध्र आपो यत्र देवाःसमगछन्त विश्वे|	the waters they received that germ primeval wherein the gods were gathefed all together.
अजस्य नाभावध्येकमर्पितंयस्मिन विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुः|	it rested set upon the unborns navel that one wherein abide all things existing.
न तं विदाथ य इमा जजानायद युष्माकमन्तरम्बभूव|	ye will not find him who produced these creatures another thing hath risen up among you.
नीहारेण पराव्र्ता जल्प्या चासुत्र्प उक्थशासश्चरन्ति|	enwrapt in misty cloud with lips that stammer hymnchanters wander and are discontented.
इदं त एकं पर ऊ त एकं तर्तीयेन जयोतिषा संविशस्व|	here is one light for thee another yonder enter the third and he therewith united.
संवेशने तन्वश्चारुरेधि परियो देवानाम्परमे जनित्रे|	uniting with a body be thou welcome dear to the gods in their sublimest birthplace.
तनूष टे वाजिन तन्वं नयन्ती वाममस्मभ्यं धातुशर्म तुभ्यम|	bearing thy body vajin may thy body afford us blessing and thyself protection.
अह्रुतो महो धरुणाय देवान दिवीवज्योतिः सवमा मिमीयाः|	unswerving stablish as it were in heaven thine own light as the mighty gods supporter.
वाज्यसि वाजिनेना सुवेनीः सुवित सतोमं सुवितो दिवंगाः|	strong steed art thou go to the yearning maidens with vigour happily go to heaven and praises.
सुवितो धर्म परथमानु सत्या सुवितो देवान सुवितोऽनु पत्म|	fly happily to the gods with easy passage according to the first and faithful statutes.
महिम्न एषां पितरश्चनेशिरे देवा देवेष्वदधुरपिक्रतुम|	part of their grandeur have the fathers also gained the gods have seated mental power in them as gods.
समविव्यचुरुत यान्यत्विषुरैषां तनूषु निविविशुः पुनः|	they have embraced within themselves all energies which issuing forth again into their bodies pass.
सहोभिर्विश्वं परि चक्रमू रजः पूर्वा धामान्यमितामिमानाः|	they strode through all the region with victorious might establishing the old immeasurable laws.
तनूषु विश्वा भुवना नि येमिरे परासारयन्तपुरुध परजा अनु|	they compassed in their bodies all existing things and streamed forth offipring in many successive forms.
दविधा सूनवोअसुरं सवर्विदमास्थापयन्त तर्तीयेनकर्मणा|	in two ways have the sons established in his place the asura who finds the light by the third act.
सवां परजां पितरः पित्र्यं सह आवरेष्वदधुस्तन्तुमाततम|	as fathers they have set their heritage on earth their offspring as a thread continuously spun out.
नावा न कषोदः परदिशः पर्थिव्याः सवस्तिभिरतिदुर्गाणि विश्वा|	as in a ship through billows so through regions of air with blessings through toils and troubles.
सवां परजां बर्हदुक्थो महित्वावरेष्वदधादा परेषु|	hath bṛhaduktha brought his seed with glory and placed it here and in the realms beyond us.
आ व रञ्जस ऊर्जां वयुष्टिष्विन्द्रं मरुतो रोदसीनक्तन|	i grasp at you when power and strength begin to dawn bedew ye indra and the maruts heaven and earth.
उभे यथा नो अहनी सचाभुवा सदःसदोवरिवस्यात उद्भिदा|	that day and night in every hall of sacrifice may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth.
तदु शरेष्ठं सवनं सुनोतनातयो न हस्तयतो अद्रिःसोतरि|	press the libation out most excellent of all the pressingstone is grasped like a handguided steed.
विदद धयर्यो अभिभूति पौंस्यं महो राये चित्तरुते यदर्वतः|	so let it win the valour that subdues the foe and the fleet coursers might that speeds to ample wealth.
तदिद धयस्य सवनं विवेरपो यथा पुरा मनवेगातुमश्रेत|	juice that this stone pours out removes defect of ours as in old time it brought prosperity to man.
गोर्णसि तवाष्ट्रे अश्वनिर्णिजि परेमध्वरेष्वध्वरानशिश्रयुः|	at sacrifices they established holy rites on tvaṣṭars milkblent juice bright with the hue of steeds.
अप हत रक्षसो भङगुरावत सकभायत निरतिंसेधतामतिम|	drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us keep nirrti afar and banish penury.
आ नो रयिं सर्ववीरं सुनोतन देवाव्यम्भरत शलोकमद्रयः|	pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons and bear ye up o stones the song that visits gods.
दिवश्चिदा वोअमवत्तरेभ्यो विभ्वना चिदाश्वपस्तरेभ्यः|	to you who are more mighty than the heavens themselves who finishing your task with more than vibhvans speed.
वायोश्चिद सोमरभस्तरेभ्योअग्नेश्चिदर्चपितुक्र्त्तरेभ्यः|	more rapidly than vāyu seize the soma juice better than agni give us food to you i sing.
भुरन्तु नो यशसः सोत्वन्धसो गरावाणो वाचा दिवितादिवित्मता|	stirred be the glorious stones let it press out the juice the stone with heavenly song that reaches up to heaven.
नरो यत्र दुहते काम्यं मध्वाघोषयन्तोभितो मिथस्तुरः|	there where the men draw forth the meath for which they long sending their voice around in rivalry of speed.
सुन्वन्ति सोमं रथिरासो अद्रयो निरस्य रसं गविषोदुहन्ति ते|	the stones press out the soma swift as carborne men and eager for the spoil drain forth the sap thereof.
दुहन्त्यूधरुपसेचनाय कं नरो हव्य नामर्जयन्त आसभिः|	to fill the beaker they exhaust the udders store as the men purify oblations with their lips.
एते नरः सवपसो अभूतन य इन्द्राय सुनुथ सोममद्रयः|	ye present men have been most skilful in your work even ye o stones who pressed soma for indras drink.
वामंवामं वो दिव्याय धाम्ने वसुवसु वः पार्थिवयसुन्वते|	may all ye have of fair go to the heavenly race and all your treasure to the earthly worshipper.
इन्द्र पिब परतिकामं सुतस्य परातःसावस्तव हिपूर्वपीतिः|	drink of the juice o indra at thy plea sure for thy first draught is early morns libation.
हर्षस्व हन्तवे शूर शत्रूनुक्थेभिष टेवीर्या पर बरवाम|	rejoice that thou mayst slay our foes o hero and we with lauds will tell thy mighty exploits.
यस्ते रथो मनसो जवीयानेन्द्र तेन सोमपेयाय याहि|	thou hast a car more swift than thought o indra thercon come hither come to drink the soma.
तूयमा ते हरयः पर दरवन्तु येभिर्यासि वर्षभिर्मन्दमानः|	let thy bay steeds thy stallions hasten hither with whom thou cornest nigh and art delighted.
हरित्वता वर्चसा सूर्यस्य शरेष्ठै रूपैस्तन्वंस्पर्शयस्व|	deck out thy body with the fairest colours with golden splendour of the sun adorn it.
अस्माभिरिन्द्र सखिभिर्हुवानः सध्रीचीनोमादयस्वा निषद्य|	o indra turn thee hitherward invited by us thy friends be seated and be joyful.
यस्य तयत ते महिमानं मदेष्विमे मही रोदसीनाविविक्ताम|	o thou whose grandeur in thy festive transports not even these two great worlds have comprehended.
तदोक आ हरिभिरिन्द्र युक्तैः परियेभिर्याहि परियमन्नमछ|	come indra with thy dear bay horses harnessed come to our dwelling and the food thou lovest.
यस्य शश्वत पपिवानिन्द्र शत्रूननानुक्र्त्या रण्याचकर्थ|	pressed for thy joyous banquet is the soma soma whereof thou indra ever drinking.
स ते पुरन्धिं तविषीमियर्ति स ते मदायसुत इन्द्र सोमः|	hast waged unequalled battles with thy foemen which prompts the mighty flow of thine abundance.
इदं ते पात्रं सनवित्तमिन्द्र पिबा सोममेना शतक्रतो|	found from of old is this thy cup o indra Śatakratu drink therefrom the soma.
पूर्ण आहावो मदिरस्य मध्वो यं विश्व इदभिहर्यन्तिदेवाः|	filled is the beaker with the meath that gladdens the beaker which all deities delight in.
वि हि तवामिन्द्र पुरुधा जनासो हितप्रयसो वर्षभह्वयन्ते|	from many a side with proffered entertainment the folk are calling thee o mighty indra.
अस्माकं ते मधुमत्तमानीमा भुवन सवना तेषुहर्य|	these our libations shall for thee be richest in sweet meath dvink thereof and find them pleasant.
पर त इन्द्र पूर्व्याणि पर नूनं वीर्या वोचं परथमाक्र्तानि|	i will declare thy deeds of old o indra the mighty acts which thou hast first accomplished.
सतीनमन्युरश्रथायो अद्रिं सुवेदनामक्र्णोर्ब्रह्मणे गाम|	in genuine wrath thou loosenedst the mountain so that the brahman easily found the cattle.
नि षु सीद गणपते गणेषु तवामाहुर्विप्रतमंकवीनाम|	lord of the hosts amid our bands be seated they call thee greatest sage among the sages.
न रते तवत करियते किं चनारे महामर्कंमघवञ्चित्रमर्च|	nothing is done even far away without thee great wondrous maghavan is the hymn i sing thee.
अभिख्या नो मघवन नाधमानान सखे बोधि वसुपतेसखीनाम|	aim of our eyes be thou for we implore thee o maghavan friend of friends and lord of treasures.
रणं कर्धि रणक्र्त सत्यशुष्माभक्ते चिदाभजा राये अस्मान|	fight warrior strong in truth fight thou the battle give us our share of undivided riches.
शास इत्था महानस्यमित्रखादो अद्भुतः|	a mighty governor art thou wondrous destroyer of the foe.
न यस्यहन्यते सखा न जीयते कदा चन|	whose friend is never done to death and never never overcome.
सवस्तिद विशस पतिर्व्र्त्रहा विम्र्धो वशी|	lord of the clan who brings us bliss strong warrior slayer of the fiend.
वर्षेन्द्रःपुर एतु नः सोमप अभयंकरः|	may india somadrinker go before us bull who gives us peace.
वि रक्षो वि मर्धो जहि वि वर्त्रस्य हनू रुज|	drive rākṣasas and foes away break thou in pieces vṛtrasjaws.
वि मन्युमिन्द्र वर्त्रहन्नमित्रस्याभिदसतः|	o vṛtraslaying indra quell the foemans wrath who threatens us.
वि न इन्द्र मर्धो जहि नीचा यछ पर्तन्यतः|	o indra beat our foes away humble the men who challenge us.
यो अस्मानभिदासत्यधरं गमया तमः|	send down to nether darkness him who seeks to do us injury.
अपेन्द्र दविषतो मनोअप जिज्यासतो वधम|	baffle the foemans plan ward off his weapon who would conquer us.
वि मन्योःशर्म यछ वरीयो यवया वधम|	give shelter from his furious wrath and keep his murdering dart afar.
सं जाग्र्वद्भिर्जरमाण इध्यते दमे दमूना इषयन्निळस पदे|	brisk at the place of iḷā hymned by men who wake our own familiar friend is kindled in the house.
विश्वस्य होता हविषो वरेण्यो विभुर्विभावासुषखा सखीयते|	hotar of all oblation worthy of our choice lord beaming trusty friend to one who loveth him.
स दर्शतश्रीरतिथिर्ग्र्हेगर्हे वनेवने शिश्रियेतक्ववीरिव|	he excellent in glory guest in every house finds like a swiftwinged bird a home in every tree.
जनंजनं जन्यो नाति मन्यते विश आक्षेति विश्यो विशं विशम|	benevolent to men he scorns no living man friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe.
सुदक्षो दक्षैः करतुनासि सुक्रतुरग्ने कविः काव्येनासिविश्ववित|	most sage with insight passing skilful with thy powers art thou o agni wise with wisdom knowing all.
वसुर्वसूनां कषयसि तवमेक इद दयावा चयानि पर्थिवी च पुष्यतः|	as vasu thou alone art lord of all good things of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce.
परजानन्नग्ने तव योनिं रत्वियमिळायास पदे घर्तवन्तमासदः|	foreknowing well o agni thou in iḷās place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil.
आ ते चिकित्र उषसामिवेतयोअरेपसः सूर्यस्येवरश्मयः|	marked are thy comings like the comings of the dawns the rays of him who shineth spotless as the sun.
तव शरियो वर्ष्यस्येव विद्युतश्चित्राश्चिकित्र उषसांन केतवः|	thy glories are as lightnings from the rainy cloud marked manyhued like heralds of the dawns approach.
यदोषधीरभिस्र्ष्टो वनानि च परिस्वयं चिनुषे अन्नमास्ये|	when loosed to wander over plants and forest trees thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth.
तमोषधीर्दधिरे गर्भं रत्वियं तमापो अग्निंजनयन्त मातरः|	him duly coming as their germ have plants received this agni have maternal waters brought to life.
तमित समानं वनिनश्च वीरुधोऽनतर्वतीश्च सुवते च विश्वहा|	so in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore.
वातोपधूत इषितो वशाननु तर्षु यदन्ना वेविषद्वितिष्ठसे|	when sped and urged by wind thou spreadest thee abroad swift piercing through thy food according to thy will.
आ ते यतन्ते रथ्यो यथा पर्थक छर्धांस्यग्ने अजराणि धक्षतः|	thy neverceasing blazes longing to consume like men on chariots agni strive on every side.
मेधाकारं विदथस्य परसाधनमग्निं होतारम्परिभूतमं मतिम|	agni the hotarpriest who fills the assembly full waker of knowledge chief controller of the thought.
तमिदर्भे हविष्या समानमित्तमिन महे वर्णते नान्यं तवत|	him yea none other than thyself doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike.
तवामिदत्र वर्णते तवायवो होतारमग्ने विदथेषुवेधसः|	here agni the arrangers those attached to thee elect thee as their priest in sacred gatherings.
यद देवयन्तो दधति परयाण्सि ते हविष्मन्तोमनवो वर्क्तबर्हिषः|	when men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment piously inclined.
तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रं रत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं तवमग्निद रतायतः|	thine is the heralds task and cleansers duly timed leader art thou and kindler for the pious man.
तव परशास्त्रं तवमध्वरीयसि बरह्माचासि गर्हपतिश्च नो दमे|	thou art director thou the ministering priest thou art the brahman lord and master in our home.
यस्तुभ्यमग्ने अम्र्ताय मर्त्यः समिधा दाशदुत वाहविष्क्र्ति|	when mortal man presents to thee immortal god agni his fuel or his sacrificial gift.
तस्य होता भवसि यासि दूत्यमुप बरूषेयजस्यध्वरीयसि|	then thou art his adhvaryu hotar messenger callest the gods and orderest the sacrifice.
इमा अस्मै मतयो वाचो अस्मदान रचो गिरः सुष्टुतयःसमग्मत|	from us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him these holy words these Ṛcas songs and eulogies.
वसूयवो वसवे जातवेदसे वर्द्धासु चिद वर्धनोयासु चाकनत|	eager for wealth to jātavedas fain for wealth when they have waxen strong they please their strengthener.
इमां परत्नाय सुष्टुतिं नवीयसीं वोचेयमस्मा उशतेश्र्णोतु नः|	this newest eulogy will i speak forth to him the ancient one who loves it may he hear our voice.
भूया अन्तरा हर्द्यस्य निस्प्र्शे जायेवपत्य उशती सुवासाः|	may it come near his heart and make it stir with love as a fond welldressed matron clings about her lord.
यस्मिन्नश्वास रषभास उक्षणो वशा मेषावस्र्ष्टास आहुताः|	he in whom horses bulls oxen and barren cows and rams when duly set apart are offered up.
कीलालपे सोमप्र्ष्ठाय वेधसेह्र्दा मतिं जनये चारुमग्नये|	to agni somasprinkled drinker of sweet juice disposer with my heart i bring a fair hymn forth.
अहाव्यग्ने हविरास्ये ते सरुचीव घर्तं चम्वीव सोमः|	into thy mouth is poured the offering agni as soma into cup oil into ladle.
वाजसनिं रयिमस्मे सुवीरं परशस्तं धेहि यशसम्ब्र्हन्तम|	vouchsafe us wealth strengthwinning blest with heroes wealth lofty praised by men and full of splendour.
विभ्राड बर्हत पिबतु सोम्यं मध्वायुर्दधद यज्ञपतावविह्रुतम|	may the bright god drink glorious somamingled meath giving the sacrifices lord uninjured life.
वातजूतो यो अभिरक्षति तमना परजाः पुपोषपुरुधा वि राजति|	he who windurged in person guards our offspring well hath nourished them with food and shines oer many a land.
विभ्राड बर्हत सुभ्र्तं वाजसातमं धर्मन दिवो धरुणेसत्यमर्पितम|	radiant as high truth cherished best at winning strength truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens.
अमित्रहा वर्त्रहा दस्युहन्तमं जयोतिर्जज्ञेसुरहा सपत्नहा|	he rose a light that kills vṛtras and enemies best slayer of the dasyus asuras and foes.
इदं शरेष्ठं जयोतिषां जयोतिरुत्तमं विश्वजिद्धनजिदुच्यते बर्हत|	this light the best of lights supreme allconquering winner of riches is exalted with high laud.
विश्वभ्राड भराजो महि सूर्यो दर्शौरु पप्रथे सह ओजो अच्युतम|	alllighting radiant mighty as the sun to see he spreadeth wide unfailing victory and strength.
विभ्राजञ जयोतिषा सवरगछो रोचनं दिवः|	beaming forth splendour with thy light thou hast attained heavens lustrous realm.
येनेमाविश्वा भुवनान्याभ्र्ता विश्वकर्मणा विश्वदेव्यावता|	by thee were brought together all existing things possessor of all godhead alleffecting god.
मयोभूर्वातो अभि वातूस्रा ऊर्जस्वतीरोषधीरारिशन्ताम|	may the wind blow upon our cows with healing may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices.
पीवस्वतीर्जीवधन्याः पिबन्त्ववसाय पद्वतेरुद्र मर्ळ|	may they drink waters rich in life and fatness to food that moves on feet be gracious rudra.
याः सरूपा विरूपा एकरूपा यासामग्निरिष्ट्यानामानि वेद|	likecoloured varioushued or singlecoloured whose names through sacrifice are known to agni.
या अङगिरसस्तपसेह चक्रुस्ताभ्यःपर्जन्य महि शर्म यछ|	whom the aṅgirases produced by fervourvouchsafe to these parjanya great protection.
या देवेषु तन्वमैरयन्त यासां सोमो विश्वा रूपाणिवेद|	those who have offered to the gods their bodies whose varied forms are all well known to soma.
ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः परजावतीरिन्द्रगोष्ठे रिरीहि|	those grant us in our cattlepen o indra with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring.
परजापतिर्मह्यमेता रराणो विश्वैर्देवैः पित्र्भिःसंविदानः|	prajāpati bestowing these upon me oneminded with all gods and with the fathers.
शिवाः सतीरुप नो गोष्ठमाकस्तासांवयं परजया सं सदेम|	hath to our cowpen brought auspicious cattle so may we own the offspring they will bear us.
अग्ने अछा वदेह नः परत्यं नः सुमना भव|	turn hither agni speak to us come to us with a gracious mind.
पर नोयछ विशस पते धनदा असि नस्त्वम|	enrich us master of the house thou art the giver of our wealth.
पर नो यछत्वर्यमा पर भगः पर बर्हस्पतिः|	let aryarnan vouchsafe us wealth and bhaga and bṛhaspati.
परदेवाः परोत सून्र्ता रायो देवी ददातु नः|	let the gods give their gifts and let sūnṛtā goddess grant us wealth.
सोमं राजानमवसेअग्निं गीर्भिर्हवामहे|	we call king soma to our aid and agni with our songs and hymns.
आदित्यान्विष्णुं सूर्यं बरह्माणं च बर्हस्पतिम|	Ādityas viṣṇu sūrya and the brahman priest bṛhaspati.
इन्द्रवायू बर्हस्पतिं सुहवेह हवामहे|	indra vāyu bṛhaspati gods swift to listen we invoke.
यथा नः सर्वैज्जनः संगत्यां सुमना असत|	that in the synod all the folk may be benevolent to us.
अर्यमणं बर्हस्पतिमिन्द्रं दानाय चोदय|	urge aryaman to send us gifts and indra and bṛhaspati.
वातंविष्णुं सरस्वतीं सवितारं च वाजिनम|	vāta viṣṇu sarasvatī and the strong courser savitar.
तवं नो अग्ने अग्निभिर्ब्रह्म यज्ञं च वर्धय|	do thou o agni with thy fires strengthen our prayer and sacrifice.
तवं नोदेवतातये रायो दानाय चोदय|	urge givers to bestow their wealth to aid our service of the gods.
तव तय इन्द्र सख्येषु वह्नय रतं मन्वाना वयदर्दिरुर्वलम|	allied with thee in friendship indra these thy priests remembering holy law rent vṛtra limb from limb.
यत्रा दशस्यन्नुषसो रिणन्नपः कुत्सायमन्मन्नह्यश्च दंसयः|	when they bestowed the dawns and let the waters flow and when thou didst chastise dragons at kutsas call.
अवास्र्जः परस्वः शवञ्चयो गिरिनुदाज उस्रा अपिबोमधु परियम|	thou sentest forth productive powers clavest the hills thou dravest forth the kine thou drankest pleasant meath.
अवर्धयो वनिनो अस्य दंससा शुशोचसूर्य रतजातया गिरा|	thou gavest increase through this trees surpassing might the sun shone by the hymn that sprang from holy law.
वि सूर्यो मध्ये अमुचद रथं दिवो विदद दासय परतिमानमार्यः|	in the midway of heaven the sun unyoked his car the Ārya found a match to meet his dam foe.
दर्ळानि पिप्रोरसुरस्य मायिन इन्द्रो वयास्यच्चक्र्वान रजिश्वना|	associate with Ṛjiśvan indra overthrew the solid forts of pipru conjuring asura.
अनाध्र्ष्टानि धर्षितो वयास्यन निधीन्रदेवानम्र्णदयास्यः|	he boldly cast down forts which none had eer assailed unwearied he destroycd the godless treasurestores.
मासेव सूर्यो वसु पुर्यमा ददे गर्णानःशत्रून्रश्र्णाद विरुक्मता|	like sun and moon he took the strongholds wealth away and praised in song demolished foes with flashing dart.
अयुद्धसेनो विभ्वा विभिन्दता दाशद वर्त्रहा तुज्यानि तेजते|	armed with resistless weapons with vast power to cleave the vṛtraslayer whets his darts and deals fordi wounds.
इन्द्रस्य वज्रादबिभेदभिश्नथः पराक्रामच्छुन्ध्युरजहदुष अनः|	bright uṣas was afraid of indras slaughtering bolt she went upon her way and left her chariot there.
एता तया ते शरुत्यानि केवला यदेक एकमक्र्णोरयज्ञम|	these are thy famous exploits only thine when thou alone hast left the other reft of sacrifice.
मासां विधानमदधा अधि दयवि तवया विभिन्नम्भरति परधिं पिता|	thou in the heavens hast set the ordering of the moons the father bears the felly portioned out by thee.
विश्वो हयन्यो अरिराजगाम ममेदह शवशुरो न जगाम|	now all my other friends are here assembled my sireinlaw alone hath not come hither.
जक्षीयाद धना उत सोमं पपीयात सवाशितः पुनरस्तं जगायात|	so might he eat the grain and drink the soma and satisfied return unto his dwelling.
स रोरुवद वर्षभस्तिग्मश्र्न्गो वर्ष्मन तस्थाु वरिमन्नाप्र्थिव्याः|	loud belloweth the bull whose horns are sharpened upon the height above earths breadth he standeth.
विश्वेष्वेनं वर्जनेषु पामि यो मे कुक्षिसुतसोमः पर्णाति|	that man i guard and save in all his troubles who fills my flanks when he hath shed the soma.
अद्रिणा ते मन्दिन इन्द्र तूयान सुन्वन्ति सोमान पिबसि तवमेशाम|	men with the stone press out for thee o indra strong gladdening soma and thereof thou drinkest.
पचन्ति ते वर्षभानत्सि तेषां पर्क्षेण यन्मघवन हूयमानः|	bulls they dress for thee and of these thou eatest when maghavan with food thou art invited.
इदं सु मे जरितरा चिकिद्धि परतीपं शापं नद्योवहन्ति|	resolve for me o singer this my riddle the rivers send their swelling water backward.
लोपाशः सिंहं परत्यञ्चमत्साः करोष्टावराहं निरतक्त कक्षात|	the fox steals up to the approaching lion the jackal drives the wildboar from the brushwood.
कथ त एतदहमा चिकेतं गर्त्सस्य पाकस्तवसोमनीषाम|	how shall i solve this riddle i the simple declare the thought of thee the wise and mighty.
तवं नो विद्वान रतुथा वि वोचो यमर्धं तेमघवन कषेम्या धूः|	tell us well knowing as befits the season whitherward is thy prosperous car advancing.
एवा हि मां तवसं वर्धयन्ति दिवश्चिन मे बर्हतौत्तरा धुः|	thus do they magnify me me the mighty higher than even high heaven is my carpole.
पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि साकमशत्रुंहि म जनिता जजान|	i all at once demolish many thousands my sire begot me with no foe to match me.
एवा हि मां तवसं जज्ञुरुग्रं कर्मनकर्मन वर्षणमिन्द्र देवाः|	yea and the gods have known me also indra as mighty fierce and strong in every exploit.
वधीं वर्त्रं वज्रेण मन्दसनोअप वरजम्महिना दाशुषे वम|	exulting with the bolt i slaughtered vṛtra and for the offerer oped with might the cowstall.
देवास आयन परशून्रबिभ्रन वना वर्श्चन्तो अभि विड्भिरायन|	the deities approached they carried axes splitting the wood they came with their attendants.
नि सुद्र्वं दधतो वक्षणासु यत्रा कर्पीटमनुतद दहन्ति|	they laid good timber in the firereceivers and burnt the grass up where they found it growing.
शशः कषुरं परत्यञ्चं जगाराद्रिं लोगेन वयभेदमारात|	the hare hath swallowed up the opposing razor i sundered with a clod the distant mountain.
बर्हन्तं चिद रहते रन्धयानि वयद वत्सो वर्षभंशूशुवानः|	the great will i make subject to the little the calf shall wax in strength and cat the bullock.
सुपर्ण इत्था नखमा सिषायावरुद्धः परिपदं नसिंहः|	there hath the strongwinged eagle left his talon as a snared lion leaves the trap that caught him.
निरुद्धश्चिन महिषस्तर्ष्यावान गोधा तस्मायथं कर्षदेतत|	even the wild steer in his thirst is captured the leather strap still holds his foot entangled.
तेभ्यो गोधा अयथं कर्षदेतद ये बरह्मणः परतिपियन्त्यन्नैः|	so may the leather strap their foot entangle who fatten on the viands of the brahman.
सिम उक्ष्णोअवस्र्ष्टानदन्ति सवयं बलानितन्वः शर्णानाः|	they all devour the bulls set free to wander while they themselves destroy their bodies vigour.
एते शमीभिः सुशमी अभूवन ये हिन्विरे तन्वः सोमौक्थैः|	they were well occupied with holy duties who sped in person with their lauds to soma.
नर्वद वदन्नुप नो माहि वाजान दिवि शरवोदधिषे नाम वीरः|	speaking like man mete to us wealth and booty in heaven thou hast the name and fame of hero.
पर मा युयुज्रे परयुजो जनानां वहामि सम पुषणमन्तरेण|	the urgings of the people have impelled me and bythe nearest way i bring you pūṣan.
विश्वे देवासो अध मामरक्षन दुःशासुरागादिति घोष आसीत|	the universal gods have brought me safely the cry was heard behold dubsasu cometh.
सं मा तपन्त्यभितः सपत्नीरिव पर्शवः|	the ribs that compass me give pain and trouble me like rival wives.
नि बाधतेमतिर्नग्नता जसुर्वेर्न वेवीयते मतिः|	indigence nakedness exhaustion press me sore my mind is fluttering like a birds.
मूषो न शिश्ना वयदन्ति माध्य सतोतारं ते शतक्रतो|	as rats eat weavers threads cares are consuming me thy singer gatakratu me.
सक्र्त सु नो मघवन्निन्द्र मर्ळयाधा पितेव नो भव|	have mercy on us once o indra bounteous lord be thou a father unto us.
कुरुश्रवणमाव्र्णि राजानं तरासदस्यवम|	i the priests Ṛṣi chose as prince most liberal kurusravana.
मंहिष्ठंवाघतां रषिः|	the son of trasadasyus son.
यस्य मा हरितो रथे तिस्रो वहन्ति साधुया|	whose three bays harnessed to the car bear me straight onward i will laud.
सतवैसहस्रदक्षिणे|	the giver of a thousand meeds.
यस्य परस्वादसो गिर उपमश्रवसः पितुः|	the sire of upamasravas even him whose words were passing sweet.
कषेत्रं नरण्वमूचुषे|	as a fair field is to its lord.
अधि पुत्रोपमश्रवो नपान मित्रातिथेरिहि|	mark upamasravas his son mark grandson of mitratithi.
पितुष टे अस्मिवन्दिता|	i am thy fathers eulogist.
यदीशीयाम्र्तानामुत वा मर्त्यानाम|	if i controlled immortal gods yea even were i lord of men.
जीवेदिन्मघवा मम|	my liberal prince were living still.
न देवानामति वरतं शतात्मा चन जीवति|	none lives even had he hundred lives beyond the statute of the gods.
तथायुजा वि वाव्र्ते|	so am i parted from my friend.
ईङखयन्तीरपस्युव इन्द्रं जातमुपासते|	swaying about the active ones came nigh to indra at his birth.
भेजानसःसुवीर्यम|	and shared his great heroic might.
तवमिन्द्र बलादधि सहसो जात ओजसः|	based upon strength and victory and power o indra is thy birth.
तवं वर्षन्व्र्षेदसि|	thou mighty one art strong indeed.
तवमिन्द्रासि वर्त्रहा वयन्तरिक्षमतिरः|	thou art the vṛtraslayer thou indra hast spread the firmament.
उद दयामस्तभ्ना ओजसा|	thou hast with might upheld the heavens.
तवमिन्द्र सजोषसमर्कं बिभर्षि बाह्वोः|	thou indra bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee.
वज्रंशिशान ओजसा|	whetting thy thunderbolt with might.
तवमिन्द्राभिभूरसि विश्वा जातान्योजसा|	thou indra art preeminent over all creatures in thy might.
स विश्वाभुव आभवः|	thou hast pervaded every place.
परैते वदन्तु पर वयं वदाम गरावभ्यो वाचं वदतावदद्भ्यः|	let these speak loudly forth let us speak out aloud to the loud speaking pressingstones address the speech.
यदद्रयः पर्वताः साकमाशवः शलोकंघोषं भरथेन्द्राय सोमिनः|	when rich with soma juice stones of the mountain ye united swift to indra bring the sound of praise.
एते वदन्ति शतवत सहस्रवदभि करन्दन्ति हरितेभिरासभिः|	they speak out like a hundred like a thousand men they cry aloud to us with their greentinted mouths.
विष्ट्वी गरावाणः सुक्र्तः सुक्र्त्यया होतुश्चित पूर्वे हविरद्यमाशत|	while pious stones they ply their task with piety and even before the hotar taste the offered food.
एते वदन्त्यविदन्नना मधु नयूङखयन्ते अधि पक्वामिषि|	loudly they speak for they have found the savoury meath they make a humming sound over the meat prepared.
वर्क्षस्य शाखामरुणस्य बप्सतस्ते सूभर्वाव्र्षभाः परेमराविषुः|	as they devour the branch of the redcoloured tree these the wellpastured bulls have uttered bellowings.
बर्हद वदन्ति मदिरेण मन्दिनेन्द्रं करोशन्तोअविदन्ननामधु|	they cry aloud with strong exhilarating drink calling on indra now for they have found the meath.
संरभ्या धीराः सवस्र्भिरनर्तिषुराघोषयन्तः पर्थिवीमुपब्दिभिः|	bold with the sisters they have danced embraced by them making the earth reecho with their ringing sound.
सुपर्णा वाचमक्रतोप दयव्याखरे कर्ष्णा इषिरानर्तिषुः|	the eagles have sent forth their cry aloft in heaven in the skys vault the dark impetuous ones have danced.
नयं नि यन्त्युपरस्य निष्क्र्तं पुरू रेतोदधिरे सूर्यश्वितः|	then downward to the nether stones fixt place they sink and splendid as the sun effuse their copious stream.
उग्रा इव परवहन्तः समायमुः साकं युक्ता वर्षणोबिभ्रतो धुरः|	like strong ones drawing they have put forth all their strength the bulls harnessed together bear the chariotpoles.
यच्छ्वसन्तो जग्रसाना अराविषुःश्र्ण्व एषां परोथथो अर्वतामिव|	when they have bellowed panting swallowing their food the sound of their loud snorting is like that of steeds.
दशावनिभ्यो दशकक्ष्येभ्यो दशयोक्त्रेभ्यो दशयोजनेभ्यः|	to these who have ten workers and a tenfold girth to these who have ten yokestraps and ten binding thongs.
दशाभीशुभ्यो अर्चताजरेभ्यो दश धुरो दश युक्तावहद्भ्यः|	to these who bear ten reins the eternal sing ye praise to these who bear ten carpoles ten when they are yoked.
ते अद्रयो दशयन्त्रास आशवस्तेषामाधानं पर्येतिहर्यतम|	these stones with ten conductors rapid in their course with lovely revolution travel round and round.
त ऊ सुतस्य सोम्यस्यान्धसोअंशोः पीयूषम्प्रथमस्य भेजिरे|	they have been first to drink the flowing soma juice first to enjoy the milky fluid of the stalk.
ते सोमादो हरी इन्द्रस्य निंसतेअंशुं दुहन्तो अध्यासतेगवि|	these somaeaters kiss indras baycoloured steeds draining the stalk they sit upon the oxs hide.
तेभिर्दुग्धं पपिवान सोम्यं मध्विन्द्रो वर्धतेप्रथते वर्षायते|	indra when he hath drunk somameath drawn by them waxes in strength is famed is mighty as a bull.
वर्षा वो अंशुर्न किला रिषाथनेलावन्तः सदमित्स्थनाशिताः|	strong is your stalk ye verily never shall be harmed ye have refreshment ye are ever satisfied.
रैवत्येव महसा चारव सथन यस्यग्रावाणो अजुषध्वमध्वरम|	fair are ye as it were through splendour of his wealth his in whose sacrifice o stones ye find delight.
तर्दिला अत्र्दिलासो अद्रयोअश्रमणा अश्र्थिता अम्र्त्यवः|	bored deep but not pierced through with holes are ye o stones not loosened never weary and exempt from death.
अनातुरा अजरा सथामविष्णवः सुपीवसो अत्र्षितात्र्ष्णजः|	eternal undiseased moving in sundry ways unthirsting full of fatness void of all desire.
