धरुवा एव वः पितरो युगेयुगे कषेमकामासः सदसो नयुञ्जते|	your fathers verily stand firm from age to age they loving rest are not dissevered from their seat.
अजुर्यासो हरिषाचो हरिद्रव आ दयां रवेणप्र्थिवीमशुश्रवुः|	untouched by time neer lacking green plants and green trees they with their voice have caused the heavens and earth to hear.
तदिद वदन्त्यद्रयो विमोचने यामन्नञ्जस्पा इव घेदुपब्दिभिः|	this this the stones proclaim what time they are disjoined and when with ringing sounds they move and drink the balm.
वपन्तो बीजमिव धान्याक्र्तः पर्ञ्चन्तिसोमं न मिनन्ति बप्सतः|	like tillers of the ground when they are sowing seed they mix the soma nor devouring minish it.
सुते अध्वरे अधि वाचमक्रता करीळयो न मातरन्तुदन्तः|	they have raised high their voice for juice for sacrifice striking the mother earth as though they danced thereon.
वि षू मुञ्चा सुषुवुषो मनीषां वि वर्तन्तामद्रयश्चायमानाः|	so loose thou too his thought who hath effused the sap and let the stones which we are honouring be disjoined.
अग्ने तव शरवो वयो महि भराजन्ते अर्चयो विभावसो|	agni lifepower and fame are thine thy fires blaze mightily thou rich in wealth of beams.
बर्हद्भानो शवसा वाजमुक्थ्यं दधासि दाशुषे कवे|	sage passing bright thou givest to the worshipper with strength the food that merits laud.
पावकवर्चाः शुक्रवर्चा अनूनवर्चा उदियर्षि भानुना|	with brilliant purifying sheen with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light.
पुत्रो मातरा विचरन्नुपावसि पर्णक्षि रोदसी उभे|	thou visiting both thy mothers aidest them as son thou joinest close the earth and heaven.
ऊर्जो नपाज्जातवेदः सुशस्तिभिर्मन्दस्व धीतिभिर्हितः|	o jātavedas son of strength rejoice ihyself gracious in our fair hymns and songs.
तवे इषः सं दधुर्भूरिवर्पसश्चित्रोतयो वामजाताः|	in thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food born nobly and of wondrous help.
इरज्यन्नग्ने परथयस्व जन्तुभिरस्मे रायो अमर्त्य|	agni spread forth as ruler over living things give wealth to us immortal god.
सदर्शतस्य वपुषो वि राजसि पर्णक्षि सानसिं करतुम|	thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon thou leadest us to conquering power.
इष्कर्तारमध्वरस्य परचेतसं कषयन्तं राधसो महः|	to him the wise who orders sacrifice who hath great riches un der his control.
रातिं वामस्य सुभगां महीमिषं दधासि सानसिंरयिम|	thou givest blest award of good and plenteous food givest him wealth that conquers all.
रतावानं महिषं विश्वदर्शतमग्निं सुम्नाय दधिरेपुरो जनाः|	the men have set before them them for their welfare agni strong visible to all the holy.
शरुत्कर्णं सप्रथस्तमं तवा गिरा दैव्यम्मानुषा युगा|	thee godlike one with ears to hear most famous mens generations magnify with praisesongs.
तयमू षु वाजिनं देवजूतं सहावानं तरुतारंरथानाम|	this very mighty one whom gods commission the conqueror of cars ever triumphant.
अरिष्टनेमिं पर्तनाजमाशुं सवस्तयेतार्क्ष्यमिहा हुवेम|	swift fleet to battle with uninjured fellies even tārkṣya for our weal will we call hither.
इन्द्रस्येव रातिमाजोहुवानाः सवस्तये नावमिवा रुहेम|	as though we offered up our gifts to indra may we ascend him as a ship for safety.
उर्वी न पर्थ्वी बहुले गभीरे मा वामेतौ मा परेतौरिषाम|	like the two wide worlds broad deep farextended may we be safe both when he comes and leaves you.
सद्यश्चिद यः शवसा पञ्च कर्ष्टीः सूर्य इवज्योतिषापस्ततान|	he who with might the five lands hath pervaded like sūrya with his lustre and the waters.
सहस्रसाः शतसा अस्य रंहिर्नस्मा वरन्ते युवतिं न शर्याम|	his strength wins hundreds thousands none avert it as the young maid repelleth not her lover.
देवाः कपोत इषितो यदिछन दूतो निरतया इदमाजगाम|	gods whatsoeer the dove came hither seeking sent to us as the envoy of destruction.
तस्मा अर्चाम कर्णवाम निष्क्र्तिं शं नो अस्तु दविपदेशं चतुष्पदे|	for that let us sing hymns and make atonement well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds.
शिवः कपोत इषितो नो अस्त्वनागा देवाः शकुनो गर्हेषु|	auspicious be the dove that hath been sent us a harmless bird ye gods within our dwelling.
अग्निर्हि विप्रो जुषतां हविर्नः परि हेतिः पक्षिणी नोव्र्णक्तु|	may agni sage be pleased with our oblation and may the missile borne on wings avoid us.
हेतिः पक्षिणी न दभात्यस्मानाष्ट्र्यां पदं कर्णुतेग्निधाने|	let not the arrow that hath wings distract us beside the fireplace on the hearth it settles.
शं नो गोभ्यश्च पुरुषेभ्यश्चास्तु मा नोहिंसीदिह देवाः कपोतः|	may it bring welfare to our men and cattle here let the dove ye gods forbear to harm us.
यदुलूको वदति मोघमेतद यत कपोतः पदमग्नौक्र्णोति|	the screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the dove hath settled.
यस्य दूतः परहित एष एतत तस्मै यमाय नमोस्तु मरित्यवे|	to him who sent it hither as an envoy to him be reverence paid to death to yama.
रचा कपोतं नुदत परणोदमिषं मदन्तः परि गांनयध्वम|	drive forth the dove chase it with holy verses rejoicing bring ye hither food and cattle.
संयोपयन्तो दुरितानि विश्वा हित्वा न ऊर्जं परपतात पतिष्थः|	barring the way against all grief and trouble let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour.
पर ते महे विदथे शंसिषं हरी पर ते वन्वे वनुषोहर्यतं मदम|	in the great synod will i laud thy two bay steeds i prize the sweet strong drink of thee the warriorgod.
घर्तं न यो हरिभिश्चारु सेचत आ तवाविशन्तु हरिवर्पसं गिरः|	his who pours lovely oil as twere with yellow drops let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.
हरिं हि योनिमभि ये समस्वरन हिन्वन्तो हरी दिव्यंयथा सदः|	ye who in concert sing unto the goldhued place like bay steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat.
आ यं पर्णन्ति हरिभिर्न धेनव इन्द्रायशूषं हरिवन्तमर्चत|	for indra laud ye strength allied with tawny steeds laud him whom cows content as twere with yellow drops.
सो अस्य वज्रो हरितो य आयसो हरिर्निकामो हरिरागभस्त्योः|	his is that thunderbolt of iron goldenhued goldcoloured very dear and yellow in his arms.
दयुम्नी सुशिप्रो हरिमन्युसायक इन्द्रे नि रूपाहरिता मिमिक्षिरे|	bright with strong teeth destroying with its tawny rage in indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.
दिवि न केतुरधि धायि हर्यतो विव्यचद वज्रो हरितो नरंह्या|	as if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky the golden thunderbolt spread out as in a race.
तुददहिं हरिशिप्रो य आयसः सहस्रशोकाभवद धरिम्भरः|	that iron bolt with yellow jaw smote ahi down a thousand flames had he who bore the tawnyhued.
तवंतवमहर्यथा उपस्तुतः पूर्वेभिरिन्द्र हरिकेशयज्वभिः|	thou thou when praised by men who sacrificed of old hadst pleasure in their lauds o indra goldenhaired.
तवं हर्यसि तव विश्वमुक्थ्यमसामि राधोहरिजात हर्यतम|	all that befits thy song of praise thou welcornest the perfect pleasant gift o goldenhued from birth.
ता वज्रिणं मन्दिनं सतोम्यं मद इन्द्रं रथे वहतोहर्यता हरी|	these two dear bays bring hither indra on his car thunderarmed joyous meet for laud to drink his fill.
पुरूण्यस्मै सवनानि हर्यत इन्द्रायसोमा हरयो दधन्विरे|	many libations flow for him who loveth them to indra have the goldhued soma juices run.
अरं कामाय हरयो दधन्विरे सथिराय हिन्वन हरयो हरीतुरा|	tle goldhued drops have flowed to gratify his wish the yellow dro s have urged the swift bays to the strong.
अर्वद्भिर्यो हरिभिर्जोषमीयते सो अस्य कामंहरिवन्तमानशे|	he who speeds on with bay steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.
हरिश्मशारुर्हरिकेश आयसस्तुरस्पेये यो हरिपावर्धत|	at the swift draught the somadrinker waxed in might the iron one with yellow beard and yellow hair.
अर्वद्भिर्यो हरिभिर्वाजिनीवसुरति विश्वादुरिता पारिषद धरी|	he lord of tawny coursers lord of fleetfoot mares will bear his bay steeds safely over all distress.
सरुवेव यस्य हरिणी विपेततुः शिप्रे वाजाय हरिणीदविध्वतः|	his yellowcoloured jaws like ladles move apart what time for strength he makes the yellowtinted stir.
पर यत कर्ते चमसे मर्म्र्जद धरी पीत्वामदस्य हयतस्याधसः|	when while the bowl stands there he grooms his tawny steeds when he hath drunk strong drink the sweet juice that he loves.
उत सम सद्म हर्यतस्य पस्त्योरत्यो न वाजं हरिवानचिक्रदत|	yea to the dear ones seat in homes of heaven and earth the bay steeds lord hath whinnied like a horse for food.
मही चिद धि धिषणाहर्यदोजसा बर्हद वयोदधिषे हर्यतश्चिदा|	then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily and the beloved one hath gained high power of life.
आ रोदसी हर्यमाणो महित्वा नव्यंनव्यं हर्यसि मन्मनु परियम|	thou comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new.
पर पस्त्यमसुर हर्यतं गोराविष्क्र्धि हरयेसूर्याय|	o asura disclose thou and make visible the cows beloved home to the bright golden sun.
आ तवा हर्यन्तं परयुजो जनानां रथे वहन्तु हरिशिप्रमिन्द्र|	o indra let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee delightful goldenvisored on thy car.
पिबा यथा परतिभ्र्तस्य मध्वो हर्यन यज्ञंसधमादे दशोणिम|	that pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil thou mayest at the feast drink of our offered meath.
अपाः पूर्वेषां हरिवः सुतानामथो इदं सवनंकेवलं ते|	juices aforetime lord of bays thou drankest and thine especially is this libation.
ममद्धि सोमं मधुमन्तमिन्द्र सत्रा वर्षञ्जठर आ वर्षस्व|	gladden thee indra with the meathrich soma pour it down ever mighty one within thee.
वर्षा वर्ष्णे दुदुहे दोहसा दिवः पयांसि यह्वो अदितेरदाभ्यः|	the bull hath yielded for the bull the milk of heaven the son of aditi can never be deceived.
विश्वं स वेद वरुणो यथा धिया सयज्ञियो यजतु यज्ञियान रतून|	according to his wisdom varuṇa knoweth all may he the holy hallow times for sacrifice.
रपद गन्धर्वीरप्या च योषणा नदस्य नादे परि पातुमे मनः|	gandharvi spake may she the lady of the flood amid the rivers roaring leave my heart untouched.
इष्टस्य मध्ये अदितिर्नि धातु नो भराता नोज्येष्ठः परथमो वि वोचति|	may aditi accomplish all that we desire and may our eldest brother tell us this as chief.
सो चिन नु भद्रा कषुमती यशस्वत्युषा उवास मनवेस्वर्वती|	yea even this blessed morning rich in store of food splendid with heavenly lustre hath shone out for man.
यदीमुशन्तमुशतामनु करतुमग्निंहोतारं विदथाय जीजनन|	since they as was the wish of yearning gods brought forth that yearning agni for the assembly as the priest.
अध तयं दरप्सं विभ्वं विचक्षणं विराभरदिषितः शयेनो अध्वरे|	and the fleet falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing drop most excellent and keen of sight.
यदी विशो वर्णते दस्ममार्याग्निं होतारमध धीरजायत|	then when the Āryan tribes chose as invoking priest agni the wonderworker and the hymn rose up.
सदासि रण्वो यवसेव पुष्यते होत्राभिरग्ने मनुषःस्वध्वरः|	still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass and skilled in sacrifice offers thee holy gifts.
विप्रस्य वा यच्छशमान उक्थ्यं वाजंससवानुपयासि भूरिभिः|	when thou having received the sages strengthening food with lauds after long toil cornest with many more.
उदीरय पितरा जार आ भगमियक्षति हर्यतो हर्त्तैष्यति|	urge thou thy parents as a lover  to delight the lovely one desires and craves it from his heart.
विवक्ति वह्निः सवपस्यते मखस्तविष्यते असुरोवेपते मती|	the priest calls out the sacrificer shows his skill the asura tries his strength and with the hymn is stirred.
यस्ते अग्ने सुमतिं मर्तो अक्षत सहसः सूनो अति स परश्र्ण्वे|	farfamed is he the mortal man o agni thou son of strength who hath obtained thy favour.
इषं दधानो वहमानो अश्वैरा स दयुमानमवान भूषति दयून|	he gathering power borne onward by his horses makes his days lovely in his might and splendour.
यदग्न एषा समितिर्भवाति देवी देवेषु यजता यजत्र|	when holy agni the divine assembly the sacred synod mid the gods is gathered.
रत्ना च यद विभजासि सवधावो भागं नो अत्र वसुमन्तंवीतात|	and when thou godlike one dealest forth treasures vouchsafe us too our portion of the riches.
शरुधी नो अग्ने सदने सधस्थे युक्ष्वा रथमम्र्तस्यद्रवित्नुम|	hear us o agni in your common dwelling harness thy rapid car of amṛta.
आ नो वह रोदसी देवपुत्रे माकिर्देवानामपभूरिह सयाः|	bring heaven and earth the deities parents hither stay with us here nor from the gods be distant.
देवानां नु वयं जाना पर वोचाम विपन्यया|	let us with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the gods.
उक्थेषुशस्यमानेषु यः पश्यादुत्तरे युगे|	that one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age.
बरह्मणस पतिरेता सं कर्मार इवाधमत|	these brahmaṇaspati produced with blast and smelting like a smith.
देवानाम्पूर्व्ये युगेअसतः सदजायत|	existence in an earlier age of gods from nonexistence sprang.
देवानां युगे परथमेअसतः सदजायत|	existence in the earliest age of gods from nonexistence sprang.
तदाशा अन्वजायन्त तदुत्तानपदस परि|	thereafter were the regions born this sprang from the productive power.
भूर्जज्ञ उत्तानपदो भुव आशा अजायन्त|	earth sprang from the productive power the regions from the earth were born.
अदितेर्दक्षोजायत दक्षाद वदितिः परि|	dakṣa was born of aditi and aditi was dakṣas child.
अदितिर्ह्यजनिष्ट दक्ष या दुहिता तव|	for aditi o dakṣa she who is thy daughter was brought forth.
तां देवान्वजायन्त भद्रा अम्र्तबन्धवः|	after her were the blessed gods born sharers of immortal life.
यद देवा अदः सलिले सुसंरब्धा अतिष्ठत|	when ye o gods in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood.
अत्रा वोन्र्त्यतामिव तीव्रो रेणुरपायत|	thence as of dancers from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose.
यद देवा यतयो यथा भुवनान्यपिन्वत|	when o ye gods like yatis ye caused all existing things to grow.
अत्रा समुद्रा गूळमा सूर्यमजभर्तन|	then ye brought sūrya forward who was lying hidden in the sea.
अष्टौ पुत्रासो अदितेर्ये जातास्तन्वस परि|	eight are the sons of adid who from her body sprang to life.
देवानुपप्रैत सप्तभिः परा मार्ताण्डमास्यत|	with seven she went to meet the gods she cast martanda far away.
सप्तभिः पुत्रैरदितिरुप परैत पूर्व्यं युगम|	so with her seven sons aditi went forth to meet the earlier age.
परजायै मर्त्यवे तवत पुनर्मार्ताण्डमाभरत|	she brought martanda thitherward to spring to life and die again.
तेअवदन परथमा बरह्मकिल्बिषेअकूपारः सलिलोमातरिश्वा|	these first the boundless sea and mātariśvan fierceglowing fire the strong the blissbestower.
वीळुहरास्तप उग्रो मयोभूरापो देवीःप्रथमजा रतेन|	and heavenly floods firstborn by holy order exclaimed against the outrage on a brahman.
सोमो राजा परथमो बरह्मजायां पुनः परायछदह्र्णीयमानः|	king soma first of all without reluctance made restitution of the brahmans consort.
अन्वर्तिता वरुणो मित्र आसीदग्निर्होताहस्तग्र्ह्या निनाय|	mitra and varuṇa were the inviters agni as hota took her hand and led her.
हस्तेनैव गराह्य आधिरस्या बरह्मजायेयमिति चेदवोचन|	the man her pledge must by her hand be taken when they have cried she is a brahmans consort.
न दूताय परह्ये तस्थ एषा तथा राष्ट्रं गुपितंक्षत्रियस्य|	she stayed not for a herald to conduct her thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.
देवा एतस्यामवदन्त पूर्वे सप्तर्षयस्तपसे ये निषेदुः|	thus spake of her those gods of old seven Ṛṣis who sate them down to their austere devotion.
भीमा जाया बराह्मणस्योपनीता दुर्धां दधातिपरमे वयोमन|	dire is a brahmans wife led home by others in the supremest heaven she plants confusion.
बरह्मचारी चरति वेविषद विषः स देवानां भवत्येकमङगम|	the brahmacari goes engaged in duty he is a member of the gods own body.
तेन जायामन्वविन्दद बर्हस्पतिः सोमेन नीतांजुह्वं न देवाः|	through him bṛhaspati obtained his consort as the gods gained the ladle brought by soma.
पुनर्वै देवा अददुः पुनर्मनुष्या उत|	so then the gods restored her so men gave the woman back again.
राजानःसत्यं कर्ण्वाना बरह्मजायां पुनर्ददुः|	the kings who kept their promises restored the brahmans wedded wife.
पुनर्दाय बरह्मजायां कर्त्वी देवैर्निकिल्बिषम|	having restored the brahmans wife and freed them with gods aid from sin.
ऊर्जम्प्र्थिव्या भक्त्वायोरुगायमुपासते|	they shared the fulness of the earth and won themselves extended sway.
अहं भुवं वसुनः पूर्व्यस पतिरहं धनानि संजयामि शश्वतः|	i was the first possessor of all precious gear the wealth of every man i win and gather up.
मां हवन्ते पितरं न जन्तवोअहन्दाशुषे वि भजामि भोजनम|	on me as on a father living creatures call i deal enjoyment to tho man who offers gifts.
अहमिन्द्रो रोधो वक्षो अथर्वणस्त्रिताय गा अजनयमहेरधि|	i indra am atharvans stay and firm support i brought forth kine to trita from the dragons grasp.
अहं दस्युभ्यः परि नर्म्णमा ददे गोत्रा शिक्षन्दधीचे मातरिश्वने|	i stripped the dasyus of their manly might and gave the cattlestalls to matarigvan and dadhyac.
मह्यं तवष्टा वज्रमतक्षदायसं मयि देवासोअव्र्जन्नपि करतुम|	for me hath tvaṣṭar forged the iron thunderbolt in me the gods have centred intellectual power.
ममानीकं सूर्यस्येव दुष्टरं मामार्यन्तिक्र्तेन कर्त्वेन च|	my sheen is like the suns insufferably bright men honour me as lord for past and future deeds.
अहमेतं गव्ययमश्व्यं पशुं पुरीषिणं सायकेनाहिरण्ययम|	i won myself these herdi of cattle steeds and kine and gold in ample store with my destructive bolt.
पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशामि दाशुषे यन मासोमास उक्थिनो अमन्दिषुः|	i give full many a thousand to the worshipper what time the somas and the lauds have made me glad.
अहमिन्द्रो न परा जिग्य इद धनं न मर्त्यवेअव तस्थेकदा चन|	indra am i none ever wins my wealth from me never at any time am i a thrall to death.
सोममिन मा सुन्वन्तो याचता वसु न मेपूरवः सख्ये रिषाथन|	pressing the soma ask riches from me alone ye pūrus in my friendship shall not suffer harm.
अहमेताञ्छाश्वसतो दवादवेन्द्रं ये वज्रं युधयेऽकर्ण्वत|	these breathing loud in fury two and two who caused indra to bring his bolt of thunder to the fray.
आह्वयमानानव हन्मनाहनं दर्ळा वदन्ननमस्युर्नमस्विनः|	the challengers i struck with deadly weapon down firm stand what words the god speaks to his worshippers.
अभीदमेकमेको अस्मि निष्षाळ अभी दवा किमु तरयःकरन्ति|	this one by stronger might i conquered singly yea also two shall three prevail against me.
खले न पर्षान परति हन्मि भूरि किं मा निन्दन्तिशत्रवोअनिन्द्राः|	like many sheaves upon the floor i thrash them how can my foes the indraless revile me.
अहं गुङगुभ्यो अतिथिग्वमिष्करमिषं न वर्त्रतुरंविक्षु धारयम|	against the gungus i made atithigva strong and kept him mid the folk like vṛtraconquering strength.
यत पर्णयघ्न उत वा करञ्जहे पराहम्महे वर्त्रहत्ये अशुश्रवि|	when i won glory in the great foeslaying fight in battle where karanja fell and parṇaya.
पर मे नमी साप्य इषे भुजे भूद गवामेषे सख्याक्र्णुत दविता|	with food for mine enjoyment sapya nami came he joined me as a friend of old in search of kine.
दिद्युं यदस्य समिथेषु मंहयमादिदेनं शंस्यमुक्थ्यं करम|	as i bestowed on him an arrow for the fight i made him worthy of the song apd hymn of praise.
पर नेमस्मिन दद्र्शे सोमो अन्तर्गोपा नेममाविरस्थाक्र्णोति|	one of the two hath soma seen within it the herdsman with the bone shows forth the other.
स तिग्मश्र्ङगं वर्षभं युयुत्सन दरुहस्तस्थौबहुले बद्धो अन्तः|	he fain to fight the bull whose horns were sharpened stood fettered in the demons ample region.
आदित्यानां वसूनां रुद्रियाणां देवो देवानां नमिनामि धाम|	i as a god neer violate the statutes of gods of vasus rudriyas Ādityas.
ते मा भद्राय शवसे ततक्षुरपराजितमस्त्र्तमषाळम|	these gods have formed me for auspicious vigour unconquered and invincible for ever.
तां सु ते कीर्तिं मघवन महित्वा यत तवा भीते रोदसीह्वयेताम|	i sing thy fame that maghavan through thy greatness the heavens and earth invoked thee in their terror.
परावो देवानातिरो दासमोजः परजायैत्वस्यै यदशिक्ष इन्द्र|	thou aiding gods didst quell the power of dāsas what time thou holpest many a race o indra.
यदचरस्तन्वा वाव्र्धानो बलानीन्द्र परब्रुवाणो जनेषु|	when thou wast roaming waxen strong in body telling thy might indra among the people.
मायेत सा ते यानि युद्धान्याहुर्नाद्य शत्रुं ननुपुरा विवित्से|	all that men called thy battles was illusion no foe hast thou today nor erst hast found one.
क उ नु ते महिमनः समस्यास्मत पूर्व रषयोअन्तमापुः|	who are the Ṛṣis then who comprehended before our time the bounds of all thy greatness.
यन मातरं च पितरं च साकमजनयथास्तन्वःस्वायाः|	for from thy body thou hast generated at the same time the mother and the father.
चत्वारि ते असुर्याणि नामादाभ्यानि महिषस्य सन्ति|	thou mighty steer hast four supremest natures asura natures that may neer be injured.
तवमङग तानि विश्वानि वित्से येभिः कर्माणि मघवञ्चकर्थ|	all these o maghavan thou surely knowest wherewith thou hast performed thy great achievements.
तवं विश्वा दधिषे केवलानि यान्याविर्या च गुहावसूनि|	thou hast all treasures in thy sole possession treasures made manifest and treasures hidden.
काममिन मे मघवन मा वि तारीस्त्वमाज्ञातात्वमिन्द्रासि दाता|	defer not thou o maghavan my longing thou art director indra thou art giver.
यो अदधाज्ज्योतिषि जयोतिरन्तर्यो अस्र्जन मधुना सम्मधूनि|	to him who set the light in things of splendour and with all sweetness blent essential sweetness.
अध परियं शूषमिन्द्राय मन्म बरह्मक्र्तोब्र्हदुक्थादवाचि|	to indra hath this welcome hymn that strengthens been uttered by the votary bṛhaduktha.
आग्निं न सवव्र्क्तिभिर्होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे|	with offerings of our own we choose thee agni as invoking priest.
यज्ञायस्तीर्णबर्हिषे वि वो मदे शीरं पावकशोचिषंविवक्षसे|	for sacrifice with trimmed grassat your glad carousepiercing and brightly shining thou art waxing great.
तवामु ते सवाभुवः शुम्भन्त्यश्वराधसः|	the wealthy ones adorn thee they who bring us horses as their gift.
वेति तवामुपसेचनी वि वो मद रजीतिरग्न आहुतिर्विवक्षसे|	the sprinkling ladle agniat your glad carouse and glowing offering taste thee thou art waxing great.
तवे धर्माण आसते जुहूभिः सिञ्चतीरिव|	the holy statutes rest by thee as twere with ladles that oerflow.
कर्ष्णारूपाण्यर्जुना वि वो मदे विश्वा अधि शरियो धिषेविवक्षसे|	black and whitegleaming coloursat your glad carouseall glories thou assurnest thou art waxing great.
यमग्ने मन्यसे रयिं सहसावन्नमर्त्य|	o agni what thou deemest wealth victorious and immortal one.
तमा नोवाजसातये वि वो मदे यज्ञेषु चित्रमा भरा विवक्षसे|	bring thou to give us vigourat your glad carouse splendid at sacrifices thou art waxing great.
अग्निर्जातो अथर्वणा विदद विश्वानि काव्या|	skilled in all lore is agni he whom erst atharvan brought to life.
भुवद दूतोविवस्वतो वि वो मदे परियो यमस्य काम्यो विवक्षसे|	he was vivasvāns envoy at your glad carousethe weilloved friend of yama thou art waxing great.
तवां यज्ञेष्वीळतेअग्ने परयत्यध्वरे|	at sacrifices they adore thee agni when the rite proceeds.
तवं वसूनिकाम्या वि वो मदे विश्वा दधासि दाशुषे विवक्षसे|	all fair and lovely treasuresat your glad carousethou givest him who offers thou art waxing great.
तवां यज्ञेष्व रत्विजं चारुमग्ने नि षेदिरे|	men agni have established thee as welcome priest at holy rites.
घर्तप्रतीकं मनुषो वि वो मदे शुक्रं चेतिष्ठमक्षभिर्विवक्षसे|	thee whose face shines with butterat your glad carousebright with eyes most observant thou art waxing great.
अग्ने शुक्रेण शोचिषोरु परथयसे बर्हत|	wide and aloft thou spreadest thee o agni with thy brilliant flame.
अभिक्रन्दन्व्र्षायसे वि वो मदे गर्भं दधासि जामिषु विवक्षसे|	a bull art thou when bellowingat your glad carousethou dost impregn the sisters thou art waxing great.
सूर्यो नो दिवस पातु वातो अन्तरिक्षात|	may sūrya guard us out of heaven and vāta from the firmament.
अग्निर्नःपार्थिवेभ्यः|	and agni from terrestrial spots.
जोषा सवितर्यस्य ते हरः शतं सवानर्हति|	thou savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations be thou pleased.
पाहिनो दिद्युतः पतन्त्याः|	from failing lightning keep us safe.
चक्षुर्नो देवः सविता चक्षुर्न उत पर्वतः|	may savitar the god and may parvata also give us sight.
चक्षुर्धाता दधातु नः|	may the creator give us sight.
चक्षुर्नो धेहि चक्षुषे चक्षुर्विख्यै तनूभ्यः|	give sight unto our eye give thou our bodies sight that they may see.
संचेदं वि च पश्येम|	may we survey discern this world.
सुसन्द्र्शं तवा वयं परति पश्येम सूर्य|	thus sūrya may we look on thee on thee most lovely to behold.
वि पश्येमन्र्चक्षसः|	see clearly with the eyes of men.
या ओषधीः पूर्वा जाता देवेभ्यस्त्रियुगं पुरा|	herbs that sprang up in time of old three ages earlier than the gods.
मनैनु बभ्रूणामहं शतं धामानि सप्त च|	of these whose hue is brown will i declare the hundred powers and seven.
शतं वो अम्ब धामानि सहस्रमुत वो रुहः|	ye mothers have a hundred homes yea and a thousand are your growths.
अधाशतक्रत्वो यूयमिमं मे अगदं कर्त|	do ye who have a thousand powers free this my patient from disease.
ओषधीः परति मोदध्वं पुष्पवतीः परसूवरीः|	be glad and joyful in the plants both blossoming and bearing fruit.
अश्वािव सजित्वरीर्वीरुधः पारयिष्ण्वः|	plants that will lead us to success like mares who conquer in the race.
ओषधीरिति मातरस्तद वो देवीरुप बरुवे|	plants by this name i speak to you mothers to you the goddesses.
सनेयमश्वंगां वास आत्मानं तव पूरुष|	steed cow and garment may i win win back thy very self o man.
अश्वत्थे वो निषदनं पर्णे वो वसतिष कर्ता|	the holy fig tree is your home your mansion is the parna tree.
गोभाज इत्किलासथ यत सनवथ पूरुषम|	winners of cattle shali ye be if ye regain for me this man.
यत्रौषधीः समग्मत राजानः समिताविव|	he who hath store of herbs at hand like kings amid a crowd of men.
विप्रः सौच्यते भिषग रक्षोहामीवचातनः|	physician is that sages name fiendslayer chaser of disease.
अश्वावतीं सोमावतीमूर्जयन्तीमुदोजसम|	herbs rich in soma rich in steeds in nourishments in strengthening power.
आवित्सिसर्वा ओषधीरस्मा अरिष्टतातये|	all these have i provided here that this man may be whole again.
उच्छुष्मा ओषधीनां गावो गोष्ठादिवेरते|	the healing virtues of the plants stream forth like cattle from the stall.
धनंसनिष्यन्तीनामात्मानं तव पूरुष|	plants that shall win me store of wealth and save thy vital breath o man.
इष्क्र्तिर्नाम वो माताथो यूयं सथ निष्क्र्तीः|	reliever is your mothers name and hence restorers are ye called.
सीराःपतत्र्णी सथन यदामयति निष कर्थ|	rivers are ye with wings that fly keep far whatever brings disease.
अति विश्वाः परिष्ठा सतेन इव वरजमक्रमुः|	over all fences have they passed as steals a thief into the fold.
ओषधीःप्राचुच्यवुर्यत किं च तन्वो रपः|	the plants have driven from the frame whatever malady was there.
यदिमा वाजयन्नहमोषधीर्हस्त आदधे|	when bringing back the vanished strength i hold these herbs within my hand.
आत्मायक्ष्मस्य नश्यति पुरा जीवग्र्भो यथा|	the spirit of disease departs ere he can seize upon the life.
यस्यौषधीः परसर्पथाङगमअञ्गं परुषपरुः|	he through whose frame o plants ye creep member by member joint by joint.
ततोयक्ष्मं वि बाधध्व उग्रो मध्यमशीरिव|	from him ye drive away disease like some strong arbiter of strife.
साकं यक्ष्म पर पत चाषेण किकिदीविना|	fly spirit of disease begone with the blue jay and kingfisher.
साकंवातस्य धराज्या साकं नश्य निहाकया|	fly with the winds impetuousspeed vanish together with the storm.
अन्या वो अन्यामवत्वन्यान्यस्या उपावत|	help every one the other lend assistance each of you to each.
ताः सर्वाःसंविदाना इदं मे परावता वचः|	all of you be accordant give furtherance to this speech of mine.
याः फलिनीर्या अफला अपुष्पा याश्च पुष्पिणीः|	let fruitful plants and fruitless those that blossom and the blossomless.
बर्हस्पतिप्रसूतास्ता नो मुञ्चन्त्वंहसः|	urged onward by bṛhaspati release us from our pain and grief.
मुञ्चन्तु मा शपथ्यादथो वरुण्यादुत|	release me from the curses plague and woe that comes from varuṇa.
अथो यमस्यपड्बीशात सर्वस्माद देवकिल्बिषात|	free me from yamas fetter from sin and offence against the gods.
अवपतन्तीरवदन दिव ओषधयस परि|	what time descending from the sky the plants flew earthward thus they spake.
यं जीवमश्नवामहै न स रिष्याति पूरुषः|	no evil shall befall the man whom while he liveth we pervade.
या ओषधीः सोमराज्ञीर्बह्वीः शतविचक्षणाः|	of all the many plants whose king is soma plants of hundred forms.
तासां तवमस्युत्तमारं कामाय शं हर्दे|	thou art the plant most excellent prompt to the wish sweet to the heart.
या ओषधीः सोमराज्ञीर्विष्ठिताः पर्थिवीमनु|	o all ye various herbs whose king is soma that oerspread the earth.
बर्हस्पतिप्रसूता अस्यै सं दत्त वीर्यम|	urged onward by bṛhaspati combine your virtue in this plant.
मा वो रिषत खनिता यस्मै चाहं खनामि वः|	unharmed be he who digs you up unharmed the man for whom i dig.
दविपच्चतुष्पदस्माकं सर्वमस्त्वनातुरम|	and let no malady attack biped or quadruped of ours.
याश्चेदमुपश्र्ण्वन्ति याश्च दूरं परागताः|	all plants that hear this speech and those that have departed far away.
सर्वाः संगत्य वीरुधोअस्यै सं दत्त वीर्यम|	come all assembled and confer your healing power upon this herb.
ओषधयः सं वदन्ते सोमेन सह राज्ञा|	with soma as their sovran lord the plants hold colloquy and say.
यस्मै कर्णोतिब्राह्मणस्तं राजन पारयामसि|	o king we save from death the man whose cure a brahman undertakes.
तवमुत्तमास्योषधे तव वर्क्षा उपस्तयः|	most excellent of all art thou o plant thy vassals are the trees.
उपस्तिरस्तुसोअस्माकं यो अस्मानभिदासति|	let him be subject to our power the man who seeks to injure us.
उत तिष्ठताव पश्यतेन्द्रस्य भागं रत्वियम|	now lift ye up yourselves and look on indras seasonable share.
यदि शरातोजुहोतन यद्यश्रातो ममत्तन|	if it be ready offer it unready ye have been remise.
शरातं हविरो षविन्द्र पर याहि जगाम सूरो अध्वनोविमध्यम|	oblation is prepared come to us indra the sun hath travelled over half his journey.
परि तवासते निधिभिः सखायः कुलपा नव्राजपतिं चरन्तम|	friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribes wandering chieftain.
शरातं मन्य ऊधनि शरातमग्नौ सुश्रातं मन्ये तद्र्तं नवीयः|	dressed in the udder and on fire i fancy welldressed i fancy is this recent present.
माध्यन्दिनस्य सवनस्य दध्नः पिबेन्द्रवज्रिन पुरुक्र्ज्जुषाणः|	drink indra of the curd of noons libation with favour thunderer thou whose deeds are mighty.
इमा नु कं भुवना सीषधामेन्द्रश्च विश्वे च देवाः|	we will with indra and all gods to aid us bring these existing worlds into subjection.
यज्ञं च नस्तन्वं च परजां चादित्यैरिन्द्रः सहचीक्ळिपाति|	our sacrifice our bodies and our offspr let indra form together with Ādityas.
आदित्यैरिन्द्रः सगणो मरुद्भिरस्माकं भूत्ववितातनूनाम|	with the Ādityas with the band of maruts may indra be protector of our bodies.
हत्वाय देवा असुरान यदायन देवा देवत्वमभिरक्षमाणाः|	as when the gods came after they had slaughtered the asuras keeping safe their godlike nature.
परत्यञ्चमर्कमनयञ्छचीभिरादित सवधामिषिराम्पर्यपश्यन|	brought the sun hitherward with mighty powers and looked about them on their vigorous godhead.
शरद्धयाग्निः समिध्यते शरद्धय हुयते हविः|	by faith is agni kindled through faith is oblation offered up.
शरद्धां भगस्य मूर्धनि वचसा वेदयमसि|	we celebrate with praises faith upon the height of happiness.
परियं शरद्धे ददतः परियं शरद्द्ते दिदासतः|	bless thou the man who gives o faith faith bless the man who fain would give.
परियम्भोजेषु यज्वस्विदं म उदितं कर्धि|	bless thou the liberal worshippers bless thou the word that i have said.
यथा देव असुरेषु शरद्धामुग्रेषु चक्रिरे|	even as the deities maintained faith in the mighty asuras.
एवम्भोजेषु यज्वस्वस्माकमुदितं कर्धि|	so make this uttered wish of mine true for the liberal worshippers.
शरद्धां देवा यजमाना वायुगोपा उपासते|	guarded by vāyu gods and men who sacrifice draw near to faith.
शरद्धांह्र्दय्ययाकूत्या शरद्धया विन्दते वसु|	man winneth faith by yearnings of the heart and opulence by faith.
शरद्धां परातै हवामहे शरद्धां मध्यन्दिनं परि|	faith in the early morning faith at noonday will we invocate.
शरद्धां सूर्यस्य निम्रुचि शरद्धे शरद धापयेह नः|	faith at the setting of the sun o faith endow us with belief.
उदप्रुतो न वयो रक्षमाणा वावदतो अभ्रियस्येव घोषाः|	like birds who keep their watch plashing in water like the loud voices of the thundering raincloud.
गिरिभ्रजो नोर्मयो मदन्तो बर्हस्पतिमभ्यर्का अनावन|	like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain thus to bṛhaspati our hymns have sounded.
सं गोभिराङगिरसो नक्षमाणो भग इवेदर्यमणंनिनाय|	the son of aṅgirases meeting the cattle as bhaga brought in aryaman among us.
जने मित्रो न दम्पती अनक्ति बर्हस्पतेवाजयाशून्रिवाजौ|	as friend of men he decks the wife and husband as for the race bṛhaspati nerve our coursers.
साध्वर्या अतिथिनीरिषिरा सपार्हाः सुवर्णानवद्यरूपाः|	bṛhaspati having won them from the mountains strewed down like barley out of winnowing baskets.
बर्हस्पतिः पर्वते भयो वितूर्या निर्गाूपे यवमिव सथिविभ्यः|	the vigorous wandering cows who aid the pious desired of all of blameless form wellcoloured.
आप्रुषायन मधुन रतस्य योनिमवक्षिपन्नर्क उल्कामिवद्योः|	as the sun dews with meath the seat of order and casts a flaming meteor down from heaven.
बर्हस्पतिरुद्धरन्नश्मनो गा भूम्या उद्नेव वित्वचं बिभेद|	so from the rock bṛhaspati forced the cattle and cleft the earths skin as it were with water.
अप जयोतिषा तमो अन्तरिक्षादुद्नः शीपालमिव वाताजत|	forth from mid air with light he dravc the darkness as the gale blows a lily from the fiver.
बर्हस्पतिरनुम्र्श्या वलस्याभ्रमिव वात आ चक्रा गाः|	like the wind grasping at the cloud of vala bṛhaspati gathered to himself the cattle.
यदा वलस्य पीयतो जसुं भेद बर्हस्पतिरग्नितपोभिरर्कैः|	bṛhaspati when he with fiery lightnings cleft through the weapon of reviling vala.
दद्भिर्न जिह्वा परिविष्टमाददाविर्निधीन्रक्र्णोदुस्रियाणाम|	consumedḥim as tongues cat what teeth have compassed he threw the prisons of the red cows open.
बर्हस्पतिरमत हि तयदासां नाम सवरीणां सदनेगुहा यत|	that secret name borne by the lowing cattle within the cave bṛhaspati discovered.
आण्डेव भित्त्वा शकुनस्य गर्भमुदुस्रियाःपर्वतस्य तमनाजत|	and drave himself the bright kine from the mountain like a birds young after the eggs disclosure.
अश्नापिनद्धं मधु पर्यपश्यन मत्स्यं न दीन उदनिक्षियन्तम|	he looked around on rockimprisoned sweetness as one who eyes a fish in scanty water.
निष टज्जभार चमसं न वर्क्षाद्ब्र्हस्पतिर्विरवेणा विक्र्त्य|	bṛhaspati cleaving through with varied clamour brought it forth like a bowl from out the timber.
सोषामविन्दत स सवः सो अग्निं सो अर्केण वि बबाधेतमांसि|	he found the light of heaven and fire and morning with lucid rays he forced apart the darkness.
बर्हस्पतिर्गोवपुषो वलस्य निर्मज्जानं नपर्वणो जभार|	as from a joint bṛhaspati took the marrow of vala as he gloried in his cattle.
हिमेव पर्णा मुषिता वनानि बर्हस्पतिनाक्र्पयद वलो गाः|	as trees for foliage robbed by winter vala mourned for the cows bṛhaspati had taken.
अनानुक्र्त्यमपुनश्चकार यात सूर्यामासा मिथौच्चरातः|	he did a deed neer done neer to be equalled whereby the sun and moon ascend alternate.
अभि शयावं न कर्शनेभिरश्वं नक्षत्रेभिः पितरोद्यामपिंशन|	like a dark steed adorned with pearl the fathers have decorated heaven with constellations.
रात्र्यां तमो अदधुर्ज्योतिरहन्ब्र्हस्पतिर्भिनदद्रिं विदद गाः|	they set the light in day in night the darkness bṛhaspati cleft the rock and found the cattle.
इदमकर्म नमो अभ्रियाय यः पूर्वीरन्वानोनवीति|	this homage have weoffered to the cloud god who thunders out to many in succession.
बर्हस्पतिः स हि गोभिः सो अश्वैः स वीरेभिः सन्र्भिर्नो वयो धात|	may this bṛhaspati vouchsafe us fulness of life with kine and horses men and heroes.
इमां धियं सप्तशीर्ष्णीं पिता न रतप्रजातां बर्हतीमविन्दत|	this holy hymn sublime and sevenheaded sprung from eternal law our sire discovered.
तुरीयं सविज्जनयद विश्वजन्योअयास्य उक्थमिन्द्राय शंसन|	ayasya friend of all men hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to indra.
रतं शंसन्त रजु दीध्याना दिवस पुत्रासो असुरस्यवीराः|	thinking aright praising eternal order the sons of dyaus the asura those heroes.
विप्रं पदमङगिरसो दधाना यज्ञस्य धामप्रथमं मनन्त|	aṅgirases holding the rank of sages first honoured sacrifices holy statute.
हंसैरिव सखिभिर्वावदद्भिरश्मन्मयानि नहनाव्यस्यन|	girt by his friends who cried with swanlike voices bursting the stony barriers of the prison.
बर्हस्पतिरभिकनिक्रदद गा उत परास्तौदुच्चविद्वानगायत|	bṛhaspati spake in thunder to the cattle and uttered praise and song when he had found them.
अवो दवाभ्यां पर एकया गा गुहा तिष्ठन्तीरन्र्तस्यसेतौ|	apart from one away from two above him he drave the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood.
बर्हस्पतिस्तमसि जयोतिरिछन्नुदुस्रा आकर्विहि तिस्र आवः|	bṛhaspati seeking light amid the darkness drave forth the bright cows three he made apparent.
विभिद्या पुरं शयाथेमपाचीं निस्त्रीणि साकमुदधेरक्र्न्तत|	when he had cleft the lairs and western castle he cut off three from him who held the waters.
बर्हस्पतिरुषसं सूर्यं गामर्कंविवेद सतनयन्निव दयौः|	bṛhaspati discovered while he thundered like dyaus the dawn the sun the cow the lightning.
इन्द्रो वलं रक्षितारं दुघानां करेणेव वि चकर्तारवेण|	as with a hand so with his roaring indra cleft vala through the guardian of the cattle.
सवेदाञ्जिभिराशिरमिछमानोअरोदयत पणिमागा अमुष्णात|	seeking the milkdraught with sweatshining comrades he stole the paṇis kine and left him weeping.
स ईं सत्येभिः सखिभिः शुचद्भिर्गोधायसं विधनसैरदर्दः|	he with bright faithful friends winners of booty hath rent the milker of the cows asunder.
बरह्मणस पतिर्व्र्षभिर्वराहैर्घर्मस्वेदेभिर्द्रविणं वयानट|	bṛhaspati with wild boars strong and mighty sweating with heat hath gained a rich possession.
ते सत्येन मनसा गोपतिं गा इयानास इषणयन्तधीभिः|	they longing for the kine with faithful spirit incited with their hymns the lord of cattle.
बर्हस्पतिर्मिथोवद्यपेभिरुदुस्रिया अस्र्जतस्वयुग्भिः|	bṛhaspati freed the radiant cows with comrades selfyoked averting shame from one another.
तं वर्धयन्तो मतिभिः शिवाभिः सिंअमिव नानदतंसधस्थे|	in our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth like a lion.
बर्हस्पतिं वर्षणं शूरसातौ भरेभरे अनुमदेम जिष्णुम|	maywe in every fight where heroes conquer rejoice in strong bṛhaspati the victor.
यदा वाजमसनद विश्वरूपमा दयामरुक्षदुत्तराणिसद्म|	when he had won him every sort of booty and gone to heaven and its most lofty mansions.
बर्हस्पतिं वर्षणं वर्धयन्तो नाना सन्तोबिभ्रतो जयोतिरासा|	men praised bṛhaspati the mighty bringing the light within their mouths from sundry places.
सत्यामाशिषं कर्णुता वयोधै कीरिं चिद धयवथस्वेभिरेवैः|	fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigour aid in your wonted manner even the humble.
पश्चा मर्धो अप भवन्तु विश्वास्तद्रोदसी शर्णुतं विश्वमिन्वे|	let all our foes be turned and driven backward hear this o heaven and earth ye allproducers.
इन्द्रो मह्ना महतो अर्णवस्य वि मूर्धानमभिनदर्बुदस्य|	indra with mighty strength cleft asunder the head of arbuda the watery monster.
अहन्नहिमरिणात सप्त सिन्धून देवैर्द्यावाप्र्थिवीप्रावतं नः|	slain ahi and set free the seven rivers o heaven and earth with all the gods protect us.
महत तदुल्बं सथविरं तदासीद येनाविष्टितःप्रविवेशिथापः|	large was that covering and firm of texture folded wherein thou enteredst the waters.
विश्वा अपश्यद बहुधा ते अग्ने जातवेदस्तन्वो देव एकः|	one deity alone o jātavedas agni saw all thy forms in sundry places.
को मा ददर्श कतमः स देवो यो मे तन्वो बहुधापर्यपश्यत|	what god hath seen me who of all their number clearly beheld my forms in many places.
कवाह मित्रावरुणा कषियन्त्यग्नेर्विस्वाःसमिधो देवयानीः|	where lie then all the sacred logs of agni that lead him godward varuṇa and mitra.
ऐछाम तवा बहुधा जातवेदः परविष्टमग्ने अप्स्वोषधीषु|	in many places agni jātavedas we sought thee hidden in the plants and waters.
तं तवा यमो अचिकेच्चित्रभानो दशान्तरुष्यादतिरोचमानम|	then yama marked thee god of wondrous splendour effulgent from thy tenfold secret dwelling.
होत्रादहं वरुण बिभ्यदायं नेदेव मा युनजन्नत्रदेवाः|	i fled in fear from sacrificial worship varuṇa lest the gods should thus engage me.
तस्य मे तन्वो बहुधा निविष्टा एतमर्थं नचिकेताहमग्निः|	thus were my forms laid down in many places this as my goal i agni saw before me.
एहि मनुर्देवयुर्यज्ञकामोअरंक्र्त्या तमसि कषेष्यग्ने|	come man is pious and would fain do worship he waits prepared in gloom thou agni dwellest.
सुगान पथः कर्णुहि देवयानान वह हव्यानिसुमनस्यमानः|	make pathways leading godward clear and easy and bear oblations with a kindly spirit.
अग्नेः पूर्वे भरातरो अर्थमेतं रथीवाध्वानमन्वावरीवुः|	this goal mine elder brothers erst selected as he who drives a car the way to travel.
तस्माद भिया वरुण दूरमायं गौरो नक्षेप्नोरविजे जयायाः|	sovaruṇa i fled afar through terror as flies the wildbull from an archers bowstring.
कुर्मस्त आयुरजरं यदग्ने यथा युक्तो जातवेदो नरिष्याः|	we give thee life unwasting jātavedas so that employed thou never shalt be injured.
अथा वहासि सुमनस्यमानो भागं देवेभ्योहविषः सुजात|	so nobly born shalt thou with kindly spirit bear to the gods their share of mens oblations.
परयाजान मे अनुयाजांश्च केवलानूर्जस्वन्तं हविषोदत्त भागम|	grant me the first oblations and the latter entire my forceful shares of holy presents.
घर्तं चापां पुरुषं चौषधीनामग्नेश्च दीर्घमायुरस्तु देवाः|	the soul of plants the fatness of the waters and let there be long life ye gods to agni.
तव परयाजा अनुयाजाश्च केवल ऊर्जस्वन्तो हविषः सन्तुभागाः|	thine be the first oblations and the latter entire thy forceful shares of holy presents.
तवाग्ने यज्ञोअयमस्तु सर्वस्तुभ्यं नमन्ताम्प्रदिशश्चतस्रः|	let all this sacrifice be thine o agni and let the worlds four regions how before thee.
अबुध्रमु तय इन्द्रवन्तो अग्नयो जयोतिर्भरन्त उषसोव्युष्टिषु|	these fires associate with indra are awake bringing their light when first the dawn begins to shine.
मही दयावाप्र्थिवी चेततामपोअद्यादेवानामव आ वर्णीमहे|	may heaven and earth great pair observe our holy work we claim for us this day the favour of the gods.
दिवस्प्र्थिव्योरव आ वर्णीमहे मातॄन सिन्धून पर्वताञ्छर्यणावतः|	yea for ourselves we claim the grace of heaven and earth of Śaryaṇāvān of the hills and mother streams.
अनागास्त्वं सूर्यमुषासमीमहे भद्रंसोमः सुवानो अद्या कर्णोतु नः|	for innocence we pray to sūrya and to dawn so may the flowing soma bring us bliss today.
दयावा नो अद्य पर्थिवी अनागसो मही तरायेतां सुवितायमातरा|	may the great twain the mothers heaven and earth this day preserve us free from sin for peace and happiness.
उषा उछन्त्यप बाधतामघं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे|	may morning sending forth her light drive sin afar we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
इयं न उस्रा परथमा सुदेव्यं रेवत सनिभ्यो रेवती वयुछतु|	may this first dawn bring us the host of gracious gods rich may it richly shine for us who strive for wealth.
आरे मन्युं दुर्विदत्रस्य धीमहि सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे|	the wrath of the malignant may we keep afar we pray to kindled agni for feilicity.
पर याः सिस्रते सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिर्ज्योतिर्भरन्तीरुषसो वयुष्टिषु|	dawns who come forward with the bright beams of the sun and at your earliest flushing bring to us the light.
भद्रा नो अद्य शरवसे वयुछत सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे|	shine ye on us today auspicious for renown we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
अनमीवा उषस आ चरन्तु न उदग्नयो जिहतां जयोतिषाब्र्हत|	free from all sickness may the mornings come to us and let our fires mount upward with a lofty blaze.
आयुक्षातामश्विना तूतुजिं रथं सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे|	the aśvin pair have harnessed their swiftmoving car we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
शरेष्ठं नो अद्य सवितर्वरेण्यं भागमा सुव स हिरत्नधा असि|	send us today a portion choice and excellent o savitar for thou art he who dealeth wealth.
रायो जनित्रीं धिषणामुप बरुवे सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे|	i cry to dhiṣaṇā mother of opulence we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
पिपर्तु मा तद रतस्य परवाचनं देवानां यन मनुष्यामन्महि|	further me this declaring of eternal law the law of gods as we mortals acknowledge it.
विश्वा इदुस्रा सपळ उदेति सूर्यः सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे|	the sun goes up beholding all the rays of morn we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
अद्वेषो अद्य बर्हिष सतरीमणि गराव्णां योगे मन्मनःसाध ईमहे|	this day we pray with innocence in strewing grass adjusting pressingstones and perfecting the hymn.
आदित्यानां शर्मणि सथा भुरण्यसि सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे|	thou in the Ādityas keeping movest restlessly we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
आ नो बर्हिः सधमादे बर्हद दिवि देवानीळे सादयासप्त होतॄन|	to our great holy grass i bid the gods at morn to banquet and will seat them as the seven priests.
इन्द्रं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगं सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे|	varuṇa indra mitra bhaga for our gain we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
त आदित्या आ गता सर्वतातये वर्धे नो यज्ञमवतासजोषसः|	come hither o Ādityas for our perfect weal accordant help our sacrifice that we may thrive.
बर्हस्पतिं पूषणमश्विना भगं सवस्त्यग्निं समिधानमीमहे|	pūṣan bṛhaspati bhaga both aśvins and enkindled agni we implore for happiness.
तन नो देवा यछत सुप्रवाचनं छर्दिरादित्याः सुभरंन्र्पाय्यम|	Ādityas gods vouchsafe that this our home may be praiseworthy prosperous our heroes sure defence.
पश्वे तोकाय तनयाय जीवसे सवस्त्यग्निंसमिधानमीमहे|	for cattle for our sons for progeny for life we pray to kindled agni for felicity.
विश्वे अद्य मरुतो विश्व ऊती विश्वे भवन्त्वग्नयःसमिद्धाः|	this day may all the maruts all he near us with aid may all our fires be well enkindled.
विश्वे नो देवा अवसा गमन्तु विश्वमस्तुद्रविणं वाजो अस्मे|	may all gods come to us with gracious favour may spoil and wealth he ours and all possessions.
यं देवासोअवथ वाजसातौ यं तरायध्वे यं पिप्र्थात्यंहः|	he whom ye aid o deities in battle whom ye protect and rescue from affliction.
यो वो गोपीथे न भयस्य वेद ते सयामदेववीतये तुरासः|	who fears no danger at your milklibation such may we be to feast the gods ye mighty.
परावतो ये दिधिषन्त आप्यं मनुप्रीतासो जनिमाविवस्वतः|	may they who would assume kinship from far away vivasvāns generations dearly loved of men.
ययातेर्ये नहुष्यस्य बर्हिषि देवा आसते तेधि बरुवन्तु नः|	even the gods who sit upon the sacred grass of nahuṣas son yayāti bless and comfort us.
विश्वा हि वो नमस्यानि वन्द्या नामानि देवा उत यज्ञियानिवः|	for worthy of obeisance gods are all your names worthy of adoration and of sacrifice.
ये सथ जाता अदितेरब्ध्यस परि ये पर्थिव्यास्तेम इह शरुता हवम|	ye who were born from waters and from aditi and from the earth do ye here listen to my call.
येभ्यो माता मधुमत पिन्वते पयः पीयूषं दयौरदितिरद्रिबर्हाः|	i will rejoice in these Ādityas for my weal for whom the mother pours forth water rich in balm.
उक्थशुष्मान वर्षभरान सवप्नसस्तानादित्याननु मदा सवस्तये|	and dyaus the infinite firm as a rock sweet milkgods active strong through lauds whose might the bull upholds.
नर्चक्षसो अनिमिषन्तो अर्हणा बर्हद देवासो अम्र्तत्वमानशुः|	looking on men neer slumbering they by their deserts attained as gods to lofty immortality.
जयोतीरथा अहिमाया अनागसो दिवो वर्ष्माणंवसते सवस्तये|	borne on refulgent cars sinless with serpents powers they robe them for our welfare in the height of heaven.
सम्राजो ये सुव्र्धो यज्ञमाययुरपरिह्व्र्ता दधिरे दिविक्षयम|	great kings who bless us who have come to sacrifice who neer assailed have set their mansion in the sky.
ताना विवास नमसा सुव्र्क्तिभिर्महो आदित्यानदितिं सवस्तये|	these i invite with adoration and with hymns mighty Ādityas aditi for happiness.
को व सतोमं राधति यं जुजोषथ विश्वे देवासो मनुषोयति षठन|	who offereth to you the laud that ye accept o ye allgods of manu many as ye are.
को वोअध्वरं तुविजाता अरं करद यो नःपर्षदत्यंहः सवस्तये|	who mighty ones will prepare for you the sacrifice to bear us over trouble to felicity.
येभ्यो होत्रां परथमामायेजे मनुः समिद्धाग्निर्मनसासप्त होत्र्भिः|	ye to whom manu by seven priests with kindled fire offered the first oblation with his heart and soul.
त आदित्या अभयं शर्म यछत सुगा नःकर्त सुपथा सवस्तये|	vouchsafe us ye Ādityas sheitcr free from fear and make us good and easy paths to happiness.
य ईशिरे भुवनस्य परचेतसो विश्वस्य सथातुर्जगतश्चमन्तवः|	wise deities who have dominion oer the world ye thinkers over all that moves not and that moves.
ते नः कर्तादक्र्तादेनसस पर्यद्या देवासःपिप्र्ता सवस्तये|	save us from uncommitted and committed sin preserve us from all sin today for happiness.
भरेष्विन्द्रं सुहवं हवामहेअंहोमुचं सुक्र्तन्दैव्यं जनम|	in battles we invoke indra still swift to hear and all the holy host of heaven who banish grief.
अग्निं मित्रं वरुणं सातये भगन्द्यावाप्र्थिवी मरुतः सवस्तये|	agni mitra and varuṇa that we may gain dyays bhaga maruts prthivi for happiness.
सुत्रामाणं पर्थिवीं दयामनेहसं सुशर्माणमदितिंसुप्रणीतिम|	mightilysaving earth incomparable heaven the good guide aditi who gives secure defence.
दैवीं नावं सवरित्रामनागसमस्रवन्तीमा रुहेमा सवस्तये|	the welloared heavenly ship that lets no waters in free from defect will we ascend for happiness.
विश्वे यजत्रा अधि वोचतोतये तरायध्वं नो दुरेवायाभिह्रुतः|	bless us all holy ones that we may have your help guard and protect us from malignant injury.
सत्यया वो देवहूत्या हुवेम शर्ण्वतो देवावसे सवस्तये|	with fruitful invocation may we call on you gods who give ear to us for grace for happiness.
अपामीवामप विश्वामनाहुतिमपारातिं दुर्विदत्रामघायतः|	keep all disease afar and sordid sacrifice keep off the wicked mans malicious enmity.
आरे देवा दवेषो अस्मद युयोतनोरु णः शर्मयछता सवस्तये|	keep far away from us all hatred o ye gods and give us ample shelter for our happiness.
अरिष्टः स मर्तो विश्व एधते पर परजाभिर्जायतेधर्मणस परि|	untouched by any evil every mortal thrives and following the law spreads in his progeny.
यमादित्यासो नयथा सुनीतिभिरतिविश्वानि दुरिता सवस्तये|	whom ye with your good guidance o Ādityas lead safely through all his pain and grief to happiness.
यं देवासोअवथ वाजसातौ यं शूरसाता मरुतो हितेधने|	that which ye guard and grace in battle o ye gods ye maruts where the prize is wealth where heroes win.
परातर्यावाणं रथमिन्द्र सानसिमरिष्यन्तमारुहेमा सवस्तये|	that conquering car o indra that sets forth at dawn that never breaks may we ascend for happiness.
सवस्ति नः पथ्यासु धन्वसु सवस्त्यप्सु वर्जने सवर्वति|	vouchsafe us blessing in our paths and desert tracts blessing in waters and in battle for the light.
सवस्ति नः पुत्रक्र्थेषु योनिषु सवस्ति राये मरुतो दधातन|	blessing upon the wombs that bring male children forth and blessing o ye maruts for the gain of wealth.
सवस्तिरिद धि परपथे शरेष्ठा रेक्णस्वत्यभि यावाममेति|	the noblest svasti with abundant riches who comes to what is good by distant pathway.
सा नो अमा सो अरणे नि पातु सवावेशा भवतुदेवगोपा|	may she at home and far away preserve us and dwell with us under the gods protection.
एवा पलतेः सूनुरवीव्र्धद वो विश्व आदित्या अदितेमनीषी|	thus hatb the thoughtful sage the son of plati praised you o aditi and all Ādityas.
ईशानासो नरो अमर्त्येनास्तावि जनो दिव्योगयेन|	men are made rich by those who are immortal the heavenly folk have been extolled by gaya.
सुष्वाणास इन्द्र सतुमसि तवा ससवांसश्च तुविन्र्म्णवाजम|	when we have pressed the juice we laud thee indra and when most valorous we have won the booty.
आ नो भर सुवितं यस्य चाकन तमना तनासनुयाम तवोताः|	bring us prosperity as each desires it under thine own protection may we conquer.
रष्वस्त्वमिन्द्र शूर जातो दासीर्विशः सूर्येणसह्याः|	sublime from birth mayst thou o indra hero with sūrya overcome the dāsa races.
गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळमप्सु बिभ्र्मसिप्रस्रवणे न सोमम|	as by a fountains side we bring the soma that lay concealed closehidden in the waters.
अर्यो वा गिरो अभ्यर्च विद्वान रषीणां विप्रः सुमतिंचकानः|	answer the votarys hymns for these thou knowest craving the Ṛṣis prayer thyself a singer.
ते सयाम ये रणयन्त सोमैरेनोत तुभ्यंरथोळ भक्षैः|	may we be they who take delight in somas these with sweet food for thee o chariotrider.
इमा बरह्मेन्द्र तुभ्यं शंसि दा नर्भ्यो नर्णां शूरशवः|	these holy prayers o indra have i sung thee grant to the men the strength of men thou hero.
तेभिर्भव सक्रतुर्येषु चाकन्नुत तरायस्वग्र्णत उत सतीन|	be of one mind with those in whom thou joyest keep thou the singers safe and their companions.
शरुधी हवमिन्द्र शूर पर्थ्या उत सतवसे वेन्यस्यार्कैः|	listen to pṛthis call heroic indra and be thou lauded by the hymns of venya.
आ यस्ते योनिं घर्तवन्तमस्वारूर्मिर्न निम्नैर्द्रवयन्त वक्वाः|	him who hath sung thee to thine oilrich dwelling whose rolling songs have sped thee like a torrent.
पतंगमक्तमसुरस्य मायया हर्दा पश्यन्ति मनसाविपश्चितः|	the sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the bird adorned with all an asuras magic might.
समुद्रे अन्तः कवयो वि चक्षते मरीचीनाम्पदमिछन्ति वेधसः|	sages observe him in the oceans inmost depth the wise disposers seek the station of his rays.
पतंगो वाचं मनसा बिभर्ति तां गन्धर्वोअवदद गर्भेन्तः|	the flying bird bears speech within his spirit erst the gandharva in the womb pronounced it.
तां दयोतमानां सवर्यं मनीषां रतस्य पदेकवयो नि पान्ति|	and at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant heavenlybright invention.
अपश्यं गोपामनिपद्यमानमा च परा च पथिभिश्चरन्तम|	i saw the herdsman him who never resteth approaching and departing on his pathways.
स सध्रीचीः स विषूचीर्वसान आ वरीवर्तिभुवनेष्वन्तः|	he clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour within the worlds continually travels.
किमिछन्ती सरमा परेदमानड दूरे हयध्वा जगुरिःपराचैः|	what wish of saramā hath brought her hither the path leads far away to distant places.
कास्मेहितिः का परितक्म्यासीत कथं रसायातरः पयांसि|	what charge hast thou for us where turns thy journey how hast thou made thy way oer rasās waters.
इन्द्रस्य दूतीरिषिता चरामि मह इछन्ती पणयो निधीन्वः|	i come appointed messenger of indra seeking your ample stores of wealth o paṇis.
अतिष्कदो भियसा तन न आवत तथा रसाया अतरम्पयांसि|	this hath preserved me from the fear of crossing thus have i made my way oer rasās waters.
कीद्रंं इन्द्रः सरमे का दर्शीका यस्येदं दूतीरसरः पराकात|	what is that indra like what is his aspect whose envoy saramā from afar thou comest.
आ च गछान मित्रमेना दधामाथागवां गोपतिर्नो भवाति|	let him approach and we will show him friendship he shall be made the herdsman of our cattle.
नाहं तं वेद दभ्यं दभत स यस्येदं दूतीरसरं पराकात|	i know him safe from harm but he can punish who sent me hither from afar as envoy.
न तं गूहन्ति सरवतो गभीरा हतािन्द्रेण पणयः शयध्वे|	him rivers flowing with deep waters bide not low will ye be o paṇis slain by indra.
इमा गावः सरमे या ऐछः परि दिवो अन्तान सुभगेपतन्ती|	these are the kine which saramā thou seekest flying o blest one to the ends of heaven.
कस्त एना अव सर्जादयुध्व्युतास्माकमायुधासन्ति तिग्मा|	who will loose these for thee without a battle yea and sharppointed are our warlike weapons.
असेन्या वः पणयो वचांस्यनिषव्यास्तन्वः सन्तु पापीः|	even if your wicked bodies o ye paṇis were arrowproof your words are weak for wounding.
अध्र्ष्टो व एतवा अस्तु पन्था बर्हस्पतिर्व उभया नम्र्ळात|	and were the path to you as yet unmastered bṛhaspati in neither case will spare you.
अयं निधिः सरमे अद्रिबुध्नो गोभिरश्वेभिर्वसुभिर्न्य्र्ष्टः|	paved with the rock is this our treasurechamber filled full of precious things of kine and horses.
रक्षन्ति तं पणयो ये सुगोपा रेकु पदमलकमा जगन्थ|	these paṇis who are watchful keepers guard it in vain hast thou approached this lonely station.
एह गमन्न्र्षयः सोमशिता अयास्यो अङगिरसो नवग्वाः|	Ṛṣis will come inspirited with soma aṅgirases unwearied and navagvas.
त एतमूर्वं वि भजन्त गोनामथैतद वचः पणयोवमन्नित|	this stall of cattle will they part among them then will the paṇis wish these words unspoken.
एवा च तवं सरम आजगन्थ परबाधिता सहसा दैव्येन|	even thus o saramā hast thou come hither forced by celestial might to make the journey.
सवसारं तवा कर्णवै मा पुनर्गा अप ते गवां सुभगेभजाम|	turn thee not back for thou shalt be our sister o blest one we will give thee of the cattle.
नाहं वेद भरात्र्त्वं नो सवस्र्त्वमिन्द्रो विदुरङगिरसश्च घोराः|	brotherhood sisterhood i know not either the dread aṅgirases and indra know them.
गोकामा मे अछदयन यदायमपात इत पणयोवरीयः|	they seemed to long for kine when i departed hence into distance be ye gone o paṇis.
दूरमित पणयो वरीय उद गावो यन्तु मिनतीरतेन|	hence far away ye paṇis let the cattle lowing come forth as holy law commandeth.
बर्हस्पतिर्या अविन्दन निगूळाः सोमो गरावाण रषयश्च विप्राः|	kine which bṛhaspati and soma Ṛṣis sages and pressingstones have found when hidden.
हिरण्यगर्भः समवर्तताग्रे भूतस्य जातः पतिरेकासीत|	in the beginning rose hiranyagarbha born only lord of all created beings.
स दाधार पर्थिवीं दयामुतेमां कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम|	he fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven what god shall we adore with our oblation.
य आत्मदा बलदा यस्य विश्व उपासते परशिषं यस्यदेवाः|	giver of vital breath of power and vigour he whose commandments all the gods acknowledge.
यस्य छायाम्र्तं यस्य मर्त्युः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम|	the lord of death whose shade is life immortal what god shall we adore with our oblation.
यः पराणतो निमिषतो महित्वैक इद राजा जगतो बभूव|	who by his grandeur hath become sole ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers.
य ईशे अस्य दविपदश्चतुष्पदः कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम|	he who is loord of men and lord of cattle what god shall we adore with our oblation.
यस्येमे हिमवन्तो महित्वा यस्य समुद्रं रसया सहाहुः|	his through his might are these snowcovered mountains and men call sea and rasā his possession.
यस्येमाः परदिशो यस्य बाहू कस्मै देवाय हविषाविधेम|	his arms are these his are these heavenly regions what god shall we adore with our oblation.
येन दयौरुग्रा पर्थिवी च दर्ळ्हा येन सव सतभितं येननाकः|	by him the heavens are strong and earth is stedfast by him lights realm and skyvault are supported.
यो अन्तरिक्षे रजसो विमानः कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम|	by him the regions in midair were measured what god shall we adore with our oblation.
यं करन्दसी अवसा तस्तभाने अभ्यैक्षेतां मनसारेजमाने|	to him supported by his help two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit.
यत्राधि सूर उदितो विभाति कस्मै देवायहविषा विधेम|	when over them the risen sun is shining what god shall we adore with our oblation.
आपो ह यद बर्हतीर्विश्वमायन गर्भं दधानाजनयन्तीरग्निम|	what time the mighty waters came containing the universal germ producing agni.
ततो देवानां समवर्ततासुरेकःकस्मै देवाय हविषा विधेम|	thence sprang the gods one spirit into being what god shall we adore with our oblation.
यश्चिदापो महिना पर्यपश्यद दक्षं दधानाजनयन्तीर्यज्ञम|	he in his might surveyed the floods containing productive force and generating worship.
यो देवेष्वधि देव एक आसीत कस्मैदेवाय हविषा विधेम|	he is the god of gods and none beside him what god shall we adore with our oblation.
मा नो हिंसीज्जनिता यः पर्थिव्या यो वा दिवंसत्यधर्मा जजान|	neer may he harm us who is earths begetter nor he whose laws are sure the heavens creator.
यश्चापश्चन्द्रा बर्हतीर्जजानकस्मै देवाय हविषा विधेम|	he who brought forth the great and lucid waters what god shall we adore with our oblation.
परजापते न तवदेतान्यन्यो विश्वा जातानि परि ताबभूव|	prajāpati thou only comprehendest all these created things and none beside thee.
यत्कामास्ते जुहुमस्तन नो अस्तु वयं सयाम पतयोरयीणाम|	grant us our hearts desire when we invoke thee may we have store of riches in possession.
वसूनां वा चर्क्र्ष इयक्षन धिया वा यज्ञैर्वारोदस्योः|	i am prepared to laud with song or worship the noble ones who are in earth and heaven.
अर्वन्तो वा ये रयिमन्तः सातौ वनुं वा येसुश्रुणं सुश्रुतो धुः|	or coursers who have triumphed in the contest or those who famed have won the prize with glory.
हव एषामसुरो नक्षत दयां शरवस्यता मनसा निंसतक्षा|	their call the call of gods went up to heaven they kissed the ground with gloryseeking spirit.
चक्षाणा यत्र सुविताय देवा दयौर्न वारेभिःक्र्णवन्त सवैः|	there where the gods look on for happy fortune and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties.
इयमेषामम्र्तानां गीः सर्वताता ये कर्पणन्त रत्नम|	this is the song of those immortal beings who long for treasures in their full perfection.
धियं च यज्ञं च साधन्तस्ते नो धान्तु वसव्यमसामि|	may these completing prayers and sacrifices bestow upon us wealth where naught is wanting.
आ तत त इन्द्रायवः पनन्तभि य ऊर्वं गोमन्तन्तित्र्त्सान|	those living men extolled thy deed o indra those who would fain burst through the stall of cattle.
सक्र्त्स्वं ये पुरुपुत्रां महीं सहस्रधाराम्ब्र्हतीं दुदुक्षन|	fain to milk her who bare but once great lofty whose sons are many and her streams past number.
शचीव इन्द्रमवसे कर्णुध्वमनानतं दमयन्तं पर्तन्यून|	sacivan win to your assistance indra who never bends who overcomes his foemen.
रभुक्षणं मघवानं सुव्र्क्तिं भर्ता यो वज्रं नर्यम्पुरुक्षुः|	Ṛbhukṣan maghavan the hymns upholder who rich in food bears mans kind friend the thunder.
यद वावान पुरुतमं पुराषाळ आ वर्त्रहेन्द्रो नामान्यप्राः|	since he who won of old anew hath triumphed indra hath earned his name of vṛtraslaycr.
अचेति परासहस पतिस्तुविष्मान यदीमुश्मसिकर्तवे करत तत|	he hath appeared the mighty lord of conquest what we would have him do let him accomplish.
रतं च सत्यं चाभीद्धात तपसोअध्यजायत|	from fervour kindled to its height eternal law and truth were born.
ततोरात्र्यजायत ततः समुद्रो अर्णवः|	thence was the night produced and thence the billowy flood of sea arose.
समुद्रादर्णवादधि संवत्सरो अजायत|	from that same billowy flood of sea the year was afterwards produced.
अहोरात्राणिविदधद विश्वस्य मिषतो वशी|	ordainer of the days nights lord over all who close the eye.
सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ धाता यथापूर्वमकल्पयत|	dhātar the great creator then formed in due order sun and moon.
दिवं चप्र्थिवीं चान्तरिक्षमथो सवः|	he formed in order heaven and earth the regions of the air and light.
विष्णुर्योनिं कल्पयतु तवष्टा रूपाणि पिंशतु|	may viṣṇu form and mould the womb may tvaṣṭar duly shape the forms.
आसिञ्चतु परजापतिर्धाता गर्भं दधातु ते|	prajāpati infuse the stream and dhātar lay the germ for thee.
गर्भं धेहि सिनीवालि गर्भं धेहि सरस्वति|	o sinīvālī set the germ set thou the germ sarasvatī.
गर्भं तेश्विनौ देवावा धत्तां पुष्करस्रजा|	may the twain gods bestow the germ the aśvins crowned with lotuses.
हिरण्ययी अरणी यं निर्मन्थतो अश्विना|	that which the aśvins twain rub forth with the attritionsticks of gold.
तं तेगर्भं हवामहे दशमे मासि सूतवे|	that germ of thine we invocate that in the tenth month thou mayst bear.
हये जाये मनसा तिष्ठ घोरे वचांसि मिश्राक्र्णवावहै नु|	ho there my consort stay thou fiercesouled lady and let us reason for a while together.
न नौ मन्त्रा अनुदितास एते मयस करन्परतरे चनाहन|	such thoughts as these of ours while yet unspoken in days gone by have never brought us comfort.
किमेता वाचा कर्णवा तवाहं पराक्रमिषमुषसामग्रियेव|	what am i now to do with this thy saying i have gone from thee like the first of mornings.
पुरूरवः पुनरस्तं परेहि दुरापना वातैवाहमस्मि|	purūravas return thou to thy dwelling i like the wind am difficult to capture.
इषुर्न शरिय इषुधेरसना गोषाः शतसा न रंहिः|	like a shaft sent for glory from the quiver or swiftsteed winning cattle winning hundreds.
अवीरे करतौ वि दविद्युतन नोरा न मायुं चितयन्तधुनयः|	the lightning seemed to flash as cowards planned it the minstrels bleated like a lamb in trouble.
सा वसु दधती शवशुराय वय उषो यदि वष्ट्यन्तिग्र्हात|	giving her husbands father life and riches from the near dwelling when her lover craved her.
अस्तं ननक्षे यस्मिञ्चाकन दिवा नक्तंश्नथिता वैतसेन|	she sought the home wherein she found her pleasure accepting day and night her lords embraces.
तरिः सम माह्नः शनथयो वैतसेनोत सम मेअव्यत्यैप्र्णासि|	thrice in the day didst thou embrace thy consort though coldly she received thy fond caresses.
पुरूरवोअनु ते केतमायं राजा मे वीर तन्वस्तदासीः|	to thy desires purūravas i yielded so wast thou king o hero of my body.
या सुजूर्णिः शरेणिः सुम्नापिर्ह्रदेचक्षुर्न गरन्थिनीचरण्युः|	the maids sujirni sreni sumneapi charanyu granthini and hradecaksus.
ता अञ्जयोअरुणयो न सस्रुः शरिये गावो नधेनवोअनवन्त|	these like red kine have hastened forth the bright ones and like milchcows have lowed in emulation.
समस्मिञ जायमान आसत गना उतेमवर्धन नद्यःस्वगूर्ताः|	while he was born the dames sate down together the rivers with free kindness gave him nurture.
महे यत तवा पुरूरवो रणायावर्धयन्दस्युहत्याय देवाः|	and then purūravas the gods increased thee for mighty battle to destroy the dasyus.
सचा यदासु जहतीष्वत्कममानुषीषु मानुषो निषेवे|	when i a mortal wooed to mine embraces these heavenly nymphs who laid aside their raiment.
अप सम मत तरसन्ती न भुज्युस्ता अत्रसन रथस्प्र्शोनाश्वाः|	like a scared snake they fled from me in terror like chariot horses when the car has touched them.
यदासु मर्तो अम्र्तासु निस्प्र्क सं कषोणीभिः करतुभिर्नप्र्ङकते|	when loving these immortal ones the mortal hath converse with the nymphs as they allow him.
ता आतयो न तन्वः शुम्भत सवा अश्वासो नक्रीळयो दन्दशानाः|	like swans they show the beauty of their bodies like horses in their play they bite and nibble.
विद्युन न या पतन्ती दविद्योद भरन्ती मे अप्या काम्यानि|	she who flashed brilliant as the falling lightning brought me delicious presents from the waters.
जनिष्टो अपो नर्यः सुजातः परोर्वशी तिरत दीर्घमायुः|	now from the flood be born a strong young hero may uruvasi prolong her life for ever.
जज्ञिष इत्था गोपीथ्याय हि दधाथ तत पुरूरवो मोजः|	thy birth hath made me drink from earthly milchkine this power purūravas hast thou vouchsafed me.
अशासं तवा विदुषी सस्मिन्नहन न म आश्र्णोःकिमभुग वदासि|	i knew and warned thee on that day thou wouldst not hear me what sayest thou when naught avails thee.
कदा सूनुः पितरं जात इछाच्चक्रन नाश्रु वर्तयद्विजानन|	when will the son be born and seek his father mournerlike will he weep when first he knows him.
को दम्पती समनसा वि यूयोदध यदग्निःश्वशुरेषु दीदयत|	who shall divide the accordant wife and husband while fire is shining with thy consorts parents.
परति बरवाणि वर्तयते अश्रु चक्रन न करन्ददाध्येशिवायै|	i will console him when his tears are falling he shall not weep and cry for care that blesses.
पर तत ते हिनवा यत ते अस्मे परेह्यस्तं नहिमूर मापः|	that which is thine between us will i send thee go home again thou foolṭhou hast not won me.
सुदेवो अद्य परपतेदनाव्र्त परावतं परमां गन्तवा उ|	thy lover shall flee forth this day for ever to seek without return the farthest distance.
अधा शयीत निरतेरुपस्थेअधैनं वर्का रभसासोद्युः|	then let his bed be in destructions bosom and there let fierce rapacious wolves devour him.
पुरूरवो मा मर्था मा पर पप्तो मा तवा वर्कासो अशिवास उक्षन|	nay do not die purūravas nor vanish let not the evilomened wolves devour thee.
न वै सत्रैणानि सख्यानि सन्ति सालाव्र्काणांह्र्दयान्येता|	with women there can be no lasting friendship hearts of hyenas are the hearts of women.
यद विरूपाचरं मर्त्येष्ववसं रात्रीः शरदश्चतस्रः|	when amid men in altered shape i sojourned and through four autumns spent the nights among them.
घर्तस्य सतोकं सक्र्दह्न आश्नां तादेवेदन्तात्र्पाणा चरामि|	i tasted once a day a drop of butter and even now with that am i am contented.
अन्तरिक्षप्रां रजसो विमानीमुप शिक्षाम्युर्वशींवसिष्ठः|	i her best love call urvasi to meet me her who fills air and measures out the region.
उप तवा रातिः सुक्र्तस्य तिष्ठान नि वर्तस्वह्र्दयं तप्यते मे|	let the gift brought by piety approach thee turn thou to me again my heart is troubled.
इति तवा देवा इम आहुरैळ यथेमेतद भवसिम्र्त्युबन्धुः|	thus speak these gods to thee o son of iḷā as death hath verily got thee for his subject.
परजा ते देवान हविषा यजाति सवर्ग उ तवमपि मादयासे|	thy sons shall serve the gods with their oblation and thou moreover shalt rejoice in svarga.
विप्रासो न मन्मभिः सवाध्यो देवाव्यो न यज्ञैःस्वप्नसः|	ye by your hymns are like highthoughted singers skilful inviting gods with sacrifices.
राजानो न चित्राः सुसन्द्र्शः कषितीनां नमर्या अरेपसः|	fair to behold like kings with bright adornment like spotless gallants leaders of the people.
अग्निर्न ये भाजसा रुक्मवक्षसो वातासो न सवयुजःसद्यूतयः|	like fire with flashing flame breastbound with chains of gold like tempestblasts selfmoving swift to lend your aid.
परज्ञातारो न जयेष्ठाः सुनीतयःसुशर्माणो न सोमा रतं यते|	as best of all foreknowers excellent to guide like somas good to guard the man who follows law.
वातासो न ये धुनयो जिगत्नवोअग्नीनां न जिह्वाविरोकिणः|	shakers of all like gales of wind they travel like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence.
वर्मण्वन्तो न योधाः शिमीवन्तः पितॄणांन शंसाः सुरातयः|	mighty are they as warriors clad in armour and like the fathers prayers most bounteous givers.
रथानां न येअराः सनाभयो जिगीवांसो न शूराभिद्यवः|	like spokes of carwheels in one nave united ever victorious like heavenly heroes.
वरेयवो न मर्या घर्तप्रुषोअभिस्वर्तारोर्कं न सुष्टुभः|	shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers.
अश्वासो न ये जयेष्ठास आशवो दिधिषवो न रथ्यःसुदानवः|	they who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers.
आपो न निम्नैरुदभिर्जिगत्नवो विश्वरूपाङगिरसो न सामभिः|	like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods like omniform aṅgirases with sāmahymns.
गरावाणो न सूरयः सिन्धुमातर आदर्दिरासो अद्रयो नविश्वहा|	born from the stream like pressstones are the princes for ever like the stones that crush in pieces.
शिशूला न करीळयः सुमातरो महाग्रामो नयामन्नुत तविषा|	sons of a beauteous dame like playful children like a great host upon the march with splendour.
उषसां न केतवोअध्वरश्रियः शुभंयवो नाञ्जिभिर्व्यश्वितन|	like rays of dawn the visitors of sacrifice they shine with ornaments as eager to be bright.
सिन्धवो न ययियो भराजद्र्ष्टयः परावतो नयोजनानि ममिरे|	like rivers hasting on glittering with their spears from far away they measure out the distances.
सुभागान नो देवाः कर्णुता सुरत्नानस्मान सतोतॄन मरुतोवाव्र्धानाः|	gods send us happiness and make us wealthy letting us singers prosper o ye maruts.
अधि सतोत्रस्य सख्यस्य गात सनाद धि वोरत्नधेयानि सन्ति|	bethink you of our praise and of our friendship ye from of old have riches to vouchsafe us.
रात्री वयख्यदायती पुरुत्रा देव्यक्षभिः|	with all her eyes the goddess night looks forth approaching many a spot.
विश्वाधि शरियोअधित|	she hath put all her glories on.
ओर्वप्रा अमर्त्या निवतो देव्युद्वतः|	immortal she hath filled the waste the goddess hath filled height and depth.
जयोतिषा बाधतेतमः|	she conquers darkness with her light.
निरु सवसारमस्क्र्तोषसं देव्यायती|	the goddess as she comes hath set the dawn her sister in her place.
अपेदु हासतेतमः|	and then the darkness vanishes.
सा नो अद्य यस्या वयं नि ते यामन्न्नविक्ष्महि|	so favour us this night o thou whose pathways we have visited.
वर्क्षेन वसतिं वयः|	as birds their nest upon the tree.
नि गरामासो अविक्षत नि पद्वन्तो नि पक्षिणः|	the villagers have sought their homes and all that walks and all that flies.
निश्येनासश्चिदर्थिनः|	even the falcons fain for prey.
यावया वर्क्यं वर्कं यवय सतेनमूर्म्ये|	keep off the shewolf and the wolf o urmya keep the thief away.
अथा नःसुतरा भव|	easy be thou for us to pass.
उप मा पेपिशत तमः कर्ष्णं वयक्तमस्थित|	clearly hath she come nigh to me who decks the dark with richest hues.
उष रणेवयातय|	o morning cancel it like debts.
उप ते गा इवाकरं वर्णीष्व दुहितर्दिवः|	these have i brought to thee like kine o night thou child of heaven accept.
रात्रि सतोमंन जिग्युषे|	this laud as for a conqueror.
जग्र्भ्मा ते दक्षिणमिन्द्र हस्तं वसूयवो वसुपतेवसूनाम|	thy right hand have we grasped in ours o indra longing for treasure treasurelord of treasures.
विद्मा हि तवा गोपतिं शूर गोनामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः|	because we know thee hero lord of cattle vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
सवायुधं सववसं सुनीथं चतुःसमुद्रं धरुनंरयीणाम|	wealth fully armed good guard and kind protector sprung from four seas the prop and stay of treasures.
चर्क्र्त्यं शंस्यं भूरिवारमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः|	fraught with great bounties meet for praise and glory vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
सुब्रह्माणं देववन्तं बर्हन्तमुरुं गभीरं पर्थुबुध्नमिन्द्र|	wealth with good brahmans indra godattended high wide and deep arid based on broad foundations.
शरुतर्षिमुग्रमभिमातिषाहमस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः|	strong with famed Ṛṣis conquering our foemen vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
सनद्वाजं विप्रवीरं तरुत्रं धनस्प्र्तं शूशुवांसंसुदक्षम|	victorious winning strength with hero sages confirmed in power most useful wealthattracting.
दस्युहनं पूर्भिदमिन्द्र सत्यमस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः|	true indra crushing forts and slaying dasyus vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
अश्वावन्तं रथिनं वीरवन्तं सहस्रिणं शतिनंवाजमिन्द्र|	wealthy in heroes and in cars and horses strength hundredfold and thousandfold o indra.
भद्रव्रातं विप्रवीरं सवर्षामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः|	with manly sages happy troops iightwinning vouchsafe us mighty and resplentdent riches.
पर सप्तगुं रतधीतिं सुमेधां बर्हस्पतिं मतिरछाजिगाति|	to saptagu the sage the holyminded to him bṛhaspati the song approaches.
य आङगिरसो नमसोपसद्योअस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः|	aṅgiras son who must be met with homage vouchsafe us mighty and reslendent riches.
वनीवानो मम दूतास इन्द्रं सतोमाश्चरन्ति सुमतीरियानाः|	my lauds like envoys craving lovingkindness go forth to indra with their strong entreaty.
हर्दिस्प्र्शो मनसा वच्यमाना अस्मभ्यं चित्रंव्र्षणं रयिं दाः|	moving his heart and uttered by my spirit vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
यत तवा यामि दद्धि तन न इन्द्र बर्हन्तं कषयमसमंजनानाम|	grant us the boon for which i pray o indra a spacious home unmatched among the people.
अभि तद दयावाप्र्थिवी गर्णीतामस्मभ्यंचित्रं वर्षणं रयिं दाः|	to this may heaven and earth accord approval vouchsafe us mighty and resplendent riches.
आयं गौः पर्श्निरक्रमीदसदन मातरं पुरः|	this spotted bull hath come and sat before the mother in the east.
पितरं च परयन सवः|	advancing to his father heaven.
अन्तश्चरति रोचनास्य पराणादपानती|	expiring when he draws his breath she moves along the lucid spheres.
वयख्यन्महिषो दिवम|	the bull shines out through all the sky.
तरिंशद धाम वि राजति वाक पतंगाय धीयते|	song is bestowed upon the bird it rules supreme through thirty realms.
परतिवस्तोरह दयुभिः|	throughout the days at break of morn.
चित्र इच्छिशोस्तरुणस्य वक्षथो न यो मातरावप्येतिधातवे|	verily wondrous is the tender younglings growth who never draweth nigh to drink his mothers milk.
अनूधा यदि जीजनदधा च नु ववक्ष सद्योमहि दूत्यं चरन|	as soon as she who hath no udder bore him he faring on his great errand suddenly grew strong.
अग्निर्ह नाम धायि दन्नपस्तमः सं यो वना युवतेभस्मना दता|	then agni was his name most active to bestow gathering up the trees with his consuming tooth.
अभिप्रमुरा जुह्वा सवध्वर इनो नप्रोथमानो यवसे वर्षा|	skilled in fair sacrifice armed with destroying tongue impetuous as a bull that snorteth in the mead.
तं वो विं न दरुषदं देवमन्धस इन्दुं परोथन्तम्प्रवपन्तमर्णवम|	praise him yourgod who birdlike rests upon a tree scattering drops of juice and pouring forth his flood.
आसा वह्निं न शोचिषा विरप्शिनम्महिव्रतं न सरजन्तमध्वनः|	speaking aloud with flame as with his lips a priest and broadening his paths like one of high command.
वि यस्य ते जरयसानस्याजर धक्षोर्न वाताः परि सन्त्यच्युताः|	thou everlasting whom farstriding fain to burn the winds uninterrupted never overcome.
आ रण्वासो युयुधयो न सत्वनं तरितंनशन्त पर शिषन्त इष्टये|	they have approached as warriors eager for the fight heroic trita guiding him to gain his wish.
स इदग्निः कन्व्वतमः कण्वसखार्यः परस्यान्तरस्यतरुषः|	this agni is the best of kaṇvas kaṇvas friend conqueror of the foe whether afar or near.
अग्निः पातु गर्णतो अग्निः सूरीनग्निर्ददातुतेषामवो नः|	may agni guard the singers guard the princes well may agni grant to us our princes gracious help.
वाजिन्तमाय सह्यसे सुपित्र्य तर्षु चयवानो अनु जातवेदसे|	do thou supitrya swiftly following make thyself the lord of jātavedas mightiest of all.
अनुद्रे चिद यो धर्षता वरं सते महिन्तमाय धन्वनेदविष्यते|	who surely gives a boon even in thirsty land most powerful prepared to aid us in the wilds.
एवाग्निर्मर्तैः सह सूरिभिर्वसु षटवे सहसः सूनरोन्र्भिः|	thus noble agni with princes and mortal men is lauded excellent for conquering strength with chiefs.
मित्रासो न ये सुधिता रतायवो दयावो न दयुम्नैरभि सन्ति मानुषान|	men who are welldisposed as friends and true to law even as the heavens in majesty surpass mankind.
ऊर्जो नपात सहसावन्निति तवोपस्तुतस्य वन्दते वर्षा वाक|	o son of strength victorious with this title upastutas most potent voice reveres thee.
तवां सतोषाम तवया सुवीरा दराघीय आयुः परतरन्दधानाः|	blest with brave sons by thee we will extol thee and lengthen out the days of our existence.
इति तवाग्ने वर्ष्टिहव्यस्य पुत्रा उपस्तुतास रषयोअवोचन|	thus agni have the sons of vrstihavya the Ṛṣis the upastutas invoked thee.
तांश्च पाहि गर्णतश्च सूरीन वषड वषळ इत्यूर्ध्वासो अनक्षन नमो नम इत्यूर्ध्वासो अनक्षन|	protect them guard the singers and the princes with vaṣaṭ have they come with hands uplifted with their uplifted hands and cries of glory.
वात आ वातु भेषजं शम्भु मयोभु नो हर्दे|	filling our hearts with health and joy may vāta breathe his balm on us.
पर णायूंषि तारिषत|	may he prolong our days of life.
उत वात पितासि न उत भरातोत नः सखा|	thou art our father vāta yea thou art a brother and a friend.
स नोजीवातवे कर्धि|	so give us strength that we may live.
यददो वात ते गर्हेअम्र्तस्य निधिर्हितः|	the store of amṛta laid away yonder o vāta in thine home.
ततो नो देहिजीवसे|	give us thereof that we may live.
य इमा विश्वा भुवनानि जुह्वद रषिर्होता नयसीदत्पिता नः|	he who sate down as hotarpriest the Ṛṣi our father offering up all things existing.
स आशिषा दरविणमिछमानः परथमछदवराना विवेश|	he seeking through his wish a great possession came among men on earth as archetypal.
किं सविदासीदधिष्ठनमारम्भणं कतमत सवित्कथासीत|	what was the place whereon he took his station what was it that supported him how was it.
यतो भूमिं जनयन विश्वकर्म वि दयामौर्णोन महिना विश्वचक्षाः|	whence visvakarman seeing all producing the earth with mighty power disclosed the heavens.
विश्वतश्चक्षुरुत विश्वतोमुखो विश्वतोबाहुरुतविश्वतस्पात|	he who hath eyes on all sides round about him a mouth on all sides arms and feet on all sides.
सं बाहुभ्यां धमति सं पतत्रैर्द्यावाभूमी जनयन देव एकः|	he the sole god producing earth and heaven weldeth them with his arms as wings together.
किं सविद वनं क उ स वर्क्ष आस यतो दयावाप्र्थिवीनिष्टतक्षुः|	what was the tree what wood in sooth produced it from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven.
मनीषिणो मनसा पर्छतेदु तद यदध्यतिष्ठद भुवनानि धारयन|	ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things.
या ते धामानि परमाणि यावमा या मध्यमाविश्वकर्मन्नुतेमा|	nine highest lowest sacrificial natures and these thy midmost here o visvakarman.
शिक्षा सखिभ्यो हविषि सवधावःस्वयं यजस्व तन्वं वर्धानः|	teach thou thy friends at sacrifice o blessed and come thyself exalted to our worship.
विश्वकर्मन हविषा वाव्र्धानः सवयं यजस्व पर्थिवीमुत दयाम|	bring thou thyself exalted with oblation o visvakarman earth and heaven to worship.
मुह्यन्त्वन्ये अभितो जनास इहास्माकं मघवासूरिरस्तु|	let other men around us live in folly here let us have a rich and liberal patron.
वाचस पतिं विश्वकर्माणमूतये मनोजुवं वाजे अद्याहुवेम|	let us invoke today to aid our labour the lord of speech the thoughtswift visvakarman.
स नो विश्वानि हवनानि जोषद विश्वशम्भूरवसेसाधुकर्मा|	may he hear kindly all our invocations who gives all bliss for aid whose works are righteous.
अरण्यान्यरण्यान्यसौ या परेव नश्यसि|	goddess of wild and forest who seemest to vanish from the sight.
कथाग्रामं न पर्छसि न तवा भीरिव विन्दतीअअअन|	how is it that thou seekest not the village art thou not afraid.
वर्षारवाय वदते यदुपावति चिच्चिकः|	what time the grasshopper replies and swells the shrill cicalas voice.
आघाटिभिरिवधावयन्नरण्यानिर्महीयते|	seeming to sound with tinkling bells the lady of the wood exults.
उत गाव इवादन्त्युत वेश्मेव दर्श्यते|	and yonder cattle seem to graze what seems a dwellingplace appears.
उतो अरण्यानिःसायं शकटीरिव सर्जति|	or else at eve the lady of the forest seems to free the wains.
गामङगैष आ हवयति दार्वङगैषो अपावधीत|	here one is calling to his cow another there hath felled a tree.
वसन्नरण्यान्यां सायमक्रुक्षदिति मन्यते|	at eve the dweller in the wood fancies that somebody hath screamed.
न वा अरण्यानिर्हन्त्यन्यश्चेन नाभिगछति|	the goddess never slays unless some murderous enemy approach.
सवादोःफलस्य जग्ध्वाय यथाकामं नि पद्यते|	man eats of savoury fruit and then takes even as he wills his rest.
आञ्जनगन्धिं सुरभिं बह्वन्नामक्र्षीवलाम|	now have i praised the forest queen sweetscented redolent of balm.
पराहम्म्र्गाणां मातरमरण्यानिमशंसिषम|	the mother of all sylvan things who tills not but hath stores of food.
पर सु गमन्ता धियसानस्य सक्षणि वरेभिर्वरानभिषु परसीदतः|	forth speed the pair to bring the meditating god benevolent with boons sent in return for boons.
अस्माकमिन्द्र उभयं जुजोषति यत्सोम्यस्यान्धसो बुबोधति|	may indra graciously accept both gifts from us when he hath knowledge of the flowing soma juice.
वीन्द्र यासि दिव्यानि रोचना वि पार्थिवानि रजसापुरुष्टुत|	thou wanderest far o indra through the spheres of light and realms of earth the region thou whom many praise.
ये तवा वहन्ति मुहुरध्वरानुप ते सुवन्वन्तु वग्यनानराधसः|	let those who often bring their solemn rites conquer the noisy babblers who present no gifts.
तदिन मे छन्त्सत वपुषो वपुष्टरं पुत्रो यज्जानम्पित्रोरधीयति|	more beautiful than beauty must this seem to me when the son duly careth for his parents line.
जाया पतिं वहति वग्नुना सुमत पुंसैद भद्रो वहतुः परिष्क्र्तः|	the wife attracts the husband with a shout of joy the mans auspicious marriage is performed aright.
तदित सधस्थमभि चारु दीधय गावो यच्छासन्वहतुं न धेनवः|	this beauteous place of meeting have i looked upon where like milchcows the kine order the marriage train.
माता यन मन्तुर्यूथस्यपूर्व्याभि वाणस्य सप्तधातुरिज्जनः|	where the herds mother counts as first and best of all and round her are the seventoned people of the choir.
पर वोअछा रिरिचे देवयुष पदमेको रुद्रेभिर्यातितुर्वणिः|	the pious one hath reached your place before the rest one only moves victorious with the rudras band.
जरा वा येष्वम्र्तेषु दावने परि वूमेभ्यः सिञ्चता मधु|	to these your helpers pour our meath immortal gods with whom your song of praise hath power to win their gifts.
निधीयमानमपगूळमप्सु पर मे देवानां वरतपाुवाच|	he who maintains the laws of god informed me that thou wast lying hidden in the waters.
