इन्द्रो विद्वाननु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहमग्नेनुशिष्ट आगाम|	indra who knoweth well beheld and showed thee by him instructed am i come o agni.
अक्षेत्रवित कषेत्रविदं हयप्राट स परैतिक्षेत्रविदानुशिष्टः|	the stranger asks the way of him who knows it taught by the skilful guide he travels onward.
एतद वै भद्रमनुशासनोस्योतस्रुतिं विन्दत्यञ्जसीनाम|	this is in truth the blessing of instruction he finds the path that leads directly forward.
अद्येदु पराणीदममन्निमाहापीव्र्तो अधयन मातुरूधः|	even now he breathed these days hath he remembered concealed he sucked the bosom of his mother.
एमेनमाप जरिमा युवानमहेळन वसुः सुमनाबभूव|	yet in his youth old age hath come upon him he hath grown gracious good and free from anger.
एतानि भद्रा कलश करियाम कुरुश्रवण ददतो मघानि|	o kalasa all these blessings will we bring them o kurusravana who give rich presents.
दान इद वो मघवानः सो अस्त्वयं च सोमो हर्दि यम्बिभर्मि|	may he o wealthy princes and this soma which i am bearing in my heart reward you.
इमां मे अग्ने समिधं जुषस्वेळस पदे परति हर्याघ्र्ताचीम|	enjoy o agni this my fuel welcome the oilfilled ladle where we pour libation.
वर्ष्मन पर्थिव्याः सुदिनत्वे अह्नामूर्ध्वोभव सुक्रतो देवयज्या|	rise up for worship of the gods wise agni on the earths height while days are bright with beauty.
आ देवानामग्रयावेह यातु नराशंसो विश्वरूपेभिरश्वैः|	may he who goes before the gods come hither with steeds whose shapes are varied narasarhsa.
रतस्य पथा नमसा मियेधो देवेभ्यो देवतमःसुषूदत|	may he most godlike speed our offered viands with homage godward on the path of order.
शश्वत्तममीळते दूत्याय हविष्मन्तो मनुष्यासो अग्निम|	men with oblations laud most constant agni and pray him to perform an envoys duty.
वहिष्ठैरश्वैः सुव्र्ता रथेना देवान वक्षि निषदेह होता|	with lightlyrolling car and best draughthorses bring the gods hither and sit down as hotar.
वि परथतां देवजुष्टं तिरश्चा दीर्घं दराघ्मासुरभि भूत्वस्मे|	may the delight of gods spread out transversely may it be with us long in length and fragrant.
अहेळता मनसा देव बर्हिरिन्द्रज्येष्ठानुशतो यक्षि देवान|	o holy grass divine with friendly spirit bring thou the willing gods whose chief is indra.
दिवो वा सानु सप्र्शता वरीयः पर्थिव्या वा मात्रया विश्रयध्वम|	touch ye the farextending height of heaven or spring apart to suit the wide earths measure.
उशतीर्द्वारो महिना महद्भिर्देवं रथंरथयुर्धारयध्वम|	yearning ye doors with those sublime in greatness seize eagerly the heavenly car that cometh.
देवी दिवो दुहितरा सुशिल्पे उषासानक्ता सदतां नियोनौ|	here in this shrine may dawn and night the daughters of heaven the skilful goddesses be seated.
आ वां देवास उशती उशन्त उरौ सीदन्तु सुभगेुपस्थे|	in your wide lap auspicious willing ladies may the gods seat them with a willing spirit.
ऊर्ध्वो गरावा बर्हदग्निः समिद्धः परिया धामान्यदितेरुपस्थे|	up stands the stone high burns the fire enkindled aditis lap contains the friendly natures.
पुरोहिताव रत्विजा यज्ञे अस्मिन विदुष्टराद्रविणमा यजेथाम|	ye two chief priests who serve at this our worship may ye more skilled win for us rich possessions.
तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरिदं वरीय आ सीदत चक्र्मा वःस्योनम|	on our wide grass three goddesses be seated for you have we prepared and made it pleasant.
मनुष्वद यज्ञं सुधिता हवींषीळा देवीघ्र्तपदी जुषन्त|	may iḷā she whose foot drops oil the goddess taste manlike sacrifice and wellset presents.
देव तवष्टर्यद ध चारुत्वमानड यदङगिरसामभवः सचाभूः|	since thou god tvaṣṭar hast made beauty perfect since hou hast been the aṅgirases companion.
स देवानां पाथ उप पर विद्वानुशन यक्षि दरविणोदः सुरत्नः|	willing most wealthy giver of possessions grant us the gods assembly thou who knowest.
वनस्पते रशनया नियूया देवानां पाथ उप वक्षिविद्वान|	wellknowing binding with thy cord bring hither lord of the wood the deities assembly.
सवदाति देवः कर्णवद धवींष्यवतान्द्यावाप्र्थिवी हवं मे|	the god prepare and season our oblations may heaven and earth be gracious to my calling.
आग्ने वह वरुणमिष्टये न इन्द्रं दिवो मरुतोन्तरिक्षात|	agni bring hither varuṇa to help us indra from heaven from airs midrealm the maruts.
सीदन्तु बर्हिर्विश्व आ यजत्राः सवाहादेवा अम्र्ता मादयन्ताम|	on sacred grass all holy ones be seated and let the immortal gods rejoice in svāhā.
बरह्मणाग्निः संविदानो रक्षोहा बाधतामितः|	may agni yielding to our prayer the rakṣasslayer drive away.
अमीवायस्ते गर्भं दुर्णामा योनिमाशये|	the malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.
यस्ते गर्भममीवा दुर्णामा योनिमाशये|	agni concurring in the prayer drive off the eater of the flesh.
अग्निष टम्ब्रह्मणा सह निष करव्यादमनीनशत|	the malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.
यस्ते हन्ति पतयन्तं निषत्स्नुं यः सरीस्र्पम|	that which destroys the sinking germ the settled moving embryo.
जातंयस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि|	that which will kill the babe at birtheven this will we drive far away.
यस्त ऊरू विहरत्यन्तरा दम्पती शये|	that which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair.
योनिं योन्तरारेळि तमितो नाशयामसि|	that penetrates and licks thy sideeven this will we exterminate.
यस्त्वा भराता पतिर्भूत्वा जारो भूत्वा निपद्यते|	what rests by thee in borrowed form of brother lover or of lord.
परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि|	and would destroy thy progenyeven this will we exterminate.
यस्त्वा सवप्नेन तमसा मोहयित्वा निपद्यते|	that which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee.
परजां यस्ते जिघांसति तमितो नाशयामसि|	and will destroy thy progenyeven this will we exterminate.
मा पर गाम पथो वयं मा यज्ञादिन्द्र सोमिनः|	let us not indra leave the path the somapressers sacrifice.
मान्त सथुर्नो अरातयः|	let no malignity dwell with us.
यो यज्ञस्य परसाधनस्तन्तुर्देवेष्वाततः|	may we obtain completely wrought the thread spun out to reach the gods.
तमाहुतं नशीमहि|	that perfecteth the sacrifice.
मनो नवा हुवामहे नाराशंसेन सोमेन|	we call the spirit hither with the soma of our parted sires.
पितॄणां चमन्मभिः|	yea with the fathers holy hymns.
आ त एतु मनः पुनः करत्वे दक्षाय जीवसे|	thy spirit come to thee again for wisdom energy and lire.
जयोक चसूर्यं दर्शे|	that thou mayst long behold the sun.
पुनर्नः पितरो मनो ददातु दैव्यो जनः|	o fathers may the heavenly folk give us our spirit once again.
जीवं वरातंसचेमहि|	that we may be with those who live.
वयं सोम वरते तव मनस्तनूषु बिभ्रतः|	o soma with the spirit still within us blest with progeny.
परजावन्तः सचेमहि|	may we be busied in the law.
पर ते यक्षि पर त इयर्मि मन्म भुवो यथा वन्द्यो नोहवेषु|	to thee will send praise and bring oblation as thou hast merited lauds when we invoked thee.
धन्वन्निव परपा असि तवमग्न इयक्षवे पूरवेप्रत्न राजन|	a fountain in the desert art thou agni o ancient king to man who fain would worship.
यं तवा जनासो अभि संचरन्ति गाव उष्णमिव वरजंयविष्ठ|	thou unto whom resort the gathered people as the kine seek the warm stall o most youthful.
दूतो देवानामसि मर्त्यानामन्तर्महांश्चरसि रोचनेन|	thou art the messenger of gods and mortals and goest glorious with thy light between them.
शिशुं न तवा जेन्यं वर्धयन्ती माता बिभर्तिसचनस्यमाना|	making thee grow as twere some noble infant thy mother nurtures thee with sweet affection.
धनोरधि परवता यासि हर्यञ जिगीषसेपशुरिवावस्र्ष्टः|	over the desert slopes thou passest longing and seekest like some beast set free thy fodder.
मूरा अमूर न वयं चिकित्वो महित्वमग्ने तवमङग वित्से|	foolish are we o wise and free from error verily agni thou dost know thy grandeur.
शये वव्रिश्चरति जिह्वयादन रेरिह्यते युवतिंविश्पतिः सन|	there lies the form he moves and licks and swallows and as houselord kisses the youthful maiden.
कूचिज्जायते सनयासु नव्यो वने तस्थौ पलितो धूमकेतुः|	he rises ever fresh in ancient fuel smokebannered gray he makes the wood his dwelling.
अस्नातापो वर्षभो न पर वेति सचेतसो यं पर्णयन्तमर्ताः|	no swimmer steer he presses through the waters and to his place accordant mortals bear him.
तनूत्यजेव तस्करा वनर्गु रशनाभिर्दशभिरभ्यधीताम|	like thieves who risk their lives and haunt the forest the twain with their ten girdles have secured him.
इयं ते अग्ने नव्यसी मनीषा युक्ष्वा रथंन शुचयद्भिरङगैः|	this is a new hymn meant for thee o agni yoke as it were thy car with parts that glitter.
बरह्म च ते जातवेदो नमश्चेयं च गीः सदमिद्वर्धनी भूत|	homage and prayer are thine o jātavedas and this my song shall evermore exalt thee.
रक्षा णो अग्ने तनयानि तोका रक्षोत नस्तन्वो अप्रयुछन|	agni protect our children and descendants and guard with everwatcliful care our bodies.
पराग्नये वाचमीरय वर्षभाय कषितीनाम|	to agni send i forth my song to him the bull of all the folk.
स नःपर्षदति दविषः|	so may he bear us past our foes.
यः परस्याः परावतस्तिरो धन्वातिरोचते|	who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes.
स नःपर्षदति दविषः|	so may he bear us past our foes.
यो रक्षांसि निजूर्वति वर्षा शुक्रेण शोचिषा|	the bull with brightlygleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends.
स नःपर्षदति दविषः|	so may he bear us past our foes.
यो विश्वाभि विपश्यति भुवना सं च पश्यति|	who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his view.
स नःपर्षदति दविषः|	so may he bear us past our foes.
यो अस्य पारे रजसः शुक्रो अग्निरजायत|	resplendent agni who was born in farthest region of the air.
स नः पर्षदति दविषः|	so may he bear us past our foes.
